name: Pinot Noir Qualitätswein Trocken Thermenregion Reserve
review: A ripe style, with raspberry, licorice and dark cherry flavors that fan out nicely on the broad, spicy finish. Drink now through 2010. 116 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Qualitätswein Trocken Thermenregion Reserve
review: Chewy red cherry and berry flavors dominate, with spice and currant overtones. Fresh and appealing. Drink now. 350 cases made.

name: Rotgipfler Qualitätswein Trocken Thermenregion Rodauner
review: Nice minerality and fruitiness to this, with peach flavors and a light creaminess on the finish. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Rotgipfler Qualitätswein Trocken Thermenregion Rodauner Top Selektion
review: This has a mix of mineral and oak flavors, with plenty of ripe pear and apple accents. Finishes ripe. Drink now. 150 cases made.

name: Rotgipfler Qualitätswein Trocken Thermenregion Rodauner Top Selektion
review: Off-dry, with golden raisin, ripe peach and vanilla flavors followed by a short finish. Drink now. 200 cases made.

name: Zierfandler Qualitätswein Trocken Thermenregion
review: Light white, with straightforward mineral and green peach flavors, and some smoky notes on the finish. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Riesling Alto Adige
review: This juicy white is infused with candied orange peel and lemon verbena flavors, as well as hints of crystallized honey and dried pineapple. Dry, with a floral finish. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Pinot Grigio Alto Adige
review: A straightforward white, with bright acidity and modest apple, lemon and nut flavors. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Pfalz Weisenheimer Halde
review: Juicy, displaying plenty of peach, apricot and spice notes. The firm structure keeps it all balanced and lively. Moderate length. Drink now through 2010.

name: Riesling Spätlese Trocken Pfalz Weisenheimer Hahnen
review: A ripe, full-bodied white, offering quince, almond and spice flavors, viscous texture and a solid structure. All the elements are balanced, and the finish lingers. Best from 2000 through 2006.

name: Riesling Auslese Pfalz Weisenheimer Hasenzeile
review: Exotic, this dishes up spice, almond and orange aromas and flavors, moderate sweetness and a sense of elegance. Not very expressive, but shows good concentration and length on the finish. Drink now through 2005.

name: Portugieser QbA Trocken Pfalz Weisenheimer Rosenbühl
review: Light in body, yet packs a lot of berry and spice on its lean, lively framework, with a silky feel. Drink now through 2001.

name: Riesling Spätlese Trocken Pfalz Weisenheimer Hahnen
Riesling Spätlese Trocken Pfalz Weisenheimer Altenberg
Riesling Kabinett Halbtrocken Pfalz Weisenheimer Hahnen
review: Floral and fruit-cocktail aromas and flavors highlight this soft white. Pleasant if a little obvious, offering crisp acidity on the finish. Drink now through 2002.

name: Riesling Kabinett Pfalz Weisenheimer Hahnen
review: Loads of grapefruit and herb notes in this lean Riesling, yet it seems a touch unripe, with tart acidity on the finish.

name: Riesling Kabinett Pfalz Weisenheimer Goldberg
review: An oddball. This kabinett starts round and forward, delivering floral and peach aromas with an intriguing hint of sage, then turns lean and bitter on the finish, though the aftertaste lingers.

name: Riesling Spätlese Pfalz Weisenheimer Halde
review: Deep in color, showing strong marzipan aromas and flavors, this is awkward, with sweetness and soft acidity, becoming lean and astringent on the finish.

name: Riesling Kabinett Halbtrocken Pfalz Weisenheimer Hasenzeile
Agiorgitiko Péloponnèse
review: Roasted plum and dried berry flavors dominate this sinewy red, which features notes of black olive. Presents some tannic punch on the finish, with lingering savory spice accents. Drink now. 4,166 cases made.

name: Agiorgitiko Péloponnèse
review: Mature, with plum and dried cherry flavors and notes of plum and mineral. Spice and roasted meat notes round out the finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Sancerre Perle Blanche
review: A pure, chiseled style, with a flint note stretching all the way through, while jicama, white peach and gooseberry accents go along for the ride. Very steely. Drink now through 2020. 833 cases made.

name: Sancerre Red Moulin des Vrillères
review: Modest cherry and pomegranate fruit flavors are laced with light tea and savory hints. Offers a lightly firm finish and stays elegant overall. Drink now. 725 cases made.

name: Pinot Grigio Alto Adige Valle Isarco
review: Honeycrisp apple, floral and citrus notes mix with mineral and spice accents in this lightly honeyed white, framed by juicy acidity. Light- to medium-bodied, with a fresh, smoky finish. Drink now through 2019. 665 cases made.

name: Kerner Alto Adige Valle Isarco
review: This fresh, open-knit white displays a minerally underpinning and a well-knit mix of melon, lemon zest and crunchy white peach flavors, with a hint of ground ginger. Drink now through 2018. 1,700 cases made.

name: Riesling Alto Adige Valle Isarco
review: A bright and tangy Riesling, with snappy peach, stone, orchard blossom and ginger notes. This is hard to stop sipping. Drink now through 2018. 165 cases made.

name: Sylvaner Alto Adige Valle Isarco R
review: A lithe white, with mouthwatering acidity and minerally hints of stone and saline underscoring the ripe melon, star fruit and sliced almond flavors. Tangy and fresh. Drink now through 2018. 165 cases made.

name: Veltliner Alto Adige Valle Isarco
review: Grapefruit, crunchy white peach and lentil notes are underscored by hints of stone and smoke in this balanced, light-bodied white. Creamy finish. Drink now through 2018. 333 cases made.

name: Kerner Alto Adige Valle Isarco
review: A fresh white, with minerally notes of smoke, saline and wet stone layered with hints of green melon, star fruit and apricot. Drink now. 1,666 cases made.

name: Sylvaner Alto Adige Valle Isarco
review: A subtle white, with lemon curd, nectarine, smoke and crushed almond notes. Tangy finish, with a hint of fresh tarragon. Drink now. 666 cases made.

name: Sylvaner Alto Adige Valle Isarco R
review: A lithe, minerally white, with lively acidity and a subtle mix of Meyer lemon, apricot, ground white pepper and fresh herb notes. Drink now. 165 cases made.

name: Veltliner Alto Adige Valle Isarco
review: Aromatic, with slate and floral accents, this sleek version offers subtle notes of melon, grapefruit pith and paraffin. Drink now. 330 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alto Adige Valle Isarco
review: Fresh and zesty, with a stony base note and flavors of grapefruit zest, melon and lots of ground white pepper. Offers a clean-cut finish of moderate length. Drink now. 292 cases made.

name: Kerner Alto Adige
review: Fresh and floral, with hints of mango and lemon juice on the nose and palate. Full and rich. An interesting white from this hybrid. Drink now. 650 cases made.

name: Müller-Thurgau Alto Adige Valle Isarco
review: A light, fresh white, with hints of stone and smoke underscoring the subtle melon, star fruit and grapefruit zest notes. Drink now. 750 cases made.

name: Pinot Grigio Alto Adige Valle Isarco
review: Light-bodied and zesty, with hints of apple blossom, fresh ginger, yellow pear and stone. Lively. Drink now. 650 cases made.

name: Sylvaner Alto Adige Valle Isarco
review: Modest persimmon, verbena and slivered almond notes show in this fresh, easy-drinking white. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Veltliner Alto Adige Valle Isarco
review: Modest, this fresh white offers subtle notes of pink lentil, grapefruit pulp, verbena and stone on a creamy texture. Drink now. 333 cases made.

name: Müller-Thurgau Alto Adige Valle Isarco
review: A light white, with a hint of fresh earth underscoring the tangy Granny Smith apple, wet stone and crunchy white peach flavors. Citrusy. Drink now. 750 cases made.

name: Pinot Grigio Alto Adige
review: A simple, grapey white, with a fresh, fruity palate and a clean finish. Drink now. 650 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Alto Adige
review: Pink grapefruit and crunchy peach fruit notes are layered with lively acidity and accents of Thai basil, stone and spice in this light-bodied, balanced white. Drink now through 2018. 2,500 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alto Adige
review: Spice, tea rose and cream accents lace this clean-cut white, mixing with a lightly smoky base note and flavors of candied orange zest and melon. Fresh through to the crisp finish. Drink now through 2016. 4,200 cases made.

name: Lagrein Alto Adige
review: This juicy red is light-bodied and bright, with brambly flavors of crushed berry and cherry, wild herb and mineral. Easy-drinking and creamy, with a spiced finish. Drink now through 2018. 2,500 cases made.

name: Lagrein Alto Adige
review: Light-bodied and balanced, offering a silky palate of blackberry, cassis, gumdrop and dried herb notes. Easy-drinking, with a moderate finish. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Grigio Alto Adige
review: This creamy white is soft and supple, showing juicy acidity and a streak of stony mineral layered with notes of baked pear, toasted almond and fleur de sel. Lightly zesty on the moderate finish. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Grigio Alto Adige
review: Apple blossom, yellow plum and sliced almond notes show a vein of smoky minerality in this creamy white. Fresh finish. Drink now through 2017. 1,250 cases made.

name: Pinot Bianco Alto Adige
review: Ground spice and citrus zest notes feature in this light-bodied and fresh white, layered with flavors of yellow apple, almond skin and apricot. Smoky finish. Drink now through 2017. 1,700 cases made.

name: Pinot Bianco Alto Adige
review: Light-bodied and fresh, this easy-drinking white offers ripe Gala apple, white peach and floral notes, with bright acidity and a modest finish. Drink now. 1,700 cases made.

name: Pinot Grigio Alto Adige
review: A minerally white that's light-bodied and crisp, with hints of Gala apple, stone, lemon peel and smoke. Well-balanced. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Nero Alto Adige
review: Light herb and smoke notes lace kirsch and spiced plum flavors in this tangy and zesty, light-bodied red.  Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Alto Adige
review: A fresh white, with modest melon, fresh herb, lemon zest and smoke notes. Drink now. 1,700 cases made.

name: Pinot Grigio Alto Adige
review: Fresh and clean, with a stony base note supporting subtle flavors of green pear, apricot and ginger. Tangy finish. Drink now. 1,250 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Alto Adige
review: A straightforward white, with modest orchard and citrus fruit notes backed by zesty acidity. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Riesling QbA Trocken Rheinhessen
review: On the lean side, with bright acidity focusing the lemon, white peach and mineral notes. Moderate length. Drink now.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Rheinhessen Nierstein
review: Dry, yet round and tasting like peach, quince and citrus, with a touch of herb and spice. This is balanced and ends with a crisp, citrus-tinged aftertaste. Drink now through 2015. 30 cases imported.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Rheinhessen Nierstein
review: Peach preserve, tinged with citrus and a salty mineral element, washes over the palate easily in this open white. There's enough acidity to keep it fresh. Drink now through 2016. 700 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Nierstein Pettenthal
review: A rich, full-bodied dry Riesling, showing elements of peach, quince, sweet corn and mineral. Well balanced. Just lacks a little grip on the finish. Drink now through 2014. 250 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Oppenheim Sackträger
review: Broad and waxy, offering apricot, quince and pineapple notes. Stays fresh enough to avoid softness, lingering nicely on the finish. Drink now through 2014. 250 cases made.

name: Riesling QbA Trocken Rheinhessen
review: The flavors aren't particularly vivid, yet this is harmonious and racy due to its vibrant structure. Everything is in the right place, with a peppery, crisp finish. Drink now through 2015. 200 cases imported.

name: Riesling Spätlese Rheinhessen Oppenheimer Herrenberg
review: Aromas of talc and vanilla custard turn to ripe peach and apricot in this rich, expansive spätlese. The acidity will need some time to integrate, as it leaves a tart impression now. Best from 2000 through 2007.

name: Kathikas Agios Onoufrios
review: A juicy red, with plum and red berry flavors that are fringed by shiso leaf notes. The crisp finish has touches of hot stone, with mouthpuckering tannins. Drink now through 2013. 10,000 cases made.

name: Paphos White
review: Tropical fruit flavors are ripe, with plenty of baked pineapple and spice notes. Glazed citrus notes chime in on the finish. Xynisteri. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Kathikas Agios Onoufrios
review: Firm and dry, with a tannic punch to the red fruit and blackberry flavors. Features tobacco leaf notes on the finish. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Kathikas Agios Onoufrios
review: Offers lots of juicy raspberry and red plum flavors up front. The finish clamps down with assertive herbal notes. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Kathikas Agios Onoufrios
review: Herbal aroma and flavors, with decadent meaty flavors on the finish. Mavrodaphne, Ofthalmo, Cabernet Sauvignon and Mataro. 3,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley
review: Well-built, with appealing notes of dark cherry, dusty herb and spice. Drink now through 2023. 250 cases made.

name: Rosé Russian River Valley
review: Soft and a touch sweet, but fun to drink, with bold raspberry and toasted spice flavors. Drink now. 230 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Rock Garden
review: Dense, rich, ripe and expressive, offering a feast of plum and black currant flavors, with ripe pear, honey and floral overtones as the minerally finish wells up with intensity and harmony. Shows tremendous presence and depth. Best from 2017 through 2025. 348 cases made.

name: Syrah Wahluke Slope Northridge
review: So concentrated it feels like the essence of Syrah. A glowing ball of red and black cherry, pomegranate and plum flavors lights up a galaxy of tobacco, allspice, crème brûlée and black pepper grace notes, coming together harmoniously on the very long finish. This has power, but doesn't weigh down the palate. Drink now through 2020. 243 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Morrison Lane
review: Distinctly minerally, with wet stone and salty overtones to the rich plum and blackberry fruit, merging harmoniously on the powerful finish as this persists beautifully. Drink now through 2025. 387 cases made.

name: En Chamberlin Roma Walla Walla Valley
review: Explosive, intense flavors of ripe cherry, pomegranate, black olive and tomato leaf ride easily, almost airily, over a refined structure. The tannins are nicely submerged, and the flavors seem to whoosh through the finish. Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah. Drink now through 2017. 187 cases made.

name: Ovide En Cerise Walla Walla Valley
review: Big and generous, but stays light enough on its feet to make the powerful black olive-scented currant, plum and peppery spice flavors sing with refinement. An undercurrent of minerality adds interest and depth, and the finish persists impressively. Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah. Best from 2012 through 2020. 214 cases made.

name: Roma En Chamberlin Walla Walla Valley
review: Polished, supple and silky in texture, with a distinctive black olive note coursing through the ripe plum, currant and crushed stone flavors, mingling effectively on the persistent finish. Shows stature, depth and finesse to go with its power. Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah. Drink now through 2018. 190 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Cougar Hills
review: Big, dense and complex, this red hits hard, then backs off, leaving a trail of plum, blackberry, black olive, smoke and mineral flavors that linger. Tannins are present and crisp, but don't get in the way. Best from 2012 through 2018. 260 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Morrison Lane
review: Supple in texture, with a beguiling purity to the black currant, plum and savory spice flavors, offering hints of coffee and molasses as the finish lingers and lingers. This has poise and tremendous presence. Drink now through 2020. 265 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Powerline Estate
review: A knockout Syrah, precise and impeccably built but explosive with personality. Smoky roasted meat and floral blackberry aromas combine with bold, supple flavors of dark plum, pepper and licorice. The tannins are big but polished. Drink now through 2024. 1,319 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley The Beautiful
review: Soft and supple, this red is vibrant in flavor and long on the finish, exhibiting plum, exotic spice, melon and tapenade flavors, with grace and harmony. Approachable now, this should develop more with cellaring. Drink now through 2021. 250 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley The Beautiful
review: The black olive, licorice and black pepper character tries to overtake the rich, focused blackberry and dark plum fruit, but the flavors come together into a harmonious whole, persisting enticingly as the finish lingers against polished tannins. Drink now through 2020. 430 cases made.

name: The Creator Walla Walla Valley
review: Firm, focused and dripping with personality, this is full of wet slate, rare meat and sourdough toast flavors, along with dense, dark blueberry and plum fruit, all competing for attention against polished tannins that let the finish roll on and on. Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah. Best from 2014 through 2020. 300 cases made.

name: En Chamberlin Roma Walla Walla Valley
review: Very expressive, smooth, round and distinctive for the black olive and mineral overtones that weave through the dark berry and tar flavors. Beautifully knit, long and delicious. Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah. Drink now through 2016. 190 cases made.

name: Ovide En Cerise Walla Walla Valley
review: Rich and generous, with a strong mineral element adding depth to the cherry, cinnamon and dark berry flavors. This has floral and wet earth overtones that make the finish complex, with depth and impressive length. Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah. Drink now through 2018. 215 cases made.

name: Roma River Rock Vineyard Walla Walla Valley
review: Deftly combines refinement with muscle, offering expressive black cherry and crushed stone aromas and deeply structured plum, roasted herb and spice flavors that finish with big, polished tannins. Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah. Best from 2019 through 2025. 614 cases made.

name: Syrah Wahluke Slope The Deal Sundance
review: Plush and generous, with roasted meat and green olive flavors underlying rich currant, plum and spice character, which swirls through the long, expressive finish against refined tannins. Offers great presence and depth. Drink now through 2025. 447 cases made.

name: Syrah Wahluke Slope The Deal Sundance Vineyard
review: Soft and meaty, with rich black olive and savory spice overtones to the plum and blackberry fruit, finishing poised and intense, with well-concealed power driving the long, expressive finish. Drink now through 2018. 235 cases made.

name: Syrah Wahluke Slope The Deal Sundance Vineyard
review: Ripe and spicy, this is a big wine that deftly balances its powerful blackberry, plum and fresh currant fruit against cedar, black pepper and bacon flavors, lingering on the tightly packed finish. Best from 2012 through 2020. 200 cases made.

name: Syrah Wahluke Slope The Hidden Northridge Vineyard
review: Offers freshness, purity and depth in a sleek package, with rose petal accents to the ripe blackberry, dark plum and brioche aromas and flavors. Lingers with deftness on the finish. Drink now through 2020. 370 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Cougar Hills
review: Ripe, open-textured and expansive, this rich style displays licorice-accented blackberry, plum and black olive flavors with vivid intensity. The finish comes together harmoniously. Drink now through 2020. 460 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Klein
review: Rich and deep, with tannins tightly woven into a smooth blanket that wraps around a powerful core of blueberry, blackberry and smoky, peppery flavors. Persists into the long, harmonious finish. Best from 2017 through 2025. 112 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Morrison Lane
review: Big and brawny, delivering a huge mouthful of tar- and black olive-accented plum and currant flavors, coalescing into a rich, complex finish. A sizable wine with poise. Best from 2011 through 2016. 250 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Old Stones
review: Supple, seductive and ripe, with explosive plum, currant and exotic spice flavors, hinting at coffee and cocoa as the finish lingers. Combines power with refinement. Drink now through 2020. 330 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Phil Lane
review: Velvety, plush and generous with its sassafras-accented blackberry, fresh currant and black olive flavors, coursing smoothly into the long, vivid finish. This has the poise and intensity to last. Best from 2013 through 2018. 70 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Phil Lane
review: This rich, ripe red is generous with its spicy green and black olive flavors, which weave through plum, blackberry and wet stone character that remains powerful through the deftly balanced finish. The tannins need some time to absorb. Best from 2011 through 2016. 140 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley River Rock
review: Broad and open-textured, this offers juicy, pear-accented blackberry, licorice and black tea flavors, finishing harmoniously with pinpoint focus. This has presence and depth without great weight. Best from 2017 through 2023. 723 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Rock Garden
review: Intense yet harmonious, with floral black raspberry and garrigue aromas and well-structured flavors of blackberry, orange zest and smoky spice that linger toward refined tannins. Drink now through 2024. 561 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley The Beautiful
review: A big, bold wine, with a sense of style and grace, offering floral blueberry and lavender aromas and savory dark raspberry, tapenade and pepper flavors that linger toward mineral-tinged tannins. Drink now through 2024. 461 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley The Beautiful
review: Supple, plush and generous with its rose petal-accented blueberry and plum flavors, finishing with seamless integration of tannins. A big wine with a gentle mien. Drink now through 2020. 290 cases made.

name: The Creator Walla Walla Valley
review: Supple, expressive, polished and generous, with layers of dark berry, cherry, black olive and spice flavors that merge harmoniously on the long and refined finish. Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah. Drink now through 2022. 1,301 cases made.

name: The Creator Walla Walla Valley
review: Rich, ripe and round, brimming with black olive, blackberry, cherry and spice flavors that glide easily and appealingly over a polished frame. The finish doesn't quit, but strikes an elegant balance, with refined power. Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah. Best from 2012 through 2019. 242 cases made.

name: The Creator Washington
review: Muscular and powerful, brimming with ripe currant, blackberry, blueberry and meat flavors, yet graceful enough to do a pirouette as this spins into the finish. Lingers effortlessly as the flavors keep blasting away against polished tannins. Needs time only to tame the ebullience. Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah. Best from 2014 through 2020. 665 cases made.

name: Ovide En Cerise Walla Walla Valley
review: Supple, expansive and distinctive for the black olive, barbecue smoke and licorice overtones that weave through the dark, ripe blueberry and blackberry flavors. Finishes with hints of basalt and dark spices. Nicely put together, with a harmonious finish. Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah. Drink now through 2019. 205 cases made.

name: Roma En Chamberlin Walla Walla Valley
review: Prominent earthy and gamy notes add depth and complexity to the rich vein of blackberry, dried blueberry and seared steak flavors that glide easily over polished tannins into the long, vivid finish. Offers great presence and distinctive flavors. Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah. Drink now through 2018. 185 cases made.

name: Syrah Wahluke Slope Northridge
review: Polished, generous and appealing for its gorgeous raspberry, blueberry and Santa Rosa plum fruit, nicely tinged with espresso and crème fraîche notes, gaining tempo on the racy finish. Drink now through 2016. 280 cases made.

name: Syrah Wahluke Slope Pheasant Vineyard
review: Fresh and vibrant, open-textured and appealing, with a distinctive meaty, minerally cast to the dark berry flavors, persisting impressively as the finish dances. Drink now through 2020. 230 cases made.

name: Syrah Wahluke Slope Pheasant Vineyard
review: Rich in texture and flavor, this is plump, offering polished tannins and blueberry, plum, cream and spice flavors that just won't quit on the finish. Shows intensity, early complexity, balance and supple grace. Drink now through 2017. 187 cases made.

name: Syrah Wahluke Slope The Deal Sundance
review: Shows expression and verve, with blackberry and stony mineral aromas and impressively structured roasted meat, plum and espresso flavors that finish with refined tannins. Drink now through 2024. 1,054 cases made.

name: Syrah Wahluke Slope The Deal Sundance
review: Broad and succulent, with a mineral edge to the tautly focused but generous blackberry, blueberry. smoke and espresso flavors, lingering against fine tannins on the finish. Best from 2018 through 2023. 1,658 cases made.

name: Syrah Wahluke Slope The Deal Sundance Vineyard
review: Focused, generous and complex, offering a chewy mouthful of cherry, tobacco, black olive and wet rock flavors that don't quit on the finish. Balanced against lively acidity, the flavors just take off. Best from 2013 through 2019. 360 cases made.

name: Syrah Wahluke Slope The Deal Sundance Vineyard
review: Rich, ripe and distinctive for the tarry, smoky dark chocolate and black olive character that weaves through blackberry and ripe cherry fruit, all of it mingling on the solid, well-formed finish. Best from 2011 through 2016. 440 cases made.

name: Syrah Wahluke Slope The Hidden Northridge Slope
review: Broad, generous and opulent, with raspberry, black cherry and rhubarb flavors that maintain momentum into a long and supple finish, picking up hints of dill and black tea. Best from 2018 through 2023. 760 cases made.

name: Syrah Wahluke Slope The Hidden Northridge Vineyard
review: Deeply structured and expressive, with floral blackberry and licorice aromas that open to broad and dynamic dark plum, roasted meat and crushed stone notes that persist toward big but polished tannins. Best from 2019 through 2025. 759 cases made.

name: Syrah Wahluke Slope The Hidden Northridge Vineyard
review: A vibrant, focused and distinctive red, with tar and mineral notes underlying the dark plum and licorice flavors, extending into the long, expressive finish. The tannins are beautifully absorbed. Drink now through 2020. 440 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Cougar Hills
review: Beautifully silky, supple and immensely generous with its plum, rhubarb and pomegranate fruit, lingering with a touch of stony mineral character as the finish lingers effortlessly. Drink now through 2012. 320 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Morrison Lane
review: Smooth and round, with black olive and meaty overtones to the blackberry and plum flavors, finishing with harmony and presence, lingering easily against refined tannins. Drink now through 2022. 394 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Morrison Lane
review: Ripe, polished and generous with its black cherry, wet slate, tobacco and roasted meat flavors, each one coming in and out of focus as the finish lingers against refined tannins. Drink now through 2019. 300 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Phil Lane
review: Ripe fruit, earth and tar notes combine to produce complex and powerful flavors in this big, brawny Syrah. There's black cherry and currant at the core, with dead leaf and soy sauce notes poking in from the side. Massive structure needs time to soften. Best after 2013. 141 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley River Rock
review: Velvety, open-textured and inviting, with plum, fresh currant and apricot flavors. Hints of crème brûlée complement the deftly balanced finish. Approachable, but worth cellaring. Drink now through 2021. 350 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley The Hustler
review: Has presence, featuring a smoky edge to blueberry and black cherry flavors that spill around the stony notes on the finish. Comes together with intensity and harmony. Best from 2017 through 2022. 143 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley The Hustler
review: Big, broad and generous, offering a powerful mouthful of black cherry, sassafras and sweet leather flavors that persist against mildly gritty tannins. Best from 2014 through 2017. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 135 cases made.

name: Syrah Washington Motor City Kitty
review: Rich and generous, layered with freshly ground pepper and black olive flavors around a core of deep cherry and floral notes, finishing with presence and persistence against nubby tannins. Best from 2018 through 2022. 446 cases made.

name: The Boy Walla Walla Valley
review: Delicious stuff, this is bold in flavor but light in texture. Plum, pomegranate and black olive character at the core drives the profile, which floats pepper and spice notes on the long finish. Grenache and Syrah. Drink now through 2014. 340 cases made.

name: The Boy Walla Walla Valley
review: This gorgeous wine is packed with flavors that just hover over the palate instead of attacking it. Impressive for the way the guava-accented plum and berry flavors pick up green olive and tar accents without losing their essential charm, then keep going on the long finish. Grenache and Syrah. Drink now through 2014. 417 cases made.

name: Merlot Washington Stoneridge Vineyard
review: Plush, aromatic, and focused, furrowing the plum, currant and white pepper flavors into a smooth stream that stands out against modest tannins. Finishes with flair. Best from 2015 through 2020. 490 cases made.

name: Merlot Washington Stoneridge Vineyard
review: Ripe, generous, transparent and distinctive, balancing its rich cherry, orange peel, tea and sassafras flavors against refined tannins and an open texture, completing the circle with elegance. Drink now through 2017. 200 cases made.

name: Ovide En Cerise Walla Walla Valley
review: Dense, ripe and chewy, this is packed with black cherry, black plum and licorice flavors, hinting at savory herbs and charred meat as the finish rolls on. Complex and well-structured, this needs time to flourish. Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah. Best from 2010 through 2016. 215 cases made.

name: Syrah Snipes Mountain The Cattle King Upland Vineyard
review: Dense and focused, with generous wild blueberry and meaty spice flavors set on a taut beam against firm tannins. Finishes with extra oomph. Best from 2017 through 2022. 612 cases made.

name: Syrah Wahluke Slope Clifton
review: Polished, focused and refined, offering a supple mouthful of blackberry, green olive, sage and smoke flavors, mingling effectively as the finish sails on against well-buffed tannins. Drink now through 2016. 210 cases made.

name: Syrah Wahluke Slope Milbrandt
review: Broad and expressive, with juicy raspberry, cherry and plum flavors, plus hints of white pepper and black tea. The finish plays against crisp tannins. Best from 2018 through 2022. 1,557 cases made.

name: Syrah Wahluke Slope Pheasant Vineyard
review: Polished, focused and dense, with blackberry, black cherry, licorice and black pepper flavors, finishing with black olive character. Shows length and vivacity. Drink now through 2018. 190 cases made.

name: Syrah Wahluke Slope The Deal Sundance
review: A fresh, expressive and open-textured red, offering an array of red berry, black cherry, licorice and subtle smoke notes as the finish sails on against fine, well-integrated tannins. Drink now through 2021. 429 cases made.

name: Syrah Wahluke Slope The Hidden Northridge Vineyard
review: A broad, powerful and expressive red, brimming with blackberry, fresh currant, black pepper and clove flavors that gain traction against a bed of tannins and race into the long and generous finish. Best from 2018 through 2024. 511 cases made.

name: Syrah Wahluke Slope The Hidden Northridge Vineyard
review: Fresh, vibrant and inviting, with a polished texture and expressive blueberry and clotted cream flavors, hinting at peach as the finish lingers against modest tannins. Drink now through 2019. 459 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Cougar Hills
review: Rich, complex, powerful and compelling, densely packed with ripe blackberry, black cherry, licorice and tar flavors that keep pumping through the rock-solid finish. Best from 2014 through 2020. 300 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Cougar Hills
review: Though not big and fat, this is rich, ripe and focused to show off its generous plum and blackberry flavors, which persist into the long finish as they pick up floral and black olive notes. Best from 2009 through 2015. 580 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Morrison Lane
review: Precise and tautly built, with a lively core of bright acidity and firm tannins, framed by deep notes of blackberry, salty wet slate and black olive. Best after 2018. 633 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Morrison Lane
review: Lithe, sleek and seductive, focusing the blackberry, currant and sweet spice flavors into a bright beam that shoots through the extended finish, revealing hints of white pepper and cream. Drink now through 2018. 235 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Morrison Lane
review: Dark and dense, a brooding wine, offering savory roasted meat and charred pepper notes around a tight core of roasted fig, dried currant and black olive. Distinctive stuff, but this will take years to show what it has. Best after 2013. 365 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Phil Lane
review: Broad and expressive, with rich cherry notes blooming at the core, weaving in toasty, peppery overtones as the finish veers toward espresso details. Has depth and harmony. Best from 2018 through 2022. 87 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley River Rock
review: Rich and velvety, layered with dark plum, boysenberry and black olive notes, playing against snappy tannins on a taut frame that sends the flavors bursting through the finish. Best from 2017 through 2022. 258 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Rock Garden
review: Firm, focused and distinctive, with an orange peel and tea leaf character that weaves through the blackberry and plum flavors. A hint of pear adds interest to the supple finish. Best from 2018 through 2023. 395 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley The Beautiful
review: Distinctive for its vibrant black pepper and sassafras overtones to the ripe blackberry and plum flavors. Open-textured and refined, humming sweetly through the long, expressive finish. Drink now through 2015. 108 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Wells
review: Ripe, round and silky, with a lovely interplay of blackberry, pomegranate and exotic spice flavors, hinting at aromatic herbs as the finish lingers effortlessly. Drink now through 2013. 50 cases made.

name: The Boy Walla Walla Valley
review: On the lighter side, but dense with tar, black olive and rose scents around a core of dark berry and cherry fruit, smoothing out nicely on the extensive finish. Grenache and Syrah. Drink now through 2015. 315 cases made.

name: The Creator Old Stones Walla Walla Valley
review: An earthy, savory style, offering distinctive mineral and grilled meat layers over the plum fruit lurking below the surface, lingering well as the finish expands deftly against refined tannins. Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah. Best from 2015 through 2020. 495 cases made.

name: The Creator Powerline Estate Vineyard Walla Walla Valley
review: Supple and well-structured, with spirited blackberry and black olive aromas and deeply flavored smoky plum, grilled anise and cracked pepper notes that finish with stony tannins. Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah. Drink now through 2023. 644 cases made.

name: The Klein Walla Walla Valley
review: Powerful, ripe and focused, with a dense mouthful of blueberry, plum and licorice flavors playing against firm tannins that wrap around the extended finish. This has presence and a sense of tension. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc. Best from 2018 through 2022. 232 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington Stoneridge Vineyard
review: Firm and focused, centered on black cherry and mint notes, with hints of crème fraîche on the fine-grained finish, lingering with juicy intensity. Has presence and subtlety behind the power. Drink now through 2019. 512 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington Stoneridge Vineyard
review: Fresh and supple, offering juicy black cherry and tobacco in the flavor profile, with a hint of grapefruit. The medium-weight finish is framed with fine tannins. Drink now through 2018. 500 cases made.

name: Charlotte Walla Walla Valley
review: Well-built and showing impressive torque, this offers expressive roasted meat, crushed stone and dark plum notes framed by beefy but polished tannins. Grenache, Mourvèdre, Syrah and Roussanne. Best from 2019 through 2024. 279 cases made.

name: Charlotte Walla Walla Valley
review: Broad and rich, with layered flavors of plum, tobacco, pear, orange peel and roasted meat that come together on a savory finish, persisting against polished tannins. Mourvèdre, Grenache, Syrah, Counoise, Grenache Blanc and Picpoul. Drink now through 2022. 421 cases made.

name: El Jefe En Chamberlin Walla Walla Valley
review: Generous, round and focused, with blackberry and black olive flavors pushing through a veil of mildly gritty tannins. This has a deft balance that lets the flavors emerge smoothly. Tempranillo and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2016. 135 cases made.

name: El Jefe En Chamberlin Walla Walla Valley
review: Ripe and dark, with smoky plum and black olive flavors on a polished frame, lingering gently after the muscular start. Offers depth and persistence. Tempranillo and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2014. 135 cases made.

name: En Chamberlin Roma Walla Walla Valley
review: Smooth and polished, weaving green olive and savory herb notes around a lithe core of plum and berry fruit, lingering nicely against crisp tannins. Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah. Drink now through 2014. 95 cases made.

name: Merlot Washington Northridge Vineyard
review: Supple and expressive, layering cherry and spice flavors with blankets of mint and green herbs, coming together smoothly on the generous finish. The tannic backbone is well-integrated. Best from 2016 through 2021. 430 cases made.

name: Ovide Jack's Vineyard Walla Walla Valley
review: Precise and a bit racy, with a well-structured core and persistent notes of dark plum, crushed stone and roasted pepper that tighten along the finish toward trim tannins. Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah. Drink now through 2024. 808 cases made.

name: Syrah Wahluke Slope Clifton Hill
review: Fresh and inviting, with an open texture allowing the plum compote and cassis flavors to float into a long and expressive finish, hinting at cocoa as the finish lingers. Drink now through 2019. 430 cases made.

name: Syrah Wahluke Slope Milbrandt
review: Round and velvety, with earthy, crushed-stone overtones to the dark berry and dusky spice flavors on an open texture. This lingers effectively against polished tannins. Drink now through 2019. 1,660 cases made.

name: Syrah Wahluke Slope Pheasant Vineyard
review: A round and generous red, with the flavors leaning toward the dark side, but the structure is crisp and expressive, offering notes of blackberry, tar and black pepper in the profile. Drink now through 2017. 375 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Cougar Hills
review: Dark, ripe and generous, a remarkably elegant mouthful of plum, pepper and exotic spice flavors, finishing with a wee touch of olive and game, all with some refinement to the tannins. Best after 2005. 138 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Klein
review: Brooding and tannic, with expressive notes of bacon fat, blackberry and wet slate shining through. Time in the cellar could do the trick. Best from 2019 through 2024. 287 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Klein
review: The tannins swarm around a solid core of blueberry and plum fruit, veering toward toffee and wet earth notes as the finish pushes past the texture and persists. Best after 2019. 242 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Morrison Lane
review: Round, ripe and decidedly gamy, an impressive mix of plum, berry and roasted meat flavors, hinting at pepper and exotic spices as it all lingers on the fine-grained finish. Give it time to develop. Best after 2005. 280 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Phil Lane
review: Dense, deep and focused, this features a beam of currant and plum fruit shining through a veil of fine tannins. Garrigue and moist earth hints add depth as the finish lingers. Drink now through 2018. 17 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley The Beautiful
review: Lithe and savory, showing green olive, moss and wet leaf notes around a core of black cherry and plum fruit. The tannins are nicely contained, and the finish rolls on without excess weight. Best after 2017. 658 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley The Beautiful
review: Lively, exuberant and brimming with raspberry, blackberry, lime and spice character, an especially tangy Syrah that keeps beaming the flavors through a long, polished finish. Drink now through 2010. 340 cases made.

name: Syrah Washington Motor City Kitty
review: Lithe, with crisp acidity and complex layers of blackberry, wet earth, black olive, tomato and herb. Interesting and intense, but not for all tastes. Best from 2016 through 2019. 700 cases made.

name: Syrah Washington Motor City Kitty
review: Vital and refreshing, with a good lift of acidity to the juicy plum and blackberry flavors, hinting at tar as the softly spicy finish lingers. Drink now through 2016. 380 cases made.

name: Syrah Washington Motor City Kitty
review: Firm in texture, this is lighter in weight than many versions, with dark berry and smoke flavors prominent, finishing with a tarry note. Needs time to flesh out. Best from 2013 through 2018. 220 cases made.

name: Syrah Washington Motor City Kitty
review: Expressive and open-textured, focusing its blackberry and black cherry flavors over polished tannins, picking up hints of flowers and cream as the finish lingers easily. Drink now through 2013. 95 cases made.

name: The Boy Columbia Valley
review: Supple, velvety and lively, with acidity to underpin the ripe cherry and spice flavors, glowing brightly as the finish lingers seductively. Grenache and Mourvèdre. Drink now through 2019. 475 cases made.

name: The Boy Washington
review: Supple, polished and expressive, with spicy orange peel overtones to the rhubarb and pear flavors, lingering on the refined finish. Grenache. Drink now through 2020. 1,223 cases made.

name: The Boy Washington
review: A light color, with seductive plum, white pepper, tomato leaf and spice flavors on a velvety frame, finishing with an open weave and fine tannins. Grenache and Syrah. Drink now through 2019. 389 cases made.

name: The Creator Walla Walla Valley
review: Rich, ripe and polished, with a glassy texture around a sleek core of peppery black cherry, cream and pear notes that linger easily on the expressive finish. Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah. Drink now through 2021. 1,446 cases made.

name: The Creator Walla Walla Valley
review: Dark and chewy, this is dense with blackberry, currant and tar flavors, glowing and pulsing against a layer of smoky tannins. Shows a lot of life. Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah. Best from 2011 through 2018. 365 cases made.

name: Viognier Columbia Valley
review: Polished and generous, showing a raw fruit edge to the lingering pear, apricot and spice flavors. This is lively, not unctuous, and could develop nicely with cellaring. Drink now through 2013. 1,200 cases made.

name: Viognier Yakima Valley Art Den Hoed
review: Ripe and expressive, with lemony acidity complementing pineapple and pear flavors that zing through the extended finish. Drink now through 2017. 1,600 cases made.

name: En Chamberlin El Jefe Walla Walla Valley
review: Lively, spicy and supple, brimming with cinnamon and clove accents to the plum and guava flavors, lingering on the refined finish against polished tannins. Tempranillo and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2014. 140 cases made.

name: En Chamberlin El Jefe Walla Walla Valley
review: Offers a lovely balance of blueberry and earthy, slightly minty spice flavors that hover gently through the expressive finish. Lithe and open-textured. Tempranillo and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2010. 95 cases made.

name: En Chamberlin Roma Walla Walla Valley
review: Rich in texture, beautifully focused, with a velvety feel to the tarry blackberry, currant and black olive flavors, finishing with harmony and power. Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah. Best from 2007 through 2012. 120 cases made.

name: Merlot Wahluke Slope Northridge Vineyard
review: Firm in texture, with licorice accents to the ripe cherry, red pepper and loamy earth flavors, finishing with persistence and a light tannic bite. Best after 2016. 368 cases made.

name: Ovide En Cerise Walla Walla Valley
review: Lithe and open-textured. Beautifully formed to show its pretty plum and blackberry flavors, framed with hints of leather and mint, trailing a whiff of coffee as the finish goes on against highly polished tannins. Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah. Drink now through 2014. 175 cases made.

name: Syrah Snipes Mountain The Cattle King Upland Vineyard
review: Gritty tannins surround a juicy core of blackberry and floral flavors, persisting into the long and open-textured finish. Drink now through 2019. 341 cases made.

name: Syrah Wahluke Slope Milbrandt
review: Fresh and spicy, with clove and white chocolate notes weaving through the blueberry and currant fruit, finishing with focus on a narrow beam. Drink now through 2017. 1,640 cases made.

name: Syrah Wahluke Slope Milbrandt
review: Smooth and inviting, with a meaty animal note adding a spark of interest to the ripe, walnut-accented black cherry flavors. The finish tastes a bit cooked, but this is distinctive and welcoming. Drink now through 2017. 750 cases made.

name: Syrah Wahluke Slope Milbrandt
review: Polished and lively, with a lovely open-textured feel to the plum, tobacco and roasted meat flavors, which linger on the extensive, perfumed finish. Drink now through 2013. 1,500 cases made.

name: Syrah Wahluke Slope Pheasant Vineyard
review: Polished, with earthy, meaty overtones to the cherry and pepper flavors, lingering against firm tannins. Drink now through 2014. 190 cases made.

name: Syrah Wahluke Slope The Deal Sundance Vineyard
review: This lithe style offers vibrant cherry and black currant flavors, veering toward black olive and roasted meat notes as the finish lingers against polished tannins. Best from 2015 through 2018. 210 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Cougar Hills
review: Has a distinctive array of flavors, offering a tangy, tangerinelike component along with lively blackberry and cherry character, remaining vibrant through the long, exuberant, slightly gamy finish. Drink now through 2010. 171 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Pepperbridge
review: Dense, dark and chewy, with layers of red berry, cherry and white pepper aromas and flavors that linger on the juicy, taut finish. Best from 2003 through 2006. 120 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Wells
review: Has a raw edge to the vibrant raspberry, pomegranate, coffee and peppery spice flavors, finishing with a gamy character and fine tannins, but the fruit comes through in the end. Best from 2006 through 2012. 48 cases made.

name: Syrah Washington Motor City Kitty
review: Bold blueberry and bitter chocolate aromas suggest a big wine, but the flavors surprise with supple complexity, offering smoky plum and pepper notes. Drink now through 2023. 1,270 cases made.

name: Viognier Columbia Valley
review: Vibrant, ripe, focused and distinctive, with honeyed almond and floral character around a core of pear and citrus flavors, lingering enticingly on the open-textured finish. Drink now through 2016. 1,875 cases made.

name: Viognier Columbia Valley
review: This silky, spicy white brims with floral, clove and white pepper flavors. The finish is almost oily-and that's a nice thing. Drink now. 850 cases made.

name: Viognier Yakima Valley Art Den Hoed
review: This bright, tangy style emphasizes floral and citrus flavors, weaving in delicate touches of apricot and peach as the finish rolls on. Drink now through 2018. 1,999 cases made.

name: El Jefe En Chamberlin Walla Walla Valley
review: Smooth and round, featuring a distinctive green olive note that harmonizes with the plum and blackberry fruit, finishing with finesse. Tempranillo and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2014. 134 cases made.

name: Sangiovese Walla Walla Valley Guido Jack's Vineyard
review: Bright and peppery, with zing to the raspberry and white chocolate flavors, lingering against a polished texture on the medium-weight finish. Drink now through 2019. 538 cases made.

name: Syrah Columbia Valley Milbrandt Wahluke Slope
review: Bright and crisp, with cherry and white pepper aromas and flavors, finishing with blueberry and cream notes, lingering nicely. Drink now through 2007. 630 cases made.

name: Syrah Snipes Mountain The Cattle King Upland Vineyard
review: Firm and focused, dense with grippy tannins and smoky overtones to the blackberry and plum flavors, finishing with oomph. Best after 2018. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 649 cases made.

name: Syrah Wahluke Slope Milbrandt
review: Polished, velvety, fresh and appealing for its black olive and roasted tomato nuances around a core of plum and berry fruit. Shows some style. Drink now through 2014. 830 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley
review: Supple, juicy style emphasizes elegant structure, even if the flavors are not as exuberant as other Syrahs. It has nicely focused blackberry and mineral notes that echo nicely on the firm finish. Drink now through 2005. 340 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Pepperbridge
review: Ripe, balanced with tangy acidity and a nice touch of pepper, offering solid cherry and plum flavors that echo nicely on the round, spicy finish. Drink now through 2008. 138 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Phil Lane
review: Taut and dense, with currant, dusty stone and garrigue flavors, framed by dry, grippy tannins. Best after 2018. 191 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Phil Lane
review: Fleshy and ripe, with nice blackberry and currant fruit at the center, hinting at smoke and black tea on the finish. Lingers against crisp tannins. Best from 2009 through 2015. 65 cases made.

name: Cape Blend Auction Reserve Cape Winemakers Guild Stellenbosch
review: Dark and winey, with sleek tannins framing the lush core of mulled currant, plum and anise flavors, all backed by black tea, smoked apple wood and bittersweet cocoa. The long finish has heft, but stays polished. Cabernet Sauvignon, Pinotage and Merlot. Drink now through 2013. 225 cases made.

name: Cape Blend Cape Winemakers Guild Stellenbosch
review: This has an old-school feel, with hints of bay leaf and mint leading the way for mulled currant and black cherry fruit. Lots of singed cedar and espresso cut through on the finish, where a mouthwatering iron note checks in as well. Cabernet Sauvignon and Pinotage. Drink now through 2020. 111 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch 1947 Cape Winemakers Guild
review: Lush, with gorgeous heather, brioche, peach, apricot and yellow apple notes all melded together and flowing through the broad but defined finish, where a lovely hint of verbena chimes in. Drink now through 2017. 70 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot Stellenbosch Auction Reserve Cape Winemakers Guild
review: Ripe and lush, with fig, boysenberry and plum sauce notes, laced with hints of espresso, graphite and fruitcake. The long finish is velvety and flattering. Drink now through 2012. 150 cases made.

name: Auction Reserve Cape Winemakers Guild Stellenbosch
review: Robust, with grilled meat, tobacco, tar and roasted chestnut notes, backed by a muscular, briary finish. Very gutsy. Cabernet Sauvignon, Pinotage and Merlot. Drink now through 2009.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Stellenbosch Cape Winemakers Guild
review: Rather mature, but holding together nicely, with loam, dried currant, plum sauce and cocoa powder notes backed by a long, fine-grained, cedary finish. If you like these with a little age, this is spot on now. Drink now.

name: Cape Blend Auction Reserve Cape Winemakers Guild Bottelary
review: Fleshy but reserved in style, with a mix of mint, coffee and currant notes backed by a supple, lingering finish. Yet this is deceptively concentrated, with the currant fruit hanging on nicely. Cabernet Sauvignon, Pinotage and Merlot. Drink now through 2009. 110 cases made.

name: Cape Blend Cape Winemakers Guild Stellenbosch
review: A juicy, bright, slightly tangy style, with red currant, bitter plum and blackberry fruit notes mixed together, offset with singed vanilla bean and sanguine hints on the finish. Drink now through 2015. 37 cases made.

name: Pentagon Cape Winemakers Guild Stellenbosch
review: This has matured already, with mint, bay and coffee notes taking the lead over lightly mulled currant and blackberry fruit. Leather and tobacco nuances line the finish. Decidedly old-school and ready to drink. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Malbec. Drink now through 2016. 37 cases made.

name: Pinotage Stellenbosch Reserve Cape Winemakers Guild
review: A maturing red, with roasted cedar and apple wood notes leading the way for a core of earth-tinged blackberry, currant and coffee notes, which rumble through the slightly rustic finish. This shows more guts than nuance though, despite the extra time in bottle. Contains 14 percent cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2012. 115 cases made.

name: Shiraz Stellenbosch
review: Ripe, muscular currant, anise and prune flavors, along with extra notes of cocoa, game and even Provençal garrigue. It's chunky, but has a lot packed into it, so let it blossom with some cellaring. Drink now through 2005. 3,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Stellenbosch
review: Sweet berry and cassis, with lots of smoke, and a nice mineral note coming in on the finish. Drink now through 2003. 3,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Stellenbosch
review: Shows lots of pretty cocoa powder, plum and smoke notes, with solid concentration, and enough structure in the background to carry it through. Drink now through 2003. 750 cases made.

name: Merlot Stellenbosch Wooded
review: Pure fruit quality, extremely ripe, evoking raspberry, cherry and spice, well integrated with the medium-weight and lively structure. Delicious. Drink now through 2002.

name: Shiraz Stellenbosch Wooded
review: Exuding violets and raspberries, this is a pretty Shiraz, taking on allspice, juniper and leather notes on the palate. Elegant, dense and creamy, it's not what you expect, yet it's very attractive. Drink now through 2001. 739 cases made.

name: Steytler Vision Stellenbosch
review: Mature but still lively, with currant, sanguine, coffee and prune notes that give way to a tangy mineral note on the finish. For fans of the mature, claret style. Cabernet Sauvignon, Pinotage and Merlot. Drink now. 100 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot Stellenbosch Bin 3
review: Fresh, ripe and forward, with dark berry, plum and toast flavors and a sweet, plush finish. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot Stellenbosch Bin 3
review: Red berry and blackberry fruit, with coffee and spice hints, and lots of sweet smoke on the finish. Picks up a slight rhubarb hint, but good. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Merlot-Cabernet Sauvignon Stellenbosch Bin 3
review: Tangy herb and black currant flavors mix in this medium-weight red, showing slightly snappy licorice and tobacco notes on the finish. Drink now. 3,500 cases made.

name: Pinotage Stellenbosch Steytler
review: A fruit bomb, bright and buoyed by light tannins wrapped around a core of raspberry and wild berry flavors. On the lean side, this should go well with simple grilled food. Drink now through 2001.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Stellenbosch
review: Cherry and raspberry flavors up front catch your attention, but overall it's a bit awkward. Firmly structured, with intensity and personality, it may come together with time. Drink now through 2002.

name: Sauvignon Blanc-Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch Combination
review: A lemon zest streak runs through the modest white peach and nectarine core, with a tangy finish. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Stellenbosch
review: A dark red, showing a slightly raisined edge to the plum, currant and fig fruit flavors, all layered with dark toast. This has weight, but it's a touch shy on purity. Drink now. 3,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Shiraz Stellenbosch Estate Red
review: Forward, with a mix of red and black cherry and tobacco notes, picking up an olive hint on the finish. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Pinotage Stellenbosch
review: Good sweet plum and prune fruit up front, but rather mature, with the flavors giving way to coffee, earth and truffle notes on the finish. Don't wait. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Steytler Vision Stellenbosch
review: Softening, and a touch over the top, with cassis, blackberry and plum jam notes that are friendly, but lack some definition, as the grip has started to fade. Cabernet Sauvignon, Pinotage and Merlot. Drink now. 450 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Negev Reserve
review: Offers a spicy aroma, with ripe flavors of blueberry and boysenberry. This medium-bodied red has a broad, supple texture and good fruity length on the creamy finish. Kosher. Drink now. 138 cases imported.

name: Merlot Negev Reserve
review: Very juicy and lush, with berry, smoke and tar notes. Finishes with touches of salt and pepper. Kosher. Drink now. 138 cases imported.

name: Negev Gilad
review: Very plummy, showing berry and stewy components, with a hint of tomato. Finishes with sweet-and-sour notes. Kosher. Drink now. 224 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Pure and rich, with a mix of dark berry, dill, cedar and cigar box notes, weighted toward the cedar and tobacco side. Full-bodied and firmly tannic on the finish, this needs time to develop and should reward short-term cellaring. Drink now through 2023. 175 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Rutherford Hunt McKay Morisoli Vineyard
review: Quite oaky, with a charry wood dominance that gives a dose of charcoal amid the muddled dark berry notes, with oak being an annoyance. Give this a long decant. Drink now. 350 cases made.

name: Syrah Red Mountain Ciel Du Cheval Vineyard
review: Firm in texture, with a swarm of fine tannins wound around a sleek core of currant and exotic spice flavors, narrowing on the finish. Best after 2014. 75 cases made.

name: Grenache Santa Ynez Valley
review: Generous layers of ripe blackberry, wild berry and raspberry are tight, focused, long and persistent, ending with firm, ripe tannins and a nice spicy edge. Drink now through 2012. 50 cases made.

name: Grenache Santa Ynez Valley Tierra Alta Vineyard
review: A rich, explosive style, with dense, vivid raspberry, blackberry and boysenberry flavors, maintaining a snappy vibrancy on the long finish. Drink now through 2022. 175 cases made.

name: Syrah Ballard Canyon Tenth Anniversary Tierra Alta Vineyard
review: The zesty, vibrant blueberry and huckleberry notes are pure, fresh and snappy, unfolding slowly but gracefully. This ends with a long, persistent finish that keeps the flavors lingering. Drink now through 2023. 50 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Ynez Valley
review: Dark, rich and plush, with layers of ripe plum, pomegranate and blackberry fruit that's deftly balanced, offering depth and length, with ripe, fine-grained tannins. Drink now through 2010. 100 cases made.

name: Grenache Santa Ynez Valley Larner Vineyard
review: An immense wine, gutsy, rich and tannic, presenting a powerful mix of dark berry, chocolate, spice, black licorice, cedar and crushed rock flavors. Maintains focus, ending chewy and persistent. Drink now through 2022. 125 cases made.

name: Hapa Santa Ynez Valley
review: Ripe and vibrant, with zesty wild berry, blackberry and black cherry flavors that are tightly wound and focused, finishing with a burst of fresh, lively fruit flavors and crisp acidity. Syrah, Grenache and Mourvèdre. Drink now through 2012. 150 cases made.

name: Grenache Santa Ynez Valley
review: Focused and precise, with floral cherry and spice aromas and ripe, delicately layered flavors of raspberry, smoky sage and mineral. Drink now through 2024. 500 cases made.

name: Grenache Santa Ynez Valley La Presa Vineyard
review: A racy red, with good focus and structure, showing lively aromas of ripe raspberry and cinnamon, and appealing flavors of red currant, jalapeño and mocha. Drink now through 2025. 100 cases made.

name: Grenache Santa Ynez Valley Larner Vineyard
review: Rich, plush, deep and stylish, with a center of juicy blackberry, huckleberry and spice. Open knit and ready to drink. Fruity aftertaste. Drink now through 2017. 100 cases made.

name: Grenache Santa Ynez Valley Larner Vineyard
review: Rich and intense, with grapey wild berry, raspberry and huckleberry providing the core flavors. Full-bodied and well-structured, gaining traction on the finish, with firm tannins. Drink now through 2014. 150 cases made.

name: Grenache Santa Ynez Valley Larner Vineyard
review: Offers plump, ripe and generous plum and black cherry fruit that builds intensity and structure, firming up on the finish. Full-bodied and brimming with ripe fruit. Drink now. 100 cases made.

name: Grenache Santa Ynez Valley Tierra Alta Vineyard
review: Ripe and plump, with supple plum, black cherry and wild berry fruit that's full-bodied and easy to enjoy, with enough complexity and depth to hold your interest. Drink now through 2012. 100 cases made.

name: Hapa Santa Ynez Valley
review: Rich, complex and full-bodied, this is layered with flavors built around earthy sage, blackberry, wild berry, anise, pepper and nutmeg. Firms up nicely on the finish. Syrah, Grenache and Mourvèdre. Drink now through 2017. 225 cases made.

name: Hapa Santa Ynez Valley
review: This has wonderful fruit purity, with a full-bodied mix of blueberry, wild berry, boysenberry and huckleberry fruit that's delicious to drink now. Syrah, Grenache and Mourvèdre. Drink now through 2012. 150 cases made.

name: Syrah Ballard Canyon Tierra Alta Vineyard
review: Dark and intense, with rich blackberry and huckleberry notes that are snappy and firmly tannic. Yet the tannins are ripe, allowing this to gain a measure of suppleness midpalate on. Drink now through 2026. 100 cases made.

name: Grenache Ballard Canyon Larner Vineyard
review: Tightly focused, with a complex core, showing ripe but dried cherry notes plus espresso, grilled herb and mineral details. Drink now through 2024. 125 cases made.

name: Grenache Ballard Canyon Larner Vineyard
review: Pure, fresh and snappy, with fresh-crushed grape, raspberry, cranberry and spice evident throughout. Drink now through 2024. 175 cases made.

name: Grenache Ballard Canyon Tierra Alta Vineyard
review: Soft and easygoing flavors of cherry pie and smoky sage are accented by a touch of peppered beef. Drink now through 2024. 200 cases made.

name: Grenache Ballard Canyon Tierra Alta Vineyard
review: Presents a tasty mix of raspberry, black cherry and spice-scented fruit, supported by ripe, gripping tannins that end with a cleansing sensation. Drink now through 2024. 175 cases made.

name: Grenache Blanc Santa Ynez Valley La Presa Vineyard
review: The fresh peach and apricot flavors have a lemony squirt of acidity, with plenty of spice and floral details, a fleshy texture and a long finish. Drink now. 100 cases made.

name: Grenache Santa Ynez Valley
review: Plush and zesty, with aromas of raspberry and spicy cinnamon leading to lively flavors of cherry pie, grilled herb and espresso. Drink now through 2023. 275 cases made.

name: Grenache Santa Ynez Valley
review: Ripe, juicy plum, blackberry and black cherry fruit is elegant and easy-drinking, with touches of spice and flowers. Drink now. 150 cases made.

name: Grenache Santa Ynez Valley Larner Vineyard
review: Seductive creamy oak is evident in the aroma and flavor and that gives this a sweet mouthfeel. Supple, with black cherry, cranberry and wild berry fruit, this one grows on you. Drink now through 2009. 50 cases made.

name: Grenache Santa Ynez Valley Tierra Alta Vineyard
review: Supple and creamy, with a hint of vanilla amid a medley of cherry and berry flavors. Finishes with crisp acidity and fine tannins. Drink now through 2009. 50 cases made.

name: Hale Santa Barbara County
review: Complex, if a bit jumbled now, with intense spice, pepper, dried berry, sage and cedar flavors, yet on the finish it all folds together nicely, ending with an uplifting note of black licorice. Syrah, Cabernet Sauvignon and Mourvèdre. Drink now through 2017. 200 cases made.

name: Hapa Santa Ynez Valley
review: Fresh and vibrant, with snappy wild berry, plum and huckleberry flavors. Medium- to full-bodied, this is complex and elegant on the finish. Syrah, Grenache, Mourvèdre and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2017. 200 cases made.

name: Grenache Santa Ynez Valley
review: Fresh and snappy, with vibrant raspberry, blackberry and wilted rose scents, ending with firm, ripe, gripping tannins. Drink now through 2026. 250 cases made.

name: Grenache Santa Ynez Valley Larner Vineyard
review: Delivers a ripe, juicy mix of red berry fruit, with touches of mineral and spice, ending with red licorice and fine-grained tannins. Drink now through 2018. 125 cases made.

name: Grenache Santa Ynez Valley Tierra Alta Vineyard
review: Tight, with taut cedar, dried currant, sage and herbal-mineral scents that are complex and concentrated, ending with firm tannins. Drink now through 2011. 50 cases made.

name: Hale Santa Barbara County
review: Offers lots of grapey wild berry and blackberry fruit that's supple and easygoing, full-bodied and complex. Ends with mild tannins. Grenache and Syrah. Drink now. 120 cases made.

name: Hapa Blanc Santa Ynez Valley
review: Peach, tropical and citrus flavors are ripe and round, with both a luscious mouthfeel and refreshing acidity. There's good intensity and focus, with an apricot finish. Grenache Blanc and Roussanne. Drink now. 170 cases made.

name: Hapa Santa Ynez Valley
review: Exhibits ripe plum and blackberry, with a roasted pepper and hot brick edge. Cloaked in firm tannins. Syrah, Grenache and Mourvèdre. Drink now through 2020. 200 cases made.

name: Syrah Ballard Canyon Tierra Alta Vineyard
review: Spry and appealingly rustic, with notes of raspberry, briary underbrush and grilled herb. Drink now through 2023. 150 cases made.

name: Grenache Los Olivos District La Presa Vineyard
review: Plump and ripe, with notes of smoky herb, raspberry, blueberry and pepper. Drink now through 2024. 175 cases made.

name: Grenache Santa Ynez Valley
review: This red delivers intense, firm, vivid raspberry, blackberry, black tea and dried herb notes, flexing some tannic muscle on the finish. Drink now through 2020. 225 cases made.

name: Grenache Santa Ynez Valley
review: Pure and pleasant, with ripe, supple plum and black cherry fruit that's easy to enjoy. Drink now. 200 cases made.

name: Grenache Santa Ynez Valley Larner Vineyard
review: A touch musty, with ripe dark berry, espresso, dried herb and savory notes. This ends up being drying and grainy on the finish. Drink now through 2020. 100 cases made.

name: Grenache Santa Ynez Valley Rosé
review: A full-throttle rosé, featuring a bold pink hue and aromas of raspberry and cinnamon, with ripe juicy cherry and spice flavors. Drink now. 200 cases made.

name: Grenache Santa Ynez Valley Tierra Alta Vineyard
review: Ripe and medium-weight, with tasty, easy-drinking cherry and raspberry flavors. Drink now through 2018. 175 cases made.

name: Grenache Santa Ynez Valley Tierra Alta Vineyard
review: Firm and intense, well-structured, with ripe strawberry and plum jam notes that are full-bodied and expansive, gaining traction on the finish. Drink now through 2014. 75 cases made.

name: Grenache Santa Ynez Valley Vie Caprice Vineyard
review: Rich and gutsy, ripe and roughhewn, with chunky red and dark berry notes that echo and turn a bit muddled. Drink now through 2019. 75 cases made.

name: Hale Santa Barbara County
review: Offers a tight mix of dried berry, blackberry, mineral and crushed rock, turning simple on the finish. Syrah, Mourvèdre and Grenache. Drink now. 200 cases made.

name: Hale Santa Barbara County
review: Good intensity, delivering grapey plum, wild berry and black cherry fruit that's pure and polished. Easy-drinking yet complex, with lingering flavors. Grenache and Syrah. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Hapa Blanc Santa Ynez Valley
review: The peach, nectarine, apple and lemon flavors are balanced, bold and very refreshing, with terrific details of citrus zest and lemongrass. Roussanne, Grenache Blanc and Riesling. Drink now. 200 cases made.

name: Hapa Santa Ynez Valley
review: Smooth, easy-drinking, complex and inviting, with spicy raspberry and wild berry fruit, ending with good length. Syrah and Grenache. Drink now through 2010. 75 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Santa Ynez Valley Tierra Alta Vineyard
review: Distinctive, with honeyed notes of pear, peach, apple and citrus, a floral, honeysuckle note and tangy acidity. Drink now. 150 cases made.

name: Grenache Blanc Santa Ynez Valley La Presa Vineyard
review: Shows good intensity to the lemon-scented citrus flavors, with plenty of juicy acidity and spice, zest and herbal notes. Refreshing finish. Drink now. 100 cases made.

name: Hapa Blanc Santa Ynez Valley
review: Pineapple, peach and apple flavors are fresh and lively, with almond skin and floral details, and a hefty dose of toasty, spicy accents. Moderate acidity chimes in on the finish. Roussanne, Grenache Blanc, Sauvignon Blanc and Riesling. Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Hapa Blanc Santa Ynez Valley
review: A rich, full-bodied and smooth wine, offering ripe peach, nectarine and yellow pear flavors, with soft acidity. Finishes with spice and hay notes. Grenache Blanc and Roussanne. Drink now. 100 cases made.

name: Hapa Blanc Santa Ynez Valley
review: Citrus, peach and lime peel notes have a crisp, refreshing edge, floral note, and slightly coarse (though not distracting) texture. Grenache Blanc and Roussanne. Drink now. 125 cases made.

name: Grenache Santa Ynez Valley
review: Elegantly styled, supple and easy-drinking, with dried cherry, herb and earthy notes that are clean and refreshing. Drink now. 125 cases made.

name: Hapa Blanc Santa Ynez Valley
review: Tangy lemon flavors are backed up by a dominating acidity, with touches of herb and spice on the finish. Grenache Blanc and Roussanne. Drink now. 175 cases made.

name: Grenache Ballard Canyon Tierra Alta Vineyard
review: Compact and fairly closed, with accents of cinnamon, cherry and herb. Drink now through 2022. 200 cases made.

name: Halé Santa Barbara County
review: A zesty red, with modest flavors of cherry, herb and spice. Tannins bracket the finish. Grenache and Syrah. Drink now through 2022. 425 cases made.

name: Grenache Santa Ynez Valley Larner Vineyard
review: Tastes racy, with high-toned fruit that has sweet-sour cherry flavors that are a bit lifted. Best of two bottles. Drink now. 75 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Old Bastard
review: A big but remarkably elegant wine, focusing its pure blueberry, blackberry and plum flavors on a laser beam of finely balanced tannins and judicious acidity, persisting on the finish with glints of white pepper, licorice and coffee. Serious stuff that begs for cellar time. Best from 2010 through 2025. 400 cases made.

name: Old Bastard Barossa Valley
review: Big but graceful. Offers a plush mouthful of ripe cherry, blackberry, pomegranate and cardamom, mingling beautifully on the rich, expressive finish. The tannins are beautifully integrated and refined, but definitely worth cellaring to soften. Shiraz. Best from 2010 through 2020. 500 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Old Bastard
review: Velvety, round and beautifully focused, lifting its blackberry, currant and delicate spice profile into the long, expressive finish. Powerful, but not weighty. Best from 2014 through 2020. 500 cases made.

name: Old Bastard Barossa Valley
review: Lithe and juicy. A lively mouthful of raspberry, currant, coffee and peppery spice flavors, lingering enticingly on the fine-grained finish. Shows a bit of heat on the finish, but has tremendous depth and persistence. A bit tight now, this can benefit from cellaring. Shiraz. Best from 2010 through 2018. 1,200 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Old Bastard
review: A skyscraper of a wine. Dense, powerful and rangy, with raw-edged cherry, blackberry and cedary spice flavors competing for attention, persisting impressively on the long, vivid finish. Give it time to integrate its tannins. Best from 2007 through 2017. 300 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley The Bogan
review: Ripe and rich, but not over the top, a plush mouthful of cherry, blackberry, plum and licorice flavors, picking up coffee and cream notes as the finish sails on and on. Tannins are nicely integrated, but they can use cellaring to soften. Best from 2008 through 2019. 1,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Old Bastard
review: Dark, dense and muscular, with a mouthful of blackberry, spice and espresso flavors, accented by a touch of candied ginger. Robust and intense, featuring flavors that persist on the finish, transmitting power and focus. Drink now through 2030. 500 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Old Vine
review: Smooth, velvety and deep, glowing with rich cherry, blackberry, anise and mocha flavors, which echo beautifully and long on the round, plush finish. Drink now through 2010. 600 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Alte Reben
review: Polished and supple, with cinnamon-scented black cherry, dark chocolate and espresso flavors. Intense and harmonious on the long finish, where the fine-grained tannins linger. Drink now through 2021. 500 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Old Bastard
review: Big, ripe and generous, delivering a powerful mouthful of spicy blackberry, black plum, licorice and tobacco flavors that push right through the fine tannins on the long, slightly hot finish. Best from 2010 through 2018. 500 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Old Vine
review: Dense and complex, layered with black cherry, licorice, smoke and orange peel flavors that push against fine tannins on the finish. Needs cellaring to come together. Best from 2017 through 2022. 800 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Old Vine
review: Smooth and open-textured, this is nicely fleshed out with red berry and cherry flavors, shaded on the long, refined finish with hints of pepper and spice. Drink now through 2017. 1,500 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Old Vine
review: Ripe and generous, a big, round wine that bursts with black currant, blackberry and licorice flavors on a polished, generous frame. A classic Barossa Shiraz that manages to keep from going over the top. Drink now through 2015. 500 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley The Bogan
review: Sleek, polished and refined, wrapping cherry, tobacco and cinnamon flavors in silky tannins. The finish shows persistence. Best from 2016 through 2022. 1,200 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley The Bogan
review: Fresh and vibrant, this brims with red berry and cinnamon flavors, feeling plush as the finish lingers easily. Shows depth and swagger. Drink now through 2017. 2,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz South Eastern Australia Stonehorse
review: Polished and expressive, offering a lithe silhouette of dark berry, fresh currant, coffee and muddled spices. The flavors expand and roll easily through the long finish. Drink now through 2020. 5,000 cases made.

name: The Bogan Barossa Valley
review: Dark and inky, big but not gigantic, bursting with plum, cherry and white pepper flavors, hinting at cream as the spices kick in on the round, generous finish. Shiraz. Best from 2012 through 2017. 1,000 cases made.

name: Grenache-Shiraz-Mourvèdre Barossa Valley Stonehorse
review: Smooth and polished, with a lovely core of black cherry and currant fruit, dripping with dark chocolate and smoky spice notes as the finish goes on. Impressive for its balance and length. Drink now through 2014. 4,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Australia Stonehorse
review: Juicy and precise, with wild blueberry and cherry flavors that are vibrant, set against a dense, tannic backdrop of cedar and rosemary. Persistent on the long finish. Drink now through 2020. 5,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Old Vine
review: Bright and focused, a jazzy mouthful of blackberry and cherry fruit shaded with licorice and pepper. It gets a bit alcoholic in the mouth, but it has the density to carry it off. Best after 2008. 400 cases made.

name: The Bogan Barossa Valley
review: Lithe, supple and generous. A silken mouthful of ripe blueberry, plum and black olive flavors, mingling effectively as the finish rolls on and on. The tannins are well-integrated. Shiraz. Drink now through 2013. 2,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Barossa Valley
review: Plum and huckleberry flavors are ripe, fleshy and velvety, with chai tea, black walnut and vanilla bean details. Generous and lingering on the long finish. Drink now through 2027. 3,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Old Vine
review: Smooth and ripe, with dark berry, tobacco and wet earth flavors, persisting on the solid finish. The tannins are well-submerged. Drink now through 2017. 600 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Old Vine
review: Dark, rich and peppery, it packs in lots of wild berry, anise, stewed plum and cherry flavors, gaining finesse and polish on the finish, where it turns chocolaty. Drink now through 2007. 700 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Stonehorse
review: Starts with a grip, then softens as the blackberry, currant and dusky spice flavors play out, remaining lively as the finish lingers. Drink now through 2017. 2,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Stonehorse
review: Polished on the outside, vibrant on the inside, with a whoosh of cherry, plum and licorice flavor that just won't quit as the finish persists impressively. Drink now through 2012. 3,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Stonehorse
