review: Dense and chewy, concentrating its raspberry and red cherry flavors with vanilla and licorice notes, echoing on the fine-grained finish. Drink now through 2008. 1,500 cases made.

name: Stonehorse Barossa Valley
review: Smooth and velvety, with dusky tobacco nuances to the ripe blackberry and spice flavors, gliding nicely on a sleek frame. Grenache, Shiraz and Mourvèdre. Drink now through 2016. 10,000 cases made.

name: The Bogan Barossa Valley
review: Firm and chewy, this tough-textured Shiraz has a glowing core of blackberry, cola and spice flavors straining to poke through. Needs time to let it happen. Best from 2011 through 2018. 2,500 cases made.

name: The Fave Barossa Valley
review: Lithe, spicy and distinctive for the earthy undertones woven through the cherry, blackberry and clove flavors linger on the polished finish. Grenache. Drink now through 2011. 500 cases made.

name: Riesling Barossa Valley Old Vine
review: Crisp and forward, with peach, pineapple and mineral flavors, lingering easily, finishing dry. Drink now through 2013. 250 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Old Vine
review: Wild berry and fresh herb flavors are brambly and have a rustic edge, with chewy tannins and a note of toasted caraway. Drink now through 2022. 800 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Stonehorse
review: Broad, fresh and open, a lively mouthful of currant, blackberry and dusky spice flavors, picking up peppery notes as the flavors persist against very fine tannins. Best from 2008 through 2012. 3,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley The Bogan
review: Firm, delivering cedar and roasted herb flavors, this has currant and dried berry notes mingling with fresh clay accents and taut tannins on the finish. Hints of sage and rosemary provide an aromatic lift. Drink now through 2022. 1,200 cases made.

name: Stonehorse Barossa Valley
review: Fresh and appealing for its medium weight and fresh-tasting plum and spice flavors, framed by sandy tannins and a hint of black coffee as the finish lingers. Shiraz, Grenache and Mourvèdre. Drink now through 2015. 5,000 cases made.

name: Viognier Barossa Valley
review: Smooth and round, with pretty pear and spice flavors, aiming more for refinement than flamboyance. Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Avignon Barossa Valley
review: Firm in texture, lean and focused, with licorice-accented berry flavors that persist well against moderate grip. Grenache, Shiraz and Mourvèdre. Drink now through 2015. 1,200 cases made.

name: Avignon Barossa Valley
review: Vibrant and focused, with a distinctly floral character settling like a blanket over the ripe cherry and raspberry fruit. Tannins are present, but know their place. Grenache, Shiraz and Mourvèdre. Best from 2010 through 2014. 600 cases made.

name: Avignon Barossa Valley
review: Lithe and appealing for its juicy cherry and pomegranate flavors, finishing with a fresh, earthy tang. Grenache, Shiraz and Mourvèdre. Drink now through 2010. 900 cases made.

name: Avignon Barossa Valley
review: Chunky, sturdy, packed with tobacco-scented cherry and berry flavors, picking up a floral note but keeping the fruit going on the chewy finish. Grenache, Shiraz, Mourvèdre and Viognier. Best from 2006 through 2010. 600 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Barossa Valley
review: Bright and refreshing, with a mild grip to the texture surrounding the black currant and spice flavors, lingering nicely. Drink now through 2019. 1,500 cases made.

name: Grenache-Shiraz Barossa Valley Avignon
review: This lithe style offers currant and floral flavors on a velvety texture, picking up butter and spice notes as the finish lingers. Drink now through 2019. 1,000 cases made.

name: Sémillon Barossa Valley Old Vine
review: Fresh, tangy and appealing for its crisp texture and grapefruit flavors that linger well. Drink now through 2011. 500 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Old Bastard
review: Firm in texture, with density but not extra weight to the boysenberry and roasted meat flavors. Lingers nicely. A solid Shiraz, but lacks the flair of previous vintages. Best from 2012 through 2017. 250 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Old Vine
review: Bright and jazzy, a vigorous wine with layers of cherry, beet and strawberry shaded with hints of anise and toast, all echoing nicely on the finish. Best after 1999. 500 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Old Vine
review: Lithe in texture, rich in flavor, with anise-scented blackberry and cherry flavors that linger with concentration on the finish. Best from 1999 to 2000. 500 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Stonehorse
review: Firm in texture and juicy in flavor, this red is a claret style of Shiraz that shows cedary berry flavors and fine tannins, with the flavors lasting nicely through the finish. Drink now through 2007. 800 cases made.

name: Grenache-Shiraz-Mourvèdre Barossa Valley Stonehorse
review: Thick and sturdy, a chunky wine with ripe cherry, floral and spice flavors, finishing on a meaty note. Best from 2005 through 2010. 3,800 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Old Vine
review: Rich and mouthfilling, this is a full-bodied Shiraz with toasty berry and plum flavors that show hints of licorice on the velvety finish. Best from 1999. 3,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Stonehorse
review: On the crisp side, with tobacco and smoke overtones to the dark berry flavors, lingering on the narrow finish. Drink now through 2015. 2,500 cases made.

name: Avignon Barossa Valley
review: Firm in texture, a sturdy wine with polished mulberry and rhubarb flavors, lingering on the spicy finish. Grenache, Shiraz and Mourvèdre. Drink now through 2013. 1,200 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Barossa Valley
review: Ripe, generous and a bit funky, with meaty, suggestively vegetal undertones to the cherry and chocolate flavors. Drink now through 2012. 1,000 cases made.

name: Sémillon Barossa Valley Old Vine
review: An odd balance of pear, bitters and sour salt flavors that eventually becomes smooth and distinctive. A bit unsettling. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Stonehorse
review: A sinewy wine, on the lean side, with mineral and black olive accents to the berry flavors, finishing tight. Needs time to soften. Best after 2012. 5,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Stonehouse
review: Crisp and appealing for its juicy blueberry, plum and sweet spice flavors, lingering on the somewhat oaky finish. Best after 2008. 4,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz South Australia Stonehorse
review: Firm in texture, medium-weight, with green olive overtones to the black fruit flavors, finishing on an earthy note. Drink now through 2018. 5,000 cases made.

name: Avignon Barossa Valley
review: Firm, with pretty plum and berry flavors at the core, finishing with a peppery, ever-so-slightly bitter edge. Grenache, Shiraz and Mourvèdre. Best from 2006 through 2009. 1,000 cases made.

name: Grenache-Shiraz Barossa Valley Stonehorse
review: A tight mix of cedar, spice and cherry flavors. Fresh earth and toasted nut notes linger on the finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Stonehorse Barossa Valley
review: Firm in texture and a bit leaner than most Grenache, with taut blackberry and spice flavors. Grenache, Mourvèdre and Shiraz. Drink now through 2017. 5,000 cases made.

name: Viognier Barossa Valley
review: Very spicy, with a strong peppery note weaving through the modest pear flavors. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Sémillon Barossa Valley Old Vine
review: Tart, with hay and grain character more prominent than the fruit. Drink now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Sémillon Barossa Valley Old Vine
review: Pale, with earthy pear flavors and smoky, peppery notes on the finish. Drink now through 2010. 500 cases made.

name: Stonehorse Barossa Valley
review: Soft on balance and in texture, with an earthy, vegetal edge to the ripe plum and licorice flavors. Shiraz, Grenache and Mourvèdre. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Barbara County Colson Canyon Vineyard
review: Intense and concentrated, with superripe black cherry, pomegranate, black currant and spice tones that keep the flavors coming, with plenty of toasty oak and a wave of round tannins. Drink now through 2010. 126 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Ynez Valley
review: Brimming with ripe, complex black cherry, plum, and wild berry flavors that approach over-the-top ripeness, with excellent concentration, brawny tannins and generous toasty oak tones in a powerful, alcoholic finish. Drink now through 2009. 263 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Ynez Valley
review: Flavorful, with smoke, grape, anise and blackberry flavors and a smooth, rich texture. Nice first release for this producer. Drink now. 88 cases made.

name: Syrah Central Coast
review: Raspberry flavors are ripe and bright, with cinnamon, toast, and a hint of orange peel. Drink now. 1,224 cases made.

name: Syrah Central Coast
review: Vibrant, intense, tart blueberry jam and white pepper flavors on a smooth frame with a spicy finish. Drink now through 2005. 420 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Nelson
review: Soft and appealing for its pure varietal flavors, offering grapefruit, pear, floral and spice notes that last on the off-dry finish. Drink now. 56 cases imported.

name: Malbec Mendoza Mai
review: Explosively fruity and concentrated, with luscious flavors of raspberry preserves, blackberry pie and dark plum that feature plenty of Asian spice notes. Cocoa powder and vanilla accents linger on the rich finish.  Drink now through 2022. 80 cases imported.

name: Malbec Mendoza Mai
review: Very plush and creamy, with unctuous flavors of dark cherry, hoisin sauce, dried blackberry and membrillo. Dark chocolate and Asian spice notes fill the rich finish, along with lively pepper details. Drink now through 2019. 100 cases imported.

name: Malbec Mendoza Mai
review: Dark and powerful, with concentrated macerated fig and racy cassis notes backed by hints of mesquite, licorice and woodsy spice. Long finish. Drink now through 2017. 300 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Mendoza Ultra
review: A ripe and powerful red, with concentrated flavors of dark cherry, smoke and Asian spice that are loaded with chocolate and fresh-ground coffee notes. Creamy and lush on the rich finish. Drink now through 2020. 1,500 cases imported.

name: Malbec Mendoza Mai
review: Dense and compact, with layers of plum skin, mulled blackberry and cassis flavors framed by fine tannins. Accents of espresso bean, maduro tobacco and licorice snap mark the long, muscular finish. This isn't shy about its toast, but has the depth of fruit to pull it off. Drink now through 2012. 1,000 cases made.

name: Malbec Mendoza Reserva
review: This ripe red is filled with plenty of dark chocolate and Asian spice notes up front, wrapped around flavors of roasted plum, dark currant and wild herb. Features a luscious mouthfeel, with a finish supported by medium-grained tannins. Drink now through 2020. 30,000 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Mendoza Ultra
review: A dark, rich red, displaying layers of mocha, tar and spice to the ripe cassis, plum and kirsch notes. There's depth to the flavors that reverberate on the tangy finish. Drink now. 3,000 cases imported.

name: Malbec Mendoza Mai
review: Rich and plush, with firm flavors of dried blackberry and dark cherry, supported by sinewy tannins. The creamy finish is filled with plenty of dried juniper and beefy notes. Drink now through 2019. 350 cases made.

name: Malbec Mendoza Ultra
review: This is loaded to the brim with effusive Asian spice and chocolate mousse accents, delivering blackberry pie and plum tart flavors. The firm finish is long and rich, with enticing savory and slate notes. Drink now. 5,500 cases imported.

name: Malbec Mendoza Ultra
review: Aromatic and dark, with notes of incense, cigar box and spice to the chewy dark plum and cassis flavors, followed by a structured finish. Drink now through 2016. 3,500 cases imported.

name: Malbec Mendoza Ultra
review: Dark and juicy, delivering anise, plum skin and dark crushed currant fruit that's carried by nicely integrated grip. Hints of tar and charcoal check in on the finish. Drink now through 2011. 2,500 cases imported.

name: Malbec Mendoza Ultra
review: Ripe and solid, with a nice range of blueberry, fig and boysenberry fruit layered with sweet toast that carries through on the long, polished finish. Drink now through 2009. 20,000 cases made.

name: Malbec Mendoza Ultra Las Rocas
review: Dense and rich-tasting, with a muscular mix of dark currant and black olive flavors that are supported by firm tannins. Cocoa powder and slate notes fill the finish, along with peppery hints. Drink now through 2022. 10,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Mendoza Ultra
review: Shows focused loam, currant, fig and coffee flavors that linger nicely on the muscular finish. Drink now through 2008. 3,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Mendoza Ultra
review: Muscular, with a hint of funk (that blows off quickly) followed by black currant, espresso, bittersweet chocolate and loam flavors. Concentrated on the finish. For fans of the style. Drink now through 2007. 3,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Malbec-Petit Verdot Mendoza Terroir Series
review: This has a good backbone to the dark plum, graphite and dried berry flavors, accented by baker's chocolate notes. Blueberry pie details show on the finish, with plenty of tannins. Drink now through 2020. 700 cases imported.

name: Corte Mendoza
review: Game, herb and spice notes accent the tangy dark cherry and plum flavors in this medium- to full-bodied red, lingering with a spicy aftertaste. Malbec, Bonarda and Petit Verdot. Drink now. 2,200 cases imported.

name: Malbec Mendoza
review: Very fresh and pure, with lovely violet, shaved vanilla and dark raspberry notes gliding over fine-grained tannins. The long, suave finish has a nice pastis hint. Drink now. 17,000 cases imported.

name: Malbec Mendoza Reserva
review: This features some engaging floral accents to the sturdy dark plum, raspberry and chocolate flavors. Mineral and Asian spice notes lengthen out pleasantly, with peppery details on the finish. Drink now through 2019. 30,000 cases imported.

name: Malbec Mendoza Ultra
review: A firm and savory red, with dense flavors of dark plum, dried blackberry and dark currant. Bittersweet chocolate accents linger with creamy notes on the focused finish. Drink now through 2018. 13,000 cases made.

name: Malbec Mendoza Ultra
review: This dark, jammy red displays rich plum, dark cherry and grilled fig notes, fortified with mocha, salted licorice and underbrush flavors, which expand with some air. Drink now. 2,900 cases imported.

name: Malbec Mendoza Ultra
review: A dark, toasty style, delivering macerated black currant, fig sauce and coffee notes held together by a nice graphite underpinning. Dark fruit hangs on nicely through the finish. Drink now. 2,900 cases imported.

name: Malbec Mendoza Ultra
review: A ripe, modern style. Bacony toast and coffee is layered with dark plum, currant and boysenberry fruit. Plenty of muscle, with more prominent tannins than many of its peers, but with the requisite flesh and fruit for balance. Drink now through 2008. 3,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Mendoza Ultra
review: This dark, zesty red sports macerated cherry, cassis, spice box, incense and smoke notes on a full, rich frame. Drink now. 1,900 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Mendoza Ultra
review: A dark, beefy red, offering a spicy mix of currant, black cherry and red plum notes framed by hints of incense and leather, with light yet firm tannins on the cedary finish. Drink now. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 1,400 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Mendoza Ultra
review: Solid, with a mix of red and black currant fruit layered with coffee and bittersweet cocoa notes. Good grip on the finish. Drink now. 6,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Mendoza Ultra Leyenda
review: Minerally and muscular, showing good concentration to the plum pudding, hot stone and cocoa powder flavors. Savory notes linger on the fresh finish. Drink now. 9,200 cases made.

name: Malbec Mendoza
review: This has a solid core of raspberry and macerated cherry fruit, laced with a bright floral hint and a lively mineral note that helps extend the finish. Very tasty. Drink now. 19,100 cases imported.

name: Malbec Mendoza
review: Good loam and cocoa notes, with mineral, sanguine, currant preserve and pepper flavors. Smoky finish has a nice tug of earth, but also plenty of fruit. Drink now through 2007. 5,000 cases made.

name: Malbec Mendoza
review: Interesting black pepper note running through blackberry and boysenberry flavors. It's all covered with a sweet, dark chocolate coating that dominates the finish. A bit heavy on the chocolate toast here, but will have some fans. From Aurelio Montes of Chile. Drink now through 2006. 4,000 cases made.

name: Malbec Mendoza Ultra
review: Taut and sinewy, with plenty of peppery notes to the red plum and spiced cherry flavors. Minerally details extend on the crisp finish. Drink now through 2018. 5,800 cases imported.

name: Malbec Mendoza Ultra
review: More like Cabernet than Malbec, with dark, muscular currant, blackberry and coffee notes, followed by a loamy hint on the plush finish. Drink now through 2008. 7,000 cases made.

name: Malbec Mendoza Ultra
review: Very good raspberry and blackberry fruit, but the toast is a bit heavy, turning to cinnamon and coffee in the end, leaving a slightly rigid feel. Plenty of fruit though; this should come around with brief cellaring. Drink now through 2007. 5,000 cases made.

name: Malbec-Bonarda-Petit Verdot Mendoza Terroir Series
review: A snappy red, with rich flavors of blackberry and dark plum, accented by floral notes. Hints of green herbs and pepper lend zest to the tannic finish. Drink now through 2019. 2,700 cases imported.

name: Malbec-Bonarda-Petit Verdot Mendoza Terroir Series Corte
review: Creamy and rich, with a range of spicy dried berry and plum tart flavors that offer some beefy notes. Long and lush on the finish, presenting some cedary accents. Drink now through 2018. 2,700 cases imported.

name: Torrontés Salta Terroir Series
review: This light yet intense white offers notes of wild rose to its zesty tangerine and nectarine fruit, with a long finish. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Mendoza
review: Solid, with dark currant, cocoa and loam flavors on a fleshy, ripe frame. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Mendoza
review: Has a thick coating of sweet, chocolaty toast covering its black cherry, cassis, pepper and tobacco notes. Smooth, easy finish. Drink now through 2005. 4,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Mendoza Reserva
review: Game and spice notes lead off in this charming red, which features dark cherry and cassis accents, medium tannins and a zesty finish. Drink now. 7,000 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Mendoza Ultra
review: A savory style, with dark currant and roasted plum flavors that feature notes of paprika and white pepper. Toasty hints on the finish.  Drink now. 1,500 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Mendoza Ultra
review: A solid, focused Cab, with a core of plum cake, raisin and black cherry fruit framed by lightly firm, bittersweet cocoa and toast notes. For fans of the slightly chewy style. Drink now. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Mendoza Ultra
review: Hearty style, with tobacco and loam framing the black currant and fig fruit flavors. Fleshy, smoky finish. Drink now. 3,500 cases made.

name: Corte Mendoza
review: Shows a mix of violet, pastis and ripe boysenberry fruit, backed by ample spice and toast. The fleshy finish lets the toasty edge hang on. Malbec, Bonarda and Petit Verdot. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Malbec Mendoza
review: Notes of game and spice lead to rich dark cherry and jammy blackberry fruit character that gives way to more spice and smoke notes on the finish. Drink now. 12,000 cases imported.

name: Malbec Mendoza Reserva
review: Ample spicy notes accent the cherry and brambly flavors. Creamy midpalate, with notes of tangerine on the finish. Drink now. 30,000 cases imported.

name: Malbec Mendoza Rosé
review: A juicy rosé, offering a solid core of ripe strawberry, currant and watermelon rind notes that lead to hints of licorice on the fresh finish. Drink now. 200 cases imported.

name: Malbec Mendoza Ultra
review: A solid red, with jammy layers of cassis and boysenberry, framed by toasty oak and spice notes that turn a touch dry on the finish. Drink now. 2,900 cases imported.

name: Torrontés Salta Terroir Series
review: Aromatic, with salt and white pepper notes to the spiced apple flavors, accented by ripe melon on the finish. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Mendoza
review: Big yet round, this red sports wild berry and kirsch notes, with light hints of underbrush, tar and spice on the soft finish. Drink now. 6,000 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Mendoza
review: Good fleshy vanilla, cherry and plum flavors are followed by a round, toasty finish. Drink now. 13,000 cases made.

name: Malbec Mendoza
review: Rustic version, with mint and briar notes weaving through blackberry and plum fruit. Slightly chewy finish, but good fruit. Drink now through 2006. 4,000 cases made.

name: Malbec Mendoza Reserva
review: This features juicy flavors of dark plum and dried raspberry, matched to notes of dark chocolate and spice. Clean finish. Drink now. 90,000 cases made.

name: Malbec-Bonarda-Petit Verdot Mendoza Terroir Series Corte
review: This offers a mix of dried berry and green olive flavors, accented by juniper berry notes. Spiced cherry details show on the finish. Drink now. 6,000 cases made.

name: Malbec-Bonarda-Petit Verdot Mendoza Terroir Series Corte
review: A dark, round red, with jammy black plum fruit, spice and a hint of tobacco on the broad finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases imported.

name: Torrontés Salta Terroir Series
review: Aromatic, with notes of geranium leaf to the Meyer lemon and ripe lime flavors. Fresh finish.  Drink now. 2,700 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Mendoza
review: Medium- to full-bodied, offering spicy black cherry and currant notes that mix with hints of tobacco and graphite on the solid finish. Drink now. 6,000 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Mendoza
review: Dark and toasty, with plum, fig and raisin notes that linger on the fleshy, smoky finish. Drink now. 18,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Mendoza
review: Solid, with red and black cherry and plum fruit layered with sweet toast and spice notes. Drink now. 4,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Mendoza Reserva
review: Milk chocolate and Asian spice accents dominate the stewed cherry and roasted plum flavors. Hoisin sauce details show on the finish. Drink now. 6,700 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Mendoza Reserva
review: A fruity style, with boysenberry and dried currant flavors that are joined by floral and mocha notes. Spicy finish. Drink now. 22,000 cases made.

name: Malbec Mendoza Reserva
review: Dried berry and leafy notes dominate this medium-bodied red. Green herbal accents show on the finish. Drink now. 50,000 cases made.

name: Malbec Mendoza Reserva
review: Jammy, offering roasted plum, mocha and woodsy spice notes on a round frame. Drink now. 18,000 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Mendoza
review: A forward, jammy style, with plum and raspberry notes liberally laced with sweet toasted vanilla. Drink now. 6,000 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Mendoza
review: Forward, with straightforward mocha, plum and toast notes that stay round and fleshy on the finish. Drink now. 8,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Malbec-Petit Verdot Mendoza Terroir Series
review: This offers a smoky aroma, with plenty of oak notes to the roasted plum and stewy cherry flavors. Spicy finish. Drink now. 1,400 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Malbec-Petit Verdot Mendoza Terroir Series Corte
review: Decadently spicy aromas, with flavors to match, as well as plenty of roasted plum notes. A touch astringent on the finish.  Drink now. 1,500 cases imported.

name: Malbec Mendoza
review: Modestly juicy, with black cherry, plum and raisin notes backed by a toasty finish. Drink now. 40,500 cases made.

name: Malbec Mendoza
review: Offers a mix of mint, sage, cherry and plum sauce notes followed by a layer of melted red licorice. Shows a slightly raisined edge on the grippy finish. Drink now. 40,000 cases made.

name: Malbec Mendoza Rosé
review: Dark and juicy, with ripe cherry fruit and a fresh, spicy finish. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Malbec Mendoza
review: Very smoky, with slightly cloying chocolate leading the way for soft, modest plum fruit. Drink now. 18,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Mendoza Reserva
review: An overripe red, with dark plum flavors that are smoky and decadently spiced.  Drink now. 6,000 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: On the light side, with pretty floral and grapefruit aromas and flavors, which echo almost delicately. Drink now. 2,100 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Crisp, with distinct green anise[NDASH]scented citrus and bell pepper flavors, which echo on the tangy finish. Drink now. 1,300 cases made.

name: Furmint Tokaji
review: Kosher. Distinctive, with ripe apple and matchstick flavors, some lemony notes as well. Try it for a change of pace. Drink now. 3,500 cases made.

name: Bouvier Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Seewinkler Impressionen DNP
review: Loads of tangy grapefruit and orange notes lead into honey and a hint of truffle on the palate in this fresh, lively version. Sweet, but not overly so, and the acidity should help it age. Not imported into the U.S. Best from 2000 through 2008. 415 cases made.

name: Beerenauslese Neusiedlersee Seewinkler Impressionen
review: Interesting aromas of shiso leaf and rhubarb highlight this medium-sweet BA. A delicate style, with honey notes emerging on the subtle finish. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2001. 750 cases made.

name: Blauer Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Neusiedlersee Kaiser Symphonie
review: This rich, round red shows up-front cherry flavors, with balancing acidity and firm tannins on the finish. The lasting impression is one of sweet fruit. Drink now through 2000. 1,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Canterbury The Kaituna Vineyard
review: Distinctively minty, strongly so, from the first whiff to the last of the finish, but it's put together with balance and charm, offering generous plum and cherry flavors that linger on the round finish. Drink now through 2008. 500 cases made.

name: Merlot Yakima Valley
review: Polished, refined style is generous with its juicy currant and raspberry flavors, persisting on the finish wrapped in slightly gritty tannins, hinting at red chile pepper as the flavors linger. Drink now through 2010. 216 cases made.

name: Merlot Yakima Valley
review: Lithe and lively, a complex wine with a distinct red pepper note atop nicely focused black currant and licorice flavors, finishing with a smoky note. Tannins are well-integrated. Drink now through 2010. 254 cases made.

name: Merlot Yakima Valley
review: Supple in texture and generous with its ripe black cherry and spice flavors, wrapped in lavish oak character, which echoes sweetly on the finish. Drink now through 2005. 198 cases made.

name: Syrah Yakima Valley
review: Firm in texture, nicely packed with ripe cherry and licorice flavors, hinting at pepper as the finish lingers against chewy tannins. Best from 2008 through 2012. 102 cases made.

name: Syrah Yakima Valley
review: Thick in texture, with a green streak running through the gamy flavors. Has some ripe plum character, too, but the earthy stuff predominates. Drink now through 2008. 108 cases made.

name: Chardonnay South Eastern Australia Bin Select 462
review: Smooth and open-textured, this is a soft, cushy mouthful of pear, floral and spice flavors that float nicely through the appealing finish. Drink now. 3,200 cases imported.

name: Shiraz South Eastern Australia Bin Select 667
review: On the lighter side, with a lilt to the raspberry and sassafras flavors. Drink now. 2,346 cases made.

name: Chardonnay South Eastern Australia Bin Select 462
review: Light, with a honeyed edge to the modest pineapple and pear fruit, finishing dry. Drink now. 2,192 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon South Eastern Australia Bin Select 513
review: Bright, sturdy and nicely filled out, with the currant and herb flavors playing well against each other. Drink now. 7,428 cases made.

name: Chardonnay South Eastern Australia Bin Select 462
review: Light and pretty, with pear and lemon notes whistling against a delicate background. Drink now. 2,184 cases imported.

name: Shiraz South Eastern Australia Bin Select 667
review: Fresh and silky, with pretty raspberry and spice flavors that linger gently. Drink now. 1,176 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay South Eastern Australia Bin Select 462
review: Smooth and easygoing, with pretty pear and anise flavors, lingering gently. Drink now. 5,994 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon South Eastern Australia Bin Select 513
review: On the light side, with cooked berry and rhubarb flavors, finishing smoothly. Drink now. 2,346 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon South Eastern Australia Bin Select 513
review: Has a tart edge to the dark berry and floral flavors, finishing on a savory note. Drink now. 2,335 cases made.

name: Heritage McGah Vineyard Rutherford
review: Stylish and jammed with personality, but well-focused. Peppered cinnamon and raspberry aromas combine with rich, plump flavors of smoky meat, bittersweet chocolate and orange zest. Grenache, Mourvèdre and Syrah. Drink now through 2026. 114 cases made.

name: Home Run Cuvée Kick Ranch Vineyard Sonoma County
review: Rich, bold and deeply flavored, with tiers of blackberry, boysenberry and raspberry that saturate the palate, easing up midpalate and ending with a long, dense, chewy aftertaste. Syrah, Grenache and Viognier. Drink now through 2023. 81 cases made.

name: Syrah Russian River Valley Samantha's Vineyard
review: Sleek but well-focused and structured, with smoky and spicy black raspberry aromas that lead to layered plum, stony graphite and roasted herb flavors. Drink now through 2022. 114 cases made.

name: Broken Axle Stagecoach Vineyard Napa Valley
review: Ripe but well-balanced, with black cherry and dusty herb aromas and layered flavors of smoky raspberry, white pepper and licorice. Syrah and Grenache. Drink now through 2026. 150 cases made.

name: Homerun Cuvée Sonoma County
review: Fresh and focused, showing subtle power. Floral cherry and grilled anise aromas open to elegantly complex flavors of smoky plum, white pepper and sage. Syrah and Grenache. Drink now through 2026. 450 cases made.

name: Syrah Mendocino County Alder Springs Vineyard-Spirit Rock
review: The power is understated at first, picking up weight and richness as this develops. The smoky raspberry and floral blueberry aromas lean toward structured flavors of roasted anise, mineral and pepper. Bold tannins appear on the finish. Best from 2015 through 2021. 119 cases made.

name: Broken Axle Stagecoach Vineyard Napa Valley
review: Offers a mix of rustic road tar, gravel, dried berry and herb notes, with dry, savory tannins. Displays elegant weight and mouthfeel. Syrah and Grenache. Drink now through 2022. 337 cases made.

name: Grenache Blanc Napa Valley Somerston Vineyard
review: Juicy grapefruit and pear flavors show appealing notes of beeswax and lentil, with a refreshing finish. Drink now. 201 cases made.

name: Rosé Sonoma County
review: Supple and lively, with notes of strawberry and watermelon plus spiced herb. Grenache and Syrah. Drink now. 203 cases made.

name: Home Run Cuvée Kick Ranch Vineyard Sonoma County
review: Tilting toward the dryer, earthier, more tannic side of Syrah, this is shy on richness, depth and overt fruit, yet succeeds with gravelly flavors and texture. Syrah, Grenache and Viognier. Drink now through 2023. 306 cases made.

name: Rosé Napa Valley
review: Delicate, showing a subtle richness, offering cherry and smoky herb aromas and crisp flavors of watermelon and spice. Grenache and Syrah. Drink now. 176 cases made.

name: Rosé Sonoma County
review: Floral strawberry and orange zest aromas lead to delicate watermelon and spice flavors. Grenache and Mourvèdre. Drink now. 280 cases made.

name: Home Run Cuvée Kick Ranch Vineyard Sonoma County
review: Offers a complex mix of dried herb, cedar, vanilla bean and blueberry, ending with tight, chewy, drying tannins. Syrah and Grenache. Drink now through 2020. 203 cases made.

name: Syrah Mendocino County Alder Springs Vineyard-Spirit Rock
review: Savory and piquant, with smoky anise and cherry aromas and crisp boysenberry, fresh herb and cedar flavors. Drink now through 2018. 111 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Central Otago Alex Kaufman
review: Fleshy red raspberry, cherry and pomegranate flavors are bright, accented by hints of white pepper, fresh earth and pine needle. Offers a plush texture, with juicy highlights and notes of dried sage, rose petal and tobacco on the finish. Drink now through 2030. 1,128 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Monterey County
review: Lovely pineapple, lemon curd and peach flavors veer toward ripe and candied, with pretty oak shadings, juicy acidity and a lingering finish. Drink now through 2010. 15,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Monterey County
review: Rich, concentrated and full-bodied, with a broad range of complex flavors, ranging from grapefruit and citrus to fig and honeysuckle, even a dash of pineapple. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Monterey County
review: This wine is marked by a twinge of sour pineapple and tropical fruit cocktail mix flavors. A bit cloying, but the fruit pours through on the finish. Drink now. 9,800 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Monterey County
review: Medium-weight baked cherry and plum flavors are simple and easy-drinking, turning to pomegranate and ending with dusty berry flavors. Drink now. 8,600 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Monterey County
review: Sweet, with a soft fruit cocktail, pear, melon and spice edge. A good quaffer that's full-bodied but ends cloying. Drink now. 38,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Monterey County
review: Offers earthy dried cherry and herb flavors, with a touch of gaminess. Shows more fruit on the finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Monterey County
review: A curious mix of dried berry and cola are pleasant enough, if shy on varietal character. 4,300 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Monterey County
review: An ultrarich, almost syrupy style, with concentrated citrus, pineapple and tropical fruit flavors that offer hints of ripe pear and green apple along with a hint of celery. Drink now through 2008. 6,500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Monterey
review: Bright and lively, with ripe, complex peach, nectarine, tangerine and light toasty oak notes. Excellent value. Talbott's second label. Drink now through 2004. 1,200 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Monterey
review: Crisp, with flavors of lemon, stewed apple, peanuts and toasty oak that carry through the finish. Drink now through 2003. 4,500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Monterey County
review: A pure fruit style that shows off ripe tropical fruit flavors (peach and guava) that veer close to canned fruit cocktail. Drink now. 8,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands
review: Quite tart, with raspberry and balsamic flavors. 1,100 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County Cuvée CH
review: Bold, ripe, rich and supple, boasting silky texture and tiers of honey, pear, spice and hazelnut flavors that unfold gently. Complex and concentrated. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County Cuvée LD
review: A rich, complex wine that's intriguing, with ripe pineapple, honey, pear and spice notes that turn smooth and creamy on the palate before picking up oak tannins on the finish. Balanced and well made. Drink now through 1994.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County Cuvée DD
review: Deep and complex, with tiers of pearl, honey, earth and butterscotch flavors that are rich and concentrated. Has presence and personality, and finishes with good length. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County Cuvée LD
review: Soft, showing mature spice, honey and hazelnut flavors that linger, turning complex. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay Potter Valley Cuvée BL
review: Elegant and balanced, with ripe pear, pineapple and nutmeg flavors and a touch of vinegar adding an edge. Of moderate depth and complexity. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay Livermore Valley Cuvée W
review: Mature with honey, apricot and pear flavors that pick up an earthy mineral flavor. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma County Reserve
review: A mature style, with a weedy, earthy aroma and flavors of black currant and olive that turn tart on the finish. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma County Reserve
review: Big and generous, with lots of black cherry and currant aromas and flavors shaded by a significant complement of toasty oak. The sharp, jagged texture will need cellar time to soften. Best after 1997.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County Cuvée LR
review: Distinctive, with characteristic rose petal aromas and flavors, this medium-weight, polished wine also shows pleasant pear and apple flavors and a hint of oak on the finish but fades fast. Drink now.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma County Cuvée DD
review: The menthol edge may not be for everyone, but this sturdy, lively wine shows enough cherry flavor to be likable. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County Cuvée LD
review: Dull and oxidized, with weedy, herbal, vegetal flavors that override the pear and fig notes. The finish lacks focus. Drinkable but unexciting.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County Cuvée DD
review: A strange geraniumlike character permeates the nose and palate. Not our style, but drinkable.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County Cuvée LV
review: Lean and earthy, with a metallic edge to the astringent green apple flavors. Seems bitter on the finish.

name: Zinfandel Paso Robles
review: Appealing for its supple raspberry and cherry notes, this also adds a nice spicy twist on the finish.

name: Chardonnay Knights Valley
review: Pretty melon, pear and spice flavors have a touch of menthol and mint, but the flavors turn watery, with a hint of citrus. Drink now.

name: The Lightsman Sutherland-Karoo
review: Forward, with a pretty array of plum, cherry and white pepper notes backed by a cedar thread on the finish. Syrah, Malbec and Petit Verdot. Drink now. 1,300 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Johann Georg Old Vine
review: Big, ripe, rich and focused, dripping with spicy, meaty cherry and toast flavors, remaining silky, explosive and generous as the finish rolls on and on. The tannins are well-integrated. Best from 2012 through 2020. 100 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Greenock Single Vineyard
review: Spicy and distinctive, with rich notes of sandalwood, cinnamon bark, dark chocolate, wild berry, black cherry and sarsaparilla. The tannins are supple and velvety, the finish expressive and generous. Drink now through 2030. 1,000 cases made.

name: Grenache Barossa Valley Old Vine Basket Pressed
review: Supple, sumptuous and round, a lithe mouthful of spicy cherry and plum flavors that remain succulent right through the long, fine-grained finish. Drink now through 2012. 120 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Greenock Single Vineyard
review: Thick and rich, this is dense, with spicy, licorice-accented plum and blueberry flavors playing against a veil of firm tannins. Needs cellaring to settle down. Best after 2016. 1,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Moppa
review: Rich and expressive, with dense flavors of blackberry, licorice, white pepper and sage, finishing with a crème fraîche note that adds to the depth. Offers presence and length. Drink now through 2022. 3,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Greenock
review: Firm in texture, with dark berry, coffee and sassafras flavors mingling easily on the supple frame. A classy wine that lets the flavors persist against fine tannins on the finish. Best from 2011 through 2016. 350 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Greenock Single Vineyard
review: A bright, polished mix of wild strawberry, raspberry coulis and kirsch flavors, with accents of rosemary, spice and green tea, finishing on a note of toasted rye bread. Drink now through 2030. 1,000 cases made.

name: Clarry's GSM Barossa Valley
review: Juicy and vivid, with black tea accents to the core of spiced plum, black licorice and gunpowder flavors. Notes of smoke and spice linger on the dense finish. Grenache, Shiraz and Mataro. Drink now through 2029. 6,000 cases made.

name: Grenache Barossa Valley Old Vine
review: Dark, fleshy plum and cherry flavors are ripe, scented with clove and vanilla, appealing and supple on the long, spicy finish. Drink now through 2026. 200 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Eduard Old Vine
review: Chewy blackberry, licorice and mineral notes are robust, accented by toasted rye bread notes, with a spicy finish and fine-grained tannins. Drink now through 2026. 400 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Moppa
review: Espresso and roasted herb flavors add a fresh edge to the core of dense, expressive cassis and plum flavors. A floral detail gains momentum on the finish. Drink now through 2028. 3,000 cases made.

name: Clarry's Barossa Valley
review: Soft, round and mouthfilling, with generous cherry and tobacco flavors the linger on the open-textured finish. Grenache and Shiraz. Drink now through 2010. 2,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Johann Georg Old Vine
review: Big, mouthfilling and powerful, with layers of green olive and a touch of bitterness to the rich blackberry and cherry flavors, lingering on the finish with lots of licorice. Needs time and food. Best after 2008. 30 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Pirathon
review: Blackberry and plum flavors are juicy and fleshy, with licorice and fresh mint notes set against a background of fine-grained, espressolike tannins. Drink now through 2026. 7,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Pirathon
review: Fresh and expressive, with flavors centered on blackberry and licorice. A minty note adds interest to the long, open-weave finish. Drink now through 2020. 10,000 cases made.

name: Clarry's Barossa Valley
review: Ripe and focused, a bit chewy with tannin but nicely fleshed out with black cherry and spice flavors, lingering on the minty finish. Grenache and Shiraz. Drink now through 2012. 800 cases made.

name: Grenache Barossa Valley Old Vine Basket Pressed
review: Velvety and round, with oak-accented cherry, blackberry and dusky spice flavors, lingering on the polished finish. Drink now through 2011. 40 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Greenock
review: Dense, chewy style has firm tannins around a core of ripe blackberry and cherry, shaded with cedar and pepper as the finish persists. Best after 2007. 300 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Greenock
review: Smooth, polished style offers spicy, vanilla oak-scented berry and tar flavors, finishing with refinement. There's a wonderful open texture to this wine, but the level of oak might need decanting for an hour or two to tame it. Drink now through 2007. 200 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Moppa
review: Smooth and thick, with an appealing candied edge and a touch of dried apricot to the core of wild berry and chai tea flavors. Drink now through 2027. 3,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Barossa Valley Merchant Single Vineyard
review: Grippy tannins surround a bright core of currant and pear flavors, picking up sage and savory spice as the finish lingers against the tannins. Best after 2016. 600 cases made.

name: Clarry's GSM Barossa Valley
review: Plenty of plum and licorice flavors, with peppery notes and an herb accent on a dense, thick frame. Grenache, Shiraz and Mataro. Drink now through 2020. 6,600 cases made.

name: Clarry's Barossa
review: Bright and lively, with pretty pineapple, melon and vanilla flavors. Sémillon and Chenin Blanc. Drink now. 840 cases made.

name: Clarry's GSM Barossa Valley
review: Chalky tannins surround a sleek core of cherry and floral flavors, finishing with a strong meaty note. Needs time to come together. Grenache, Shiraz and Mataro. Best after 2016. 6,000 cases made.

name: Clarry's Red Barossa
review: Has some ripe fruit, but earthy flavors predominate, finishing firm. Grenache and Shiraz. Best from 2006 through 2008. 350 cases imported.

name: Shiraz-Cabernet Sauvignon Barossa Valley-Santa Ynez Valley Hemispheres
review: Ripe and juicy, with fuzzy tannins around a lively core of blackberry, tar, licorice and a touch of tangy bell pepper on the finish. 70 percent Shiraz from Barossa with 30 percent Cabernet Sauvignon from Santa Ynez. Drink now through 2006. 600 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Santa Ynez Valley Westerly Vineyard
review: Lively lemon, floral and melon tones are vibrant and intense, with fine depth and mocha-scented oak. Drink now. 330 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma Valley
review: A very seductive style, with tiers of flavor--mixing ripe currant, black cherry and toasty mocha-laced oak--that fold together in a elegant style that's complex and concentrated without being weighty. Finishes with a long, lingering aftertaste and firm tannins. Drink now through 2013. 1,225 cases made.

name: Syrah Sonoma Valley
review: A savory stew of beefy, peppery, rustic Syrah flavors that are firm, full-bodied and spicy, at times smelling like you're standing on a pile of gravel. There's a wonderful finish of tobacco leaf, dried herb and dried berry. Best from 2012 through 2021. 100 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma Valley
review: Tightly wound and firm, with roasted coffee, dried herb and dried berry flavors that are intense and concentrated, rustic and cedary, slowly moving into a pleasing loamy earthiness that gives this a distinctive quality. Best from 2012 through 2022. 1,420 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma Valley
review: Tight and structured, with firm mineral, cedar, dried berry, sage and anise flavors. Slow to unfold, but does so gracefully, ending with a black tea and mineral aftertaste. Drink now through 2019. 1,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma Valley
review: Rich and intense without being heavy, combining ripe, spicy currant and blackberry-laced fruit with hints of sandalwood and cedar, ending with a dash of anise. Drink now through 2013. 1,256 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma Valley
review: Ripe and fleshy, with supple plum and cherry jam notes that fill out the palate, remaining fresh and lively. Ends with a crushed rock minerality. Drink now through 2023. 1,460 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma Valley
review: Tightly wound, firm and tannic, this full-bodied red shows a mix of dried currant, mineral, graphite and lead pencil notes. Balanced and focused, yet taut, with a dry finish that echoes black licorice and dusty mineral. Best from 2010 through 2015. 1,454 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma Valley
review: This wine exhibits a vibrant core of ripe, juicy plum and black cherry fruit framed by tight cedary oak and wood flavors. The tannins are ripe and firm on the finish. A step up in quality from previous vintages. Drink now through 2010. 1,650 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Sonoma Valley
review: The bold apple and citrus flavors are crisp and refreshing, with terrific, bright acidity at the core and notes of melon, herb and citrus zest. Shows good intensity, and a long, lingering finish. Drink now. 350 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma Valley
review: Lean and firm, with a rich, complex band of currant, anise, cedar and a touch of lead pencil. Finishes with dry, tight, cedary tannins that give it a sense of austerity, which some will find more appealing than others. Best from 2006 through 2011. 1,610 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma Valley
review: Tightly wound, with a tannic structure, offering blackberry, plum and violet notes that work into a core of smoky, toasty oak, turning dry and tannic. Drink now through 2008. 453 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma Valley
review: Well-balanced, a touch austere, with good depth to black currant, black cherry and fresh herb nuances wrapped within solid tannin and cedary character. Drink now through 2007. 802 cases made.

name: Cellar Select Columbia Valley
review: Smooth and spicy, with black olive and sage overtones to the ripe cherry flavors that linger on the finish, framed by toasty oak. Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Drink now through 2011. 3,300 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley Unoaked
review: Fresh and lively, with pretty peach and grapefruit flavors on a sleek frame, finishing with lingering floral notes. Drink now. 1,950 cases made.

name: Rosé Palouse River Columbia Valley
review: Pale pink, with a sweet-sour feel to the watermelon and vaguely red pepper flavors. Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now. 1,800 cases made.

name: Dark Star Columbia Valley
review: Smooth and supple, with black teaaccented blackberry and pear flavors, mingling harmoniously as the rich finish persists against polished tannins. Syrah, Mourvèdre, Grenache, Counoise and Cinsault. Drink now through 2017. 200 cases made.

name: Dark Star Columbia Valley
review: Velvety, focused and generous with its bay leaf-accented blueberry and currant flavors, riding fine tannins through a vivid finish. Syrah, Grenache and Tempranillo. Drink now through 2014. 240 cases made.

name: Scarlet Fire Reserve Columbia Valley
review: Firm tannins surround a supple core of plum and spice character, tinged by lively acidity that eases the flavors into a generous and appealing finish. Mourvèdre, Grenache, Counoise and Syrah. Drink now through 2017. 300 cases made.

name: Ciel du Cheval Red Mountain
review: Firm and chewy, with impressive density to the cherry and black raspberry flavors, yet it never becomes heavy. Needs cellaring to soften the edges. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Merlot, Petit Verdot and Malbec. Best after 2008. 440 cases made.

name: Cuvée Le Blanc Reserve Yakima Valley
review: Spicy, floral and polished, this silky-textured white shows pretty lychee and pear flavors that last on the finish. Viognier, Roussanne and Marsanne. Drink now. 414 cases made.

name: Dark Star Columbia Valley
review: Firm in texture, with prickly tannins around a gentle core of black cherry and spice flavors, lingering nicely on the finish. Syrah, Mourvèdre and Grenache. Best from 2015 through 2017. 600 cases made.

name: Dark Star Columbia Valley
review: Tangy, with distinctive spicy flavors blanketing the ripe currant and berry fruit at the core, mingling black pepper with allspice and pink peppercorn notes. Well-knit, this should age well. Syrah, Grenache and Mourvèdre. Drink now through 2013. 1,000 cases made.

name: Dark Star Yakima Valley
review: Lively, jazzy and refreshingly balanced, this red displays a silky texture around lime-accented blackberry flavors, finishing with a touch of smoke. Syrah and Grenache. Drink now through 2014. 320 cases made.

name: Workingman's Red Columbia Valley
review: Firm, focused and bright, with juicy plum, blackberry and licorice flavors, remaining deftly balanced through the evocative finish. Syrah, Mourvèdre, Grenache and others. Drink now through 2014. 630 cases made.

name: Dark Star Columbia Valley
review: Lithe and appealing for its green olive-scented cherry and licorice flavors, lingering on the tightly wound finish. Syrah, Mourvèdre and Grenache. Drink now through 2011. 528 cases made.

name: Katie-Mae Yakima Valley
review: Soft and fragrant with spicy, vanilla-scented pear, peach and tangy star fruit character lingering nicely on the silky finish. Roussanne, Viognier and Marsanne. Drink now. 400 cases made.

name: Tempranillo Columbia Valley
review: Vibrant and sleek, with ripe cherry and mint flavors on a lithe frame, beaming with vivid fruit as the finish lingers. Drink now through 2018. 375 cases made.

name: Cuvée Blanche Columbia Valley
review: Silky and appealing for its spicy mandarin orange flavors, lingering nicely. Roussanne, Viognier and Marsanne. Drink now. 620 cases made.

name: Dark Star Columbia Valley
review: Dark and spicy, an open-textured style that brims with fruit and hints of coffee as the finish softens. Syrah, Mourvèdre and Grenache. Drink now through 2015. 525 cases made.

name: Dark Star Elerding Vineyard Columbia Valley
review: Broad and ripe, but not heavy, a rich wine with fine balance that allows the jammy blackberry and meat flavors to roll smoothly through the finish. Mourvèdre, Syrah and Counoise. Drink now through 2008. 320 cases made.

name: Lemberger Yakima Valley Old Vine Vignes De Marcoux Vineyard
review: Firm in texture, this is crisp, with juicy blackberry and floral flavors. Drink now through 2009. 210 cases made.

name: Masterpiece Reserve Yakima Valley
review: Soft and appealing for its polished texture and pretty pear, tangerine and spice flavors. Viognier, Roussanne and Marsanne. Drink now. 280 cases made.

name: Scarlet Fire Columbia Valley
review: Earthy, meaty flavors offer a gamy character, with orange peelscented black cherry notes on the polished finish. Mourvèdre, Grenache, Syrah, Counoise and Cinsault. Drink now through 2016. 200 cases made.

name: Scarlet Fire Columbia Valley
review: Has density and richness without excess weight, offering blackberry and tar flavors that linger on the finish. Mourvèdre, Counoise and Cinsault. Drink now through 2015. 200 cases made.

name: Tempranillo Columbia Valley
review: Bright and jazzy, with a warm blanket of rich fruit and tannin around a lively core of red berry and spice flavors. Drink now through 2013. 320 cases made.

name: Workingman's Red Columbia Valley
review: Not for all tastes, but this has a crisp zing, with a swath of mineral-accented blackberry and dried cherry flavors. Zinfandel, Malbec and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2009. 286 cases made.

name: Workingman's Red Columbia Valley
review: Fresh and appealing for its lively cherry and herb aromas and flavors, persisting on the distinctive finish against fine tannins. Zinfandel, Malbec, and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2011. 495 cases made.

name: Viognier Yakima Valley Elephant Mountain Vineyard
review: Broad and spicy, with a toasty edge to the pear and nutmeg flavors. Drink now. 85 cases made.

name: Workingman's Red Columbia Valley
review: Taut on balance, chewy with tannins, with black cherry and herb flavors pushing against the tannins. Tempranillo, Syrah, Mourvèdre, Counoise and Cinsault. Best after 2015. 400 cases made.

name: Tempranillo Columbia Valley
review: Firm and chewy, with a tart balance to the flavors of blackberry and bitters. Best after 2015. 230 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Willamette Valley Blue Eye Croft & Oster Vineyards
review: Fresh and vibrant, tight and juicy, with a creamy edge to the lemon meringue and lime blossom flavors, which surround a core of ripe pear notes. Drink now. 160 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Willamette Valley Blue Eye Croft & Oster Vineyards
review: Fresh and tangy, with vibrant, refined acidity and a satiny texture that embraces the pear and herb flavors. Drink now. 175 cases made.

name: Syrah Bennett Valley Pepper Mélange
review: Marked by a spicy, minty overlay to the snappy dark berry notes. If you like mint, here's your cup of tea. Dense and structured. Drink now through 2018. 150 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Oregon Blue Eye
review: Crisp and tangy, with the grapefruit and lime flavors leading to a finish of green herb notes. Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon McLaren Vale
review: Polished, focused and appealing for the minty overtones that seep into the cherry and black pepper flavors, lingering on the refined finish. Drink now through 2015. 3,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon McLaren Vale
review: A harmonious wine that's crisp, juicy and lively with red berry, red cherry and subtle herbal overtones, which keep pulsing through the racy finish. Best from 2008 through 2015. 2,500 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon McLaren Vale
review: Big, ripe and generous, a huge mouthful of ripe cherry, sweet oak and an undercurrent of mint making it interesting as the flavors persist on the round finish. Drink now through 2010. 2,000 cases imported.

name: Sangiovese McLaren Vale
review: Vibrant and light on its feet, this is juicy and distinctive for its plum and pomegranate fruit and floral white pepper overtones, lingering on the open-textured finish against refined tannins. Drink now through 2013. 1,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale
review: Firm in texture, showing a sweetness and suppleness under the tannins that lets the racy blackberry, cherry and spice flavors come through beautifully. The flavors last on the deftly balanced finish. Best from 2011 through 2017. 6,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale
review: Goes for elegance over power, with delicious blueberry, plum, olive and black pepper flavors mingling effectively. Has fine tannins and refined texture to lift the flavors through a long finish. Drink now through 2012. 6,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz-Viognier McLaren Vale
review: Smooth, ripe and generous. A hint of apricot adds interest to the mocha-accented blackberry flavors, finishing polished and refined. Drink now through 2014. 800 cases imported.

name: Shiraz-Viognier McLaren Vale
review: Nearly black in color, but refreshing for its open, sweet and spicy berry flavors, which hover gently through the long, elegant finish. Drink now through 2009. 400 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon McLaren Vale
review: On the light side, this crips red offers fine tannins around a juicy core of berry and coffee flavors that emerge on the expressive finish. Drink now through 2014. 6,500 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale
review: Broad and generous, with wet loam, orange peel and coffee overtones to the berry flavors, finishing with firm tannins. Best after 2012. 10,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale
review: Firm in texture, with a nice beam of dark berry and cherry flavors at the core, hinting at cinnamon and cedar around the edges. Finishes with persistence. Drink now through 2012. 6,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Alluvial Fans
review: Finds a good balance between juicy cherry and huckleberry flavors and plush, thick tannins, with an aromatic touch of violet. Drink now through 2022. 500 cases made.

name: Viognier McLaren Vale
review: Bright and refreshing, with more citrus and pear flavors than spice and apricot, but the richness is there, lurking beneath the placid surface. Drink now through 2010. 400 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon McLaren Vale
review: Soft and ripe, offering pretty flavors of cherry, raspberry and fresh herbs that linger delicately. Drink now through 2012. 3,000 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon McLaren Vale
review: Focused and generous with its blueberry and currant fruit, nicely framed with hints of mineral and spice, finishing with a creamy texture. Drink now through 2011. 3,000 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon McLaren Vale
review: Bright and juicy, tightly packed with cherry, blackberry and cedar flavors that linger nicely on the round finish. Drink now through 2006. 2,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay McLaren Vale
review: On the light side, with pretty pear and yogurt aromas and flavors, finishing with a bright grapefruit note. Drink now through 2009. 200 cases imported.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale
review: Floral and perfumed, with gripping berry flavors and a lingering Earl Grey tea note. Drink now. 12,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale
review: Smooth and round, showing ripe currant and coffee notes that compete for attention. Drink now. 1,900 cases imported.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale
review: Ripe, focused and open-textured, with a savory herb-crusted meat character adding interest to the blackberry and plum flavors. Drink now through 2014. 6,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale
review: Dense and chewy, with focused black cherry, herb and pepper flavors that linger on the finish. Fine-grained tannins are present, but not intrusive. Best from 2003 through 2010. 6,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz-Viognier McLaren Vale
review: Tight and focused, playing out its iron-accented cherry and roasted meat flavors on a lithe frame. Best from 2012 through 2017. 1,200 cases imported.

name: Zinfandel McLaren Vale
review: Broad and ripe, a solid red with spicy blackberry and cherry flavors, finishing with a peppery, smoky note on the finish. Best from 2006 through 2010. 100 cases imported.

name: Sangiovese McLaren Vale
review: Fresh and juicy, this deftly balanced red delivers rose petal-accented raspberry and mulberry flavors, finishing with an open texture and medium weight. Drink now through 2014. 800 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale
review: Broad, brawny style has lots of ripe cherry and earth aromas and flavors, finishing with a savory note. Best from 2008 through 2014. 6,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale
review: Smooth and round, with a roasted red pepper edge to the ripe berry and plum flavors, finishing firm and with lively acidity. Drink now through 2010. 6,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale
review: A solid Shiraz, offering blueberry and plum fruit shaded with toast and licorice notes, echoing nicely on the smooth finish. Drink now through 2005. 12,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale
review: Smooth, polished and juicy, with berry, pepper and distinct game flavors, finishing harmoniously. Drink now through 2005. 4,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale The Devil's Whiskers
review: Spicy and firm, with taut cherry and licorice flavors, finishing with a pumpkin-pie spice detail that lingers. Drink now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Shiraz-Viognier McLaren Vale
review: Velvety, with an earthy edge to the plush cherry and tobacco flavors, finishing firm and generous. Drink now through 2010. 100 cases imported.

name: Zinfandel Langhorne Creek
review: A solid, medium- to large-scale wine that smells and tastes like a California Zinfandel from a warmer region, like Lodi, with stewed plum, pepper and mustard seed flavors that persist on the finish. Drink now through 2008. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon McLaren Vale
review: A dense wall of tannins at the core threatens to overwhelm the red berry flavors, fresh herb notes and spice accents. The tannins seem to gain momentum on the finish. Drink now through 2030. 5,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon McLaren Vale
review: Plump and appealing for its nice currant and blackbery fruit, with a hint of mint on the firm finish. Best after 2004. 1,227 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon McLaren Vale
review: Firm in texture, with a spicy, exotic edge to the ripe cherry and berry flavors, finishing with a nice echo of the fruit. Drink now through 2007. 3,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon McLaren Vale
review: Smooth and appealing for its basic berry and herb flavors, finishing with fine texture. Drink now through 2006. 3,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet-Cabernet Franc-Malbec McLaren Vale
review: This firm-textured wine has an earthy, decadent edge to the ripe blackberry and anise flavors. May be a bit short on charm but has plenty of oomph. Best from 2002 through 2007. 2,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale
review: Firm in texture, nicely packed with blueberry, blackberry and vanilla-spice flavors, which come together nicely on the finish. Drink now through 2004. 6,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale
review: Firm, almost chewy, with ripe berry and anise flavors that stop just short of gooey on the firm finish. Best from 2000 through 2005. 2,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale The Devil's Whiskers
review: Clove and cherry flavors have a juicy tang, with tar and coffee notes and firm tannins. Drink now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Viognier McLaren Vale
review: Light for a Viognier, with pretty pear and spice aromas and flavors. Lingers gently. Drink now. 400 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Adelaide Hills
review: Pear and melon flavors are softly juicy, with spice and honey notes that linger. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon McLaren Vale
review: Earthy and leathery up front, with chalky cherry and licorice flavors and a rustic profile. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Good Intentions McLaren Vale
review: Tart, with a bland feel to the citrus and green pineapple flavors. Viognier. Drink now. 600 cases made.

name: Viognier McLaren Vale
review: Raw and slightly bitter. Not as appealing as this aromatic white should be.   112 cases imported.

name: Florance Premium Release Australia
review: Firm in texture and bright in flavor, with pretty raspberry notes swirling around the earthy cherry, anise and black pepper flavors. Minty notes echo on the finish. Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Best from 2003 through 2010. 500 cases made.

name: Shiraz Kangaroo Island The Barque Mars
review: Plump in texture, with earthy plum and blackberry flavors, finishing with a mineral edge on the juicy finish. Drink now through 2005. 1,000 cases made.

name: The Florance Vineyard Kangaroo Island
review: Mint, eucalyptus and mineral flavors abound in this full-bodied but gently textured red, a core of black cherry peeking through on the fine-grained finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Drink now through 2010. 700 cases made.

name: Florance Premium Release Kangaroo Island
review: A strong green streak runs through this firm-textured red, dripping with leather, truffle and olive flavors around a core of black cherry. The flavors aren't for everyone, but it has character. Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Best after 2000. 600 cases made.

name: The Florance Vineyard Kangaroo Island
review: Gentle and round, appealing for its distinctive chocolate and smoke notes that weave through the modest blackberry and currant flavors. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Drink now through 2004. 1,000 cases made.

name: Paul Sauer Cape Winemakers Guild Simonsberg
review: Well-packed, with mouthwatering flavors of black currant preserves, warmed fig and steeped black cherry fruit layered with leather, singed bay, roasted alder and tobacco notes. The long, loamy finish still has plenty of polish. Very impressive. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Best from 2016 through 2022. 38 cases made.

name: Paul Sauer Cape Winemakers Guild Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: Well-built, offering a dark, brooding core of currant preserves, plum pâte de fruit and pastis, with a backdrop of roasted apple wood and charcoal that should meld nicely with the fruit over time. A lingering iron accent on the finish adds extra length and definition. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Best from 2014 through 2020. 45 cases made.

name: Paul Sauer Cape Winemakers Guild Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: This is densely packed, but still provides a rapier feel, with mouthwatering licorice snap and tar notes coursing along the edges, while dark currant, bramble, plum skin and mulled blackberry fruit fill in the core. The mouthwatering finish, filled with roasted apple wood, should handle cellaring well. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Best from 2013 through 2020. 45 cases made.

name: Paul Sauer Cape Winemakers Guild Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: This is packed, boasting a great, rugged mountain fruit feel to the chunky but integrated structure that supports the dark fig, currant and blackberry fruit. Lots of roasted spice and singed apple wood notes lurk in the background, and excellent acidity drives the finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Best from 2012 through 2016. 48 cases made.

name: Pinotage Simonsberg-Stellenbosch Black Label
review: Very alluring, with warm fruit cake, melted licorice, steeped plum and black tea notes rolled together, backed by a fleshy structure and carrying through a solid, juicy finish. Shows lovely range and terrific integration, allowing everything to sail through effortlessly, retaining ample power in reserve. Drink now through 2024. 408 cases made.

name: Pinotage Simonsberg-Stellenbosch Black Label
review: This is dark, with dense layers of fig, raspberry, plum and blueberry fruit, while licorice snap, roasted alder and warm fruitcake notes wait in reserve. Features a long, muscular finish. An impressive wine, and about as serious as this varietal can be. Best from 2016 through 2023. 290 cases made.

name: Pinotage Simonsberg-Stellenbosch Cape Winemakers Guild
review: Remarkably pure for Pinotage, with sleek, well-integrated structure that lets an ample range of crushed blueberry, steeped black currant, warm linzer torte and plum sauce flavors glide along, all lined with graphite and toasty apple wood on the finish. Offers lots of juicy flesh, with well-integrated grip for the cellar. Best from 2013 through 2019. 45 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: A sleek, taut style, with good energy to the core of black currant, plum and anise flavors, lined with mouthwatering iron and briar notes. The long finish lets the iron edge play out with a flicker of rooibos tea that should emerge more with cellaring. Drink now through 2018. 100 cases imported.

name: Paul Sauer Cape Winemakers Guild Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: The extra bottle age has let this settle in nicely, with a smoldering sage leaf note now woven into the fabric of the mulled currant, blackberry and black cherry fruit. The espresso- and cedar-tinged structure has melded nicely into the finish, while the sage note lingers. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Drink now through 2018. 146 cases made.

name: Paul Sauer Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: This has a winey core of steeped currant and fig fruit, lined with singed cinnamon and tobacco notes. Shows a juicy tug through the finish, with an echo of mesquite. Displays solid range and depth. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Drink now through 2020. 3,500 cases made.

name: Paul Sauer Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: Offers an old-school feel, with mint and bittersweet cocoa notes leading the way for a solid core of steeped plum, black currant and blackberry fruit. Well-embedded bramble and licorice accents line the finish, showing a whiff of singed cedar. Drink now through 2021. 110 cases imported.

name: Paul Sauer Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: Features a core of dark plum, cassis and blackberry fruit offset by a floral anise notes. Delivers ample grip, but remains sleek and fine-grained, with a flicker of apple wood filling out the finish. Shows latent depth and should cellar nicely. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Best from 2014 through 2020. 100 cases imported.

name: Paul Sauer Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: A dense and chewy red, delivering damson plum, raspberry and cherry skin flavors wound together, along with a floral edge and an iron note. The long, savory herb-tinged finish has matured a touch, but is still vibrant and chiseled in feel and should unwind more with additional cellaring. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Drink now through 2017. 300 cases imported.

name: Paul Sauer Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: Rich but racy, with tangy minerality coursing through the core of loganberry, plum and fig fruit flavors. There's also roasted mesquite and iron, adding length to the finish, where a maduro tobacco note lingers. Should age nicely. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Drink now through 2013. 100 cases imported.

name: Paul Sauer Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: Great character in this throwback wine, with a thicket of dark currant, blackberry, tar, beef, chestnut, mineral and sanguine flavors. Long finish is etched with bittersweet chocolate and another layer of really ripe blackberry fruit. Impressive. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Drink now through 2008. 3,080 cases made.

name: Pinotage Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: This sports some very alluring dark fig and blackberry reduction flavors that glide over perfectly embedded anise, black tea and smoldering tobacco notes, with a fleshy, polished feel along with a mouthwatering mineral edge guiding the finish. Remarkably refined for the varietal.  Drink now through 2027. 7,000 cases made.

name: Pinotage Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: Enticing and well ahead of the Pinotage pack, with alluring blueberry, loganberry and raspberry fruit melded seamlessly with anise, fruitcake and ganache notes. Everything flows through the lush finish, while a backdrop of charcoal keeps this honest. Drink now through 2019. 750 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: Mature, but still has some punch. The core of steeped fig and blackberry fruit is enlivened by singed mesquite, tobacco and bay notes. A juicy edge lets the finish hang for a bit. Distinctive. Drink now through 2020. 5,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: Alluring, with a black tea note weaving around supple blackberry, black cherry and plum fruit flavors. Shows a lingering mineral hint on the finish, with a loamy accent, but stays polished overall. Best from 2016 through 2021. 100 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: A perfumy, grilled savory note offsets the core of red currant and black cherry fruit, with an iron hint framing the sleek finish. A solid, minerally Cabernet that should age gracefully. Drink now through 2018. 120 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: Ripe and full-bodied, offering delicious black currant, fig and licorice snap flavors that glide through the polished finish. A dash of loam adds length. Bottle age has tamed this, but it still has plenty of life. Drink now through 2011. 150 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: Ripe and juicy, but nicely focused, with alluring fig paste, black tea, incense and hoisin sauce notes carried by supple tannins. The long finish lets all the flavors play out, with nice buried acidity. The best Cabernet in a while from this Pinotage specialist. Drink now through 2011. 110 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Stellenbosch
review: A diamond in the rough. This is a seriously gorgeous Cabernet with great fruit concentration, super balance and a feeling of harmony and grace. No gimmicks here, just wonderful Cabernet flavors that fill the mouth and linger on the finish. Drink now through 2004. 2,800 cases made.

name: Cape Winemakers Guild Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: Shows a bright, tobacco- and pepper-accented nose, with layers of crushed plum, fig paste and mulled currant fruit quickly filling in behind. Violet, anise and briar notes chime in on the nicely grippy finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Best from 2011 through 2013. 292 cases made.

name: Paul Sauer Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: A direct beam of blackberry and black currant fruit is intertwined with savory, sanguine and lightly singed cedar notes. Shows good focus through the finish, where a perfumy rooibos tea accent lingers. Sneakily long and should unfold more in the cellar. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Best from 2016 through 2024. 110 cases imported.

name: Paul Sauer Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: A dark, winey style, featuring black currant, maduro tobacco, mulled fig and spice notes, all carried by solid, tar-edged grip. Whiffs of smoked apple wood and black tea mingle with a sanguine hint on the finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2014. 100 cases imported.

name: Paul Sauer Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: Quite ripe and rather full, with a nice velvety feel to the dark plum, mashed currant and fig paste notes, all laced with maduro tobacco and bittersweet cocoa hints. The muscular finish has an iron hint buried. Much better than on release, when it had an inconsistent showing.--Non-blind Kanonkop vertical tasting (2010). Drink now through 2012. 3,209 cases made.

name: Paul Sauer Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: A burly wine, with a knot of cassis and currant flavor that is yet to unwind, this shows beef, mineral, bittersweet chocolate and briar flavors for now. Serious, throw-back tannins complete the muscular finish. Big wine. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Best from 2004 through 2007. 3,025 cases made.

name: Pinotage Simonsberg-Paarl Cape Winemakers Guild
review: Rock-solid, with layers of blueberry, loganberry, raspberry ganache and mulled currant fruit, backed by briar, melted licorice and dark earth notes. The long finish is both grippy and racy. Should age nicely. Drink now through 2013. 204 cases made.

name: Pinotage Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: A juicy, racy style, with deliciously pure plum and blackberry compote flavors enlivened by an anise note that lingers through the finish. Features dark fruit but remains bright and fresh in feel. Well done. Drink now through 2020. 650 cases imported.

name: Pinotage Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: This has a lovely dark currant, warmed plum and steeped blueberry core, inlaid with cocoa and melted black licorice. Everything flows through the rich, velvety finish, with a note of black tea weaving in. Drink now through 2020. 750 cases imported.

name: Pinotage Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: This has a hearty, slightly rugged core of dark currant, plum sauce and fig paste, while the edges are polished and racy, with alder wood, sweet spice and anise providing a nice contrast through the finish. Shows better purity than in some previous vintages. Drink now through 2014. 600 cases imported.

name: Pinotage Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: Dark and alluring, with mulled black currant, Turkish coffee, bittersweet cocoa and licorice snap notes framed by solid structure. Shows roasted notes, but stays polished and focused on the grippy finish. Drink now through 2012. 750 cases imported.

name: Pinotage Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: There's a nice sappy edge to the plum and kirsch fruit, with a strong lacing of red licorice as well as fresh briar and spice notes that enliven the finish. Really racy acidity.--Non-blind Kanonkop vertical tasting (2010). Drink now through 2016. 8,673 cases made.

name: Pinotage Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: Right on stride, with a nice lacing of cedar and espresso bean guiding the dark, macerated plum, fig and currant fruit. Features maduro tobacco and bittersweet cocoa notes on the finish, with a graphite hint as well.--Non-blind Kanonkop vertical tasting (2010). Drink now through 2011. 6,307 cases made.

name: Pinotage Simonsberg-Stellenbosch Cape Winemakers Guild
review: Quite lively, with lots of peppery spice and perky acidity coursing through the black cherry, currant and plum fruit flavors. A bouncy cassis bush note hangs on the finish. A touch shy on flesh at first, but this fills out nicely as it airs in the glass, showing more grip through the finish. Drink now through 2014. 50 cases made.

name: Pinotage Stellenbosch
