review: Here's a rich and remarkable South African red, impressively structured, with plenty of jammy flavors in the midpalate framed by chocolate, leather and smoke notes. Has good acidity as well. Drink now through 1999. 14,500 cases made.

name: Pinotage Stellenbosch Reserve
review: Fabulous wine exhibiting great concentration of fruit and toasted oak, yet extremely well balanced and refined. Full in body with firm tannins and a long, rich finish. Drink now through 1999.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: This is dense, but has a sleek, racy feel overall, with lively black currant, anise and raspberry fruit laced with maduro tobacco, savory herb and iron notes. The finish has cut and length. Best from 2013 through 2020. 100 cases imported.

name: Paul Sauer Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: Offers a structured mix of red and black currant, coffee, roasted vanilla and licorice notes that all weave together nicely on the polished, herb-tinged finish. Very youthful, despite the late release. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Drink now through 2011. 150 cases imported.

name: Paul Sauer Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: This is solid, with mature hints of cedar and tobacco now weaving through the core of red currant, damson plum and red licorice. A nice briary edge frames the tangy finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot.--Non-blind Kanonkop vertical tasting (2010). Drink now. 4,125 cases made.

name: Paul Sauer Stellenbosch
review: Seductive Cabernet with beautifully spicy aromas, ripe fruit flavors and a velvety texture. It's tannic and full-bodied, but so generous with the black cherry and vanilla notes that you hardly notice. A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Drink now through 2002. 1,800 cases made.

name: Paul Sauer Stellenbosch
review: Unctuous red boasting currant and almost blueberry character, full body, velvety tannins and long, delicious finish. Drink now.

name: Pinotage Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: Dark, pure and driven, with focused plum, singed raisin, anise and blackberry notes, lined with integrated apple wood and backed by good grip on the finish. Should gain more nuance with cellaring. Drink now through 2020. 750 cases imported.

name: Pinotage Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: This is very solid, with a gutsy core of plum, blackberry and raspberry fruit that gets tamed by sweet spice and a melted licorice snap note on the polished finish. Approachable, but with the stuffing to cellar a bit as well. Drink now through 2015. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Pinotage Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: This red combines the dark, briary edge of the grape with rich, ripe plum sauce and notes of crushed currant and fig. A licorice snap note lingers nicely on the plush finish. Should be fun to age a bit. Drink now through 2012. 600 cases imported.

name: Pinotage Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: Shows a streak of mesquite, with tangy red currant, blackberry, briar and tobacco notes. The taut, muscular finish picks up a hint of roasted chestnut. Starting to open up, and a little funkier than the 2006.--Non-blind Kanonkop vertical tasting (2010). Drink now through 2015. 5,976 cases made.

name: Pinotage Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: Still quite youthful, with a touch of mulled plum moving in on the core of red and black licorice, raspberry ganache and maduro tobacco. Solid grip helps frame the finish, with a smoky edge weaving in.--Non-blind Kanonkop vertical tasting (2010). Drink now through 2014. 7,275 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: Muscular style, with currant and blackberry fruit backed up by beef, bacon, tar and sanguine notes and powerful tannins. Impressively concentrated, this is worth waiting on by cellaring. Best from 2005 through 2007. 3,416 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Stellenbosch
review: Has flashy, New World-style fruit--raspberry, plum, blackberry--all tightly wound now, with smoke and spice notes. Crushed berry flavors linger on the dense finish. Give it some time. Best from 2002 through 2004.

name: Cape Winemakers Guild Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: Fully mature now, with smoky mesquite, espresso and dried currant notes mingling with hints of fig paste and mulled spices on the cedar-famed finish.--Non-blind Kanonkop vertical tasting (2010). Drink now. 93 cases made.

name: Kadette Stellenbosch
review: This has a core of tangy red currant and damson plum flavors, with a sleek iron edge and lingering rooibos tea hints. Solid grip. Pinotage, Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2017. 3,250 cases imported.

name: Paul Sauer Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: Mature, but still has some brawn to the tobacco, roasted chestnut, macerated black currant and coffee notes. A roasted cedar spine takes over on the finish. For fans of the style. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Drink now through 2012. 125 cases imported.

name: Paul Sauer Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: Nicely mature, with cedar, roasted vanilla, dried currant and sanguine notes that still have good grip and cut. A sanguine edge mingles with the dried fruit notes on the finish. This has held on nicely.--Non-blind Kanonkop vertical tasting (2010). Drink now. 2,756 cases made.

name: Paul Sauer Stellenbosch
review: Impressive for its age, with plenty of raspberry and blackberry fruit still showing, helping to offset the heavy dose of smoke and toast. Picks up a chocolate note on the muscular finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Drink now through 2002.

name: Paul Sauer Stellenbosch
review: Smooth and focused, brimming with delicious cherry, red plum, spice and chocolate flavors. It's well crafted, showing abundant character, acidity and reserve. Drink now through 1999. 1,800 cases made.

name: Pinotage Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: This is softening now, with mulled plum and fig notes laced with hints of tobacco, chestnut and dark earth. Picks up a rustic hint, but stays polished enough on the finish.--Non-blind Kanonkop vertical tasting (2010). Drink now through 2012. 8,500 cases made.

name: Pinotage Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: Fine-grained, with a graphite note weaving through a supple core of mulled plum, boysenberry and raspberry ganache notes. Aged tobacco and saucisson sec hints frame the finish. This still has some guts, but this has softened nicely.--Non-blind Kanonkop vertical tasting (2010). Drink now. 6,425 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: Beefy Cabernet, with black currant, tar and cedar notes on a muscular frame. Big, burly finish. Admirable for its gutsy quality, but not for everyone. Drink now through 2006. 100 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Stellenbosch
review: Mature, with leather and game notes, this still has plenty of guts, with black currant and coffee flavors, and a firm, chewy finish. On the savage side, but has concentration and balance. Drink now through 2005. 3,500 cases made.

name: Kadette Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: Shows hints of Pinotage's rustic, funky edge, but has nice concentration and mouthfeel, with ample raspberry and currant fruit. The smoky, chocolaty finish has guts. Solid. Pinotage, Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Ruby Cabernet and Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2005. 13,500 cases made.

name: Kadette Stellenbosch
review: Bright and juicy, with an anise thread weaving through the blackberry and raspberry fruit. Judicious toast lines the black teaaccented finish, with good acidity running throughout. Pinotage, Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2016. 3,500 cases imported.

name: Pinotage Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: Maturing, with a tarry hint weaving through the warm, mulled blackberry and black currant fruit and blood sausage notes, followed by hints of cedar, prune and earth on the finish. This has the range, but not quite the polish of the best vintages.--Non-blind Kanonkop vertical tasting (2010). Drink now. 8,536 cases made.

name: Pinotage Stellenbosch
review: A truly ambitious red wine. An inky-dark color, pronounced oak aromas and concentrated fruit flavors combine with very firm tannins. Too young to enjoy now--but time should reveal its concentration and complexity. Best after 2001.

name: Pinotage Stellenbosch
review: Big and beautiful. Wonderful pure cherries and toasted oak open to a lush and velvety palate. The tannins are firm but well integrated in the fruit. Drink now through 1996.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: This has matured well, with a smoky espresso hint weaving through the bittersweet cocoa, loam, cedar and mulled black currant fruit flavors. Shows cedary grip, but there's enough flesh for balance. Drink now. 100 cases imported.

name: Kadette Stellenbosch
review: A gutsy style, with notes of plum skin and currant preserves laced with accents of roasted vanilla and licorice root. Stays slightly chewy through the fruit-driven finish. A pasta wine. Pinotage, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Drink now through 2018. 7,500 cases made.

name: Kadette Stellenbosch
review: A light black tea note gives way to sanguine-edged plum and blood orange flavors. Lightly singed herb and vanilla accents stitch up the finish. Pinotage, Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Drink now. 2,600 cases imported.

name: Kadette Stellenbosch
review: Offers notes of plum cake, raspberry, bitter cherry and tobacco, with a hint of briar showing on the finish. Pinotage, Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Drink now. 3,500 cases imported.

name: Kadette Stellenbosch
review: Focused, with a core of fresh plum, red currant and cherry skin notes, laced with dark spice and black tea. The lightly taut structure harnesses the finish. Pinotage, Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Drink now. 5,000 cases imported.

name: Kadette Stellenbosch
review: This has a charrry edge, with dark olive and braised beef notes guiding the mesquite, plum and briar flavors. The grippy finish shows a hint of roasted chestnut. For fans of gutsy wines. Pinotage, Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Drink now. 2,400 cases imported.

name: Kadette Stellenbosch
review: Slightly firm, with red and black currant fruit laced with cedar, coffee and spice notes, followed by a dark, slightly earthy finish. A bit rigid in the end, but solid. Cabernet Sauvignon, Pinotage, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2009. 2,800 cases imported.

name: Kadette Stellenbosch
review: Flavorful, well balanced and bright, this lively Bordeaux-style blend of Cabernet and Merlot is appealing to the palate, marrying ripe fruit flavors, a tangy texture and firm tannins. Drink now through 2001. 8,000 cases made.

name: Kadette Stellenbosch
review: Plush and full-bodied, this succulent red from South Africa offers plenty of yummy plum, cherry and herbal flavors. Rich and fairly distinctive, with a nice leathery note on the finish, it's quite a mouthful for the money. Drink now. 6,500 cases made.

name: Paul Sauer Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: Taut and tangy, with iron, grilled herb, red currant and mesquite notes that run from start to finish, laving a sinewy feel as they move along. Not as lean as the 2005—and with better precision—but still a bit trim. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot.--Non-blind Kanonkop vertical tasting (2010). Drink now through 2011. 3,661 cases made.

name: Pinotage Stellenbosch
review: Rustic—and in the mold of 2000—with a Band-Aid hint and a gamey edge to the mulled plum and currant notes, followed by pepper, spice and cedar notes on the finish. Not as aggressively rustic as the 2000, but without the polish of the best vintages either.--Non-blind Kanonkop vertical tasting (2010). Drink now. 6,123 cases made.

name: Pinotage Stellenbosch Reserve
review: Soft, round and velvety blackberry and chocolate aromas and flavors, full body and long aftertaste. Drink now through 1996.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: A slightly taut, herb-driven style, with the core of red currant and black cherry fruit held in check by tobacco and coffee notes, which linger on the finish. This might open up a touch with some cellaring. For fans of the rustic style. Drink now. 175 cases imported.

name: Kadette Stellenbosch
review: Ripe, with tasty black cherry and blackberry and firm but ripe tannins. Not big, but character-filled. Pinotage, Merlot, Ruby Cabernet and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2002.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: Chunkier style, with beef, black currant and bittersweet cocoa notes. Slightly firm, with licorice root on the finish. Needs gutsy food. Drink now. 200 cases imported.

name: Kadette Stellenbosch
review: Structured, with a noticeable grilled herb spine supporting black cherry, tar and chestnut notes, followed by a peppery finish. For fans of the style. Pinotage, Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2009. 500 cases imported.

name: Pinotage Simonsberg-Stellenbosch
review: Squarely in the rustic camp, with game and Band-Aid aromas giving way to slightly chewy briar, black pepper and mulled currant notes, followed by a beefy finish. Only if you like the funk.--Non-blind Kanonkop vertical tasting (2010). Drink now. 5,730 cases made.

name: Kadette Stellenbosch
review: Good berry fruit, then shows off more herbal notes on the back end. Has some sweet toast for effect. Medium-weight, moderate finish. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Pinotage and Ruby Cabernet. Drink now.

name: Paul Sauer Stellenbosch
review: Hanging on, but only for those who like dried currant, leafy tobacco and mulled spice notes. The finish is starting to dry out as well. Pushing it.--Non-blind Kanonkop vertical tasting (2010). Past its prime. 3,333 cases made.

name: Pinotage Stellenbosch
review: Pretty blackberry flavors are accented by smoky new oak notes in a soft, easy-drinking wine. Balanced and bright. Drink now.

name: Pinotage Stellenbosch Kadette Rosé
review: Watermelon rind, cherry pit and blood orange notes mingle in this light, easy rosé. Drink now. 300 cases imported.

name: Pinotage Stellenbosch Kadette Rosé
review: Features light herb and watermelon rind notes, with a hint of cherry pit on the finish. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Pinotage Stellenbosch Rosé Kadette
review: A soft and light-bodied rosé, with modest white cherry and watermelon rind notes. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Kadette Stellenbosch
review: A firm, tobacco-tinged edge frames the modest damson plum, cherry pit and briar notes. The lightly tangy finish lacks some flesh. Pinotage, Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Drink now. 5,000 cases imported.

name: Kadette Stellenbosch
review: Shows dark berry, sage, pepper and tobacco notes, with a slightly rustic background that lingers through the finish. Pinotage, Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Drink now. 5,000 cases imported.

name: Kadette Stellenbosch
review: Offers a mix of herb, green pepper, tobacco, olive and cherry fruit flavors, with the greener notes holding sway on the finish. Has good richness, but this is on the green side. Pinotage, Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Drink now. 2,500 cases imported.

name: Kadette Stellenbosch
review: A wild and woolly red, with effusive aromas and flavors that are earthy and smoky but light on fruit. Medium-bodied, not very tannic. Drink now.

name: Pinotage Stellenbosch Kadette Rosé
review: Soft and easygoing, with lightly mulled strawberry and watermelon notes. Rounded finish. Drink now. 250 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Stellenbosch
review: Solid red showing tobacco, cherry, berry and earth character, medium body, lots of tannins and dry, simple finish. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Stellenbosch
review: Rich but rustic tobacco, dried cherry and chestnut character. Full-bodied and thick with velvety tannins, yet slightly dry on the finish. Drink now.

name: Kadette Stellenbosch
review: Smoky and herbal, with modest fruit and a trim finish. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Pinotage, Ruby Cabernet and Cabernet Franc. Drink now. 2,000 cases imported.

name: Riesling Adelaide Hills Egon Müller Balhannah Vineyard
review: Vibrant and crisp, with whiffs of honey and lanolin to the core of lime and pear flavors. Light-bodied yet intense. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Adelaide Hills Egon Müller Balhannah Vineyard
review: Light and tangy, with pineapple, melon and lemon flavors that echo nicely on the refreshing finish. Drink now through 2013. 2,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Adelaide Hills Echunga Vineyard
review: Light, refreshing and dry, with a lemony edge to the apple flavors, finishing on a leafy note. Drink now through 2018. 600 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Venezia-Giulia
review: This delivers aniseed, apple pie and light vanilla and honey aromas and flavors. Full-bodied, with pineapple and honey character that opens to a structured palate, and good acid backbone. Subtle and structured. Reminds me of Ramonet Burgundies. Drink now. 750 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Carso
review: Enticing aromas of freshly sliced pear and aniseed, with a clean mineral note. Full-bodied, with a tight palate, intense flavors and a crisp, even firm feel to the finish. Almost steely, like a grand cru Chablis. Best after 2010. 850 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Carso
review: Aromas of lemon skin, minerals, spice and oak. Full-bodied, with intense apple and honey flavors and a long, long finish. Very fine indeed. A Chardonnay with special character.  Drink now. 750 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Venezia-Giulia
review: Focused more on its minerality and fine balance than its flavors of poached quince, orchard blossom, ground anise, blanched almond, beeswax and apricot, this elegant white is subtle and well-knit. Drink now through 2019. 330 cases made.

name: Malvasia Venezia-Giulia
review: Tangy acidity focuses this firm, snappy white. The palate is subtle and creamy, offering an elegant mix of almond skin, crunchy white peach, pink grapefruit granita and smoke. Drink now through 2022. 204 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Carso
review: Tight and closed, with traces of citrus fruits, fresh chicory and toasted coconut. Full-bodied and compact, with a long, intense finish of fruit and mineral. Stylish. Needs decanting. Tasted from a 1-liter bottle. Drink now. 850 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Carso
review: Grapefruit, gooseberry and lemon character, with a hint of flint. Medium-bodied, with fresh acidity and a lively finish. Very long and very subtle. Excellent Sauvignon. Drink now. 915 cases made.

name: Brut Vino Spumante KK
review: Like biting into a ripe apple, this is crisp and mouthwatering, with layers of persimmon, dried apricot, ground ginger, smoke and toasted nut notes. Offers a creamy bead and moderate finish. Drink now through 2016. 830 cases made.

name: Carso Terranum
review: This aging red still shows enough sour cherry acidity for balance, as well as integrated, dusty tannins and flavors of dried cherry and currant, leather and earthy peat smoke. A hint of dried sage lingers on the modest finish. Terrano (Refosco). Drink now. 25 cases imported.

name: Venezia-Giulia Red Little Blue
review: A silky, exuberant red, with ripe, juicy flavors of raspberry liqueur and tangy candied strawberry and red cherry. It's balanced by bright acidity and subtle hints of smoke, violets and spice. Refosco, Pinot Nero, Merlot and Cabernet. Drink now. 10 cases imported.

name: Vitovska Venezia-Giulia
review: Featuring a zesty, minerally undertow of ground spice, this well-meshed white displays bright acidity and flavors of crunchy pear, lemon curd, salted butter, biscuit, blanched almond and smoke. Drink now through 2016. 725 cases made.

name: Vitovska Venezia-Giulia Selezione Graphic Label
review: Lanolin and smoke notes form a minerally underpinning to the hints of chamomile, melon rind, sliced almond and star fruit in this subtle white. Fresh and racy even with 10 years of age, showing an open knit on the aromatic finish. Drink now through 2022. 102 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Carso Selezione
review: A good dose of spicy apple pie and lemon curd on the nose and palate, with tangy fresh acidity and a crisp finish, leaving lingering fruit and mineral notes. The finish is creamy and milky. In good shape for a 2000. Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Venezia-Giulia
review: Almond skin, orange peel and sour cherry notes mix in this creamy white, which is medium-bodied and lightly smoky, backed by firm acidity, with lingering notes of salted almond. For fans of the style. Drink now through 2018. 204 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Venezia-Giulia
review: A spicy thread of exotic myrrh, fennel seed and cardamom notes accent the tangerine, green apple and candied orange peel flavors in this tangy Chardonnay. It's an atypical version, but clean and fresh, with a lightly smoked finish. Drink now through 2013. 43 cases imported.

name: Malvasia Carso
review: A delicious wine with plenty of mineral, light grass and clove honey character. Medium-bodied, with good acidity and a long finish. Very well done. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Malvasia Carso Selezione
review: An intense white, with honeydew melon and fresh ginger on the nose and palate. Full-bodied, with an oily texture and solid fruit. Medium finish. Aging nicely. Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Malvasia Venezia-Giulia
review: There's a stony sublayer to this fresh white, along with flavors of fresh quince, white peach, licorice and candied lemon peel. Zesty finish. Drink now. 35 cases imported.

name: Rex Apum White
review: A dry and tangy wine with pronounced aromas of fresh orange peel and orange blossom, and flavors of clementine, mango, verbena and a hint of fresh herbs. Perfumed, with a clean, minerally finish. Moscato di Momiano. Drink now through 2013. 20 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Venezia-Giulia
review: Aromas of fennel seed, lemon peel, mineral and green apple lead to a full body, with aniseed, light celery and lime peel flavors. Nonfiltered. A stylish wine. Drink now. 750 cases made.

name: Terrano Carso
review: A smoky red, with bright and tangy acidity, bordering on tart, but not so much as to be distracting. Flavors of sour cherry and white raspberry mix with a hint of red licorice and lots of dried herb and spice through the  finish. Terrano (Refosco). Drink now through 2012. 30 cases imported.

name: Venezia-Giulia La Bora di Kante
review: A subtle white, with a minerally underpinning and hints of melon rind, apple, lanolin and preserved lemon. Well-knit and balanced, with a modest finish. Chardonnay. Drink now through 2018. 51 cases imported.

name: Vitovska Venezia-Giulia
review: A subtle white, with a floral overtone and a hint of smoke underscoring the flavors of steeped white cherry, orange peel and fleur de sel. Drink now through 2018. 255 cases imported.

name: Malvasia Carso
review: White peach and melon aromas, with a hint of cut wood character. Full-bodied, with a solid core of fruit and salty mineral and fennel seed on the palate. Persistent on the palate. Very lemony finish. Drink now. 850 cases made.

name: Malvasia Venezia-Giulia
review: Tangy, featuring candied almond and smoke notes mixing with hints of spiced plum, orange zest and crunchy peach. Drink now. 650 cases made.

name: Vitovska Carso
review: An interesting white with apple peel and light pear aromas and flavors. Medium-bodied, with good acidity and a medium finish. Light lemongrass note.  Drink now. 800 cases made.

name: Vitovska Carso
review: Very grapey, with pear, lemon skin and flint character. Medium- to full-bodied, with good acidity and a fruity finish. A bit rustic, but interesting. Drink now. 580 cases made.

name: Malvasia Carso
review: Aromas of flowers, dried peaches and lemons follow through to a medium body with medium acidity and a chunky mouthfeel. Not many very good Malvasia in the world, but this one is.  Drink now. 665 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Carso
review: Aromas of gooseberry, apple and fruit cocktail. Medium-bodied, good acidity and a light finish. Drink now. 900 cases made.

name: Vino Spumante Dosaggio Zero Metodo Classico
review: A firm and toasty version, with aromatic hints of graphite and honeysuckle accenting the flavors of macerated peach, white cherry and toasted almond. Drink now. 102 cases imported.

name: Vitovska Venezia-Giulia
review: An aromatic white, light-bodied and fresh, with notes of orchard blossoms, Gala apple, apricot and nut. An easy-drinking white, with a clean, salty finish. Drink now. 35 cases imported.

name: Brut KK
review: Firm and crisp, with a hint of salted butter adding richness to flavors of glazed apple, vanilla, lemon curd and kumquat. Modest, lightly tangy finish. Drink now. 50 cases imported.

name: Rosé Vino Spumante Dosaggio Zero Metodo Classico
review: Smoked almond and baked cherry and licorice flavors mix in this firm, almost austere rosé. Drink now. 102 cases imported.

name: Vitovska Carso
review: Grapey and minerally on the nose and palate, but turns a little dull, even candied on the finish. Drink now. 850 cases made.

name: Noble Late Harvest Kia-Ora Stellenbosch
review: Rich and sweet, but with bouncy acidity too, keeping all the dried apricot, mango, persimmon and ginger flavors harmonious through the exotic, alluring finish. Drink now through 2011. 75 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Stellenbosch
review: Racy and pure, with pear, quince and fig notes that seem almost unadorned, as the deftly added toast stays in the background, allowing the finish to come alive with another wave of fruit. Drink now through 2004. 1,750 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch Wooded
review: Rich and plump, with ginger, cardamom and honey notes up front, turning to fig, dried pineapple and mineral on the finish. Despite its richness, it's tangy and taut, with real nice verve. Long finish too. Drink now through 2005. 1,330 cases made.

name: Noble Late Harvest Kia-Ora Stellenbosch
review: Rich and showy, with lots of orange marmalade, dried apricot and peach, spice and maple notes. Juicy and unctuous through the sweet but fresh finish. Very tasty. Chenin Blanc and Sauvignon Blanc. Drink now through 2010. 500 cases imported.

name: Noble Late Harvest Kia-Ora Stellenbosch
review: Mature, with a burnished feel to the maple, ginger, lemon candy, green tea and papaya flavors, which cascade to a long, lush, spicy finish. Chenin Blanc. Drink now. 75 cases imported.

name: Noble Late Harvest Kia-Ora Stellenbosch
review: Bursts with enticing apricot, orange peel and maple sugar aromas and flavors. Shows good cut on the finish, where the citrus note lingers. Made from Hárslevelü. Drink now through 2003. 250 cases made.

name: Shiraz Western Cape
review: Lovely purity here, with rich plum and blackberry fruit augmented by dark chocolate, toast and a hint of meat. Dark, roasted edge on the finish doesn't overwhelm the fruit either. Really delicious. Drink now through 2005. 735 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Stellenbosch
review: Claret like, with currant, smoke, cocoa powder, clay and mineral flavors. Ripe and taut, with a focused finish. Fans of the Old World style will really like this. Drink now through 2003.

name: KCB Piekenierskloof
review: A rather bold style, with creamed apricot and nectarine fruit flavors, liberally gilded with honey and white ginger notes. Lush overall but has just enough cut to stay honest. For fans of the style. Chenin Blanc. Drink now. 2,250 cases made.

name: Noble Late Harvest Kia-Ora Stellenbosch
review: Lots of orange peel, maple and caramel notes run through this sweet Chenin, with a ginger color, a near-syrupy texture and just enough zip to keep it honest. Tasty, forward style. Drink now. 450 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Stellenbosch
review: Rich, with lots of lemon and pink grapefruit flavors offset by a strong grassy edge. Chive, mineral and floral hints enter on the finish, where the richness fans out. Approachable, but can cellar short-term too. Drink now through 2004. 6,605 cases made.

name: Shiraz Stellenbosch
review: Fresh, modern style, with lots of plum pudding, sweet chocolate, mocha, blackberry and boysenberry flavors supported by round, sweet tannins and toast. Drink now through 2006. 250 cases imported.

name: Keystone Stellenbosch
review: Mature, with mint and coffee notes leading the way for tangy cedar-tinged mulled currant and blackberry fruit flavors. Smoke and cedar linger on the finish. For fans of the style. Cabernet Sauvignon, Malbec and Cabernet Franc. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now.

name: Merlot Stellenbosch
review: Hedonists will enjoy the forward mix of blackberry and sweet toast here, with the dark, ripe fruit bouncing through the finish. Floral hints too. Very tasty. Drink now through 2004. 500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Stellenbosch
review: Taut and minerally, with lime and flint notes backed by a tangy finish. Solid length. Drink now. 600 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Stellenbosch
review: Solid, with racy lemon peel, grapefruit and fig hints followed by a pure, clean, minerally finish. Drink now. 3,000 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Stellenbosch
review: Leaner style, this is shy at first, but crisp grass, mineral and lime flavors build nicely through the finish. Drink now. 7,400 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Stellenbosch
review: Has a delicious mix of grass, floral and hay notes, along with white peach and nectarine fruit. Vibrant, bracing finish. Drink now through 2003. 2,420 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Stellenbosch
review: Delicious mix of lime, cut grass and chive, with a racy, chalky palate that carries the flavors. Shellfish yes, but could stand up to richer foods, too. Very good. Drink now through 2002.

name: Shiraz Stellenbosch
review: Maturing, with a softening structure and a coffee note moving in, but the core of crushed red and black cherry and plum fruit is still fresh. The lingering finish features herb and licorice. Drink now. 56 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Stellenbosch
review: Ripe and fleshy, with raspberry ganache, spice cake, coffee and graphite notes backed by a juicy, lengthy finish. Still fresh, despite its age. Drink now. 100 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Stellenbosch
review: There's some fine black cherry and currant fruit here, but a pronounced herb and sanguine streak won't be everyone's cup of tea. Big, smoky finish, with iron and sanguine notes lingering. Drink now through 2006. 1,250 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Stellenbosch
review: Shows a taut mix of herb, currant and chocolate notes, with a firm layer of smoky toast. Dried currant and mineral notes emerge on the finish. Drink now through 2005. 1,270 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Stellenbosch
review: Nice fig, spice and piecrust aromas and flavors, which linger nicely through the finish. Drink now. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Stellenbosch
review: Shows maturity, with a waxy feel to the honey and ginger notes, but still has a firm finish to hold it together. Drink now.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch
review: A bright, breezy style, with easygoing pear, apple and fig notes that are nicely rounded on the finish. Drink now. 4,000 cases imported.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch
review: Forward, with open-knit pear, fig, apple and almond notes that linger easily on the medium-weight finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases imported.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch
review: Very fresh, with lime, kiwifruit and green melon notes that stay bright and open through the finish. Drink now. 10,000 cases imported.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch
review: Shows richness, with almond and sweet butter notes, along with floral, white peach and mineral. Loses some drive on the finish, but has a nice range of flavors. Drink now. 6,000 cases imported.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch
review: Nice taut nectarine, peach and spice flavors here, with a bracing edge that runs right through the finish. A bright, tangy introduction to this grape's good side. Drink now through 2004. 32,000 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch
review: Lovely orange blossom and white peach flavors that are offset by a bracing mineral streak. Finishes with a hint of honeycomb. A textbook Chenin that's hard to resist. Drink now through 2003. 6,585 cases made.

name: Merlot Stellenbosch
review: Nice mix of black cherry, cocoa, tar and dried herbs here, with a focused palate. For fans of the style though, as the herbal edge develops on the finish. Drink now through 2005. 1,350 cases made.

name: Merlot Stellenbosch
review: Thick, ripe and extracted, this is impressive for its plum and chocolate flavors, full body and fleshy texture. The oak emerges on the finish, leaving vanilla and coarse tannins behind. Needs food. Drink now through 2003.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Stellenbosch Bulkamp
review: Shows richness, with lemon curd and straw flavors, and a broad finish. Stays fresh with a sweet pea note lingering in the end. Drink now.

name: Shiraz Stellenbosch
review: With its pronounced mineral, sanguine and floral notes, this is a racy, medium-weight version of the grape for fans of Northern Rhône wines. Drink now through 2003.

name: Chardonnay Stellenbosch
review: Mature, with open-knit fig, pear and peach flavors. Hint of toast on the modestly juicy finish. Drink now. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch Wooded
review: Tasty, with peach, lemon and floral notes, that stay full and juicy on the finish, where a buffering dry edge comes in. Good intro to Chenin Blanc. Drink now. 1,814 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch Wooded
review: Shows spice and honeycomb aromas, with tasty orange blossom and toast flavors and a juicy finish. Not my preferred style, but this wears its wood well. Drink now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Stellenbosch
review: Crisp lime, chive and citrus notes, and a finish chiseled with acidity. Not as concentrated as the top examples, but still very good. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay Stellenbosch
review: Nice peach and apricot flavors, with vanilla and spice notes coming in on the finish. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Stellenbosch
review: Mature, with pear and nutty notes, and a slightly waxy palate. Hanging in there, though the flavors fade a bit on the finish. Drink now.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch
review: Fresh, with floral and peach notes followed by a crisp, lime-filled finish. Drink now. 6,500 cases imported.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch
review: This juicy white sports grapefruit, lime and honeysuckle notes, with a clean, fresh finish. Drink now. 1,300 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch
review: Fruit cocktail, with sweet pear and nectarine flavors, but a touch of acidity on the finish keeps it in check. Drink now.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch Wooded
review: Soft and plump, with ginger, apple and butter notes on a round, accessible frame. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now. 2,800 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch
review: Light-weight, with candied lime, chamomile and green almond notes. Touch blowsy on the finish. Drink now. 5,500 cases imported.

name: Red Stellenbosch
review: A bit charry on the nose, with tobacco and bell pepper notes, and a very smoky finish. Ruby Cabernet and Cinsault. Drink now.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch Wooded
review: Soft, forward style, with modest butter and peach flavors. Drink now. 100 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Bold, ripe and assertive, with rich, distinctive blueberry, huckleberry and boysenberry fruit that's pure and delicious. This is tightly focused on the fruit, showing hints of mineral, sage, cola and earth on the finish. Finally the vintage in which the estate wine struts its stuff. Drink now through 2015. 348 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Reserve
review: Seductive and smooth-textured, with a broad, full-bodied range of ripe, rich yet elegant plum, black cherry and raspberry, picking up a touch of anise, fresh earth and mineral. Ends with fine-grained tannins. Drink now through 2014. 50 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Brimming with rich, ripe layers of blueberry and wild berry at the core. Spicy, complex and focused, this gains velocity and ends with a long, persistent finish that echoes fresh earth and black licorice. Drink now through 2022. 272 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: A firm, assertive style, showing well-structured wild berry and blackberry fruit, with touches of mineral and spice. Very tight and closed, yet dense and concentrated, ending with a mix of mineral and ripe berry. Drink now through 2019. 450 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley
review: Plump, rich and generous, offering tiers of plum, blackberry, raspberry and blueberry flavors, all tightly knit and supported by fine-grained tannins, with an echo of smoky oak in the background. Drink now through 2024. 480 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Fresh, vivid raspberry, rose petal, fresh-cut anise and zesty wild berry flavors give this a sharp, riveting focus, retained through the long, graceful finish. Drink now through 2022. 432 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: A savory style, with a mix of cola, rhubarb, sassafras, spicy plum and blueberry flavors that are rich, intense and full-bodied, yet graceful and refined, ending with a pleasant minerality. Drink now through 2015. 438 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Wonderful intensity, richness, depth and concentration, without being heavy. Fascinating range of flavors, with spice, earth, plum, hazelnut, nutmeg and raspberry. Long, elegant, complex aftertaste picks up floral notes and a hint of anise. Drink now through 2009. 257 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Estate Reserve
review: Pure, rich and vivid, with a zesty core of blackberry and wild berry notes, featuring attractive lavender aromas and a persistent finish where the flavors commingle with spicy tannins. Drink now. 220 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Smooth, rich and complex up front, this gains weight and depth, with a medley of ripe cherry, wild berry, anise and sage that provide a saturated mouthfeel, ending with firm tannins. Best from 2008 through 2012. 350 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Estate Reserve
review: A charming, graceful style that exhibits juicy flavors of blueberry, wild berry, plum, anise, violet, wilted rose, subtle cedar and fresh earth, lingering elegantly on the finish. Drink now through 2020. 175 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Estate Reserve
review: Very tight, this red commands a focused beam of spice notes, with peppery, stemmy scents and snappy red berry and floral touches that clamp down on the finish. Best from 2014 through 2024. 60 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Reserve
review: Rich and unctuous, with a spicy cherry and strawberry rhubarb core of flavor that's dense and concentrated;  touching on syrupy, yet impressive for its persistence and length. Drink now through 2022. 64 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Reserve
review: Cola, olallieberry, dusty cedar and mineral notes give this a tight, narrow range of flavors, but they slowly unravel, offering dried currant, blueberry, plum and sage. Full-bodied, ending with chewy, minerally tannins and a splash of cola. Drink now through 2016. 64 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley
review: Clean, pure peach and orange blossom scents draw out pithy citrus skin and apple peel notes before veering into a mix of honey and apricot flavors. Drink now. 160 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Walker Station
review: Starts out rich and assertive, and maintains that profile, with ripe apple, pear, melon, spice and light oak notes. Loses a little velocity on the finish. Drink now through 2022. 98 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Estate Reserve
review: Broad and expressive, this makes a statement about power and depth, with a deep core of mocha, dark berry, savory underbrush and sage flavors. Maintains focus, working through firm, ripe tannins. Should gain. Drink now through 2023. 193 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Supple and generous, with savory wild strawberry, plum and blackberry flavors and shades of nutmeg. Offers a strong, persistent finish, lending this depth and persistence. Drink now. 1,150 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Clean and centered on ripe cherry, plum and blueberry notes, with a dusty earth edge and tannins that grow and cling in a pleasing manner. Drink now through 2020. 860 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Walker Station
review: Exhibits a rich core of plum and blackberry that's well-focused, intense and layered, ending with firm, ripe tannins and ample oak. Drink now through 2023. 92 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Aromas of roasted herb join dried berry and mineral notes in this moderately rich yet appealing effort. Gains depth and nuance on the finish, ending with tar and nutmeg elements. Drink now through 2022. 775 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Estate Reserve
review: Mixes up dried berry, gravelly earth, cedar and subtle anise notes that are medium-weight and restrained, gliding along on the finish. Drink now through 2022. 145 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Rosé
review: Floral strawberry and tangerine aromas lead to crisp, plush flavors of raspberry and spice. Drink now. 132 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley
review: A young, racy, grassy Sauvignon-like rendition, with complex earthy aromatics amid zesty citrus and green apple flavors. Shows a refreshing personality. Drink now through 2020. 285 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Reserve
review: Superrich, almost syrupy in its concentration, with tiers of sweet-tasting plum, blackberry, boysenberry and huckleberry that coat the palate. Intense and potent, with well-integrated tannins and oak. Fans of the style will find it exciting, while some will find it overdone. Drink now through 2010. 24 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Rosé
review: Offers pizzazz and lively cherry and spicy raspberry flavors. Drink now. 165 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Reserve
review: Fresh strawberry and raspberry scents have a touch of wilted rose in this medium- to full-bodied red, turning elegant and detailed on the finish. Much more restrained and somewhat simpler than the regular Kanzler bottling. Best from 2012 through 2019. 150 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Supple and harmonious, with loamy earth, black cherry, sage, underbrush and hints of anise that fan out nicely, ending with a smooth, complex finish. Drink now through 2011. 420 cases made.

name: State Lane Vineyard Napa Valley
review: One of the most youthful and potent wines in this tasting. Firm, dense and tightly wound, with complex aromatics centered on jazzy Asian spice, cedar, blackberry, mocha, loamy earth and more. The tannins are big and gripping. The whole is much greater than the parts. Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot.—2004 California Cabernet blind retrospective (August 2014). Drink now through 2024. 900 cases made.

name: Estate Cuvée State Lane Vineyard Yountville
review: Graves-like in its rusticity and minerally profile, this is firm, dense, focused and chewy. Broad and complex, gaining depth, with subtle herb, espresso and mocha notes, and ending with a potent finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2024. 825 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yountville Grand Vin State Lane Vineyard
review: A classy, Bordeaux-like red from Napa, with ripe, rich fruit and tiers of currant, spice, cigar box and tobacco leaf. Well-built, showing a measure of restraint, this delivers fine-grained tannins and a long, tapered finish. Best from 2014 through 2026. 275 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yountville Grand Vin State Lane Vineyard
review: A substantial effort that weaves together dense, earthy, clay-laced currant, dark berry, sage and cedar. Slow to unfold, but does so gracefully and gets better with each sip. Best from 2013 through 2028. 480 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yountville Grand Vin State Lane Vineyard
review: Complex and well-structured, with sour cherry, wild berry, cedar, lead pencil and tobacco, Bordeaux-like in its structure, balance and mix of flavors, with a nice aftertaste. Needs time. Best from 2013 through 2023. 430 cases made.

name: Estate Cuvée State Lane Vineyard Yountville
review: Pure and focused on a dense core of extracted currant, crushed rock, espresso, plum and wild berry. The tannins are firm and gripping but also ripe, giving this a long, tapered finish. Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Best from 2018 through 2030. 800 cases made.

name: Roberta's Reserve State Lane Vineyard Yountville
review: A distinctive Merlot that combines muscle with richness. Bold aromas of red currant and tomato leaf lead to rich, complex flavors of cherry, olive and dark Asian spice. The tannins are big but fleshy. Merlot. Drink now through 2023. 200 cases made.

name: State Lane Vineyard Napa Valley
review: Firm, intense and concentrated, showing rich, focused currant, anise, blackberry and spicy, cedary, toasty oak, with hints of violet and wild berry. Impressive finish, where the fruit and tannins are well-integrated. Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Best from 2009 through 2014. 900 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley State Lane Vineyard
review: Firm, dense and well-built, with solid, chewy tannins amid a tight core of currant, dark berry, dusty, loamy earth and cedary oak flavors, finishing with a full, persistent aftertaste and lingering fruit, earth and spice nuances. Tasted from 375ml.2005 California Cabernet blind retrospective (September 2015). Drink now through 2024. 550 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yountville Estate Cuvée State Lane Vineyard
review: Smooth and richly flavored, offering supple currant, black berry and beef carpaccio. Firms up on the finish, with the flavors gaining traction and detail. Drink now through 2023. 300 cases made.

name: Estate Cuvée State Lane Vineyard Yountville
review: Reminiscent of Bordeaux with its loamy earthiness, texture and structure, this is rich and full-bodied, with mouthcoating tannins yet also plenty of herb- and currant-laced mineral and graphite flavors that are intense and concentrated. Needs time. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Best from 2012 through 2020. 750 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yountville Grand Vin State Lane Vineyard
review: A classy effort that is tight, structured and firmly tannic, with a core of chewy licorice, blackberry, currant, savory herb and underbrush flavors. Impressively focused and graceful, this glides along the palate. The modest tannins portend well for the future. Best from 2020 through 2032. 550 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yountville Grand Vin State Lane Vineyard
review: Pure and focused on earth- and herb-laced sweet currant and tarry notes, this flexes some tannic muscle and features a strong, persistent, complex and layered finish. Very Bordeaux-like in structure and flavor profile. Drink now through 2029. 250 cases made.

name: Roberta's Reserve State Lane Vineyard Yountville
review: Firm and tightly wound, with a rich and complex core, offering flavors of black currant and dried herbs, plus accents of tomato leaf, olive and tart cherry. Needs time. Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Best from 2015 through 2020. 200 cases made.

name: Roberta's Reserve State Lane Vineyard Yountville
review: Rich and complex, but tight as a drum, with bright red currant and dark cinnamon aromas and black cherry, toasty sage and Asian spice flavors that finish with ripe but dense tannins. Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Best after 2012. 100 cases made.

name: Endre State Lane Vineyard Yountville
review: Offers a rugged mix of crushed rock, dried berry and dried herb. Ausone-like in terms of austerity and minerality, this is tight, dry and tannic. The most closed and reticent of the new Kapcsándy 2010s. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Petit Verdot and Cabernet Franc. Best from 2014 through 2024. 2,400 cases made.

name: Endre Yountville
review: A rich, graceful style, offering loamy earth, blackberry and wild berry fruit, with graphite, mineral and cedar notes. Full-bodied and balanced, ending with a complex display of dried berry and earth. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2017. 500 cases made.

name: Estate Cuvée State Lane Vineyard Napa Valley
review: Very Bordeaux-like in many ways, from the sleek, elegant framework to the flavor profile of drying berry, currant, black licorice and dusty, cedary oak. Displays touches of graphite, ending with cigar box nuances and gravelly tannins.2005 California Cabernet blind retrospective (September 2015). Drink now. 800 cases made.

name: Estate Cuvée State Lane Vineyard Yountville
review: Pleasantly rustic and rugged, featuring a dense, chewy mix of savory herb, dried berry, anise, crushed rock and gravelly earth flavors, with pebbly tannins. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Best from 2020 through 2032. 650 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yountville Estate Cuvée State Lane Vineyard
review: Dense, detailed and tannic, with a core of dried berry, cedar, tobacco leaf and dried herb, finishing with a mix of crushed rock and loamy earth. Best from 2014 through 2025. 285 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yountville Grand Vin State Lane Vineyard
review: Fairly dense and tannic, but with a solid core of rich, earth- and anise-laced dark berry, mineral, cedar and tobacco leaf flavors, ending with a nice push of fruit and chewy tannins.--Blind 2007 California Cabernet retrospective (January 2017). Drink now through 2024. 300 cases made.

name: Estate Cuvée State Lane Vineyard Napa Valley
review: Mature and moderately complex, with a mix of creamy oak, dried red berry and dark berry, licorice and gravelly rock flavors imparting a fading, chewy texture and a hint of ripe sweetness. Has reached a nice drinking stage reminiscent of an aged Bordeaux. The better of two bottles tasted. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc.2006 California Cabernet blind retrospective (December 2015). Drink now. 750 cases made.

name: Roberta's Reserve State Lane Vineyard Napa Valley
review: Trim and elegant, very Bordeaux-like in structure and tannic presence, with dried herb, cedar, dried currant and berry flavors, ending with graphite and cedary notes.2005 California Cabernet blind retrospective (September 2015). Drink now through 2022. 230 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley State Lane Vineyard
review: Claret-like in weight and flavor profile, with cedary cigar box, dried currant and licorice, graphite and pencil lead notes. Tilts toward drying on the aftertaste, making now a good time to enjoy.—2006 California Cabernet blind retrospective (December 2015). Drink now. 650 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yountville Grand Vin State Lane Vineyard
review: Firm, tight and focused, striking a balance between ripe dried berry, light toasty oak, underbrush and black licorice flavors before the chewy, gritty tannins take hold. Drink now through 2022. 300 cases made.

name: Endre State Lane Vineyard Yountville
review: A classy, Bordeaux-like rendition, with taut herb, cedar, currant and savory notes. Well-structured and focused, this ends with a long, herb-laced finish, accented by drying tannins. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2024. 200 cases made.

name: Endre Yountville
review: This complex, easy-drinking mix of ripe cherry, plum and raspberry flavors leads to a medium body, showing fleshy tannins and good depth, ending with red and black licorice notes. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2018. 370 cases made.

name: Estate Cuvée State Lane Vineyard Yountville
review: There's plenty to admire in this trim mix of ripe currant, dark berry, cedar, tobacco leaf, dried herb and wildflower notes. Turns and stays from tannic midpalate on. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Petit Verdot and Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2022. 1,800 cases made.

name: Roberta's Reserve State Lane Vineyard Napa Valley
review: Complex and well-focused, offering currant and cedar aromas and sleek, tightly wound flavors of black cherry, blueberry and exotic spices. Finishes with firm, dry tannins. Needs time. Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Best from 2010 through 2015. 265 cases made.

name: Rosé State Lane Vineyard Yountville
review: An appealing but atypical style of rosé, offering notes of black cherry, bell pepper and spice, with smoky, almost tannic flavors. Drink now. 210 cases made.

name: State Lane Vineyard Yountville
review: Strong oak, shoe polish and dried cedary flavors don't give the fruit much chance. 190 cases made.

name: Pouilly-Fumé
review: This superzesty white offers lemon and grapefruit notes laced with white peach, verbena and floral hints, with a long, minerally finish. Drink now through 2012. 100 cases imported.

name: Sancerre
review: Crunchy, with lots of gooseberry and thyme notes bouncing around, while flint and fleur de sel accents drive the mouthwatering finish. Drink now through 2020. 3,125 cases imported.

name: Sancerre
review: This has a lovely floral nose, with excellent cut to the tangy white peach, gooseberry and honeysuckle notes on the palate. The finish is long and finely tuned. Drink now through 2012. 3,000 cases imported.

name: Pouilly-Fumé
review: Pure and nervy, with gooseberry, flint and white peach flavors allied to racy acidity and backed by a light whiff of smoke on the finish. Textbook. Drink now through 2020. 349 cases made.

name: Pouilly-Fumé
review: Quite lean and racy, displaying brisk flint, fresh plantain and white peach notes laced with a hint of quinine through the finish. Very distinctive and refreshing. Drink now through 2012. 3,000 cases made.

name: Sancerre
review: This is light-bodied, with hints of chive and lime, but persistent, as a mouthwatering fleur de sel edge lingers on the finish. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Pouilly-Fumé
review: Soft, with straw, almond and lightly muddled peach notes that fade out on the finish. Drink now. 80 cases imported.

name: Sancerre
review: Modest earth, lemon and gooseberry notes meander through to a slightly soft finish. Drink now. 3,000 cases imported.

name: Cabernet-Merlot Greece
review: Juicy, with pretty red plum, cherry and berry flavors on a taut frame. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Merlot Greece
review: Medium-bodied, with plum and berry flavors. Tealike notes on the finish. Drink now. 900 cases made.

name: Syrah Thessalikos
review: Juicy, showing currant and cranberry flavors, with peppery notes on the finish. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Syrah Greece
review: Angular, with cherry and red plum flavors and smoky-spicy notes on the finish.  Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Ürziger Würzgarten
review: Starts out smooth and luscious, with an apricot note, picking up citrus flavors and lively acidity, ending with a kick of mineral. Sleek and balanced overall. Drink now through 2026. 2,000 cases imported.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Ürziger Würzgarten
review: Lush and soft, yet still focused, with apricot and orange notes. This may not have quite the longevity of its peers, but it's tasty nonetheless. Drink now through 2018. 3,000 cases imported.

name: Riesling Auslese* Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Ürziger Würzgarten
review: Round and softly structured, with concentrated peach and apricot flavors, this '00 auslese is clean and pretty, but not that vibrant. Drink now through 2008. 75 cases made.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Ürziger Würzgarten
review: Apricot, passion fruit and spice notes weave through the viscous texture in this plump white, which has enough acidity for balance. Despite its length, a woolly flavor upsets the purity. Drink now through 2012. 3,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Ürziger Würzgarten
review: Very focused, exhibiting a beam of almond and cherry in a compact frame. Turns slightly coarse on the finish. Best from 2003 through 2007. 500 cases made.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Ürziger Würzgarten
review: Candied herbal and almond notes accented by mineral on a firm structure. 800 cases made.

name: Riesling Eiswein Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Ürziger Würzgarten
review: Weird stuff. Smells like petrol, tastes piney and tart. Thin too. 12 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Wagram Schlossberg Erste Lage
review: Offers spicy flavors and aromas, accented by plush creaminess. Apple and dried mango notes linger midpalate. The finish is rich, with white chocolate details. Drink now through 2018. 600 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Donauland Steinberg
review: Lovely floral and tropical notes mark this rich white. It has a silky texture, picking up almond and grapefruit peel accents by the finish. Drink now through 2004.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Niederösterreich Mordthal
review: This amply spiced version is redolent of apple tart and pear sauce flavors. Honeyed notes linger on the long and plush finish, showing plenty of creaminess. Drink now through 2018. 500 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Wagram Schlossberg
review: This plush Grüner delivers concentrated and well-defined flavors of peach, apricot and ruby grapefruit. Cream and spice fill the finish, with notes of mineral. Drink now through 2013. 442 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Donauland Die Essenz Vom Veltliner
review: A delicious dessert wine, sweet and lush yet not too heavy, balanced by lively acidity that keeps the apricot, citrus and honey flavors focused and interesting. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now. 20 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Wagram Steinberg
review: Shows some richness, along with peach, apple, earth and stone notes. Balanced, leaning toward the soft side, with a moderately long finish. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Wagram Steinberg
review: Juicy and spicy, with plenty of ripe apple, pear and peach flavors that are supported by fresh acidity. Finishes with spice and cream. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Spätlese Trocken Donauland Ried Schlossberg-Oberstockstall Wagramer
review: Wonderfully ripe, with grapefruit and apricot aromas and flavors. Full-bodied and dry, with a lovely, fruity finish. Delicious. 290 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Wagram
review: There's an intense dried apricot note to the core of peach and ripe apple flavors. Golden raisin accents mark the ripe finish. Drink now through 2016.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Donauland Classic
review: Young, this cherry- and plum-flavored red gets plenty of support from vibrant acidity and firm, chewy tannins. Earth and mineral notes on the finish add complexity and distinction. Drink now through 2005.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Qualitätswein Trocken Donauland
review: A menthol note from start to finish marks this compact and chewy red. It's elegant and medium-bodied, with cherry and cedar accents. Good lingering finish. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2004.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Donauland P
review: Obvious new oak here, and it needs time to integrate. There's plenty of substance however, with the vanilla, pear and citrus notes dovetailing by the finish. Lively and appealing. Drink now through 2003. 80 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Donauland Wagram Schlossberg
review: Shows a creamy aroma, with flavors to match, including lemon custard, mineral and spice. The spicy finish has touches of richness. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2009. 458 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Niederösterreich Windspiel
review: A crisp white, with ripe grapefruit and apricot flavors that feature notes of smoke and spice. The zesty finish shows hints of tarragon and mineral. Drink now. 598 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Wagram Schlossberg
review: Apple pie is the main flavor theme, with accents of apricot and lentil. Stays bright, yet is ready to enjoy. Drink now. 700 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Wagram Steinberg
review: A supple, spicy style, with red peach and ruby grapefruit flavors. Finishes with subtle hints of anise and cream. Drink now. 1,333 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Donauland
review: Plenty of weight and density, with flavors of peach and almond, and an intriguing tropical note. Moderately high acidity keeps it lively, but the finish lacks length. Drink now. 415 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Halbtrocken Donauland Reserve
review: Broad-tasting, with rich peachy flavors and plenty of smoke. Exotic notes of tropical fruit and spice linger on the finish. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Halbtrocken Wagram Kapuzinerberg Reserve
review: Supple, with apricot preserves notes to the Fuji apple and pear flavors. Butter accents mark the finish. Drink now.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Donauland Wagram
review: Shows good definition and structure to the lemon-lime, peach and Fuji apple flavors. There's a hint of custard in this as well, with creamy notes on the juicy finish. Drink now through 2011. 1,000 cases made.

name: Weissburgunder Qualitätswein Trocken Donauland Schlossberg
review: Soft and appealing, here's a juicy white, full of butter and peach notes with a hint of smokiness. Good lingering finish of nutmeg. Drink now.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Donauland Wagram Red Soil
review: Very plummy-tasting, with spice notes and hints of orange peel. The lively, juicy finish echoes the flavors, with notes of tropical fruits. Drink now through 2009. 916 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Donauland Classic
review: Interesting for its intense peach and lime flavors, which are nicely rounded by white cherry and spice notes. Floral elements enliven the finish. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Donauland Schlossberg
review: Rich and peppery flavors, like mustard greens or arugula with ripe melon or apricot notes, match with a smooth, opulent texture and soft structure for an immediately appealing impression. Drink now through 2002. 330 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Niederösterreich Vom Donaulöss
review: A ripe style, with concentrated flavors of quince, gooseberry and peach, matched to toothsome lentil notes. Cherry pie accents show on the finish. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Wagram Schlossberg
review: Ripe, with baked peach and apple flavors, and smoky notes on the creamy finish. Try with roast pork. Drink now through 2010. 442 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Wagram Schlossberg Erste Lage
review: Juicy, with bacon fat overtones to the ripe apple and pear flavors. Butter notes emerge on the spicy finish. Drink now. 27 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Qualitätswein Trocken Donauland P
review: Good structure and focus, with plenty of ripe cherry, spice and raspberry jam flavors. Notes of mincemeat on the broad finish. Drink now through 2007. 450 cases made.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Donauland Foggathal No. 6
review: Very good focus and expression of coffee, mocha and chocolate in this rich, firm '98 red, which shows better overall harmony than most. Drink now through 2002. 415 cases made.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Donauland Wagram Foggathal
review: Spicy aroma, with a deep well of dark plum and cassis flavors. Finishes with baker's chocolate notes and hints of mocha. Zweigelt, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Donauland Windspiel
review: On the tart side and structured, with grapefruit and green apple flavors and some herbal notes. Try with smoked fish. Grüner Veltliner. Drink now. 2,150 cases made.

name: Rieslaner Qualitätswein Donauland Perfektion
review: An austere style that shows medium concentration, this is really more elegant, with a mineral, citrus character. Drink now through 2001. 330 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Donauland Mordthal
review: Rich and broad, showing floral, lime and mineral aromas and flavors. Well balanced, with a lingering aftertaste. Very appealing. Drink now. 330 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Donauland Perfektion Ried: Mordthal Ruppertsthal
review: Subtle and elegant, its delicate peach and lime flavors accented by a lingering, minerally finish. Ready to drink. 165 cases made.

name: Blauer Spätburgunder Qualitätswein Trocken Donauland Ried Kreuzberg-Ruppersthal
review: The rich, velvety texture complements the aromas and flavors of black fruits and smoky oak. Well made and intriguing.

name: Chardonnay Qualitätswein Trocken Donauland Steinberg
review: Broad and nutty, evoking apple and citrus flavors on a firm structure. A touch of bitterness adds dimension to the finish. Drink now. 415 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Donauland Classic
review: Broad, this shows peach and almond flavors, softly textured, with a refreshing finish. Drink now. 840 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Donauland Schlossberg
review: Medium-bodied, with ripe apple, pear and green peach flavors. Smoky and spicy notes linger on the finish. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Donauland Windspiel
review: An aromatic white, with almond, ripe peach and hints of butterscotch. The fresh, lively finish shows citrusy notes. Drink now. 2,916 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Niederösterreich Windspiel
review: Savory and fresh-tasting, with stony notes to the ripe melon and citrus flavors. Offers a crisp, juicy finish. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Niederösterreich Windspiel
review: A touch soft, but pleasant for its mix of ruby grapefruit and Gala apple flavors. Hints of apricot on the finish. Drink now. 700 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Wagram Steinberg
review: Peachy-tasting, with green apple notes and hints of orange rind. Fresh finish features plenty of citrus notes. Drink now. 830 cases made.

name: Riesling Kabinett Trocken Donauland Ried Zeiselgraben Mitterstockstall
review: Slighty heavier style of Riesling with a flinty, earthy character on the nose and palate. Medium bodied with medium acidity and a light finish. 250 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Donauland Windspiel
review: Spry, with crunchy green apple, citrus and almond flavors, which linger on the fresh-tasting finish. Drink now. 100 cases imported.

name: Weissburgunder-Chardonnay Qualitätswein Donauland Schlossberg-Oberstockstall
review: Tropical fruit and floral notes mark this round, exotic white, then the acidity and smoky flavors take over, leaving a refreshing, tangy aftertaste. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 1999. 250 cases made.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Donauland
review: Good, light red with berry, spice aromas and flavors and a hint of vanilla. Medium body with medium tannins and a light finish. Slightly one-dimensional. Drink now. 415 cases made.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Wagram Red Soil
review: Medium-bodied, with dark plum and dark berry flavors, which show a ripe edge. Peppery finish. Drink now. 75 cases imported.

name: Zweigelt-Cabernet-Merlot Qualitätswein Trocken Donauland Foggathal No. 4
review: Round and generous, this feels ripe, though there are some dill and bell pepper notes along with the raspberry. Some tannins emerge on the finish. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now. 330 cases made.

name: Foggathal Qualitätswein Trocken Donauland
review: A serious attempt at winemaking, but it's not quite there yet. Light and fresh with pretty berry, Port-like flavors and a hint of new wood. Zweigelt, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Drink now. 165 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Donauland Alte Reben
review: Sports floral and peach aromas and flavors, with underlying mineral and herb accents. Soft, ripe, round and attractive, finishing on a minerally note. Drink now through 2000. 330 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Donauland Schlossberg P
review: Peach and earth aromas and flavors mingle in this rich, almost viscous Grüner. Very ripe, it's balanced by a citrus element on the finish. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Donauland Wagram Steinberg
review: Very ripe, showing peach and guava flavors, with spice and smoke on the finish. Drink now. 916 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Wagram Steinberg
review: Grapefruit and kiwifruit flavors are the hallmarks of this straightforward white. Green almond notes show on the finish. Drink now. 1,950 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Wagram Steinberg
review: Ripe, showing modest apple and green peach flavors, with some smoke notes on the finish. Drink now. 150 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Spätlese Donauland
review: Ripe and rich, full of honey, apple and herb flavors. Falls a bit short. Balanced on the soft side for early consumption. Drink now through 2000. 250 cases made.

name: Merlot Qualitätswein Trocken Donauland Kreuzberg-Ruppersthal
review: Good, in a lighter style. Offers berry, vanilla and raspberry character, light tannins and a light, fruity finish. 80 cases made.

name: Weissburgunder Qualitätswein Trocken Donauland Schlossberg
review: Seems mature, offering almond, cut apple and earth flavors that start out rich, turn austere and almost tart on the finish. Drink now through 2000. 165 cases made.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Wagram Red Soil
review: A crisp red, with plum and cherry flavors. Short, spicy finish. Drink now. 98 cases imported.

name: Blauer Burgunder Qualitätswein Trocken Donauland P
review: Smells a bit resinous, courtesy of new oak, but settles down on the palate. Sweet cherry and cedar notes are matched to a firm structure, with some astringency on the finish. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2004.

name: Blauer Burgunder Qualitätswein Trocken Donauland P
review: An overtly oaky style, with a vanilla and smoke overlay to the berry aromas and flavors. Supple and medium-bodied, with a lingering aftertaste. Drink now. 330 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Donauland Windspiel
review: Elegant and tangy, with vibrant acidity driving the grass and apple notes. Not that concentrated, but ideal as an aperitif. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Donauland Windspiel
review: Crisp and zingy, with attractive floral and pear aromas and flavors and a clean finish. Light- to medium-bodied. 1,000 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Wagram Windspiel
review: Crunchy white, with green peach and pear flavors, and some herbal notes on the finish. Drink now. 3,330 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Qualitätswein Trocken Donauland Wagram P
review: On the beefy side, with dried cherry and cola flavors. Mocha notes on the finish. Drink now. 442 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Donauland Windspiel
review: Very smoky on the nose, with mature flavors of pear, apple and spice. Drink now. 80 cases imported.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Donauland Wagram Red Soil
review: Juicy, straightforward red, with berry and plum flavors. Drink now. 1,667 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Wagram Schlossberg Erste Lage
review: A touch overripe, with blood orange and nougat flavors. Drink now. 330 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Donauland Wagramer Classic
review: Peach-flavored and crisp, this is straightforward and mouthwatering on the finish. Drink now. 835 cases made.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Donauland Red Soil
review: One-dimensional, with modest red plum flavors, and mocha notes on the finish. Drink now. 700 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Kabinett Donauland Ried Zeiselgraben-Mitterstockstall
review: Lovely almond, pear and floral aromas, but the flavors don't hold up. Soft, slightly flat. Not imported into the U.S.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Niederösterreich Donaulöss
review: A neutral white, offering modest apple and earth flavors. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Donauland
review: Applesauce flavors, with some spice notes, and a plum sauce finish. 970 cases made.

name: Foggathal Donauland Red
review: Has some vanilla and wood character combined with a medium structure, but not much fruit. 250 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Donauland Zeiselgraben
review: A bit of trapped CO2 gas provides an edge to the texture of this white but may be flattening the aromas and flavors at this stage. It hints at white pepper, celery and lentil, finishing on the sour side.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Donauland Wagram
review: Resinous aromas and flavors dominate. Pine and menthol pervade the finish. 916 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Halbtrocken Donauland Mordthal
review: Slightly odd. Beery, with a lot of CO2. Not very pleasant.   205 cases made.

name: Blauer Burgunder Qualitätswein Donauland Ried Kreuzberg-Ruppersthal
review: Smells and tastes like cherry candy. Not imported into the U.S. 125 cases made.

name: Extra Brut Chardonnay-Pinot Noir Austria
review: A delicate, subtle sparkler, very dry, with apple and floral notes accented by mineral and a firm structure. The mouthwatering finish makes it a perfect apéritif. Drink now. 3,300 cases made.

name: Brut Austria Inführ Gold
review: There's richness and concentration here, with fig, lemon and honey flavors, a hint of sweetness, a lingering finish. Drink now. 6,660 cases made.

name: Extra Brut Chardonnay-Pinot Noir Austria
review: Dry and austere, with a touch of berry flavor, finishing more like beer than sparkling wine. 3,330 cases made.

name: Riesling Kabinett Rheingau Hattenheimer
review: Light-weight, with stone, apple, white peach and spice notes. It builds on the palate to a nice finish. It's well-balanced and tangy. Drink now through 2020. 400 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Rheingau Hattenheimer
review: Load of grapefruit and orange flavors, along with mineral, highlight this sleek Riesling. The texture is just a bit coarse, leaving a clipped impression on the finish. Drink now through 2020. 400 cases made.

name: Riesling Kabinett Rheingau Hattenheimer Heiligenberg
review: Ripe and concentrated, this vibrant white borders on cherry flavor, supported by peach and mineral. It's balanced and light-bodied, with a firm finish. Drink now through 2007. 300 cases made.

name: Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wachau Spitzer 1000-Eimerberg
review: Has a seductive spice aroma, with creamy accents to the apricot and ripe peach flavors. Finishes with vanilla, ginger and hints of smoke and tea. Finely balanced and supple. Drink now through 2020. 50 cases imported.

name: Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wachau Spitzer 1000-Eimerberg
review: A subtle wine of depth and harmony. The floral, peach and mineral aromas and flavors match seamlessly with the rich texture and vivid structure in this ripe Riesling. It builds in intensity to a long, long finish. Full-bodied, yet fine and graceful. Drink now through 2012. 10 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Trocken Wachau Steinborz
review: Intense and savory, with plenty of tarragon and anise notes to the grapefruit, lentil and mineral flavors. White pepper and sea salt linger on the powerful finish. Drink now through 2020. 300 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Trocken Wachau Ried Vorderseiber
review: A combination of ripe fruit and vibrant structure sets the stage for grapefruit, hops and peach notes. It's elegant and long, with a mineral undercurrent. Drink now through 2015. 165 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Trocken Wachau Ried Vorderseiber
review: Opulent and muscular, with surprising structure keeping it all together, showing harmony and suppleness in a big, gentle way. Vanilla, peach, almond and grapefruit all add complexity. Drink now through 2007. 500 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Trocken Wachau Ried Vorderseiber
review: Subtle aromas and flavors of white peach, quince and chamomile mark this firm, tightly wound Grüner Veltliner. It shows fine density and concentration and the finish lingers. Drink now through 2008. 25 cases imported.

name: Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wachau Spitzer 1000-Eimerberg
review: This has breed and complexity. An opulent style, balanced on the soft side, yet there's a piquancy to the apricot, floral and mineral notes. Fine, lingering finish.  Drink now through 2010.

name: Grüner Veltliner Federspiel Trocken Wachau Burgberg
review: Concentrated grapefruit, spice and mineral notes fill this medium-bodied Grüner, which exhibits lots of stone fruit flavors on the finish. Drink now through 2012. 200 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Trocken Wachau Steinborz
review: This has good richness, with seductive creamy flavors and loads of ripe peach and grapefruit. The finish is long and spicy. Drink now through 2010. 341 cases made.

name: Riesling Federspiel Wachau Von den Terrassen
review: Lemon curd, peach pie and lemon rind give this a powerful zestiness. The flavors echo on the long finish. Drink now through 2014. 591 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Wachau Ried Steinborz
review: Concentrated, lush and slightly over the top, with impressive flavors of apricot, quince paste, marzipan and mineral. Firms up on the finish, but doesn't have the expansiveness of the best in this category. Drink now through 2007. 35 cases imported.

name: Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wachau Spitzer 1000-Eimerberg
review: This is filled with grapefruit, green peach and crisp apple flavors and a dash of white pepper and sea salt. There are seductive creamy notes wrapped inside the fruit, with a spicy finish. Drink now through 2012. 233 cases made.

name: Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wagram Spitzer 1000-Eimerberg
review: There's ample ripeness to the baked apple and pear tart flavors. Pastry notes chime in as well. Tropical fruit notes linger on the well-spiced finish. Drink now through 2018. 50 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Federspiel Wachau Burgberg
review: Spicy aroma, with slate, white pepper and green peach flavors. Crisp, clean finish of smoke and spice. Drink now through 2010. 700 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Trocken Wachau Ried Vorderseiber
review: Ripe and mouthfilling, with a piquant acidity accenting the legume and white pepper notes. It's all balanced and accessible now. Drink now through 2007.

name: Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Trocken Wachau Steinborz
