review: Hints of malt and beef bouillon augment the peach and citrus notes in this moderately concentrated white. It's balanced toward the alcohol on the finish. Drink now through 2012. 400 cases made.

name: Riesling Federspiel Wachau Setzberg
review: This delicate wine offers rich butter pastry notes wrapped around baked apple and ripe pear flavors. Delivers engaging minerality, with a flush of crisp acidity lingering on the fresh-tasting finish. Drink now through 2018.

name: Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wachau Ried Steinborz
review: Medium-bodied and round, with peach, pastry and a hint of grapefruit flavors. Not the length and cut of the best though. Drink now through 2007.

name: Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wachau Spitzer 1000-Eimer-Berg
review: Rich and tropical in its fruit flavors, with a hint of bitter citrus, too. Very well-delineated, with a mineral aftertaste. Lacks the concentration of the best. Drink now through 2004.

name: Grüner Veltliner Federspiel Wachau Burgberg
review: Has a suave texture, with bright peach, apple, smoke and spice flavors that carry over to the bright finish.  Drink now. 1,416 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Trocken Wachau Steinborz
review: Smoky aromas and flavors take on a hickory cast. Ripe peach and pineapple notes emerge on the finish. Drink now through 2010. 50 cases imported.

name: Neuburger Qualitätswein Trocken Wachau Spitzer 1000 Eimerberg
review: A spicy, medium-bodied white, with fresh-cut cherry and peach flavors mixing effortlessly. Ripe citrus and pear flavors linger on the finish. Drink now.

name: Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wachau Spitzer 1000-Eimerberg
review: There's ripeness here, showing honey and peach flavors, but also firm structure. The terroir shows, infusing a cool, mineral character to this white. Moderate length. Best from 2007 through 2015. 275 cases made.

name: Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wachau Spitzer 1000-Eimerberg
review: Superripe, this reminds me of apricot juice, picking up complexity midpalate, with herb and mineral notes. A bit loose-knit in the end, with modest length. Drink now. 35 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Wachau Ried Steinborz
review: Shows the tropical flavors typical of a ripe year, in a rich, broad style. Soft in structure, with some heat on the finish. Drink now through 2003.

name: Riesling Federspiel Wachau Von den Terrassen
review: Nice crunchy apple and citrus flavors make this a lively and approachable white that will make an excellent aperitif. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wachau Ried Steinborz
review: Ripe and balanced in an accessible, loose-knit manner, this white exhibits peach and spice flavors. Forward and short on the finish. Drink now through 2005. 15 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Federspiel Wachau Ried Burgberg
review: Big and balanced toward the alcohol side, with basil, mint and mineral flavors. Moderate length. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Supple and polished, with a rich core of leathery currant, anise, sage, tea and wild berry flavors that fan out nicely, turning elegant and finishing with firm tannins. Best from 2002 through 2010. 860 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Complex and complete, with ripe currant, spice box, cedar and blackberry fruit. Tight, firm and focused on the palate, this is deeply fruity and ends with ripe, structured tannins. Drink now through 2012. 1,400 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Concentrated, tightly structured and well balanced, with mineral, currant, black cherry, sage and cedar flavors that remain focused and complex on the finish. Tannins are firm and well integrated. Best from 2000 through 2006. 408 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Shows a taut herbal dill edge that veers to dry, cedary oak and lead pencil, with an appealing mix of spicy, minty currant and wild berry fruit that's firm and persistent. Best from 2010 through 2016. 1,550 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: A bit on the rustic side, with a claylike flavor to the earthy currant and cherry notes. Finishes with a nice touch of fruit, which works its way through the tannins. 650 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Strives for complexity with its spicy oak accent, but comes up a little short on richness and concentration. The currant, cherry and berry flavors are pleasant, picking up a fruity note on the finish. Drink now through 1998. 350 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Concentrated and supple, with coffee notes from toasty oak that frame fresh herb, plum and tart cherry flavors.  Drink now through 2005. 850 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Wachau Steinterrassen Kartäuserhof
review: Intense and powerful, with deep flavors of ruby grapefruit, apricot, pear tart and white pepper. Very spicy, with lots of cream and acidity on the finish. Drink now through 2015.

name: Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Trocken Wachau Achleiten Kartäuserhof
review: Delivers powerful grapefruit and green tea flavors, with an intense smoky essence to the ripe pear and pepper notes. The fat finish offers spice and cream. Drink now through 2013.

name: Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Trocken Wachau Achleiten Kartäuserhof
review: Very lush, juicy and ripe-tasting, with loads of coconut, lemon-lime, peach and gooseberry flavors. Well-focused mineral and smoke flavors fill the long, rich finish. Drink now through 2015. 333 cases made.

name: Riesling Federspiel Trocken Wachau Hinterkirchen Kartäuserhof
review: Powerful aromas and flavors of flint, mineral, apple and smoke are backed up by plenty of crisp acidity. Shows hints of gooseberry and peat on the finish. Very racy and focused. Best from 2009 through 2013. 1,250 cases made.

name: Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wachau Achleiten Kartäuserhof
review: Ripe, with baked peach and apricot flavors, along with notes of mango, golden raisin and plenty of spicy notes. Finishes with piecrust and hints of butter. Drink now through 2015.

name: Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wachau Achleiten Kartäuserhof
review: Juicy aromas and flavors of citrus, apple, peach and apricot are supported by plenty of crisp acidity. Mineral and smoke fill the finish. Drink now through 2013. 208 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Trocken Wachau Ultimo Kartäuserhof
review: Redolent of white pepper, with peach, sour cherry and Anjou pear flavors, followed by a fat finish of spice, with some salty notes. Drink now.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Wachau Kartäuserhof Decimo
review: Taut, with a stewy quality along with the plum and berry flavors. Zweigelt and Pinot Noir. Drink now.

name: Riesling Auslese Gold Cap Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Lorenzhofer
review: A zippy auslese, combining succulent flavors of peach, lime and mineral with a vibrant, mouthcoating intensity. This just keeps coming at you with layer after layer of flavor. Drink now through 2015.

name: Riesling Auslese Gold Cap Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Kaseler Kehrnagel
review: Fabulous interplay of ripe apricot, nectarine and mineral aromas and flavors on a velvety swath, supported by a racy structure. Fine length and depth of flavor. Best from 2002 through 2010.

name: Riesling Auslese Gold Cap Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Lorenzhofer
review: A gorgeous auslese. Huge aromas of pineapple, passion fruit, vanilla and mineral integrate with the rich, creamy texture and racy structure to create a fantastic taste experience. Superripe yet balanced, this is young and unevolved, so be patient. Best from 2004 through 2012.

name: Riesling Eiswein Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Kaseler Kehrnagel
review: Broad and rich, offering warm, baking apple and maple notes, with a tart citrus acidity supporting the whole. Should be interesting in a few years. Best after 2001.

name: Riesling Eiswein Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Lorenzhöfer
review: Gorgeous, and smelling like butterscotch and vanilla, but turns crystal clear. Pear and apple flavors hold sway, on a firm, mouthwatering structure. Drink now through 2009. 28 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Patheiger Kaseler Nies'chen
review: Broad in profile, and juicy, yet with density to the peach and citrus flavors. Not as complex as the best Mosel auslesen, but very pure and satisfying. Drink now through 2012.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Kaseler Nies'chen
review: Gorgeous. Rich, round and bursting with floral, citrus and mineral notes, all on a firm, dense frame. This '99 shows a lot of extract, yet maintains delicacy. Great finish. Drink now through 2006. 110 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Kaseler Nies'chen
review: A racehorse. Redolent of apples and almonds, this high-strung '97 Mosel displays screaming acidity, beautiful focus and clarity, dense flavors and a citrusy finish. Not imported into the U.S. Best from 2001 through 2008.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Kaseler Nies'chen
review: An effusive white, bursting with mango, peach and slate aromas and flavors, all charming and fresh thanks to its lively structure. Fine, lingering finish. Drink now through 2012. 400 cases made.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Kaseler Nies'chen
review: Dense and creamy, evoking lanolin and pear notes on a lush texture and elegant structure. It needs some time for the flavors to crystallize and express themselves. Very distinctive and evocative of the site. Best from 2004 through 2010.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Lorenzhöfer Mäuerchen
review: Gorgeous. Compact and electric, with a crunchy texture and luminescent structure setting the stage for the white peach, lime, mineral and spice notes. Long, stony aftertaste. Drink now through 2006. 530 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Kaseler Kehrnagel Patheiger
review: Well made. Smoke, lime and red berry flavors are displayed on a delicate, sleek framework that is dense and firm. A mineral note intermingles from start to lingering finish. Best from 2001 through 2008.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Kaseler Nies'chen
review: Here's a fleshy '01, bursting with lime, peach and mineral notes, backed by piquant acidity. Really expressive and mouthwatering, it ends with a long, mineral encore. Drink now through 2010.

name: Riesling Auslese Gold Cap Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Lorenzhöfer
review: Plenty of current electrifies the peach, lime and mineral flavors of this lithe '99 auslese, which displays density and persistence through the lingering finish. Best from 2003 through 2008. 80 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Lorenzhofer
review: Focused and intense, this streamlined '97 auslese displays lime, peach and mineral flavors, with an orange note on the finish. A live-wire white that shows good ripeness, this is medium-sweet and structured for aging. Best from 2002 through 2008.

name: Riesling Eiswein Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Lorenzhofer
review: Very good intensity here, like crystallized fruit, boasting aromas and flavors of dried apricot and peach. It has a focused sweet/tart component and a subtle finish. Drink now through 2012. 25 cases made.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Lorenzhöfer Mäuerchen
review: Extremely fresh and fruity, reminiscent of uncooked apple pie and a slightly smoky character. It's medium-bodied, with a very lively acidity. Drink now.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Kaseler Nies'chen
review: A well-made, sophisticated spätlese, with an attractive mineral, spice and fruit character. Medium-bodied and lightly sweet with a lovely, fresh aftertaste.

name: Riesling Auslese Long Gold Cap Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Lorenzhöfer
review: Closed and hard right now but some excellent ripe fruit and ample acidity. Full-bodied and linear in structure. Drink now.

name: Riesling QbA Halbtrocken Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Lorenzhöfer
review: Gorgeous aromas of slate, lime and spice persist right through to the finish in this sleek, dense Riesling. Packs a lot of flavor into its vibrant frame. Drink now through 2005. 400 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Lorenzhöfer
review: Very floral and on the sweet side for a spätlese, displaying ripe apricot, passion fruit and pineapple, richly textured and firm in structure. Drink now through 2006.

name: Riesling Beerenauslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Lorenzhofer
review: There's a lot of acidity and modest concentration, but not much flavor. A fresh passion fruit flavor is the theme. Too tart in the end, with a lemon note. Drink now through 2012.

name: Riesling Eiswein Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Lorenzhofer
review: Wow. Here's a racy version, with tart acidity overwhelming the flavors of lemon-lime, vanilla custard and marzipan and really dominating the finish; doubtful that it will be balanced in the future. Best from 2003 through 2020.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Lorenzhofer Mäuerchen
review: Bursting with aromas and flavors of ripe, juicy apples and peaches, very precocious, yet there's no shortage of fine acidity to balance all the elements. Drink now through 2004.

name: Riesling Spätlese Halbtrocken Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Kaseler Kehrnagel
review: Distinctive, with almost pungent wet earth, truffle and a hint of black currant aromas. The luscious texture is impressive in this medium-bodied, wonderfully balanced, round wine. Drink now.

name: Riesling Eiswein Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Lorenzhofer
review: A hard, lemon candy element pervades this eiswein. Firm structure, but the flavors are straightforward and dissipate quickly. Drink now through 2015.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Lorenzhöfer Mäuerchen
review: Very spicy, with a snap of acidity driving the apple, herb and mineral flavors. Well-done. Drink now through 2005. 230 cases made.

name: Riesling QbA Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Lorenzhöfer
review: Crisp and distinctive, with a sharp texture that vibrates with lively apple and citrus flavors and a touch of earthiness that makes it quite interesting. Drink now.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Lorenzhöfer
review: A clean, fresh auslese that's medium in body and sweetness. Has a steely, lemony, lightly mineral finish. A bit light. Drink now.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Kaseler Nies'chen
review: A bit muted in its spice and herb notes, yet dense and clean, with a firm structure and lingering finish. Drink now through 2005.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Lorenzhöfer Mäuerchen
review: Very distinctive. Light and zesty, with a bit of spritz, showing honey, herb and earth flavors that fold nicely into the crisp citrus character. Has a lively, focused finish. Drink now.

name: Riesling QbA Halbtrocken Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Lorenzhöfer
review: Focused earth, herb and spice flavors mingle with pear notes in this interesting wine. Has a crisp finish. Drink now.

name: Riesling Spätlese Halbtrocken Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Lorenzhöfer Felsay
review: Exceedingly fresh wine with sliced apple, melon aromas and flavors. Medium bodied, lightly sweet with a firm acidity. Drink now.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Kaseler Nies'chen
review: Spice and herb notes mingle with lively acidity. It lacks finesse and intensity of the best, however. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Riesling Eiswein Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Lorenzhöfer
review: Slightly buttery, with very sweet flavors and high acidity, but it's rather one-dimensional and the buttery finish detracts. Drink now.

name: Zinfandel Amador County Warrior Fires
review: Layers of complex currant, cherry, plum and berry flavors render this dark, rich and plush. It's big, concentrated and well crafted, finishing with firm tannins and a nice touch of chocolate. Drinkable now, but cellaring into 1998 won't hurt. 804 cases made.

name: Marsanne Amador County
review: A smooth, classy wine, with a silky texture. The subtle flavors--hazelnuts, minerals, sweet pea and citrus come to mind--blend nicely on a long finish. 224 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Amador County
review: Rich and fragrant, with gooseberry and passion fruit aromas and just a hint of earthiness. The wine is a little hot on the palate, but still serves up plenty of fresh pea, melon and citrus flavors. Finishes on a minerally note. Drink now. 1,707 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Amador County Warrior Fires
review: Very ripe, expressive and intense, with a rich core of earthy wild berry, cherry and plum. Deeply concentrated, with an attractive earthiness, it is well focused, firmly tannic and worthy of short-term cellaring. Best from 1999 through 2004. 1,105 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Amador County Pokerville
review: This wine has a pleasant earthy edge to the sweet plum and cherry flavors, giving it an added flavor dimension. Elegant and well balanced; it's tasty to drink now through 1996. 4,130 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Amador County Sadie Upton Vineyard
review: A ripe, jammy style that gushes with fresh black cherry, raspberry and plum flavors plus earthy notes on the tannic finish. Enjoy now.

name: Sangiovese Amador County
review: Ripe and complex, with a pleasant, earthy edge to the ripe cherry and plumlike flavors. Finishes with a zesty aftertaste. 830 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Amador County
review: Somewhat delicate, with a nice blend of grapefruit and lime flavors backed by this varietal's signature grassy tones. Finishes clean and fresh. 1,804 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Amador County
review: Rich; spicy nectarine and floral flavors glide smoothly through, finishing on a grassy note. 2,340 cases made.

name: Syrah Amador County
review: Focused, with hints of blackberry and plum framed in pretty, toasty oak. Plush on the palate, with supple tannins and a moderate finish. Drink now through 2002. 775 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Amador County Pokerville
review: A touch earthy, but the cherry and wild berry flavors are very ripe and floral in this bargain of a California red. Hints of jam seep in around the palate and the fruity finish shows dry tannins. 2,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Amador County Warrior Fires
review: Austere, with an earthy, leathery streak running through the sage and wild berry flavors. Firms up on the finish with drying tannins. Best from 2000 through 2005. 962 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Amador County
review: Ripe and jammy, this young, firm, tannic Zin won't shortchange you on intensity. Despite the tannins, it's offers a lot of ripe, juicy fruit, making it fun to drink now. 2,209 cases made.

name: Orange Muscat Amador County
review: Sweet, syrupy and smooth, with a nice floral note riding above the modest apricot flavors. Ready to drink. 415 cases made.

name: Syrah Amador County
review: Bright plum, cherry and herb notes blend nicely with a touch of earthiness in this medium-bodied wine. Tannins are a bit rough, however, and the finish is somewhat tart. Drink now through 2004. 500 cases made.

name: Syrah Amador County
review: A ripe, chewy, solid red that beams its plum and berry flavors brightly through the chunky tannins. 745 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Edna Valley MacGregor Vineyard
review: Fresh and spicy, with a slight honeyed edge to the basic pear and apple flavors. Try now. 900 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Amador County
review: Still quite young and spritzy; needs to settle down. Light in texture, with grapefruit, almond and mineral touches. Clean finish. 1,867 cases made.

name: Petite Sirah Amador County Not So
review: Smooth and flavorful, with a wild edge to the berry character, finishing slightly gamy. Drink now. 504 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Amador County
review: Smooth and fruity, generous and definitive; leafy, herbal overtones add to the pear and melon flavors. 2,243 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Amador County
review: Earthy and smoky, with very ripe fruit flavor that could use a firmer, more muscular structure. For such a big wine it comes off as simple and gentle on the finish. Drinkable now.

name: Zinfandel Amador County
review: Lavishly oaked and elegant in style, with clean, simple, ripe flavors in an easy-to-drink wine. Fruit comes through on the finish. Drink now.

name: Zinfandel Amador County Buck's Ten Point
review: Ripe, soft and pleasant, with modest depth to the earthy blackberry and cherry flavors. Drink now. 1,850 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon El Dorado Stromberg Carpenter Vineyard
review: An earthy, herbal style with muddled currant and plum flavors. Drinkable now.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Amador County
review: Crisp and fruity, but polished in texture, echoing pear and mineral flavors. 1,952 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Amador County
review: An earthy, gamy style that is slightly funky, but it holds together. Enough wild berry flavors keep your interest. 2,453 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Amador County
review: Intense and a bit raw, but with enough spicy cherry and raspberry flavors to hold your interest. Drinkable now. 970 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Amador County Pokerville
review: A touch sweet, with lots of earthlike, sage and wild berry flavors, but a glimpse of its varietal soul holds it together. 4,500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Edna Valley MacGregor Vineyard
review: Sturdy flavorful white with a spice-honey edge to the apple flavor. 892 cases made.

name: Marsanne Amador County
review: Light in texture, with nectarine and earth flavors lingering on the modest finish. Drink now. 802 cases made.

name: Petite Sirah Amador County Not So
review: Sturdy, funky and generous, with ripe flavors reminiscent of Concord grapes, layered with earthy, gamy and spicy overtones. Should develop well with cellaring. Love the label. Best from 1993 through 1995.

name: Zinfandel Amador County Sadie Upton Vineyard
review: A very earthy aroma throws you off, but the raspberry and herb flavors make a recovery. Good quality overall.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Amador County
review: A full-bodied, assertive Sauvignon blanc that nicely integrates grapefruit ter than most.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Amador County
review: Simple, straightforward, floral, fruity and light. Drinkable now.

name: Zinfandel Amador County
review: Ruggedly earthy, powerful style adds a leathery rim to the plum and wild berry flavors. Big and ripe, lots of tannin, comes across as clumsy. 2,734 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Amador County
review: Not for the faint of palate. Powerfully oaky and herbal in flavor and quite tannic. The plum and berry flavors seem strong enough to balance the tannins.

name: Zinfandel Amador County Sadie Upton Vineyard
review: Earthy and gamy, with coarse, leathery flavors. 500 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Amador County
review: Thick in texture, tasting cooked, buttery, nutty and bitter on the finish. Reminds us more of Brazil nuts than fruit. Drinkable with hearty food.

name: Petite Sirah Amador County
review: Earthy animal aromas and flavors add up to a classic barnyardy, gamy wine. Not our style at all.

name: Brut Columbia Valley
review: Light and expressive, this is spicy, offering a fine bead and overtones of clove and grapefruit peel to the modest pear flavors, coming together with finesse. Drink now. 450 cases made.

name: Pink Bubbly Columbia Valley
review: Vivid and succulent, showing a smooth feel to the delicate watermelon and citrus flavors, with toasted bread notes adding interest on the finish. Drink now. 400 cases made.

name: Brut de Brut Columbia Valley
review: Light and refreshing, with an earthy edge to the grapefruit and apple flavors, finishing with a tobacco note. Drink now. 600 cases made.

name: Blanc de Noir Lake Chelan
review: Bright and lively if a bit abrupt, this packages pear, pineapple and floral flavors in a taut frame, finishing with deftness. Drink now. 115 cases made.

name: Brut Columbia Valley
review: Light and tangy, with a gingerbread note and a sour edge mingling with lively citrus flavors. Drink now. 600 cases made.

name: Pink Bubbly Columbia Valley
review: Pink in color and floral on the aromatics, with watermelon and white pepper notes playing against the lightly sweet texture. Drink now. 200 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Barossa Valley
review: Plenty of apple, pear and nutmeg aromas and flavors persist on the long finish, which echoes almond and vanilla notes. Crisp and lively. Packed with flavor; a solid package. A good value. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Barossa Valley
review: Firm and focused, with strong, minty, cedary overtones to the ripe currant and black cherry flavors; finishes peppery and buttery. Should improve through 1995 to '97. 4,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Barossa Valley
review: Fresh, focused and fruity, with lots of well-modulated peach, pear, vanilla and honey flavors in elegant proportions. It's flavorful without being weighty. A stylish wine.

name: Chardonnay Barossa Valley
review: Spicy, ripe and tasty, but not too heavy, a golden-hued and intensely fruit y, given nerve with a backbone of slightly sharp lemony acidity. Drink now through 1991.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Barossa Valley
review: Very firm, almost hard-edged and astringent, but it has a solid core of ripe currant and cherry flavor, and oak to spare. Drinkable now.

name: Chardonnay Eden Valley
review: Ripe and sweet, a soft white with spicy pear and nutmeg flavors. 6,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Barossa Valley
review: A straightforward, spicy, floral-tasting Chardonnay, with lively acidity. Has good fruit flavors, but doesn't come together as well as it might on the finish.

name: Chardonnay Barossa Valley
review: Simple, direct fruity style that is pleasant and easy on the pocketbook. The ripe pear and melon flavors offer modest depth and complexity. Drink now.

name: Hermitage Barossa Valley
review: Showing maturity and smoothness, a gentle, supple wine offering coffee, plum and raisin aromas and flavors, a bit spicy, balanced. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay Barossa Valley
review: Firm in texture, simple and appealing, with modest apple and spice aromas and flavors. Drinkable now.

name: Hermitage Barossa Valley
review: Not a very charming wine but it's got some decent flavors with hints of min t and coffee and tart cherry. Finish is drying.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Barossa Valley
review: Herbal and grassy, with candied fruit and slightly sour flavors. An extreme style that won't appeal to everyone.

name: Shiraz South Eastern Australia
review: Has ripe, supple character, offering black cherry and smoke, finishing with lithe texture. Drink now. 12,000 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Tightly wound, firm and complex, offering a mix of cedar, loamy earth, dried currant and blackberry flavors, with touches of black licorice, mineral and sage. Full-bodied, ending with ripe, chewy tannins that reverberate on the finish. Best from 2012 through 2022. 680 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: In excellent shape, this combines ripe, intense, extracted dark berry, mineral, licorice, kirsch and dusty-cedary oak. The tannins are firm, keeping the flavors alive on the long finish.2003 California Cabernet blind retrospective (July 2013). Drink now through 2024. 250 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Firm, rich and polished up front before the tannins weigh in, framing the dried currant and loamy earth flavors--and even when they do, they're supple and integrated. Best from 2010 through 2016. 467 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: A dark, rich, potent wine, with layers of complex currant, blackberry, cedar and spice, it's tightly focused, firm and concentrated, finishing with a tight band of tannins, but also excellent structure. New wine from Kevin Carriker; Mark Herold of Merus is consulting winemaker. Best from 2005 through 2012. 261 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley 41.08N 08.40W
review: Bright and juicy, with a black tea note and a whiff of smoke mingling with fresh ripe cherry and blackberry flavors, accented by an Amaretto hint. Intense, with firming tannins. Drink now through 2030. 135 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: An immense, richly flavored and firmly tannic effort, deep and extracted, with chewy dark berry, mocha, crushed rock, cedar and graphite flavors. Ends with a savory, dried herb edge to the tannins. Drink now through 2024. 680 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Pure and silky at the start, firming with dried herb and cedar notes. This offers rich plum and berry, with chewy, mineral-laced tannins imparting a nice push of flavors on the finish. Drink now through 2023. 465 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Knights Valley
review: Bursting with apricot, nectarine and peach flavors and aromatics, this displays wonderful purity to the fruit flavors. There's an elegance here, delivering juicy acidity and fresh herbal shadings on the finish. Drink now. 170 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Firm and structured, showing a tight band of cedary- and creamy-oak flavors, chewy tannins and an extracted core of earthy currant, mineral and blackberry fruit where the tannins definitely hold the upper hand. Needs time or aeration. Best from 2010 through 2016. 585 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: A mixed bag, with ripeness extending to berry pie and jam flavors on a sleek frame. Those who enjoy the riper expression of Cabernet will enjoy that high-toned fruit. Loses velocity and focus on the finish. Drink now through 2022. 489 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Intense and rustic, with chewy tannins wrapped around core flavors of dried herb and currant, mineral, sage, tea, coffee grounds and cedar. This is full-bodied and complex, if still quite tight and leathery. In need of cellaring. Best from 2013 through 2023. 683 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: At a good drinking plateau, still rich and vibrant, centered on blackberry, plum and black licorice flavors. The tannins are lively but starting to dry out, revealing a chalky, dried herb edge on the finish. Not likely to gain.2004 California Cabernet blind retrospective (August 2014). Drink now through 2020. 381 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Drying out, yet there's enough richness in the core dark berry fruit to sustain interest. Big and rich, with blackberry, mineral and cedar notes. Drying tannins are a concern.—2002 California Cabernet blind retrospective (May 2012). Drink now through 2018. 221 cases made.

name: Window Pane California
review: Potent yet restrained, showing firm, persistent tannins woven within extracted dark berry. The grip shows no signs of softening any time soon. Cabernet Sauvignon, Petite Sirah, Carignan and Graciano. Drink now through 2022. 789 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Knights Valley
review: Crisp and focused, with a lemon-citrus core and lemongrass, ginger and melon details. Drink now. 212 cases made.

name: Window Pane California
review: Shows a mix of ripe and green flavors, with trim berry, herb and cedary notes of moderate complexity. Cabernet Sauvignon, Petite Sirah and Carignane. Drink now through 2020. 778 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley
review: The fresh earth, dried cranberry, tea and wilted rose flavors give this a distinct, sleek profile. Understated throughout, finishing with touches of anise, black tea and cedar. Drink now through 2020. 300 cases made.

name: Grenache Russian River Valley Rosé
review: Zesty and lush, with raspberry and cinnamon aromas and rich, lively flavors of cherry and spice. Drink now. 50 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Unti Vineyard
review: Supple and fun to drink, with jammy raspberry aromas and soft flavors of black cherry, pepper and anise. Drink now through 2017. 195 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Sonoma Mountain
review: Hay and chamomile notes are good accents to the juicy pear, lemon and green apple flavors. Fresh and refreshing on the finish. Drink now. 50 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Aromas of dusty berry, pencil lead, maraschino cherry and herb are at the core of this supple, graceful effort. Ends with delicate wilted rose tannins. Drink now. 150 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Anderson Valley
review: The citrus notes show plenty of tangerine and Meyer lemon flavors on a medium frame, with touches of spice on the crisp finish. Drink now. 100 cases made.

name: Torrontés Cafayate Valley Piattelli Vineyards Premium
review: Ripe but still stylish, with good depth to the rounded clementine, persimmon and white peach flavors that linger on the juicy finish. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Luján de Cuyo Piattelli Vineyards Grand Reserve
review: Solid, with a straightforward range of dark currant, fig and loam notes that linger through the finish. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Malbec Luján de Cuyo Piattelli Vineyards Grand Reserve
review: Heavily toasty, with mesquite, coffee and plum notes that follow through on the muscular finish. A bit shy on purity in the end. Drink now through 2009. 5,000 cases made.

name: Malbec Luján de Cuyo Piattelli Vineyards Premium
review: Dark, with a slightly raisined edge to the plum, prune, black cherry and cocoa notes. Concentrated, but the raisined edge peeks out again on the finish, holding this back. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Tupungato
review: Moderate black cherry, currant and vanilla notes, with a dusty edge to the finish. A bit trim in the end, but good. Drink now. 120 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Tupungato Piattelli Vineyards Premium
review: Medium-weight, with a mix of grape, cherry and herb notes, backed by a dash of toast. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Malbec Luján de Cuyo Piattelli Vineyards Premium
review: A bit compact, with fig, prune and coffee notes followed by a smoky finish. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Beli Pinot Goriska Brda Zanut
review: Apple and peach on the nose. Medium-bodied, with good acidity and a clean finish. Drink now. 330 cases made.

name: Sivi Pinot Goriska Brda
review: Canned pear and fruit cocktail aromas. Medium-bodied, with good acidity and a simple finish. Not much to it. Drink now. 580 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Ynez Valley Reserve
review: Combines rich layers of ripe plum, pomegranate and boysenberry with touches of spice and fresh earth. Complex, full-bodied and supple in texture, this is simply delicious to drink now. Drink now through 2014. 245 cases made.

name: Grenache Blanc Santa Ynez Valley
review: Offers grapefruit and lime notes up front, but the core is reminiscent of spicy poached pear. Elegant and fragrant, with a clove accent lingering on the light, crisp body. Drink now. 375 cases made.

name: Grenache Santa Ynez Valley Rosé
review: Racy aromas loaded with smoky spice meet zesty raspberry and strawberry flavors. Drink now. 550 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Ynez Valley
review: Tightly wound and full-bodied, with firm loamy earth, dried berry, sage and herbal scents. Very complex and supple-textured. Drink now through 2013. 1,408 cases made.

name: Grenache Santa Ynez Valley
review: Fresh, snappy, sweetish black cherry and wild berry fruit is delivered in a medium-to-full-bodied, ready-to-enjoy-now style. Drink now. 489 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Santa Ynez Valley
review: Light-bodied and elegant, with pretty citrus notes that are refreshing and bright. Lemon zest, nectarine, melon and tangerine flavors are focused and spicy on the finish. Drink now. 1,182 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Ynez Valley
review: Marked by spicy smoked bacon, dried currant, sage and dusty berry notes. Complex and concentrated, this firms up and shows its tannic muscle at the end. Gains on the finish. Drink now through 2014. 1,068 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Ynez Valley
review: Ripe, with a lush and aromatic mix of elderflower, dried mango and apple tart flavors. The spicy finish has some smoky notes. Drink now. 230 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Ynez Valley Reserve
review: A fragrant, floral, delicate style, with subtle spicy pear, citrus and a touch of mineral. Drink now through 2011. 220 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sta. Rita Hills
review: Marked by an initial edge of meaty tobacco, which tops the rustic, chewy dried currant, plum and berry. This straightens out, revealing concentration and depth, ending with chewy tannins. Drink now through 2015. 440 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Santa Ynez Valley
review: Sophisticated, displaying tangerine, apricot, citrus peel and yellow apple flavors that are pleasantly fleshy and refined, with a spicy note on the finish. Drink now. 505 cases made.

name: Viognier Santa Ynez Valley
review: There's nice intensity to the lemon-lime, pear and apricot flavors that have a spicy tobacco flair. Light-bodied, with an extremely refreshing acidity. Drink now. 383 cases made.

name: Riesling Santa Ynez Valley
review: The candied yellow apple, pear and melon flavors are ripe and round, with appealing juicy notes on the finish. Drink now. 1,024 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Santa Ynez Valley
review: Spiced apple pie, pear and citrus flavors are mellow, with soft acidity and a spicy finish. Drink now. 1,036 cases made.

name: Viognier Santa Ynez Valley
review: A lean style, with zippy pineapple, peach and herb flavors. Finishes with a mineral and slate note. Drink now. 677 cases made.

name: Grenache Santa Ynez Valley
review: Ripe and spicy, with a pleasant mix of snappy plum, black cherry and subtle herbal notes. Full-bodied and easy-drinking. Drink now. 601 cases made.

name: Sangiovese Santa Ynez Valley Oak Savanna Vineyard
review: Tart and juicy, with modest cranberry, cherry and spicy herb notes. Drink now. 237 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Santa Ynez Valley
review: Trim currant, raspberry and cherry flavors have green and herbal shadings on a smooth frame, with a spicy finish. Drink now through 2012. 1,059 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Barbara County
review: Savory, with stewed tomato, herb and oregano flavors and underripe flavors that leave you wishing for ripe dark fruit. Drink now. 1,567 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Rita Hills
review: Crisp flavors of sour cherry, licorice and pepper are refreshing. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Barbara County
review: Tart and a bit bitter, with dried berry notes accented by white pepper, leather, beef jerky, coffee and herbal flavors. Drink now. 400 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Rita Hills
review: Pungently earthy, with funky, barnyardy flavors. 486 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Santa Ynez Valley
review: Bitter and dirty flavors showed up in two separate bottles tasted, putting it in the not recommended category. 2,400 cases made.

name: Muskateller Trockenbeerenauslese Pfalz Kallstadter Saumagen
review: Very intense raisin, honey and spice aromas and flavors. Extremely full-bodied and very sweet, but beautifully balanced. An outstanding Muskateller that will improve into 1998.

name: Riesling Auslese Trocken Pfalz Kallstadter Saumagen R
review: Custardy and rich-tasting, delivering loads of complex apricot, ripe citrus, melon, and raspberry flavors flanked by lush pastry notes, this is very refined, with elegant shadings of mulled spice on the long finish.  Drink now through 2019. 200 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Trocken Pfalz Kallstadter Saumagen
review: There are hints of shiso leaf to the crisp and focused flavors of white raspberry and melon. Juicy and rich spice notes fill the pure and creamy finish.  Drink now through 2021. 150 cases made.

name: Riesling Beerenauslese Pfalz Kallstadter Saumagen
review: Not very sweet, but shows beautiful peach and almond aromas and flavors along with complex honey and earth notes. Has imposing concentration and enough structure to age for decades.

name: Riesling Spätlese Trocken Pfalz Kallstadter Saumagen
review: Offering apple pastry, plum tart and chamomile tea flavors that are well-spiced, this creamy white is nicely structured, with plenty of flint and slate notes. The finish delivers peach elements, with savory accents.   Best from 2018 through 2022. 200 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Trocken Pfalz Kallstadter Saumagen R
review: Nicely matured, with subtle petrol notes to the ripe cherry, dried apricot and peach tart flavors, this boasts rich minerality. Apricot jam and spice accents linger on the finish.  Drink now. 65 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Gold Cap Pfalz Kallstadter Saumagen
review: There's lovely, concentrated dried apricot, honey and citrus components in this rich, sweet white. The underlying structure is fine, but is overshadowed by the sweetness and fruit. Drink now through 2008.

name: Riesling Auslese Pfalz Kallstadter Saumagen
review: Focused and elegant, this '97 auslese displays lime, peach and mineral aromas and flavors, a vibrant, racy structure and beautiful harmony accompanied by a long finish . It really sings today, though it will also develop well over the next few years. Not imported into the U.S. Best from 2002 through 2010.

name: Riesling Beerenauslese Pfalz Kallstadter Saumagen
review: Incredibly fresh aromas of quince and orange lead into an elegant dessert white that carries a distinctive minty element on the palate. Balanced on the rich, soft side, with a hint of astringency on the finish. Drink now through 2010.

name: Riesling Kabinett Trocken Pfalz Kallstadter
review: Very fruity, offering pure-tasting and off-dry flavors of peach, apple and honeysuckle that carry hints of lushness, with mouthfilling minerality completing the package. The snappy finish has some chamomile tea notes.  Drink now through 2019. 650 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Pfalz Kallstadter Saumagen
review: Big, powerful and not terribly sweet, but shows lots of substance, featuring lovely dried apricot and almond flavors and good acidity for a '92. A serious wine, with a long, mineral-flavored finish that needs time to show its best. Try now.

name: Riesling Kabinett Trocken Pfalz Kallstadter Saumagen
review: Rich and intense, delivering loads of concentrated pear, glazed pineapple and dried apricot flavors that are lathered with creamy notes. Honey and dried savory accents lift the finish.  Drink now through 2019. 500 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Pfalz Kallstadter Saumagen
review: Showing breadth and power, this delivers rich, dense flavors of citrus, apricot and licorice on a bracing structure. Drink now through 2006. 200 cases made.

name: Riesling Trockenbeerenauslese Pfalz Kallstadter Saumagen
review: A voluptous, thick and buttery Riesling, with lovely honey, almond and lemon rind aromas and flavors. Full body, sweet and round, with a chewy texture. Drinkable now, but age will treat this well.

name: Riesling Auslese Pfalz Kallstadter Saumagen
review: Not your typical straightforward Auslese. This is racy, closed up with steely acidity yet rich and ripe character. Medium-to-full bodied, sweet and elegant. Drinkable now.

name: Riesling Auslese Trocken Pfalz Kallstadter Saumagen R
review: Aromas of sweet spice and vanilla are followed by peach and apricot flavors. This is about as full-bodied as Riesling gets, with noticeable alcohol. Firmly structured, it develops some spice and orange accents on the dry, mineral-tinged finish.--German Riesling non-blind vertical (April 2008). Drink now.

name: Riesling Beerenauslese Pfalz Kallstadter Saumagen
review: Intensely floral, almost like rose essence, this is very big and powerful showing much less sweetness than most others in this category. Lots of honey flavors on the palate lead to a long, chunky finish. Drink now, or age.

name: Riesling Eiswein Pfalz Kallstadter Saumagen
review: Very clean, with pure flavors of peach and almond, moderate concentration and rich mouthfeel. The acidity has a citrusy edge to it, though not particularly bracing. Drink now through 2012.

name: Riesling Kabinett Halbtrocken Pfalz Kallstadter Steinacker
review: Absolutely delicious. A ripe and juicy dry wine with melon, pie crust, cantaloupe character. Full-bodied, off-dry, with loads of spicy, smoky fruit and a long, long finish. Drink or hold.

name: Riesling Spätlese Halbtrocken Pfalz Kallstadter Saumagen
review: Big yet lively showing spice and pie crust aromas and flavors. Full in body and off-dry with an abundance of ripe fruit character. Refreshing finish. Delicious.

name: Riesling Spätlese Pfalz Kallstadter Saumagen
review: Exotic and spicy, here's a Riesling full of vanilla, honey, pineapple and passion fruit, buoyed by succulent acidity and ending on a firm note. Drink now through 2003.

name: Riesling Spätlese Pfalz Kallstadter Saumagen
review: Very good Pfalz Spätlese with mineral, earthy fruity aromas and flavors. Full-to-medium bodied with a round and fruity texture. Medium sweet and a clean finish. Drink now.

name: Muskateller Auslese Pfalz Kallstadter Saumagen
review: Rich and slightly dry for an Auslese, this stylish white exhibits spice, burnt almond and apricot character. Medium-bodied and off-dry, with a silky texture. Perfect with food. Drink now.

name: Riesling Auslese Pfalz Kallstadter Saumagen
review: Firm and spicy in a slender mold, this lightweight auslese is well defined, keeping its narrow range of citrus and peach reined in through the finish. Drink now through 2006.

name: Riesling Auslese Pfalz Kallstadter Saumagen
review: A big, voluptuous wine with lots of stuffing. Full-bodied and weighty, though it doesn't have quite enough sweetness for the ideal balance. A big punch of flavor at the end brings it back alive, however. Drinkable now, or try it with some age.

name: Riesling Kabinett Halbtrocken Pfalz Kallstadter Steinacker
review: Reserved and steely, with complex aromas and flavors of flowers, minerals and almond, this '97 white is medium weight with lemony acidity and a long, subtle finsih. It needs time to develop. Not imported into the U.S. Best from 2000 through 2007.

name: Riesling Spätlese Halbtrocken Pfalz Kallstadter Saumagen
review: A very intense wine loaded with ripe spice, tropical fruit and brown sugar aromas and flavors. Medium- to full-bodied, off-dry, with a long, spicy, honey finish.

name: Riesling Spätlese Pfalz Kallstadter Saumagen
review: Oily, big spätlese with plenty of ripe, spicy fruit character. Only half-sweet. Medium- to full-bodied with creamy texture and a long, flavorful finish. Stylish. Drink now or hold.

name: Riesling Auslese Pfalz Kallstadter Saumagen Reserve
review: This has richness and concentration balanced by high acidity, which offsets the nectarine and apricot flavors nicely. There's an impression that this wine is holding back. Wait until 2000.

name: Riesling Kabinett Halbtrocken Pfalz Kallstadter Steinacker
review: Apricot, pine forest and spice aromas and flavors highlight this big, robust kabinett made in a traditional style. It's dense, well-integrated and long, but needs time to come together. Best from 2007 through 2012.

name: Riesling Kabinett Pfalz Kallstadter Steinacker
review: Very pretty kabinett with honey, apple and cream character. Rather silky and caressing in texture, with clean fruit flavor, light sweetness and crisp finish. Delicious.

name: Riesling Kabinett Pfalz Kallstadter Steinacker
review: Unusual spicy, orange, lemon aromas and flavors. Medium bodied and off-dry with a long spicy finish. Crisp and clean. Drinkable now.

name: Riesling Spätlese Halbtrocken Pfalz Kallstadter Saumagen
review: A white that starts in a rich, peach-flavored direction before turning reserved, steely and focused on its minerally finish. Good intensity and length. Not imported into the U.S. Best from 2000 through 2006.

name: Riesling Spätlese Pfalz Kallstadter Saumagen
review: Quite rich and delivers lots of ripe fruit flavors. Full-bodied and succulent, only a hint of sweetness and a long, creamy finish. Drinkable now or try aging a few years.

name: Scheurebe Beerenauslese Pfalz Kallstadter Saumagen
review: Has very rich caramel accents. Big and powerful, but not as lively or succulent as many others from this vintage. The dried apricot flavors echo long on the finish. Drinkable now, or hold off for more development.

name: Scheurebe Spätlese Pfalz Kallstadter Steinacker
review: Floral and apricot notes are pure, sweet and ripe, backed by a grapefruit peel character as well as acidity in this focused, elegant, pretty style of Scheurebe. Drink now.

name: Gewürztraminer Spätlese Pfalz Kallstadter Steinacker
review: Richly textured yet lively and focused, this spicy white has immediate appeal. The lushness is balanced by a characteristic grapefruit peel accent on the finish. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now.

name: Riesling Auslese Pfalz Kallstadter Saumagen
review: Lively and fresh in a dry style, showing plenty of almond, apple, honey and touch of mineral aromas and flavors. Ready to drink, try with food.

name: Riesling Spätlese Halbtrocken Pfalz Kallstadter Saumagen
review: Very appealing, ripe peach and honeysuckle character and succulent mouth-feel make this medium-bodied dry white easy to enjoy. Drinkable now.

name: Muskateller Auslese Pfalz Kallstadter Saumagen
review: Assertive and spicy, rich in body and well balanced, displaying pine, clove and grapefruit aromas and flavors. Try as an aperitif. Drink now.

name: Riesling Auslese Pfalz Kallstadter Saumagen
review: Not as sweet as some in this category, but has an attractive spicy, honey and mineral character. Medium in body and sweetness, with medium acidity on the he finish. Drink now.

name: Riesling Kabinett Halbtrocken Pfalz Kallstadter Steinacker
review: This is fresh and lively, with melon, grapefruit and a hint of earthy mineral character. It's medium-bodied, off-dry, with a crisp finish. Drink now or hold.

name: Riesling Kabinett Pfalz Kallstadter Steinacker
review: Off-dry, with grainy, oxidative notes, along with peach and spice flavors. A more rustic style, yet young and unevolved, ending with fine length. Needs time. Best from 2008 through 2015.

name: Riesling Kabinett Pfalz Kallstadter Steinacker
review: Pleasantly balanced, grapey and spicy, showing off its pineapple character. Medium-bodied, off-dry, with lovely harmony between the fruit and acidity. Drinkable now.

name: Muskateller Beerenauslese Pfalz Kallstadter Saumagen
review: Hard, rough and rustic, offering bitter, astringent almond and apricot flavors laced with butter, vanilla and cedar notes. A bit disjoined and awkward on the finish.

name: Riesling Beerenauslese Pfalz Kallstadter Saumagen
review: More auslese in weight and character than a BA, but it still shows pretty spice, lemon and sweet fruit notes.

name: Riesling Kabinett Pfalz Kallstadter Steinacker
review: A very spicy wine with a hint of dried herbs on the finish. Medium bodied, off-dry with lively acidity. Best after 1997.

name: Riesling Kabinett Halbtrocken Pfalz Kallstadter Steinacker
review: Off-dry and plenty of flavor, but just a little lighter than the flavors suggest. Nice spice, almond and earth aromas, though, and a clean finish. Drinkable now.

name: Riesling Kabinett Pfalz Kallstadter Steinacker
review: Lean and sharply acidic, without the balance and juicy fruit typical of the best kabinetts. Best from 2004 through 2008.

name: Riesling Spätlese Pfalz Kallstadter Saumagen
review: Good creamy, vanilla and candied pear aromas and flavors. Medium-bodied, medium-sweet, but slightly short and diluted on the finish. Drink now.

name: Gewürztraminer Spätlese Pfalz Kallstadter Steinacker
review: Rough and aggressive now; the lush pineapple and honey texture is struggling to soften the harsh, spicy, vegetal flavors. Try now.

name: Muskateller Kabinett Trocken Pfalz Kallstadter Saumagen
review: Very aromatic, floral and light, this is tart, dry and built on a lean frame that needs food to round it out. Drinkable now.

name: Gewürztraminer Auslese Pfalz Kallstadter Steinacker
review: Hot and burning, with a spicy, burnt almond character. Too dry. Full-bodied and rich, but not much pleasure.

name: Syrah Snake River Valley Cuvée Amelia Reserve
review: Dense, focused and expressive, wrapping the rich, ripe dark cherry, berry and chocolate flavors in a veil of firm tannins. The finish trails plum and floral notes. Best from 2016 through 2020. 74 cases made.

name: Riesling Snake River Valley Ice Wine
review: Light-footed, sweet and rich, offering pineapple, pear and honey notes that linger enticingly. Displays depth and intensity. Drink now through 2016. 387 cases made.

name: Syrah Snake River Valley Three Vineyard Cuvée
review: Fresh and supple, with crisp acidity supporting the blackberry and currant fruit, finishing with plushness and length. Drink now through 2018. 325 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Syrah Snake River Valley
review: Firm in texture, with a black pepper note prominent among the black currant and blackberry flavors, lingering enticingly on the chewy finish. Best after 2014. 202 cases made.

name: Syrah Snake River Valley Three Vineyard Cuvée
review: Firm in texture, with a peach note adding interest to the blackberry and smoke flavors, coming together smoothly against nubby tannins as the finish lingers persuasively. Best from 2016 through 2019. 325 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Syrah Snake River Valley
review: Firm in texture, with grippy tannins around a broad, ripe core of cherry, chocolate and nutmeg flavors, lingering on the finish. Best after 2016. 193 cases made.

name: Syrah Idaho Three Vineyard Cuvée
review: Honest plum and raspberry fruit here, with supple texture, sweet smoke and hints of violets and chocolate on the finish. Nicely done. Drink now. 75 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace
review: A lithe Gewürztraminer, with bright acidity framing the flavors of white peach, grapefruit sorbet, stone and ginger. Creamy finish. Drink now through 2019. 3,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Blanc Alsace
review: This fresh, light-footed white offers subtle notes of Anjou pear, honeysuckle and lemon zest, with a modest, stony finish. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace
review: A fresh and balanced white, with stone and saline accents underscoring the crunchy green pear, spring blossom and Meyer lemon zest notes. Drink now through 2018. 25,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Idaho Ice Wine Windridge Vineyard
review: Quite rich, with forward apricot and nectarine flavors that push through the finish where a nice tangy note keeps it all honest. Drink now. 87 cases made.

name: Riesling Snake River Valley Ice Wine
review: Dark gold in color, rich and satiny in texture, with a balsa edge to the modest pear and molasses flavors. Drink now. 342 cases made.

name: Riesling Snake River Valley Ice Wine Windridge Vineyard
review: Rich, sweet and forward, with orange peel and creamed peach flavors. Modest in terms of range, but tasty. Drink now. 284 cases made.

name: Riesling Snake River Valley Icewine
review: This dessert-style wine has good peach, date and apricot notes, with a frankly sweet finish. Drink now. 110 cases made.

name: Syrah Idaho Three Vineyard Cuvée
review: Soft and forward, with a nice core of plum and raspberry fruit backed by modest toast. Nicely done. Drink now. 325 cases made.

name: Syrah Snake River Valley Three Vineyard Cuvée
review: A broad, toasty style, with the plum and blackberry fruit giving way to cocoa and roasted vanilla on the finish. Drink now. 248 cases made.

name: Pinot Blanc Alsace
review: White peach, dried strawberry and candied orange zest notes mix in this creamy, light-bodied sipper. Offers a fresh, floral finish of moderate length. Drink now. 7,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace
review: Light-bodied and crisp, this snappy white offers clean-cut flavors of crunchy pear, wet stone and lemon curd. Drink now. 2,800 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Idaho Bitner Vineyard
review: Solid, ripe berry fruit, with a jammy edge, but enough chocolaty grip to keep it honest. Drink now. 152 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Petit Verdot Snake River Valley
review: Shows a well-toasted mix of plum, prune and briar notes, with just enough vivacity on the finish to keep this honest. Drink now. 98 cases made.

name: Merlot Idaho Estate Vineyard
review: Bright plum and berry fruit, with a firm chocolate note as well. Smoky, fleshy finish. Drink now. 205 cases made.

name: Syrah Idaho Cuvée Amelia Reserve
review: Shows good dark plum, cherry and toast flavors, with the toasty edge taking over on the finish. Bigger than the Three Vineyard Cuvée, but lacks its purity. Drink now. 48 cases made.

name: Merlot Snake River Valley Estate Vineyard
review: Tobacco, plum and toast notes mingle in this medium-weight Merlot. Lingering toast on the finish. Drink now. 302 cases made.

name: Riesling Snake River Valley Sunny Slope Cuvée
review: Soft and forward, with mature baked apple, ginger and brioche notes backed by a slight hint of lanolin on the off-dry finish. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Sémillon-Chardonnay Idaho
review: Shows nice lime, floral and white peach flavors, with decent cut on the finish. Good job. Drink now. 187 cases made.

name: Syrah Idaho Three Vineyard Cuvée
review: Easygoing grape and berry fruit, with a floral note on the finish. Drink now. 202 cases made.

name: Syrah Snake River Valley Cuvée Amelia Reserve
review: Forward and frankly toasty, but with good flesh to the plum, fig and mocha notes. Drink now. 72 cases made.

name: Viognier Idaho Williamson Vineyard
review: Shows good varietal notes of anise and peach with a plump, clean texture and finish. Drink now. 192 cases made.

name: Viognier Snake River Valley Williamson Vineyard
review: Light and clean, with direct kiwifruit and pear flavors. Drink now. 374 cases made.

name: Brut Crémant d'Alsace
review: This bright sparkler is almost crunchy in texture, with crisp acidity and a lively mousse, offering hints of melon, smoke, white peach and lemon zest. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet-Syrah Snake River Valley
review: Rather direct, with a heavily toasty beam of black currant and fig notes. A strong coffee edge marks the square finish. Drink now. 140 cases made.

name: Merlot Snake River Valley
review: Tangy in flavor, soft in texture, offering an odd mix of ripe cherry and green bean flavors that keeps fighting through the finish. Best after 2015. 410 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Idaho Albers Vineyard
review: Light, but with good red and back cherry fruit, with a clean, spice-tinged finish. Drink now. 148 cases made.

name: Syrah Snake River Valley Three Vineyard Cuvée
review: Clean and forward, with grape and black cherry fruit backed by modest toast. Drink now. 325 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace
review: This is light and creamy, with hints of lychee, smoke, ginger and verbena. Drink now. 18,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet-Syrah Idaho
review: Quite toasty, with a thick layer of cocoa covering the modest plum and cherry fruit. The crisp finish shows a mix of herb hints and heavy toast. Drink now. 125 cases made.

name: Riesling Idaho Late Harvest Windridge Vineyard
review: Soft, with some lime candy and green apple fruit. Moderate finish. Drink now. 210 cases made.

name: Sémillon-Chardonnay Idaho
review: Broad and soft, with straightforward peach and citrus flavors. Drink now. 198 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Idaho Bitner Vineyard
review: A bit blowsy, with tinned peach and pear juice flavors that are clean but a touch cloying. Gets by. Drink now. 198 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Idaho Bitner Vineyard
review: Sweet toast aroma, but only modest plum fruit, which is unable to support it in the end, so it turns dry and lean. 148 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Idaho Bitner Vineyard
review: Gussied up, with a whack of toast up front that overrides the grapey fruit. 156 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Idaho Bitner Vineyard
review: Soft butter and McIntosh apple notes, with a blowsy finish. 202 cases made.

name: Riesling Idaho Sunny Slope Cuvée
review: Offers simple candied lime and watermelon favors. 202 cases made.

name: Viognier Idaho Williamson Vineyard
review: Light, with lime and fennel notes that turn lean on the finish. 175 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Snake River Valley Bitner Vineyard
review: A bit muddled, with prune and coffee notes that lack vivacity and definition. 250 cases made.

name: Merlot Idaho
review: Fading, with faint cherry notes, and a slightly cloying butter note on the finish. Past its prime. 398 cases made.

name: Cuvée Alden Private Reserve Snake River Valley
review: Fading, with dried currant, prune and tomato notes followed by a slightly firm, toasty finish. 73 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Idaho Albers Vineyard
review: Funky, with a rubbery hint to the black cherry and earth notes. 131 cases made.

name: Riesling Idaho Ice Wine Windridge Vineyard
review: Odd clove and musk aromas are hard to overcome, despite lots of fleshy sweetness. 84 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Idaho Special Harvest Bitner Vineyard
review: Like watermelon candy, with candied green apple fruit that turns cloying in the end. 99 cases made.

name: Cuvée Alden Private Reserve Idaho
review: Odd menthol and cough syrup notes run through this cloying, clumsy red. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. 51 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Idaho Bitner Vineyard
review: Woodsy, mulchy flavors. Blunt finish. 202 cases made.

name: Laski Rizling Jagodni Izbor Mea Culpa
review: Lovely aromas of dried pineapple, apricot and honey. Full-bodied and very sweet, with a lemon, sweet and sour finish. A solid sweet wine. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now. 70 cases made.

name: Pgo Trio
review: Very fresh and clean, with apple, cream and mineral character. Medium-bodied, with good acidity and a bright finish. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now. 100 cases made.

name: Slovenia Slovenia
review: Hint of carbon dioxide, and freshness carries the peach and pear flavors nicely. Rich and concentrated, if not that complex. Good lingering finish. Drink now. 250 cases imported.

name: Pgo Magna Dominica Albus
review: Pineapple, honey and apple character. Medium-bodied, with good fruit and a light finish.  Drink now. 150 cases imported.

name: Ranina Pgo Mea Culpa
review: Pear and apple on the nose. Medium-bodied, with fresh fruit and a simple finish. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now. 70 cases made.

name: Sämling Pgo
review: Lots of lime and pear on the nose. Medium-bodied, with bright acidity but a slightly dull finish. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now. 70 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Pineapple, lime and peach flavors are fresh, vibrant and intense, with accents of lemon verbena on the crisp finish. Drink now. 11,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Ripe pear, peach and pineapple flavors are juicy and bright, with a lip-smacking finish and details of lemon verbena. Drink now. 50,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough
review: The dark cherry and plum flavors show notes of cola and dried herb, set on a fleshy body, with clove-scented spices on the finish. Drink now through 2027. 2,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough
review: Vibrant, with orange peel and wild strawberry flavors that show accents of caramel, toast and caraway. The elegant finish lingers. Drink now through 2025. 15,000 cases made.

name: Aglianico Puglia
review: This medium, rustic red offers ample character, marrying sun-dried cherry and plum notes with attractive hints of underbrush and cigar box. Drink now. 8,000 cases made.

name: Primitivo di Manduria
review: Leather and tobacco notes offset the jammy plum, spice and licorice flavors, concluding with a hot, herb-tinged finish. Drink now. 12,500 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Pauline's Vineyard
review: Jammy but well-structured, with black cherry and smoky licorice aromas matched to complex, vibrant flavors of red plum and raspberry, accented by nuances of cracked pepper and dried sage. Drink now through 2025. 347 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Winemaker's Reserve Pauline's Vineyard
review: Expressive aromas of cracked pepper and black cherry lead to ripe and layered flavors of blackberry, licorice and sage. Tannins are big but ripe. Drink now through 2017. 200 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Peters Vineyard
review: Intense and vibrant, complex and delicate, offering a tight mix of earthy cherry, raspberry and blackberry fruit, with hints of sage and mineral. Shows wonderful balance, gaining depth on the finish. Drink now through 2014. 350 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Winemaker's Reserve Peters Vineyard
review: Smooth, rich and creamy-textured, with layers of ripe cherry, plum and raspberry that are focused, elegant and persistent, ending with a dash of fresh earth and mineral. Drink now through 2011. 220 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Timber Crest Vineyard
review: A big, ripe, well-structured red, with a black cherry armoa leading to jammy yet focused raspberry, briary anise and smoke flavors. Drink now through 2018. 217 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Timber Crest Vineyard Winemaker's Reserve
review: Richly structured, with a dense, focused core. Toasty cherry and mineral aromas lead to layered flavors of ripe black raspberry, fresh sage and white pepper. Drink now through 2024. 390 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Pauline's Vineyard
review: Briary and ripe, with baked cherry and spicy cinnamon aromas and plum, black raspberry, black pepper and dark licorice flavors. Drink now through 2024. 350 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Timber Crest Vineyard
review: Rich and vibrant, with smoky back raspberry aromas and layered flavors of cherry pie, cracked pepper and fresh sage. Drink now through 2021. 472 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Timber Crest Vineyards Winemaker's Reserve
review: Supple and jammy, with raspberry and cinnamon aromas and fresh, ripe flavors of cherry, spiced vanilla and toasty sage. Drink now through 2018. 120 cases made.

name: Cuvée 4791 Dry Creek Valley
review: Sleek and nicely balanced, with bright raspberry and red currant fruit and supple layers of toasty cinnamon, Asian spice and dried sage. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Zinfandel, Carignane, Petite Sirah and Syrah. Drink now through 2014. 1,900 cases made.

name: Cuvée Sonoma County
review: This easygoing red blend is fun to sip, offering lively cherry and spice aromas and supple flavors of red currant, black olive and bittersweet chocolate. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Malbec, Grenache and Petite Sirah. Drink now through 2022. 1,670 cases made.

name: Grenache Dry Creek Valley Rosé Pauline's Vineyard
review: Very pretty and delicate, with aromas of rose petal and strawberry, and crisp flavors of watermelon and spicy orange zest. Drink now. 618 cases made.

name: Grenache Dry Creek Valley Rosé Pauline's Vineyard
review: A zesty rosé, offering a delicate pink color, with floral raspberry and spice aromas that lead to lively strawberry and smoky melon flavors. Drink now. 623 cases made.

name: Grenache North Coast Rosé
review: Lovely watermelon and peach aromas lead to snappy strawberry and orange zest flavors. Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Grenache North Coast Rosé
review: Crisp and lively, with orange blossom and apricot aromas and watermelon and spice flavors. Drink now. 210 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Peters Vineyard Winemaker's Reserve
review: Exhibits complex flavors of raspberry, cranberry and wild berry that are supple, with fine-grained tannins and a tight focus, ending with a spicy mix of fruit. Drink now through 2024. 400 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley
review: Though young and a bit brooding, this bursts with bold black raspberry fruit, offering accents of licorice and toasted pepper. Drink now through 2024. 280 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley
review: Bright and zesty, with cherry and fresh anise aromas and sleek, focused flavors of raspberry, white pepper and jalapeño. Drink now through 2021. 291 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley
review: This zesty Zin shows lively black raspberry and cinnamon aromas, joined by baked cherry and spiced licorice flavors. Drink now through 2016. 1,050 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Timber Crest Vineyard
review: Zesty and full of jammy fruit, with aromas of roasted raspberry and anise leading to perky flavors of cherry, white pepper and jalapeño. Drink now through 2019. 394 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma County
review: Robust and youthful, with lively wild berry jam and spice aromas and ripe, well-structured boysenberry, toasty vanilla and rustic anise flavors. Drink now through 2014. 700 cases made.

name: Grenache Dry Creek Valley
review: Floral black raspberry and anise aromas lead to supple and jammy flavors of cherry pie and smoky pepper. Drink now through 2026. 368 cases made.

name: Grenache Dry Creek Valley Rosé Pauline's Vineyard
review: Snappy and precise, with easygoing strawberry and spicy watermelon flavors. Drink now. 900 cases made.

name: Grenache Dry Creek Valley Rosé Pauline's Vineyard
review: Soft and supple, with floral peach and strawberry aromas and watermelon flavors. Drink now. 616 cases made.

name: Grenache Dry Creek Valley Rosé Pauline's Vineyard
review: This delicate, floral rosé exhibits dusty strawberry and watermelon flavors, with spice accents. Drink now. 220 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley
review: Offers harmonious raspberry, blackberry and wild berry fruit, with moderate richness and depth. Supple and graceful in texture and balance, ending long, clean and vibrant. Drink now through 2022. 1,544 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Peters Vineyard Winemaker's Reserve
review: Firm and dense, with a rich core of firm dark and red berry fruit, revealing touches of spice and stem. Offers gripping tannins. Drink now through 2022. 377 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Peters Vineyard Winemaker's Reserve
review: Tilts toward the herbal side of Pinot, with a tight frame and firm tannins woven in with sour cherry and pepper notes. Drink now through 2020. 322 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Winemaker's Reserve Peters Vineyard
review: Rich and full-bodied, with ripe currant, black cherry, savory herb and spice nuances that give this a wide range of complex flavors. Firms up on the finish, letting the dark fruit flavors flow through. Drink now through 2011. 300 cases made.

name: Primitivo Dry Creek Valley Winemaker's Reserve Timber Crest Vineyard
review: Lively and zesty, balancing smoky baked cherry fruit with a good core of acid and tannins. Offers accents of roasted jalapeño and anise. Drink now through 2018. 144 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Dry Creek Valley Timber Crest Vineyard
review: Lemon and lime sherbet flavors are fresh, with a note of lemon verbena. Appealingly juicy. Drink now. 950 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley
review: Ripe and jammy, with black raspberry and plum fruit, plus accents of spicy caramel and smoky sage. Drink now through 2020. 629 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley
review: Zesty and ripe, with jammy black cherry and briary anise aromas that lead to soft raspberry and vanilla flavors. Drink now through 2016. 300 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Pauline's Vineyard Winemaker's Reserve
review: Jammy, plush and ripe, with bold raspberry aromas and zesty flavors of baked cherry, spicy cinnamon and licorice. Drink now through 2021. 473 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Pauline's Vineyard Winemaker's Reserve
review: Jammy and supple, showing floral raspberry and cinnamon aromas, with zesty cherry, anise and pepper flavors. Drink now through 2018. 372 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Timber Crest Vineyard
review: Sleek and focused, with pretty raspberry and toasty vanilla aromas complemented by zesty black cherry, toasted sage and spice flavors. Drink now through 2018. 574 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Timber Crest Vineyards Winemaker's Reserve
review: Dense and ripe, featuring bold, smoky black raspberry aromas, with flavors of jammy baked cherry and cracked white pepper. Drink now through 2015. 145 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma County
review: Appealingly briary, with wild berry and underbrush aromas and zesty black cherry, sage and cracked pepper flavors that finish with slightly rustic tannins. Drink now through 2016. 800 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Peters Vineyard
review: This is notable for an assertive citrusy personality, with pithy citrus skin notes and twinges of bitterness, traits some may find too strong. Drink now through 2020. 750 cases made.

name: Grenache Dry Creek Valley Rosé Pauline's Vineyard
review: Pretty and floral, with soft, easygoing raspberry and spice flavors. Drink now. 503 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Peters Vineyard Gopher Hill Block
review: Pure and pleasant, with a delicate mix of cherry and raspberry notes. Medium-weight, and ending with a minerally edge. Drink now through 2019. 209 cases made.

name: Primitivo Dry Creek Valley Timber Crest Vineyards
review: Soft and supple, with easygoing notes of raspberry and spicy herb. Drink now through 2021. 100 cases made.

name: Syrah Dry Creek Valley Green Pastures Vineyards
review: Rustic, with smoke, mineral, pebble and dried currant and berry fruit that's intense, full-bodied and gritty. Drink now through 2014. 500 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley
review: Soft and supple, featuring cinnamon and raspberry aromas, with cherry and toasted sage flavors that finish on a briary note. Drink now through 2017. 1,719 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley
review: Appealingly rustic and zesty, with raspberry and spicy cinnamon aromas and huckleberry, sage and underbrush flavors that finish on a tannic note. Drink now through 2014. 560 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Peters Vineyard Winemaker's Reserve
review: A delicate style, with dusty cherry and cranberry notes, featuring a touch of gravel and cedary oak. The flavors fade on the finish. Drink now through 2018. 448 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Mendocino County
review: Tasty melon and mango flavors are juicy, with a lovely grassy note and a lingering finish. Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Perotti Vineyards
review: Ripe but nicely structured, with spicy raspberry aromas and cherry and licorice flavors that finish with dusty, drying tannins. Drink now through 2014. 204 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Timber Crest Vineyards Winemaker's Reserve
review: Ripe and jammy, with raspberry and toasty sage aromas and soft cherry, pepper and vanilla flavors. Drink now through 2013. 238 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Peters Vineyard
review: Features toasty notes up front, with a core of crisp lemon, green apple and lime skin, revealing a touch of grapefruit peel on the finish. Drink now. 775 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Windsor Oaks Vineyards
review: Dry and cedary, with earthy cherry and wild berry flavors that have just enough depth to hold your interest.The 2005 Peters Vineyards bottling is superior. Drink now through 2009. 364 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Windsor Oaks Vineyards
review: Marked by charry oak, fresh earth and dried berry flavors, it's medium-bodied, ending with a drying finish. Drink now through 2013. 585 cases made.

name: Merlot Dry Creek Valley
review: Tight and rather herbal, with modest notes of black cherry, roasted dill and espresso. Drink now through 2012. 120 cases made.

name: Merlot Dry Creek Valley Pauline's Vineyard
review: Tightly wound, with modest cherry and herb notes. Tannins are firm and a touch earthy. Drink now through 2017. 250 cases made.

name: Syrah Dry Creek Valley Green Pastures Vineyards
review: Herbal, greenish berry flavors have a tart edge, and this keeps its herbal profile through the finish. Medium-bodied. Drink now. 658 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Winemaker's Reserve Pauline's Vineyard
review: Offers distinctive aromas of fresh pine and spice, with tart flavors that seem a bit simple, except for the herb accents. Drink now through 2018. 299 cases made.

name: Petite Sirah North Coast
review: Intense, vivid wild berry flavors struggle to compete with the herbal notes and chalky, drying tannins. Drink now. 365 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma County
review: Lean and metallic, with modest cherry, spice and herb flavors. 800 cases made.

name: Cuvée Béla Sonoma County
review: A weedy, herbal, bitter and drying style, nearly void of black fruits. Cabernet Franc, Petite Sirah and Cabernet Sauvignon. 1,300 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Arizona Paradise Valley Vineyards
review: Hanging in there, with lime and pippin apple notes that fade on the finish despite the still-lively acidity. Hurry though. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Arizona Paradise Valley Vineyards
review: There's a cooked edge to its soft black cherry and beet flavors. 1,703 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Arizona
review: Buttery nose, waxy palate, dilute finish.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Arizona Paradise Valley Vineyards
review: Tea leaf notes and a drying finish. Past its prime.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Arizona Private Reserve
review: A touch soapy on the nose and palate, with decaying fruit.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley
review: Rich and gutsy, elegant and refined, dense and persistent, this red delivers a core of wild berry, raspberry, dried herb and cedary notes. Drink now through 2022. 120 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Offers chewy, extracted tannins, filling in with generous plum and red berry fruit that echoes red licorice, anise, cedar and loamy earth flavors. Drink now through 2022. 140 cases made.

name: Chardonnay-Welschriesling Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland
review: A mélange of candy, fresh fruit and spice. New oak lends a vanilla note and creamy texture to this sweet, sumptuous dessert wine. Concentrated and vibrant, resulting in a lovely balance and harmony. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2008.

name: Welschriesling Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland
review: Really zingy. Plenty of spice, orange and caramel notes hold court in this racy white. It's sweet, but the vivid acidity keeps it all lively and interesting. Great finish. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2010.

name: Weissburgunder Eiswein Neusiedlersee-Hügelland
review: Terrific eiswein. Delicious candied citrus peel and honey aromas take on a smoky flavor of grilled nuts in the main roles, while the sweetness and acidity tango in support. Lovely harmony and length in an elegant presentation. Drink now through 2004. 40 cases made.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Steinzeiler
review: Fresh and full-bodied, with an herbal edge to the black cherry and cassis flavors. There's a smoothness initially, then a wall of tannins takes over, leaving a sandalwood and cedar aftertaste. Blaufränkisch, Cabernet Sauvignon and Zweigelt. Drink now through 2007.

name: Qualitätswein Burgenland Eichkogel
review: A taut, muscular red, with a core of red currant and dried raspberry flavors infused with notes of mineral and cast iron. Truffle and spice accents fill the rich finish, graced by dark chocolate hints. Blaufränkisch and Zweigelt. Drink now through 2018. 250 cases made.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Eichkogel
