review: Finely crafted, with a robust aroma of freshly ground coffee and a spicy mix of firm flavors of raspberry, currant and dark plum. Good grip to this as well, with wild spicy notes emerging on the elegant finish. Blaufränkisch and Zweigelt. Drink now through 2010. 1,085 cases made.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Eichkogel
review: A seductive mélange of black cherry, boysenberry, chocolate and vanilla notes penetrate the dense structure in this concentrated, modern-style red. Fresh and lively, it's also tannic, with a coffee aftertaste. Blaufränkisch and Zweigelt. Drink now through 2008. 50 cases imported.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Setz
review: Very creamy, spicy and elegant, with a luscious array of boysenberry, dark plum and raspberry flavors. A complex finish of mocha and chocolate caresses the palate. Blaufränkisch. Drink now through 2014. 200 cases made.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Setz
review: Concentrated dark plum, dark cherry and kirsch flavors fill this full-bodied red. Plenty of luscious spicy element in this as well, along with bittersweet chocolate. The long finish offers plenty of mocha notes. Blaufränkisch. Drink now through 2015. 5 cases imported.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Steinzeiler
review: Very pure, focused and linear, casting its beam of cassis and violet flavors through the firm structure. The oak dominates on the finish today, but there's substance, ending with an element of sweet fruit. Blaufränkisch, Cabernet Sauvignon and Zweigelt. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2012.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Steinzeiler
review: A gorgeous red. Blackberry, cherry and vanilla notes highlight the flavor spectrum, while ripe tannins and lively acidity provide buoyancy. Lingering finish reveals spicy oak nuances and sweet fruit. Blaufränkisch, Cabernet Sauvignon and Zweigelt. Drink now through 2006. 25 cases imported.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Steinzeiler
review: A young blockbuster. Black cherry highlighted by toasty, vanilla-scented new oak introduces this suave, full-bodied red. Dense and supple, with a firm backbone, it should develop well over the next decade. Cabernet Sauvignon and Blaufränkisch. Best from 2003 through 2008.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland White Gloria
review: Ripe and spicy, with concentrated flavors of pear tart, lemon meringue and peach cobbler that are very creamy and lush. The long finish has plenty of honeyed notes. Chardonnay. Drink now through . 5 cases imported.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Neusiedlersee-Hügelland Eichkogel
review: Stunning red. Pure and focused, displaying beautiful integration of raspberry, blackberry, cedar and vanilla with velvety texture and dense structure. Tightly wound, with an aftertaste of fresh berries and chocolate. Drink now through 2003. 580 cases made.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Neusiedlersee-Hügelland Steinzeiler
review: Wonderful purity and freshness mark this cassis- and spice-laden young red. Grace notes of vanilla from new oak round out the flavor profile. Exhibits both elegance and solid structure. Long finish. Drink now through 2003. 1,165 cases made.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Burgenland Leithagebirge
review: An aroma of black pepper leads to focused red currant, dried raspberry and pomegranate flavors in this red, which is filled with lively acidity, finishing with notes of slate and spice. Drink now through 2019. 15 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay-Welschriesling Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee-Hügelland
review: Lean and racy, yet sweetness and concentration are here, too. The vibrant structure provides a great vehicle for the caramel, spice and cooked apple flavors, all well integrated and ending with a complex aftertaste. Drink now through 2003. 63 cases made.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Eichkogel
review: A powerful red, with plenty of fresh acidity behind the currant, dark plum and dried raspberry flavors. Savory herb notes linger with dark chocolate on the finish. Drink now through 2015. 500 cases made.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Steinzeiler
review: Rich, ripe and peppery, with a deep well of blackberry and dark plum flavors that are flanked by plenty of Asian spice notes. Chocolate and mocha on the finish. Blaufränkisch, Cabernet Sauvignon and Zweigelt. Drink now through 2014. 5 cases imported.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Steinzeiler
review: Plush, rich and ripe red that oozes delicious blackberry, dark plum, dark cherry and cream flavors. There's a nice finesse to this as well, with delicate spicy notes extending with silky tannins onto the broad finish. Blaufränkisch, Cabernet Sauvignon and Zweigelt. Drink now through 2010. 1,085 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland
review: A straightforward, medium-weight dessert wine with caramel and apricot notes, picking up some smoke on the finish. It's thickly textured, yet balanced by the acidity. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2006.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Burgenland Föllikberg
review: Big and rich, with white pepper notes to the chewy red plum and dark cherry flavors. Effusively spicy on the fresh finish, with notes of dark chocolate and cardamom. Drink now through 2016. 50 cases imported.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Burgenland Leithagebirge
review: Well-spiced, with firm flavors of dark plum and dried cherry, as well as plenty of black currant. Portabello mushroom and spice notes mark the tannic finish. Drink now through 2015. 30 cases imported.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Vom Leithagebirge
review: Dense and meaty-tasting, featuring dark plum flavors that have plenty of herbal tinges. The powerful finish features graphite and mineral notes. Drink now through 2013. 10 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Leithakalk
review: A buttery and fruity white, with ripe apple and pear flavors that are well-spiced. Cream notes on the well-structured finish.  Drink now. 25 cases imported.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Eichkogel
review: Plum and spice notes mingle in this ripe, expansive red. A little loose around the edges, then the tannins kick in on the finish. Blaufränkisch and Zweigelt. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2008.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Eichkogel
review: A lightweight red, elegant and classy, with blackberry and cassis flavors on a firm structure. It has tannins on the finish, too, with a lingering aftertaste of smoke and cherry. Blaufränkisch and Zweigelt. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2004.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Leithakalk
review: Juicy and filled with fresh-crushed red fruit flavors, including plum and raspberry, supported by crisp acidity. Minerally and peppery notes on the zesty finish.  Drink now. 20 cases imported.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Eichkogel
review: Load of fresh crushed berry and plum flavors are matched to violet accents in this fresh, juicy red. Peppery finish. Blaufränkisch and Zweigelt. Drink now. 12 cases imported.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Eichkogel
review: An open, cherry-, earth- and cedar-flavored red, medium-bodied and concentrated, with tannins that emerge on the finish. Spicy oak aftertaste. Blaufränkisch and Zweigelt. Drink now through 2005.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland White Gloria
review: Fresh and buttery-tasting, with apple streudel, apricot tart and ripe pear flavors. The long, spicy finish features vanilla notes. Chardonnay. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland White Steinmühle
review: A zesty white, with plenty of citrus and green apple flavors and crunchy mineral notes on the finish. Sauvignon Blanc. Drink now. 20 cases imported.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Neusiedlersee-Hügelland Eichkogel
review: Intense and smoky, offering coffee, black cherry, leather and spice flavors of moderate richness on a lean, tannic profile. The tannins lack full ripeness, yet it's a fine effort in the tricky '98 vintage. Drink now through 2004. 100 cases imported.

name: Welschriesling Beerenauslese Burgenland
review: Pungent, with horehound candy notes changing to caramel. Rich, sweet and a little cloying on the finish, which picks up a bitter element. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Burgenland Föllikberg
review: A sinewy red, with mature flavors of dried berry, lavender and white pepper. Shows some tannic snap on the savory finish. Drink now. 25 cases imported.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Burgenland Föllikberg
review: Firm, with crisp acidity behind the plum, licorice and dark cherry flavors. The tannic finish features tobacco notes. Best from 2012 through 2015. 50 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland
review: Firm, with plenty of tannins to the dried berry and roasted plum flavors. Notes of hot stone and green herb linger on the finish.  Drink now. 5 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland
review: A ripe and smoky red, with concentrated flavors of dark plum and blackberry, and some herbal notes. Baker's chocolate on the finish. Drink now. 5 cases imported.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Eichkogel
review: Red berry, including boysenberry and blueberry, flavors dominate this medium-bodied red. Supple and spicy on the finish, with hints of chocolate. Blaufränkisch and Zweigelt. Drink now. 15 cases imported.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland White Gloria
review: Rich aromas and flavors of butter, ripe pear and apple are well-defined, with glazed citrus and smoke on the finish. Chardonnay. Drink now. 15 cases imported.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Neusiedlersee-Hügelland Steinzeiler
review: Rich and supple, evoking coffee, vanilla and plum notes through the midpalate, then the rough-edged tannins take over. A hint of astringency, which time may tame. Drink now through 2003. 50 cases imported.

name: Qualitätswein Burgenland White Steinmühle
review: Crisp and lean, with stone notes to the fresh-cut apple, white cherry and savory herbal flavors. Dried mango on the finish. Drink now. 25 cases imported.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Föllikberg
review: A peppery red, with crisp flavors of red plum, currant and raspberry. Notes of graphite linger on the finish.  Drink now. 25 cases imported.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Föllikberg
review: A medium- to full-bodied red, with damson plum and dried raspberry flavors that are accented with notes of earth and spice. Crisp finish. Drink now. 45 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland
review: Aromas and flavors of dark chocolate, dark plum and spice, with some meaty elements on the finish. Drink now. 583 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Qualitätswein Burgenland Leithagebirge
review: Soft, with a buttery overlay to the ripe apple and baked peach flavors. Short finish. 30 cases imported.

name: Qualitätswein Burgenland White Steinmühle
review: A medium- to full-bodied white, with lemon curd and peach cobbler flavors. Vanilla and spice fill the finish.  Sauvignon Blanc. Drink now. 20 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Vom Leithagebirge
review: A ripe style, with baked apple and pear flavors. Spicy finish. Drink now. 20 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Qualitätswein Trocken Neusiedlersee-Hügelland Tatschler
review: An international style, offering nutmeg and vanilla from new oak but not much fruit. Broad, the structure comes from the oak as much as the acidity. Drink now through 2000. 580 cases made.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Steinzeiler
review: Lots of green herbal notes to the red cherry and dried berry flavors. Tart finish. Blaufränkisch, Cabernet Sauvignon and Zweigelt. Drink now. 5 cases imported.

name: Shiraz-Cabernet McLaren Vale The Carbine
review: Smooth and polished, a supple, velvety package that presents its toasted coconut-scented black cherry and plum flavors like jewels. Finishes long and seductive. Drink now through 2012. 1,800 cases made.

name: Shiraz-Cabernet McLaren Vale The Carbine
review: Lean and nicely focused to show off its well-demarcated blackberry and black pepper flavors, picking up rosemary, tarragon and sweet spices as the solid finish lingers. Best from 2008 through 2013. 900 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale
review: Gamy, meaty flavors predominate in this full-figured red, offering cherry and spice as the finish lingers. Drink now through 2009. 1,800 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Dogday
review: Ripe, generous and harmonious, with shadings of leather and spice to the cherry flavors, persisting well. Drink now. 600 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale
review: Chewy in texture, with well-defined cherry and game flavors. Obtrusive acidity makes it finish sharp but generous. Best after 2005. 1,500 cases made.

name: Shiraz-Cabernet McLaren Vale The Carbine
review: Firm, chewy and dense with licorice-scented blackberry flavors, finishing with enough crisp tannins to warrant cellaring. Best after 2008. 300 cases made.

name: The Carbine McLaren Vale
review: Earthy, dusky undertones add a little something extra to the anise-scented cherry flavors. Shiraz and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: The Carbine McLaren Vale
review: Firm, flavorful and round, with muted blackberry and black pepper aromas and flavors, which echo gently. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Shiraz. Drink now through 2003. 100 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon McLaren Vale Niseda
review: Marked by bayleaf and beef notes, it struggles to find riper fruit flavors. Turns tannic and dry. Drink now through 2004. 56 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay McLaren Vale Bottin Vineyards
review: Peppery, floral aromas and flavors make this distinctive if a little strange--the fruit doesn't come through as fresh. Won't appeal to everyone. 56 cases imported.

name: Red Blend Columbia Valley
review: A zesty blend, vibrant and juicy, with appealing cherry and spicy cinnamon flavors. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah. Drink now through 2021. 4,392 cases made.

name: Malbec Mendoza
review: Medium-weight mix of briar, raspberry and black cherry. Lacks a little drive on the finish, but still good. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: A fantastic, opulent mouthful of Chardonnay, with complex, concentrated layers of fig, cream, butterscotch and marshmallow, the flavors go on seemingly forever--at least until the next sip. Chardonnay in this style doesn't get much better, and for all its richness and depth, this wine has amazing finesse. Drink now through 2009. 1,200 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Delicious California Chardonnay. Packs in lots ofrich, supple, complex flavors, with a range ofripe fig, pear, apricot, melon and citrus, as wellas a lively seam of acidity that keeps the flavorsbright and lively. Subtle toasty oak addsdimension. Drink now through 2005. 900 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley The Judge
review: In this style, there's nothing better in California. Serves up a medley of rich, exotic pineapple and tropical fruit flavors that are as broad as they are deep. Most impressive on the finish, where the flavors coat the palate and linger, with fig and apricot details adding to the pleasure. Buttery oak folds in nicely. Drink now through 2020. 372 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley The Judge
review: This makes a profound statement about Chardonnay style. Openly rich and smoky, yet graceful and polished, with roasted fig, honeysuckle, baked apple, marshmallow and cinnamon-tinged spices, gaining depth and length. Drink now through 2019. 340 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: A gorgeous young Cabernet that is rich, plush, layered and persistent, with a mix of blackberry, currant, licorice, red candy and light cedary oak. The expressive finish sails on, revealing greater depth and persistence, complemented by firm, gripping tannins. Drink now through 2030. 180 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: A tour de force that stretches the range of flavors, rich and laden with roasted, smoky marshmallow, showing tiers of marmalade, tangerine, roasted fig and fig tapenade, sailing along seamlessly through the finish. Drink now through 2019. 1,050 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: A remarkably bold, rich yet elegant and refined style, with tiers of complex pear, hazelnut, honeysuckle, spice and orange/citrus peel scents. Intense and concentrated, it further folds in complex mineral, sage and a touch of marmalade. Finishes in a long, persistent aftertaste. Drink now through 2008. 900 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Displays wonderful complexity and richness of flavors, with ripe, smooth fig, anise and pear woven together, finishing long and lively. Drink now through 2004. 600 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley The Judge
review: Some would say there's enough new toasty oak here for two vintages, but if you enjoy the enhancement oak adds to Chardonnay this means double the pleasure. Rich apricot, fig, honeydew and citrus notes join in the chorus. Long and full. Drink now through 2021. 300 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley The Judge
review: Ultrarich, this shows what oak can add to a wine, brimming with hints of butterscotch, ripe pear, fig, tangerine and nectarine. Drink now through 2021. 350 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley The Judge
review: Shows complex aromatics of ripe pear and apple, with subtle hazelnut and anise notes that are intense yet elegant and detailed, finishing with pure, ripe green-skinned fruits and honeydew melon. Drink now through 2020. 400 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: A dazzling effort that combines intensity with purity of flavor, depth, focus and persistence, offering a core of juicy apple, honeydew, citrus and meringue flavors, with vibrant tannins. Shows a hint of toasty oak on the finish, where this gains a measure of elegance and finesse. Drink now through 2021. 1,600 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: A hugely successful 2011, beautifully crafted and sleek, with a creamy and smoky oak edge that's subtle amid the rich, polished fig, pear, citrus rind, beeswax, butterscotch and honey notes. This glides along on a long, silky finish. Drink now through 2020. 980 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley The Judge
review: Offers a strikingly rich yet subtle mix of Chardonnay scents, with glazed crème brûlée, roasted marshmallow and campfire notes to the rich core of lemon-citrus rind and honeydew melon flavors. Drink now through 2020. 215 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Lively, aromatic toasty oak is evident throughout, giving the vibrant pear, citrus, green apple and honeydew flavors a nice accent. Picks up body and depth, delivering a wonderful encore for the finish. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Pure and focused, with complex hazelnut, green apple, floral and citrus notes that are young and vibrant. Cleansing, mouthwatering finish. Drink now through 2019. 1,100 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Not only is this wine quite rich and concentrated, it offers lots of subtle flavor nuances, with ripe pear, fig, apricot, nectarine and hints of hazelnut and nutmeg. Drink now through 2006. 950 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: A smooth style, with espresso, dried currant, cedary oak, anise and loamy earth, ending with a long, tannic finish that offers notes of dried herb, sage and black tea. Best from 2014 through 2024. 280 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Exhibits a dense, rich, explosive core of dried dark berry, loamy earth, tobacco leaf, mocha, herb, black licorice and espresso notes, ending with chewy, mouthcoating tannins. The flavors push through. Best from 2015 through 2030. 400 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Pleasantly smooth, rich and creamy, delivering juicy green apple, pear and citrus notes framed by smoky, toasty oak. Full-bodied, unfolding with complex flavors on the finish. Drink now through 2017. 1,200 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley The Judge
review: A delicate, understated style, with notes of green apple, pear, spice and light cedary oak leading to a full body. Flavors slowly build on the finish, where this white's minerally attributes shine. Drink now through 2017. 400 cases made.

name: The Fimasaurus Napa Valley
review: Built to cellar, this is young, dense and tight, with a trim yet rich mix of savory Cabernet flavors of gravel, graphite, licorice and dried herb. Ends with dusty, loamy tannins and a hint of mocha. Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Best from 2018 through 2030. 90 cases made.

name: The Fimasaurus Napa Valley
review: Aromas of ripe dark berry, black licorice, mocha, charcoal and smoky oak give this a rich mouthfeel. The fruit is sweet and showy, ending with pleasantly chewy tannins and great length. Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Drink now through 2028. 75 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Unfolds slowly, with toasty, spicy oak gaining depth and dimension. Once the wood integrates, this should gain with age. Drink now through 2020. 1,990 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Deliciously ripe, rich and intense, deeply concentrated, with layers of ripe fig, apricot, pear, hazelnut and citrus. Long, complex aftertaste. This is a notably young, vibrant wine that will benefit from short-term cellaring. Drink now through 2008. 1,400 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Fresh and lively, rich and spicy, with a distinct olive oil-like edge. Shows lemon, pepper, fig, green apple and a hint of marshmallow, ending with a long, complex finish. Not on par with the 2003--quite a bit sleeker. Drink now through 2011. 2,000 cases made.

name: Albariño Napa Valley
review: Medium-weight and elegant, with spicy, low-key lemon notes. Clean and refreshing in an easy-to-drink style. Drink now. 100 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Smooth-textured, with herb, dried currant, vanilla bean and earthy mineral flavors that lend a drying edge to the flavors. Decant for now. Best from 2009 through 2014. 400 cases made.

name: VioRous Napa Valley
review: Ultrarich and flamboyant, with a mix of exotic flavors, offering ripe, full-bodied apricot, fig and honeydew melon notes. A fun quaff. Viognier and Roussanne. Drink now. 75 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: A touch coarse and simple, with a lean band of citrus- lemon- and pear-laced flavors, turning tight on a rather brisk finish. Not the stellar success it's been in the past. Drink now through 2005. 750 cases made.

name: Syrah Napa Valley
review: Dry and leathery, with coffee, beef and dried blackberry fruit swarmed by gritty tannins. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Barrel Select
review: Bright and lively, with a strong cedary component to the generous cherry and plum flavors, persisting impressively on the long finish. Drink now through 2010. 180 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: This refreshing white offers a clear, focused mix of passion fruit, lime, mango and green apple flavors on a light, smooth body. Finishes with a succulent juiciness, showing echoes of lemon verbena. Drink now. 80,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: A light and silky white, with refreshing pineapple, peach and green apple flavors in tremendous focus, lingering elegantly. Drink now. 5,000 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Light and lively, with refreshing acidity that keeps the papaya, lime and pineapple flavors fresh and vibrant. Drink now. 175,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Lemon curd, fresh ginger and ripe apricot flavors are in harmony, with refreshing acidity and a light but smooth body. Drink now. 96,300 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: As close as it gets to biting into a perfectly juicy Granny Smith apple, with a wonderful purity and mouthwatering acidity. This is also extremely smooth, with lime peel and grapefruit flavors that linger on the finish. Drink now. 56,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Succulent peach and nectarine flavors have a squirt of fresh lime juice, smooth and refreshing, with highlights of white flowers echoing in the background. Drink now. 70,200 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Tangy and bright, with juicy flavors of fresh lime juice, ruby grapefruit, pineapple and lemon, set on a light, smooth body. Drink now. 100,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough
review: Supple, with toffee-scented toasty oak framing tangy wild strawberry, black plum and fresh herb tones. Drink now 4,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Aromatic, with a punch of fresh herb, grass and sweet pea notes that add complexity to the smooth but crisp lemon-lime and green apple flavors at the core. Drink now. 115,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Lively, with sweet pea, grass, lime and grapefruit flavors accented by mineral and a hint of sweetness on the finish. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Serves up tart lemon-lime, grass and sweet pea flavors. Green apple and floral tones shape the crisp finish. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Light and floral, with pretty pear fruit on a lean frame. Drink now. 15,000 cases made.

name: Malbec Mendoza
review: Solid, with a straightforward core of dark berry fruit and toast, which lingers on the medium-weight finish. Drink now. 2,660 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Central Valley
review: Soft and forward, with tasty fig, pear and butter flavors followed by a round finish. Good, but doesn't taste unwooded. Drink now. 4,074 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Central Valley
review: Fresh, with lemon zest and grapefruit hints. Soft, open-knit finish. Drink now. 4,579 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Central Valley
review: Open-knit, with light-bodied cherry and currant notes, backed by a slightly high-toned finish. Drink now. 5,928 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Lake County
review: Firm and concentrated, with cherry and blackberry flavors. Drinkable now, but very impressive depth and power, which should develop with age. 6,940 cases made.

name: Chardonnay California Mount Konocti Reserve
review: Complex and intense with concentrated pear, spice, vanilla and butterscotch flavors. Finishes with flavors that fan out and stay with you. Drink now. 330 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Lake County
review: A delightful, young, harmonious wine, brimming with fresh, ripe pear, spice and melon flavors that stay with you on the finish, where subtle oak shadings and perfumed nuances emerge. A wonderful value. Drinkable now. 4,998 cases made.

name: Fumé Blanc Lake County
review: Crisp and floral, with generous grapefruit, melon and sweet pea aromas and flavors broadening on the finish. A lovely wine. Drink now. 11,358 cases made.

name: Grand Fumé Reserve Clear Lake
review: Bright and spicy, marked by sweet oak in both the aroma and flavor, smooth, polished and round, echoing pear and vanilla on the solid finish. Drink now. 374 cases made.

name: Merlot Lake County Mount Konocti Kelsey
review: Rich and fruity, with a pretty band of currant, herb and oak flavors that fold together nicely. Finishes with firm tannins and spicy oak notes. Best from 1996 to 1997. 5,800 cases made.

name: Merlot Lake County
review: Offers attractive dark cherry and blackberry flavors and a hint of plum. A lean, crisp wine that's not too tannic. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Lake County
review: An attractive Cabernet with tart cherry, herbal and oaky flavors that are well balanced. The tannins on the finish are smooth and round. An early drinker.

name: Fumé Blanc Kelsey Lake County
review: A crisp, juicy, grapefruity Sauvignon Blanc, with bright fruit flavors and good balance. Enjoy now, well chilled. 14,000 cases made.

name: Fumé Blanc Lake County
review: Light and lively, with appealing grapefruit, apple and herb aromas and flavors. Definitely a fruit-oriented wine. Sauvignon Blanc, Sémillon and White Riesling. Drink now. 10,500 cases made.

name: Meritage Red Clear Lake
review: Smooth and generous, with hints of dill and celery around a core of sweet cherry, currant, cedar and tobacco flavors. Snappy tannins. Drink now through 1998. 2,768 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Lake County
review: Grapey and supple, with plum and raspberry notes, this easy-drinking style speaks well but not loudly for Cabernet Franc. Balanced and not too tannic or rich. Drink now. 1,610 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Lake County
review: A well-balanced and firmly structured wine. Luxuriously fruity flavors grow stronger on the finish. Apple, peach and pear flavors are woven into a rich, full-bodied wine. 3,208 cases made.

name: Merlot Lake County
review: More tannic than the gentle currant and berry aromas would suggest, but the flavors manage to peek through the tough texture on the finish. It's a gamble, but worth waiting until 1994 to '96. 2,086 cases made.

name: Merlot Lake County
review: Supple, elegant Merlot with spicy cherry, herb and plummy fruit and just en ough tannin to carry it a year or two. Tastes great to drink now.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Lake County Grand Fumé Barrel Fermented
review: Crisp and simple, with light citrus, onion skin, pear and spice flavors that fade on the finish. Drinkable now. 480 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Lake County
review: Light and simple, with a bit of an herb and beet edge to the currant flavors, finishing with a touch of tar. Drink now. 6,249 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Lake County
review: Crisp in texture, with tightly reined-in raspberry and cola flavors, tannic and almost austere on the finish. Needs to soften. Drink now through 1997. 5,832 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Lake County
review: Elegant and stylish. Has pretty plum and currant flavors, with a touch of bell pepper and herb flavors that add dimension. Not too tannic. Drink now. 6,711 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Lake County
review: Clean and simple. Nicely balanced with crisp grapey and appley fruit. A modest, sound wine with spicy overtones.

name: Red Table Wine Lake County
review: Light and lean, with a hint of beet aroma against flavors of strawberry and spice. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Mount K Select Reserve Clear Lake
review: Tries to balance the separate elements of fruit and oak, but with limited success. The buttery, spicy flavors don't quite mesh with the herbal, citrus component. 715 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Lake County
review: A smooth, supple, even-handed Cabernet that lacks vitality and the generous fruit you'd expect from an '84. It's drinkable and pleasant, but lacks pizzazz.

name: Chardonnay California Mount Konocti Kelsey
review: Simple and fruity, with an anise edge to the basic apple flavors. 6,000 cases made.

name: Meritage White Clear Lake
review: A frankly grassy, herbal wine that turns soft and simple on the finish. Decent quality. Sauvignon Blanc and Sémillon. 1,050 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Lake County
review: Light and simple, with thin lemon and herb notes and a short finish. Drinkable, but very short on flavor. 6,142 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Lake County
review: Tart and appley, fresh and lively on the palate but not particularly concentrated, perhaps a bit metallic on the finish. A crisp, modest wine. 5,980 cases made.

name: Merlot Lake County
review: Lean and citrusy, with vaguely defined olive and toast aromas and flavors and not much intensity to stand up to the tough tannins. 2,558 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Bright and jazzy, offering a refreshing sweep of pineapple and lime to the green apple flavors, which linger easily on the zesty finish. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: There's a succulent, savory note of saline to the core of melon and Key lime flavors, lending this the air of a margarita on the juicy finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Mendocino County
review: Ripe and buttery, with bold, spicy pineapple, fig and pear notes that stay with you. Has the depth and concentration to cellar short-term. Drinkable now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Mendocino County
review: Chewy, concentrated and distinctive, offering blackberry, plum and black pepper aromas and flavors. A grand-scale wine, with spicy dill notes making it more complex on the finish. Drink with cheese; best through 1996. 1,071 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Appealing pear, orange sherbet and lemon details mingle with melon and yellow apple flavors. Fresh and juicy. Drink now. 8,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Crisp and tangy, with peach and lemon zest notes, showing good intensity to the green apple and Key lime flavors. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Mélange à Trois Mendocino County
review: Tight and firm, but with a pretty core of rich currant, cherry and anise flavors that offer fine depth and concentration. The flavors linger on the finish, where it turns a touch tannic. Drink now. 2,320 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough
review: Lively, with an orange peel accent to the lingering raspberry and thyme flavors. Drink now. 7,500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Pear, papaya and lemon drop flavors feature good acidity and a grassy green note, with a slightly coarse texture. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Mélange à Trois Mendocino
review: Crisp in texture, jammy and intense in flavor, showing currant and berry and nice hints of vanilla and toast on the finish.

name: Pinot Noir Central Otago
review: Spice, green tea and cherry flavors are firm and concentrated, with gripping, herb-edged tannins clamping down in the cedary finish. Drink now through 2010. 750 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Fragrant quince, lemon and yellow apple flavors have very good intensity, with grass and grapefruit peel lingering on the tart finish. Drink now. 900 cases made.

name: Barbera Amador County
review: Light and airy in texture, with nicely focused plum and blackberry fruit that keeps coming on the finish. 400 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Mendocino County
review: A serious style from a new producer. Barrel fermented and aged on the lees, but the flinty pear, peach and nectarine flavors are very tight and austere. A balanced wine; drinkable now. 600 cases made.

name: Mélange à Trois Mendocino
review: Pleasant enough with wild berry and cherry-laced fruit, finishing with firm tannins, a touch of heat and a leathery edge. Can stand cellaring into 1997 to soften. 900 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: The grapefruit and lemon flavors have a spicy edge and a touch of pith, offering a pleasantly bitter finish to the crisp juiciness. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Mendocino County
review: Ripe, intense and perfumed, with pear, hazelnut, citrus and spice flavors that are well integrated and tasty. Drinkable now. 1,670 cases made.

name: Petite Sirah Mendocino
review: Bright in flavor, chunky in texture, slipping some nice blackberry and spice flavors through the tannins. Best from 1997 to 1998.

name: Zinfandel Mendocino County
review: Packed with ripe berry flavors and accented by cinnamon notes, this is well balanced to begin drinking in about 1994. The tight tannins on the finish need time to settle down. 1,008 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Mendocino
review: A sturdy white with spicy, slightly resiny apple flavors; starting to show some maturity. 880 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough
review: Wild berry, stone and fresh thyme and sage flavors have good depth, turning a bit tart and austere in the gripping tannins of the finish. Drink now. 700 cases made.

name: Charbono Mendocino
review: Earthy, barnyardy flavors weave their way through this chewy, supple wine. A touch of cherry fruit echoes on the finish. Maybe best from 1997-1998. 500 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Mendocino
review: Crisp and austere, with more drying tannins than fruit showing through. 900 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Mendocino
review: Lacks focus, the earthy, tarry Zinfandel flavors ending on a leathery note. 888 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Mendocino
review: Simple with modest toast and apple flavors. 1,100 cases made.

name: Petite Sirah Port Mendocino Admiral's Quinta
review: An awkward, Port-style wine that's coarse and sweet, with decadent floral aromas and flavors. Extremely tannic, showing smoky notes but not much fruit. Has concentration and body, but just doesn't come together.

name: Riesling Marlborough Sigrun Noble
review: Rich, plush and deep. Golden, sweet and beautifully balanced, with enough acidity to make the honey, orange peel, apricot and caramel flavors feel elegant and refined as they last nicely on the long finish. Drink now through 2012. 250 cases made.

name: Riesling Marlborough Sigrun Noble
review: Dark and rich, but not weighty, with silky texture and just enough acidity to keep it from going flabby. Pineapple, orange marmalade, honey and clove flavors mingle nicely as the finish persists. Drink now through 2008. 250 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Bright, lively and appealing for a lovely creamy edge to its juicy nectarine, lime and mineral aromas and flavors, lingering gently on the long finish. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Bright and tangy, with lime and green apple flavors that persist nicely on the lively finish. Drink now. 8,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough
review: Fragrant, with raspberry, strawberry jam and sandalwood character. Fresh herbs, crushed stone and cedar linger on the tart finish. Drink now through 2009. 600 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Tangy style has green pepper notes weaving through the tart apple and citrus flavors. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Not quite as tart as some Sauvignon Blancs, with pretty melon, pear and citrus flavors, echoing nicely on the polished finish. Drink now. 8,000 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough
review: Has some ripe berry and cherry fruit, but it's aggressively tart, finishing with a leathery character. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Mount Fishtail
review: Lean, with grass and tart quince flavors. Drink now. 4,500 cases imported.

name: Riesling Marlborough Sigru Noble
review: Sweet and lively at the same time, its juicy mouthful of honeyed pear and lime flavors segues into gorgeous orange peel and marmalade flavors that resonate on the finish. Drink now through 2005. 100 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Bright and zingy, a lively mouthful of citrus, pineapple and passion fruit aromas and flavors, which echo nicely on the focused finish. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Bright and fruity, with nectarine and guava aromas and flavors that pick up zippy notes of green herb and anise on the focused finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Marlborough Sigru Noble
review: Sweet and tasty, with more honey than fruit in the flavor spectrum, finishing with spicy, cedary notes more reminiscent of Sauternes than the Rhine. Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Greece Anny's Animus
review: Quite ripe, with sweet cherry and spice flavors. Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Trifilia Ftelia
review: Herbal aromas and flavors turn to bell pepper on the finish. Drink now. 850 cases made.

name: Viognier North Fork of Long Island
review: A fresh style, with light green melon and pear fruit notes lined with a subtle anise hint. A floral edge holds the finish. Drink now. 243 cases made.

name: Merlot North Fork of Long Island
review: Direct, with a solid core of black cherry, plum and tobacco leaf notes framed by a slightly firm roasted vanilla-bean edge that hangs through the finish. Drink now. 146 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon North Fork of Long Island
review: This has a direct core of black cherry and plum flavors, with a singed tobacco leaf note draped on the finish. Drink now. 177 cases made.

name: Chardonnay North Fork of Long Island Orient
review: Direct, with dried pineapple and peach notes backed by a hint of ginger on the finish. Drink now. 410 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc North Fork of Long Island
review: A mix of black cherry, green pepper and tobacco notes are backed by cedary tannins holding the finish. Drink now. 506 cases made.

name: Alatus Blend Walla Walla Valley
review: Lithe, expressive and appealing, with deftly balanced, licorice-accented blackberry and spice flavors, lingering effortlessly against polished tannins. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Malbec and Syrah. Drink now through 2020. 205 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Les Collines Vineyard
review: A polished, soft-textured and appealing red, with well-mannered plum and pomegranate flavors, picking up toast and broken twig nuances as the finish lingers against fine tannins. Best from 2015 through 2019. 140 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Walla Walla Valley
review: Swarms of prickly tannins surround the focused licorice-accented currant and spice flavors, picking up a roasted red pepper note as the finish persists. Best from 2018 through 2022. 210 cases made.

name: Merlot Walla Walla Valley
review: Fresh and sleek, with pretty currant character at the core. Delicate hints of spicy oak and polished tannins complete the picture. Has finesse. Drink now through 2017. 145 cases made.

name: Merlot Walla Walla Valley
review: Vivid, generous and focused, with plum and blackberry fruit riding on refined acidity and persisting against gritty tannins. Best from 2014 through 2017. 220 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Les Collines Vineyard
review: Taut, focused and lively, with tangy blackberry, cherry and floral flavors, picking up cucumber and pear skin notes as the finish lingers. Drink now through 2019. 240 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley
review: Crisp, with a moderate grip of tannins around the flavors of coffee, tobacco and blackberry. Needs cellaring to soften. Best after 2014. 100 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Les Collines Vineyard
review: Firm in texture, with a savory bent to the cherry and tobacco flavors, finishing on a smoky note. Drink now through 2018. 240 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Walla Walla Valley
review: Firm in texture, with a peppery edge adding interest to the chunky green olive and blackberry flavors. Has intensity and a narrow finish. Best after 2015. 210 cases made.

name: Merlot Walla Walla Valley
review: Firm, showing crunchy tannins around a core of fennel-inflected black fruit flavors, finishing with density. Best after 2018. 205 cases made.

name: Alatus Blend Walla Walla Valley
review: Dark and spicy, with sassafras and balsamic notes more prominent than fruit flavors, finishing peppery. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Malbec and Syrah. Drink now. 220 cases made.

name: Vidal Niagara Peninsula Ice Wine
review: Intense aromas and flavors of beeswax, orange marmalade, vanilla and apricot. Concentrated, yet lithe and supple, with bright acidity and great harmony. Lovely finish and long marmalade aftertaste. Drink now through 2020. 3,200 cases made.

name: Riesling Niagara Peninsula Icewine
review: The ripe apricot flavor is pure and lightly tinged by orange peel and baking spice elements in this juicy, vibrant dessert white. Lively acidity contributes to a long, lingering finish. Drink now through 2020. 800 cases made.

name: Vidal Niagara Peninsula Icewine
review: Thick-textured and sweet, yet also fresh and lively, thanks to the vibrant structure. Apricot, honey and orange peel notes pick up a mineral edge on the finish. Very clean and harmonious. Drink now through 2022. 1,244 cases made.

name: Riesling Niagara Peninsula Ice Wine
review: A pungent aroma of apple turns to cinnamon, hard candy and apple compote flavors. Clean and racy, with a succulent texture, finesse and harmony. Nice length. Drink now through 2020. 1,300 cases made.

name: Vidal Blanc Niagara Peninsula Ice Wine
review: Thick, rich and vibrant, this has all the elements of ice wine, with apricot, honey, almond and candied orange peel flavors that persist through the finish. Showing great intensity, this needs time for the sweetness and structure to integrate. Drink now through 2003.

name: Vidal Niagara Peninsula Icewine
review: Pungent, showing aromas and flavors of truffle, decaying apple, honey and rhubarb. This is compelling for its luscious texture and racy acidity, leaving a fresh and harmonious impression. Drink now through 2020. 4,900 cases made.

name: Vidal Niagara Peninsula Ice Wine
review: Very tasty, exhibiting candied berry, dried apricot and mandarin orange notes framed by a lively structure. Developing nicely, it appears to have plenty in reserve. Drink now through 2012. 4,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Niagara Peninsula Ice Wine
review: Black currant pastille, cherry and spice aromas and flavors are intriguing. Has varietal character, a juicy midpalate, concentration and length. Very tasty overall. Drink now through 2015. 400 cases made.

name: Riesling Niagara Peninsula Ice Wine
review: Very pure aromas and flavors on an elegant frame, showing peach, honey and citrus notes backed by a vivid structure. Packs in a lot of flavor. Drink now through 2006. 500 cases made.

name: Riesling Niagara Peninsula Ice Wine
review: This has the ice wine intensity and tension between sweetness and acidity that sets the stage for the coconut, apricot and orange nuances. Lovely gracefulness and length. Only imported into Hawaii. Drink now through 2003.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Niagara Peninsula Icewine
review: Pale red in color, this intensely sweet style offers dried cherry, currant and apricot flavors. Thick and concentrated, this stays bright with fresh acidity. Drink now through 2016. 800 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Niagara Peninsula Icewine Winemaster's Collection
review: Intensely sweet, exhibiting cherry, black currant and spice flavors with a hint of astringence on the finish. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2010. 88 cases made.

name: Riesling Niagara Peninsula Ice Wine
review: Very fresh, with a sweet-tart component to its orange marmalade, honey and apricot flavors. Elegant and lively, with a mouthwatering finish. Drink now through 2012. 300 cases made.

name: Vidal Blanc Niagara Peninsula Ice Wine
review: A blast of fresh fruit-cocktail, this displays apricot, peach and mandarin orange notes on a opulent texture and moderately firm structure. Good length. Drink now through 2004. 2,500 cases made.

name: Vidal Ontario Late Harvest Special Select
review: Perfumed and fruity, this dessert white exudes flowers, fresh peach and honey notes. It melts in the mouth and is well-balanced, if not that complex. Lovely clean finish. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Pinot Blanc Niagara Peninsula Weissburgunder
review: A fresh, fruity style, offering peach, apple and light earth notes. Balanced, with a lingering finish and fine varietal character. Drink now. 4,600 cases made.

name: Pinot Blanc Niagara Peninsula
review: Apple, grapefruit and earth flavors match the rich texture in this white, which remains bright and fresh on the moderately long finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Niagara Peninsula Off Dry
review: Fresh and crisp, showing peach and white pepper notes, with a hint of earth. Nice length. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Niagara Peninsula Medium Dry Reserve
review: A rich white, displaying rose, lychee and grapefruit flavors. Bright, lingering moderately on the finish. Slightly candied fruit. Drink now. 1,400 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Niagara Peninsula Late Harvest
review: Petrol, lychee and grapefruit aromas and flavors course through the lightly oily texture. This turns a little coarse on the finish. Off-dry. Drink now. 2,400 cases made.

name: Pinot Blanc Niagara Peninsula Off Dry
review: Juicy acidity frames flavors of star fruit, pear and a hint of lemon peel in this easy-drinking white, followed by a modest finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel California Old Vine
review: Offers appealing cherry and sassafras notes and modest, tart fruit, with a hint of tannin. Drink now through 2014. 2,500 cases made.

name: Shiraz South Eastern Australia
review: On the lighter side, with pleasantly earthy plum and vanilla flavors that carry through the crisp finish. Drinkable now. 10,800 cases made.

name: Chardonnay South Eastern Australia
review: Sharp-edged and a little coarse, but the bright pineapple and pear flavors come through on the finish. 8,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon South Eastern Australia
review: Earthy and somewhat musty notes cut through the modest plum flavor. Finishes herbal. 8,500 cases made.

name: Riesling Clare Valley
review: Bright and jazzy, offering a lively mouthful of star fruit, grapefruit, floral and mineral character, remaining seamless through the long, vivid finish. Drink now through 2018. 160 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Clare Valley
review: Refined style has velvety tannins and a medium-weight frame around nicely modulated plum, spice and mineral flavors, lingering on the focused finish. Drink now through 2014. 168 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Clare Valley
review: Smooth in texture, with zingy acidity supporting bright flavors, playing out its raspberry, blackberry and plum notes generously as everything lingers on the finish. Drink now through 2005. 800 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Clare Valley
review: Has a wonderful sense of refinement to the smoky, minty cherry and pepper flavors, finishing with velvety tannins. Best from 2006 through 2010. 450 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Clare Valley
review: Bright, lively red, with mineral and cedar overtones to the black cherry flavors, echoing on the smoky finish, narrowing a bit. Drink now through 2006. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Clare Valley
review: Firm in texture, with lots of olive and herb around a modest core of chunky currant flavors, finishing with a touch of earth. Best after 2007. 500 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Clare Valley
review: Rich in texture, with a strong gamy, bay leaf character that distorts what fruit may be present.   500 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch One World
review: Plump, with soft apple and green almond notes and a round, loose-knit finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Pinotage Stellenbosch One World
review: Rather rustic, with stemmy, briary notes that carry a gamy streak through the modest plum fruit. Slightly stewed on the finish. 5,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Mornington Peninsula Farrago
review: Smooth in texture, with a zing of lime and the attendant acidity to balance the toast and caramel flavors, showing fig and spice as the finish lingers. Drink now through 2010. 300 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Mornington Peninsula Faultline
review: Ripe in flavor, this is a tightly wound wine, with tangy lime and mineral character galore. Finishes vibrant, finally opening up enough to show its pear flavors. Has depth and promises much with cellaring. Best from 2008 through 2013. 320 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Mornington Peninsula Faultline
review: Smooth, a seamless white with creamy pear and pineapple flavors, hinting seductively at warm stones and freshly baked bread as the finish lingers. Drink now through 2010. 400 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Mornington Peninsula Meres
review: This is silky smooth and nicely focused to show off its pretty raspberry and cream flavors that linger gently against highly polished tannins on the finish. Poised to develop well with cellaring. Best from 2008 through 2014. 180 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Mornington Peninsula Meres Single Vineyard Selection
review: Polished, vibrant and generous, a smooth Pinot with layers of cherry, currant, plum and floral aromas and flavors that persist on the refined finish. Drink now through 2013. 400 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Mornington Peninsula
review: Smooth and polished, with ripe, spicy flavors under a wrapping of toasty oak, offering peach, honey and pineapple flavors that lingers on the generous finish. Drink now through 2005. 35 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Mornington Peninsula Farrago Single Vineyard Selection
review: An intense blend of creamy, buttery lemon and peach flavors, rich and with a toasted hazelnut edge, smooth and juicy on the finish. Drink now. 30 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Mornington Peninsula Faultline
review: Lithe and crisp, with bright grapefruit and apple fruit riding against hints of lime, spice and mineral, lingering deftly. Best from 2009 through 2012. 300 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Mornington Peninsula
review: Restrained notes of black tea, spice, rose petal and dried cherry are quiet but harmonious, with velvety tannins. Drink now through 2030. 50 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Mornington Peninsula Haven
review: Lively and appealing for its fresh carpaccio-scented raspberry and espresso flavors that linger nicely on the open-textured finish. Drink now through 2011. 275 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Mornington Peninsula
review: Juicy and transparent, with notes of lemon zest and lime sherbet. Robust and bold, showing shadings of spice and dried flowers that linger on the finish. Drink now. 50 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Mornington Peninsula Clonale
review: Tangy, generous and immensely appealing for its harmonious pear, spice and almond aromas and flavors, lingering enticingly on the refined finish. Drink now through 2010. 2,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Mornington Peninsula
review: Plush and juicy, offering a mineral streak that runs though the ripe plum and strawberry flavors, finishing with a mix of dried rose petal and herb accents. Drink now through 2020. 120 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Mornington Peninsula Massale
review: Spice, black tea and peppery notes mingle with clove-infused black cherry and plum flavors. Firm tannins and sage accents on the finish. Drink now through 2026. 60 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Mornington Peninsula Massale
review: Bright and juicy. Presents its raspberry and strawberry fruit on a firm pillow of fine tannins, with sweet leather and spice notes as the finish lingers. Drink now through 2011. 6,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Mornington Peninsula
review: Ripe and round, with a woodsy, leafy edge to the pear and spice flavors. The fruit persists nicely on the finish. Drink now through 2011. 192 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Mornington Peninsula Clonale
review: Lemon curd, green apple and peach blossom notes are crisp and bright, with plenty of intensity and focus on the finish. Drink now. 40 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Mornington Peninsula Faultline
review: Lithe, silky and subtle in flavor, with spicy oak notes weaving around a core of citrus, pineapple and cream, finishing with real polish. Drink now through 2007. 12 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Mornington Peninsula
review: Lithe and generous, a refreshing mouthful of black cherry, mineral and a wee touch of earth, framed with slightly chalky tannins, the fruit persisting nicely. Best from 2007 through 2011. 1,200 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Mornington Peninsula Ferrous
review: Light, tangy and distinctive for a carpaccio note to the raspberry and spice flavors, persisting on the finish against refined tannins. Drink now through 2010. 225 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Mornington Peninsula Haven Single Vineyard Selection
review: Light, with an earthy note running through the modest raspberry and chocolate flavors, lingering gently. Drink now through 2010. 375 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Mornington Peninsula Massale
review: Vibrant, with raspberry and cherry flavors accented by toast, cigar box and spice notes. Harmonious on the finish. Drink now through 2030. 50 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Mornington Peninsula
review: Supple style has subtle pear and spice flavors, lively acidity and a hint of olive as the flavors linger. Drink now through 2007. 75 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Mornington Peninsula Mosaic
review: Spicy, round and polished, a well-made peppery wine that comes up a bit short on flavor intensity. Has a nice balance on the finish, so it might be worth cellaring to see what becomes of it. Drink now through 2009. 12 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Mornington Peninsula Ferrous Single Vineyard Selection
review: Wild strawberry and cranberry flavors have almond skin, toasted herb and spice notes, and earthy, sinewy tannins. Drink now through 2026. 20 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Mornington Peninsula Clonale
review: Toasty, spicy and on the peppery side, but nicely fleshed out with pear and orange peel flavors. Drink now through 2010. 1,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Mornington Peninsula
review: Bright and jazzy, with firm tannins and focused raspberry, earthy flavors that pick up more than a hint of oak as they linger. Drink now through 2006. 200 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Mornington Peninsula
review: Light and appealing for its strawberry and spice flavors. Drink now through 2007. 200 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Mornington Peninsula
review: Light and fragrant, with a smoky edge to the modest raspberry flavors, hinting at roasted game on the finish. Drink now through 2010. 192 cases imported.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Weinberg
review: Very juicy, balanced and fresh, with a firm acidity behind the rich red plum, raspberry and blueberry flavors. Has medium-grained tannins, with chocolate and pepper notes on the finish. Drink now through 2011. 833 cases made.

name: Port Colheita
review: Baked pear, dried apricot and roasted apple flavors dominate in this mature yet fresh-tasting version. White pepper and lightly smoky notes show on the fresh finish. Rich and complex. Drink now. 200 cases imported.

name: Port Colheita
review: A light amber color, with zesty, fresh flavors of dried citrus, ginger and glazed apricot which lengthen out midpalate. White pepper and plenty of spice details show on the finish. Drink now. 200 cases imported.

name: Vintage Port
review: Offers layers of dark plum, raspberry ganache and dark cherry flavors, filled with chocolate truffle notes. Shows seductive cedary details on the finish. Best from 2025 through 2050. 300 cases imported.

name: White Port 40 Years Old
review: Rich and smoky, featuring a core of spicy vanilla, cream and ripe pear flavors that glide across the palate. Shows a lot of pedigree, with crisp acidity and plenty of minerality. Spicy notes fill the rich finish. Drink now. 200 cases imported.

name: Port Colheita
review: Richly spiced, with hints of juniper berry to the dried cherry, plum and butterscotch flavors. The creamy finish is loaded with spiciness. Fresh and inviting. Drink now. 200 cases imported.

name: Port Colheita
review: A warm, inviting style, with brown bread, toasted almond, powdered ginger and green tea notes leading the way. The green tea edge lingers longest through the focused, slightly taut finish. Starts slow, but adds zip and length with air. Drink now.

name: Port Colheita
review: Loaded with rich and lively flavors of white chocolate and buttercream, this features glazed apricot and citrus zest notes on the intensely spicy finish, with hints of white pepper. Drink now. 200 cases imported.

name: White Port 20 Years Old
review: An amber color, with rich, enveloping flavors of dried apricot, quince, pear tart and flan that take on mature overtones. The powerfully spicy finish is loaded with cream and honey notes that linger with some savory details. Drink now. 200 cases imported.

name: Port Colheita
review: Quite lively, with energetic acidity rippling from start to finish, allowing the raisin, dried plum, green tea, ginger and roasted almond notes to race along in lockstep. The tightly focused finish has excellent length. Drink now.

name: Port Colheita
review: Crisp and spicy, with dried citrus, maple and ginger flavors, supported by fresh acidity. White chocolate and cardamom notes flood the tangy finish. Drink now. 200 cases imported.

name: Port Colheita
review: Shows a slightly dark profile, with broad bread, clove and juniper notes leading the way. Exhibits good energy to the core of raisin, bitter almond and dried orange peel. Shows weight and drive through the finish, presenting a lingering toasted peanut hint. Drink now.

name: Tawny Port Colheita
review: Shows refined maturity, with elegant flavors of dried apricot, citrus peel, chanterelle mushroom and apple cobbler flowing into a rich, spicy finish that features notes of white chocolate. Drink now. 100 cases imported.

name: Tawny Port Colheita
review: Very airy, offering broad, still-fresh flavors of apricot tart and hints of fresh-cut peach that are balanced against a deep well of toffee and white chocolate notes, with a toasty finish. Drink now. 50 cases imported.

name: White Port 10 Years Old
review: Creamy and lush-tasting, with a complex and concentrated mix of butterscotch, salted almond and quince flavors. Dried apricot, honey and spice details linger on the rich finish. Drink now. 200 cases imported.

name: White Port 30 Years Old
review: Lush, with butterscotch, dried apricot and vanilla flavors that are long and richly spiced. This really sings midpalate, presenting vibrant acidity and iodine accents. Drink now. 200 cases imported.

name: Port Colheita
review: Warm toffee, cinnamon and ginger notes glide through, enhanced by a light streak of juniper. Ends with accents of dark tea and a flash of bitter almond. Drink now.

name: Port Colheita
review: Redolent of toffee, this light, spicy style offers succulent flavors of dried fig, pear tart and baked apple. Cinnamon and white chocolate notes chime in on the fresh, juicy finish, accompanied by hints of sage. Drink now. 50 cases imported.

name: Tawny Port 10 Year Old
review: White chocolate, crème brûlée and ripe apple flavors blend seamlessly in this lush, rich tawny. Offers a silky mouthfeel, with a long finish supported by fresh acidity. Drink now. 800 cases imported.

name: Vintage Port
review: Plum and blackberry aromas, with hints of chocolate and nut follow through to a full body, medium sweetness and a long caressing finish. Youthful, round and rich. '77/'85/'97 blind Port retrospective. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Tawny Port 20 Year Old
review: Very interesting aromas of maple syrup, honey, and mahogany. Full-bodied, very rich with a decadent butterscotch and nutty aftertaste. Very typical. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now.

name: Late Bottled Port
review: Peppery, with some resinous notes. Dark plum and roasted cherry flavors dominate. Finishes sweet and crisp. Drink now through 2020. 200 cases imported.

name: Vintage Port Quinta São Luiz
review: Offers loads of mineral, mint and crushed blackberry character. Full-bodied, with a medium sweetness and a long, caressing finish. A very balanced, pretty wine. Nicely done. Best after 2010. 460 cases made.

name: White Port Colheita
review: Sweet and caressing in feel, with peach melba, apricot jam and orange peel notes, laced with a light twinge of bitter almond to stay honest. Drink now.

name: Vintage Port
review: Beautiful aromas of licorice and blueberry follow through to a full body, with fine tannins and a clean and fruity finish. Subtle and refined. '77/'85/'97 blind Port retrospective. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Vintage Port Quinta São Luiz
review: A very grapey young Port with lots of jam and chocolate character. Medium- to full-bodied, very sweet, with big, soft tannins and a fruity finish. Best after 2002.

name: White Port Colheita
review: Friendly, with sweet marmalade, apricot jam, candied ginger peel and elderflower honey notes that glide through a slightly waxy finish. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: White Port Lágrima
review: The buttery notes give this a rich allure, with ripe pear, lemon curd and crème brûlée flavors. Offers a fresh finish, with accents of salted almond. Drink now. 700 cases imported.

name: Tawny Port Colheita
review: Hot, heady aroma, with flavors of toffee and allspice and some root-beer overtones. Brown sugar on the supple finish. Drink now.

name: Vintage Port
review: Pretty aromas of plums and berries, with hints of pepper. Follows through to a medium- to full-bodied palate, with fine tannins and a fruity finish.  Best after 2010. 2,000 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: A very good, strong '60. Medium red with a garnet edge, complex cherry and bark nose, medium-bodied, with a rich, round mouth-feel and wonderfully rich fruit flavors on the finish.

name: Vintage Port
review: Fresh and clean aromas of flowers and crushed berries follow through to a medium-bodied palate, medium sweet, with silky tannins. Not a big wine, but harmonious and pretty. Not imported into the U.S. Best after 2008. 2,700 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Pretty young Port. Lovely, balanced, with floral, fruity aromas and flavors, medium body and a medium, firm tannin structure. Best after 2004. 2,500 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Offers plenty of wet earth, toast and blackberry character. Medium-bodied, with well-integrated tannins and a sweet, ripe fruit finish. A pretty Port. Best after 2004.

name: Vintage Port
review: This is an elegant wine with good fruit and structure. Deep purple, with a rich, floral, grapy nose, full-bodied, with a good balance of medium tannins and sweet fruit flavors.

name: Douro Reserva
review: Ripe and dense, with plenty of smoky notes to the dark plum and roasted cherry flavors. Asian spice and chewy tannins on the finish. Drink now. 200 cases imported.

name: Vintage Port
review: A bit one-dimensional but wonderfully rich and fruity. Deep purple, with a dense blackberry nose, full-bodied, with intense grapy flavors, medium tannins and a firm backbone.

name: Late Bottled Port
review: Medium-bodied and very sweet, with raisin and spice character and chocolate, pepper and sweet-and-sour flavors on the finish. Lacks a bit of freshness. Drink now.

name: Vintage Port
review: A very well-made '82 with lots of finesse. Medium to deep ruby, with a rich strawberry nose, full-bodied, with medium tannins, very good fruit flavors and a medium finish. Slightly one-dimensional.

name: Vintage Port
review: Rather forward Port. Round and sweet berry and cherry character, medium to full body, sweet and soft tannins. Best after 1997. 1,700 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Much better than the '77 and good for such a weak vintage. Medium red-garnet, grape and chocolate aromas, medium-bodied, with a velvety mouth-feel and earthy, roasted fruit flavors.

name: Vintage Port
review: A confusing wine. It is quite forward in color but has a youthful nose and palate. Medium red with a garnet edge, excellent fresh fruit aromas, full-bodied, with a good balance of focused fruit flavors and medium tannins.

name: Vintage Port
review: Rich but rather hard. It has reached its peak. Medium red with a garnet rim, bitter chocolate and walnut aromas, medium-bodied, with walnut flavors, medium tannins and a dry finish.

name: Late Bottled Port
review: Earthy mushroom and old-wood character dominates the fruit. Hard to get excited about. 2,200 cases made.

name: Vintage Port
review: Breaking up a bit but still holding on. Medium red with a garnet rim, chocolate and coffee nose, medium-bodied, with forward coffee and fruit flavors, light tannins and a medium finish.

name: Port Varsity
review: Mature, thick, woody style, emphasizing wood and chocolate flavors over vag ue hints of prune. Balanced toward alcohol, it's a bit harsh.

name: Vintage Port
review: Quite hot and unbalanced, it is evolving too quickly. Medium ruby-red, with forward alcohol and vanilla aromas, medium-bodied, with decent peppery, spicy fruit flavors, but a little hot on the finish.

name: Vintage Port
review: Past its prime, quite weak. Light to medium red, with spicy berry aromas, light-bodied, light tannins and simple cough syrup flavors.

name: Vintage Port
review: Very weak and simple. Medium red, with a sweet cherry nose, light-bodied, with very sweet fruit flavors and a short finish. Drinkable but too simple

name: Vintage Port
review: Too far off the mark for such an excellent vintage. It is simply too mature. Medium red with a garnet edge, slightly nutty cassis aromas, light-bodied, with cassis flavors, light tannins and a very short finish.

name: Vintage Port
review: Pure plum on the nose, with orange peel and dried flowers. Full-bodied, medium sweet and very chunky and rich, with firm tannins and lots of fruit. Just coming together now, but there's all the components for an outstanding Vintage Port.   Score range: 89-92

name: Vino da Tavola della Svizzera Italiana Balino
review: Distinctive, with mint, grilled meat and mineral notes along with red berry. Medium-bodied, with good intensity and subtle oaky, smoky accents. Lacks a bit of supple texture; fresh, high-toned finish. Best from 2002 through 2006. 830 cases made.

name: Vino da Tavola della Svizzera Italiana Gorla
review: Crisp, cool fruit with herbal accents give this fresh, medium-bodied red a hard edge. Some nice red berries on the firm, citrusy finish. Drink now. 665 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot-Cabernet Franc South Australia
review: Firm, focused and juicy, with licorice-scented black cherry and blackberry flavors that persist on the finish. Stylish, built to age. Best from 2003 through 2010. 3,500 cases made.

name: Classic South Australia
review: Firm in texture, with bright, distinctive blackberry, blueberry and plum flavors glowing through a fine layer of tannin. Has a nice layer of dusky spice, too. Cabernet Sauvignon,  Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Best after 2000. 2,000 cases made.

name: Classic South Australia
review: Firm in texture, with a bite of acidity around the edges. Has pretty raspberry and herbal flavors at the core, with a surprising touch of lime sneaking in on the finish. Cabernet Sauvignon,  Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Best from 2001 through 2007. 2,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet-Merlot Limestone Coast
review: Firm in texture, with earthy, cedary character around a fine core of black cherry and currant fruit, finishing with fine tannins. Drink now through 2006. 3,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot-Cabernet Franc Limestone Coast
review: Soft in texture, with a strong herbal streak running through the floral blackberry notes. Drink now through 2005. 200 cases imported.

name: Syrah Coonawarra
review: Distinctly peppery, with layers of raspberry, blackberry and a touch of cream as the flavors mingle on the fine-grained finish. Has power but not a huge wine. Give it time to develop. Best from 2005 through 2010. 1,900 cases made.

name: Cabernet-Merlot Coonawarra
review: Firm, fine and focused, aiming its currant, cedar and spice flavors through a thin veil of nicely polished tannins and harmonious oak notes. Drink now through 2007. 2,100 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Carneros Unoaked
review: Eschews oak, offering fresh, snappy, vibrant green apple, pear and citrus notes that have a pithy edge. Drink now. 750 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Carneros Cassidy Ranch
review: Still a bit green, with a minerally lime and pippin apple fruit profile and tart, flinty acidity. Best after 2008. 591 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Carneros-Sonoma County Unoaked
review: Clean and refreshing, with a crisp core of lime and green apple flavors. Mouthwatering. Drink now. 700 cases made.

name: Le Premier Reserve California
review: Marked by depth, finesse and elegance, this is toasty and smooth, yet still bright, with a nutty quality that's tempered by notes of citrus, herbs, spice and dried cherry. Complex and delicious. Top-of-the-line bubbly from this often-underrated producer. 1,400 cases made.

name: Blanc de Noirs Russian River Valley Champagne Master's Reserve
review: Starts off with pretty toast, dough and citrus aromas, then kicks into gear with complex hazelnut, fig, melon, cherry, lemon-lime and spice. Terrific price. Drink now. 2,570 cases made.

name: Brut California Organic Grapes
review: Crisp and luscious, this is a winning bubbly for a big party. Aromas of cinnamon, ginger and citrus lead to creamy flavors of pear and blanched almond. Drink now. 15,000 cases made.

name: Brut California Organic Grapes
review: Alluring apple and floral cherry aromas lead to supple, fruit-forward Meyer lemon and fresh ginger flavors. Pinot Gris, Chardonnay, French Colombard and Sangiovese. Drink now. 34,000 cases made.

name: Blanc de Noirs Russian River Valley Master's Reserve
review: Starts very crisp with Granny Smith apple flavors, then rounds out with currant, mushroom and fig flavors. Drink now through 2005. 2,500 cases made.

name: Brut California
review: Sleek and vibrant, with spicy nut and tropical fruit aromas and lively, crisp lemon curd and ginger flavors. Drink now. 10,300 cases made.

name: Brut California
review: This is crisp and loaded with spice, offering creamy apple, citrus and anise flavors that are balanced, with a vibrant finish. Drink now. 6,500 cases made.

name: Brut Rosé California
review: Soft and easy to like, offering spicy cherry and vanilla aromas that lead to slightly sweet strawberry and citrus flavors, with a crisp finish. Drink now. 50,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Heck Family Cellar Selection
review: Tropical fruit, apple and spice flavors are tightly wound on a firm, elegant frame. Finishes with complex toast and fruit flavors. Drink now through 2001. 775 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Heck Family Cellar Selection
review: A jazzy wine, ripe and juicy, with pineapple, pear, resin and vanilla flavors tumbling over each other. Finishes fresh and lively. Nice now, may be best in 1999 or 2000. 750 cases made.

name: Extra Dry California
review: Who says you have to pay big bucks for a goodsparkling wine? This affordable version is roundin the mouth, with ripe flavors of cherry, redcurrant and fig. Starts with a bit of sweetnessthat carries through the finish. Goodavailability, too. Drink now. 400,000 cases made.

name: Natural' Russian River Valley
review: Expressive and zesty, with spicy Asian pear aromas and lively, fruit-forward red apple and fresh ginger flavors. Drink now. 16,750 cases made.

name: Natural' Russian River Valley
review: Offers appealing notes of spiced apple and citrus, with touches of cinnamon and roasted almond. A lively and quaffable bubbly. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Brut California
review: Lively aromas of citrus and cinnamon roll lead to crisp flavors of apple, tropical fruit and spiced nuts in this fun bubbly. Drink now. 850,000 cases made.

name: Brut California
review: Lively and appealing, offering citrus and raspberry fruit, with spice and cinnamon accents. Drink now. 850,000 cases made.

name: Brut California Organic Grapes
review: Crisp and lively, with easygoing flavors of lemon, tropical fruit and creamy spice. Drink now. 14,000 cases made.

name: Brut Rosé California
review: A fun quaff, with strawberry and floral-spiced nut aromas, this is easygoing, offering a hint of sweet raspberry and tropical fruit flavors. A crowd-pleaser. Drink now. 60,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Alexander Valley Heck Family Cellar Selection
review: Emits pretty aromas of black currant, mushroom and smoke. A bit restrained at this point, the powdery tannins holding back blackberry, blueberry, anise and herb flavors. Better with more bottle age. Drink now through 2005. 770 cases made.

name: Chardonnay California Champagne
review: If you love big, toasty California Chardonnays, this is the bubbly for you. A lot of spicy tropical fruit and pear flavors are balanced with lively acidity. Drink now through 2012. 55,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay California Champagne
review: Ripe and juicy, like a Chardonnay with bubbles. Shows notes of toasty tropical fruit, spice and pear. Drink now. 55,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay California Champagne
review: A bold California style, offering big aromas of toasty oak and tropical fruit, with easygoing flavors of lemon and apple that show lots of spice. Drink now. 45,000 cases made.

name: Extra Dry California
review: Crisp and lively, with a hint of sweet apple and citrus fruit, complemented by notes of toasty yeast and spice. Drink now. 350,000 cases made.

name: Le Premier Reserve Russian River Valley
review: Sandalwood, apple and fig overtones offer layers of ripeness and concentration, with floral and vanilla nuances framing a tangy finish. Drink now. 3,100 cases made.

name: Le Premier Reserve Russian River Valley
review: Round, with vanilla, melon, fig and coconut flavors. Finishes with lingering citrus notes. Drink now through 2005. 774 cases made.

name: Le Premier Reserve Russian River Valley
review: Spicy and complex, with earthy pear, mushroom, fig and citrus flavors. Finishes with a touch of doughiness. Drink now through 2004. 750 cases made.

name: Le Premier Russian River Valley
review: Toast, green apple, cherry and roasted almond flavors have fine depth and concentration, with excellent focus in the lingering finish. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Natural' Russian River Valley
review: A good quaff, with creamy apple and tropical fruit aromas that lead to lush flavors of spicy cinnamon roll and baked pear. Drink now. 35,000 cases made.

name: Natural' Russian River Valley
review: Crisp and lively, with user-friendly Asian pear, tropical fruit and spicy cream flavors. Drink now. 35,000 cases made.

name: Rouge Sonoma County
review: Don't be put off by the concept. This is easy to like, with good intensity to the round flavors of black currants, black cherries, and mocha. Drink now through 2004. 2,800 cases made.

name: Blanc de Noirs California
review: Boldly perfumed aromas of raspberry and spicy nuts lead to easygoing flavors of pear, pineapple and anise. Drink now. 15,000 cases made.

name: Blanc de Noirs California
review: Perfumed strawberry and spiced nut aromas open to juicy citrus and anise flavors in this sparkler. Drink now. 18,000 cases made.

name: Blanc de Noirs California
review: Perfumed strawberry and watermelon aromas lead to soft and slightly sweet flavors. Drink now. 15,000 cases made.

name: Brut Rosé California
review: Peppery black cherry and wild berry aromas are lean and firm on the palate, giving it a crisp, refreshing mouthfeel. Drink now. 35,000 cases made.

name: Brut Rosé California
review: A fun quaff that's soft and easygoing, with notes of strawberry, white chocolate and cinnamon. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Brut Rosé California Atlanta 1996
review: An off-dry style that serves up lots of ripe, juicy black cherry and berry flavors and spice notes. Appealing for its frank fruitiness. 23,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Alexander Valley Heck Family Cellar Selection
