review: Firm and very ripe, with plummy, almost pruny, notes alongside chocolate and coconut nuances. Drink now through 2006. 6,783 cases made.

name: Chardonnay California Champagne
review: Bold and juicy, with tropical fruit and spicy vanilla aromas that lead to easygoing pear and cinnamon roll flavors. Drink now. 30,000 cases made.

name: Extra Dry California
review: Crisp and fresh, with modest apple, lemon and anise notes. Drink now. 235,000 cases made.

name: Extra Dry California
review: Crisp and succulent, with lemon sorbet aromas leading to slightly sweet vanilla, apricot and spice notes. Drink now. 235,000 cases made.

name: Extra Dry California
review: A combo of crispy and creamy elements, with accents of lemon sorbet, sweet anise and blanched almond. Drink now. 23,386 cases made.

name: Natural' California
review: Toasty, zingy, lemony flavors in this bright, up-front wine wrap the palate in snappy acidity. Try with raw oysters. Drink now through 2002. 37,000 cases made.

name: Natural' Russian River Valley
review: Appealing, with easygoing flavors of apple, anise and spice. Drink now. 21,000 cases made.

name: Natural' Russian River Valley
review: Shows pretty floral aromas and an appealing mix of raspberry and green apple notes. The flavors offer fresh and crisp Asian pear accents, with a delicately spicy, toasty finish. Drink now through 2013. 45,000 cases made.

name: Natural' Sonoma County
review: Crisp apple and lemon notes form the core of this bright bubbly. It's refreshing and light-textured. Drink now through 2002. 17,600 cases made.

name: Blanc de Noirs California
review: Cherry, green apple and tangy strawberry flavors are round and refreshing, with lively, lemony acidity through the finish. A consistent value. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Blanc de Noirs Russian River Valley Champagne Master's Reserve
review: Ripe, with poached pear, nectarine, red currant and floral tones wrapped within a pleasant burst of refreshing acidity. Drink now. 1,900 cases made.

name: Brut California
review: Floral, with flavors of white nectarines and figs. Drink now through 2003. 850,000 cases made.

name: Brut California
review: Soft and refreshing, with apple, lemon, fig and lime flavors that stay lively through the finish. This producer is a trustworthy name in sparklers. Drink now through 2004. 700,000 cases made.

name: Brut California
review: Soft and easygoing, with creamy, spicy pear aromas and pleasant baked apple and fig flavors. Drink now through 2012. 750,000 cases made.

name: Brut California
review: Offers modest apple and citrus fruit, with notes of mineral and spice. Drink now. 755,000 cases made.

name: Brut Rosé California
review: Here's a festive little rosé bubbly, with a delicate pink hue and a slightly candied aroma. But it has bright, tart flavors of raspberry and apple. It's only moderately complex but it goes down so easy. Drink now. 22,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Champagne California
review: Soft, with notes of pear and white peaches. Drink now. 100,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley
review: Smooth, creamy and medium-bodied, showing ripe pear, fig and apricot flavors and a spicy finish. Well crafted. 900 cases made.

name: Extra Dry California
review: Light in style, offering a pleasant mix of creamy lemon and spice flavors, with crisp acidity. Drink now. 350,000 cases made.

name: Le Premier Reserve Russian River Valley
review: A lean style, with a lemony core. Fresh and clean, it harbors nice apple and herb flavors, if lacks the complexity of last year's release. Bright on the finish, it could improve in the bottle. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Natural' Sonoma County
review: Grassy and crisp, with apple, vanilla and butter notes in the finish. Drink now through 2002. 45,000 cases made.

name: Blanc de Noirs Russian River Valley Champagne Master's Reserve
review: At times a touch raw and tart, with spicy citrus, green apple and earthy flavors. Good, but nothing more; serve well-chilled. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Brut California
review: Round and pleasant, with soft flavors of apple, pear and sandalwood, nicely highlighted by tangy citrus. Drink now. 800,000 cases made.

name: Brut California
review: Citrus, apple and anise aromas lead to crisp, easy going flavors that finish on a toasty, spicy note. Drink now through 2011. 750,000 cases made.

name: Brut California
review: Offers easygoing flavors of sweet tropical fruit and spice. A good quaff for the big holiday party. Drink now. 880,000 cases made.

name: Brut California
review: Spicy and a touch sweet, with modest citrus and spicy anise flavors. Drink now. 960,000 cases made.

name: Brut Rosé California
review: Round and ripe, with soft banana, fig, cherry and tart currant notes. Drink now. 30,000 cases made.

name: Brut Rosé California
review: Cherry, red currant and strawberry tones are soft and easy-drinking, with lingering tanginess. Drink now. 17,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay California Champagne
review: Easygoing toasty apple and citrus aromas lead to zesty pear and spice flavors. Drink now. 55,000 cases made.

name: Extra Dry California
review: Tangy, with fine intensity to grape soda, green apple and off-dry watermelon tones. Drink now. 235,000 cases made.

name: Natural' California
review: Lively and a hint sweet, with appealing tropical fruit, apple and spice notes. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Rouge California
review: Smoky, earthy black currant and cassis flavors rise to the fore. Pleasant enough, but why bother with the bubbles? Drink now. 2,840 cases made.

name: Rouge Sonoma County
review: Round and ripe, with easy-drinking black cherry, vanilla and mocha flavors. Drink now. 3,500 cases made.

name: Blanc de Noirs California
review: Bright and straightforward, with green apple, vanilla and red currant flavors. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Blanc de Noirs California
review: Soft and ripe, with good depth to red currant, strawberry and raspberry flavors. Drink now. 14,000 cases made.

name: Blanc de Noirs California
review: Highly perfumed aromas of raspberry and vanilla lead to crisp, straightforward flavors. Drink now. 17,000 cases made.

name: Blanc de Noirs California
review: Spicy and fruity, with modest cherry, floral and vanilla notes. Drink now. 17,000 cases made.

name: Blanc de Noirs California
review: Soft, offering easygoing raspberry, spice and vanilla notes. Drink now. 17,000 cases made.

name: Blanc de Noirs California
review: Crisp and user-friendly, with notes of creamy raspberry and apple. Drink now. 12,000 cases made.

name: Brut California
review: Green apple, citrus and tart nectarine flavors fold into red currant tones in the finish. Drink now. 670,000 cases made.

name: Brut California
review: Creamy and appealing for its spicy citrus and toasty apple notes. Drink now. 750,000 cases made.

name: Brut California
review: Crisp and sleek, with modest citrus and creamy tropical fruit notes. Drink now. 750,000 cases made.

name: Brut California
review: Crisp and appealing, with modest citrus, pine needle and spice aromas. Drink now. 25,000 cases made.

name: Brut Rosé California
review: Very pale pink in color, with hints of cherry, vanilla and spice, finishing with delicate fruit flavors. Well balanced and lively on the finish. Drinkable now. 23,000 cases made.

name: Brut Rosé California
review: Soft and modestly structured, but appealing for its sweet cherry, vanilla and spice flavors. Drink now. 35,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Alexander Valley Heck Family Cellar Selection
review: Firmly tannic, with a healthy measure of toasty oak framing green bean, herb, plum and currant notes. Drink now through 2005. 774 cases made.

name: Champagne California
review: Kosher. Pleasant and bright on the palate, with hints of toast and citrus. Finishes clean but short. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay California Champagne
review: Soft and modestly structured, with citrus, apple and spice flavors. Drink now. 45,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay California Champagne
review: Offers straightforward tropical fruit and toasty oak flavors. Drink now. 17,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Champagne California
review: Pleasant enough, with bright apple and citrus flavors. Finishes clean and fresh. Drink now.

name: Extra Dry California
review: Soft and straightforward, with a pleasant touch of sweetness to flavors of quince, apple and fig. Drink now. 400,000 cases made.

name: Extra Dry California
review: Straightforward and a hint sweet, with floral notes and spicy apple and lemon. Drink now. 270,000 cases made.

name: Extra Dry California
review: This is like lemon sorbet, with sweet yet tart citrus, peach and creamy spice flavors. Drink now. 235,000 cases made.

name: Natural' California
review: Offers modest notes of floral lemon and spiced apple. Drink now. 43,000 cases made.

name: Natural' Russian River Valley
review: Offers modest flavors of dry citrus and spice. Drink now. 26,000 cases made.

name: Natural' Russian River Valley
review: Modest green apple, fig and spice flavors finish with a tangy note. Drink now. 37,000 cases made.

name: Rouge Sonoma County
review: Red bubbly--a different animal. Pleasant enough, with tangy cherry and herb notes and a touch of astringent tannins. Drink now. 2,840 cases made.

name: Blanc de Noirs California
review: A pleasant bubbly, straightforward and juicy, with raspberry, vanilla and spice flavors and a crisp finish. Drink now. 19,000 cases made.

name: Blanc de Noirs California
review: Displays appealing strawberry and spice aromas, but the raspberry flavors are soft and fairly simple. Drink now. 17,000 cases made.

name: Blanc de Noirs California
review: Soft and a hint sweet, with notes of raspberry and spicy vanilla. Drink now. 18,000 cases made.

name: Blanc de Noirs California Champagne Master's Reserve
review: Tart, earthy and a bit tinny. Shows hints of spice, citrus and black cherry flavors, but it's coarse and biting on the finish. 3,500 cases made.

name: Brut California
review: A fruity style, featuring apple and lemon flavors. Somewhat simple, yet pleasant and light on the palate. Drink now. 900,000 cases made.

name: Brut California
review: Spice, ginger and Muscat-like aromas are lean, firm and fruity on the palate, with nice pear and apple flavors that fall on the simple side. Drink now. 750,000 cases made.

name: Brut California
review: Offers straightforward flavors of citrus and spicy dill. Drink now. 900,000 cases made.

name: Brut California
review: Simple and rather sweet, with notes of white chocolate, citrus and spice. Drink now. 25,000 cases made.

name: Brut Rosé California
review: Offers easygoing strawberry and ginger aromas and flavors. Drink now. 40,000 cases made.

name: Brut Rosé California
review: Spicy but simple, with modest raspberry and spicy nut flavors. Drink now. 35,000 cases made.

name: Brut Rosé California
review: A zesty wine, with modest nut, cherry and spice flavors. Drink now. 55,000 cases made.

name: California Russian River Valley Natural'
review: Sweet and a bit earthy, with modest cherry and berry fruit that takes on a pebbly aftertaste. Drink now. 40,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Champagne California
review: Ripe, with banana, vanilla and green apple character that finishes with a grassy note. Drink now. 62,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Champagne California
review: Lean and austere, with distinct perfume notes and toasty apple and spice flavors. Drink now. 59,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County
review: Strikes a nice balance between light pear and apple notes with spicy oak flavors. 1,275 cases made.

name: Commemorative Cuvée Sonoma County
review: A bit sweet, though showing bright acidity. Green apple notes are a bit one-dimensional and there's slight oxidation; fun to quaff now, but you might not want to wait for the millennium, despite the name. Drink now. 30,000 cases made.

name: Extra Dry California
review: Lively, with bright floral, candied apple and sweet fig flavors underscored by lemony acidity. Drink now through 2004. 450,000 cases made.

name: Natural' Russian River Valley
review: Soft and easygoing, with flavors of apple, citrus and sandalwood. Drink now. 17,500 cases made.

name: Natural' Russian River Valley
review: Austere, with a chewy texture and tropical canned pineapple flavors that end on a sweetish floral note. Drink now. 44,000 cases made.

name: Rosé California Sweet
review: A party in a bottle for those with a sweet tooth. A bright pink hue leads to sweet cherry, spice and vanilla flavors. Drink now. 75,000 cases made.

name: Sweet Cuvée California
review: For those with a sweet tooth. Soft and supple, with aromas of tropical fruit, spiced almond and tangerine. Drink now. 25,000 cases made.

name: Brut California
review: Pleasant but rather simple, with slightly sweet apple and pear flavors. Drink now. 670,000 cases made.

name: Brut Rosé California Whoopi Goldberg Artist Series
review: Tart and tangy, showing hints of cherry, watermelon and lemon. Pleasant and simple. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay Champagne California
review: Soft and oaky, with vanilla, coconut, pear and fig flavors. Drink now  85,000 cases made.

name: Natural' Russian River Valley
review: Simple but pleasantly fragrant, with sugary orange rind, Earl Grey tea and sweet-and-sour lemon-drop flavors. Drink now. 43,000 cases made.

name: Rosé California Sweet
review: Bold aromas of ripe strawberry follow through to sweet flavors of raspberry and vanilla. Dessert in a glass. Drink now. 100,000 cases made.

name: Sweet Cuvée California
review: Soft and sweet, with candied flavors of tropical fruit. Drink now. 35,000 cases made.

name: Blanc de Noirs California
review: Attractive for its fresh cherry and strawberry flavors, this is soft and fleshy, turning creamy on the finish. Drinkable now.

name: Blanc de Noirs California
review: Apple and cherry aromas lead to dull, slightly sweet and listless flavors. Drink now. 19,000 cases made.

name: Blanc de Noirs California Master's Reserve
review: Crisp and firm with tart black cherry and vanilla notes that are simple but pleasing. Drinkable now. 6,300 cases made.

name: Brut Rosé California
review: Simple and rather sweet, with overly floral raspberry notes and a cidery finish. Drink now. 22,000 cases made.

name: Brut Rosé California Jane Seymour
review: Sweet and simple, with a strong raspberry edge. Bottle design by actress Jane Seymour adds little.

name: Brut Rosé California Kenny G Artist Series
review: Simple, with spicy, sour cherry flavors. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Brut Rosé California Sinatra
review: Fairly simple, with raspberry and cherry flavors, it's not quite as sparkling as its namesake, but should please some.

name: Extra Dry California
review: Spicy quince aromas lead to soft, slightly sweet and fairly dull flavors. Drink now. 235,000 cases made.

name: Rosé California Sweet
review: Very sweet, almost syrupy, with chocolate-covered cherry flavors. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Rouge Sonoma County
review: This full-bodied bubbly has the hue of a Pinot Noir, with blackberry, herb and spice flavors that are simple and slightly sweet and tannic. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Champagne California
review: Perfumed and fairly simple but slightly sweet, with simple orange and spicy apple flavors and a slightly bitter finish. 59,000 cases made.

name: Extra Dry California
review: Tastes off-dry (and is) with spicy, fruit flavors that turn smooth on the finish. A simple quaffer that's well balanced. 250,000 cases made.

name: Blanc de Noirs California Cuvée Master's Reserve
review: Tastes sweet with crisp, tinny pear, cherry and citrus notes. 5,000 cases made.

name: Brut Rosé California
review: Simple cherry and spice aromas lead to bitter, cloying flavors. 40,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Champagne California
review: Soft and fairly dull, with slight apricot and creamy spiced fruit. 55,000 cases made.

name: Natural' Russian River Valley
review: A lean, tightly wound bubbly that lacks much in the way of generosity. Aromas and flavors of toast and baked apple, with a finish that's both slightly candied and bitter. 39,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma Valley
review: Displays fresh, spicy and savory currant, soy and fresh earth flavors, with hints of bay leaf and tar. Clean, elegant and focused, with a refreshing aftertaste and mild tannins. Best from 2009 through 2014. 458 cases made.

name: Merlot Sonoma Valley
review: Soft and a bit jammy, with good structure and appealing notes of black cherry, spicy toast and vanilla. Drink now through 2017. 400 cases made.

name: Merlot Sonoma Mountain
review: Soft and appealingly mature, with layered notes of cedar, cherry and toasty herb. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Cuvée Kristin Sonoma Valley
review: This zesty red features notes of black cherry, spice and cedar. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Malbec and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2018. 380 cases made.

name: Merlot Moon Mountain District
review: Lean, bitter and quite herbal. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 250 cases made.

name: Merlot Sonoma Valley
review: Lean and leathery, with earthy black cherry aromas and flavors and dry, cedary tannins. 453 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir California 4-Barrel
review: This offers gorgeous fruit that's ripe, lush and layered, ending with a sense of opulence and finesse. From Keefer, Amber Ridge, Kanzler and Koplen vineyards.—Kosta Browne non-blind vertical (March 2011). Drink now through 2020. 91 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Koplen Vineyard
review: This very ripe yet subtle '05 hasn't missed a beat, delivering rich, juicy, elegantly styled plum, black cherry and blackberry fruit. Subtle touches of spicy mineral mark the finish. Amazing persistence.—Kosta Browne non-blind vertical (March 2011). Drink now through 2017. 500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir California 4-Barrel
review: A supple, graceful style that builds depth and intensity, with ripe, plump black cherry, plum and blueberry notes. Full-bodied, gaining depth and nuance while remaining elegant and delicate. A classically styled young Pinot that's also a tour de force. Drink now through 2018. 91 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Cohn Vineyard
review: This delivers gorgeous fruit, pure, rich and layered, with a vivid mix of dark berry, raspberry, plum, tar, sage, cedar, anise and mineral flavors, all unfolding gracefully. Long finish.—Kosta Browne non-blind vertical (March 2011). Drink now through 2016. 330 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands Rosella's Vineyard
review: A very complex and focused Pinot, this shows subtle notes of spice, dried berry, wild berry and loamy earth, with savory touches.—Kosta Browne non-blind vertical (March 2011). Drink now through 2020. 247 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Kanzler Vineyard
review: There are restrained aromas here, yet the flavors build gracefully. Juicy, with vivid, layered wild berry, raspberry, cherry and floral scents. Deep, complex and ending with a laser-beam focus.—Kosta Browne non-blind vertical (March 2011). Drink now through 2017. 255 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir California 4-Barrel
review: Ripe, tight and juicy, with vivid dark berry, floral and wilted rose flavors that are more impressive than when this was reviewed last year. One of those happy gains.—Kosta Browne non-blind vertical (March 2011). Drink now through 2020. 97 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Amber Ridge Vineyard
review: Well-oaked, but deftly balanced, boasting generous plum, blueberry and raspberry flavors, ending with loamy earth and tea notes.—Kosta Browne non-blind vertical (March 2011). Drink now through 2020. 600 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Keefer Ranch
review: One of two I correctly identified. This is notably spicy, with nutmeg, floral and berry scents. Rich and full-bodied, delivering layers of dark berries and a dash of mocha.—Kosta Browne non-blind vertical (March 2011). Drink now through 2020. 613 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Koplen Vineyard
review: This is dense, pure, rich and supple, displaying tiers of black cherry and blueberry fruit. Ends with a long burst of flavor.—Kosta Browne non-blind vertical (March 2011). Drink now through 2020. 792 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Koplen Vineyard
review: This bright, rich and juicy Pinot features vivid, blackberry jam, raspberry and wild berry flavors, tapering off to floral nuances, as well as tar and mineral. Good length.—Kosta Browne non-blind vertical (March 2011). Drink now through 2016. 210 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands Garys' Vineyard
review: Builds intensity, depth and dimension, exhibiting loamy earth, sage and underbrush notes joining a medley of dried berry, plum, raspberry and black cherry flavors. Wonderful finish.—Kosta Browne non-blind vertical (March 2011). Drink now through 2017. 264 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands Rosella's Vineyard
review: Ripe and generous, with open-knit plum, black cherry and wild berry fruit, firming on the finish, where the tannins offer an aftertaste of crushed rock and pebble. Drink now through 2022. 272 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Ripe and deeply flavored, concentrated and well-structured, this full-bodied red offers a complex mix of black cherry, wild berry and raspberry fruit that's pure and persistent, ending with a pebbly note and firm tannins. Drink now through 2018. 5,818 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Kanzler Vineyard
review: Ripe, rich, plump, concentrated and full-bodied, with a tight mix of mineral, raspberry and spice flavors. Gains a plum and berry pie edge while remaining firm and structured, dense and concentrated. Drink now through 2018. 575 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Kanzler Vineyard
review: This very tight Pinot is dense, concentrated and focused on pure, ripe, layered plum and raspberry fruit. Impressive showing.—Kosta Browne non-blind vertical (March 2011). Drink now through 2019. 803 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Kanzler Vineyard
review: Aging beautifully, this exhibits pure, ripe, rich, high-toned dark berry, floral and lavender scents. Intense, focused, vibrant and layered.—Kosta Browne non-blind vertical (March 2011). Drink now through 2018. 270 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma County 4-Barrel
review: Still delightfully rich, pure and gracefully balanced, this displays tiered notes of ripe plum, blackberry, spice, and wild berry, yet for its fruit complexity this offers subtle nuances of mineral and anise.—Kosta Browne non-blind vertical (March 2011). Drink now through 2017. 90 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma County 4-Barrel
review: Of the bottlings in this tasting, this gained the most from aging. Very rich and elegant, sleek and pure, with tiered flavors of dark berry, plum, cherry, spice and wilted rose. A blend of Amber Ridge, Cohn, Kanzler and Koplen vineyards.—Kosta Browne non-blind vertical (March 2011). Drink now through 2018. 90 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir California 4-Barrel
review: Offers amazing aromas of wild berry, spice, cedar, sage and underbrush, with a texture that highlights the tenderness and strength of the tannins, sailing along on a persistent finish. Drink now. 88 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir California 4-Barrel
review: Rich and layered, with spice box, creamy oak and firm, well-defined red and dark berry flavors. Touches of mocha, espresso, vanilla and cedar appear on the long, clean finish. Drink now through 2022. 92 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir California 4-Barrel
review: A notably elegant and stylish Pinot, this offers a complex mix of cola, raspberry, spice, subtle forest floor and wilted rose notes. The flavors are woven together on a long finish.—Kosta Browne non-blind vertical (March 2011). Drink now through 2017. 92 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley
review: Dense, rich and extracted with deep currant and berry fruit, with mineral, sage and tea.—Kosta Browne non-blind vertical (March 2011). Drink now through 2020. 3,632 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley
review: Perhaps the thickest and richest of all the Kosta Brownes in this tasting, it approaches the purity and density of boysenberry syrup with its viscosity and depth of flavors. Yet it's precisely those flavors that make it so distinctive and fun to drink. Vibrant and well-balanced.—Kosta Browne non-blind vertical (March 2011). Drink now through 2016. 1,020 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Amber Ridge Vineyard
review: Very tight, concentrated and focused, with a pronounced minerally and pebbly aroma that carries over to the palate. Full-bodied, dense and perfumed, this is slow to unfold but does so in a pure, pleasing way. Drink now through 2019. 423 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Amber Ridge Vineyard
review: Dense aromas of tar, gravel and fresh earth join chunky, chewy dark berry flavors. Deeply concentrated.—Kosta Browne non-blind vertical (March 2011). Drink now through 2019. 727 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Keefer Ranch
review: Aromas of cola, black licorice, loganberry, mineral and spice are tight, structured, focused and concentrated, fanning out nicely on the finish. Gains depth and detail, ending with a red candy aftertaste. Drink now through 2018. 816 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Keefer Ranch
review: Tight, firm, spicy, loamy earth notes and tannins give this a nice backbone. Snappy berry flavors are fresh and lively. Tasted from magnum.—Kosta Browne non-blind vertical (March 2011). Drink now through 2018. 556 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Keefer Ranch
review: Fresh and vibrant, with a strong gravel and mineral presence, this shows rich dried berry notes, ending with subtle spice, floral and berry pie touches.—Kosta Browne non-blind vertical (March 2011). Drink now through 2016. 117 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Koplen Vineyard
review: Firm, tight and somewhat closed, but with a wealth of flavor built around ripe plum, black cherry and blueberry. Juicy and full-bodied, showing a nice tannic backbone on the finish. Drink now through 2019. 678 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Koplen Vineyard
review: Pure, rich and direct, almost syrupy, with thick, persistent layers of dark berry fruit.—Kosta Browne non-blind vertical (March 2011). Drink now through 2020. 867 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands Garys' Vineyard
review: Ultrarich, with restrained power, this is pure and focused on dense, ripe plum, black cherry and blackberry flavors. Deftly balanced and elegant, ending with a mix of suppleness and subtlety. Drink now through 2022. 404 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands Garys' Vineyard
review: Pure, ripe, intense and vibrant, with vivid blackberry and spice notes. Shows lively acidity, too.—Kosta Browne non-blind vertical (March 2011). Drink now through 2020. 422 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands Pisoni Vineyard
review: This wine builds depth and density gracefully, adding subtle graphite and gravel notes to the core of black cherry, raspberry and wild berry flavors, retaining a tight focus and ending with a long, detailed and persistent finish. Drink now through 2022. 132 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands Rosella's Vineyard
review: A gorgeous version, ultrarich, supple and graceful, with plump plum, black cherry and wild berry flavors imparting mouthwatering juiciness and presence. Silky in texture, this is smooth and round, long and lingering. Drink now through 2022. 840 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Very complex, intense and spicy, delivering intense, persistent and rich dried berry flavors.—Kosta Browne non-blind vertical (March 2011). Drink now through 2017. 3,069 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Gap's Crown Vineyard
review: Broad-shouldered, very ripe and rich, with great intensity and concentration to the baked berry notes, mixing blueberry, wild berry, plum and raspberry. Ends with fresh earth, wilted rose and subtle berry flavors. Drink now through 2020. 1,615 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Kanzler Vineyard
review: Shows wonderful depth, richness, balance and complexity, with enticing aromas and an array of blackberry, raspberry, licorice, fresh-turned earth and crushed rock flavors, ending smooth. The tannins exhibit nice grip at the very end. Drink now through 2022. 665 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Kanzler Vineyard
review: Fragrant wilted rose notes are elegant and delicate, with ripe plum and wild berry flavors that are deceptively concentrated and detailed, picking up a raspberry, fresh loam and black tea edge on the finish. Drink now through 2020. 458 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Kanzler Vineyard
review: This dense red exhibits cola, sassafras, ripe plum and wild berry flavors, ending with black tea notes.—Kosta Browne non-blind vertical (March 2011). Drink now through 2020. 564 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Kanzler Vineyard
review: Graceful and somewhat subdued in this mix of wines, having become with time more elegant and refined and less opulent. This exhibits complex, delicate flavors of tar, wilted rose, forest floor and glazed brown sugar.—Kosta Browne non-blind vertical (March 2011). Drink now through 2016. 430 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Miron Vineyard
review: Rich and plush, dense and potent, this Pinot shows vivid wild berry, blackberry and raspberry scents. Persistent finish.—Kosta Browne non-blind vertical (March 2011). Drink now through 2016. 92 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley One Sixteen
review: Intense and vibrant, with lively pear, nectarine, citrus, peach and mineral notes. Full-bodied, concentrated and persistent, ending with a pleasant burst of fruit. Drink now through 2016. 267 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir California 4-Barrel
review: Pure and juicy, with an initial burst of fresh, snappy raspberry that offers a unique mix of density and richness. The flavors dance across the palate. Drink now through 2023. 98 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley
review: Rich and expressive, with bold layers of ripe blueberry, plum and wild berry flavors that show touches of spice and espresso. At points open-knit, yet tightening on the finish. Best from 2013 through 2023. 4,742 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley
review: Firm, tight, elegant and understated, this offers fresh, vibrant flavors of black cherry, wild berry and raspberry.—Kosta Browne non-blind vertical (March 2011). Drink now through 2018. 3,136 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley
review: This has gained in bottle, becoming notably graceful, elegant and supple. Rich, complex red berry and spice flavors are joined by a cola-sassafras edge.—Kosta Browne non-blind vertical (March 2011). Drink now through 2016. 1,812 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley
review: Very rich and vibrant, this is deeply concentrated, and delivers layers of complexity. Subtle notes include ripe cherry, wilted rose and spice. From Amber Ridge, Koplen, Cohn, Dutton-Manzana and Tykanera vineyards.—Kosta Browne non-blind vertical (March 2011). Drink now through 2017. 450 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Amber Ridge Vineyard
review: Fresh and snappy, with ripe, vivid, layers of blackberry, cherry and raspberry flavors. Smooth texture.—Kosta Browne non-blind vertical (March 2011). Drink now through 2016. 510 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Cohn Vineyard
review: Rustic and edgy, with extracted, firmly tannic wild berry, cherry and earth-scented plum and blueberry flavors. Slow to unfold, but impressive overall. Drink now through 2022. 88 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Cohn Vineyard
review: This strikes a fine balance between rich red berry fruit and clean earth, dried herb and soy accents, with fine-grained tannins. Gains depth and richness on the finish, where the flavors fan out and gain traction. Drink now through 2022. 65 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Giusti Ranch
review: Dark, rich and vivid, with anise-shaded blackberry, licorice, berry pie, sweet plum and cherry notes that coat the palate and fan out gracefully. Has the substance and drive to further excite and reward. Drink now through 2023. 998 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Keefer Ranch
review: Gushes with fresh, snappy cherry, raspberry and wild berry flavors enlivened by zesty acidity and firm, fine-grained tannins. Offers a juicy, supple texture and striking velocity to the fruit flavors. Drink now through 2022. 1,659 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Keefer Ranch
review: Well-built, ripe and layered, with rich plum, wild berry and black cherry fruit that firms nicely midpalate, with touches of herb and cedar. Finishes with a strong medley of berries and tannins. Drink now through 2022. 1,177 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Koplen Vineyard
review: Zeros in on a tight core of vivid dark berry, with touches of wild berry, raspberry and blueberry shaded by creamy oak. Gains velocity and depth, ending with a long, persistent finish. Drink now through 2022. 637 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands
review: Like walking through a rose garden, this offers exotic, perfumed scents. Starts out elegant and understated but gains depth and complexity, fanning out with black licorice, dusty earth and dried herb flavors that highlight the zesty raspberry fruit. Drink now. 2,286 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands
review: Rustic and edgy, in an alluring style, with a crushed rock minerality to the vivid dark berry, raspberry and subtle earth and herb touches. The finish gains momentum and carries the flavors a long way. Drink now through 2021. 2,168 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands
review: Very complex, rich and flavorful, offering a mix of plum, spice and mineral flavors, ending with forest floor and mushroom notes.—Kosta Browne non-blind vertical (March 2011). Drink now. 272 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands Garys' Vineyard
review: Plump and supple up front, with plum and black cherry flavors. Gains firmness and backbone, featuring detailed, fine-grained tannins that shade the earth and anise notes. Drink now. 552 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands Garys' Vineyard
review: Supple and immediately pleasing, with tasty plum, wild berry and floral scents. Smooth-textured and full-bodied, gaining structure and depth and unfolding in a graceful, supple manner. Drink now through 2018. 439 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands Garys' Vineyard
review: Dense and extracted, making points for its subtle, well-focused, elegant flavors.—Kosta Browne non-blind vertical (March 2011). Drink now through 2019. 436 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands Pisoni Vineyard
review: Plump and generous, with lively, delicate, earth- and gravel-laced plum and black cherry flavors, gaining a spicy quality and firming with fine-grained tannins on the aftertaste. Drink now. 175 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands Pisoni Vineyard
review: An intense red, focused on pure, ripe and vivid plum, raspberry, wild berry and black tea flavors, with a touch of underbrush and a persistent finish. Drink now through 2021. 154 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands Pisoni Vineyard
review: Very tight but also very concentrated, with great density and focus. Ends with a complex mix of berry and loamy earth flavors that are focused and persistent. The most closed and restrained of the 2009 Kosta Brown wines. Best from 2012 through 2020. 142 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands Pisoni Vineyard
review: Rich and loamy, with melted licorice and dark berry flavors, firm tannins and dash of mocha.—Kosta Browne non-blind vertical (March 2011). Drink now through 2020. 115 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands Rosella's Vineyard
review: This generous red offers ripe plum, raspberry and wild berry flavors, with hints of crushed rock, wilted rose, fresh-cut herbs and a measure of creamy, vanilla-tinged oak. The tannins are well-integrated. Drink now through 2021. 549 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands Rosella's Vineyard
review: Spicy and peppery, in a stemmy way, this intense, full-bodied red delivers fresh, vibrant acidity and density, with loamy earth and dried berry notes. Greatly in need of cellaring. Best from 2012 through 2019. 272 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands Rosella's Vineyard
review: This fresh, juicy Pinot shows a touch of watermelon woven with the blueberry and wild berry flavors. Elegant, stylish, persistent.—Kosta Browne non-blind vertical (March 2011). Drink now through 2020. 255 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Delivers a pure, focused core of wild berry, raspberry, gravel, anise, dried herb and savory notes that are pleasantly tannic. The fruit pushes through in the end, finishing in a juicy, mouthwatering manner. Drink now through 2022. 6,581 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Mature, very complex, offering a range of dried berry, jam, tar, forest floor and black licorice notes. Soft and fleshy in a pleasant way.—Kosta Browne non-blind vertical (March 2011). Drink now. 1,010 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Gap's Crown Vineyard
review: Strikes a beautiful balance between ripe plum, raspberry and black cherry notes and subtle, delicate floral, lavender and anise scents, turning supple and graceful on the finish. Drink now through 2019. 1,678 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Gap's Crown Vineyard
review: The other wine I was able to guess. This shows a distinct herbal edge in this tasting, offering a subtler, subdued presence, with complex dark berry, herb and tea notes.—Kosta Browne non-blind vertical (March 2011). Drink now through 2020. 690 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Kanzler Vineyard
review: Focused on a rich core of dark berry, raspberry and savory dried herb notes, this gains depth and dimension midpalate on, ending with a potent mix of vivid flavors supported by fine-grained tannins. Drink now through 2022. 781 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley One Sixteen
review: Charming for the rich, creamy mix of anise, pear, fig and apricot notes. A wine that is both intense and, at points, seamless and refined. Ends with edgy tannins but complex flavors. Drink now through 2022. 2,337 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley One Sixteen
review: Shows intensity and vibrancy, exhibiting a complex mix of mineral- and citrus-laced green apple flavors, with subtle touches of toasty oak. Ends with a full-bodied aftertaste that should be better after a year. Drink now. 2,912 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir California 4-Barrel
review: Combines pure, ripe plum and raspberry fruit with touches of fresh earth, anise and lavender, graced by the right mix of acidity and tannins. Tightens on the finish in a good way, with the tannins giving the flavors traction. Drink now through 2022. 89 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir California 4-Barrel
review: Remarkably elegant and delicate, with a supple texture and an open-knit mix of juicy plum and raspberry. Yet for all its subtlety, this firms nicely on the finish, where the tannins are firm and detailed. Drink now through 2020. 351 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir California 4-Barrel
review: Mature and vibrant, with lively cola, sassafras and dried berry flavors, ending with a very delicate aftertaste. From Kanzler, Miron, Gap's Crown and Rosella's vineyards.—Kosta Browne non-blind vertical (March 2011). Drink now. 101 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley
review: Lightly perfumed floral and raspberry scents gain depth, weight and dimension, with blackberry, raspberry, spice and sandy earth notes that are refined. Drink now through 2022. 5,914 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley
review: Combines a tight, firm framework and a complex mix of dark berry, anise, gravel, road tar and savory herb notes, finishing with a long, clean, layered aftertaste. Should reward short-term cellaring. Drink now through 2020. 5,709 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley
review: A strikingly graceful, complex and layered effort that puts the raspberry, wild berry, anise and floral scents front and center, and keeps them at the forefront through the long, lingering finish. Drink now through 2022. 7,123 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Amber Ridge Vineyard
review: Mature yet drinking well, with dark berry, tea, mineral and herb notes. Holding nicely.—Kosta Browne non-blind vertical (March 2011). Drink now through 2016. 212 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Cohn Vineyard
review: Dense, rich and well-extracted, pulling out the supple charm of the grape's vivid berry, spice and earth notes. The fruit purity shines and sustains the flavors. Long and lingering on the aftertaste. Drink now through 2023. 99 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Cohn Vineyard
review: Very rich, spicy and firm, with complex brown sugar, stewed plum and wild berry flavors. Ends with a minerally note.—Kosta Browne non-blind vertical (March 2011). Drink now through 2017. 260 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Giusti Ranch
review: Brimming with rich, juicy wild berry and blueberry fruit, shaded by firm, dusty, hazelnut-scented tannins, this ends snug and tannic, yet the depth and persistence are evident. Drink now through 2022. 768 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Giusti Ranch
review: Deceptively complex, with subtle, vibrant raspberry and blackberry flavors that are fresh and vibrant, revealing touches of black cherry and red plum that are expansive. Ends with a touch of crushed rock and fresh-turned earth. Drink now through 2022. 949 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Keefer Ranch
review: This is firm and well-centered on ripe plum, black cherry and raspberry flavors, this is clean, trim and persistent on the finish. Good now, but should be better in a year. Drink now through 2022. 1,385 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Keefer Ranch
review: Spicy, earthy and vibrant, with wild berry, sage and herb notes. Finishes somewhat simpler in this grouping.—Kosta Browne non-blind vertical (March 2011). Drink now through 2018. 698 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Koplen Vineyard
review: Begins restrained but expands, gaining velocity and depth, with gravel-laced tannins and supple plum and black cherry flavors. Impressive for the delicate aftertaste. Drink now through 2022. 744 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Koplen Vineyard
review: Complex cherry, plum and raspberry flavors are ripe, moderately rich and layered, turning delicate and elegant, where the plummy flavors reverberate. Best from 2013 through 2023. 780 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Koplen Vineyard
review: Chewy and extracted, with complex, understated flavors of spice, tea and dried berry. Maintains its tannic muscle.—Kosta Browne non-blind vertical (March 2011). Drink now through 2016. 724 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands
review: Tight and spicy, with a sassafras edge to the wild berry and raspberry flavors, offering a hint of anise and licorice. Lively acidity keeps this fresh and zesty. Drink now through 2023. 1,251 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands
review: Offers ripe, generous plum, wild berry and blueberry fruit that's both tight and intense, yet shows a supple texture. Gains muscle and weight on the finish. Best from 2013 through 2023. 768 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands Garys' Vineyard
review: Offers a wide range of complex flavors, extending from herb to spice to wild berry, turning to shadings of wilted rose and subtle earth. Drink now through 2023. 555 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands Garys' Vineyard
review: Fresh and vibrant, featuring snappy wild berry, cola, raspberry and dusty earth notes. Tight but expansive, with the fruit playing a bigger role toward the finish, where the tannins grip and hold the flavors. Drink now through 2021. 493 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands Pisoni Vineyard
review: Openly fruity, supple and harmonious, with ripe plum, raspberry, black cherry and anise. Most striking for the graceful balance and elegant aftertaste. Drink now through 2021. 124 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands Rosella's Vineyard
review: Tight, dense and structured, with vibrant, snappy wild berry, fresh earth, cedar and anise. Pure and focused, ending with delicacy and refinement. Best from 2014 through 2022. 433 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Focused on pure, ripe plum and black cherry flavors, this is supple and structured, ending with a mix of baking spices, anise, mocha and black tea notes. Drink now through 2022. 7,203 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Displays a firm, generous mix of dried berry, mineral, cedar and sage, with touches of wilted rose, raspberry and cranberry, ending with fine, detailed tannins. Drink now through 2022. 4,940 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Graceful and elegant, full-bodied, this offers rich, complex notes of cola, spice and mixed dark berries. Firm, structured tannins mark the finish.—Kosta Browne non-blind vertical (March 2011). Drink now through 2016. 1,821 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Gap's Crown Vineyard
review: Firm and tight, with acidity and tannins imparting structure and definition. The core of raspberry, anise, cedar and red licorice are presented in a restrained manner, gaining depth and persistence on the finish. Drink now through 2022. 2,481 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Gap's Crown Vineyard
review: Exhibiting rich dark berry, raspberry, mocha and savory herb notes, this is very complex and well-built, with firm, fine-grained tannins that give the flavors traction. Drink now through 2022. 2,186 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Gap's Crown Vineyard
review: Trim and focused, with a spicy herbal edge to the dried berry, mineral, tar and cedar notes. Full-bodied, ending with a neatly tapered finish that ends on a fresh earthy, pebbly aftertaste. Best from 2012 through 2020. 1,480 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Kanzler Vineyard
review: The purity and brilliance of the plum and raspberry fruit rises to the occasion, giving this depth, complexity and persistence. Presents a supple texture amid the pleasant weave of savory touches. Drink now. 648 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley One Sixteen
review: Tight and concentrated, with a trim mix of subtle pear, honeysuckle, green fig and apple flavors. Aromas of fresh citrus and honeydew gain through the long and persistent finish. Drink now through 2020. 2,462 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley One Sixteen
review: Showing a pithy orange peel and spicy floral edge to the white peach and mineral notes, this is young and tight, gaining gains depth and intensity. Needs time. Best from 2013 through 2019. 512 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley
review: Smooth and inviting, offering charming flavors of wild berry, blueberry, spice and cedar. Supple in texture, long and lingering on the finish. Drink now. 6,859 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley
review: Fresh, bright, ripe black cherry, raspberry and light floral scents lead off in this supple, fleshy, full-bodied red, which is complex and layered on the palate, maintaining its core fruitiness and gaining subtle touches of dark berry and spice. Drink now through 2018. 4,320 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Cohn Vineyard
review: This is deceptively complex and nuanced, with a taut core of raspberry and wild berry notes and touches of anise and nutmeg. The flavors build gracefully on the finish. Drink now through 2020. 60 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Giusti Ranch
review: Firm, with a dense, expansive core of dark berry, mineral, dried herb, dried porcino mushroom and black tea flavors, ending with dry, gripping tannins and a pleasant push of fruit on the finish. Drink now through 2022. 626 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Keefer Ranch
review: Generous, focused flavors of spicy plum and wild berry notes are at the core, with firm tannins. Well-proportioned, ending with supple wilted rose and raspberry accents that are clean and persistent. Drink now through 2022. 1,355 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Keefer Ranch
review: A delicate, understated style, featuring pure, ripe raspberry and wild berry notes, with a touch of gravel. Ends with floral-anise scents and fine-grained tannins. Drink now through 2019. 818 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands
review: Presents a rich, powerful display of blackberry, raspberry, spice and floral scents, with touches of smoky oak, anise and dusty earth and a long, persistent finish. Drink now through 2022. 1,849 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands Garys' Vineyard
review: Offers a plump and fleshy medley of dark berryblueberry, blackberry and wild berrygaining depth and dimension. Firms pleasantly on the finish. Drink now through 2020. 313 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands Garys' Vineyard
review: Distinctive for its understated flavors of dried berry, loamy earth and mushroom. Soft, fleshy finish.—Kosta Browne non-blind vertical (March 2011). Drink now. 365 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands Pisoni Vineyard
review: Very rich, supple and spicy, with wild berry, light oak, subtle earth, savory herb and underbrush notes. Most impressive for the length and tannic weight. Drink now through 2023. 162 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands Pisoni Vineyard
review: Offers a mix of rich raspberry and red berry fruit, with a measure of elegance and finesse. Offers hints of anise and dried herb, ending with delicate tannins on the simple finish. Drink now through 2022. 539 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands Rosella's Vineyard
review: Pure and rich, with vivid blackberry, wild berry and raspberry flavors that are snappy and zesty, offering lively acidity and firm tannins marked by a touch of stemminess. Ends with an elegant, layered finish. Drink now through 2022. 539 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands Rosella's Vineyard
review: Shares the Garys' profile of understated flavors built around forest floor, mushroom, dried berry, sage and anise flavors. Drinking well now.—Kosta Browne non-blind vertical (March 2011). Drink now. 365 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Notably elegant and rich, with a deceptively deep and persistent mix of raspberry and wild berry flavors, shaded by gravelly earth and savory notes that lose a bit of focus on the finish. Drink now through 2023. 5,550 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Kanzler Vineyard
review: Complex and defined by a mix of savory black tea, raspberry, sandalwood and light earth notes, gaining tannic strength and richness without losing focus or persistence. Drink now through 2023. 657 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Kanzler Vineyard
review: A sleeker, more refined manner, offering ripe raspberry, cherry and strawberry notes, with touches of floral, anise and cedar. Drink now through 2020. 121 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley One Sixteen
review: A racy, exciting style, with a touch of grassiness to the core pear and green apple notes, this is pure, clean and focused, long and persistent, if pithy in texture. Drink now. 2,167 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley One Sixteen
review: Sleek and perfumed, with pretty floral scents wrapped around lively and refreshing flavors of subtle tangerine and nectarine. Drink now through 2016. 2,191 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Keefer Ranch
review: A wine of substance and finesse, full of supple earth, gravel-laced berry and plum flavors. A charmer. Drink now through 2022. 2,238 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Koplen Vineyard
review: Firm and vibrant, with an edge of savory herb and fresh earth to the snappy wild berry, raspberry and licorice notes. Needs time. Drink now through 2020. 537 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Koplen Vineyard
review: Mature and drying, but complex and subtle, this shows forest floor, mineral, dried berry and cherry pie notes.—Kosta Browne non-blind vertical (March 2011). Drink now. 142 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands
review: Gutsy, showing tannic muscle, this offers tidbits of dark berry, with grainy, gripping tannins and notes of cedar and crushed rock. Complete, but should improve with cellaring. Drink now through 2022. 1,693 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands Garys' Vineyard
review: An elegant, graceful style, with red berry, strawberry and watermelon notes that are also quite firm and concentrated, ending with a long, lingering finish. Drink now through 2022. 776 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands Rosella's Vineyard
review: Well-proportioned, with a nice backbone of tannin and acidity and a tight core of spicy, loamy wild berry, cedar and anise notes that should gain by 2018. Drink now through 2024. 374 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Offers direct, rich and deep red and dark berry flavors that are spicy, pleasantly tannic and chewy, ending with a pure, rich burst of fruit that tails off into drying tannins. Tasted twice with consistent notes. Drink now. 6,935 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Fresh and vibrant, tight and well-balanced, with zesty, snappy raspberry and wild berry notes, this gains richness and depth on the licorice-accented finish. Drink now through 2020. 5,004 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Shows a smoky, baconlike charry richness, with loamy earth and dried berry.—Kosta Browne non-blind vertical (March 2011). Drink now through 2018. 3,554 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Gap's Crown Vineyard
review: Rich and spicy, with a dense core of extracted dark berry, mocha, spice, cedary oak and loamy earth notes. Packs a lot of flavor into a style that will benefit from short-term cellaring. Drink now through 2023. 2,817 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Gap's Crown Vineyard
review: Supple and generous, with ripe plum and blackberry flavors, this is aromatic and delicate, enticingly friendly and easy to drink, ending with fine-grained tannins. Drink now. 2,694 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Bright and open-textured, showing real transparency to the grapefruit, lime and green papaya flavors, with a hint of mineral as the finish lingers easily. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Lively, juicy, round and generous with its apricot, lime and grapefruit flavors, pointing its beam of flavor into the long, focused finish. Drink now. 1,750 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Flavors of pear, peach, mango and citrus are elegant, with a smooth texture and refreshing acidity. Drink now. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 1,600 cases imported.

name: Santorini Nikteri
review: Very rich and spicy, with concentrated flavors of pear sauce, honeysuckle, fennel and white currant that are supported by vibrant acidity. Minerally finish fills the long, creamy finish.  Drink now through 2020. 200 cases made.

name: Santorini
review: This rich, refined and full-flavored white has fine cut to its apple, grapefruit and peach flavors, with lively acidity and plenty of creamy notes, which extend with golden raisin and tropical fruits on the powerful finish. Drink now through 2016. 4,000 cases made.

name: Santorini
review: This is filled with powerful smoky notes that flank the baked apple and pear tart flavors. A touch rough hewn, but plenty of lush spiciness on the juicy finish. Drink now through 2018. 3,000 cases made.

name: Assyrtiko Santorini
review: An intense-tasting white, featuring concentrated ripe tropical fruit flavors and powerful minerally notes. Anise and basil accents mark the finish. Drink now through 2016. 2,083 cases made.

name: Santorini
review: Dried pear and pineapple flavors blend well in this ripe white, which features accents of lemon meringue. The long finish has plenty of smoke and spice accents. Drink now through 2018. 3,000 cases made.

name: Santorini
review: A powerful, distinctive white, with concentrated flavors of quince, melon and grapefruit. There's a crisp, focused finish of spice, mineral and lime. Drink now through 2012. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Santorini
review: Offers a creamy aroma, with flavors to match, joined by plenty of tropical fruit notes. The finish is intense, with exotic spice. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Assyrtiko Santorini Ksera Homata
review: Dense and powerful, with white currant, lemon-lime and baked pineapple flavors that turn creamy and lush. Savory notes extend on the smoky finish. Drink now. 150 cases made.

name: Santorini Vinsanto
review: A thick sweetie, with candied apricot and pineapple flavors, joined by some buttery notes on the finish. Drink now. 833 cases made.

name: Santorini Red
review: A light- to medium-bodied red, with tea, cola and dried cherry flavors and a mapley finish. Mandelaria, Mavrathiro and Mavrotragano.

name: Santorini Barrel Fermented
review: Mature-tasting, with touches of maderization. 500 cases imported.

name: Zinfandel Napa Valley
review: Lively, with very good intensity to plum, wild berry and mustard seed flavors, with tart, gripping structure and generous cedary oak. Drink now through 2007. 1,454 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Campfire, mineral, spice, leather and blackberry notes have good intensity on a chewy, tannic frame. Drink now through 2006. 860 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Napa Valley
review: Very ripe, with dried black cherry, earth and fresh herb tones wrapped in loads of smoky, cedary oak and green-edged tannins. Drink now through 2007. 455 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Nouvelle Vague No. 13
review: A white chocolate dream. Incredibly concentrated and viscous, lively and complex at the same time. The white chocolate is augmented by lemon peel, vanilla custard and apricot flavors that pulse through the finish. Best after 2000. 133 cases made.

name: Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Grande Cuvée Nouvelle Vague No. 10
review: Complex and ethereal. Concentrated and thick, yet lighter than air, this sweetie combines apricot, caramel and vanilla flavors with a velvety texture and vibrant acidity. Picks up a smoky note on the finish. Beautifully done. Drink now through 2010. 330 cases made.

name: Welschriesling Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Zwischen den Seen No. 11
review: A rich, concentrated and seductive sweetie, with a core of chocolate and butterscotch flavors. There are plenty of fruit notes to this as well, dominated by dried apricot, ripe pear and baked apple. Long, long finish, with touches of smoke and spice. A monumental effort. Drink now through 2030. 7 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Nouvelle Vague No. 13
review: Nectar. Packed with apricot, mandarin orange, honey and hints of spice, this explodes on the palate, thanks to its submerged acidity and precision balance. A lovely expression of sweet wine, integrating the botrytis elements beautifully. Best from 2002 through 2015. 125 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Nouvelle Vague No. 7
review: Not flamboyant, but concentrated and focused, its butterscotch, vanilla and apricot flavors unfolding bit by bit until they coat the palate. The bright acidity lends support and keeps it all together. Endless finish. Best from 2004 through 2015. 130 cases made.

name: Chardonnay-Welschriesling Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Nouvelle Vague No. 7
review: This dessert white from Austria is very aromatic, sporting floral elements alongside passion fruit and butterscotch flavors, especially on the finish. A beam of acidity running throughout makes it sing. Drink now through 2005.

name: Welschriesling Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Zwischen den Seen No. 7
review: There's impeccable balance, depth and concentration to this ripe, luscious sweetie. Ripe apricot, peach and pineapple flavors fill this to the brim, topped by lush vanilla, white chocolate and cream notes that linger on the finish. Drink now through 2030.

name: Chardonnay Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Nouvelle Vague No. 4
review: A thick, rich and powerful sweetie, with concentrated flavors of ripe pineapple, melon and glazed apricot that are full and lush. Very creamy and spicy, this oozes with pure honey notes, lingering on the slightly savory finish. Drink now through 2045. 50 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Nouvelle Vague No. 5
review: Seductively creamy and spicy, showing plenty of freshness and purity to its ripe grapefruit, toffee, honey and beeswax flavors. This complex wine offers notes of tarragon on the rich finish, which is filled with accents white chocolate. Drink now through 2050. 125 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Nouvelle Vague No. 9
review: Elegant and rich, with an impressive purity and concentration to the ripe peach, apricot, vanilla and cream flavors. The spicy finish of cinnamon and nutmeg is lush and filled with ripe tropical fruit notes. Very honeyed and complex. Drink now through 2040.

name: Scheurebe Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Zwischen den Seen No. 10
review: Candied apricot and ripe pear flavors fill this lush and focused sweetie. There's also a reservoir of buttercream, vanilla and spice that give this plenty of richness as well. Unctuous, balanced finish. Drink now through 2015. 50 cases imported.

name: Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Grande Cuvée Nouvelle Vague No. 7
review: Amazingly lush and unctuous, with an impressive silkiness and loads of buttercream, vanilla, ripe pear and baked apple flavors. Balanced, thick and ripe, with plenty of structure. The elegant finish is filled with lots of hot toddy notes. Chardonnay and Welschriesling. Drink now through 2020. 50 cases imported.

name: Welschriesling Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Zwischen den Seen No. 11
review: A contradiction in terms. Great dramatic tension between the intense sweetness and unctuous texture and the vivid, racy structure. The aromas and flavors evoke dried apricot, caramel, orange marmalade and Indian spices. Long, long finish. Best from 2002 through 2015.

name: Welschriesling Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Zwischen den Seen No. 2
review: Rich and silky-smooth, full of raisinlike flavors, baked apple and honey. Super acidity cleanses the palate, leaving an impression of a wine lighter than this actually is. Drink from 1999 through 2005.

name: Welschriesling Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Zwischen den Seen No. 8
review: Gorgeous, with an elegant structure and impressive richness. This has a deep well of butterscotch, almond, ripe pear and candied apricot flavors that are flanked by seductive spicy and creamy notes. Finishes with fine balance and freshness. Drink now through 2025. 37 cases imported.

name: Welschriesling Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Zwischen den Seen No. 8
review: Wonderful intensity here. Honey, candied citrus and apricot flavors are dripping with botrytis, lending a pungent, spicy character, and there's a vibrant acidity supporting it all. Very sweet, yet clean and almost mouthwatering on the long finish. Best from 2006 through 2020. 165 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Nouvelle Vague No. 11
review: Shows an essence of apricot nectar, with decadent spicy notes to the thick, rich flavors of ripe pineapple, white chocolate, candied cherry and peach cobbler. The endless finish is pillowy, revealing ripe melon, nutmeg and lavender notes. Drink now through 2045. 50 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Nouvelle Vague No. 3
review: Liquid candy. White chocolate, butterscotch, vanilla cream and citrus all come to mind as this white caresses the palate. Intensely flavored, yet very sleek and graceful, with a long finish and aftertaste that combines chocolate and toasted nuts. Drink now through 2012. 215 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Nouvelle Vague No. 7
review: There's a lot of botrytis in this thick, ultrasweet nectar, which today covers the vibrant structure and mutes the orange marmalade, butterscotch and nutmeg notes. It has balance and a beautiful texture, melting in the mouth on the long finish. Best from 2006 through 2020. 150 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Nouvelle Vague No. 9
review: Seductive sweetie, filled with honey, cream and caramel flavors that are broad and lush. Like drinking liquid nectar, with a deep well of vanilla bean, dark rum and white chocolate notes. Long, elegant finish. Drink now through 2015. 50 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Nouvelle Vague No. 9
review: Clean and opulent, this melts in the mouth, unfolding layer after layer of honey, citrus blossom, orange peel and vanilla. The purity and harmony are rhapsodic as it fades gently away over the long finish. Drink now through 2012.

name: Scheurebe Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Zwischen den Seen No. 10
review: Fruity and lush, with vivid cherry, berry and dark currant flavors that show a racy edge. Marmalade notes come to the fore, revealing savory elements that linger on the cream- and spice-filled finish. Fresh and lustrous. Drink now through 2042. 200 cases made.

name: Scheurebe Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Zwischen den Seen No. 10
review: Intense and structured, with delicious ripe Fuji apple flavors, flanked by plenty of honey and allspice. There's also plenty of mineral, with citrus notes that linger on the long, sumptuous finish. Drink now through 2030.

name: Scheurebe Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Zwischen den Seen No. 11
review: A powerful sweetie, delivering intense flavors of apricot, chamomile and pear tart that coat the mouth with creamy lusciousness. Features lemon curd and peach jam on the rich finish. Drink now through 2035. 1,000 cases made.

name: Scheurebe Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Zwischen den Seen No. 11
review: Thick, rich and ripe, with an aroma of orange blossom and concentrated flavors of baked pineapple, peach, pear and spice. The long, lush finish drips with honey and touches of cream, all backed up by firm acidity. Drink now through 2020.

name: Scheurebe Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Zwischen den Seen No. 3
review: Very lush and rich-tasting, this features concentrated flavors of pear tart, ripe apple and buttercream that take on loads of spicy notes. Buttery midpalate, with notes of ripe melon that flow into the rich, plush finish. A mouthwatering sweetie. Drink now through 2045. 250 cases made.

name: Scheurebe Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Zwischen den Seen No. 8
review: Rich and unctuous, with plenty of fresh acidity behind the pure and focused flavors of Gala apple, melon, lemon curd and pear tart. A suave style, offering some savory notes on the long, creamy finish. Drink now through 2050. 150 cases made.

name: Scheurebe Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Zwischen den Seen No. 12
review: Thickly textured, deftly balanced and pure in its apricot, ginger and caramel flavors, this is dominated by intense sweetness today, yet never gets heavy, and finishes with grace and clarity. Best from 2002 through 2010.

name: Scheurebe Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Zwischen den Seen No. 9
review: Luscious and ethereal at once, mingling honey and grapefruit notes with a creamy texture and bright structure. Well-integrated and moderately sweet, with a finish that lasts and lasts. Drink now through 2010. 130 cases made.

name: Traminer Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Nouvelle Vague No. 8
review: Rich and well-crafted, offering deep and rich flavors of peach, apricot, golden raisin and allspice layered with cream and butterscotch. Light on its feet, this displays plenty of vibrant acidity and a long, plush and unctuous finish. Drink now through 2040. 75 cases made.

name: Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Grande Cuvée Nouvelle Vague No. 6
review: Vibrant and lush, with pure flavors of ripe pineapple, melon, apple pastry and dried apricot that mesh seamlessly. Very spicy, with a rich yet fresh finish of buttercream and white chocolate. Unctuous. Drink now through 2050. 150 cases made.

name: Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Grande Cuvée Nouvelle Vague No. 6
review: An intensely honeyed and concentrated sweetie, with unctuous flavors of apricot, peach, pear and apple, with a lively acidity and a lushness that extends into the long, butter- and cream-filled finish. Drink now through 2040. 1,000 cases made.

name: Welschriesling Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Nouvelle Vague No. 10
review: An ethereal sweet wine, that melts away on the palate. It begins with an opening salvo of dried tropical fruit, caramel and candied citrus aromas and flavors, seamlessly meshed with the sweetness and acidity, giving an impression of cashmere on the palate. It ends with lingering caramel and apricot notes. Well-done. Drink now through 2015. 650 cases made.

name: Welschriesling Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Zwischen den Seen No. 10
review: Extremely unctuous, sweet and mouthcoating, this seeps into the palate with honey and candied citrus flavors and stays there for a long time. It's impressive for its weight more than its finesse, although there's good structure. Drink now through 2010. 30 cases made.

name: Welschriesling Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Zwischen den Seen No. 8
review: Not as showy today as some of its peers, yet this promises plenty in the future. Thick and full of apricot, coconut and citrus notes, intensely sweet and offset by a lively structure, it's balanced and complex with a wonderful sense of harmony. The finish just melts away. Best from 2004 through 2012. 130 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Beerenauslese Neusiedlersee Nouvelle Vague No. 6
review: Young and opulent, exhibiting vanilla and honey aromas followed by flavors of butterscotch, dried apricot and orange peel, all focused by a racy framework. Great intensity and depth of flavor, with a long finish. Best from 2001 through 2007. 48 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Nouvelle Vague No. 8
review: Rich, unctuous, long and creamy, with concentrated ripe apricot, pear and apple tart flavors that are full of honeyed notes. Very spicy on the plush finish. Drink now through 2035. 1,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Nouvelle Vague No. 8
review: Rich, ripe and lush, with loads of ripe pear, butter and cream notes that are long and well-spiced. The finish is powered by crème brûlée and white chocolate notes. Drink now through 2040. 1,000 cases made.

name: Muskat Ottonel Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Zwischen den Seen No. 1
review: Very concentrated, this is filled with glazed apricot, ripe pear and baked peach flavors. The spicy finish is long and lush, with butterscotch and honey cream notes. Drink now through 2035. 1,000 cases made.

name: Muskat Ottonel Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Zwischen den Seen No. 2
review: A zesty sweetie, with a savory edge to the red peach, Fuji apple and gooseberry flavors, displaying a luxuriant minerality. Floral notes linger on the finish, offering a rich spiciness and plenty of sage honey elements. Drink now through 2040. 75 cases made.

name: Muskat Ottonel Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Zwischen den Seen No. 5
review: An enticing aroma of grapefruit leads to flavors of candied citrus and apricot followed by lush, rich notes of butterscotch, honey, white chocolate and cream. Unctuous and complex, with a long, long finish. Drink now through 2040.

name: Scheurebe Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Zwischen den Seen No. 12
review: Richly viscous, peachy and suave, with rich glazed apricot and pineapple flavors. The silky finish is loaded with cream and spice. Drink now through 2018.

name: Scheurebe Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Zwischen den Seen No. 4
review: Impressively concentrated and lush-tasting, with loads of ruby grapefruit, peach, apricot, honey and butter flavors. There's plenty of structure to back it all up, with a long finish of baked peach and allspice. Drink now through 2025. 167 cases made.

name: Scheurebe Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Zwischen den Seen No. 7
review: Ripe apple and pear flavors appear in this luxuriant and creamy sweetie, featuring a fresh spiciness and hints of savory herbs. Very honeyed on the finish, with some notes of maple. Drink now. 150 cases made.

name: Scheurebe Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Zwischen den Seen No. 4
review: Heavily botrytized and a little monolithic at this stage, but there's plenty of concentration and vibrant acidity to offset the sweetness and apricot, honey and citrus flavors. Should come together by 2000.

name: Scheurebe Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Zwischen den Seen No. 6
review: Juicy and sweet, with apricot and baked apple flavors, and notes of smoke and candied grapefruit. Wonderful balance and acidity, and loads of spice on the fresh finish. Drink now through 2020. 150 cases imported.

name: Scheurebe Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Zwischen den Seen No. 9
review: Candied grapefruit, clove and honey notes are backed by a firm structure. It's all balanced, finishing cleanly. Thick and lush, yet I don't find the focused flavors here of the Chardonnay and Welschriesling. Drink now through 2015. 100 cases made.

name: Scheurebe Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Zwischen den Seen No. 9
review: Thick and sweet, yet backed by vivid acidity, this adds an herbal note to the caramel, dried fig and apricot flavors. It needs time to integrate the flavors with the structure. Fine, refreshing finish. Best from 2003 through 2015. 900 cases made.

name: Traminer Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Nouvelle Vague No. 5
review: A rich mix of crushed red fruit and ripe melon fills this luscious and rich dessert-style white. Deeply colored, this delivers plenty of plushness to the butterscotch and honey cream flavors, lingering with some sage notes on the finish. Drink now through 2045. 75 cases made.

name: Traminer Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Nouvelle Vague No. 8
review: Wow. Intense and smoky, this Traminer TBA shows tropical fruit and botrytis elements, like pineapple and citrus peel, on a racy structure. It evolves nicely across the palate to the finish, where it turns to smoke and tobacco nuances. Drink now through 2008.

name: Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Grande Cuvée Nouvelle Vague No. 6
review: Lush, buttery and creamy, with concentrated flavors of ripe pear, dried mango and roasted pineapple. Features brioche accents midpalate, with an unctuous finish of spice and honey. Welschriesling and Chardonnay. Drink now through 2045. 333 cases made.

name: Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Grande Cuvée Nouvelle Vague No. 6
review: Butter cream notes abound in this big and juicy sweetie, featuring ripe pear, apple and peach flavors, with some candied ginger notes. Viscous and spicy at midpalate, this delivers a long and custardy, yet crisp, finish that goes on and on. Welschriesling and Chardonnay. Drink now through 2045. 225 cases made.

name: Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Grande Cuvée Nouvelle Vague No. 6
review: Offers a pure-tasting mix of ripe apple and peach flavors that are fresh and crunchy, oozing sweetness, with a hint of savory herb on the back end. Finishes with smoke and spice. Drink now through 2018.

name: Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Grande Cuvée Nouvelle Vague No. 6
review: Terrific flavors of apricot, hazelnut, butter and vanilla pick up a smoky element on the finish. It's the seamless texture and lively structure that complete the overall impression. More elegant than some of the Kracher lineup, showing well now.  Drink now through 2008. 200 cases made.

name: Welschriesling Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Zwischen den Seen No. 4
review: Rich and full of well-spiced flavors of baked pear, roasted peach, pineapple and dried mango. Complex, with fresh acidity to back up the sweet elements. Pastry and buttery notes fill the finish. Drink now through 2035. 2,000 cases made.

name: Welschriesling Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Zwischen den Seen No. 7
review: An unctuous dessert-style white, with a creamy texture and loads of full and rich flavors of ripe peach, pear, apricot and honey. Hums on the finish, displaying a long flush of spice and wild cherry. Drink now through 2036. 150 cases made.

name: Welschriesling Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Nouvelle Vague No. 4
review: A wonderful mélange of flavors. Botrytis adds a mushroom note to the apricot and orange nuances. Intense, concentrated and complex, it still has a raw edge that needs time to smooth out. Takes on a deep, earthy accent on the finish. Best from 2002 through 2010.

name: Welschriesling Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Zwischen den Seen No. 4
review: Apricot, honey and zesty citrus notes highlight this elegant, focused dessert wine. Moderately sweet and light in weight, with a firm structure, it lingers on the finish. It needs a very light dessert. Drink now through 2010. 250 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Nouvelle Vague No. 10
review: Essence of baked apple, with elegant notes of cream, spice and peach cobbler. There's also a luscious core of pear tart. The long finish features notes of baked pineapple and mango. Drink now through 2020. 75 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Nouvelle Vague No. 8
review: A creamy style, offering ripe pear and apple pastry flavors that are flanked by plenty of spice and honeyed accents. Fresh acidity emerges midpalate, leading to a finish that offers notes of dried fig and allspice. Drink now through 2045. 125 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Nouvelle Vague No. 9
review: Intense, with spicy aromas and flavors, featuring ripe pear, peach and candied quince flavors alongside some jellied citrus notes. Backed by lively acidity, this boasts a finish of custard, hibiscus and butterscotch. Drink now through 2040. 50 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Nouvelle Vague
review: We've never tasted a Chardonnay like this. It's thick as honey and just as sweet, with exotic tropical fruit, spice and burnt almond aromas and flavors and a long, sweet finish.  An amazing sticky.

name: Chardonnay Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Nouvelle Vague No. 8
review: Beautiful wine. Gorgeous aromas of warm spice, orange, butterscotch and apricot. This flavorful, supersweet white has a firm structure if not quite the richness to round out all the edges. Drink now through 2007.
