name: Muscat Ottonel Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Zwischen den Seen No. 11
review: Incredibly dense and rich, displaying nutmeg, citrus peel and apricot essence, all the while maintaining a lovely sense of harmony. Not searingly high acidity, but enough to keep the finish clean and lively, with a white-chocolate aftertaste.

name: Muscat Ottonel Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Zwischen den Seen No. 5
review: Delicate in style, with rose petal, citrus and raisin flavors, this dessert wine glides across the palate gracefully, where the bright acidity delivers the honey and raisin on the lingering finish. Beautifully crafted.

name: Muskat Ottonel Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Zwischen den Seen No. 4
review: Big and thick, filled with rich butter cream, ripe pear and baked apple flavors that show white chocolate and chamomile accents. There's an unctuous spiciness on the finish, with ripe gooseberry and caramel notes. Drink now through 2040. 25 cases imported.

name: Muskat Ottonel Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Zwischen den Seen No. 9
review: Intensely fresh and fruity, with a plush creaminess to the flavors of peach, pear, glazed apricot and Gala apple, supported by fresh acidity. Very spicy and honeyed on the long, rich finish. Drink now through 2050. 100 cases made.

name: Scheurebe Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Zwischen den Seen No. 10
review: Thick and rich-tasting, with scrumptious flavors of brioche, French toast and butter. Cinnamon and spice details emerge midpalate, leading to a finish filled with honey notes and concentrated creaminess. Drink now through 2045. 250 cases made.

name: Scheurebe Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Zwischen den Seen No. 2
review: Features a deep well of ripe pear, glazed apricot and candied quince flavors that are thick with floral and spice notes. Hints of dried ginger and white pepper, accompanied by plenty of creamy notes, linger on the finish. Drink now through 2040. 25 cases imported.

name: Scheurebe Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Zwischen den Seen No. 3
review: Shows a note of chamomile to the viscous golden raisin, ripe apple and pear tart flavors, exhibiting plenty of luscious creaminess. Anise and pineapple hints appear on the long, rich and spice-infused finish. Drink now through 2038. 150 cases made.

name: Scheurebe Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Zwischen den Seen No. 5
review: Thick and rich, with plenty of spicy notes behind the green apple, pear and apricot flavors. Vanilla and glazed pineapple notes fill the intensely creamy finish. Drink now through 2018.

name: Scheurebe Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Zwischen den Seen No. 5
review: This is a moderately thick sweetie, with plenty of pure grapefruit, fig, almond and spice flavors all wrapped inside an inviting texture. There's also a freshness that extends onto the finish. Fig and vanilla cream linger on the long aftertaste. Drink now through 2015. 37 cases imported.

name: Traminer Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Nouvelle Vague No. 1
review: Concentrated toffee and buttercream flavors dominate this exotic sweetie, featuring notes of dried pineapple and mango. Fresh acidity lingers through the finish, which is filled with smoky details. Drink now through 2040. 150 cases made.

name: Traminer Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Nouvelle Vague No. 8
review: Spicy, floral aromas lead into a rich, seductive mix of savory herb, baked apple and nut flavors. Pineapple and cream flood the viscous finish. Drink now through 2018.

name: Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Grande Cuvée Nouvelle Vague No. 6
review: A rich and buttery dessert white, with notes of chamomile to the pear tart, crème brûlée and almond pastry flavors. Offers a well-spiced, honeyed finish. Chardonnay and Welschriesling. Drink now through 2035. 5,000 cases made.

name: Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Grande Cuvée Nouvelle Vague No. 6
review: Rich, structured and well-focused, with flavors of ripe peach, mineral and buttercream flavors. Candied apricot and macadamia nut fill the viscous finish. Drink now through 2030.

name: Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Grande Cuvée Nouvelle Vague No. 7
review: Rich glazed apricot and pineapple flavors fill this fruity dessert white. Concentrated spice and glazed mango notes carry through to the creamy finish. Drink now through 2018. 312 cases made.

name: Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Grande Cuvée Nouvelle Vague No. 6
review: Racy and intensely flavored, showing candied citrus, clove and honey notes. The texture is a little grainier and less supple than the best in this group, yet it's tasty and persistent. Drink now through 2006. 330 cases made.

name: Welschriesling Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Zwischen den Seen No. 11
review: Features an essence of apricot nectar, with plush and well-spiced flavors of peach pie, apple cobbler and cream that are mouthfilling and rich. Delivers a long, fat finish of lemon curd. Drink now through 2030. 150 cases made.

name: Welschriesling Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Zwischen den Seen No. 11
review: Very honeyed, creamy, and rich, with glazed apricot, pineapple, pear and peach flavors that are long and viscous. Offers clove and kumquat on the lively finish. Drink now through 2030. 1,000 cases made.

name: Welschriesling Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Zwischen den Seen No. 3
review: A fresh, fruity style, with good focus and precision to the baked peach, pear tart and candied yam flavors, offering concentrated notes of ginger and nutmeg. Accents of marshmallow and cream fill the finish. Drink now through 2042. 25 cases imported.

name: Welschriesling Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Zwischen den Seen No. 4
review: A plush, juicy style, with concentrated, rich flavors of apple pastry, savory herb, pear and lavender which are focused and fresh. Ripe orange and cream notes fill the bright finish. Drink now through 2045. 150 cases made.

name: Welschriesling Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Zwischen den Seen No. 7
review: This is loaded with rich tropical fruit flavors of pineapple and dried mango, complemented by a deep well of ripe pear and glazed peach. The honeyed finish lingers, with butterscotch and crème brûlée accents. Drink now through 2045. 250 cases made.

name: Welschriesling Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Zwischen den Seen No. 8
review: Deeply flavored, unctuous, lush and buttery, with a glorious array of ripe stone fruit flavors--peach, apricot and hints of nectarine--that are flanked by a spicy essence. Honey and cream fill the long finish. Drink now through 2020. 83 cases made.

name: Welschriesling Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Zwischen den Seen No. 15
review: Wow. Thick and mouthcoating, here's a superrich dessert-style wine that shows weight but never gets heavy or cloying. The flavors, ranging from candied orange peel and apricot to vanilla and crème brûlée, linger gracefully on the clean finish. Better than previously reviewed. Drink now through 2005.

name: Welschriesling Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Zwischen den Seen No. 5
review: This concentrated sweet white begins with a thick texture, and its sweetness covers the almost racy acidity today. Give it time for the structure to integrate and the intense honey, candied citrus, apricot and spice flavors to unwind. Best from 2006 through 2015. 150 cases made.

name: Welschriesling Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Zwischen den Seen No. 6
review: This concentrated dessert white lacks expression today, but it offers plenty of apricot, honey and citrus notes imbedded in its dense, lively structure. Fine length, too, so be patient. Best from 2002 through 2012.

name: Welschriesling Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Zwischen den Seen No. 8
review: Terrific dessert wine, combining the intensity of truffle, mint, dried apricot and citrus peel with a racy structure and great harmony. It melds beautifully on the long, long finish. Drink now through 2015. 650 cases made.

name: Zweigelt Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Nouvelle Vague No. 10
review: A delicious dessert wine, with everything in the right proportions. Apricot, crème brûlée and raisin character in spades, without being too sweet. Just when you think it's too much, the acidity sweeps the palate clean. Well done. Drink now through 2005.

name: Auslese Burgenland Cuvée
review: A lively and balanced sweetie, offering honeyed and creamy notes of peach, apricot and wild sage. Golden raisin and allspice accents linger on the vivid finish. Welschriesling and Chardonnay. Drink now through 2024. 225 cases imported.

name: Beerenauslese Burgenland Cuvée
review: Rich and creamy, with a vibrant array of lush apricot, peach and Fuji apple flavors that show butterscotch and dried quince elements. The long finish has plenty of honeyed notes. Welschriesling and Chardonnay. Drink now through 2032. 1,400 cases made.

name: Beerenauslese Neusiedlersee Nouvelle Vague
review: Tasting this is like biting into a piece of pecan pie. Full-bodied, and very sweet with wild coconut and honey flavors. Long, long finish. A unique wine. A blend of Chardonnay and Welschriesling.

name: Burgenland L09A Nouvelle Vague No. 7
review: The flavors of raspberry jam, spice, cherry and plum are broad and luscious, with notes of ginger and cinnamon. This has a crisp acidity, showing accents of dark currant and black fig on the finish. Drink now through 2035. 25 cases imported.

name: Burgenland L11B Zwischen den Seen No. 3
review: This sweetie has an alluring spiciness to the fresh, fruity flavors of strawberry, melon and cherry pie. The creamy finish is full and plush, with hints of mint. Best after 2030. 150 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Nouvelle Vague No. 10
review: Interesting notes of chamomile, tangerine and honey fill this rich, creamy sweetie. Concentrated fresh apricot notes extend on the crisp finish. Drink now through 2016.

name: Chardonnay Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Nouvelle Vague No. 4
review: Offers a spicy aroma, with good cut and minerality to the flavors of apple, white cherry and Bosc pear. Light-footed, featuring a finish that offers lanolin and ripe citrus notes. Drink now through 2040. 125 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Nouvelle Vague No. 5
review: This is very fresh and oozes with fresh citrus, apple and peach flavors that are flanked by plenty of spice and cream. Finishes with orange peel and candied ginger. Drink now through 2020. 125 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Nouvelle Vague No. 3
review: Full-bodied, opulent and packed with butterscotch, apricot and vanilla flavors. It's extremely supple, harmonious and long, with a buttered pastry aftertaste. It's sweet, but remains clean on the finish. Drink now through 2015. 165 cases made.

name: Chardonnay-Welschriesling Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Nouvelle Vague No. 3
review: A blend that combines the richness of Chardonnay with the raciness of Welschriesling. Full of apricot, honey and orange peel notes on a high wattage frame that gives an ethereal quality to the whole package. Yet there's intense dried fruit essence. Drink now through 2012. 1,100 cases made.

name: Chardonnay-Welschriesling Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Nouvelle Vague No. 7
review: Clean and focused, showing smoky caramel and citrus notes on a racy structure. Long finish. Best from 2002 through 2010.

name: Muscat Ottonel Beerenauslese Neusiedlersee Zwischen den Seen No. 5
review: Gorgeous purity in this butterscotch-, honey- and orange-flavored sweetie. Very sweet, thick and unctuous, yet remains lively and focused thanks to firm underlying acidity. Beautifully done. Drink now through 2005. 40 cases made.

name: Muscat Ottonel Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Zwischen den Seen No. 5
review: Beautiful. Clean and velvety, this dessert white juxtaposes richness and an airy, ethereal texture with flavors of orange, cinnamon, ground coriander, honey and ginger. Bright acidity keeps it lively and focused. Fine, lingering finish. Drink now through 2006.

name: Muskat Ottonel Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Zwischen den Seen No. 2
review: Vibrant and fresh-tasting, showing crunchy flavors of apple and peach, with touches of citrus. Features sage, honey and pineapple on the finish. Drink now through 2016.

name: Muskat Ottonel Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Zwischen den Seen No. 6
review: Creamy and lush-tasting, with ripe peach, apple and marmalade flavors. Well-structured and balanced, with a firm well of mineral and spice notes on the finish. Drink now through 2020. 83 cases made.

name: Muskat Ottonel Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Zwischen den Seen No. 9
review: Plenty of floral notes emerge in this aromatic sweetie, which offers fresh, juicy flavors of spiced plum, cherry, gooseberry and allspice. Interesting hints of jalapeño show on the honeyed finish. Drink now through 2040. 333 cases made.

name: Scheurebe Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Zwischen den Seen No. 3
review: There are lots of ripe grapefruit, apricot, pear and red peach flavors in this unctuous dessert wine, with notes of smoke and spice on the plush finish. Drink now through 2030. 1,000 cases made.

name: Scheurebe Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Zwischen den Seen No. 5
review: Lush and creamy, with flavors of butterscotch, roasted almond, pear tart, honey and spice. The luscious finish is long and rich. Drink now through 2030. 1,000 cases made.

name: Scheurebe Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Zwischen den Seen No. 9
review: Very spicy and rich, with loads of glazed apricot, pear and pineapple flavors that feature plenty of lift. Features custard and cream on the long finish, with intense notes of clove. Drink now through 2025. 1,000 cases made.

name: Scheurebe Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Zwischen den Seen No. 3
review: Floral and peach aromas are accented by spicy botrytis notes in this racy TBA. Everything is in the right proportion, from the honey and lime flavors to the medium weight and texture, and it finishes long and complex. Drinkable now, better in 2000.

name: Scheurebe Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Zwischen den Seen No. 4
review: Thick and intense, this dessert wine glides across the palate, thanks to its vibrant acidity. Plenty of honey and spice accentuates its grapefruit and tobacco notes. Fine length. Drink now through 2012. 165 cases made.

name: Traminer Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Nouvelle Vague No. 3
review: Very rich, exotic and exuberantly spicy, with flavors of ripe pear, apricot and cardamom. The long finish is filled with candied fruits and meadlike flavors. Drink now through 2020. 104 cases made.

name: Traminer Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Nouvelle Vague No. 8
review: Concentrated ripe apricot, peach and honey flavors are seductive and very creamy. Structured, fresh and balanced, with a finish redolent of tropical fruits and baked pineapple. Drink now through 2025.

name: Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Grande Cuvée Nouvelle Vague No. 6
review: Amber-colored, with a flush of honey, apricot, baked apple and kumquat flavors that are rich and smoky. The firm finish is filled with lots of ripe tropical notes. Welschriesling and Chardonnay. Drink now through 2030.

name: Welschriesling Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Zwischen den Seen No. 1
review: Ripe, thick and full of luscious floral and smoke flavors, this features notes of marzipan and nutmeg. Gooseberry and candied quince accents are joined by a dried ginger hint on the broad, zesty finish. Drink now through 2038. 100 cases made.

name: Welschriesling Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Zwischen den Seen No. 1
review: Intense and full-flavored, with glazed apricot, ripe peach and plenty of smoky notes, followed by a lusciously long finish of cream and spice. Drink now through 2018. 167 cases made.

name: Welschriesling Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Zwischen den Seen No. 2
review: A lush, rich and elegant-tasting dessert white, with concentrated pear tart and glazed apricot flavors. There's also lots of custard notes, which extend on the finish. Drink now through 2025.

name: Welschriesling Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Zwischen den Seen No. 7
review: A rich, creamy sweetie, showing layers of peach cobble flavors, with glazed apricot, vanilla and rich spice notes. Lively on the finish, with hints of white chocolate. Drink now through 2018.

name: Welschriesling Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Zwischen den Seen No. 9
review: A fruit-forward and creamy style, offering concentrated peach and piecrust flavors, with apricot and pear. The rich finish is luxuriant and smooth. Drink now through 2016.

name: Zweigelt Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Nouvelle Vague No. 1
review: Shows fascinating aromas of herbs and truffle, with delicious sweet cherry, plum and spice flavors. Chocolate and cream fill the long, rich finish. Drink now through 2020.

name: Zweigelt Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Nouvelle Vague No. 5
review: The spiced plum and luscious red berry flavors are fresh and focused in this sweetie. Notes of cinnamon and nutmeg lead to the long, spice-filled finish of hoisin sauce and marmalade. Drink now. 50 cases made.

name: Beerenauslese Burgenland Cuvée
review: Rich and lush, with concentrated glazed apricot, lemon, buttercream and baked apple flavors. The long finish features spice and white chocolate. Drink now through 2030. 20,000 cases made.

name: Beerenauslese Neusiedlersee Grande Cuvée
review: A fruit bomb. Packed with apricot, honey and orange-zest flavors that deliver immediate gratification, then turn subtle, yet lingering. Very elegant, despite the rich texture.

name: Bouvier Beerenauslese Neusiedlersee Zwischen den Seen No. 2
review: Intriguing. A hint of truffle augments the white chocolate, honey, apricot and orange notes in this thick, concentrated BA. Wonderful balance and interplay of flavors across the palate, ending in a vibrant, long finish. Drink now through 2005. 145 cases made.

name: Burgenland L11A Nouvelle Vague No. 2
review: Sweet cherry, strawberry and ripe melon flavors feature engaging notes of mint and chamomile. The juicy finish is well-spiced. Drink now through 2025. 200 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Nouvelle Vague No. 4
review: This thick, exotic and creamy-tasting sweetie offers lots of ripe apple and melon flavors, with notes of spiced berry and white pepper. Zesty finish. Drink now through 2015.

name: Chardonnay Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Nouvelle Vague No. 2
review: Honey and citrus mingle with vanilla from new oak in this suave, sprightly dessert wine. A vivid acidity punctuates the moderately sweet, medium-bodied structure, ending on a butterscotch note. Drink now through 2006.

name: Chardonnay Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Nouvelle Vague No. 7
review: Lovely candied fruit character, hinting at apricot, passion fruit, fig and orange, all very concentrated and a bit monolithic at this point. Good caramel and marmalade aftertaste. Drink now through 2010. 1,200 cases made.

name: Muscat Ottonel Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Zwischen den Seen No. 2
review: Delicious. Delicate and pure, this offers rose petal, pine and honey aromas and flavors matched to a lively structure and lightweight frame. Beautifully balanced, with a lingering finish. Drink now through 2008. 75 cases made.

name: Muscat Ottonel Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Zwischen den Seen No. 4
review: Fresh and rich, with an appealing floral aroma and delicious flavors of golden raisins, ripe apricot and allspice. Nicely balanced, with a finish filled with honey notes and pine elements. Drink now through 2010. 31 cases imported.

name: Scheurebe Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Zwischen den Seen No. 4
review: Concentrated flavors of peach, apricot, honey and smoke are knit together seamlessly, with a long, long finish that echoes the flavors with white chocolate and chamomile. Drink now through 2015.

name: Scheurebe Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Zwischen den Seen No. 9
review: This sweetie shows lots of honey and butter flavors. Peach and apricot fill out the fruit components, with a touch of grapefruit and a thick, spice-filled finish. Drink now through 2018. 83 cases made.

name: Scheurebe Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Zwischen den Seen No. 14
review: Assertive Scheurebe character shows through in this thickly textured, sweet wine that absolutely melts in the mouth. Smoke and grapefruit aromas augment the honey and apricot flavors, with good acidity beneath. Drink now through 2003.

name: Scheurebe Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Zwischen den Seen No. 3
review: Impressive, but impenetrable today. Intense aromas, almost a singed or burnt character, introduce this racy, elegant TBA whose grapefruit, orange marmalade and almond candy flavors converge into a hard-candy aftertaste. Give it some time. Best from 2002 through 2007.

name: Scheurebe Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Zwischen den Seen No. 5
review: This reels in Scheurebe's assertiveness, coaxing grapefruit and pineapple flavors with tantalizing acidity, ending with a long finish and honey aftertaste. Drink now through 2006. 250 cases made.

name: Traminer Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Nouvelle Vague No. 2
review: Offers an interesting, lively mix of mango, cream and guava flavors that feature smoky overtones, followed by a spicy finish of clove and nutmeg. Drink now through 2025. 1,000 cases made.

name: Traminer Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Nouvelle Vague No. 8
review: Thick and honeyed. Brilliant yellow, with gold hue. Honey, syrup and burnt almond aromas with a hint of tropical fruit. Full-bodied, very sweet, with a honey, apple and almond aftertaste. Sweet finish. Drink now or hold.

name: Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland L2012A Nouvelle Vague No. 1
review: Plum and spicy cherry flavors dominate this light and refreshing red dessert wine. Spicy midpalate, with a finish featuring melon and sugar cane notes. Drink now through 2030. 167 cases made.

name: Welschriesling Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland Zwischen den Seen No. 5
review: A zesty style, filled with spicy and buttery notes to the flavors of honey, elderflower, lanolin and apricot. The crisp, focused finish is long and lush. Drink now through 2045. 208 cases made.

name: Welschriesling Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Zwischen den Seen No. 1
review: Quite delicate and elegant. Floral, nectarine and honey notes stay fresh and luscious, and the botrytis component is played down. Long, raisiny aftertaste. Delicious on its own or with light desserts.

name: Welschriesling Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Zwischen den Seen No. 3
review: Rich and fresh-tasting, with loads of cream, honey and spice flavors, and notes of vanilla and allspice. Luscious and balanced, with an enveloping unctuousness. Drink now through 2012. 31 cases imported.

name: Welschriesling Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Zwischen den Seen No. 9
review: Incredible intensity here, with peach and apricot character and nuances of pine forest, all on a rich, thick texture. This exhibits power and harmony balanced by a vibrant structure. Long, peachy aftertaste. Drink now through 2007.

name: Beerenauslese Burgenland Cuvée
review: This is smooth and moderately sweet, offering apricot, honey and butter flavors, with a hint of orange peel, finding a lighter, filigreed side on the finish, where the lively acidity keeps this focused. Welschriesling and Chardonnay. Drink now through 2022. 1,400 cases imported.

name: Beerenauslese Burgenland Cuvée
review: Sweet, rich and buttery-tasting, with flavors of crème brûlée, baked apple, pear tart and butterscotch, lingering on the spice-filled finish. Drink now through 2025. 1,800 cases made.

name: Beerenauslese Burgenland Cuvée
review: Vanilla and spice fill this ripe, well-balanced sweetie. Chamomile tea and Meyer lemon notes fill the finish. Chardonnay and Welschriesling. Drink now through 2015.

name: Beerenauslese Neusiedlersee
review: A concentrated yet well-balanced wine. Honey and vanilla aromas, with a touch of honeydew, apple and apricot. Medium- to full-bodied, with spicy flavors and a long, sweet, oily texture. Crème brûlée in a glass. Drink now or hold.

name: Chardonnay Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Nouvelle Vague No. 2
review: Broad and rich-tasting, with loads of ripe pear, ripe apple and honey spice flavors. There's a good, clean acidity as well; clove, peach and cream notes linger on the finish. Drink now through 2010. 31 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay-Welschriesling Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Nouvelle Vague No. 4
review: An elegant TBA, full of apricot, smoke and spice character underscored by a racy acidity that maintains the flavor intensity through the long finish, where hints of orange peel emerge. Drink now through 2007.

name: Muscat Ottonel Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Zwischen den Seen No. 2
review: Pungent, with grape, floral and spice notes, sweet but balanced and clean on the finish. There's a honeyed quality and good length on the finish. Try with Muenster cheese. Drink now through 2010. 105 cases made.

name: Muscat Ottonel Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee Zwischen den Seen No. 4
review: Classic Muscat notes of roses and figs, along with a minty accent matched to a vibrant structure. The overall impression is freshness and succulence, without getting too sweet. Drink now through 2012. 600 cases made.

name: Scheurebe Beerenauslese Neusiedlersee Zwischen den Seen
review: A leafy note runs through this dessert wine, adding complexity to the honey and peach flavors. Great intensity and concentration, with a flourish on the finish.

name: Chardonnay Ruster Ausbruch Neusiedlersee-Hügelland
review: Very exotic, showing a heavy botrytis element plus orange, cinnamon and marzipan flavors, all on a medium-bodied frame. Sweet, yet has enough acidity to keep it from cloying. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2003. 133 cases made.

name: Blauer Burgunder Beerenauslese Neusiedlersee-Hügelland
review: Raisin and tealike character in a light-bodied frame, with moderate acidity but an astringent finish. Not imported into the U.S. 1,500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Willamette Valley Dijon Clone
review: Bright, juicy and remarkably focused, offering powerful pear, citrus and honeysuckle flavors, echoing beautifully on the long finish. Drink now through 2007. 100 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Yamhill-Carlton District Celebrate
review: Light, lively and charming, with pretty grapefruit and spice flavors dancing on an open-textured frame, bubbling with finesse on the charming finish. Drink now. 110 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Cardiac Hill
review: Firm, focused and deftly balanced, with blackberry and white pepper flavors set against refined tannins and lively acidity. The tannins need time to soften. Best from 2015 through 2018. 100 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Heritage
review: Light, taut and focused, with spice and coffee overtones to the medium-weight blackberry flavors, persisting on the expressive finish against fine tannins. Drink now through 2020. 100 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Yamhill-Carlton District Dijon Clone
review: Smooth and round, focusing its pear and apricot flavors onto the vivacious finish. Lively acidity lifts this version. Drink now through 2016. 220 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Rebecca's Reserve
review: Black cherry, currant and dark spice flavors vie for attention in this aromatic, focused, generous wine. Tannins are way in the background, making this tempting to consume early. Drink now through 2006. 100 cases made.

name: Brut Yamhill-Carlton District
review: A toasty style, lean and lithe, with a smoky edge to the pear and floral flavors, finishing with a savory note. Drink now. 165 cases made.

name: Brut Yamhill-Carlton District Zero Dosage
review: Taut, lean and spicy, with clove and black pepper overtones to the lemon and slightly bitter grapefruit pith flavors, lingering on the steely finish. Drink now. 50 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Willamette Valley
review: A nice, crisp frame surrounds some lovely honey-scented pear and floral flavors that linger enticingly on the finish. Drinkable now, best in 1997 or '98. 160 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Willamette Valley
review: Ripe and supple, polished to a high gleam to show off the apple, pear, spice and leesy flavors. Much better than a bottle tasted in November 1994. 250 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Yamhill-Carlton District Dijon Clone
review: Taut and tangy, with lime and jalapeño notes. A waxy accent adds interest to the pear flavors. Persistent on the finish. Best from 2015 through 2018. 175 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley Kimberley's Reserve
review: Ripe and supple, a wine of delicacy and grace that features pear, vanilla and melon flavors that linger on the refreshing finish. Drink now. 100 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley Reserve
review: Ripe, flavorful and exquisitely balanced to show-off sappy pear, almond and honey flavors on a silky frame. Delicious now. 72 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Rebecca's Reserve
review: Crisp tannins prickle around the edges of the light-weight strawberry and caramel corn flavors, lingering easily and delicately, with a hint of white pepper. Drink now through 2018. 100 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Willamette Valley Dijon Clone
review: Distinctly floral, with aromas reminiscent of daisies and rose petals around a core of pear and citrus that comes through on the finish. Drink now through 2003. 100 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Willamette Valley Estate Bottled
review: Ripe, spicy and soft, this offers a nice touch of lime to enliven its generous caramel and pear flavors. Ready to drink. 160 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley Kimberley's Reserve
review: Soft and generous, a silky smooth style that offers up its melon, spice and earthy flavors with clarity and refinement. Drink now. 100 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Firm tannins support a nice array of well-crafted, spicy berry, beet and smoke flavors that swirl around the light, chewy finish. Best in 1997. 330 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Yamhill-Carlton District Dijon Clones Reserve
review: Light and tart, with an earthy streak running through the modest apple cider and quince flavors. Drink now through 2017. 125 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Soft, delicate and pleasantly earthy, with mushroom and cherry notes weaving through the finish as it firms up. Drink now through 2005. 300 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Estate Bottled
review: A more sophisticated style from Kramer, with smoky, buttery oak shadings adding dimension and depth to the crisp, lively cherry and raspberry-scented flavors. The finish is complex and lingering. Drink now to 1995. 179 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill County Reserve
review: Soft and fragrant, distinctly varietal, featuring a smoky edge to its plum and currant flavors and finishing gentle, with chunky, low-key tannins. Ready now. 150 cases made.

name: Müller-Thurgau Willamette Valley
review: A gentle mouthful of peach and apple flavors, fresh and simple. Finish is clean and refreshing. 399 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Oregon
review: Soft and pretty, with melon and citrus flavors that linger on the light finish. Drink now. 570 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley Reserve
review: Light, round and flavorful, with ripe nectarine and earth notes that linger on the open-textured finish. Drink now. 200 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Smoky and toasty with ripe, spicy red cherry, plum and currant notes that turn supple and elegant on the finish. Tasty now. 280 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill County Reserve
review: Silky and charming, with pretty blackberry and spice flavors that linger on the gentle finish. Drink now through 2000. 150 cases made.

name: Riesling Willamette Valley Estate Bottled
review: Barely off-dry, crisp and lively, focusing its green apple and floral flavors nicely on a zingy finish. Drinkable now. 377 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Willamette Valley Dijon Clone
review: Smooth and generous, but it has a sour edge that takes away from the otherwise pretty pear and spice flavors. Drink now. 75 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley Estate Bottled
review: On the crisp side, with pretty floral and apple flavors that persist on the finish. Drink now through 1999. 345 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley Estate Bottled
review: Crisp and fruity, with lively peach and pear flavors, finishing a little spicy. Drinkable now. 330 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill County
review: Pleasantly fruity, with spice, anise, cherry and raspberry flavors that are fresh and lively. Could use a little more richness and depth. Drink now to 1995. 269 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Estate
review: Earthy, tangy and formidable, with an unusual flavor profile. Offers roasted red pepper and vegetal notes around a sleek core of blackberry, finishing with firm tannins. Best after 2017. 300 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Rebecca's Reserve
review: Showing its maturity, with earthy, underbrush flavors around modest cherry and orange peel notes. Drink now. 100 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill County Reserve
review: Tight and closed without much fruit; seems heavy-handed with oak, which dominates the flavor now. Drinkable now. 100 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Willamette Valley Dijon Clone
review: Focused and round, with a distinct earthy note running through the peppery citrus flavors. Drink now. 100 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Gentle and fresh, with modest plum and vanilla flavors. Tasty now, best from late 1997. 330 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Estate Bottled
review: Lean and chewy, very firm for a light-bodied wine, with modest berry and plum flavors lurking behind the chewy layers. Best from 2000 through 2002. 300 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill County Reserve
review: Earthy, gamy flavors weave through this firm-textured, solidly built red. Not very Pinot Noir-ish, but a decent drink. Best after 2002. 200 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley
review: Fresh and simple, with pear flavors and earth notes. Ready now. 479 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley
review: Soft, almost syrupy, with earthy notes up front and modest fruit on the finish. 400 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Estate
review: Tough in texture, with anise and pepper notes more prominent than fruit. 350 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Rebecca's Reserve
review: An odd wine, with distinctive walnut aromas and flavors weaving through the modest currant character at the core, finishing a bit watery. Seems out of whack. 100 cases made.

name: Riesling Willamette Valley Select Cluster
review: Sweet with little richness or charm, showing more floral andh herbal notes than fruit or honey. 100 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill County
review: Harsh, bitter and earthy in character.

name: Pinot Grigio Delle Venezie
review: Fresh and balanced, with a stony base note and appealing flavors of melon, pear and spice. Drink now. 180,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Provincia di Pavia
review: Offers an appealing mix of ripe raspberry and strawberry fruit, with accents of smoke, spice and black licorice. Well-balanced and fresh. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Heart
review: Round and fruity, displaying cherry, plum and earth flavors. Tails off on the finish. Merlot, Montepulciano and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Grigio Delle Venezie
review: This floral white is light-bodied and juicy, with melon and apple fruit and notes of smoke, lemon zest and ginger. Drink now. 250,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Grigio Delle Venezie
review: Light-bodied and balanced, this tangy white offers modest notes of green apple, white peach, blanched almond and stone. Drink now. 300,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Grigio Delle Venezie
review: Light and crisp, with Gala apple, stone and floral notes. Offers a clean-cut, citrusy finish. Drink now. 275,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Provincia di Pavia
review: Aromatic, with pekoe tea leaf and ground star anise accents. Light tannins frame the dried cherry and smoke notes. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Rogue Valley
review: Fresh and open-textured, brimming with blackberry, currant and mineral flavors. Offers depth and expressiveness on the lingering finish. Drink now through 2017. 279 cases made.

name: Malbec Rogue Valley
review: Dark, ripe and expressive, weaving smoky, minerally notes through the dark plum and blackberry flavors, finishing with refinement. Drink now through 2021. 346 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Rogue Valley
review: Fresh and expressive, with an open texture to the pear, grapefruit and floral flavors that keep dancing lightly through the pretty finish. Drink now. 613 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Rogue Valley
review: Distinctive, offering green pineapple and floral flavors riding on a sleek frame, with a polished finish. Drink now. 246 cases made.

name: Di'tani Rogue Valley
review: Grippy tannins underlie the fresh, lively blackberry, white pepper and floral flavors, dancing deftly into a refined finish. Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon, Malbec and Tempranillo. Drink now through 2016. 249 cases made.

name: Di'tani Rogue Valley
review: Firm in texture, with a minty edge to the ripe black cherry and floral flavors, lingering gently against a mild grip of tannins. Cabernet Franc, Malbec, Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Tempranillo. Best after 2017. 611 cases made.

name: Viognier Rogue Valley
review: Sleek and polished, this is medium-weight, with pretty pear and floral flavors. A touch of honeycomb informs the dry finish. Drink now. 565 cases made.

name: Viognier Rogue Valley
review: Lively, spicy and generous, with an oily texture, offering pear, citrus and spice flavors, hinting at nectarine as the finish persists. Drink now. 289 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Rogue Valley
review: Taut, tart and distinctively old-school, with herbal, savory elements more prominent than the citrus flavors. Drink now. 566 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Oakville Entre Nous
review: Sleek, rich and layered, presenting tiers of melted black licorice, dark berry, mocha, exotic spices and seductive oak. This is still tight and rambunctious, but remains beautifully centered and is sure to gain. Best from 2014 through 2025. 281 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Entre Nous
review: Tightly wound, with a firm backbone supporting layers of dried currant, lead pencil, graphite, plum and lavender, yet for all its density, this is elegant and subtle, with a long, detailed finish. Best from 2013 through 2022. 280 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley Entre Nous
review: Impressive, with a chorus of aromatics leading to a chorus of flavors. Peach, nectarine, melon and citrus notes show accents of coconut water, almond skin and green tea, wrapped up in an elegant profile and a juicy finish. Drink now. 100 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Oakville Entre Nous
review: Shows good intensity, with robust Meyer lemon, tangerine and peach flavors that have a smooth body and a strong toasty note, with minerally and spicy, cedary details that crescendo on the finish. Drink now. 100 cases made.

name: Blanc de Noirs California
review: Smooth and polished, with complex, mature black cherry, honey, toast and hazelnut notes, all folding together into a harmonious and distinctive wine. Flavors linger on the finish.

name: Blanc de Blancs California
review: Complex in its own way, and a bit curious at first for its range of flavors. Showing pear, vanilla and a dash of oak, it turns creamy and smooth, with a distinctive, yeasty bread-dough quality that adds dimension. Complex aftertaste. 2,500 cases made.

name: Brut Rosé California
review: A classy rosé, pretty in color, with ripe, complex cherry and berry flavors, picking up hints of floral, spicy notes. Keeps its fruity edge through the finish.

name: Blanc de Blancs California
review: Mature-appearing with its deep gold color and flavors to match, which seem a bit tired for a wine this young. The toasty, earthy pear notes pick up a trace of honey and butterscotch on the finish.

name: Blanc de Noirs California
review: Prematurely aged, with strong hazelnut, earth and slightly cheesy flavors. The finish is a bit dull. Fans of old bubbly might enjoy it. 2,300 cases made.

name: Brut Rosé California Late Disgorged
review: Starts off on a doughy, almost cedary note, then serves up a blend of sour cherry, apple and citrus flavors. Unusual. Drink now. 350 cases made.

name: Brut Blanc de Blancs Vin de Table Français Extra Leger
review: Has some nice fresh, floral and spicy aromas with fresh, crisp appley flavors and a creamy texture. Tastes slightly off dry like Chenin Blanc. One of Kriter's better efforts. Drink now.

name: Demi-Sec Vin de Table Français Délicatesse
review: A dessert or aperitif sparkling wine, with sweet honey and pineapple flavors. Has an unusual deep gold color and attributes of a late harvest wine. Nice toasty flavors and a good finish. Drink now.

name: Brut Rosé Vin de Table Français
review: An unusual dry, rosé sparkler with red-wine flavors. Tastes of strawberry but with off-putting hints of tomato and leather. Medium-bodied with only a slight finish.

name: Demi-Sec Vin de Table Français
review: A sweet and almost cloying sparkler, with simple, bubblegum aromas and bland sweet flavors. Acceptable but unappealing.

name: Brut Blanc de Blancs Vin de Table Français
Brut Blanc de Blancs Vin de Table Français Imperial
Pinot Grigio Colli Orientali del Friuli
review: An attempt at a serious international style, with new oak treatment lending vanilla accents to the simple apple flavors. A bit overdone.

name: Cabernet Franc Colli Orientali del Friuli
review: Austere and tough, exhibiting a woody character and only a little black currant and mint.

name: Vintage Port Reserve
review: Out of this world--the nectar of the gods. A millennium wine, with amazing radiant colors of yellow, lime and amber. Full-bodied and very sweet, with intense aromas and flavors of butterscotch, toffee, marmalade and nut. The salt, cedar, nut and tobacco finish has hints of brown sugar and spice. Drink now.

name: Late Bottled Port
review: Plum, wet earth and cherry aromas. Medium- to full-bodied, medium sweet, with a silky, berry, cherry finish. Very nice indeed. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2005.

name: Vintage Port
review: Offers raisin and light spice aromas. Spirit shows a bit. Medium-bodied and lightly sweet, with a fresh finish. Best after 2010. 1,645 cases made.

name: Late Bottled Port
review: Shows some attractive bottle age. Lovely aromas of berries, flowers and custard. Medium- to light-bodied, with fine tannins and a smooth texture. A little hot on the finish, but still delicate. Drink now.

name: Late Bottled Port
review: Intense aromas of black pepper and raisin, but then a slight letdown. Medium-bodied and medium sweet, with soft tannins and a light, slightly alcoholic finish. Drink now. 1,215 cases made.

name: Late Bottled Port
review: A bit tired at this stage, with nut, berry, tobacco and meatlike character. Medium-bodied, medium sweet, with a slightly hot finish.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Cabernet Franc McLaren Vale
review: Classic Cabernet on the nose and palate with ripe cassis and vanilla flavors and an attractive cedary, spicy finish. It has enough tannin to fill out the structure, but it's a beautifully made claret-style wine at a remarkable price.

name: Chardonnay Australia
review: Very ripe pineappley, buttery style, full-bodied, bordering on alcoholic, f lavorful but not for fans of subtlety. There are some nice hints of earthiness and smoke. Drink now.

name: Port Robertson
review: A good ruby Port, featuring spice, berry and plum aromas and flavors, medium body, soft tannins and sweet finish. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Breede River
review: This is not much fun to drink. It smells and tastes watery and sour.

name: Brut Champagne
review: A powerful, majestic Champagne. Deep and compelling, with aromas of whole-grain toast, coconut and dried citrus that draw you in. Lean and racy on the palate, with a creaminess that's yet to be integrated. A classic '96, with ripe, exotic aromas and a steely structure. Still a baby, with the long, resonant finish confirming its potential. Best from 2009 through 2040. 10,000 cases made.

name: Brut Blanc de Blancs Champagne Clos du Mesnil
review: A lovely, lacy Champagne, with ripe apricot, fennel seed and espresso aromas. This caresses the palate with a finely detailed mousse and expansive flavors of pineapple pâte de fruit, toasted brioche, fleur de sel and grated ginger. Long and chalky on the finish, this is a prima ballerina, showing power cloaked in grace. Disgorged winter 2015. Drink now through 2032.

name: Brut Blanc de Blancs Champagne Clos du Mesnil
review: Stops you in your tracks. Fascinating-from thebarrel-fermented coconut, vanilla, pineapple andmarmalade bouquet to the incredible richness andconcentration, this is an original. The peach,vanilla, honey and tangerine flavors ride a crestof bracing acidity, dry and forceful, to alingering aftertaste of spring blossoms andhazelnut. Drink now through 2006. 1,200 cases made.

name: Brut Blanc de Blancs Champagne Clos du Mesnil
review: The very first bottling of Clos du Mesnil is a fantastic Champagne that blends fresh, lively fruit flavors with a plush texture and expansive finish. A bright citrus character evolves into mature flavors of mineral, vanilla and ginger that seem to melt in your mouth. It's still totally firm in texture and strong in structure so there's no great hurry to pop the cork.--Krug Clos du Mesnil vertical. Drink now through 2010.

name: Brut Blanc de Noirs Champagne Clos d'Ambonnay
review: Exotic on the nose, with woodsy spice and bergamot notes, this luxurious Champagne is driven by vivid, crystalline acidity. A streak of salinity underscores the flavors of black currant pâte de fruit, whole-grain toast, clover honey and chopped almond. Drink now through 2034. 400 cases made.

name: Brut Champagne
review: This harmonious Champagne offers luxurious texture and powerful, focused acidity, showing aromatic accents of spring blossom, crushed thyme and chai, with rich notes of lemon meringue, hazelnut, black currant and fresh porcini mushroom. The full package. Impressive. Drink now through 2028.

name: Brut Champagne
review: A very youthful '95. Delicate. Intense aromas of ginger, citrus, candied berry and multigrain bread turn to honey, roasted almonds and graphite on the palate. It's all underscored by a precise structure and creamy texture. Its structure keeps it persistent through the long finish. A picture of precision and intensity. Drink now through 2025. 1,700 cases imported.

name: Brut Champagne
review: A superb Champagne and still youthful. Honey, ginger, lemon confit, coffee and mineral aromas and flavors come to mind, all kept focused by a firm, tightly wound structure. The finish is where its pedigree shines through, lingering like warm gingerbread and coffee. Drink now through 2015. 5,000 cases made.

name: Brut Champagne
review: An elegantly lively wine. Rich and toasty, with caramel and spice flavors and a nice floral touch. Creamy and full-bodied, with pleasant nutmeg characteristics throughout and a good dose of butterscotch on the finish.--Krug vertical.

name: Brut Blanc de Blancs Champagne Clos du Mesnil
review: Incredibly fresh and vibrant, this stunning Champagne weaves a tightly knit skein of ripe pear and tangy yellow plum fruit flavors together, with accents of rich pastry cream, toasted brioche, elderflower, ground cardamom and coffee liqueur. Shows a beautiful texture. A thread of salinity winds through to the lasting finish. Disgorged fall 2013. Drink now through 2029. 832 cases made.

name: Brut Blanc de Blancs Champagne Clos du Mesnil
review: Silky and fine like featherweight cashmere, this vibrant blanc de blancs is nonetheless laden with ample, expressive flavors. Rich hints of XO cognac and coffee liqueur underscore bergamot and glazed apricot fruit, while smoky minerality, spun honey, grilled nut and exotic spices impart further complexity and linger on the lasting finish. Disgorged spring 2012. Drink now through 2030.

name: Brut Blanc de Blancs Champagne Clos du Mesnil
review: A minerally vein and finely tuned acidity structure this elegant 1998, with expressive notes of orchard blossom, hazelnut, dried apricot, pastry, lemon cream and crystallized pineapple sitting on a texture of finely spun silk. Features a long, mouthwatering finish. Drink now through 2028. 1,000 cases made.

name: Brut Blanc de Blancs Champagne Clos du Mesnil
review: A barrel-fermented style. Shows a slight oxidative character, with whole-grain toast, ginger, exotic citrus and honey notes. Big and dry, with a firm structure and a tactile sensation on the finish. A Champagne for food. Drink now through 2015. 120 cases imported.

name: Brut Blanc de Blancs Champagne Clos du Mesnil
review: A seductive mosaic of biscuit, honey and walnut oil lead to baking bread and citrus in this masculine, youthful Champagne. Very tightly wound and bracing at the moment, this needs time (and food) to open up and reveal all its charms. More muscular and rigid than the elegant '88. Best from 2005 through 2025. 1,200 cases made.

name: Brut Blanc de Blancs Champagne Clos du Mesnil
review: A glorious Champagne that expresses both fresh fruit and nutty, mature elements. The interplay of spring blossoms, citrus and honey, with hazelnut, coffee and fresh grains against a backdrop of finesse and depth creates a dynamic, dramatic impression. Showing its acidic structure at this stage, but the finish previews what's to come if it's cellared. Best from 2004 through 2015. 1,200 cases made.

name: Brut Blanc de Blancs Champagne Clos du Mesnil
review: A ripe, opulent vintage that makes for a rich, almost thick Champagne that's packed with toasty aromas and assertive walnut and honey flavors that linger on the finish. For all the power and breadth, it's still lively and can age even longer.--Krug Clos du Mesnil vertical. Drink now through 2015.

name: Brut Champagne
review: Rich and mouthwatering, this powerhouse Champagne is driven by vivacious acidity, with an expansive palate featuring flavors of glazed apricot, toasted brioche, candied kumquat and ginger, espresso crème, fleur de sel and cognac. The well-spiced finish is long and lingering. Disgorged summer 2013. Drink now through 2030.

name: Brut Champagne
review: An aristocrat. Big-boned and intense, yet with finesse and complex flavors of coconut, whole-grain bread, ginger, citrus and honey. Waves of flavor saturate the palate and the long finish picks up a mineral and smoke note. Very harmonious from start to finish. Drink now through 2020. 1,700 cases imported.

name: Brut Champagne Collection
review: Animated and fresh, this is exotic on the nose and palate, with a finely woven tapestry of ground ginger, chamomile, pineapple pâte de fruit, grilled nut and biscuit flavors. Refined in texture and persistent on the long, truffle-laced finish. Drink now through 2025.

name: Brut Champagne Collection
review: Tasted from magnum. Beautifully mature and a joyto drink, this 1964 displays a complex biscuit,honey and dried citrus bouquet. Rich, harmonious and still lively, it offers toast, honey and fruitpreserve flavors, with a hint of fresh mushroom. Long, nutty finish.--Krug vertical. Drink now through 2005.

name: Brut Champagne Collection
review: Tasted from magnum. Not your average glass of Champagne. Mature and distinctive, exhibiting soya, beef bouillion, almond and kirsch aromas followed by concentrated flavors of honey, caramel, hazelnut and mushroom. Very powerful, intense and long, more like an aged wine in character.--Krug vertical. Drink now.

name: Brut Champagne Grande Cuvée
review: This is all about balance and the integration of power and finesse, with finely honed acidity supporting flavors of quince paste, dried black cherry, spun honey and candied orange zest, while rich notes of roasted walnut, coffee liqueur and toasted cardamom resonate on the finish. Hard to stop sipping. Drink now through 2028.

name: Brut Blanc de Blancs Champagne Clos du Mesnil
review: Offers fine depth and complexity, showing aromas of coffee, mushroom and candied citrus. This is laserlike on the palate, focusing its citrus, honey and mineral flavors and corralling them to a long finish. Still a baby, with great length and potential. Best from 2010 through 2030. 817 cases made.

name: Brut Blanc de Blancs Champagne Clos du Mesnil
review: Classic in balance, harmony and flavor. Displays a fantastic combination of mature flavors and plush texture, with a sense of freshness and vibrancy that elevates it well above the outstanding level. Drink now through 2000. Far better than when tasted last year. 1,240 cases made.

name: Brut Champagne
review: Beautifully aromatic, this leads with aromas of ground clove, coffee liqueur and mandarin orange peel, adding crystallized honey, dried cherry, acacia blossom and toasted brioche notes on the expansive palate. Rich in flavor and broad in structure, with verve driving this through to the long, satiny finish. Drink now through 2027.

name: Brut Champagne
review: An intense, incredibly fruity wine that's also smooth in the mouth. Still somewhat tart, but draped with lusciousness and tinged with juniperlike flavors.--Krug vertical.

name: Brut Champagne
review: Shows classic, mature flavors of cream, butterscotch, almond and hazelnut, but is still amazingly fresh. Has a beautiful golden color. Almost like a dessert wine, with big bubbles and a hint of juniper.--Krug vertical.

name: Brut Champagne Collection
review: Shows a lovely interplay between the creamy bead and rich notes of almond financier, apricot preserves, treacle and cardamom, with finely cut, persistent acidity and flavors of pastis, raspberry puree, fennel seed and fleur de sel. Offers a refined, lasting finish, with a push of saline-tinged minerality. Drink now through 2029.

name: Brut Champagne Grande Cuvée
review: One whiff and you know this is serious stuff. The aromas of baking brioche, coconut, candied citrus and leather pick up roasted coffee and grilled nuts on the palate, permeating the senses. Profound depth and complexity, offering a unique Champagne experience. Drink now through 2006. 40,000 cases made.

name: Brut Champagne Grande Cuvée 164ème Édition
review: A seamless Champagne, with vibrant acidity and flavors of toasted almond, baked currant and golden raisin. Long and mouthwatering, with a finely detailed bead carrying the flavors to the lasting finish, with accents of spice, pastry cream and coffee. Disgorged spring 2016. Drink now through 2027.

name: Brut Rosé Champagne
review: Marvelous. Burnished to an orange-gold color, this rosé evokes a complex palette of gingerbread, coffee, fig compote, orange peel and smoke flavors, all enmeshed in the supple texture and graceful harmony. Fades gently on the palate over the course of several minutes. Drink now through 2006. 500 cases imported.

name: Brut Blanc de Noirs Champagne Clos d'Ambonnay
review: An elegant, almost ethereal Champagne, showing a subtle richness and power, with vibrant acidity and a beautifully creamy mousse carrying the finely meshed flavors of Chambord liqueur, singed orange peel, biscuit and spun honey, accented by hints of toasted almond, saline and smoke that gain momentum and echo on the finish. Disgorged autumn 2013. Drink now through 2025.

name: Brut Blanc de Noirs Champagne Clos d'Ambonnay
review: Full-bodied and deep, featuring graphite, toast, leather and spice notes augmented by citrus and mineral. This is dry and backed by a racy structure, with a long, structure-driven finish, replete with spice and citrus accents. A Champagne for food or contemplation. Drink now through 2025.

name: Brut Champagne
review: Like taffeta in texture, this harmonious Champagne is finely honed and fresh. A wonderfully expressive version, with ample spice and graphite accents to the blackberry pâte de fruit, coffee liqueur, dried apricot, singed orange peel and crystallized honey notes. Hard to stop sipping. Disgorged spring 2014. Drink now through 2028.

name: Brut Champagne
review: Classically rich, full-bodied and mature. Still clean and crisp, with nutty, creamy notes amid ripe pear and apple flavors. Delicate and concentrated.--Krug vertical.

name: Brut Champagne
review: Incredibly lively and spicy, with layers of toffee, caramel and ripe pear flavors. A rich, viscous wine that tastes of aged Chardonnay and still has a few bubbles to boot.--Krug vertical.

name: Brut Champagne Collection
review: Tasted from magnum. Absolutely gorgeous. Full ofdelicacy, showing citrus preserve and brioche aromas, turning into honey, citrus and a hint of almond, all on an elegant, balanced structure.Very subtle in its power, with plenty of life ahead.--Krug vertical. Drink now through 2015.

name: Brut Champagne Grande Cuvée
review: Such a glorious expression of Champagne, combining depth over vintages and complexity of sites to create a profound, multifaceted cuvée. Rich biscuit, ginger, coconut and citrus aromas are followed by gingerbread, baked apple and grilled nut flavors, all supported by a firm yet harmonious structure. Endless finish. Superb. Drink now through 2008. 3,000 cases imported.

name: Brut Champagne Grande Cuvée
review: Super texture, like velvet, offers the perfect backdrop for a kaleidoscope of flavors—coconut, ginger, vanilla, berries and tobacco. Beautifully integrated, with a firm underpinning of acidity keeping it all focused and fresh. Terrific length. Drink now through 2010. 4,100 cases imported.

name: Brut Champagne Grande Cuvée
review: A powerful, well-toned Champagne, featuring coconut, toast, grapefruit and coffee aromas and flavors. There are plenty of bass notes, punctuated by crisp acidity, and it all comes together on the fine texture, with an aftertaste of roasted hazelnut and coffee. Drink now through 2018.

name: Brut Champagne Grande Cuvée
review: A smoky, intense wine, with layer upon layer of coffee, roasted nut, golden piecrust, ripe apple, honey and spice flavors. The richness is balanced by a focused freshness, perfectly poised like a high diver about to jump, standing above the crowd and showing the interplay of power and control in an elegant package. Drink now through 2026.

name: Brut Champagne Grande Cuvée
review: Like a gymnast, this partners power with grace. Set on the finely detailed texture, flavors of fig paste, crystallized honey, toasted brioche, coconut and kumquat wrap around well-honed acidity, with an aromatic core of grated ginger, cumin and ground coffee. Ends with a long, long, smoky finish. Drink now through 2025.

name: Brut Champagne Grande Cuvée
review: Very fine on the palate, with a lovely texture, carrying layered flavors of patisserie pear, dried apricot, smoked almond, crystallized honey and a hint of kumquat. Vibrant and mouthwatering, featuring a long finish of ground cumin and ginger. Drink now through 2022.

name: Brut Champagne Grande Cuvée
review: Rich, with smoky hints of roasted almond and toasted brioche, this crystalline Champagne offers a finely detailed mousse that carries the firm, citrusy acidity and flavors of patisserie apple, spun honey and tangy black cherry, accented by subtle, aromatic hints of ground cumin and clove, bergamot and chamomile. Disgorged August 2013. Drink now through 2027.

name: Brut Champagne Grande Cuvée
review: Beautifully aromatic and inviting, with grilled nut, incense and graphite notes, this vibrant Champagne is finely knit and harmonious, expanding on the palate and delivering flavors of toast, lemon meringue, orange blossom and clover honey. The long finish features lots of exotic spice details. Disgorged winter 2013. Drink now through 2025.

name: Brut Champagne Grande Cuvée
review: This mouthwatering Champagne shows a lovely sense of finesse, with firm acidity deftly married to a rich profile of crème de cassis, toasted brioche and lime blossom, accented by hints of café au lait, singed orange peel and exotic spice. Long and plush on the finish. Disgorged 2014. Drink now through 2024.

name: Brut Champagne Grande Cuvée 163ème Édition
review: A racehorse of a Champagne, this mouthwatering sparkler offers aromatic hints of toast and vanilla lacing the tightly knit profile of crème de cassis, ground coffee and mandarin orange peel flavors, with a long thread of anise and cardamom spice notes unraveling on the palate. This is like raw silk. Disgorged winter 2015 to 2016. Drink now through 2025.

name: Brut Rosé Champagne
review: A rosé of exceptional character and finesse. Beautifully integrated layers of subtle ginger, orange zest, toast and vanilla give it complexity and depth, and the rich but light texture makes it sublime to sip. A long, long finish completes the seamless package. 1,250 cases made.

name: Brut Rosé Champagne
review: Unique style, barrel-fermented, exhibiting tobacco, apple, berries and wood notes, all on a vinous, deep, full-bodied frame. Very complex and complete, with a smooth texture and long finish. Gorgeous rosé. Drink now through 2004.

name: Brut Rosé Champagne
review: A stellar Champagne, this combines finesse and intensity, expressing its spice, biscuit, berry and honey flavors on a firm, dense structure. There's a wonderful contrast of maturity and freshness, and it just explodes on the finish. Drink now through 2003.

name: Brut Rosé Champagne
review: Fabulous, from the burnished copper color to the endless finish, this rosé is sui generis. Complex aromas of dried berries, roses and sandalwood turn to intense currant, cherry and cardamom on the palate, supported by an elegant, persuasive structure and silky texture. The multidimensional finish caps this classic beauty. Drink now through 2006. 1,200 cases made.

name: Brut Rosé Champagne
review: Wonderful finesse and expression. Complex aromas and flavors of whole grain toast, red berries, vanilla pastry and mineral seemingly float on the silky texture as the fine bubbles and lively structure transport them to a lazy, blissful finish. It's hard to imagine a more complete rosé. Drink now through 2008. 150 cases imported.

name: Brut Rosé Champagne
review: A wine for contemplation. A well of berry, toast, citrus and coconut aromas and flavors mark this vinous Champagne. Its finesse, harmony, structure and complexity add up to a complete experience. Terrific length. Drink now through 2010. 420 cases imported.

name: Brut Rosé Champagne
review: Offers plenty of fruit including raspberry and black currant, with hints of orange—but also notes of ginger, sweet baking spices and toast. This is complex and beautifully balanced, with a long, fresh and expansive aftertaste. Drink now through 2013.

name: Brut Rosé Champagne
review: Rich and smoky, with a range of savory dried herb, tea rose and curry spice notes layered with flavors of black cherry, date, ground coffee and candied orange peel. Firm, mouthwatering acidity integrates effortlessly with the flavors and silky texture, making it hard to distinguish a soloist's highlight among the symphony's vibrant whole. Drink now through 2025.

name: Brut Rosé Champagne
review: The whole package. A texture of raw silk and finely cut acidity are seamlessly integrated with layers of dried cherry, ground espresso, cardamom and ginger, ripe raspberry, mineral and a hint of almond financier. The lasting finish is dry and smoky, echoing the spice notes. Drink now through 2020.

name: Brut Rosé Champagne
review: Very expressive and beautifully balanced, this is all in the details, from the palate-caressing texture to the vibrant acidity, finely meshed with flavors of black raspberry, plum, wild strawberry, candied citrus peel, honey and ground spice, accented by rich hints of espresso, treacle and pastis. Drink now through 2025.

name: Brut Rosé Champagne
review: The silky texture of this vivid rosé Champagne drapes the palate, offering an aromatic panoply of flavors, from pure raspberry and white peach fruit to ground cumin and anise, violet, graphite, spun honey and toasted almond. Delivers a long, mouthwatering finish. Disgorged January 2013. Drink now through 2025.

name: Brut Rosé Champagne
review: Fine and harmonious, this expressive rosé offers grilled nut and coffee accents, layered with exotic spice, dried peach, raspberry, biscuit, pastry cream and bergamot notes. Long and focused, with the flavor range carried on the silky, detailed mousse and driven by vibrant acidity. Disgorged summer 2013. Drink now through 2025.

name: Brut Rosé Champagne
review: Pale copper in color, this richly expressive rosé shows an overall sense of finesse, but also well-defined tension between the vibrant acidity and finely detailed mousse that carries flavors of dried white cherry and apricot, Mandarin orange peel, espresso and honey, with an expansive finish of exotic clove and cardamom spice. Disgorged winter 2013. Drink now through 2021.

name: Brut Blanc de Blancs Champagne Clos du Mesnil
review: Showing some maturity, with truffle, coffee and roasted almond aromas and flavors, this is dense and satisfying, with whole-grain bread accents and fine length. There's a firm structure, but it doesn't match the '95 for finesse and class. Drink now through 2010. 200 cases imported.

name: Brut Blanc de Blancs Champagne Clos du Mesnil
review: Similar in style to the 1982, this is a rich, ripe Chardonnay Champagne with loads of toasty, nutty, honeyed flavors backed by exotic tropical fruit and floral notes. A creamy-smooth texture carries through to a lingering finish.--Krug Clos du Mesnil vertical. Drink now through 2015.

name: Brut Champagne
review: Rich, lush aromas of dried fruit and citrus marmalade, this is Champagne at its most opulent. Honeyed and round on the palate, with fine acidity keeping it focused. Gorgeous now, yet will age well.--Krug vertical. Drink now through 2015.

name: Brut Champagne
review: A seductive, fully mature, spicy-flavored Champagne that's rich in texture, full in body, still quite firm in balance and long on the finish. What a satisfying taste experience! Drink now through 1999. 6,000 cases made.

name: Brut Champagne
review: Lively and nutty, but a bit one-dimensional, with caramel flavors and a touch of cream. Luscious and tasty.--Krug vertical.

name: Brut Champagne Collection
review: Tasted from magnum. A firm, forceful Champagne.Extremely fresh, showing top notes of flowers, with beef bouillion underneath, turning toasty on the palate. Rich, bold and broad-shouldered, with racy acidity that sticks out a little. Still needs time to round out.--Krug vertical. Drink now through 2010.

name: Brut Champagne Collection
review: Tasted from magnum. Very supple, this '62 is rich and round. I detected candied red fruit on the nose, which turned to cherry and hazelnut on the palate, all well balanced. Delicious!--Krug vertical. Drink now.

name: Brut Champagne Grande Cuvée
review: A powerhouse. Big and brooding, showing toast, nut, coffee and oxidative aromas that pick up freshness on the palate, where citrus and dough flavors intervene. Really firm and focused, with complexity and character, this still needs time. Drink now through 2004.

name: Brut Champagne Grande Cuvée
review: The complex nose of grain, biscuit, citrus and honey indicates some use of wood, while the palate is tight and elegant. What's most impressive is the texture, all filigree and finesse, from start to finish. An elegant version, with subtle intensity and length. Drink now through 2010. 5,500 cases imported.

name: Brut Champagne Grande Cuvée
review: A complex, refined Champagne, with vanilla, coconut, lemon and mineral aromas and flavors. Fresh and elegant, yet deep and persistent, evoking whole-grain toast. This dovetails nicely on the lingering finish. Drink now through 2012.

name: Brut Rosé Champagne
review: Very dry, this rosé offers the essence of whole-grain bread, dried flowers, berries and spices. Elegant, intense and supported by lively acidity. Fine length and harmony. Complex and inviting overall. Drink now through 2012.

name: Brut Rosé Champagne
review: A vinous style, with macerated cherry, wild berry, grain and spice notes. The texture is ultrafine, and this has plenty of intensity and length. A serious rosé for the table, but has the vibrant structure to be enjoyed on its own. Drink now through 2012.

name: Brut Champagne
review: A rare, old gem of a Champagne with subtle, sophisticated, mature flavors and a light, delicate texture. Very dry but not austere, it seems to expand with each sip, and the finish lingers for minutes.

name: Brut Champagne
review: Rich and full-bodied, with spicy vanilla, nutmeg and Chardonnay fruit flavors of ripe pear and honey. The spicy flavors linger.--Krug vertical.

name: Brut Champagne Collection
review: Rich and ample in volume, with mature flavors of dried citrus, truffle, leather and spice, all backed by a firm structure. Turns leaner and sleek on the finish, with a lovely smoke and spice aftertaste. Drink now through 2015.

name: Brut Champagne Collection
review: Tasted from magnum. Muscular, ripe and powerful,evoking dried fruit in the bouquet, changing to honey, soya and mushroom in the mouth. Richly textured, with plenty of underlying structure. Enjoyable now, yet there's no urgency to drink up.--Krug vertical. Drink now through 2005.

name: Brut Champagne Grande Cuvée
review: Distinctive and dramatic. Oak lends oxidative accents to the roasted flavors of coffee, nuts and citrus. It's all displayed on a full-bodied, powerful structure, ending in a tensile conflict between texture and flavor. Drink now through 2003. 35,000 cases made.

name: Brut Champagne Grande Cuvée
review: A firm, dense, dry Champagne, with complex flavors of ginger, spice, coconut and dried citrus wrapped up tight. Hangs together seamlessly, despite a youthful freshness and reticence on the finish. Needs time. Best from 2007 through 2012.

name: Brut Champagne Grande Cuvée
review: Offers seductive aromas of graphite and vanilla, with hints of coffee. Firm and expressive, with a refined mousse and great balance. There's a mix of freshness and mature elements, with fine length. Drink now through 2010.

name: Brut Rosé Champagne
review: A real wine lover's Champagne. Pale in color, but very rich and full-bodied, accented by mature Pinor Noir character that goes deep and lasts long on the finish.

name: Brut Rosé Champagne
review: A complex Champagne, combining youth and maturity. Cherry and strawberry flavors gain depth from the toast and mineral elements. There's fine intensity and harmony, ending in a spice and mineral aftertaste. Drink now through 2012.

name: Brut Blanc de Blancs Champagne Clos du Mesnil
review: Extremely elegant in style, with enticing lemon and grapefruit aromas and a minerally, seaside tang in the complex mix of flavors. It really opens up in the glass and seems to expand on the finish.--Krug Clos du Mesnil vertical. Drink now through 2008.

name: Brut Blanc de Blancs Champagne Clos du Mesnil
review: Lighter than other vintages of Clos du Mesnil, fully mature and perfect to enjoy now. This has an attractively toasty, doughy aroma, mellow fruit flavors with hints of white pepper, and the characteristic full, creamy texture of Krug.--Krug Clos du Mesnil vertical. Drink now through 2003.

name: Brut Blanc de Noirs Champagne Clos d'Ambonnay
review: A warm, inviting Champagne, despite its vivid structure. Sweet spices, leather, cedar and kumquat aromas give way to Meyer lemon, candied berry and briar flavors. This is racy, with a clean, bracing finish. Still very young, with the acidity dominating the finish. Best from 2014 through 2040.

name: Brut Champagne
review: Still quite young, full of spicy notes and a lovely freshness, this is clean, crisp and well rounded, with apple, pear and honey flavors.--Krug vertical.

name: Brut Champagne
review: Rich and mellow, though a bit restrained, with sage and ripe plum flavors that mix well and are lively on the finish.--Krug vertical.

name: Brut Champagne
review: Well balanced and mature, but still fresh and crisp, showing hazelnut and almond flavors. Creamy, with a hint of citrus.--Krug vertical.

name: Brut Champagne Collection
review: A gorgeous but extreme style of Champagne that's fully mature in flavor yet lively in balance. It's deep gold in color, smooth in texture and long on the finish. Intricate accents of nuts, honey, butter and spice intermingle with crisp fruit flavors. Drink now through 2000.

name: Brut Champagne Collection
review: Tasted from magnum. Rich and round, with a fresh, complex bouquet dominated by honey and a touch of mushroom. Rich and soft in texture, the flavors evoke marmalade and forest floor elements. Drinking beautifully now.--Krug vertical. Drink now through 2005.

name: Brut Champagne Private Cuvée
review: Shows earthy, toasty, complex flavors, with some freshness, but it's an old bottle of a mature Champagne, with all the complexity and richness one could want.

name: Brut Rosé Champagne
review: The aromas are delicate, but this gathers intensity on the palate, revealing smoke, toast, strawberry and cherry flavors. Builds to a rich finish, with a lingering aftertaste of cherry and mineral. Drink now through 2010.

name: Brut Champagne
review: Steely pear, maple and apple flavors predominate in this spicy, full-bodied wine. Crisp and lacking richness, but still full of finesse.--Krug vertical.

name: Brut Champagne
review: Light and fresh, with nutmeg, spice, pear and ripe apple flavors. Simple but delicious, though a little bitter on the finish.--Krug vertical.

name: Brut Champagne Grande Cuvée
review: Big and rich, with the depth of character provided by older wines in the cuvée, full-bodied, with toast and vanilla flavors that linger on the palate. A powerful style that will not please those seeking delicacy.

name: Brut Champagne
review: If you like your Champagne very mature, drink this. Superbly rich with bread dough and vanilla and ripe fruit aromas and flavors. Full bodied yet fine with mature and rich flavors. Drink now.

name: Brut Champagne
review: Concentrated, unctuous and almost sweet, with ripe pear, apple and dried apricot flavors and a tinge of bitter nuttiness on the finish.--Krug vertical.

name: Brut Champagne Grande Cuvée
review: A blockbuster in a mature, decadent style. Shows vanilla, apple, truffle and slight cream aromas and flavors, good acidity and a rich, earthy finish. Not everyone's glass of Champagne, but it's impressive to us.

name: Brut Champagne
review: Still a young Champagne, with tart apple flavors and ripe pear notes, as well. Fresh, light and delicate.--Krug vertical.

name: Brut Champagne
review: Tart but still rich, with apple, pear and cream flavors. Crisp and citrusy, with an interesting touch of peanuts.--Krug vertical.

name: Brut Champagne
review: A crisp wine, with apple and citrus flavors and nutty nuances. Still quite tart; seems to need more time to smooth out, but after nearly three decades it's hard to believe. A very good wine nonetheless.--Krug vertical.

name: Brut Champagne Grande Cuvée
review: Complex aromas, a creamy texture and a delicious finish make this an elegant Champagne. Its blend of rich and subtle elements shows finesse.

name: Brut Champagne
review: Lean and fresh, with pineapple and citrus flavors. Already showing the characteristic Krug spice and cream.--Krug vertical.

name: Brut Champagne Grande Cuvée
review: A mature, subtly flavored brut that invites you in with mellow aromas and flavors, coats the mouth with a rich effervescence and keeps your interest through the tangy aftertaste. Drink now through 2000.

name: Brut Champagne Grande Cuvée
review: Elegant and subtle. Intriguing aromas and flavors of bread dough, toast, fig and apple with a smooth texture make this complex and satisfying. Nice finish, too. 25,000 cases made.

name: Brut Champagne Grande Cuvée
review: Compact and hard Champagne with very firm acidity, and lemony, custard, toasty character. A bit aggressive. Perhaps better with time.

name: Brut Rosé Champagne
review: Very distinctive, though not for everyone. Amber in color, with orange-peel and nutty aromas and flavors, and smoky, walnutlike nuances. Has lively acidity and a fresh texture, considering its rather mature character.

name: Brut Champagne
review: A tart, citrusy wine that comes off a bit thin. Offers appley, yeasty flavors, modest pear notes and tastes of apricots on the finish.--Krug vertical.

name: Brut Champagne Grande Cuvée
review: An unusually mature style of non-vintage Champagne that blends nutty, buttery aromas with crisp, lemony flavors. Full-bodied and creamy in texture.

name: Brut Champagne
review: Well rounded and smooth, with a good Chardonnay taste dominated by apricot and pears. Doesn't show much complexity, but is still quite enjoyable.--Krug vertical.

name: Brut Champagne
review: Very tart, with green apple flavors. Almost bitter on the finish, and doesn't show much depth.--Krug vertical.

name: Brut Rosé Champagne
review: Going over the hill, but still interesting to drink. Pale for a rosé, rich and very mature in flavor, showing spicy, meaty, mushroomy notes. Seems a bit oxidized. 4,000 cases made.

name: Brut Champagne
review: If you like mushrooms, this is your wine. Offers chanterelle-like flavors framed by cream and spice notes and tastes a bit thin overall. A style that may not appeal to many.--Krug vertical.

name: Brut Blanc de Blancs Champagne Clos du Mesnil
review: Lean and simple with some nice figgy fruit and cinnamon spice, a bit piney, generous in flavor but without quite the depth of the better ones.

name: Riesling Eiswein Nahe Münsterer Pittersberg
review: Delicious flavors of mango, banana, passion fruit and preserved lemon mark this lively, concentrated dessert Riesling. It's balanced by a firm structure, and all the elements are integrated. Drink now through 2020. 83 cases made.

name: Riesling Eiswein Nahe Münsterer Pittersberg
review: Extremely intense, almost burnt character to the peach, nectarine and citrus notes in this racy Riesling. So bracing, it virtually resonates on the palate, with spice and mineral accents, turning just a tad cloying on the finish. Still, it's very impressive. Best from 2005 through 2017. 35 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Gold Cap Nahe Münsterer Pittersberg
review: An impressive '97 auslese, redolent of red berries and almonds, this is intense and difficult to taste at this stage due to its raw, unharnessed power and exuberance. Its sweetness and structure need time to integrate. Great finish. Best from 2004 through 2012.

name: Riesling Auslese Nahe Münsterer Pittersberg
review: Ripe and rich, with concentrated peach, golden raisin and apricot flavors that are accented by an exotic spiciness. Tropical fruit notes of mango and baked pineapple linger on the seductively creamy finish. Drink now through 2040. 15 cases imported.

name: Riesling Eiswein Nahe Münsterer Pittersberg
