review: Packed with almond, baked piecrust and intense citrus flavors, this balances richness and concentration with a crystalline framework and bracing acidity. Finishes with a long aftertaste of marzipan. Best from 2002 through 2020.

name: Riesling Spätlese Nahe Münsterer Dautenpflänzer
review: Aromas of slate and mineral are followed by racy flavors, with plenty of fresh-cut apple, Bosc pear and quince. Very pure-tasting, finishing with currant and spice. Best after 2013. 110 cases imported.

name: Riesling Auslese Nahe Münsterer Dautenpflänzer
review: A superripe version, showing apricot, mineral and black currant flavors that just melt in your mouth, with the intensity and depth to follow through the finish. Needs time to integrate. Best from 2003 through 2010.

name: Riesling Spätlese Nahe Binger Scharlachberg
review: Minerally, powerful and well-spiced, with lovely peach pie, apricot tart and ripe pear flavors. The long, lush finish offers cream and savory herb notes. Elegant and richly fruity. Drink now through 2030. 15 cases imported.

name: Riesling Spätlese Nahe Münsterer Dautenpflänzer
review: Svelte, offering peach and tangerine flavors on a gossamer frame. A stone element shadows the fruit and should emerge more prominently over time. Balanced and subtle, it's all in the details. Drink now through 2025.

name: Riesling Spätlese Rheinhessen Binger Scharlachberg
review: Lush and juicy, sporting peach, nectarine and grapefruit notes. It's all pulled together by the vibrant acidity, as this unfolds on the palate to a long conclusion. Drink now through 2024.

name: Riesling Auslese Gold Cap Nahe Münsterer Pittersberg
review: Saturated with apricot, in a round, forward style, yet with enough acidity to keep it lively. Delicious now, should also improve with age. Drink now through 2008.

name: Riesling Kabinett Nahe Münsterer Pittersberg
review: This has snap. A lovely kabinett, rich and creamy in texture, yet elegant and piquant, offering peach, citrus and mineral flavors. Drink now through 2008. 130 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Nahe Münsterer Pittersberg
review: Delicate violet and chamomile accents enliven the medium-bodied currant, white berry and crisp pineapple flavors. Rich white chocolate notes chime in, leading to a lively finish of smoke and cedar. Drink now through 2016. 14 cases imported.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Nahe Pittersberg GG
review: Rich and vibrant, with plenty of snap to the dried red berry, black currant and green pepper flavors. Well-integrated, offering a graceful finish of pastry and peach cobbler notes. Drink now through 2017. 14 cases imported.

name: Riesling Spätlese Nahe Münsterer Dautenpflänzer
review: Lush, with Fuji apple and ripe grapefruit flavors accented by hints of smoke. Honey notes linger on the creamy finish. Drink now through 2035. 208 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Nahe Münsterer Dautenpflänzer
review: Shy in aroma, with vivid apple, violet and grapefruit flavors fixed by racy acidity. Superlight in weight, yet intense, with a long, mouthwatering finish. Best from 2012 through 2024.

name: Riesling Eiswein Nahe Münsterer Pittersberg
review: Ripe and thick, with a vibrant framework keeping everything balanced and lively, this '98 eiswein evokes peach, pear and vanilla custard notes. Approachable now, but will keep. Drink now through 2008.

name: Riesling Kabinett Nahe Münsterer Rheinberg
review: A ripe style, with jellied citrus flavors that show lilting accents of savory herb and spice. Very fresh and juicy, with a finish that has notes of light cream and spice that linger effortlessly. Drink now through 2022. 20 cases imported.

name: Riesling Kabinett Nahe Münsterer Rheinberg
review: Attractive notes of lime, vanilla and mango match the lightweight frame in this elegant white. This has fine length, with a mineral accent lurking in the background. Drink now through 2020.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Nahe Dautenpflänzer GG
review: Intense flavors of apple tart and baked pear are focused and well-spiced. Crunchy ginger and quince notes in the midpalate, with a finish that lingers, offering lemon custard accents.  Drink now through 2019. 30 cases imported.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Scharlachberg
review: An intense, elegant white, dry and saline, offering mineral elements complemented by apple and pear flavors. Displays fine balance and harmony, with a refreshing finish. Drink now through 2016.

name: Riesling Spätlese Halbtrocken Nahe Münsterer Pittersberg
review: More on the mineral side than fruity, with nice wet stone, white pepper and chalk elements shaded by peach and ripe apple. This is defined by lively acidity as it cruises to a long aftertaste. Drink now through 2022.

name: Riesling Spätlese Nahe Münsterer Dautenpflänzer
review: This is plump and tastes like peach and ripe apple, with a slight nutty, leesy note that will dissipate with time. Nicely balanced with a crisp, mouthwatering finish. Drink now through 2022. 19 cases imported.

name: Riesling Spätlese Nahe Münsterer Dautenpflänzer
review: An excellent spätlese, rich and creamy, sporting apricot, orange, vanilla and mineral aromas and flavors on a dense yet elegant frame. Fine length.  Drink now through 2020.

name: Riesling Spätlese Nahe Münsterer Dautenpflänzer
review: A sleek, dense white, featuring sweet corn, apricot, red berries and minerals all focused and lingering through the long finish. Very smooth and seductive. Drink now through 2012. 125 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Rheinhessen Binger Scharlachberg
review: Spicy and fresh-tasting, with well-concentrated flavors of citrus, melon and pear supported by lively acidity. Finishes with focus and intense creaminess, lingering with notes of tarragon. Drink now through 2035. 28 cases imported.

name: Riesling Auslese Nahe Münsterer Dautenpflänzer
review: Shy aromatically, this white shows richness, with floral, peach, baked apple and nutty, leesy notes. This is backed by bright acidity and needs time to integrate. Best from 2013 through 2025. 5 cases imported.

name: Riesling Auslese Nahe Münsterer Dautenpflänzer
review: An elegant, lacy white with some tropical nuances and a hint of tapioca on the nose. Seductive and satisfying, slightly drier than most auslesen, with a kick of honey on the finish. Best from 2001 through 2012.

name: Riesling Kabinett Nahe Münsterer Kapellenberg
review: Hints of sweet corn and vanilla augment apricot and lime in this sleek Riesling. It's not that expressive just now, but there's a firm structure and a keen mineral aftertaste. Best from 2009 through 2020.

name: Riesling Kabinett Nahe Münsterer Rheinberg
review: Redolent of dried apple and pear, with notes of dried pineapple that give this a rich, tropical allure. Lush and spicy on the elegant and refined finish.  Drink now through 2022. 80 cases imported.

name: Riesling Kabinett Nahe Münsterer Rheinberg
review: The minerally aroma is followed by well-spiced flavors of juicy peach and apricot, as well as hints of cream. Finishes with pie crust notes. Drink now through 2014. 240 cases imported.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Nahe Dautenpflänzer GG
review: On the austere side, showing lemon and green apple flavors, this dry white is balanced toward the tart end of the spectrum. Drink now through 2022. 25 cases imported.

name: Riesling Spätlese Nahe Dorsheimer Burgberg
review: Clean and crisp, revealing nectarine, lime and a hint of tangerine. It's rich, with a nice beam of acidity keeping it focused. Moderate length. Drink now through 2024.

name: Riesling Spätlese Nahe Münsterer Dautenpflänzer
review: Passion fruit and orange flavors highlight this elegant, bright Riesling. Well-balanced, with an intense core of fruit, picking up a chalky sensation on the finish. Drink now through 2015. 231 cases imported.

name: Riesling Spätlese Nahe Münsterer Dautenpflänzer
review: Very firmly structured, but this is dense and offers spice and mineral shadings to complement the apple and white peach notes. Still leaning toward the structure on the finish, but this shows promise. Best from 2007 through 2020. 250 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Nahe Münsterer Dautenpflänzer
review: A live wire of a white, reverberating with apricot, mineral and coconut aromas and flavors. Full of intensity, with a green apple finish that lingers. Best from 2002 through 2008.

name: Riesling Spätlese Nahe Münsterer Dautenpflänzer
review: A charmer. Exotic cherry and black currant notes distinguish this delicate spätlese. It's round and full of succulent fruit character, but there's plenty of zippy acidity too. Drink now through 2005.

name: Riesling Spätlese Nahe Münsterer Pittersberg
review: Fans of lean, bracing Riesling take note: The intense peach, apple and mineral flavors are stripped to the bare essentials here. It's tightly wound and built for aging. Best from 2003 through 2012. 130 cases made.

name: Riesling Kabinett Nahe Münsterer Rheinberg
review: Juicy, with good cut to the baked apple, white cherry and berry flavors. Interesting notes of white chocolate join the mix as well, extending on the rich finish. Drink now through 2020. 150 cases made.

name: Riesling Kabinett Nahe Münsterer Rheinberg
review: Slightly sweeter, yet backed by vibrant acidity, this white offers nectarine, peach and mineral notes in a forward, appealing manner. Drink now through 2018.

name: Riesling Kabinett Nahe Münsterer Rheinberg
review: Spice- and mineral-laden, full of lime, peach and orange notes, with fine clarity and intensity. It's all in balance, with a stone aftertaste. Drink now through 2015.

name: Riesling Kabinett Nahe Münsterer Rheinberg
review: Exotic and expressive, offering intense mineral, tropical fruit and citrus aromas and flavors, all well-balanced by moderate acidity. This shows richness and concentration. Drink now through 2010.

name: Riesling Kabinett Nahe Münsterer Rheinberg
review: This grows on you. Starts out broad, getting successively narrower as the mineral, peach and grapefruit notes reach their conclusion in a subtle, long finish. Drink now through 2005. 220 cases made.

name: Riesling Kabinett Nahe Münsterer Rheinberg
review: There's intensity along with a rich texture, yet this is very firmly supported by a green apple acidity and carbon dioxide, which will dissipate in time and expand the peach and spice flavors. Best from 2001 through 2006.

name: Riesling QbA Feinherb Nahe Schiefer
review: Redolent of fresh-cut apple, with refreshing and delicate notes of melon, cream and spice. The plush finish echoes the flavors. Drink now.

name: Riesling QbA Trocken Nahe Quarzit
review: Offers flavors of wild herbs, with dried basil and tarragon dominating, complemented by notes of green apple and lime. Accents of dried apricot and ginger appear on the crisp finish. Drink now. 56 cases imported.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Nahe Münsterer Pittersberg
review: A tasty dry Riesling. Round and fleshy, with floral and tropical fruit cocktail aromas and flavors, offset by refreshing acidity. Drink now through 2010. 4 cases imported.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Nahe
review: Well-spiced flavors of peach tart, baked pear and dried apple feature hints of sage cream. Luscious apricot and ginger accents on the finish.   Drink now through 2018. 450 cases imported.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Scharlachberg GG
review: Taut, with notes of slate to the grapefruit and ripe lime flavors. The crisp finish has hints of beeswax. Drink now through 2019. 15 cases imported.

name: Riesling Spätlese Nahe Münsterer Dautenpflänzer
review: This tastes on the light side, yet the peach, grapefruit and mineral flavors are attractive and it's creamy in texture. Good mouthwatering finish. Drink now through 2010. 150 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Nahe Münsterer Pittersberg
review: Off-dry, this shows plenty of pepper and mineral notes, along with peach and citrus flavors. It's elegant and balanced, showing the Mosel style of Nahe Riesling. Moderate length. Drink now through 2018. 140 cases made.

name: Riesling Kabinett Nahe Münsterer Pittersberg
review: Elegant and focused. Very creamy initially, showing vanilla and coconut flavors, then the firm acidity ushers in apple and mineral nuances, ending in a lip-smacking tang. Drink now through 2007.

name: Riesling Kabinett Nahe Münsterer Rheinberg
review: Tangy, moderately intense lemon candy, mandarin orange and apricot notes. Crisp and well-balanced. Drink now through 2016. 96 cases imported.

name: Riesling Spätlese Trocken Nahe Münsterer Dautenpflanzer
review: This is rich in texture and bright, with subtle citrus and mineral flavors lingering modestly. Good balance overall. Drink now through 2005. 330 cases made.

name: Riesling Kabinett Nahe Münsterer Kapellenberg
review: A lovely '97, displaying white peach and spice notes, with richness, density and vibrant acidity, all the while maintaining a sense of harmony. Finishes dry. Best from 2001 through 2006.

name: Riesling Kabinett Nahe Münsterer Rheinberg
review: A slight nuttiness kicks off this sleek, grapefruit- and mineral-tinged white. It's rich and backed by a vivid structure, but lacks a little intensity. Drink now through 2008. 270 cases made.

name: Riesling QbA Nahe Münsterer Kapellenberg
review: Big QbA. Off-dry and showing stone, apple and pear flavors. Rigid now, it needs time to expand and reveal all its facets. Best from 2003 through 2007.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Nahe Münsterer Pittersberg
review: Medium-bodied, dry style, with hints of petrol, pine and apple flavors. It's on the austere side with the alcohol showing. Food will help tame it. Drink now through 2010. 11 cases imported.

name: Riesling Spätlese Nahe Münsterer Dautenpflanzer
review: Huge nose of creamy vanilla, then the apricot and grapefruit emerge on the palate. Assertive rather than graceful, yet you have to admire its exuberance. Drink now through 2004.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Nahe Dautenpflänzer
review: Lean and austere, with grapefruit and apple flavors. It's juicy, with moderate length, if not very complex. Drink now through 2015.

name: Riesling Kabinett Nahe Münsterer Rheinberg
review: Has a nice crispness and underlying minerality, but this seems chalky in texture, without the clarity and precision of the best 2005s. It's also clipped on the finish. Drink now through 2012. 206 cases imported.

name: Scheurebe Spätlese Nahe Münsterer
review: Pleasant and simple, with pine and peach flavors on a soft, medium-sweet structure. Drink now through 2001.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Stagecoach Vineyard
review: Dense and chewy, a powerful expression of Cabernet that's rich with blackberry, currant, cedar, tobacco and graphite flavors and wall-to-wall tannins. Best from 2013 through 2025. 542 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: A rich, creamy, seductive and structured style, with vanilla-scented orange and citrus, ripe pear and apple blossom flavors, gaining depth and ending with a long, detailed finish. Drink now through 2018. 577 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley Stagecoach Vineyard
review: An elegant and well-structured red, with appealing aromas of red currant, cedar and tomato leaf that lead to complex flavors of ripe plum, bittersweet chocolate and olive. Tannins ease in at the finish. Drink now through 2016. 380 cases made.

name: Syrah Napa Valley Black Bart Stagecoach Vineyards
review: Ripe and lively, with intense red plum and black cherry fruit that is supple and polished at this youthful age. The finish reveals layers of fruit and spice, with a firm tannic backbone. Drink now through 2011. 900 cases made.

name: The Advocate Stagecoach Vineyard Napa Valley
review: A wine with grace and finesse, complex but sleekly structured, with aromas of black cherry and mocha oak and flavors of red currant, tomato leaf and dried brown spices. Merlot, Malbec and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2016. 628 cases made.

name: Black Bart's Bride Stagecoach Vineyards Napa Valley
review: A bold, rich, unctuous style, with layers of fig, mango and tropical fruit notes. Lots of spice, with a texture that coats the palate. Marsanne, Viognier and Chardonnay. Drink now through 2009. 437 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley Stagecoach Vineyard
review: Dense and a bit racy, showing polished black cherry and spicy oak aromas, with layered currant, espresso and dusty cedar flavors that finish with firm tannins. Best from 2013 through 2017. 525 cases made.

name: Syrah Napa Valley Black Bart Stagecoach Vineyard
review: Firmly tannic, yet rich and flavorful, with zesty wild berry, spice, pepper and blackberry fruit. Tightly wound and structured, with a long, persistent finish. Best from 2010 through 2016. 695 cases made.

name: Syrah Napa Valley Black Bart Stagecoach Vineyard
review: Distinct for its pure plum, berry and spicy, peppery attributes. Clean, tight and focused, gaining depth and complexity. Ends with spice, leather, sage and lavender. Drink now through 2012. 1,219 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Stagecoach Vineyard
review: Serves up a rich array of dusty, loamy earth, dried berry, currant and tobacco, gaining a touch of mocha on the focused finish. Drink now through 2022. 1,853 cases made.

name: Marsanne Napa Valley Stagecoach Vineyard Black Bart
review: Fragrant floral, honey, peach and pear aromas are rich and creamy. Well-focused, intense and concentrated without being heavy. One of California's best Marsannes. Drink now through 2011. 620 cases made.

name: Synchrony Stagecoach Vineyard Napa Valley
review: A very rich and layered red, with dense mocha, currant, dried herb, fresh-turned earth and tobacco notes, ending with a long, full, mouthcoating finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Malbec and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2022. 164 cases made.

name: Syrah Napa Valley Black Bart Stagecoach Vineyard
review: Focused on a core of cherry and raspberry flavors, this is firm and spicy, supported by ripe, chewy tannins and accented by hints of graphite and crushed rock. Drink now through 2024. 446 cases made.

name: Syrah Napa Valley Black Bart's Bounty
review: Tight and firm, with mineral, sage, dried berry, pepper and spice presented in a compact, concentrated style. Needs time. Best from 2009 through 2016. 1,125 cases made.

name: Black Bart's Bride Napa Valley
review: Distinctive for its toasty spice notes, with a fragrant honeysuckle detail. Full-bodied pear, citrus, apple and almond skin accents add to the complexity, with a balanced kick of acidity on the finish. Marsanne, Viognier and Chardonnay. Drink now through 2016. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 775 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley M5 Stagecoach Vineyard
review: Dry, savory and notably oaky, with dusty cedar, fresh-turned earth and dried berry and herb, ending with loamy, dry tannins. Could open up with time. Best from 2013 through 2023. 167 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Veraison Stagecoach Vineyard
review: This muscular wine is big, rich and ripe, featuring rugged tannins that have a stemmy edge amid the extracted red and dark berry, mocha and black licorice flavors. This may always be on the tannic side, but gains with aeration. Best from 2016 through 2026. 1,673 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Offers aromas of fresh citrus blossom, butterscotch, honey and fig. This is rich in flavor and texture for the vintage. Ends with a touch of smoky oak. Drink now through 2019. 180 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: A weighty, well-oaked style, with lots of smoke, cedar, roasted fig and vanilla notes. Intense and concentrated, showing focus and persistence. Best from 2014 through 2020. 296 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley Stagecoach Vineyard
review: Combines a broad, rich array of fig, melon and ripe apple flavors with snappy acidity. Smoky, toasty oak lends a touch of charry bitterness to the aftertaste, but this may fade with time. Drink now through 2020. 725 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley Stagecoach Vineyard
review: Offers good focus and structure, with plum and lead pencil aromas that lead to black currant and bittersweet chocolate flavors, finishing with dry, cedary tannins. Drink now. 290 cases made.

name: Syrah Napa Valley Joshua Stagecoach Vineyard
review: Offers a broad range of spicy wild berry and blueberry flavors that fan out on the palate, ending with a touch of fresh earth, herb and mineral. The tannins are integrated. Decant. Drink now through 2012. 203 cases made.

name: The Doctor Krupp Vineyards Atlas Peak
review: Dark, intense and concentrated, with mineral, currant, dark chocolate, cassis, licorice, strawberry and cherry flavors. Polished and balanced for such a big wine, with a long finish. Tempranillo, Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Malbec. Drink now through 2012. 495 cases made.

name: The Doctor Napa Valley
review: Rich and extracted, with juicy blackberry, anise, smoke and charcoal notes. This is slow to unfold, maintaining a chewy, tannic profile. Tempranillo, Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Malbec and Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2022. 485 cases made.

name: Veraison Napa Valley
review: Very dense and tannic, with a rich, chewy core of espresso, dried dark berry, chicory, nutmeg and savory dried berry flavors that lend this a rustic scent and texture. Syrah, Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Malbec, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2028. 2,135 cases made.

name: Veraison Napa Valley
review: Bordeaux-like in structure, showing density and a range of flavors built around dried currant, cedar, graphite, dried anise and black licorice, ending with firm, dry tannins. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Merlot, Malbec, Petit Verdot and Syrah. Drink now through 2022. 2,250 cases made.

name: Black Bart's Bride Napa Valley
review: Floral, spicy and herbal, with a dulling bitter almond skin and toasty notes that really dominate on the finish. Like it for its intensity and well-integrated acidity. Marsanne, Viognier and Chardonnay. Drink now. 930 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley M5 Stagecoach Vineyard
review: Exhibits a strong mix of powerful Cabernet and potent oak, making for a mouthful of flavors that are rustic and chewy. Lots of extracted berry and woody flavors suggest that this should be given some time. Drink now through 2026. 250 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Stagecoach Vineyard
review: Dense and intense, featuring tightly wound, rich and extracted dark berry, dried berry and mocha notes that firm up on the finish, with thick tannins. Best from 2014 through 2024. 1,644 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley Stagecoach Vineyard
review: Elegantly styled, with medium-weight pear, honeydew and apple flavors that are fresh and clean. Ends with a dash of subtle nutmeg. Drink now. 285 cases made.

name: Synchrony Stagecoach Vineyard Napa Valley
review: An immense wine, rich and flavorful, yet raw and edgy from ripeness and tannins. Should tame with time, but the alcohol sticks out. Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon, Malbec, Merlot and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2023. 210 cases made.

name: Synchrony Stagecoach Vineyard Napa Valley
review: Intense, with a strong presence of loamy earth, sage and dried berry character. Full-bodied, tight and firm, ending with a drying sensation and a minerally edge. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Petit Verdot, Malbec and Merlot. Drink now through 2020. 598 cases made.

name: Syrah Napa Valley Black Bart Stagecoach Vineyard
review: Dense and loaded with crushed-rock mineral notes, plus flavors of currant, smoky herb and cracked pepper. The tannins threaten to shut down the finish, but patience will pay off. Best from 2018 through 2028. 183 cases made.

name: Syrah Napa Valley Black Bart Stagecoach Vineyard
review: Shows a dusty, cedary, oaky side. Very dry, with chewy tannins wrapped around dense, rustic, earthy dried berry, sage and tobacco leaf notes. Needs time but may always be tannic. Drink now through 2027. 154 cases made.

name: Syrah Napa Valley Black Bart Stagecoach Vineyard
review: This red is marked by smoky, meaty scorched earth flavors that are drying, more so than in past vintages. The mineral, pebble and dried blueberry flavors show promise on the finish. Best from 2013 through 2022. 550 cases made.

name: Syrah Napa Valley Black Bart Stagecoach Vineyard
review: Spice, floral and dried berry flavors are joined by a minerally texture in this full-bodied, dry and savory red. Ends with roasted herb and gravel notes, with drying tannins. Best from 2011 through 2019. 900 cases made.

name: Black Bart's Bride Napa Valley
review: Driven by toasty aromatics, this features plenty of citrus peel, yellow apple and pear flavors, joined by spice, tobacco leaf and crème brûlée details. Smooth body, with a light acidity. Marsanne and Viognier. Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Black Bart's Bride Stagecoach Vineyard Napa Valley
review: Melon and apricot flavors are bold and fleshy, with ripe tannins and hints of toast and spice on the finish, along with a touch of orange rind. Viognier and Roussanne. Drink now. 215 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley M5 Stagecoach Vineyard
review: Intense and broad-shouldered, this features a dense, rustic mix of dried dark berry, herb, cedar and black tea flavors, accompanied by dry, gripping tannins. Needs time to resolve. Best from 2015 through 2025. 142 cases made.

name: Marsanne Napa Valley Black Bart Stagecoach Vineyard
review: Rich apple, honeysuckle and citrus notes mingle with spicy almond flavors and refreshing acidity. Drink now. 915 cases made.

name: The Doctor Napa Valley
review: Taut and tannic, with notes of dried berry, espresso and leather. Tempranillo, Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon, Malbec and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2019. 607 cases made.

name: The Doctor Napa Valley
review: Dark in color, dense, intense and peppery, with a tough core of wild berry, leather, earth and spice. But the tannins are chewy and gripping, which makes me wonder if they'll ever soften sufficiently. Cabernet Sauvignon, Tempranillo, Merlot and Malbec. Drink now through 2011. 407 cases made.

name: Marsanne Napa Valley Black Bart Stagecoach Vineyard
review: Appealing for the spicy, nutty qualities to the pear, citrus and yellow apple notes. Balanced and full-bodied, with an almond skin finish. Drink now. 768 cases made.

name: Tempranillo Napa Valley Joshua Krupp Vineyard
review: Rich and concentrated, if a bit muddled, with dried currant, berry, anise, cedar and mineral flavors. Ends with drying tannins. Drink now through 2010. 133 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Stagecoach Vineyard
review: Pure and clean, with dill and pencil lead notes amid maturing dark berry depths, the fruit holds its own and veers toward a drier, burlier profile. The core currant and blackberry flavors are slow to unfold.2006 California Cabernet blind retrospective (December 2015). Drink now. 350 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Stagecoach Vineyard
review: Presents a rich and dense, yet muddled, mix of extracted dark berry, chewy tannins and woodsy, cedary oak. Shows plenty of oomph to the flavors, but they're blurred on the finish.2005 California Cabernet blind retrospective (September 2015). Drink now. 468 cases made.

name: Synchrony Stagecoach Vineyard Napa Valley
review: More subdued than expressive, with toned down herb, dusty earth and dried berry that lumber along, with the wood dominant. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Malbec. Drink now through 2024. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 130 cases made.

name: The Doctor Napa Valley
review: Red fruit flavors are wrapped up in a muscular body, offering details of spice, earth, mineral and herb. Straightforward, and with a little charm. Tempranillo, Merlot, Malbec and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2014. 468 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Stagecoach Vineyard
review: Rich, with loamy, earthy, leathery currant, anise and sage notes. Though dense and concentrated, this is also quite dry and tannic, so decant for now. Drink now through 2012. 516 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Stagecoach Vineyard
review: Aromas of dried currant, gun metal, spice and cedar turn austere and chewy on the palate, at times providing structure. Yet the tannins turn dry and leathery on the finish, bringing it to an abrupt end. Best from 2007 through 2012. 300 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Veraison Stagecoach Vineyard
review: Intense and earthy, with an odd graphite and iodine note that's off-center and offbeat compared to the modest berry flavors. Drink now. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 315 cases made.

name: The Advocate Stagecoach Vineyard Napa Valley
review: Dry and herbal, with more tannins that fruit. Shows a hint of tart currant midpalate, but is short and tannic. Petit Verdot and Malbec. Drink now through 2011. 483 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Stagecoach Vineyard
review: Delivers a mix of loamy currant, pebble, herb, sage and tobacco. Firm and concentrated, if a bit rustic, with the tannins clamping down on the finish. Best from 2010 through 2016. 235 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Stagecoach Vineyard
review: Well-made, supple and balanced, with red and dark berry fruit shaded by fresh herb and sage. Tightens on the finish, and should reward short-term cellaring. Drink now through 2022. 205 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Martinelli Road
review: Centered on green apple and citrus notes, this is young and raw, with a pithy edge. Maintains its focus. Drink now through 2018. 150 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Lucia Highlands Sleepy Hollow Vineyard
review: Displays ginger-nutmeg scents, with tight, flinty green apple, pear and citrus notes. Still a bit raw, but intense and balanced, with a vibrant finish. Drink now through 2011. 290 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Anderson Valley
review: Medium-bodied, delicate and savory, with ripe plum, black cherry and spicy, cedary notes that are focused, ending with a loamy earth and cola edge. Drink now through 2012. 290 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Stagecoach Vineyard
review: Dry, herbal and savory, with medium- to full-bodied dried currant, mineral, sage and loamy earth flavors, ending with a touch of espresso and light oak. Decant. Drink now through 2016. 315 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Lucia Highlands Soberanes Vineyard
review: Charming, this shows a strong dill-laced herbal personality and requisite tannins, leaving a modest core of supple Pinot adrift at midpalate. Drink now. 570 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Anderson Valley
review: Solid if unexciting, this serves up a mix of savory berry, forest floor, loamy earth and dried herb notes. Drink now. 600 cases made.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Südburgenland Perwolff
review: What a wonderful pure and violet-scented red, very focused and intense in its raspberry flavor, although some may find the underlying leather note too distracting. Nonetheless, this is a singular and well-crafted red, with concentration, a firm, balanced structure and a terrific finish. Sweet, fruit and oak aftertaste. Blaufränkisch and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2010. 10 cases imported.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Südburgenland Perwolff
review: Stunning, exhibiting concentrated black cherry, cassis and licorice notes enmeshed in a suave yet so-dense-it's-almostchewy texture. So dense it takes on a tarry element, yet it also maintains a sense of grace and harmony. Blaufränkisch and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2010.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Südburgenland Perwolff
review: Beautiful red. Pure flavors of raspberry and cassis are both elegant and sumptuous, with underlying meat and mineral elements. Focused and modern, yet very Austrian, too, with a firm structure and lingering notes of vanilla on the finish. Blaufränkisch and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2006.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Südburgenland Alter Weingarten
review: Gorgeous aromas and flavors of violets, blackberries and minerals in this elegant, seductive red. The tannins are firm yet ripe, and all the elements are balanced. Great purity and length. Hard to deny this now. Blaufränkisch and Zweigelt. Drink now through 2005.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Südburgenland Perwolff
review: A very lush, full-bodied red, showing intense flavors of dark plum, chocolate, dark cherry and mocha, with silky tannins. Has a long, long finish of spice, plum pudding and smoke. Blaufränkisch. Drink now through 2014. 667 cases made.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Südburgenland Perwolff
review: Starts with an animal note, then the violet, cassis and blueberry flavors level a focused beam, wrapped in lively acidity and firm tannins. Disparate now, but shows promise. Best from 2006 through 2012. 5 cases imported.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Südburgenland Perwolff
review: Serious stuff. Ripe, concentrated black fruits augmented by vanilla, coffee and a whisky note mark this intense, inky wine. The structure is medium-bodied, with lively acidity and firm tannins. Good length, too. Best from 2001 through 2004. 575 cases made.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Trocken Südburgenland Weinberg
review: Gorgeous. Gushes with black cherry, blackberry and violet aromas and flavors, all beautifully put together on a firm yet rich structure. Great length and dimension. Drink now through 2005. 800 cases made.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Südburgenland Alter Weingarten
review: Terrific. Beautiful flavors of violets and kirsch, bordering on cassis, maintain intensity and vibrancy through the lingering finish. Elegant and well-structured, with stiff yet ripe tannins. One of the best Austrian reds in 1998. Drink now through 2005. 330 cases made.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Trocken Südburgenland Reserve
review: Very perfumed and floral, turning to blackberry and cassis in flavor, married to a supple, velvety texture. The tannins are ripe, the acidity vibrant. Drink now through 2010. 5 cases imported.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Trocken Südburgenland Weinberg
review: Young and awkward today, yet the components reveal concentrated pure blackberry flavor, lively acidity and firm, ripe tannins. Just needs a few months to knit. Fine, lingering finish. Drink now through 2006.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Trocken Südburgenland Weinberg
review: Here's an elegant mouthful of freshly crushed raspberries, cherries and blackberries on a framework of vibrant acidity and ripe tannins. Fine concentration and an excellent finish. Drink now through 2003. 915 cases made.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Südburgenland Alter Weingarten
review: Aromatic, full of violets and cassis, this dark red is concentrated, with gracefulness and harmony that belies its firm structure. Delicious now for the succulent blackberry fruit and mineral accent. Blaufränkisch and Zweigelt. Drink now through 2003. 330 cases made.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Trocken Südburgenland Reserve
review: Very fruit-forward and spicy, with rich flavors of boysenberry, blueberry and red plum. Well-structured and balanced, with a modest tannic grip and a long finish of cinnamon and hints of soy. Drink now through 2012. 833 cases made.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Südburgenland Perwolff
review: Ripe and spicy, with good structure and depth to the kirsch, damson plum and raspberry flavors. Chocolate mousse notes extend on the long, rich finish. Blaufränkisch with Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2012. 750 cases made.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Südburgenland Perwolff
review: Quaffable red, with a broad mix of juicy berry and red fruit flavors joined by delicious milk chocolate, spice and cream notes on the finish. Try with roasted salmon. Drink now through 2008. 750 cases made.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Trocken Südburgenland Reserve
review: A snappy and peppery red, with concentrated, fresh-tasting flavors of red cherry, plum and nectarine. Violet and citrus peel emerge on the finish. Drink now. 28 cases imported.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Trocken Südburgenland Reserve
review: A classy red, very supple, with cherry, spice and floral aromas and flavors. It's light in weight, with balance and moderate length. Drink now. 1,665 cases made.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Südburgenland Perwolff
review: Loads of crushed red fruit flavors, with mineral and plum notes, fill this fresh, lively red with plenty of verve. Currant and spice accent the finish. Blaufränkisch with Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2010. 583 cases made.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Südburgenland Perwolff
review: Very well done for the vintage. A lovely burst of black cherry and violet in this focused, firm '98 red lifts it above most in this vintage. Good length, too. Drink now through 2003. 50 cases imported.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Trocken Südburgenland
review: A pretty red, with a damson aroma and very lively boysenberry, dark cherry and cassis flavors. The finish is peppery. Drink now through 2009. 2,083 cases made.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Trocken Südburgenland
review: Red plum and raspberry flavors with a hint of game make this focused and structured. Crunchy finish of crushed red fruits. Drink now through 2008. 2,500 cases made.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Trocken Südburgenland Reserve
review: Firm and focused, with red plum flavors and some herbal notes. Raspberry, cream and spice dominate the finish. Drink now through 2011. 1,500 cases made.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Trocken Südburgenland Reserve
review: Fruity, with pretty red plum, boysenberry and cherry flavors. Blood orange and spiced fruit flavors define the finish. Drink now through 2009. 1,250 cases made.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Trocken Südburgenland
review: This firm red displays red plum and cherry flavors, with some herbal notes. Crisp finish. Drink now. 2,083 cases made.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Trocken Südburgenland Bründlgfangen
review: A fresh, violet- and berry-infused red, very fruity, with a soft structure. Fine on its own or with light foods. Drink now.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Trocken Südburgenland Bründlgfangen
review: Promotes raspberry and currant flavors, with hints of chocolate and black pepper. Lively acidity and light, firm tannins support the fruit. A Chianti substitute. Drink now through 2001. 2,000 cases made.

name: Malbec Mendoza Gran Reserva
review: A plush, toasty style, with an inviting warm cocoa aroma backed by velvety layers of braised fig, crushed currant and plum fruit and bittersweet chocolate. The long finish is filled with dark fruit, but it's very polished. Drink now through 2012. 250 cases made.

name: Malbec Mendoza Reserva
review: Very ripe, but also superfresh, with velvety texture and a long, beguiling palate of fig sauce, melted licorice, Turkish coffee, macerated currant and blackberry fruit. Long and dense on the finish, but pure and vivid. Drink now through 2011. 250 cases made.

name: Malbec Mendoza
review: Very fleshy, with plum, fig and boysenberry paste flavors liberally layered with dark toast and espresso notes, followed by a broad finish. For the hedonist crowd. Drink now through 2012. 2,000 cases imported.

name: Malbec Mendoza Gran Reserva
review: Spicy and rich, displaying macerated plum and wild berry notes that give way to layers of underbrush, dark tobacco and flint that expand on the long, minerally finish. Drink now. 150 cases imported.

name: Malbec Mendoza Gran Reserva
review: Very rich, with fig sauce, blueberry compote and dark, molten chocolate notes riding over the round, fleshy structure. Polished, with lots of toast and dark currant fruit on the finish. A nice debut for this label, from winemaker Héctor Durigutti. Drink now through 2011. 250 cases made.

name: Malbec Mendoza Reserva
review: Very juicy and forward, with a mix of blueberry, fig and mocha notes that pump through the fleshy, enticing finish. Nice debut for this label, from winemaker Héctor Durigutti. Drink now through 2010. 250 cases made.

name: Bonarda Mendoza
review: Ripe and round, with inviting plum, chocolate and spice notes allied to a fleshy, mouthfilling frame. Drink now. 400 cases imported.

name: Malbec Mendoza
review: Solid, with blackberry and fig fruit laid over ripe, well-integrated tannins, followed by a long, cocoa- and loam-dusted finish. Very solid. Drink now. 1,330 cases made.

name: Malbec Mendoza
review: Very polished, with creamy tannins and a milk chocolate note leading the way for plush blackberry and blueberry fruit. The round, soft finish has good length. Drink now. 1,330 cases made.

name: Malbec Mendoza Reserva
review: This medium-bodied red offers good cut and drive to its black cherry and plum pudding notes, which remain fresh on the spice- and mineral-tinged finish. Drink now. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 300 cases made.

name: Bonarda Mendoza
review: Hints of game and spice accent the ripe black cherry and black plum notes, which lead to a spice- and iron-tinged finish. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Malbec Mendoza
review: A spicy red, with hints of pepper and flint accenting the kirsch and linzer torte notes, as light tannins add some lift to the finish. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Bonarda Mendoza
review: Solid, with damson plum and black currant fruit backed by hints of herbs and graphite on the slightly soft finish. Drink now. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Bonarda Mendoza
review: Soft, with modest toast and plum notes and a light hint of game chiming in on the finish. The better of two bottles tasted. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Xinomavro Naoussa The Lady of Naoussa
review: A luscious and refined style, with concentrated red currant and spiced cherry flavors flanked by creamy notes. Cardamom and sandalwood accents grace the supple finish. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Xinomavro Naoussa
review: Supple and savory, with sanguine, cherry and dried berry flavors that are richly spiced. The long finish is pure and refreshing, showing some dried citrus accents. Drink now through 2017. 20 cases imported.

name: Xinomavro Naoussa Estate
review: Aromas and flavors of truffle are joined by notes of fig paste, dried berry and cherry strudel. Supple midpalate, presenting rich porcini accents that linger on the elegant finish. Drink now. 200 cases imported.

name: Drama Thema
review: This is filled with plush ripe cherry and dark plum flavors, flanked by savory herbal notes. The mineral-infused finish is fresh and lively, with hints of pemmican. Syrah and Agiorgitiko. Drink now through 2017. 10,000 cases made.

name: Drama White Thema
review: Medium-bodied, with ripe apple and tangerine flavors that feature accents of white cherry and spice. Juicy finish offers some creamy notes. Drink now through 2016. 4,000 cases made.

name: Vin de Pays de Velvendos
review: Ripe yet delicate, with plum, apple and dried cherry flavors and lots of iodine and smoke. Drink with grilled lamb. Xinomavro, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now. 300 cases imported.

name: Vin de Pays de Velvendos
review: A straightforward red, with dried cherry and wild plum flavors. Xinomavro, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. 500 cases imported.

name: Vin de Pays de Velvendos
review: Aromatic, with appealing cherry and red plum flavors that are framed by smoky notes. Xynomavro, Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Black Muscat. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Casablanca Valley
review: An up-front style, with tangerine and grapefruit notes backed by modest richness on the finish. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Malbec Mendoza
review: A touch jammy, with a mix of raspberry, rhubarb and roasted plum fruit backed by a slightly raisined finish. A layer of toast helps frame the finish. Drink now. 12,000 cases made.

name: Malbec Mendoza
review: Medium weight, with a straightforward set of raspberry and roasted vanilla flavors, backed by a toasty finish. Drink now. 4,000 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills Zena Crown Vineyard Single Vineyard Series
review: Firm in texture around a light thread of raspberry and guava flavors, gaining in intensity on the finish. Drink now through 2016. 319 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Bright and refreshing, with pretty cherry and floral flavors on a tangy frame, finishing with a bit of density and lingering nicely. Drink now through 2020. 12,350 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley
review: Sleek and polished, with a spicy edge to the pear and floral flavors, gliding smoothly into a persistent finish. Drink now. 5,839 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills Zena Crown Vineyard Single Vineyard Series
review: Light and tangy, with a strong mineral note and a metallic streak to the red berry flavors, persisting on the open-weave finish. Drink now through 2017. 800 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley
review: Light and sleek, with tangy lime accents around a central theme of apple and honeydew flavors, lingering refreshingly. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley
review: Light and refreshing, with nectarine and melon flavors balanced with a touch of lemon curd, finishing silky. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Light in texture, with vivid blackberry and passion fruit flavors competing for attention and lingering on the finish. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Reserve
review: Firm in texture, with a juicy blackberry character that picks up wet hay and pepper notes as the finish lingers. Needs time to soften. Best from 2015 through 2018. 4,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills Zena Crown Vineyard Single Vineyard Series
review: Aromatically compelling, layering cherry, plum, floral and peppery spice notes that carry through into the flavor profile, this picks up a slightly bitter note as the tannic finish goes on. Best after 2018. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 390 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Reserve
review: Light and tight, with a gritty edge to the pretty raspberry and red currant flavors. Drink now through 2014. 1,560 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Firm in texture, with a meaty edge to the berry flavors, turning earthy on the finish. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Reserve
review: Very firm, blanketed by peppery tannins around a slim core of blackberry and licorice flavors. Formidable texture for the fruit to overcome. Best after 2018. 4,200 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace
review: A straightforward white, displaying flavors of kumquat, candied orange peel and white pepper. Modest finish. Drink now. 3,000 cases imported.

name: Riesling Alsace
review: A dry, tangy white, with hints of candied apple and pineapple followed by a light, spicy finish. Drink now. 300 cases imported.

name: Sylvaner Alto Adige Valle Isarco
review: An elegant and balanced white, with a lovely spiced thread lacing the floral, honey, green melon and green plum notes. A quiet hint of minerality echoes on the lightly juicy finish. Drink now through 2018. 60 cases imported.

name: Riesling Alto Adige Valle Isarco Kaiton
review: Asian pear, lemon parfait, zesty mineral and apricot notes mix in this light-bodied white with a lacy texture and mouthwatering acidity. Crisp finish. Drink now. 1,416 cases made.

name: Riesling Alto Adige Valle Isarco Kaiton
review: A fresh, mineral-driven version, with subtle notes of green melon, grapefruit zest, white peach and beeswax. Offers a clean, snappy finish. Drink now. 90 cases imported.

name: Sylvaner Alto Adige Valle Isarco
review: Light-bodied, with hints of white cherry, salted almond and a floral hint of hops. Light, tangy finish. Drink now. 1,083 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Cuvée Caroline Vendange Tardive
review: Just off-dry and beautifully balanced, this vibrant version is driven by a streak of minerality and smoke, with ground spice notes underscoring finely layered flavors of melon sorbet, mango chutney and dried apricot. Ginger and cardamom details echo on the finish. Drink now through 2030. 300 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Cuvée Caroline Vendange Tardive
review: Gaining intensity from the verve of its acidity, this well-meshed version displays creamy lychee, apricot jam, and blood orange flavors in a just off-dry format. This is a powerful wine dressed up in refined clothing, and its intensity builds, accentuated by a spicy undertow, through to the lip-smacking finish. Drink now through 2027. 500 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Grand Cru Florimont Trois Châteaux
review: A lush and silky white, showing a lovely interplay between the racy acidity and ripe guava, glazed apricot and candied pink grapefruit flavors, all underscored by a subtle streak of smoky mineral that echoes with a floral detail on the lasting finish. Drink now through 2027. 100 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Pfersigberg Trois Châteaux
review: This is driven by its mineral side, with notes of flint and smoke at first, then mixing in fresh quince, peach, green pear and lemon curd flavors. Shows finely integrated acidity, with a long, mouthwatering finish. Drink now through 2030. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 300 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Pfersigberg Trois Châteaux
review: This white is very elegant and silky in texture, with beautiful balance to the smoky minerality, delicate acidity and honeyed notes of green melon, lychee, candied orange zest, tea rose and ground spice. Drink now through 2025. 300 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Grand Cru Florimont Trois Châteaux
review: This mouthwatering white has a beautiful, silky texture, carrying honeyed flavors of ripe nectarine, exotic spice, candied ginger and honeysuckle. Finely knit overall, with a smoky base note that gains momentum on the finish. Drink now through 2028. 50 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace
review: A firm Riesling, with razor-sharp acidity backing fruit flavors of Granny Smith apple, juicy tangerine and pink grapefruit, underscored by stone and smoke notes and a hint of fresh earth. It's all deftly woven together in a focused, elegant package, with a mouthwatering finish. Drink now through 2020. 500 cases imported.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Eichberg Trois Châteaux
review: Finely knit and creamy, this elegant, light-bodied white offers a backbone of lively acidity and flavors of poached quince and lemon parfait, with zesty accents of star anise and ground ginger. Clean-cut, minerally finish. Drink now through 2030. 150 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Geisberg
review: A bright and graceful white, offering a lovely mix of apple blossom, nectarine, fleur de sel and slivered almond flavors. Creamy and well-knit, with a racy, mineral-tinged finish. Drink now through 2027. 500 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Pfersigberg Trois Châteaux
review: Lithe and mouthwatering, with a fine thread of minerality woven with the flavors of ripe apricot, grapefruit sorbet, fresh ginger and spice. Features a lovely texture and a clean, fresh finish. Drink now through 2024.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Pfersigberg Trois Châteaux
review: A fresh, aromatic note of lilac runs through this wine, mixing with flavors of green melon, pink grapefruit sorbet and mango, with hints of smoke and curry spices. Finely meshed, with the subtle, juicy acidity leaving a mouthwatering impression on the creamy finish. Drink now through 2020. 250 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Pfersigberg Vendange Tardive
review: Vivid and lively, an exceptional late-harvest that layers orange, pineapple, apricot, vanilla and honey flavors over bracing acidity. Slightly sweet, charged with fruit and built to last. Try now. 100 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Cuvée Caroline Vendange Tardive
review: Off-dry and creamy, offering a smoky baseline and honeyed flavors of pear gelée, quince paste and candied lemon zest, with a hint of graham cracker. A lush white, lightly mouthcoating, with a spice-tinged finish. Drink now through 2019. 150 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Grand Cru Eichberg Trois Châteaux
review: Apple blossom and spice notes lace this silky white, while a smoky underpinning enriches the palate of Honeycrisp apple, beeswax and candied kumquat. Medium-bodied and well-cut, presenting a lightly honeyed, mouthwatering finish. Drink now through 2025. 58 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Grand Cru Florimont Trois Châteaux
review: An elegant Pinot Gris, subtly juicy and balanced, with a delicate mix of poached peach, spun honey, candied kumquat and ginger, smoke and spice notes. Light- to medium-bodied, with a lingering finish. Drink now through 2021. 70 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Trois Châteaux
review: A svelte, elegant example, structured by finely cut acidity that enlivens the ripe apricot, orange sorbet and honeyed almond notes. Bright and silky on the palate, with a lasting finish of stony mineral. Drink now through 2024.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Trois Châteaux
review: Light-bodied, with very tangy acidity, this white has tangerine, peach and mango flavors that show a hint of anise. Pairs a silky, light-weight texture with an overall bright, fresh character, making this a lovely sipper. Drink now through 2020. 100 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Collection
review: A pretty, floral white, displaying firm acidity enlivening the quince, apricot, lemon zest and ripe pear flavors. Hints of smoke and honey add complexity, and though packed and layered tightly, this is still expressive. Drink now through 2020. 830 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Geisberg
review: A creamy, finely knit white, mouthwatering and minerally, with honeysuckle and beeswax accents to the flavors of apricot, Meyer lemon, star anise and grated ginger. Offers a lasting, aromatic finish. Drink now through 2025. 250 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Pfersigberg Trois Chateaux
review: Fresh and focused, this balanced white offers subtle flavors of green pear, grapefruit, stone and smoke wrapped around a core of savory minerality. Racy, with a long finish of fleur de sel. Drink now through 2015.

name: Riesling Alsace Trois Châteaux
review: This lithe Riesling is structured by firm, well-knit acidity, with a streak of spicy mineral layered with flavors of poached apple and spring forest and hints of honeycomb and grated ginger. Vibrant. Drink now through 2029. 250 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Trois Châteaux
review: Light-bodied and snappy, defined by well-cut acidity and a minerally underpinning, this offers Honeycrisp apple, crunchy white peach, floral, spun honey and preserved lemon notes. The finish is bright and tangy. Drink now through 2025. 300 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Trois Châteaux
review: Mouthwatering, with a spicy, minerally drive to the subtle mix of guava, blood orange, almond biscotti and fleur de sel flavors. Well-meshed and vibrant. Drink now through 2022. 250 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Collection
review: The marmalade and almond skin notes are finely meshed with flavors of ripe apple, lychee and orchard blossom in this well-balanced white, with a mineral-tinged finish. Drink now through 2018. 300 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Pfersigberg Trois Châteaux
review: Rose petal and anise notes accent yellow apple, melon and candied ginger flavors in this medium-bodied white, and its rich streak of minerality gains momentum through the well-cut finish. Drink now through 2023. 200 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace
review: A rich and fleshy, medium-bodied white, offering a silky palate of marzipan, baked apricot, spun honey and smoky mineral flavors layered with juicy acidity and a hint of orange zest. The finish echoes a note of toasted almond. Drink now through 2021. 500 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Collection
review: Hints of raw almond and sea salt lace this dry white, layered with fresh-cut apple, stone and lemon curd flavors. A well-balanced white, with good acidity that leaves a snappy impression on the lightly spiced finish. Drink now through 2019.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Grand Cru Eichberg
review: A well-meshed version, showing integrated notes of pastry dough, vanilla and almond puree, with well-cut, juicy acidity and white peach, candied kumquat and plum hints. Lightly smoky throughout. Drink now through 2018. 70 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Grand Cru Eichberg
review: There's a plump juiciness to this medium-bodied white, but with good acidity to balance the honeyed apricot, yellow peach and clementine flavors. Just a touch of smoke and lanolin adds dimension and lingers on the finish. Drink now through 2015. 1,250 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Grand Cru Eichberg Trois Châteaux
review: An elegant white, delivering lightly juicy acidity that provides a bright frame for flavors of ripe green melon and blood orange, with a delicate streak of salinity, honey and spice. Drink now through 2021. 100 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Grand Cru Florimont Trois Chateaux
review: Silky in texture and well-balanced by mouthwatering acidity, this layers hints of star fruit, plum skin and crystallized honey with flavors of apricot puree and orange popsicle. Fleur de sel and mineral notes echo on the finish. Drink now through 2020. 70 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Tradition
review: Lip-smacking acidity frames this racy white, boosting the smoke, lemon zest and white grapefruit flavors. Shows good definition and balance, with a nice salty tang on the finish. Drink now through 2016. 170 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Trois Châteaux
review: Well-spiced, this firm, tightly knit white shows mineral and lemon zest accents and mouthwatering flavors of apricot, sliced almond and cantaloupe. Lasting, smoke-tinged finish. Drink now through 2025. 200 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Alsace
review: Subtle smoke and dried thyme notes underscore the well-spiced creamed cherry and mulberry fruit in this creamy red. Lightly chewy and minerally on the finish. Drink now through 2022. 500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Alsace Trois Châteaux
review: Bright acidity and mild tannins frame this light- to medium-bodied Pinot Noir, which shows ripe mulberry, spice box and dried thyme notes, with good focus. Drink now through 2020. 80 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace
review: Ripe Gala apple, star anise, verbena and apricot notes show in this lithe, elegant white, framed by bright acidity and a subtle accent of chalky mineral. Drink now through 2020. 434 cases imported.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Eichberg Trois Châteaux
review: This spicy white is lithe and lively, with pretty green pear, Thai basil, melon and slivered almond notes and a minerally undertow. This is bright and buoyant, but more delicate on the finish. Drink now through 2019. 100 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Pfersigberg
review: A floral, aromatic Riesling, featuring apricot, orange blossom, quince and candied orange peel flavors. Dry and juicy, with hints of honey and white pepper on the modest finish. Drink now through 2013. 125 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Pfersigberg Trois Chateaux
review: This racy, linear white shows abundant petrol-tinged minerality up front leading to more subtle flavors of poached pear and pink grapefruit pulp, with a touch of salted butter. Delicate finish. Drink now through 2020. 150 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Pfersigberg Trois Chateaux
review: Lightly juicy, featuring hints of almond paste and spun honey, balanced by tangy acidity and flavors of green melon, pink grapefruit zest, stone and ginger. Moderate finish. Drink now through 2018. 300 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Tradition
review: This aromatic Riesling shows a pretty note of lily of the valley on the nose and running through the palate, where it mixes with a briny, minerally edge and layers of green pear, pink grapefruit and green melon flavors. A finely woven, elegant white. Drink now through 2023.

name: Tokay Pinot Gris Alsace Cuvée Jeremy Sélection de Grains Nobles
Alsace
review: Lip-smacking and mineral-driven, this chalky white offers tangy hints of pink grapefruit granita, melon, Thai basil and pickled ginger. Sylvaner, Muscat and Auxerrois. Drink now through 2019. 2,000 cases imported.

name: Alsace
review: Hints of mineral and smoke underscore the flavors of orange confit, citrus pulp and coriander. This is an unusual white, dry and spicy, with a subtle hint of rose petal lingering on the finish. Drink now.

name: Auxerrois Alsace
review: Ripe flavors of apple and blood orange are balanced by dry, spicy acidity in this juicy white. There's a lightly chalky texture to this, and layers of anise, lemon curd and lanolin underneath. Delicious. Drink now through 2014. 200 cases made.

name: Auxerrois Alsace Trois Châteaux
review: This light-bodied white is well-spiced and vibrant, with a minerally undertow and flavors of Honeycrisp apple, crunchy white peach, orchard blossom and almond skin. Creamy. Drink now through 2019. 500 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Pfersigberg Trois Châteaux
review: Smoky, with candied orange peel and crystallized honey notes leading the way, mixing with dried apricot and ground cumin accents. Balanced, revealing a firm, spiced finish. Drink now through 2017. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 200 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Pfersigberg Trois Châteaux
review: This well-meshed version offers ripe apricot, lychee and nectarine flavors, with elegant acidity. Aromatic, with lots of floral notes as well as an exotic hint of chai tea. The finish is smoky. Drink now through 2015. 150 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Réserve Personnelle Sigillé de Qualité
review: Ripe, exotic and full-blown, offering harmonious peach, apricot, spice and honey flavors with firm acidity and a nice touch of sweetness. Maturing now; still fresh and clean. 200 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Tradition
review: Supple and seamless, featuring rose petal and lychee flavors and a hint of grapefruit. Picks up a hint of mineral on the lingering finish. Balanced and classy. Drink now through 2010. 300 cases made.

name: Muscat Alsace Grand Cru Pfersigberg Cuvée Caroline Vendange Tardive
review: On the dry side of VT, lightly sweet and mouthcoating, with a smoky undertow and flavors of candied orange zest, dried apricot, tea rose, honey and ginger. Drink now through 2020. 50 cases made.

name: Muscat Alsace Trois Châteaux
review: There is lots of Muscat character here—orange blossom and peel, and a hint of green herbs—but this is nicely restrained, resulting in a lightly creamy wine that's kept dry and lively thanks to fresh, citrusy acidity. Hints of lemon verbena and smoky stone build on the zesty finish. Drink now through 2016. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 100 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace
review: Sleek and well-knit, this smoky white layers clean-cut acidity with a subtle range of crunchy green pear, candied kumquat, dried apricot and ground ginger flavors. Drink now through 2025. 1,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Cuvée Jérémy Sélection de Grains Nobles
review: A pretty, floral Pinot Gris, soft and round, with ample apricot, nectarine and orange sorbet flavors. There's a smoky undertone of caramel candy, with hints of vanilla and pastry and a lingering finish. Drink now through 2016. 50 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Trois Châteaux
review: This light- to medium-bodied white is framed by sleek acidity, while the silky palate offers a well-meshed mix of glazed apricot, blood orange zest and crushed almond flavors. Drink now through 2022. 100 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Trois Châteaux
review: Sleek and light- to medium-bodied, this minerally white shows a tang of salinity and subtle notes of ripe pear, mandarin orange peel, sliced almond, honey and smoke. Drink now through 2020. 150 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace
review: A bright and open-knit white, with sleek acidity and a stony undertow driving the flavors of ripe and juicy Honeycrisp apple, slivered almond and honeysuckle. Drink now through 2019. 2,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace
review: This is light- to medium-bodied and creamy, with a bright frame of acidity and flavors of crushed almond, poached peach, candied pink grapefruit zest and star anise. Drink now through 2020. 3,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace
review: A dry, lightly smoky white, this exhibits a subtle tang of pink grapefruit zest and fleur de sel, with notes of fresh-cut apple, star fruit and stone. The finish is fresh and minerally. Drink now through 2018. 2,500 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace
review: Juicy, with a solid base of smoky mineral to the flavors of green apple, grapefruit zest and orange granita. Balanced, with a snappy finish. Drink now.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Eichberg Trois Châteaux
review: Lacy in texture and light-bodied, this minerally white shows a crowd-pleasing range of white peach, clementine, apple blossom and spice notes. Fresh, open-knit finish. Drink now through 2020. 100 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Tradition
review: Honeyed overtones accent the clementine, lemon zest, white grapefruit and peach flavors, all balanced by firm, juicy acidity. This is light-bodied and lithe, underscored by a hint of smoke and spice. Drink now through 2015. 2,950 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Tradition
review: An aromatic white, with apple and acacia blossom notes lacing white peach and orange ice flavors, all underscored by a hint of minerality and woven together by finely knit acidity. Fresh. Drink now through 2020.

name: Riesling Alsace Trois Châteaux
review: This is plump and juicy up front, but bright acidity keeps this well-defined and balanced, enlivening flavors of Golden Delicious apple and blood orange, with hints of crushed almond, smoke and honey. Drink now through 2019. 250 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Trois Châteaux
review: A modest white, with crackling acidity and flavors of patisserie pear and yellow apple, white pepper and lemon zest. A long, stony note lingers on the minerally finish. Drink now through 2015. 200 cases made.

name: Auxerrois Alsace Trois Châteaux
review: Tangy acidity focuses this dry white, which offers ripe Fuji apple, almond, kumquat and white pepper notes. Moderate, stone-tinged finish. Drink now.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace
review: Light-bodied and snappy, with a minerally underpinning and subtle flavors of crunchy white peach, lemon parfait, grated ginger and honeysuckle. Drink now through 2019. 500 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Collection
review: A lithe example of Gewürztraminer, with bright acidity and a stony mineral accent framing the green melon, tangy apple, zesty spice and floral notes. Drink now through 2019.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Tradition
review: Hints of pine and dried herbs accent flavors of yellow apple, orange peel, chamomile and pear in this streamlined, zesty Gewürztraminer. Modest finish. To be released spring 2012. Drink now.

name: Muscat Alsace Ottonel Trois Châteaux
review: Fresh and aromatic, a light- to medium-bodied white, with a spicy underpinning and notes of lychee, candied blood orange zest and ruby red grapefruit. Easy-drinking finish. Drink now. 200 cases made.

name: Pinot Blanc Alsace
review: A lively Pinot Blanc, offering a subtle overtone of smoke and spice, layered with lip-smacking acidity and flavors of poached pear, lemon curd and Granny Smith apple. Drink now through 2019. 650 cases made.

name: Pinot Blanc Alsace
review: Open-knit, with fresh, tangy acidity backing flavors of green apple, tangerine, grapefruit zest and stony mineral. Lightly floral and focused. Drink now.

name: Pinot Blanc Alsace
review: A full-bodied Pinot Blanc, featuring pretty floral notes playing off of the stone and citrus zest flavors. This is well-defined by lively acidity, and ends with a lingering salty tang. Drink now through 2013.

name: Pinot Blanc Alsace Tradition
review: There's good cut to this, with a backbone of tangy acidity framing the riper flavors of yellow apple, white peach, verbena and almond paste. There's a salty edge of minerality to this wine, showing on the fresh, modest finish. Drink now.

name: Riesling Alsace Cuvée Tradition
review: Very pretty Riesling, showing rose, apple, citrus and mineral aromas and flavors in a delicate, firm presentation which ends with a mouthwatering tang. Drink now through 2003.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Pfersigberg
review: Rich and mouthfilling, exhibiting forest floor, almond, apple and mineral tones, all underscored by a vibrant acidity. The refreshing finish makes it particularly suitable with food. Drink now through 2003.

name: Riesling Alsace Réserve Personnelle (Cask 1)
review: Very classy, elegant and understated. Has beautiful cream and peach aromas, a balance of honey, apple and spice flavors and a very spicy finish. Medium-bodied and dry; a seamless wine. Drinkable now.

name: Sylvaner Alsace Trois Châteaux
review: Peach yogurt and candied orange peel notes are layered with hints of grated ginger and stone in this light- to medium-bodied white. Bright and open-knit, with a zesty finish. Drink now through 2020. 150 cases made.

name: Sylvaner Alsace Trois Châteaux
review: Light-bodied and elegant, this fresh white offers a base of smoky mineral layered with crunchy pear, honeysuckle, candied kumquat and subtle beeswax notes. Drink now through 2017.

name: Sylvaner Alsace Trois Châteaux
review: Open-knit, and framed by racy acidity, this is dry and crisp, with lemon zest, wax, almond and mineral notes. Drink now.

name: Sylvaner Alsace Trois Châteaux
review: Clean and dry, this subtle Sylvaner shows flavors of lemon curd, smoke, candle wax and dried peach. A streamlined version, with racy acidity and subtle finish. Drink now through 2014. 200 cases made.

name: Tokay Pinot Gris Alsace Tradition
review: An ample white, full-bodied and tasting of apple, mango and grapefruit. It's on the soft side, with a bitter citrus peel note lending support on the finish. Drink now through 2008. 170 cases imported.

name: Tokay Pinot Gris Alsace Tradition
review: Very attractive, this Pinot Gris combines apple, pear and nut oil flavors on a full-bodied, powerful frame. It turns a bit austere on the finish, but give it some time to settle down. Drink now through 2006.

name: Alsace
review: This lithe, bright white shows a stony underpinning and delicate flavors of yellow plum, fleur de sel, blanched almond and lemon preserves. Sylvaner with Muscat and Auxerrois. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Alsace
review: A minerally white, with smoke and fresh forest notes underscoring the open-knit palate of Jonagold apple, candied kumquat and slivered almond. Drink now through 2017. 2,000 cases made.

name: Alsace
review: Floral and aromatic, this is dry and tangy, showing hints of tangerine, grapefruit zest and stony mineral, with a lip-smacking finish. Sylvaner, Muscat, Auxerrois and Chasselas. Drink now.

name: Alsace
review: An aromatic note of stargazer lily weaves through this dry white, along with clementine, jasmine, spice and earth. There's a lot of flavor packed into a light, lithe package, with a tangy finish. Sylvaner, Muscat, Auxerrois and Chasselas. Drink now. 2,950 cases made.

name: Alsace
review: Freshness and viscosity set the stage for peach, grapefruit and white pepper notes. Wraps up in a lingering, spicy finish. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Auxerrois Alsace Trois Châteaux
review: Subtle hints of earth and smoke accent flavors of apricot, white peach, candied orange peel and spice. Fresh, juicy finish. Drink now. 200 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Pfersigberg Trois Châteaux
review: An open-knit Gewürztraminer, with just enough acidity for balance, and subtle flavors of poached apricot, mandarin orange peel, apple blossom and stone. Modest finish. Drink now. 150 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Tradition
review: A refined, vivid style, almost racy, with plenty of citrus and spice notes. It doesn't quite follow through on the finish, but this should match well with Asian food. Drink now through 2007.

name: Muscat Alsace
review: A snappy white, offering a light and lively mix of pink grapefruit granita, verbena and grated ginger notes. Drink now. 400 cases made.

name: Muscat Alsace
review: A dry and tangy Muscat, featuring a lovely creamy texture and flavors of rose petal, ripe nectarine and orange Creamsicle. A spicy thread runs through to the elegant finish. Drink now. 170 cases made.

name: Muscat Alsace Collection
review: A tangy, well-balanced Muscat, with flavors of tangerine, pink grapefruit zest, verbena and stone, revealing a fresh, lightly spiced finish. Drink now through 2016.

name: Pinot Blanc Alsace
review: A stony version, with good cut to the subtle notes of McIntosh apple, toasted almond and lemon zest. Drink now. 3,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Blanc Alsace
review: A minerally version, featuring smoke and saline accents to the subtle notes of crunchy peach, lemon curd and ground ginger. Well-knit and fresh. Drink now through 2015. 2,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Blanc Alsace
review: There's ripeness, guava with a lemon accent, in this racy '96 white. Has a dense, rich texture and concentrated flavors, all in a clear, focused profile. Drink now through 2003.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Collection
review: There's a pleasant juiciness to this light-bodied white, supporting the flavors of apricot, Golden Delicious apple and citrus peel, with a pepper-tinged finish. Drink now through 2012. 375 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Collection
review: Bright and tangy, this lithe white offers pretty apricot and verbena notes underscored by stone and ground spice accents. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Collection
review: A modest white, with pretty honeysuckle, ripe apple and orange sorbet notes. Juicy acidity leaves a lightly mouthwatering impression on the moderate finish. To be released spring 2012. Drink now.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Eichberg
review: Dense and thick, teeming with fruit. Has modest honey and tropical fruit aromas, oily, rich lemon and tropical fruit flavors and a long finish. Full-bodied and almost off-dry. Drinkable now.

name: Sylvaner Alsace Trois Châteaux
review: Spring blossom, spice and lemon zest notes accent this bright, tangy white, along with vibrant flavors of peach, grated ginger and stone. Drink now. 200 cases made.

name: Tokay Pinot Gris Alsace Réserve Personnelle
review: Round and juicy in texture, with honeysuckle and apricot flavors. Fresh, with lively acidity and medium body, it ends on a mineral note. Drink now through 2001.

name: Alsace
review: Dry and tangy, this light-bodied version exhibits flavors of kumquat, macerated peach, stone and ground ginger, with a clean, modest finish. Sylvaner, Muscat and Auxerrois. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace
review: Clean-cut and tangy, with flavors of cantaloupe, candied orange zest and spice. A stony undertow surfaces on the fresh finish. Drink now through 2017. 3,500 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Collection
review: A light, refreshing Gewürztraminer, showing juicy acidity and flavors of blood orange and smoke, with a touch of pineapple and a dry, delicate finish. Drink now. 330 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Collection
review: A pretty wine, with lively acidity to the flavors of lychee, rose petal, orange sorbet and just a touch of pineapple. The moderate finish is clean and fresh with a hint of spice. Drink now. 25 cases imported.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Eichberg Vendange Tardive
Pinot Blanc Alsace
review: There's a pleasant saltiness to the flavors of lemon zest, hay and earth in this tangy Pinot Blanc. A hint of pine weaves through the wine and lingers on the finish. Drink now.

name: Pinot Blanc Alsace Cuvée Tradition
review: Intense and delicate, with vivid, balanced peach, orange and herb flavors; long and clean on the finish. Good freshness and depth; try with Vietnamese or Thai cuisine. 1,200 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Grand Cru Eichberg
review: A tutti-frutti white, displaying pineapple, peach and guava notes. It's just in balance, with juicy acidity keeping the ripe fruit flavors in check. Moderate finish. Drink now. 3 cases imported.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Tradition
review: This dry, zesty Pinot Gris features a minerally base note and hints of green pear, white peach, smoke and white pepper. Fresh and clean, with a modest finish. To be released spring 2012. Drink now. Tasted twice, with consistent notes.

name: Riesling Alsace
review: Honeysuckle and apricot notes mix in this tangy, saline-tinged white. Open-knit and easy-drinking. Drink now. 3,500 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Collection
review: Light-bodied and fresh, with hints of stony mineral, apple, kumquat and lemon zest. Moderate finish. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Cuvée Tradition
review: Delicate, firm and dry, showing floral, apple, tea and mineral flavors on a diminutive frame. An ideal white either as an aperitif or with light fish dishes. Drink now through 2003.

name: Riesling Alsace Tradition
review: A light and clean white that displays flavors of white peach, Granny Smith apple and a hint of hay. There's fresh acidity here for definition, and a modest finish. Drink now through 2010.

name: Tokay Pinot Gris Alsace Cuvée Tradition
Tokay Pinot Gris Alsace Réserve Personnelle
Alsace
review: This tangy, easy-drinking white offers pretty apple and orange blossom notes, with flavors of green melon, anise and stone. Sylvaner, Muscat, Auxerrois and Chasselas. Drink now.

name: Muscat Alsace Trois Châteaux
review: A dry version, with tropical notes of guava and tangerine, and hints of stone, spice and pink grapefruit zest that are more subtle on the fresh, modest finish. Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Pinot Blanc Alsace
review: A sleek, tangy white, light-bodied and open-knit, with a subtle range of Gala apple, honeysuckle, grapefruit granita and stone. Drink now. 3,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Blanc Alsace
review: A floral Pinot Blanc, with a hint of hyacinth accenting earth, lemon peel and almond notes. It's fresh, with a lightly tangy finish. Drink now. 251 cases imported.

name: Pinot Blanc Alsace
review: Floral and spice notes accent the peach flavor in this attractive '03 white. Though rich and soft in structure, it retains a freshness. Well done. Drink now. 1,200 cases imported.

name: Pinot Blanc Alsace
review: Rich and round, with peach and grapefruit flavors mingling in the fleshy texture. There's good acidity too, tying all the elements together on the fresh finish. Drink now.

name: Pinot Blanc Alsace
review: Rich and nutty, here's a tasty white whose apple and pear notes stay lively thanks to vibrant acidity. Try with fish or roast chicken. Drink now.

name: Pinot Blanc Alsace Tradition
review: A light Pinot Blanc, offering apple and lemon zest flavors, with just a touch of the grape's earthiness. A lively sipper for a hot day. Drink now. 3,300 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Tradition
