review: Medium-bodied, with lemon and grapefruit zest flavors mixing with hints of orange and white peach. Lightly spiced, with a modest finish. Drink now.

name: Pinot Noir Alsace
review: This balanced red is light-bodied and elegant, with a delicate mix of ripe strawberry, smoke, orange zest and dried herb. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Sylvaner Alsace Trois Châteaux
review: Kumquat, almond and honey notes find balance with lightly tangy acidity and accents of persimmon and salted butter in this modest white. Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Tokay Pinot Gris Alsace Cuvée Tradition
review: Soft and easy-drinking, with pleasant pear, smoke and butter flavors and just enough acidity to keep it lively on the long finish. 300 cases made.

name: Alsace
review: Tangy and aromatic, this light-bodied white shows flavors of dried apricot, chopped almond, fleur de sel and mandarin orange peel. Subtly zesty on the moderate finish. Sylvaner, Muscat and Auxerrois. Drink now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace
review: A light, spiced white, with smoke and honey notes underscoring hints of lychee, melon and grapefruit zest. Drink now. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 800 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Réserve Personnelle
review: A pretty wine for sipping. Medium-bodied and off- dry, with lovely pear, spice and honey aromas. Dances on the palate, with elegant pear and marzipan flavors and a light, sweet finish. Drinkable now.

name: Pas de Deux Paso Robles
review: Sleek and well-built, with smoky raspberry and spiced cinnamon aromas and layered, expressive flavors of ripe red plum, grilled anise and white pepper. Grenache and Syrah. Drink now through 2027. 199 cases made.

name: Pas de Deux Adelaida District
review: Taut but sleek, with focused flavors of dark cherry, grilled herb and white pepper. Grenache and Syrah. Drink now through 2025. 353 cases made.

name: Pas de Deux Paso Robles
review: A bruiser, with dried cherry, loam and cracked pepper aromas, leading to dense, ripe flavors of dusty plum, grilled herb and licorice. Dry tannins appear on the finish. Syrah and Grenache. Best from 2016 through 2023. 175 cases made.

name: Sisu Paso Robles
review: Appealing, with smoky and gamy aromas and structured yet jammy flavors of black raspberry, espresso and pepper. Syrah, Grenache and Mourvèdre. Drink now through 2022. 245 cases made.

name: Sisu Adelaida District
review: Well-crafted and appealing for the boysenberry and smoky herb flavors. Syrah, Grenache and Mourvèdre. Drink now through 2021. 245 cases made.

name: Noir Adelaida District
review: Appealing blueberry and raspberry aromas lead to modest flavors, with accents of mineral and white pepper. Syrah and Counoise. Drink now through 2021. 210 cases made.

name: Aatto Adelaida District
review: Floral and soft, with delicate notes of raspberry and fresh herb. Counoise, Mourvèdre and Grenache. Drink now through 2020. 210 cases made.

name: Sisu Paso Robles
review: Dense and fairly earthy, with modest notes of smoky herb, plum and crushed stone. Syrah, Grenache and Mourvèdre. Drink now through 2025. 336 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Plump and juicy, with plush plum, black cherry, blackberry and licorice flavors that are supple and layered, complex and elegant. Well-structured given its ripeness, and the tannins turn smooth and fleshy on the finish.—2001 California Cabernet blind retrospective (June 2011). Drink now through 2017. 1,073 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Floral and snappy blackberry notes form the core of this firm, dense effort, framed by fine, gripping tannins that offer touches of loamy earth and hard black licorice, with a long, clean finish. Drink now through 2024. 893 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley El Coyote
review: Deep, intense and focused, with dense, sinewy dark berry, dusty earth, cedar and black licorice notes, this is well-structured, retaining the core flavors through the long, persistent finish. Drink now through 2024. 223 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Villa Vista
review: Full-bodied, ripe, intense and fleshy, with layers of currant, black cherry and blackberry fruit that's spicy and well-structured, ending with a long, deeply flavored finish. Best from 2010 through 2016. 305 cases made.

name: Syrah Napa Valley
review: Big, ripe and grapey, yet polished and elegant, delivering tiers of full-bodied blackberry and wild berry flavors up front. Yet this is a graceful wine, pushing out rich berry character, with mocha and savory herb notes. Drink now through 2018. 816 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Bold and rich, this is driven by a hefty mix of black fruits and finds a good balance with acidity and tannins that frame it up nicely, ending with a dash of loamy earth, cedar and road tar. Drink now through 2025. 2,708 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Firm, rich and concentrated, with layers of complex mocha, currant, anise and plum, turning smooth and polished, with a long, complex aftertaste that offers depth and nuances. Best from 2003 through 2012. 280 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley India Ink
review: A classy wine, elegant and stylish. Firm, intense and concentrated. Sleek and full-bodied, with cedary currant, loamy earth and tight-knit tannins. Best from 2009 through 2015. 254 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Villa Vista
review: Supple-textured, harmonious and layered, offering dried berry, spice, subtle earth and herb notes that fan out, gaining depth and body, with the tannins making a sneaky appearance on the finish. Drink now through 2024. 223 cases made.

name: Syrah Napa Valley
review: Deftly balanced, this offers pure, dense red and black fruit flavors, with acidity and tannins that are fresh and snappy, ending with a burst of fruit and spice. Should only get better. Drink now through 2024. 160 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Danielli
review: A dense, chewy style, with crushed rock, dried currant, graphite and cedary oak presented in a full-bodied, tightly wound style, ending with gritty tannins. Best from 2010 through 2017. 317 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Serves up a tasty mix of green apple, pear and honeydew flavors, with touches of citrus, lemon and nectarine, along with a pithy texture. Ends long, clean and juicy. Drink now. 429 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: This offers exotic floral, perfumed aromas, with lively pear, apple, spice and hints of nutmeg and hazelnut. Well-focused and deftly balanced, for all its richness and concentration it maintains a sense of elegance and grace. Drink now through 2008. 379 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Sleek, rich and elegant, with a delicate band of ripe, sweet, floral, spicy apple, pear and honeydew melon fruit focused deliciously, with a long, lingering aftertaste. Drink now through 2008. 281 cases made.

name: Syrah Napa Valley
review: Dense, rich and chewy, with spicy, peppery wild berry, sage, mineral and beef components. This has good concentration and a long finish. Drink now through 2017. 897 cases made.

name: Syrah Napa Valley
review: Dense and chewy, with firm tannins wrapped around a core of blackberry and wild berry fruit, supported by excellent structure, with lively acidity and firm tannins. Drink now through 2009. 360 cases made.

name: India Ink Napa Valley
review: There's lots to admire in this ripe, rich, gutsy effort, which is dense, rustic and marked by crushed rock, ripe plum and berry, ending with chewy tannins. This may always be on the chunky side, but enjoyably so. Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2020. 2,770 cases made.

name: Syrah Napa Valley
review: Dark-hued, rich and concentrated, with layers of wild berry and blueberry fruit that's intense and vibrant. Finishes with a dash of oak, but in the end the fruit is the centerpiece. Drink now through 2011. 540 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Shows tension between the fruit and tannins, with dark berry, mocha, cedar and spice notes. The tannins are grainy and grippy, but the fruit pushes through, ending with black licorice accents.2004 California Cabernet blind retrospective (August 2014). Drink now through 2022. 2,004 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Native Son
review: Showing focus, ripeness, depth and balance, this serves up vivid mineral-laced blackberry and black cherry fruit that's chunky and structured, firming on the finish. The most polished and refined of the 2006 Kuleto Cabernets. Drink now through 2020. 294 cases made.

name: Danielli Napa Valley
review: One for the cellar, as the dusty, cedary, loamy earth flavors are unyielding now but show promise, as they are well-proportioned, complex and enticing. Should show best in a couple of years. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Syrah and Cabernet Franc. Best from 2020 through 2030. 220 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Napa Valley
review: Appealing for its fresh raspberry and cinnamon aromas and supple, balanced flavors of cherry, sage and mineral. Drink now through 2017. 1,420 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Napa Valley
review: Big and rich, this is loaded with jammy blackberry pie aromas and flavors, plus notes of white pepper, toasty sage and mocha chocolate. Drink now through 2017. 844 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Napa Valley
review: An ultraripe style, with rich blackberry and wild berry flavors that are intense and firmly tannic, offering hints of spice, nutmeg, anise and sage, showing some heat on the finish. Drink now through 2010. 544 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Well-proportioned, with gravel-laced dried berry, cedar, graphite and tobacco leaf notes, ending with a gripping edge of green tannins. Drink now through 2024. 3,115 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Smooth, rich and plush, with layers of concentrated currant, blackberry, mocha and olive. Has ripe, integrated tannins and light oak and leather shadings. Best from 2004 through 2012. 672 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley El Coyote
review: A sturdy effort, with a mix of cedary oak, crushed rock, taut dark berry and dried herb notes, this is a red best served by short-term cellaring. Best from 2020 through 2029. 211 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley India Ink
review: A rich, full-bodied style, intense and concentrated, with blackberry, black licorice and spicy, leathery, toasty oak nuances. Ends with a chewy, rustic touch. Drink now through 2018. 353 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Reserve
review: An elegant style. This is rich without being heavy, showing appealing currant, cedar and anise flavors, ending with fine-grained tannins and good length. Drink now through 2012. 293 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Villa Vista
review: A rock-solid, sturdy effort, with chunky tannins and taut dark berry and woody notes, this needs time, yet the finish is most promising, as the flavors linger. Best from 2020 through 2030. 217 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Crisp and pithy in texture, with green apple, lemon peel, spice and floral scents. Well-structured; needs time to soften. Drink now through 2018. 982 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: This white is a touch pithy, with subtle tangerine, citrus and green apple notes that are sleek, medium-bodied and more layered and vibrant on the finish. Drink now through 2016. 756 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Sleek and polished, this is well-focused, rich and vibrant, with hazelnut-tinged apple and pear-laced fruit, returning to a spicy Muscat-like aftertaste. Drink now through 2010. 284 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Napa Valley
review: Deep ruby color, quite reliant on toasty, mocha-laced oak, but also offering depth of flavor, with currant, plum and berry flavors, picking up touches of cola and rhubarb. Smooth-textured. Drink now through 2006. 180 cases made.

name: Syrah Napa Valley
review: Tightly wound, with a range of complex flavors, highlighted by spice and white pepper scents, with hints of plum, blackberry and wild berry. Needs time to soften, so decant for immediate consumption. Best from 2007 through 2011. 399 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Napa Valley
review: Loaded with jammy black raspberry, roasted coffee and bay leaf aromas followed by rich flavors that take on focus and firmness on the finish. Drink now. 1,052 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Good richness, depth and complexity, built around a center of anise, currant, cherry and sage. Drink now through 2009. 1,548 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Frog Prince
review: Rich and full-bodied, with chewy, extracted blackberry, black licorice, mineral and fresh earth flavors that are complex and firmly tannic, though shy on polish and finesse. Drink now through 2017. 289 cases made.

name: Frog Prince Napa Valley
review: An appealing, Bordeaux-inspired blend, with a dash of Syrah. Offers crushed rock, loamy earth, asphalt and dried berry, ending with tannins that cast a cedary edge. Cabernet Sauvignon, Malbec, Cabernet Franc, Syrah and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2017. 2,903 cases made.

name: India Ink Napa County
review: Floral blueberry and licorice aromas lead to modest flavors of raspberry, dried cherry and smoked pepper. Syrah, Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Malbec and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2025. 4,304 cases made.

name: Native Son Napa County
review: A kitchen-sink blend that offers dark berry accents and lots of spice. Zinfandel, Cabernet Sauvignon, Sangiovese, Syrah, Petite Sirah and Alicante Bouschet. Drink now through 2025. 4,254 cases made.

name: Native Son Napa Valley
review: This eclectic blend offers toasty baked cherry and grilled herb aromas, with tightly wound plum and spiced licorice flavors, framed by firm tannins. Zinfandel, Cabernet Sauvignon, Sangiovese, Syrah, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Best from 2015 through 2020. 1,689 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Napa Valley
review: Ripe and intense, with a rich, vibrant core of black cherry and blackberry fruit that throws off a touch of heat. Firmly tannic, with a dash of fresh earth on the finish, along with a touch of leather. Drink now through 2008. 294 cases made.

name: Syrah Napa Valley
review: Fresh and fleshy, showing spice, wild berry and black cherry, with hints of sage, tar and mineral. Very complex, elegant and easy-drinking. Drink now through 2012. 735 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Napa Valley
review: Ripe and loaded with toasty oak, showing aromas and flavors of blackberry, espresso and spice that build to steely tannins. Best from 2008 through 2010. 820 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Napa Valley
review: Dried currant, cola, plum and spicy oak flavors are intense and pure, with lively tannins and acidity that carry through the cedary finish. Impressive for its focus and length. Drink now through 2007. 504 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Napa Valley
review: Intense and concentrated, with lean herbal flavors. Shows plenty of tannins and oak, which overshadow the drying dark berry, licorice and loamy earth notes. Drink now through 2024. 261 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Napa Valley
review: Medium-bodied, intense and vibrant, with a mix of mineral, black cherry, nutmeg and hints of fresh earth. Drink now. 291 cases made.

name: Sangiovese Napa Valley
review: Vivid cherry, currant, earth, tobacco, anise and sage flavors give this wine a range of flavors. Intense and tannic on the palate, revealing a rustic personality. Drink now through 2009. 750 cases made.

name: Sangiovese Napa Valley Native Son
review: Good intensity, with a meaty, leathery edge to the ripe plum and currant flavors. Modest tannins. Drink now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Napa Valley
review: Tart and concentrated, with stewed berry, chocolate and tart plum flavors. Cedary oak and lively structure extend through the finish. Drink now through 2008. 604 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Villa Vista
review: Rustic, chunky and awkward, with ripe, raisiny Cabernet flavors that are rich and extracted. Notes of tobacco, smoke and a touch of prune mark the finish. Drink now through 2017. 353 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Fragrant, with floral, peach and honeysuckle flavors that are elegant and pure, with little reliance on oak for flavor. Drink now. 375 cases made.

name: Native Son Napa Valley
review: A rustic, simple style, with game meat, dried berry, savory herb and cedar. Cabernet Sauvignon, Sangiovese and Zinfandel. Drink now through 2017. 3,135 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Roughhewn, chunky and chewy, this is very extracted and tannic, with a tight core of cedary berry and licorice flavors amid earth and underbrush notes. Drink now. 2,391 cases made.

name: Sangiovese Napa Valley
review: Well-proportioned and rustic, offering ripe, chunky cherry, herb and mineral notes, with bright acidity and drying tannins. Drink now through 2010. 422 cases made.

name: India Ink Napa Valley
review: Cherry and smoky herb aromas lead to angular flavors of blueberry and dill. The tannins are hard and dusty. Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2019. 1,685 cases made.

name: Native Son Napa Valley
review: Rustic and rather unfocused, with notes of dried cherry, herb and licorice. Zinfandel, Cabernet Sauvignon, Sangiovese, Syrah, Merlot and Malbec. Drink now through 2019. 1,218 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Napa Valley
review: A woody, cedary edge dominates the flavor and texture, making it hard for the plum- and cherry-laced Pinot fruit to shine. Tannic. Drink now through 2008. 236 cases made.

name: Rosato Napa Valley
review: Crisp and dry, with watermelon and tart strawberry flavors, ending on a spicy herb note. Cabernet Sauvignon, Pinot Noir, Sangiovese and others. Drink now. 770 cases made.

name: Syrah Napa Valley
review: Tight, trim and concentrated, with a core of beefy, leathery flavors that are dense and chewy. Needs aeration, but still has to overcome substantial tannins. Drink now through 2009. 604 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Bold and ripe, yet ponderous, with lots of cedary oak that dominates the fruit. Hints of red currant, herb and olive struggle under the weight of the wood. The best of three bottles tasted. Drink now. 2,792 cases made.

name: Frog Prince Napa County
review: Firm and lacking fruit, with hints of cherry and cedar. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Malbec and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2020. 2,973 cases made.

name: Malbec Napa Valley
review: Uninteresting, dry and austere, with more loamy earth and crushed rock notes than ripe flavors. An anomaly for Kuleto. Drink now. 143 cases made.

name: Sangiovese Napa Valley
review: Intriguing savory plum and spicy tobacco aromas lead to soft, slight boysenberry flavors that end on a grilled herb note. Drink now. 529 cases made.

name: Sangiovese Napa Valley Native Son
review: Quite leathery, with earth flavors wrapped in firm tannins and smoky oak. 1,220 cases made.

name: Merlot Stellenbosch Reserve
review: Ripe and smoky, this distinctive red boasts plum, leather and spice flavors in a gentle, fleshy way, with just a hint of tannins on the finish. Drink now through 2001. 1,500 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Western Cape
review: This will have lots of fans due to its juicy tangerine, ginger and orange blossom flavors and bright, slightly sweet finish. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Stellenbosch Reserve
review: Soft and smooth, this Cabernet combines black cherry, herb and plum aromas and flavors. Crisp, mildly tannic finish. Drink now. 3,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Western Cape
review: Basic black cherry, bramble and toast flavors on a lightweight frame. Drink now. 30,000 cases imported.

name: Merlot Western Cape
review: Easygoing black cherry, herb and tobacco flavors. Drink now. 20,000 cases imported.

name: Pinotage Western Cape
review: Has a nice mouthfilling mix of meaty, plummy flavors on a soft, easygoing frame. Good barbecue wine. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay Western Cape
review: Light-bodied, with fresh peach and banana notes. Drink now. 20,000 cases imported.

name: Sémillon-Chardonnay Western Cape
review: Round and succulent, this white mixes melon and herb notes with a hint of earth. Straightforward, with a modest finish. Drink now. 90,000 cases made.

name: Sémillon-Chardonnay Western Cape
review: Tangerine and peach flavors on a soft frame, with a short finish. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Shiraz Western Cape
review: Light and fruity, similar to a basic Bordeaux in its soft, cherry- and herb-tinged flavors. Drink now. 50,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Western Cape
review: Modest black cherry and plum fruit, with a rustic finish. Drink now. 30,000 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Western Cape
review: Shrill, with a faint herbal note on the finish. 10,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Western Cape
review: Essentially light and dilute, showing spice and not much varietal character. 45,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Coddington
review: This wine's soft, supple texture lures you in, but the aromatics and subtle, elegant notes extend all the way to the lingering finish. Peach, apricot nectar and baked apple flavors mingle with nutmeg, mineral, cedar and fig paste details, as a fresh acidity keeps all the notes vibrant. Drink now through 2018. 950 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu
review: A many-faceted Chardonnay, impressive for its clarity and superb balance, showing tangy citrus at first, with a layer of spicy honey weaving through the rich pear and delicately smoky flavors, which echo impressively on the long finish. Drink now through 2008. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu
review: Crisp and vibrant, a tightly wound bud holding pineapple, pear and lemon flavors that will burst free after some time in the bottle. Has a touch of butter on the finish. Drink now through 2005. 600 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu
review: Big, rich and powerful. Layered with buttery, spicy pear, honey and hazelnut flavors that fold together luxuriously on a long finish.  A most distinctive wine. 3,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Coddington
review: Precise and appealing, with lemongrass and thyme accents to the pear, lemon and honeydew melon flavors, set on a sleek, crisp frame. Notes of peppery white flowers, spice and green tea linger on the finish. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Estate
review: Sleek and generous, with peach, pear, spice and honey notes, supported by refreshing, vibrant acidity. The spice and toasted nut notes gain momentum on the long, lingering finish. Drink now through 2022. 5,500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Hunting Hill
review: Intense and focused, with plenty of toasted herb and cedar notes providing an aromatic lift to the core of marmalade, pear, spice and honeysuckle shadings. Finishes with bright, refreshing acidity. Drink now through 2026. 350 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Hunting Hill
review: Starts out firm and juicy, with green apple, Asian pear and lemon zest notes, but then gains momentum, with toast, vanilla bean, candied ginger and honeycomb details, culminating in a detailed, refreshing wine with a long, lingering finish. Drink now through 2026. 1,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Hunting Hill
review: The lively acidity lends a fresh, crisp edge to the lime, pear and apricot notes, with lemon zest and spicy cedary details, showing a touch of sea salt minerality. This powerful version maintains an air of elegance, enhanced by a long finish. Drink now through 2020. 56 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Hunting Hill
review: Bright and jazzy, showing lime-accented pineapple, with hints of tobacco and star fruit weaving through the long, elegant finish. This stylish wine needs time in the cellar to settle. Best from 2010 through 2017. 300 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Maté's Vineyard
review: Bright and sleek, with zippy lime and grapefruit coursing through the pear and pineapple fruit, lingering on the expressive finish with finesse. Should benefit from cellaring. Drink now through 2015. 300 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Maté's Vineyard
review: Brilliant, zingy and ultimately subtle, with layers of stony, minerally character around a lively core of pineapple, lime and green apple flavors, lingering effortlessly on the bracingly tart finish. Has miles to go. Drink now through 2014. 200 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Matés Vineyard
review: Taut, vibrant and complex, beautifully packed with classic Burgundian character. Has hazelnut, fig and green apple flavors at the core, weaving in nuances of lemon peel and mineral as the finish lingers. Needs time to develop. Best from 2007 through 2015. 200 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu
review: With distinct mineral and floral aromas, this feels very Burgundian, especially the way its lively acidity points up the lime, stone, pear and date flavors, finishing long. Best from 2007 through 2014. 2,000 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu
review: Tangy, with bold citrus, melon, green apple and mineral flavors that grow as they linger effortlessly. Beautifully put together, this has all the earmarks of becoming great with cellaring. Best from 2005 through 2010. 600 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu
review: Disarmingly fresh and open, with pretty pear, apple, peach and gentle spice flavors mingling delicately on the round finish. Not the usual blockbuster, but refined and elegant, with flavors that linger purely. Drink now through 2008. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu
review: Ripe flavors are just the beginning in this mouthfilling, buttery beauty. Sleek in style, this New Zealand white wraps its generous peach, pear and honey flavors into a jazzy package that balances everything with delicate acidity. Approachable now. Best after 1998. 1,200 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu
review: Big and rich, putting it all together: opulent, smoky oak; firm, fresh acidity; and intense apple and melon flavors. Luscious. Also rated outstanding in a previous tasting. 3,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu
review: This full-flavored, full-bodied New Zealand Chardonnay wraps layers of vanilla and butterscotch notes around lively pear and lemon flavors that give it fine acidity and balance. The finish is long and tasty. Great to drink now through 1996. 600 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Coddington
review: This delivers wonderful depth and purity to flavors of lemon curd, yellow apple, Meyer lemon and apricot. Aromatic, with lanolin, honeycomb and floral notes, a terrific silky texture and wonderful acidity. Drink now through 2015. 100 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Estate
review: A wonderful balance between crisp, steely notes of citrus, pear and green apple and complex flavor nuances on a smooth texture, with floral, lime peel and tobacco details. The finish just goes on and on. Drink now through 2016. 2,000 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Estate
review: Bright, tangy and elegant, this vibrant wine has grapefruit and pineapple flavors at the fore, picking up apple and spice as the finish lingers effortlessly. Drink now through 2017. 7,000 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Hunting Hill
review: Supple and aromatic, offering a lovely mix of lemon blossom and butterscotch flavors on a creamy, juicy body. Gains momentum on the long, expressive finish. Drink now through 2022. 900 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Hunting Hill
review: Honeysuckle, toast and marmalade flavors come together for a rich expression of Chardonnay, but a light body and crisp acidity keep this from being too indulgent. Citrus and apple accents linger on the finish. Drink now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Hunting Hill
review: Tangy lemon meringue, honey and pear flavors show an appealing buttery note, with floral and spice highlights, a delicate but refreshing acidity and silky texture. Plenty of spice and Meyer lemon notes crescendo on the finish. Drink now through 2020. 1,100 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Hunting Hill
review: Toasty chestnut flavors emphasize the rich, round notes of lemon, nectarine and ripe pear, with a crushed stone minerality that shines through, especially on the finish. Extremely smooth and graceful. Drink now through 2016. 300 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Maté's Vineyard
review: Apricot, yellow apple, quince, pear, toasted spice and honeysuckle notes are focused and harmonious, set on a smooth body, with a lift of juicy acidity on the finish. Drink now through 2025. 1,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Maté's Vineyard
review: Aromatic, soft and supple, with honey, butterscotch and toasted brioche notes that are as intense as they appear effortless. This delivers plenty of lemon and pear flavors, with a long finish. Drink now through 2016. 1,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Maté's Vineyard
review: Open-knit, with outstanding depth and balance to the medley of pear, mineral, toasty walnut and hazelnut flavors. Lemony acidity serves up a lively counterpoint to the oak tones, harmonizing on the finish. Drink now through 2010. 200 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Maté's Vineyard
review: Has an earthy edge to the citrus and mineral flavors. Lively and aristocratic, with fine texture and impressive length to the slate and apricot flavors. Best from 2005 through 2010. 450 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Maté's Vineyard
review: A ripe and rich New Zealand Chardonnay, beautifully focused to show off its range of pear, lime, orange and mocha flavors and the hints of passion fruit that chime in on the supple finish. Balanced to age gracefully, it will be at its best from 2000. 200 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay New Zealand
review: Smooth, round and spicy, a mouthful of generous apple, tropical fruit, vanilla and citrus flavors singing harmoniously on the finish - this tells a story in the glass. Best from 1996 through 1997. 3,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu
review: Bright and refreshing, remarkably lively, offering pretty apple, pear and intriguingly peppery vanilla flavors that expand on the open-textured finish. Shows restraint (for a Kumeu River wine), but the flavors linger long. Drink now through 2003. 1,500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Coddington
review: The fleshy peach and mango flavors are ripe and clean, with a tight, juicy and crisp citrus edge, highlighted by cedar and mineral grace notes on the long finish. Drink now through 2022. 250 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Coddington
review: This is ripe and focused, with distinct pineapple character at the core, riding over a tight, mouthwatering frame that lets the mineral-accented fruit hover beautifully on the long finish. Drink now through 2013. 800 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Estate
review: Rich and deep, this features toasted hazelnut, fig and citrus flavors that have a smooth texture and vibrant acidity. The aromatics are the star here, with honeysuckle, lemon zest and green apple notes that leap out of the glass and push through on the finish. Drink now through 2016. 5,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Hunting Hill
review: This is both rich and juicy, displaying a smoky, floral note that dances around the ripe tangerine, yellow apple and melon flavors. Offers a supple texture, with details of marzipan and lanolin. Drink now through 2018. 1,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Hunting Hill
review: Taut, focused and packed with mineral-accented quince, pineapple and iron aromas and flavors, losing no momentum as this speeds into the long, graceful finish. Drink now through 2013. 1,200 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Maté's Vineyard
review: Tangy, with a mix of Key lime, pear, lemon zest and mineral flavors, showing plenty of clarity and energy from the vibrant acidity. Appealingly focused and seamless. Drink now through 2022. 1,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Maté's Vineyard
review: Lemon curd, spice and verbena flavors are deep and detailed while still vividly crisp, the spice accents gaining momentum on the long finish. Drink now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Maté's Vineyard
review: Sleek and crisp, this white offers complex and detailed notes of toasted coconut, apple pie, spice and lime zest, complementing the core of pure lemon, melon and peach flavors. Drink now through 2020. 56 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Maté's Vineyard
review: Tightly wound, with an impressive core of intensity to tangy lemon, nectarine and crushed stone flavors. Oak nuances integrate nicely, with sea salt and vibrant acidity focusing the lingering finish. Best from 2010 through 2015. 1,200 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Village
review: Has great zing and zest, with lemony pear, quince and mineral flavors, echoing a stone and slate character as the finish goes on and on. Not a hefty wine, but it has great drive and zip. Best from 2007 through 2014. 600 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay New Zealand
review: Smoky aromas surround a core of lively pear, lime and roasted hazelnut flavors, all in all a very Burgundian profile, finishing with just enough zingy acidity to keep it in beautiful balance. A stylish wine with refinement and plenty of flavor. Drink now through 2008. 500 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu
review: Generous cedary oak folds gracefully into apricot, peach and lemony pastry cream flavors. Citrusy acidity keeps this fresh, with mineral, stone and floral tones accenting the lingering finish. Drink now through 2010. 6,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu
review: Crisp, bright and generous with its pear, apple and spice flavors, smoothly integrated with hints of vanilla and lemon on the lively finish. Balanced to open up with short-term cellaring; try now through 2003. 1,200 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Coddington
review: Toasted hazelnut notes linger in the background of the crisp lemon meringue and pear flavors. Detailed and persistent on the long finish, where the spice accents crescendo. Drink now through 2022. 850 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Coddington
review: Shows terrific tension between the nervy acidity, fresh fruit flavors and minerally details. The lemon and lime zest, green apple and green papaya notes are crisp and clean, while details of lemon thyme, crushed rock and white flowers add extra dimension. Drink now. 850 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Coddington
review: Silky in texture and lively in flavor, offering pretty pear and floral flavors. Hints at lime on the lingering finish. Drink now through 2011. 300 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Estate
review: Linear, with a focused profile of lime sherbet, lemon verbena and Meyer lemon flavors that are polished and vibrant. Shows plenty of intensity on the mouthwatering finish. Drink now through 2020. 4,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Estate
review: A crisp, vibrant pineapple and grapefruit core, with accents of spice and honey adding complexity and richness on the long finish. Drink now. 5,780 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Estate
review: Features rich peach and pear notes, with a butterscotch edge complemented by clean, fresh acidity. Highlights of peppery white flowers and sea salt lend this some extra charm. Drink now through 2026. 5,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Estate
review: A bright mix of floral notes and toasty aromatics, this offers very crisp flavors of fresh lemon, lime and nectarine. The texture is silky smooth, with refreshing, zingy acidity. Drink now. 224 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Maté's Vineyard
review: Juicy and elegant. A mouthwatering wine that layers apple, citrus and spice flavors on a delicate frame. Fruit echoes nicely on the finish. Drink now through 2002. 200 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Maté's Vineyard
review: Focused, offering intense pineapple accents to the melon and lime flavors, crunchy, mouthwatering acidity and herb highlights. Offers a firm finish, with cedary elements fanning out. Drink now. 350 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Maté's Vineyard
review: A zingy wine, with plenty of green apple, Bartlett pear and lemon-lime flavors that are bright and refreshing, with a crisp acidity surging through. Shows accents of fresh thyme and mineral on the finish. Drink now through 2016. 300 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Maté's Vineyard
review: Tight and crisp, packed with lime, grapefruit and pineapple flavors, finishing with a touch of cream as the flavors linger brightly. Drink now through 2006. 75 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Village
review: Streamlined and subtle, with fine-grained intensity to the pear, lemon blossom, orange curd and soya flavors. Mineral nuances and nicely integrated oak tones fold into the finish. Drink now through 2010. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay New Zealand
review: A serious, distinctive wine, if not as grand as some previous vintages. Earthy, smoky, mineral flavors prevail up front, then picks up plenty of beautiful honey, floral and pear flavors on the long, silky finish. Needs until 2000 to 2002 to fully blossom.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu
review: Streamlined and intense, with pastry dough, lemon skin, pear and subtle peach flavors. Stone, mineral and vibrant citrus nuances harmonize deftly in the finish. Drink now through 2010. 3,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Coddington
review: Apricot, pear, yellow apple and orange zest notes are enlivened by very crisp acidity, zeroing in on citrus notes on the finish, which shows with a touch of lemon pith. Drink now. 800 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Coddington
review: Tangy, with peach and pineapple flavors that are crisp, smooth and refreshing, showing good acidity. The details of honeysuckle, spice and baked apple lend this added complexity. Drink now through 2020. 20 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Kumeu Village
review: Rich pear and apple flavors are smooth and spicy, with a toasted coconut edge and lemon curd notes. Shows good intensity and complexity, as well as crisp acidity. The finish lingers. Drink now. 7,397 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Maté's Vineyard
review: A lively mouthful of ripe pear, melon and dusky spices, hinting at honey on the supple finish. Nicely balanced, with hints of citrus on the finish. Drink now.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Kumeu
review: Bright and appealing for its spicy aromas and flavors, adding to the core of melon and pear fruit, finishing silky. Drink now. 2,000 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu
review: Pulls out all the stops. Ripe, buttery aromas and rich butterscotch flavors add up to a lush, soft wine that makes a bold style statement. Honey and peach notes lie beneath the overlay of oak aging.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Brajkovich Signature Series
review: Lean, crisp and juicy, with a lively core of nectarine and mineral flavors that keep echoing on the long, tart finish. Drink now through 2002.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Kumeu Village
review: Robust and refreshing, with concentrated lemon, pear and green apple flavors, showing lemongrass and white floral details and impressive intensity on the finish. Drink now. 10,500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Kumeu Village
review: Tangy lemon and lime notes are juicy and refreshing, with grapefruit pith, green apple and rosemary flavors on a light body, showing a touch of minerality. Delivers terrific intensity, with a mouthwatering finish. Drink now. 7,500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Maté's Vineyard
review: A tangy, juicy lemon curd flavor is at the core of this wine, with dried floral, cedar, spice and toasted almond notes. Finishes with a pleasantly bitter citrus peel accent. Drink now. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 1,100 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Maté's Vineyard
review: Polished to a fare-thee-well, this emphasizes spicy, toasty, barrel-derived character over fruit, but finishes with a lovely touch of honey. Lacks the zesty backbone of its previous vintages. Best from 1999.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Village
review: Elegant and understated, with spicy, crisp apple and pear flavors set on a light body, showing a hint of honeycomb on the finish. Drink now. 5,700 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Village
review: Fleshy but streamlined, with an inner core of concentration to the toasty oak, pear and mineral flavors. Citrus acidity and lead pencil tones linger on the finish. Drink now through 2010. 600 cases imported.

name: Pinot Gris Kumeu
review: Terrific Bartlett pear, yellow apple and nectarine flavors are ripe and fleshy, with a peppery white flower note on the refreshing finish. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Pinot Gris Kumeu
review: Crisp, juicy peach and nectarine flavors show vibrant citrus zest touches. Focused on a medium body, this is very refreshing. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Kumeu
review: This is distinctive for its fragrant honeycomb note, framing the apple, citrus and pear flavors nicely. Graceful and juicy, finishing with a lemon curd tanginess. Drink now. 560 cases imported.

name: Pinot Gris Kumeu
review: Soft and spicy, with pretty peach and grapefruit flavors on a modest scale, lingering nicely on the bright, sweet-and-sour finish. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Kumeu
review: Light and soft, brimming with pretty pear, melon and citrus flavors, balanced with tangy acidity that cries out for fish. Drink now. 200 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Village
review: A lean, flinty style, offering crisp acidity and clean, refreshing pear, lemon, lime and green apple notes. Drink now. 2,000 cases imported.

name: Melba Kumeu
review: Cedary, peppery notes weave through the plum and berry flavors in this refined, elegant red. Has some tannin to lose, but it's balanced to age gracefully. Merlot, Malbec and Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2006. 650 cases imported.

name: Pinot Gris Kumeu
review: Soft and refreshing, with pretty melon and pear fruit flavors that linger nicely. Drink now. 200 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Kumeu
review: Distinctively aromatic, this ripe, round Pinot has layers of currant, spice and earth notes plus, unfortunately, a touch of burnt coffee on the generous finish. It will be interesting to see how this develops. Drink now through 2005. 100 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Kumeu
review: A bit broader and spicier than most New Zealand Sauvignon Blancs, with a gently toasty edge to the light white grapefruit flavors. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Village
review: Pear, apricot and yellow apple flavors are appealing and ripe on a medium, somewhat fleshy body, as a crispy acidity and plenty of spicy notes mark the finish. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay New Zealand Kumeu Village
review: Focused and lively, offering lemon sherbet and green apple flavors, with hints of spice on the juicy finish. Drink now. 12,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Kumeu
review: Ripe pear and yellow apple flavors are soft and appealing, with a note of dried apricot. Softly juicy on the finish. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Kumeu
review: The yellow apple, pear and fresh peach flavors are balanced and slightly spicy, with a soft juiciness. Drink now. 5,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Kumeu
review: Soft and appealing for its almond-scented peach and pineapple flavors, lingering on the lively finish. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Pinot Gris Kumeu
review: There's a hint of sweetness and very good intensity to yellow apple, pear and cardamom flavors, with tart lemon rind in the finish. Drink now. 4,700 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Kumeu
review: Light in texture, soft and earthy, with a tinge of mint and weediness to the raspberry flavors hiding at the core. Tannins are firm and need time to soften. Best from 2003 through 2006. 300 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Kumeu
review: Distinctive, tasting almost like a dry Sauternes, with flavors of vanilla, almonds, smoke, honey and melon. A winemaker's wine, 14 percent Sémillon, barrel-fermented.

name: Pinot Gris Kumeu
review: Soft, slightly sweet, with pleasant pear and leafy-herbal flavors, finishing with polish. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Kumeu
review: Lean and herbal, with a raw edge to the citrus, sage and green onion flavors, which remain light through the finish. Drink now.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Jalapeño, grass and white grapefruit flavors have good concentration. Drink now. 3,400 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Green, grassy style has a lot of zing but not much depth. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Kumeu Village
review: Drinkable, but there's a slightly bitter edge to the modest fruit, making this feel out of whack. Drink now. 7,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Appealing for its full body, this offers balanced acidity and rich texture, but the persistent herbal, hay and green notes veer toward weedy, overwhelming the tart apple and melon flavors within. Drink now. 2,000 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc New Zealand
review: An unusual mix of sweet-and-sour pear, hay, spice and floral notes, with a zingy acidity. Drink now. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Kumeu
review: Strong gamy, medicinal flavors are off-putting. 100 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Kumeu Village
review: Light, weak, awful, with a salty edge to the gamy flavors. 600 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Kumeu
review: Shows pervading earthy, gamy flavors.   118 cases imported.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma Valley Robusto
review: Smooth, ripe, rich and supple, with layers of coffee, currant, spice and anise, it flows across the palate with a silky-smooth texture and a pleasing, earthy aftertaste. Drink now. 497 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Reserve
review: Wonderful complexity, richness and flavor, with concentrated pear, fig, vanilla, smoke and butterscotch. Deftly balanced, with pretty oak nuances. The fruit gushes through on a long, detailed finish. Drink now through 2007. 616 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Reserve
review: Intensely rich and fruity, with smoky, buttery oak shadings that add complexity and depth to the ripe pear, spice and apple flavors. Sharply focused, long and lingering on the finish. A real beauty. Drink now through 1994. 2,900 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Sonoma Valley Block 4SB20
review: This lovely white offers elegance and purity to its peach and apricot flavors, laced with a juicy note of fresh-squeezed lime juice. Shows terrific intensity on the finish, with a whiff of honeysuckle lending this extra dimension. Drink now. 800 cases made.

name: Syrah Sonoma Valley
review: This Syrah shows zest and personality, as well as good structure. Aromas of black raspberry and graphite combine with layered flavors of kirsch, smoky cracked pepper and toasty oak. Drink now through 2027. 490 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley
review: Ripe, bold and buttery, with layers of honey, pear, peach and nutmeg flavors that are rich and silky-smooth. Oak adds dimension to the flavors. A harmonious wine. Drink now. 7,800 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Kinneybrook Vineyard
review: Tremendous value in rich, complex, compelling Chardonnay. Offers lots of ripe, up-front pear, hazelnut, nutmeg and creamy buttery notes without being heavy. Finishes with a pretty orchestration of fruit and oak. Drink now through 2006. 960 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Reserve
review: Beautifully crafted, with a sleek, supple core of green apple, nectarine, sweet fig and white peach flavors. Long and clean on the finish, maintaining focus and persistence. Drink now. 570 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Wildwood Vineyard
review: Serves up a complex, focused mix of ripe pear, apple and melon, shaded by spicy, toasty oak and ending with a long, lingering finish. Drink now through 2011. 180 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Sonoma Valley Magnolia Lane
review: Perfectly ripe peach, mango and melon flavors are intense and fleshy, with bright acidity and floral and honey details that linger. Drink now. 8,900 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Sonoma Valley Vineyard Block 4SB20
review: Bright, aromatic and distinctive, offering a lush mouthful of rich, ripe pineapple, honeysuckle and lemon-lime flavors, set on a light and silky body, with mouthwatering acidity. Shows nice balance and intensity. Drink now. 640 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma Valley
review: This zesty wine combines richness with an appealing touch of briar. Aromas of black cherry and toasty spice lead to jammy cherry, anise and pepper flavors. Drink now through 2020. 2,068 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma Valley Reserve
review: Deftly balanced, rich and intense, with plush, complex black cherry, currant, plum and wild berry fruit. Sharply focused, long and complex, with fine, integrated tannins. A late-release beauty. Best from 2004 through 2010. 239 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley C.S. Ridge Vineyard
review: Strikes a good balance between spicy, citrus-laced pear, peach and nectarine flavors and delicate floral scents, finishing clean and vibrant. Drink now. 660 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley C.S. Ridge Vineyard
review: Beautifully crafted, rich and complex, with tiers of spicy, smoky pear, hazelnut, coconut, fig and butterscotch. Turns elegant and refined, while holding onto its rich, complex flavors. Drink now through 2006. 970 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Kinneybrook Vineyard
review: Ripe, rich and smoky, with a tight, complex band of fig, toast, pear and apricot flavors that fan out on the finish, gaining nuance and complexity. Best from 1999 through 2002. 1,094 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Kinneybrook Vineyard
review: Serves up lots of flavor, with lively pear, spice, citrus, hazelnut and honey notes. It's complex and rich on the finish. Drink now. 450 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Reserve
review: A refreshingly clean and vibrant mix of tangerine, nectarine, white peach and zesty citrus notes keeps the flavors alive and snappy. Drink now. 725 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Reserve
review: Lively acidity keeps the flavors bright and vivid, with a beam of lemon-lime, green pear and apple, with hints of fresh cut flowers and mineral, finishing with a pebbly aftertaste. Drink now through 2007. 590 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Reserve
review: Rich and lively, with lots of complex flavors built around floral orange blossom, honeysuckle, pear and apricot nuances. Holds its fruity finish on a long, detailed aftertaste, picking up a pretty touch of toasty oak. Drink now through 2006. 315 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Reserve
review: Packs in lots of rich, creamy fig, vanilla, apricot and nutmeg flavors, offering depth, concentration and complexity, with a long intricate aftertaste. Drink now through 2005. 260 cases made.

name: Claret Louis Kunde Founder's Reserve Sonoma Valley
review: An impressive red-wine debut from Kunde. Very ripe, rich and spicy— almost like a Syrah in its flavor profile—packing in lots of currant, anise, earth and tar flavors. The texture is thick and plush, with firm but polished tannins that linger. A distintive wine that's high in extract and flavor. Drink now through 2000. 600 cases made.

name: Viognier Sonoma Valley
review: Rich and flavorful, showing more depth and range of flavor than most Viogniers, with tiers of peach, pear, honey and spice. An altogether complex and alluring wine. Drink now through 1997. 2,200 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma Valley
review: This winery returns to Zin form with this zesty, old-school style, which shows aromas of briary cherry and sage leading to crisp, lively flavors of boysenberry, cracked pepper and underbrush. Drink now through 2016. 400 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma Valley Century Vines Reserve
review: Well-built and zesty, with dark berry, cracked pepper and Chinese five-spice powder aromas. Concentrated but lively, offering dried cherry and licorice flavors. Drink now through 2021. 1,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma Valley Drummond Vineyard
review: Ripe, concentrated and stylish, with well-balanced and nicely integrated blackberry, black currant, earth and toasty oak flavors, with firm, lingering tannins and spice notes in the finish. Drink now through 2009. 965 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma Valley Reserve
review: Aromas of damp earth and clay offer complex scents. This is tight and trim on the palate, with a similar loamy quality that echoes anise, currant and blackberry. Best from 2017 through 2027. 970 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley
review: Elegant, fresh, lively and focused, with pretty pear, nectarine, honey and vanilla flavors that are neatly woven together. A nice touch of oak and spice on the finish gives it a perfumed edge. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Kinneybrook Vineyard
review: Ripe, flavorful and complex with a range of citrus, fig, pear and earthy, minerally notes. Crisp and focused on the finish. Drink now through 2001 . 2,150 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Kinneybrook Vineyard
review: An elegant and detailed young wine with bright, vivid pear, spice and citrus flavors that keep their focus on a long, complex finish. Drink now through 1998. 500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Reserve
review: Charming, with a mix of creamy pear, fig, vanilla, honeysuckle and light spice flavors, ending with a delicate, graceful finish. Drink now. 700 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Reserve
review: Concentrated and ripe, with excellent depth and intensity to the pear, strawberry and lemon-lime flavors. Toasty oak and butterscotch fold into lively, citrusy acidity on the finish. Drink now through 2007. 2,700 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Reserve
review: An elegant style, sleek and firm, with a lots of spicy, floral aromas and a concentrated core of pear, apple and citrus. Drink now through 2005. 455 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Reserve
review: Firm, tight and spicy, with a pretty, toasty oak overlay and creamy pear, spice, vanilla and apple notes. Could use short-term cellaring to round out the rough edges. Drink now through 2002. 3,030 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Reserve
review: Smooth, ripe and buttery, sporting tiers of honey, pear, fig and toast notes that fold together nicely on the finish. Impressive for its flavor and balance. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Reserve
review: Spicy and concentrated, with pretty pear, fig and anise notes that are firm and focused, finishing with a tight beam of Chardonnay fruit that lingers. Drink now through 1997. 2,900 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Wildwood Vineyard
review: Smooth, rich and creamy, with tiers of honey, pear, vanilla and spice. A complex and well-crafted wine that finishes with a pleasant aftertaste. Drink now through 1998. 500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Wildwood Vineyard
review: Good intensity and flavor, with spicy pear, apple and honey notes. The texture is a bit coarse, but a little age should help it. Drink now through 1998. 440 cases made.

name: Petite Sirah Sonoma Valley Wine Club Selection
review: Dark and densely tannic, with black walnut and mahogany details and a whiff of white pepper to the massive blackberry, blueberry and huckleberry notes. Drink now through 2026. 289 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma Valley
review: Zesty and appealingly briary, with raspberry and grilled herb aromas, and flavors of cherry and licorice. Drink now through 2020. 6,040 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma Valley Century Vines Reserve
review: Appealing for its briary cherry aromas and well-focused raspberry, cinnamon and pepper flavors that fan out and take on richness and tannins. Drink now through 2015. 2,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma Valley Shaw Vineyard Century Vines
review: Ripe, with rich, jammy blackberry, chocolate and blueberry notes, nicely highlighted by toasty mocha oak and round tannins. Drink now through 2005. 1,650 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma Valley
review: Ripe and complex, with generous berry, currant and toast aromas and flavors, finishing firm but flavorful. Has a broad range of flavor that remains focused on the finish. A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Best after 1996. 6,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma Valley Drummond
review: Well-structured, with a mix of cedar, tobacco, cigar box, dried currant and crushed rock flavors. A bit smoother than the Meritage 202 bottling. Drink now through 2021. 999 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley
review: Clean and juicy, centered on tangerine and nectarine flavors that give this lively acidity and touches of peach and apple. Drink now. 27,500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley
review: Pure, rich and focused, with vibrant tropical fruit, pineapple, melon and apple notes, ending with a pleasing spicy aftertaste. Drink now. 29,501 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley
review: A zesty style, with ripe, racy, lemon-lime and citrus flavors that are narrowly focused, picking up a green pineapple nuance on the finish. Drink now through 2007. 9,500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley
review: Ripe and spicy, with a pretty core of buttery pear- and fig-laced Chardonnay fruit that picks up light hazelnut shadings on the finish. Drink now. 13,900 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley C.S. Ridge Vineyard
review: Offers a clean, pure mix of citrus, green apple, melon and light oak flavors, maintaining a delicate presence throughout. Drink now. 750 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Kinneybrook Vineyard
review: Elegant and understated, with attractive pear, floral, fig and melon flavors that turn complex. Drink now through 2004. 1,025 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Kinneybrook Vineyard
review: Ripe and spicy, with a solid core of pear, vanilla, hazelnut and nutmeg. Shows a trace of alcohol on the finish, where the flavors turn complex. Drink now through 2000. 945 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Reserve
review: Rich and aromatic, with plenty of spice and toast, showing touches of cumin that accent the ripe peach and citrus flavors. Juicy finish. Drink now. 875 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Reserve
review: Clean and pure ripe citrus blossom scents are medium-bodied and modestly complex, with subtle oak shadings and a touch of fig. Drink now through 2015. 1,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Reserve
review: Ripe, rich and full-bodied, with apple, fig and tangerine flavors, ending with a mineral note. Drink now through 2012. 5,800 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Wildwood Vineyard
review: Marked by a persistent pithy citrus presence of lime, lemon and nectarine, ending clean and fresh. Drink now. 670 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Wildwood Vineyard
review: Well-crafted, deftly balanced, with a pretty core of ripe pear, fig, vanilla and nutmeg that turns tangy, with a touch of citrus. Drink now through 2004. 1,050 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Wildwood Vineyard
review: Ripe, rich and smoky, with tight pear, fig and hazelnut notes. Finishes with a crisp, intense aftertaste. Best from 1999 through 2001. 1,115 cases made.

name: Claret Louis Kunde Founder's Reserve Sonoma Valley
review: Firm and focused, a spicy, toasty, chocolate-scented wine with a modest core of currant and plum flavor that persists into an elegant finish. Balanced for harmony in the long run. A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Best from 1998 through 2000. 1,000 cases made.

name: Meritage 202 Destination Series Sonoma Valley
review: Centered on ripe plum and blackberry flavors, this is supple, graceful and well-proportioned, ending with mild, fine-grained tannins and a clean aftertaste. Cabernet Sauvignon, Malbec, Merlot, Petit Verdot and Cabernet Franc. Drink now. 1,323 cases made.

name: Merlot Sonoma Valley
review: A soft and gentle red, with appealing accents of cherry and toasted herb. Drink now through 2021. 6,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Sonoma Valley
review: Offers lively and fresh black raspberry fruit, with well-focused flavors of plum, bitter chocolate and toasted spice. Drink now through 2019. 3,720 cases made.

name: Merlot Sonoma Valley
review: Appealing for its nicely mature currant, cedar and anise aromas and soft flavors. Finishes with delicate tannins. Drink now. 14,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Sonoma Valley
review: Smooth and harmonious, adding supple currant, black cherry, herb and smoky oak shadings. Impressive, elegant, graceful. Complex aftertaste. Drink now through 1997. 5,800 cases made.

name: Merlot Sonoma Valley Kinneybrook
review: Offers appealing aromas of cherry, cedar and soft red currant, with the fresh herb flavors showing just enough structure to stay interesting. Drink now through 2017. 1,000 cases made.

name: Moon Mountain District
review: Tight and structured, with a narrow band of graphite-scented currant, anise, charcoal and toasty oak flavors. This wine is styled for aging, opening to reveal the early signs of suppleness. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Petit Verdot and Malbec. Drink now through 2025. 200 cases made.

name: Muscat Canelli Sonoma Valley Late Harvest Louis Kunde Founder's Reserve
review: Sweet, fruity and fresh, with a lively core of pear and litchi flavors that last through the smooth finish. Drink now. 1,100 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Sonoma Valley Block 4SB20
review: Crisp and bright, offering a fresh mix of apple and citrus flavors, accenting the spice and white flower notes on the lingering finish. Drink now. 625 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Sonoma Valley Magnolia Lane
review: Lip-smacking lemon, mandarin orange and Key lime flavors are vivid and bright, highlighted by an extremely zingy acidity. Lemongrass and citrus zest details gain momentum on the finish. Drink now. 12,061 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Sonoma Valley Magnolia Lane
review: Pure, ripe citrus flavors are accented by notes of orange sherbet, kumquat, melon and yellow apple, featuring a satisfying, juicy acidity. Drink now. 18,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Sonoma Valley Magnolia Lane
review: Features a core of ripe, juicy pear, nectarine and apricot flavors, with a smooth texture and juicy acidity, accented by touches of fresh herb and lime zest aromatics. Drink now. 18,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Sonoma Valley Magnolia Lane
review: Tangy lemon-lime flavors are focused and direct, with a terrific refreshing acidity and hints of spice and herbs to keep this light on its feet. Drink now. 15,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Sonoma Valley Magnolia Lane
review: Intense, with tight focus to the grapefruit, cut grass, floral and herbal notes. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Syrah Sonoma Valley
review: Trim, firm and spicy, with firm acidity and tannins. Full-bodied, with a sleek mix of dried berry, mineral, sage and cedar that tightens up on the finish. Drink now through 2016. 2,800 cases made.

name: Syrah Sonoma Valley
review: Very fragrant and unusual, with pronounced black currant and apricot aromas. Rich and ripe, this concentrated Syrah has fine depth to the cocoa flavors. Good length. Drink now through 2004. 2,300 cases made.

name: Syrah Sonoma Valley
review: Dark, ripe, intense and concentrated. The meaty, beefy, plum, currant and wild berry flavors stay with you on the aftertaste. Best after 1998. 1,200 cases made.

name: Viognier Sonoma Valley
review: Deliciously fresh, floral and spicy, bright and fruity, with exotic overtones; focused and supple on the finish. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Viognier Sonoma Valley Destination Series
review: Crisp and fresh, with lime, mango and green apple flavors that are transparent and precise. Finishes with vivid acidity. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma Valley
review: A jammy, easygoing Zin, offering aromas of berry cobbler and fresh herb that lead to soft flavors of raspberry and cinnamon. Drink now through 2017. 5,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma Valley
review: Solid, chunky, somewhat unevolved, with earthy cherry, wild berry, raspberry, tar and spicy flavors, finishing with firm tannins. Best after 2000. 7,800 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma Valley Century Vines Reserve
review: Balances focus and structure, with zesty fruit. Aromas of raspberry and cinnamon spice make way for briary cherry, anise and fresh herb flavors. Drink now through 2021. 1,250 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma Valley
review: Rustic and austere, with grainy, earthy tannins that are taut and closed. This is full-bodied, exhibiting dried flowers, dried berry, mineral and chicory-laced cedary oak. Best from 2013 through 2020. 15,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma Valley
review: Rustic in a pleasant way, with mineral, dried currant, herb, sage and dusty berry fruit. Tight, full-bodied, firm and compact. Best from 2010 through 2015. 18,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma Valley
review: Rich and focused, showing ripe and earthy black cherry, currant and cedar flavors. Finishes with firm leathery tannins. Drink now through 2005 . 9,800 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma Valley Reserve
review: Sends mixed messages, with rich and supple fruit and a narrow and tannic structure. The plum and dark berry flavors may gain a greater presence in the next year or two. Best from 2019 through 2026. 1,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma Valley Reserve
review: Firm and structured, showing a band of cedary oak, dried currant, mineral and sage, with tannins clamping down on the finish. Needs time. Best from 2012 through 2018. 850 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma Valley Reserve
review: Marked by a cedary edge and firm tannins, with a tight core of earthy currant flavor. Best from 2001 through 2007. 915 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley
review: Marked by pleasant earthy citrus and green fruit notes, with crisp apple and honeydew melon character, this medium- to full-bodied wine ends with a clean aftertaste. Drink now through 2015. 15,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley
review: Trim and tasty, with subtle green apple, melon and spice notes that gain body and depth. Drink now. 35,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley
review: Bright, lively and refreshing, with zesty pear, nutmeg, citrus and tangerine notes, finishing with a slight cloying edge. Drink now through 2004. 29,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley
review: Complex, with pretty, ripe pear, spice, apple and melon flavors and a nice dash of spicy, toasty oak. Finishes with a complex aftertaste and more pretty interplay of fruit and oak. Drink now. 28,500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Kinneybrook Vineyard
review: Floral, offering peach blossom and honeysuckle details, with ripe and refreshing flavors of crisp citrus, pear and peach. Drink now through 2018. 500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Reserve
review: Light cedary oak underscores a crisp, juicy mix of citrus-laced green apple notes. Drink now through 2020. 1,250 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Reserve
review: Sleek and focused, with spice, pear, honeydew melon and floral scents that gain depth and complexity on the finish. Drink now through 2016. 250 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Reserve
review: A fragrant floral and musky note provides some intrigue, with spiced apple cobbler and juicy Meyer lemon flavors and a nicely spicy finish. Drink now through 2008. 3,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Reserve
review: Elegant and understated, with a core of spice and hazelnut-tinged pear and apple flavors. Doesn't try to overpower, yet could use a little more richness and depth. Drink now. 3,100 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Reserve
review: A subtle, elegant style that opens up an attractive core of ripe pear, apple and honey notes, then adds a trace of hazelnut on the finish. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Wildwood Vineyard
review: This is highlighted by citrusy notes of Key lime, grapefruit and green apple. Fans of lively acidity and lean wines will find this appealing. Drink now through 2020. 1,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Wildwood Vineyard
review: A bit coarse and not as refined as the other Kunde 1999 Chardonnays, the hazelnut, fig and toasty oak flavors seem a bit muted and lacking the vitality of its siblings. Still, it's a solid effort and good price. Drink now through 2005. 900 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Wildwood Vineyard
review: Rich and complex, with a pretty core of pear, butterscotch, vanilla and spice, turning syrupy. Drink now through 2004. 900 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Wildwood Vineyard
review: Ripe and a bit alcoholic, with a core of earthy pear, fig and vanilla flavors that are raw and in need of short-term cellaring to be more harmonious. Drink now through 1999. 662 cases made.

name: Merlot Sonoma Valley
review: Soft and juicy, with modest cherry, herb and spice flavors. Drink now through 2016. 3,000 cases made.

name: Red Dirt Red Sonoma Valley
review: Firm and spicy, full-bodied, with huckleberry, sage, herb and mineral, gaining depth and richness and finishing with fine length and persistence. Syrah, Barbera, Zinfandel and Sangiovese. Best from 2011 through 2017. 280 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Sonoma Valley Magnolia Lane
review: Appealing for the tangy peach, citrus and papaya flavors that are ripe and vividly juicy, packing a punch on the finish with pretty floral notes. Drink now. 18,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Sonoma Valley Magnolia Lane
review: Juicy peach, lime, mango and mouthwatering lemonade flavors are ripe and well-balanced, with the core of fruit flavors getting stronger on the finish. Drink now. 18,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Sonoma Valley Magnolia Lane
review: Refreshing and lively, with good depth and focused intensity to passion fruit, peach, citrus and vanilla flavors lingering nicely through the finish. Drink now. 6,900 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Sonoma Valley Magnolia Lane
review: Intense and spicy, with focused pear and grapefruit flavors that are rich and lively. Good depth and concentration. Drink now. 3,900 cases made.

name: Syrah Sonoma Valley
review: This complex, earthy style features loamy underbrush, dried berry, pepper and leather notes. This is medium- to full-bodied, with a tapered finish. Drink now through 2019. 400 cases made.

name: Syrah Sonoma Valley
review: Focused and nicely structured, with appealing black cherry and roasted coffee aromas leading to blackberry, spice and toasty cinnamon flavors. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Syrah Sonoma Valley
review: Redolant of blueberry syrup and huckleberry pie, ripe fruit flavors that turn into toasty vanilla and cedary notes, with a hint of spice on the finish. Drink now through 2007. 2,500 cases made.

name: Viognier Sonoma Valley
review: Smooth and tasty, with spiced apple, floral and ripe pear flavors and vibrant acidity, leading to plenty of Asian pear notes on the finish. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Viognier Sonoma Valley
review: Refreshing, with plenty of juicy highlights to the ripe peach, pear and citrus flavors, joined by floral and spicy details. Everything comes together in harmony on the finish. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma Valley
review: A solid Zinfandel, with briary undertones and flavors of raspberry, grilled herb and pepper. Drink now through 2021. 6,200 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma Valley Century Vines Reserve
review: Rather tightly wound, with modest flavors of raspberry and spiced herb framed by beefy tannins. Drink now through 2021. 1,490 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma Valley Century Vines Reserve
review: An old-school, briary Zinfandel, with ripe raspberry and licorice aromas, featuring rustic, dense flavors of dried cherry, cracked pepper and underbrush. Best after 2014. 957 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma Valley Robusto
review: Intense and concentrated, with fine depth to dried raspberry and jammy red currant flavors. Wears its 16 percent alcohol fairly well, with tangy structure and cedary oak tones extending through the finish. Drink now through 2006. 450 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma Valley Shaw Vineyard Century Vines
review: Dried currant, dried raspberry, herb and plum flavors show good depth, with chewy tannin and toasty oak in the finish. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma Valley Shaw Vineyard Century Vines
review: Very ripe, firm and dry, with earthy tannins wrapped around a core of spicy wild berry, blackberry and pepper notes. Best from 2001 through 2007. 2,400 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma Valley
review: Austere, defined by a cedary, crushed-rock earthiness, this is a chewy, rustic, extracted style that some will admire. Drink now. 17,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma Valley
review: Intense, with black currant, blueberry and green olive flavors highlighted by mocha-scented oak and firm tannins. Drink now through 2007. 15,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County Kinneybrook
review: Toasted hazelnut aromatics mingle with the lemon, apple and peach flavors. Balanced, this finishes with a refreshing acidity. Drink now. 2,100 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley
review: Clean, with a touch of lemon peel and pithy notes of tart apple. Drink now. 39,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley
review: A pleasant wine that offers spicy pear and apple notes, with a smooth and creamy mouth-feel. Drink now. 23,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley C.S. Ridge Vineyard
review: Well-balanced, with dusty, cedary oak wrapped around a core of ripe pear and peach-laced fruit. Drink now. 1,050 cases made.

name: Meritage 202 Sonoma Valley
review: Trim, with dry, herbal and rock pile flavors and dried dark berry fruit. This is best suited to a charry, grilled rib-eye steak. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Malbec, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2020. 1,139 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Sonoma Valley Magnolia Lane
review: Intense lemon and Key lime flavors have terrific focus, wonderful acidity and pretty aromatics. Light-bodied and vividly refreshing. Drink now. 15,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Sonoma Valley Magnolia Lane
review: A zesty acidity highlights fragrant lime, grapefruit, jalapeño and grass notes. Light-bodied and refreshing, with a crisp finish. Drink now. 14,500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Sonoma Valley Magnolia Lane
review: Crisp and tart, with orange skin, grass, passion fruit and lively citrus notes that stay bright and focused through the finish. Drink now. 9,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Sonoma Valley Magnolia Lane
review: Tart lemon, grapefruit, green apple and melon flavors stay crisp, intense and lively through the finish. Food would soften the edges. Drink now. 11,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Sonoma Valley Magnolia Lane
review: Firm, focused and lively, with a framework of bracing acidity supporting the array of citrus, fig, melon and herb flavors that linger through the finish, this California white offers an attractive combination of good drinking and good value. Drink now through 2002. 13,940 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Sonoma Valley Vineyard Block 4SB20
review: Offers a tangy orange Creamsicle note at the core, with details of lemon zest, fresh herb, lime and green apple. Drink now. 625 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Sonoma Valley Vineyard Block 4SB20
review: The ripe flavors add some richness to the lemon meringue pie and peach cobbler notes, with honeysuckle accents, toasty details and juicy acidity. Drink now. 650 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Sonoma Valley Vineyard Block 4SB20
review: A lean, light-bodied, refreshing style, with lemon-lime, green apple and fresh thyme flavors that finish with a crisp acidity. Drink now. 180 cases made.

name: Viognier Sonoma Valley
review: Peach, honeysuckle, yellow apple and grass flavors have fine intensity and a hint of citrus acidity on the finish. Drink now. 625 cases made.

name: Viognier Sonoma Valley
review: Honey and peach flavors up front, turning to sap and earth on the finish. Drink now. 400 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma Valley
review: Zesty and easygoing, with raspberry, jalapeño and herb flavors. Drink now through 2025. 7,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma Valley
review: Briary and a bit rustic, yet appealing for it's dried cherry and smoky cracked pepper notes. Drink now through 2012. 10,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma Valley
review: Intense, with dried black cherry, tangy currant and toasty oak. Picks up subtle herbal flavors in the soft tannin of the finish. Drink now through 2005. 8,900 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma Valley Century Vines Reserve
review: Zesty and well-focused, with aromas of dried cherry and cracked pepper, featuring tightly wound plum, anise and metallic flavors. Drink now. 600 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma Valley Kinneybrook
review: Zesty and rustic, with notes of black cherry, anise and underbrush. Drink now through 2018. 500 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma Valley Shaw Vineyard Century Vines
review: Supple and lively, with very good intensity to the raspberry, red currant and vanilla character framed by tart acidity and round tannins. Drink now through 2005. 2,400 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma Valley
review: Medium weight, with tart, simple cherry and berry flavors that gain interest on the finish as they fan out. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma Valley Reserve
review: Tart, but showing pretty cherry, smoke, blackberry and cedar notes. Somewhat lean, with mild tannins, it finishes moderately. Drink now through 2003. 1,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma Valley Reserve
review: Tight, tannic and chewy, with a leathery quality in the currant and cherry flavors, turns dry and austere on the finish, and may never tame its tannic nature. Drink now through 1998. 2,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley
review: Offers a complex mix of ripe pear, melon, spice and floral scents that are easy to drink. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley
review: A lively style, with fresh floral, peach and nectarine flavors that finish with a touch of citrus. Little in the way of oak. Drink now. 22,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley
review: A fruit-driven style, with ripe pear and apple flavors and dashes of spice, toast and honey on the finish. Drink now. 27,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley C.S. Ridge Vineyard
review: Tight and crisp, a touch coarse, with appealing pear, citrus and cedar flavors. Drink now through 2003. 840 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley C.S. Ridge Vineyard
review: Elegant and perfumed, with spicy pear and citrus notes of modest depth and proportion. Drink now. 320 cases made.
