name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Wildwood Vineyard
review: A bit coarse and simple, with modest spicy Muscat-like fruit and a touch of ripe pear. Drink now. 1,050 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Sonoma Valley Magnolia Lane
review: Richly textured, with toasty oak and hazelnut flavors up front. Finishes moderately, with hints of grapefruit, herb and vanilla. Drink now. 10,500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley
review: Rich, with rustic fig, apricot and honeydew flavors, laced with anise and licorice subtleties. Drink now through 2020. 20,000 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Barbara County
review: Smooth and silky, with distinct huckleberry, boysenberry and mocha notes. Full-bodied and seductive, ending with a tight focus and a long, persistent finish. Drink now through 2014. 650 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Barbara County Alisos Vineyard
review: Pure, rich and complex, with a medley of ripe cherry, plum, wild berry and spicy pepper notes. Elegant, stylish, complex and balanced, this is medium- to full-bodied, with a lingering finish. Better than previously reviewed. Drink now through 2015. 250 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Barbara County Alisos Vineyard
review: Dense and complex, with layers of wild berry, beef carpaccio, pepper and earthy mineral flavors. Intense and concentrated, this holds onto its tight focus on the long, lingering finish. Drink now through 2011. 250 cases made.

name: Pape Star Central Coast
review: Intensely spicy, with pepper and beefy berry flavors that are complex and focused. Full-bodied, ending with a pleasant minerally aftertaste. Grenache, Mourvèdre and Syrah. Drink now through 2014. 2,400 cases made.

name: Syrah Paso Robles French Camp Vineyards
review: A ripe, jammy style, effusively fruity, with spicy plum, black cherry, boysenberry and wild berry character that's fresh and lively. Drink now through 2006. 225 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Barbara County
review: Firm and concentrated, with rich, vivid wild berry, huckleberry and raspberry fruit that's well-centered and balanced, finishing with a rich, persistent aftertaste. Drink now through 2011. 900 cases made.

name: Pape Star Central Coast
review: Fresh herb--almost minty--accents mingle with white pepper aromatics and the tasty plum, pomegranate and raspberry flavors. Smooth and polished, with intensity on the finish. Grenache, Mourvèdre and Syrah. Drink now through 2007. 2,100 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Barbara County
review: Intense and gamy, with a mix of firm, ripe dark berry, loamy earth, anise and sage notes that provide a touch of savory leathery flavors. Full-bodied, complex and persistent. Drink now through 2017. 800 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Barbara County
review: Fresh cracked black pepper, leather and vanilla notes are warm and tasty, with a firm, cedary backbone and black cherry juice flavors, ending on a beef carpaccio note. Drink now through 2007. 650 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Barbara County Alisos Vineyards
review: A very distinctive clay note offers an exotic edge to the ripe wild berry, mineral, pepper, vanilla, spice and cedary flavors. Drink now through 2007. 325 cases made.

name: Viognier Santa Ynez Valley Stolpman Vineyards
review: Crisp and tangy, with lingering citrus, apple and herbal flavors. Drink now through 2002. 130 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Paso Robles
review: Light colored, but with some rich, dusty berry fruit flavors and a good slap of oak, finishing with tar and tobacco flavors. Drink now through 2005. 580 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Paso Robles French Camp Vineyards
review: A very ripe style, with juicy cherry and wild-berry jam flavors, turning elegant and refined on the finish. Drink now through 2006. 335 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Paso Robles Westside
review: Jammy, supple and briary, with wild berry and anise aromas and easygoing dusty cherry, loam and smoky licorice flavors. Drink now. 1,600 cases made.

name: Pape Star Central Coast
review: Shows off ripe, perfumed pomegranate and floral aromas, with spice, tar, leather and sage notes giving this an earthy texture and finish. Grenache, Mourvèdre and Syrah. Drink now. 1,700 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Barbara County Alisos Vineyard
review: Intense, with a tight band of spice, tobacco and plum, though it turns leathery and dry on the finish. Drink now through 2009. 240 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Maria Valley
review: Round, full flavors of blackberries and boysenberries, hints of spice and toast, lingering nicely. Drink now. 200 cases made.

name: Viognier Santa Ynez Valley Stolpman Vineyards
review: Fleshy peach and nectarine notes, with citrus peel and spice flavors that echo on the long finish. Juicy acidity keeps it refreshing. Drink now. 495 cases made.

name: Viognier Santa Ynez Valley Stolpman Vineyards
review: On the crisp, flinty side, with grapefruit and lychee flavors and a pithy edge that provides a cleansing aftertaste. Drink now. 520 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Paso Robles
review: Firm and tart, with concentrated raspberry extract, plum, earth and toasty oak flavors that carry through a chunky, solid finish. Drink now through 2006. 275 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Paso Robles Dante Dusi Vineyards
review: Raspberry, red currant, spice and toasty oak notes fold into tangy, modest tannin on the finish. Drink now through 2005. 250 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Paso Robles Dante Dusi Vineyards
review: Serves up an appealing array of ripe raspberry and cherry jam flavors. Finishes with anise and drying tannins. Drink now through 2004. 115 cases made.

name: Syrah Paso Robles French Camp Vineyards
review: Sleek, pleasant and light, with flavors of cola, beef, vanilla and cherry. Drink now. 275 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Paso Robles Dante Dusi Vineyards
review: Smoky, toasty oak, black cherry, black pepper and strawberry flavors have modest tannic structure. Drink now through 2006. 175 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Paso Robles Westside
review: Sweaty, with tangy dried berry flavors. Drink now. 120 cases made.

name: Pinot Bianco Alto Adige
review: Clean-cut and vibrant, this floral white offers flavors of Honeycrisp apple, pickled ginger, lemon cream and star anise. Drink now through 2019. 900 cases made.

name: Pinot Bianco Alto Adige
review: Plenty of apple and melon aromas and flavors. Medium-bodied, with loads of fruit and a long, lemony finish. Turns slightly toward lime and mineral. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Grigio Alto Adige
review: Bright and zesty, this light-bodied white shows a stony base and flavors of ripe and juicy Gala apple, ground white pepper and apricot, with a hint of honey. Drink now. 5,500 cases imported.

name: Pinot Grigio Alto Adige
review: Creamy and fresh, with a tang of salinity underscoring the flavors of ripe peach, pear, pink grapefruit zest and spice. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Alto Adige
review: Orange blossom and spice notes are an aromatic entry for this tangy white, which features flavors of apricot, blood orange granita and ground ginger on the lively palate. Snappy finish. Drink now through 2019. 5,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Alto Adige
review: Meyer lemon, pink grapefruit granita, Thai basil and pickled ginger notes emerge in this zippy Riesling. Offers a snappy, stone-tinged finish. Drink now.

name: Riesling Alto Adige
review: Bright and fruit-forward, this lithe white offers lip-smacking acidity and flavors of pineapple, passion fruit, grapefruit zest and stone. A fresh and lively sipper for a summer day. Drink now through 2018. 150 cases imported.

name: Riesling Alto Adige
review: Crisp, with tangy acidity and a vein of mineral-driven salinity, this offers an aromatic profile of Gala apple, blanched almond, grapefruit zest and white peach. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Lagrein Alto Adige Intenditore
review: A zesty red, with lots of herb and smoke accents to the flavors of juicy black currant and mulberry fruit, loamy earth and graphite. Light- to medium-bodied, with some grip on the finish. Drink now through 2017. 400 cases imported.

name: Pinot Bianco Alto Adige
review: Clean-cut and lightly floral, this offers a stony undertow and flavors of Gala apple, verbena and ground ginger, with a tangy finish that shows a hint of fleur de sel. Drink now. 900 cases made.

name: Pinot Bianco Alto Adige
review: Bright and creamy, this well-balanced white offers flavors of melon, apricot and raw almond, with hints of lemon zest and sea salt. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Grigio Alto Adige
review: This light-bodied, zesty white offers flavors of yellow apple and apricot underscored by an aromatic waft of spring forest. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Grigio Alto Adige
review: Complex aromas of tropical fruit and mineral, with hints of citrus. Full-bodied, with bright acidity and a medium finish. Clean and focused. A solid Pinot Grigio. Drink now. 8,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Bianco Alto Adige
review: Light-bodied and lithe, this open-knit white layers an aromatic hint of spring forest with apricot and pink grapefruit zest. Clean finish. Drink now. 700 cases imported.

name: Pinot Grigio Alto Adige
review: Creamy flavors of melon, apple and lemon zest are fresh and subtle in this lightly floral white, with a stony bass note. Drink now. 5,500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Alto Adige Intenditore
review: Clean and very lemony, with a touch of mineral. Medium-bodied, with bright acidity and a fresh finish. Drink now. 800 cases made.

name: Riesling Alto Adige
review: Aromas of Brazilian lime and lemon. Full-bodied, with pleasing fruit and a crisp finish. Bit simple. Drink now. 650 cases made.

name: Pinot Bianco Alto Adige
review: Stone and smoke accents lead to apricot, slivered almond and orchard blossom notes in this light-bodied, crisp white. Modest. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Kamptal Ametzberg
review: Concentrated tropical fruit flavors of mango and pineapple fill this rich Riesling. There's a ripe appley note as well, with intriguing savory herbal elements. This really hums on the creamy finish. Drink now through 2015. 267 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Kamptal Kies
review: Rich and filled with ripe peach, apricot and golden raisin flavors that are deep and well-developed. The long finish features plenty of spice and cream. Drink now through 2015. 450 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Kamptal Unfiltriert
review: Full-bore and flamboyant, viscous and seducing, with vanilla, smoke and spice flavors and accents of citrus. An atypical style, very international, yet well-made and integrated. Long, smoky butterscotch finish. Drink now through 2007. 10 cases imported.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Kamptal Ametzberg
review: A racy style, delivering mineral, peach and apple flavors, with touches of pepper and sea salt. The long finish echoes the spice, with squirts of citrus. Drink now through 2014. 292 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Kamptal Eichenstaude
review: Rich and concentrated, with loads of peach, ripe apple, piecrust and cream notes, backed up by plenty of acidity. Gooseberry and spice linger on the long finish. Drink now through 2012. 4,083 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Kamptal Loess
review: Exotic white, with lush, ripe flavors of peach, honey and smoke, and notes of white pepper throughout. Mineral and spice elements fan out nicely on the finish. Drink now through 2012. 750 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Kamptal Eichenstaude
review: Ripe, with a backbone of acidity reining in the citrus and lentil notes. Tightly wound and minerally, with obvious structure at this point. Give it six months or so to settle down. Drink now through 2007. 100 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Kamptal Kies
review: A ripe style, with well-structured flavors of green peach, white berry, cream and ginger. Grapefruit and wet stone define the finish, which ends on a tart note. Drink now through 2018. 400 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Kamptal Loess
review: Ripe and lush, with apple, peach cobbler and savory spice flavors. Shows lots of meringue, with hints of lemon curd and a long finish of white pepper and mineral. Drink now through 2012. 600 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Kamptal Spies
review: Rich, with well-defined pepper, ripe peach, kiwi and grapefruit flavors. Broad, with plenty of lush nuances, and a creamy, spicy finish. Straight-arrow Grüner. Drink now through 2010. 500 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Kamptal Spies
review: Ripe, opulent and complex, mixing citrus and lentil notes with hints of mineral and spice. Broad, moderately firm profile. Decent length on the finish. Drink now. 50 cases imported.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Kamptal Donatus
review: Fresh-tasting Riesling, with crisp apple flavors and some citrus notes. Subtle pepper and spice pervade the finish. Drink now through 2011. 459 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Kamptal Donatus
review: Spicy and ripe, with broad, unctuous flavors of peach, apple and white cherry. White chocolate and smoke fill the finish. Drink now through 2011. 330 cases made.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Kamptal Granit
review: Concentrated flavors of dark plum, kirsch and blackberry fill this rich, ripe red, which is also powered by hints of smoke and beef. Has a luscious finish of mincemeat and black licorice. Drink now through 2011. 583 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Kamptal Kies
review: This has concentrated flavors of ripe peach, ruby grapefruit and pear. The long finish is spicy and intense, with hints of glazed citrus. Drink now through 2013. 500 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Kamptal Friesenrock
review: There's good freshness and backbone of acidity to the peach, apple and apricot flavors. Finish exudes honeydew melon. Drink now through 2011. 541 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Kamptal Kies
review: A crunchy white, with well-defined flavors of apple and jellied citrus, which plenty of spice. Features hints of anise and savory herb on the crisp finish. Drink now through 2016. 400 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Kamptal Kies
review: Nicely focused, with crisp flavors of citrus, green peach, white plum and a touch of honeysuckle. Fresh, clean and balanced; try with a dish of scallops. Drink now through 2010. 3,335 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Kamptal Loess
review: Smoky aromas, like an Islay malt, give way to grapefruit and lentil flavors in this supple, ample white. Picks up a hint of bitterness on the finish. Drink now. 100 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Kamptal Spies
review: Aromas and flavors of peach, honey and smoke fill this dry, full-bodied white, with notes of lentil and herb that extend on the finish. A good match for roast fish or poultry. Drink now through 2009. 500 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Kamptal Donatus
review: On the exotic side, but well-structured with a spiced fruit aroma and flavors of tangelo, lemon curd and clove. Fresh, long, spicy finish. Drink now through 2009. 335 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Kamptal Eichenstaude
review: This has plenty of stone fruit flavors, with grapefruit notes, and lots of spice on the finish. Ripe and juicy. Drink now through 2008. 665 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Kamptal Kies
review: Citrusy, with grapefruit, lemon and spice flavors that gain intensity on the crisp, peppery finish. Try with oysters. Drink now. 4,583 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Kamptal Spies
review: This is ripe-tasting, with peach, apple and pear flavors that are accented by notes of pepper and nutmeg. The finish resonates with spice and smoke. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2010. 375 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Kamptal Unfiltriert
review: Spicy and ripe-tasting, with plenty of ripe peach, apple and pear notes. Creamy notes run throughout. Atypical yet still tasty, with a buttery finish. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now. 167 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Niederösterreich Kies
review: This is filled with ripe apple and green peach flavors, featuring plenty of stony notes. The spicy finish is bright, with spicy and savory herb accents in the mix. Drink now. 400 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Kamptal Eichenstaude
review: This has pineapple, fig and butter flavors, which are accented by spice and ripe peach notes. Drink now through 2012. 625 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Kamptal Kies
review: Medium-bodied, with lush flavors of ripe apple, peach and pear. The spicy finish features notes of white pepper and hints of fennel. Drink now through 2008. 667 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Kamptal Kies
review: Bright and minerally tasting, with grapefruit and apple flavors that linger on the spice finish. Drink now. 300 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Qualitätswein Trocken Kamptal
review: This has dark plum, cherry and licorice flavors that turn ripe and spicy on the finish. Drink now. 175 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Niederösterreich Ametzberg
review: This straightforward white shows ripe pineapple flavors that turn a bit cloying on the finish. Drink now. 50 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Kamptal Kies
review: Quite smoky, with a tight band of green peach, almond and citrus flavors that turn a bit tart on the finish. Drink now. 350 cases imported.

name: Pinot Blanc Qualitätswein Trocken Kamptal
review: Buttery aromas and flavors, with some ripe pear notes, are the hallmarks of this white. Drink now. 100 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Qualitätswein Trocken Kamptal Loam
review: Leesy-tasting, with cidery notes and a muddled finish. 500 cases made.

name: Muskateller Eiswein Pfalz Dürkheimer Hochbenn
review: Very fresh and smelling of flowers, spices and grapes, this delicately structured dessert wine is buoyed by racy acidity. Delicious spice and floral flavors, too. Drink now through 2005.

name: Rieslaner Trockenbeerenauslese Pfalz Ungsteiner Bettelhaus
review: Flashy and showy, like a big-budget Hollywood movie, but lacks a bit of sophistication. Still, this amber-colored, deep, rich, honeyed wine touches a nerve with all those caramel, dried apricot and toffee flavors coating the mouth.

name: Rieslaner Beerenauslese Pfalz Ungsteiner Bettelhaus
review: An electrified sweetie with a bounteous spicy lemon-lime and botrytis character. Full-bodied, very sweet and incredibly fresh. High acidity, long, long aftertaste. 204 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Pfalz Ungsteiner Herrenberg
review: Opulent, smooth and inviting, marrrying pure apricot and citrus flavors with a vivid and dense structure. Good, lingering aftertaste. Drink now through 2007.

name: Riesling Auslese Pfalz Ungsteiner Herrenberg
review: Lime, peach and mineral elements are intertwined with a sleek, racy structure. The sweetness is masked by a lot of acidity, giving this style and finesse. Excellent finish. Drink now through 2007.

name: Riesling Kabinett Pfalz Dürkheimer Hochbenn
review: A brilliant kabinett. Slim and zippy, with well-defined cardamom, lime and apricot notes that never veer off the course of vibrant acidity. Ends in a cascade of tropical fruit and citrus. Drink now through 2006.

name: Riesling Kabinett Pfalz Ungsteiner Bettelhaus
review: A real standout for this vintage, this shows lovely apricot and honey aromas and flavors, with a hint of spice and pie crust. Medium-bodied, medium-sweet, with a long, flavorful finish. Drink now. 233 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Pfalz Dürkheimer Michelsberg
review: Luscious peach notes are augmented by citrus and a juicy texture. Delicious now, yet it should age well judging by the crisp acidity. Drink now through 2006.

name: Scheurebe Spätlese Pfalz Dürkheimer Spielberg
review: Simply delicious, boasting dense flavors of guava, passion fruit, mango—all on a bright structure. Fine, lingering aftertaste of tropical fruit. Drink now through 2004.

name: Huxelrebe Beerenauslese Pfalz Forster Schnepfenflug
review: Sweet and thickly textured, offering nectarine, honey and apricot aromas and flavors. Drink now through 2002.

name: Riesling Kabinett Pfalz Dürkheimer Hochbenn
review: A lightweight, zippy Riesling, sporting fruit blossom and citrus notes on a bracing structure. Good density fills out the middle. Drink now through 2010. 460 cases made.

name: Riesling Kabinett Pfalz Dürkheimer Michelsberg
review: A delicious kabinett, with creaminess offsetting the vibrant peach, citrus and mineral flavors and firm structure. Fine balance, with a distinctive spicy finish. Drink now through 2012. 420 cases made.

name: Riesling Kabinett Pfalz Ungsteiner Bettelhaus
review: A delicious kabinett from the Pfalz. Lush yet firm, forward yet complex, with talcum powder, tropical fruit and spice nuances, this '97 white will only get better with age. Long, long finish. Drink now through 2007.

name: Riesling Spätlese Pfalz Dürkheimer Spielberg
review: Reminiscent of peaches and cream, with a hint of floral nuance, all riding on a rich yet airy texture. Enough acidity to balance everything. Excellent finish. Drink now through 2005.

name: Riesling Spätlese Pfalz Dürkheimer Spielberg
review: Enticing aromas and flavors of apple pie and cream. Medium-bodied, medium-sweet, with crisp acidity and a long, ripe fruit finish. Delicious. Drink now. 254 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Pfalz Ungsteiner Herrenberg
review: Very pretty, displaying peach, lime and mineral accents on an elegant, lithe frame, this combines wonderful harmony with subtle length. Drink now through 2005. 460 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Spätlese Pfalz Dürkheimer Nonnengarten
review: More like an auslese in ripeness, this has good concentration and balance between the sweetness and succulent acidity. The flavors lean toward litchi, papaya and apricot and linger on the finish. Drink now.

name: Huxelrebe Auslese Pfalz Forster Schnepfenflug
review: Direct in its appeal, there's no denying the juicy apricot notes and lively structure of this sweet white. Drink now through 2003.

name: Huxelrebe Beerenauslese Gold Cap Pfalz Forster Schnepfenflug
review: Not exactly from a noble grape, but impressive. Sweet and very intense, with sweet-and-sour, lemon-lime character throughout. Medium-bodied with lively acidity. Best after 2000. 250 cases made.

name: Riesling Kabinett Pfalz Dürkheimer Nonnengarten
review: Very appealing, with ripe peach, apple and mineral notes and a snap of acidity keeping it all fresh and tangy. Drink now through 2008. 995 cases made.

name: Rieslaner Auslese Pfalz Dürkheimer Nonnengarten
review: A forward style, with plenty of fruit up front. Floral and nectarine aromas and flavors are well integrated with the round, bright structure. Tails off a little on the finish. Drink now through 2003.

name: Riesling Auslese Pfalz Ungsteiner Herrenberg
review: Intense yet elegant, with rich pineapple and mango aromas and flavors and a dollop of lime that makes it lively and juicy on the medium-long finish. Try now.

name: Scheurebe Spätlese Pfalz Dürkheimer Spielberg
review: This medium-bodied, medium-sweet wine exhibits alluring aromas of mango and cream and a silky texture. Drink now. 200 cases made.

name: Rieslaner Beerenauslese Pfalz Dürkheimer Nonnengarten
review: Has a lovely texture, but smells and tastes like asparagus soup, which is OK, except you may expect more noble flavors from a BA. Still, it's a well-crafted dessert wine that offers a buttery, velvety mouth-feel. Not for everyone. Drink now.

name: Riesling Kabinett Pfalz Dürkheimer Hochbenn
review: Sweetness and a juicy texture are the hallmarks of this '99 kabinett, setting the stage for the peach and citrus notes. Drink now through 2004. 550 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Pfalz Ungsteiner Herrenberg
review: Plenty of CO2 in this bubbly auslese. It's lovely and delicate, showing crushed grapes, apple and pears on the nose and palate. Medium-bodied, medium-sweet and not as rich as others in this category, but delicious. Drink now. 200 cases made.

name: Riesling Kabinett Pfalz Dürkheimer Michelsberg
review: Ripe and smoky, with apricot flavor showing pungency due to botrytis. Appealing and forward in style, with a soft structure. Fades on the finish. Drink now through 2005.

name: Riesling Spätlese Pfalz Ungsteiner Bettlehaus
review: Firm and muscular, with spicy, peppery tobacco leaf, herbal and earth flavors giving it an edge of complexity. Drier than most '92 spÑtleses. Try now.

name: Rieslaner Auslese Pfalz Dürkheimer Nonnengarten
review: Fat and thick for auslese, with honeydew melon aromas. Medium- to full-bodied, with a clover honey finish. Slightly dull. Drink now. 330 cases made.

name: Riesling Kabinett Pfalz Dürkheimer Hochbenn
review: Modest pineapple, lemon and apple flavors make themselves felt in this ripe, lively wine, along with a hint of honey on the fruity finish.  Drinkable now; has enough acidity to stand up to food.

name: Riesling Spätlese Pfalz Dürkheimer Spielberg
review: Appealing for its peach flavors and juicy texture, but ends up a little flat. Drink now. 200 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Piesporter Goldtröpfchen
review: A vibrant style, sporting mandarin orange, lime and grapefruit notes, with a mineral accent. It's light-weight and focused, but also long and mouthwatering. Drink now through 2028. 200 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Piesporter Goldtröpfchen
review: Very ripe, showing apricot, baked apple and spice notes. It's broad and has weight, more than precision, with a sharp acidity following on the finish. This will impress some, but for me it lacks the detail and clarity. Drink now through 2020. 100 cases imported.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Piesporter Goldtröpfchen
review: Rich and smooth, this displays lemon custard, apricot and mango flavors wrapped around a core of lively acidity. Really integrated and charming at this stage, with a long finish. Drink now through 2015.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Piesporter Goldtröpfchen
review: Piquant. Despite low acidity, a brightness brings the tasty nectarine and vanilla custard flavors into relief. Fine length. Delicious now, but will improve with time. Drink now through 2015.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Piesporter Goldtröpfchen
review: A mélange of mango, orange cream and mineral highlight this intense, piquant white. Light-bodied, with good balance between sweetness and acidity, this lingers on the finish. Drink now through 2020.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Piesporter Goldtröpfchen
review: Ample and intense, this white delivers black currant, apricot and mineral flavors set against a vibrant structure. Really vivid and harmonious, with a long, apricot-tinged aftertaste. Drink now through 2022. 2,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Piesporter Goldtröpfchen
review: A zingy 2006 Riesling, showing lime, apple, peach and slate notes. Remains lively and intense through the lip-smacking finish. Very elegant. Drink now through 2022. 2,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Piesporter Goldtröpfchen No. 12
review: Tropical fruit aromas and flavors of mango, papaya, pineapple and banana mingle in this opulent white. The structure is mouthwatering and needs time to integrate, but everything is there. Best from 2007 through 2020. 224 cases imported.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Piesporter Goldtröpfchen
review: Creamy and ample, exuding apricot, mango, orange and vanilla flavors in a very harmonious profile. Nice, lingering aftertaste. Drink now through 2015.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Piesporter Goldtröpfchen
review: Ripe apricot, mango and citrus notes pick up a mineral accent in this rich, emphatic Mosel Riesling. It seems a bit obvious, but there's no denying its delicious flavors. Drink now through 2012.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Piesporter Goldtröpfchen
review: Lightweight and zippy, this crackles with lime and slate flavors, leaving a mouthwatering impression on the lingering finish. Nice green apple aftertaste. Drink now through 2010. 3,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Piesporter Goldtröpfchen
review: Lovely flavors of tangerine, apricot and mineral mark this rich, light-bodied Riesling. It picks up a creamy, custardlike note on the long finish. Drink now through 2012.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Piesporter Goldtröpfchen (AP 28)
review: Sleek, this is a minerally version, with lime and peach mixed with slate flavors. The racy structure lends verve and tension while it glides to a long finish. Best from 2007 through 2020. 224 cases imported.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Piesporter Goldtröpfchen No. 12
review: Flavors like candied lemon and fruit jujube, this is intriguing and appealing. Balanced by vibrant acidity, and drives to a long, lingering finish. Drink now through 2025. 200 cases made.

name: Riesling QbA Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Piesporter Goldtröpfchen
review: Creamy and inviting, with vanilla pastry, floral and peach flavors permeating its elegant profile. Has weight, but stays balanced and lingers on the finish. Drink now through 2010.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Piesporter Goldtröpfchen
review: Piquant, with lime and honey flavors and a tangy acidity, yet not the nuance and length of the best 2001s. Drink now through 2008. 2,000 cases made.

name: Alto Adige Amos
review: Lime blossom and spice notes waft through the yellow melon, blood orange and smoke flavors in this rich, vibrant white. Light- to medium-bodied and mouthwatering, with a long, zesty finish. Pinot Bianco and Chardonnay with Kerner, Müller Thurgau and Sauvignon Blanc. Drink now through 2022. 1,000 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alto Adige Brenntal Riserva
review: Rich accents of pastry cream and vanilla lace the baked peach, singed orange peel, lychee and spice notes in this harmonious, medium-bodied Gewürztraminer. Dry and focused, with a note of zesty mineral that echoes on the long, firm finish. Drink now through 2024. 1,500 cases made.

name: Merlot Alto Adige Brenntal Riserva
review: Hints of coffee and dried dill accent the concentrated black currant, spice box and ripe plum notes in this balanced, medium-bodied red, with supple, chewy tannins. Smoky finish. Drink now through 2027. 1,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Alto Adige Freienfeld
review: Hints of violet and spice lace the concentrated crème de cassis, grilled herb and dried fig flavors in this medium-bodied red, while creamy tannins and a smoky underpinning frame the finish. Drink now through 2024. 1,300 cases made.

name: Pinot Bianco Alto Adige Hofstatt
review: This lithe white is bright and creamy, with smoke and spice accents underscoring white peach, orchard blossom and pickled ginger notes. Drink now through 2019. 1,200 cases made.

name: Pinot Grigio Alto Adige
review: This creamy white is light-bodied and lithe, offering abundant stone and ground spice notes that underscore a subtle mix of creamed pear and melon ball flavors, with a hint of passion fruit. Drink now through 2018. 8,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Grigio Alto Adige Penóner
review: A well-knit white, light- to medium-bodied and fresh. This layers a stony mineral character with subtle notes of Gala apple, kumquat, anise, almond skin and honey. Drink now through 2019. 1,600 cases made.

name: Pinot Grigio Alto Adige
review: Hints of smoky mineral, preserved lemon and paraffin are layered with green plum and crunchy white peach fruit in this juicy white. Clean-cut on the lightly spiced finish. Drink now through 2018. 3,300 cases made.

name: Pinot Bianco Alto Adige
review: Fresh and open-knit, with flavors of melon, lemon zest, stone and sliced almond that are more subtle toward the finish. Drink now. 3,300 cases made.

name: Pinot Bianco Alto Adige
review: Lively and open-knit, this shows hints of melon, star fruit, smoke and grated ginger. Drink now. 3,300 cases made.

name: Barossa Valley
review: Distinctive for a pronounced dill note, with fresh mint accents to juicy and round cherry and wild berry flavors, oozing with generosity and details of chai tea and licorice. Grenache, Mataro and Shiraz. Drink now through 2022. 2,000 cases made.

name: Boundary Row Barossa Valley
review: Smooth, round and generous. A supple mouthful of black cherry, plum and subtle spices that waxes and wanes through the long, soulful finish. Grenache, Shiraz and Mataro. Drink now through 2012. 812 cases made.

name: Boundary Row Barossa Valley
review: Dark and peppery, with juicy blackberry flavor at the core, shaded with exotic spice and black pepper overtones on the long finish. Tannins are well-integrated. Grenache, Shiraz and Mataro (Mourvèdre). Drink now through 2008. 600 cases made.

name: Seven Sleepers Barossa Valley
review: Lean and focused, with juicy currant and blackberry fruit shaded with hints of carnation, roasted meat and spice as the finish expands against polished tannins. Shiraz, Petit Verdot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Grenache and Malbec. Drink now through 2013. 576 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Boundary Row
review: Polished and generous with its cherry, pomegranate and exotic spice aromas and flavors, finishing silky and long. Drink now through 2015. 300 cases imported.

name: Grenache-Shiraz Barossa Valley
review: Bright and jazzy, with juicy blackberry, raspberry and spice flavors on a sleek frame. Nubby tannins emerge on the finish. Drink now through 2017. 400 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Lunar Block
review: A strong minty note weaves through the dark berry and floral character in this medium-weight, nicely refined Shiraz. Has style and depth, but finishes a tad short. Drink now through 2017. 66 cases made.

name: Boundary Row Barossa Valley
review: Polished and generous, with a funky edge to the plum and spice flavors, finishing with an earthy tone and fine tannins. Grenache, Shiraz and Mataro. Best from 2010 through 2013. 112 cases imported.

name: Grenache Barossa Valley Boundary Row
review: Smooth, polished, generous and aromatic, with a floral edge to the plump blackberry and spice flavors, finishing with a mild graininess. Drink now through 2004. 500 cases imported.

name: Grenache-Shiraz-Mataro Barossa Valley
review: Smooth and round, with generous cherry and spice flavors that persist appealingly on the finish against modest tannins. Drink now through 2010. 800 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Boundary Row
review: Smooth and polished. A refreshing style that has lively plum and currant aromas and flavors, shaded with hints of white pepper and toast as the finish lingers. Drink now through 2013. 168 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Boundary Row
review: Rich and supple, polished in texture, with aromas of blueberry, cream and dusky herb and spice. Finish is smooth and immediately appealing. Drink now through 2005. 400 cases imported.

name: Boundary Row Barossa Valley
review: Fine, with solid blackberry and pickle barrel flavors, which linger on the slightly chewy finish. Grenache, Shiraz and Mataro. Drink now through 2009. 600 cases imported.

name: Seven Sleepers Barossa Valley
review: Light and refreshing, an open-textured mouthful of red berry, cherry and spice, lingering nicely. Shiraz, Grenache, Petit Verdot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Malbec. Drink now. 1,400 cases made.

name: Seven Sleepers Siebenschlafer Barossa Valley
review: Supple and appealing for its black fruit and peppery licorice overtones, echoing cherry notes as the finish sits nicely. Cabernet Sauvignon, Shiraz, Petit Verdot, Grenache and others. Drink now through 2010. 1,500 cases made.

name: Seven Sleepers Siebenschlafer Barossa Valley
review: Ripe and generous, with a mint and herb cast to the cherry and spice flavors, finishing with fine, chewy tannins. Cabernet Sauvignon, Petit Verdot, Syrah, Grenache, Cabernet Franc, Mourvèdre and Malbec. Best from 2008 through 2011. 1,200 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley
review: Ripe and juicy, with tangy cranberry and cherry flavors that mingle with toast and vanilla accents on a supple, easy-drinking frame. Drink now. 800 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Boundary Row
review: Soft and velvety, with a distinctly gamy note running through the generous black cherry and plum flavors. Finish lingers nicely, and tannins are resolved. Drink now through 2008. 600 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Boundary Row
review: Broad and ripe, with dried cherry and prune notes shaded with licorice and peppery spice flavors, lingering if a bit hot. Drink now through 2010. 256 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Boundary Row
review: Ripe with cherry and spice, with a distinct gamy note running through this smooth-textured red. Drink now through 2007. 300 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Boundary Row
review: A gamy style, with dark berry fruit that tries to go up against the barnyardy notes.   1,200 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley
review: Delicate raspberry, wild berry and wilted rose scents carry over nicely to the palate, where the fruit is vibrant and fleshy, with firm tannins. This has a wonderful finish, with a pleasant mineral and pebble aftertaste. Drink now through 2011. 151 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley
review: Aromas of smoky oak, ripe plum and berry join savory herb and sage notes that provide a nice loamy edge. Balanced, with good depth, but it's the delicate, fragrant aromas and flavors that stand out. Drink now through 2012. 300 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast McDougall Ranch
review: Supple and elegant, with ripe plum, black cherry and wild raspberry fruit that's fresh and zesty. Medium- to full-bodied, ending with firm tannins. Drink now through 2012. 125 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Marked by loamy earth, wet rock, dried berry, sage and black licorice flavors, this is moderately ripe, trim and full-bodied. Gains depth and nuance on the finish, where the flavors are tapered and complex. Drink now through 2018. 288 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Falstaff
review: Notably spicy and peppery, giving this a distinct edge, with snappy fresh cranberry, dried berry, mineral, tea and forest floor flavors that are vibrant yet restrained. Drink now through 2019. 75 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast McDougall Ranch
review: Savory wild plum, wild berry, cherry cobbler and a hint of mocha give this plenty of personality. Keeps its focus through the long, persistent finish. Drink now through 2011. 100 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast
review: Made in a cleansing, Chablis-like style, this is distinctive for the juicy white peach, nectarine and citrus touches, offering a hint of minerality and ending with a persistent aftertaste. Drink now through 2020. 550 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: The understated black cherry and wild berry slowly builds depth, with touches of fresh earth, road tar and crushed rock. Drink now through 2018. 240 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Kanzler Vineyard
review: An elegant style, with loamy earth, cherry and berry fruit that's ripe and supple, turning delicate, with fine-grained tannins and a persistent finish. Drink now through 2013. 175 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Anderson Valley
review: Tight and balanced, moderately ripe, offering a mix of loamy earth, graphite, dried berry and dried herb notes. This is medium- to full-bodied, firming on the finish. Drink now through 2018. 264 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Anderson Valley Savoy Vineyard
review: Complex and focused on a core of wet rock, dried berry and herb flavors. This is medium-bodied, ending with a dash of loamy earth and cedar notes. Firm tannins. Best from 2012 through 2019. 264 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Exhibits medium-weight flavors of dusty sour cherry and cranberry that are elegant and graceful, supple and tender. Drink now. 780 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Presents Pinot in an understated manner, with an emphasis on delicate, mineral-laced berry, sage, herb and cedar notes. Captures enough ripeness to sustain interest. Drink now. 1,550 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Juicy and vibrant, with tight and focused core of earthy sour cherry, ending with savory herb and cedar notes. Drink now through 2019. 1,225 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Falstaff
review: Well done in a trim style, offering a spicy, stemmy edge and gravel-laced dried berry, blackberry and peppery notes. Ends crisp, with cleansing tannins. Drink now through 2018. 375 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Falstaff
review: Offers a medium-bodied mix of savory sour cherry and wild berry that is pure and spicy, ending with a crushed-rock minerality. Drink now through 2018. 50 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Falstaff Vineyard
review: Notably elegant and graceful, with a distinctive mix of herb, spice and earthy, gravelly, savory underbrush notes amid light cherry-berry accents. Drink now. 270 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast McDougall Ranch
review: Exhibits a mix of spicy, savory raspberry and wild berry, with anise, black tea and even a touch of underbrush, all in a satisfying drink that should gain. Drink now through 2022. 350 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast McDougall Ranch
review: An elegant, lightly scented offering of plum and cherry fruit, complemented by pleasing dusty berry accents,a texture of fresh, gravelly earth and a pure, clean finish. Drink now through 2020. 550 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast McDougall Ranch
review: A graceful style, boasting a supple texture, with savory cherry and wild berry fruit, revealing touches of dried herb and cedar. Drink now through 2018. 345 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Anderson Valley Savoy Vineyard
review: Trim, offering modest sour berry, mineral, anise and cedar flavors, this is understated and refined, if short on depth and persistence. Drink now through 2018. 245 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Anderson Valley Savoy Vineyard
review: Pleasant, with understated earth-tinged dried berry fruit, black tea and cedar, ending with dry tannins and a floral note. Drink now through 2018. 240 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Mendocino Ridge Signal Ridge Vineyard
review: Starts supple and spicy, with a mix of cherry and plum flavors. Turns dusty and tannic, losing focus. More solid than exceptional. Drink now through 2022. 125 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: A tight, compact style, with a firm core of spice- and mineral-laced red berry flavors. Fans out a bit on the finish, but remains restrained for now. Drink now through 2022. 1,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast McDougall Ranch
review: Somewhat muddled, with more loamy earth, dried berry, tobacco leaf and forest floor than ripe or focused berry flavors. Drink now through 2018. 456 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Forest floor and porcini mushroom join compact flavors of dry herb, sage and dried berry. Medium-bodied, with a mix of lead pencil and slate on the finish. Drink now through 2014. 420 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast McDougall Ranch
review: A savory style that gets progressively muddled and full-bodied, with herb, cedar, dried berry and black licorice flavors that end up very dry and stemmy. Not up to the usual standards. Best from 2012 through 2020. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 288 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Knights Valley
review: Aromas of currant, sandalwood, spice and cedar carry over to the palate in an elegant, refreshing, harmonious style. What's missing is richness and concentration. Drink now through 2009. 529 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Elgin The Mentors
review: The tasty green melon, green fig and yellow apple fruit is offset with racy, finely beaded acidity and backed by a lingering hint of roasted hazelnut. Drink now. 880 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Western Cape Cathedral Cellar
review: Ripe and forward, with apple chutney, ginger, creamed pear and warm piecrust flavors. Has just enough zip to carry through the finish, but drink this soon. Drink now. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 1,460 cases made.

name: Pinotage Coastal Region Cathedral Cellar
review: A full-bodied, spicy-smelling red with a deep color, smooth tannins and plenty of fruit flavor. Drink now through 2000. 2,000 cases made.

name: Syrah Western Cape Cathedral Cellar
review: A vibrant, full-flavored Shiraz oozing with blackberry and cherry notes and accented by subtle oak. It's full-bodied, but not too tannic. Drink now through 2000. 1,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Western Cape Cathedral Cellar
review: A fresh, direct style, with a good core of cherry and red currant paste notes flecked liberally with fresh savory and pepper notes. A light cedary spine holds the finish. Drink now through 2017. 2,500 cases made.

name: Cathedral Cellar Triptych Coastal Region
review: Solid, flavorful and polished, this has rich black cherry flavors accented by vanilla and cedar, smooth but firm tannins and a lingering finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2001. 2,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Western Cape Cathedral Cellar
review: Solid, with nicely focused fig, pear and apple notes backed by judicious toast on the medium-weight finish. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay Western Cape Classic Collection
review: Bright, with lively green apple, kiwifruit and pear skin notes. Offers a slightly tangy, unadorned finish. Drink now. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 100,390 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Western Cape Classic Collection
review: Bright green almond and fresh pear notes glide along here, with a hint of heather stitching up the fresh finish. Drink now. 38,210 cases made.

name: Pinotage Coastal Region Cathedral Cellar
review: An easy-to-drink, medium-bodied red. Generous, bright cherry and plum flavors are backed by soft tannins and linger on the finish. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Roodeberg Western Cape
review: An elegant, herb-tinged style, with lightly mulled currant and cherry notes mixed with savory and singed cedar accents, remaining supple through the finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Shiraz, Merlot, Petit Verdot, Tannat and Tempranillo. Drink now. 3,500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Western Cape Cathedral Cellar
review: Offers light citrus peel, white asparagus and fennel notes, with a crunchy feel to the finish. Drink now. 2,945 cases made.

name: Shiraz Coastal Region Cathedral Cellar
review: Solid, showing softening dark plum, black licorice and toasty vanilla notes that linger on the velvety finish. Drink now.

name: The Legend of Big Bill Western Cape
review: Lively cassis and bay notes bounce along, with light, briary tannins and a dose of dark toast through the finish. Petit Verdot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Shiraz. Drink now. 8,000 cases made.

name: Abraham Perold Paarl
review: Fresh cut wood and raspberry aromas and flavors signal a bold, extroverted red boasting juicy berry flavors and a vibrant, solid structure. Medium-bodied, with a coating of tannins on the finish. 100 percent Shiraz. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coastal Region Cathedral Cellar
review: A smooth, concentrated, well-balanced wine with almost-sweet cherry and currant flavors that linger on the finish. Drink now through 1998. 2,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Stellenbosch Cathedral Cellar
review: Modern-style blackberry and boysenberry fruit, picking up mint and smoke notes on the finish. Drink now through 2003. 8,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Western Cape
review: A smooth and satisfying wine at a satisfying price, this South African Cabernet offers lots of juicy plum and cherry flavors, a moderately tannic, velvety texture and a lingering finish. Drink now. 22,000 cases made.

name: Cream Sherry South Africa Full
review: A nicely balanced sweet wine yielding mature flavors and lingering finish. It smells like molasses, tastes like black-walnut pie, yet remains subtle and enjoyable. Drink now. 40,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Coastal Region Cathedral Cellar
review: A little heavy on the sweet smoke, but with good dark berry and chocolate flavors, and nice concentration for its age. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Pinotage Western Cape
review: Generous fruit flavors and a rich texture make this eminently drinkable. It has ripe cherry and plum notes, vanilla accents and an agreeably soft balance. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Roodeberg Red Western Cape
review: A bit mature, with raisin and coffee notes, and claretlike vanilla bean and cedar on the streamlined finish. Has interest, and grows on you. Drink now through 2003. 100,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Western Cape Classic Collection
review: A good lime-and-kiwi core and sel gris notes mingle here, with a crisp, refreshing finish. Drink now. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 3,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Coastal Region Cathedral Cellar
review: Shows good medium-weight briar, chocolate and vanilla notes, with a moderate finish. Drink now. 3,700 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Western Cape Cathedral Cellar
review: This has nice richness, balance and good acidity. Ripe plum and leather flavors dominate, and tobacco and leaf notes appear. Would make a good accompaniment for grilled meats. Drink now. 800 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coastal Region Cathedral Cellar
review: Mature, with dried sage and tobacco notes leading the way for a modest core of mulled black currant fruit. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coastal Region Cathedral Cellar
review: Still has some guts and flesh, with chocolate, prune and coffee notes kept lively by ripe tannins and decent acidity. Needs hearty food. Drink now through 2003. 6,200 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coastal Region Cathedral Cellar
review: Already at its peak, showing lovely chocolate, tobacco and blackberry flavors. Medium-bodied; silky tannins and cedary finish. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coastal Region Cathedral Cellar
review: Pleasant and fruity with good raspberry and plum flavors. A rounded structure and herbal notes adds substance to this refreshing wine. A good shot of spice and chocolate flavors on the finish. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Coastal Region Cathedral Cellar
review: Straightforward, with good apple, pear and floral notes backed by modest toast on the finish. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Coastal Region Cathedral Cellar
review: Toasty oak aromas and flavors distinguish this round-textured and sufficiently fruity Chardonnay. Has generosity and complexity. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Western Cape
review: Soft, with citrus, pear and quince flavors that echo gently on the finish. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Hanepoot Breede River Valley Jerepigo
review: Thick-textured and mature; amber-colored, nutty in aroma, tasting like coffee and herbs. It's strong, not elegant, but has gained some nuances with age. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Western Cape
review: Nicely mature already, this is spicy, open and intriguing, with cedary aromas, ripe fruit flavors and a broad, moderately tannic texture. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Pinotage Paarl Cathedral Cellar
review: Dark, with coffee, prune and bittersweet chocolate notes and a still-juicy finish, this maturing Pinotage would provide an interesting drink alongside a hearty stew. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Roodeberg Red Western Cape
review: Direct, with lightly steeped plum and red currant notes lined with modest cedar and singed vanilla flavors. Cabernet Sauvignon, Shiraz and Merlot. Drink now. 101,951 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Coastal Region Cathedral Cellar
review: Alive with crisp citrus and herb aromas and flavors, this is a fresh, bright white that's easy to drink. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Western Cape
review: Bright, with tasty white peach, citrus peel and herb notes that linger on the finish. Drink now.

name: Steen Western Cape
review: Nice refreshing peach, tangerine and floral flavors here, with a clean, crisp finish. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coastal Region Cathedral Cellar
review: Open-knit red berry and blackberry fruit, with some vanilla and mocha hints. Moderate finish. Drink now. 8,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coastal Region Cathedral Cellar
review: Smooth and supple with dark plum, sweet cherry and spicy flavors that fill the mouth. Drink now through 2001. 3,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coastal Region Cathedral Cellar
review: Robust and full-bodied, with ample oak influence in the smoky, cedary aromas and flavors. Tannic and a little tough in texture. Fine, but not for everyone. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Western Cape
review: A firm and flavorful Cabernet with rich plum, chocolate and cherry flavors, and some spicy notes on the finish. A nice leathery, charred note adds interest. Drink now through 2000. 42,000 cases made.

name: Cathedral Cellar Triptych Coastal Region
review: Dressed-up and ready to drink. Finely-textured with soft, lush flavors. There are some sweet oak overtones to the nice cherry and herbal notes. Moderately tannic and fairly ripe. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Coastal Region Cathedral Cellar
review: Smoky, toasty aromas, lush texture and modest fruit flavors make this a big but rather tough Chardonnay. There is , however,  a good amount of  peach and pineapple flavor sneaking through on the finish. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Western Cape
review: Moderate pear and apple flavor, with a round, toasty finish. Straightforward, but clean; solid. Drink now. 50,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Western Cape Cathedral Cellar
review: Ripe and straightforward, with fresh pear and apple flavors and a toasty finish. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc-Chardonnay Western Cape Robert's Rock
review: A good, sturdy white, with enough apple, herb and spice flavors to give it substance. Soft in texture. Drink now. 25,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Stellenbosch Cathedral Cellar
review: Mature, but hanging in there, with medium-weight cedar, currant and sanguine notes. Firm finish. Drink now. 2,700 cases made.

name: Noble Late Harvest Coastal Region
review: Sweet, late-harvest style; mature, intriguing nutty aromas and peachy flavors. It's smooth, still fresh and lively. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Pinotage Western Cape
review: Medium-bodied, with chunky earth, prune and baked plum flavors and a bacony finish, all typical for Pinotage. Drink now. 17,000 cases made.

name: Pinotage Western Cape
review: Medium-weight, with a nice briar note to go with the meat and plum flavors, turning smoky on the finish. Drink now. 70,000 cases made.

name: Pinotage Western Cape
review: Like a good Aussie Shiraz, with abundant fruit flavors, light oak accents, modest tannins and an almost sweet blackberry finish. Drink now. 18,000 cases made.

name: Red Muscatel Breede River Valley
review: A coffee-colored, molasses-scented sweet wine showing fig and maple-syrup notes, lots of body and lingering finish. Flavorful and mature. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Roodeberg Red Western Cape
review: Moderate berry and plum fruit, with slightly firm tannins. Hint of spice on the moderate finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Shiraz. Drink now. 12,000 cases made.

name: Sherry South Africa Medium Dry Renasans Pale
review: Tastes like a well-aged sherry, with briny, nutty aromas, and seemingly dry, bracing flavors and a long-lasting finish. Drink now. 25,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Coastal Region Cathedral Cellar
review: A lot of smoke and toast up front, but the black cherry fruit is fading a bit on the back end. Feels like it just missed its prime. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Western Cape
review: Straightforward, ripe and appealing. Medium-bodied, with fresh plum and blackberry flavors and light tannins. Easy to enjoy. Drink now. 15,000 cases made.

name: Steen Western Cape
review: Interesting for its mix of ripe apple and cinnamon flavors. Not a blockbuster but an enticing example of this grape variety. Drink now. 65,000 cases made.

name: Tawny Port South Africa Full
review: Very good Madeira; unfortunately, it's labled Port. Cooked, ripe fruit aromas and flavors, medium body and sweetness, fresh finish. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Vintage Port Coastal Region
review: Quite ripe-tasting, with nice plum and chocolate flavors. Finishes a bit hot, but still very enjoyable. Smooth and ready to drink. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot Western Cape Robert's Rock
review: Fresh berry fruit, with some sweet spice and toast notes. Easy finish. Drink now. 45,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Western Cape
review: Clean and bright, with direct apple flavor and a moderate finish. Drink now. 50,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Western Cape
review: Mature, with plum and spice flavors and a cedar note on the finish. Drink now. 45,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Western Cape Cathedral Cellar
review: Mint, dried currant and tobacco notes are backed by an echo of savory and a lightly grainy, singed cedar accent. Drink now. 7,380 cases made.

name: Roodeberg Red Western Cape
review: Has some prune and raspberry notes up front, but finishes a bit short. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Ruby Cabernet. Drink now. 12,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Western Cape
review: On the lighter side, with quick floral and verbena hints. Drink now.

name: Shiraz Western Cape
review: Simple in scope, with pleasant grape and pepper notes and a soft finish. Drink now. 8,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz-Malbec Western Cape Robert's Rock
review: Polished, with sweet plum and vanilla on a medium-bodied frame, turning slightly coarse and astringent on the finish. Drink now. 18,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz-Malbec Western Cape Robert's Rock
review: A medium-bodied red from South Africa, with roasted flavors of red plum and cherry and a gamy aroma. Notes of white pepper on the finish. Drink now. 6,000 cases made.

name: Steen Western Cape
review: Light and fresh, with brisk green plum and melon rind hints. Drink now.

name: Steen Western Cape
review: Pleasant, light and fruity in flavor, with a nicely crisp texture and tangy apple and grapefruit accents. Drink now. 15,000 cases made.

name: Steen Western Cape Cathedral Cellar
review: The subdued apple and honey flavors in this smooth-textured wine grow on you with each sip. Drink now. 85,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Western Cape
review: Soft and forward, with baked plum and toast flavors. Smoky finish. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Cathedral Cellar Triptych Coastal Region
review: Lovely, enjoyable, tobacco and cedar notes on the nose; however, the palate appears rather dry and astringent. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Coastal Region Cathedral Cellar
review: Ripe and round, with toasted aromas and flavors, and a welcome touch of acidity that gives crispness. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay Coastal Region Cathedral Cellar
review: Well balanced with pear, ripe apple and spice flavors. Has some subtlety, but not much power or concentration. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Merlot Coastal Region Cathedral Cellar
review: Tannic and oaky, with a good foundation of fruit flavor, but it's too rough in texture to enjoy now. Best after 1998. 2,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Western Cape
review: An overt style, starting on a charry note, with some dark plum and sweet smoke notes in between, before returning to the charry note on the firm finish. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Roodeberg Red Western Cape
review: A bit trim, with modest cherry and currant fruit giving way to herb and pepper notes. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Shiraz. Drink now.

name: Roodeberg White Western Cape
review: Soft and forward, with apple and butter notes on a round, basic framework. Chardonnay, Chenin Blanc and Viognier. Drink now.

name: Shiraz Western Cape
review: Supple, with sweet and spicy flavors of red cherry, chocolate and clove. Medium-bodied, with a light, almost mapley finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz-Malbec Western Cape Robert's Rock
review: Crushed berry fruit, with a meaty note. Hint of rhubarb on the soft finish. Drink now. 45,000 cases made.

name: Steen Western Cape
review: Bright, with lime and honeysuckle aromas and flavors and a clean, soft finish. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Western Cape African Passion
review: Direct, with basic bitter cherry and plum skin notes backed by a hint of singed vanilla and herb. Drink now. 31,883 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Western Cape Classic Collection
review: Light, with modest dried cherry and pomegranate fruit backed by a twinge of dried herb. Drink now. 83,740 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot Western Cape Robert's Rock
review: Shows a little roasted note on the nose, with some beefy, plummy flavors, and a chewy, rustic finish. Drink now. 50,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Western Cape
review: Modest pear and apple fruit, with a hint of apple skin on the slightly coarse finish. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Western Cape African Passion
review: Light cherry pie and strawberry paste notes show some vanilla and herb hints. Drink now. 210 cases made.

name: Ruby Port South Africa Full
review: Nutty and sweet, featuring a baked apple, toffee, caramel character and slightly burnt finish. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Western Cape
review: A straightforward white with a pleasant mix of citrus and almond flavors. Drink now. 42,000 cases made.

name: Steen Western Cape
review: A touch tart, with lime and grass notes up front, and a hint of earth on the finish. Drink now. 30,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Coastal Region Cathedral Cellar
review: Some nice oak here and plenty of coconut and vanilla character, but it falls down slightly on the palate and its diluted finish. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Western Cape
review: This light-bodied Chardonnay has an attractive overlay of toasty oak flavor but could use more fruit character to back it up. Drink now. 30,000 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc-Chardonnay Western Cape Robert's Rock
review: Soft, with melon and butter notes, turning a hair dilute on the finish. Drink now. 70,000 cases made.

name: Pinotage Coastal Region Cathedral Cellar
review: Old-style Pinotage, with a jammy tobacco and earthy character, medium body, strawberry and cherry flavors and a cedary, resiny finish. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Pinotage Western Cape Café Culture
review: Up front, with black cherry jam and sweet vanilla notes that are a touch cloying in the end. Drink now.

name: Shiraz Western Cape
review: Maturing already, with dried cherry and plum fruit followed by light cedar and tobacco notes. Drink now. 14,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Western Cape
review: A bit rough around the edges, with apple and citrus flavors, some spicy notes on the finish. 30,000 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc-Chardonnay Western Cape Robert's Rock
review: Modest apple and citrus notes turn blowsy on the finish. 50,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Western Cape Cathedral Cellar
review: Prune, earth, licorice and coffee notes are hanging on in this mature version, which probably should have been released a while ago. Past its prime. 4,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz-Malbec Western Cape Robert's Rock
review: Modest black cherry, rhubarb and herb notes that fade on the finish. 50,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coastal Region Cathedral Cellar
review: Fading, with murky mint, tobacco leaf and drying cherry fruit flavors and a sour finish. Past its prime. 6,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot Western Cape Robert's Rock
review: Light and weedy, with dried cherry and herb flavors. 50,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot Western Cape Robert's Rock
review: Straightforward, with herbal and weedy aromas and flavors in a light-bodied presentation. 40,000 cases made.

name: Cathedral Cellar Triptych Coastal Region
review: Shows some decent cherry and plum flavors, but they're overwhelmed by a overt charred quality. 2,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Coastal Region Cathedral Cellar
review: Tired-tasting, with tobacco and cedarlike flavors and aromas. Ends on a faintly spicy note. Past its prime. 3,000 cases made.

name: Roodeberg Red Coastal Region
review: Some pleasant cherry and chocolate flavors provide a lively component to this, but watch out for the leather and smoke. A full-bodied red. Cabernet Sauvignon, Shiraz, Pinotage and Tinta Barocca. 75,000 cases made.

name: Roodeberg Red Western Cape
review: On the meager side, with moderately tart black cherry fruit, turning stewy and herbal in the end. Cabernet Sauvignon, Shiraz and Merlot. 20,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Western Cape Cathedral Cellar
review: Mature, with root beer aroma, and only moderate cherry fruit. Slightly spritzy palate gives way to wispy tannins and a fading finish. Not much here really. Past its prime. 4,000 cases made.

name: Steen Coastal Region
review: Lemony crispness makes this wine fresh and appealing, but there's not much fruit or depth to it. It makes a nice aperitif.

name: Pinotage Western Cape Cathedral Cellar
review: Very mature, with notes of licorice root, mushroom and prune, turning sour on the finish. Past its prime. 4,000 cases made.

name: Roodeberg Red Coastal Region
review: Tastes like a cross between Côtes du Rhône and Beaujolais, sporting peppery aromas and sweet-seeming, simple fruit flavors. 60,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Western Cape Cathedral Cellar
review: Has some zip, with lime and hay notes, but an overt earthy streak from start to finish mars it. This was the better of two bottles. 4,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Western Cape
review: Dilute and fading fast, with prune and earth notes. Past its prime. 17,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Western Cape
review: A light Chardonnay that comes off as slightly bitter or unripe in character. Drinkable, but pretty ordinary. 15,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Western Cape
review: A medium-bodied Merlot with stewed flavors and stemmy, tobaccolike notes on the finish. 20,000 cases made.

name: Vintage Port Stellenbosch
review: Sweet, baked and sickly, full-bodied and cloying, adding a nutty, raisiny, dried cherry finish. Tough to like. 1,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Ynez Valley Sanford & Benedict Vineyard
review: Smooth, polished and inviting for its citrusy pear and spice flavors, hinting at honey on the delicate, long finish. Drink now. 140 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Edna Valley
review: Elegant and spicy, with pretty plum, wild berry and cherry-laced flavors that turn supple and polished on the finish. Mild tannins on the finish make it appealing now through 2000. 400 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Edna Valley
review: Pulls no punches, with intense layers of exotic spice, cola, tea, menthol and plum. The power begs for a bit more finesse, but the wine makes a strong statement nonetheless. Full-bodied, with a long finish. Best from 2000 through 2004. 330 cases made.

name: Syrah San Luis Obispo
review: Shows a pleasant range of grilled meat, plum, black cherry, spice and herb flavors. Not a blockbuster, but very pretty and elegant. Drink now. 160 cases made.

name: Syrah San Luis Obispo County
review: Of medium weight and intensity, with attractive plum, wild berry, sage and light oak shadings. Loses its focus and turns simpler on the finish. Best now. 295 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Ynez Valley Sanford & Benedict Vineyard
review: Peach pit and vanilla flavors here, finishing with a flinty, oaky note. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Syrah Paso Robles Southridge Vineyard
review: Intense, with herb, roasted game, wet leather and black cherry flavors. The acidity and tannin structure are quite lively, turning slightly bitter. Best from 2002 through 2006. 270 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Edna Valley Paragon Vineyard
review: A bit funky and leathery, with concentrated though slightly sour earth and berry flavors. 265 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Maria Valley Julia's Vineyard
review: Strange, with racy, overripe, gamy and herbal flavors, turning dry and metallic. 260 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Edna Valley
review: Leathery, with modest berry tones and firm tannins. 335 cases made.

name: Xinisteri Limassol Petritis
review: Decadent ripe apple flavors dominate this medium-bodied white. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Samson Bravdo
review: Lush and well-spiced, with ripe apple, baked pear and toasted coconut flavors. Creamy in the midpalate, with smoky notes on the fresh finish. Kosher. Drink now through 2018. 1,270 cases made.

name: Bravdo Landmark 2B Samson
review: Lots of tealike notes to the dried cherry and plum tart flavors. Cedar and spice accents on the minerally finish. Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Kosher. Drink now. 400 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Samson Bravdo
review: Good minerality and intensity to the plum, dried cherry and raspberry flavors, with notes of spice, smoke and cream. Well-done. Drink now through 2008.

name: Chardonnay Samson Bravdo
review: Well-rounded, with light spice notes to the baked apple and apricot flavors. Tropical hints linger on the slightly buttery finish. Kosher. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Bravdo Coupage Samson
review: Medium-bodied, with some orange pekoe tea notes to the red plum and dried boysenberry flavors. Cedary accents on the finish. Cabernet Franc, Shiraz and Cabernet Sauvignon. Kosher. Drink now. 630 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Samson Bravdo
review: Juicy, with plenty of snap to the currant and red plum flavors. Notes of black licorice mark the finish. Kosher. Drink now. 1,166 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Samson Bravdo
review: A supple, spicy red, with plenty of raspberry and smoke flavors and a creamy finish. Kosher. Drink now. 600 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Samson Bravdo
review: Shows a ripe apple flavor, with plenty of spice, followed by hints of pineapple on the soft finish. Kosher. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Samson Bravdo Coupage
review: This has tobacco leaf accents to the dried cherry and plum flavors. Notes of bittersweet chocolate mark the finish. Cabernet Franc, Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon. Kosher. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Samson Bravdo
review: Dried plum and ripe cherry flavors turn a touch stewy on the spicy finish. Kosher. Drink now. 1,400 cases made.

name: Shiraz Samson Bravdo
review: Juicy, with red berry and dark currant flavors, as well as some hickory notes on the finish. Kosher. Drink now. 466 cases made.

name: Merlot Samson Bravdo
review: Red plum and dried berry flavors turn tart and green on the finish. Kosher. Drink now. 630 cases made.

name: Merlot Samson Bravdo
review: Dried cherry and plum flavors fill this medium-bodied red. Kosher. Drink now. 400 cases made.

name: Bravdo Coupage Samson
review: Menthol notes flank the dried red fruit flavors. The herbal finish is charry. Cabernet Franc, Shiraz and Cabernet Sauvignon. Kosher. 850 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Samson Bravdo
review: A touch cloying, with dried mint notes to the roasted plum flavors. Kosher. 4,200 cases made.

name: Haut-Médoc
review: Black licorice aromas, with very ripe fruit. Full-bodied, with velvety tannins and a Christmas pudding and dark chocolate aftertaste. From Sénéjac. Best after 2007. 830 cases made.

name: Haut-Médoc
review: Beautiful aromas of blackberry and cherry follow through to a full-bodied palate, with round yet firm tannins and a medium finish. Best after 2007. 500 cases made.

name: Haut-Médoc
review: A new wine from Sénéjac. Impressive aromas of ripe fruit and smoky, toasted oak, with hints of mushrooms. Full-bodied, with lots of velvety tannins and a long finish. Very pretty. Best after 2002. 500 cases made.

name: Haut-Médoc
review: A silky and delicious red with currant, vanilla and mineral character. Medium body, with good tannins and a clean finish. Best after 2006. 665 cases made.

name: Haut-Médoc
review: A clean red, with blackberry, mineral and light vanilla aromas and flavors. Medium-bodied, with fine tannins and a minerally finish. A decent 2002, if a bit hollow. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Gold Cap Mosel Brauneberger Juffer-Sonnenuhr
review: This features a honeyed aroma, with a racy core of vibrant minerality to the glazed apricot, ripe melon and red peach flavors. Plush, with plenty of richness and a long, cream- and spice-filled finish. Drink now through 2038. 50 cases made.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel Brauneberger Juffer
review: Racy and very pure-tasting, displaying plenty of minerality to the fresh-cut apple, juicy melon and Bosc pear flavors. Offers an endless finish of light smoke and spice, with hints of cream. Drink now through 2023. 120 cases made.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Brauneberger Juffer-Sonnenuhr
review: Delicate and bright. Already beginning to lose its primary fruit and show slate flavors, while the sugar and acidity are integrating. Suggests that some '97s will develop quickly. Drink now through 2003.

name: Riesling QbA Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Brauneberger Juffer
review: A little sweetness here balances the lively acidity, while the lime and mineral notes remain focused. Delicately wrought. Drink now through 2001.

name: Riesling Spätlese Feinherb Mosel Alte Reben
review: Apple and citrus flavors dominate this ripe white. Butter and spice notes linger on the rich finish. Drink now through 2015. 120 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel Brauneberger Juffer
review: Features a ripe aroma, with decadent flavors of peach cobbler and spiced apple. Languid and spicy on the finish. Drink now through 2020. 50 cases made.

name: Müller-Thurgau Small Carpathian Jagnet
review: Mandarin orange, pink grapefruit pulp, spice and floral notes are bright and lively in this light, tangy white. Drink now through 2018. 150 cases imported.

name: Riesling Beerenauslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg NR. 32 (AP 20)
review: Light on its feet and packed with dried apple, black currant and citrus notes, this is both juicy and intense. The apple theme continues through the finish, where a honey note emerges. Fine acidity keeps it fresh and lively. Best from 2008 through 2038. 8 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg NR. 36 (AP 19)
review: A luscious Riesling, with apricot, nectarine and lime mousse flavors. Seamless and very seductive, with an incredible creamy texture offset by vibrant acidity. Has fine length. Easy to enjoy now, but should also age well. Drink now through 2025. 25 cases made.

name: Riesling Eiswein Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg (AP 33)
review: Crystal clear, with incredibly vivid aromas and flavors of crushed grapes, honey and flowers. Full-bodied and very sweet, with wonderfully refreshing acidity and a very long finish. Purity all the way. Better after 2000.

name: Riesling Trockenbeerenauslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Karthauserhofberg Fuder #177
review: Light orange amber in color and extremely fresh, showing orange peel, apricot and leather on the bouquet and palate. Very elegant, delicate and refined, with medium sweetness and bright acidity focusing the orange peel and mineral flavors. Fine length.--Non-blind German TBA tasting (2010). Drink now through 2035.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel Karthäuserhofberg
review: Vibrant acidity gives great pull to the apricot, lime and mineral flavors in this electric, racy white, which is taut, giving an expression of place that is the essence of slate. Terrific length. Best from 2014 through 2048.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg (AP 11)
review: Well-defined and racy. More like a 2004 than a 2005, this is delicate, vivid and packed with vanilla, lime, peach and mineral notes. Integrated, unfolding its flavors through the long finish. A classic Mosel profile. Drink now through 2025. 100 cases imported.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg NR. 18 (AP 13)
review: More mineral-driven than most 2005s in this category, this is a slightly drier style, with full-bore intensity and a tangy acid structure. Lime and apple join the slate flavor, and these themes remain persistent through the long finish. Best from 2008 through 2025. 25 cases made.

name: Riesling Beerenauslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg NR. 57 (AP 25)
review: Fresh and delicate, revealing peach and citrus notes, with the mineral submerged right now. Lighter in style, this is very pure, with racy acidity, fine length and a tangy finish. Shows what the Mosel does best. Drink now through 2045. 400 cases made.

name: Riesling Eiswein Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg NR. 49 (AP 18)
review: A lighter style of eiswein, with a creamy texture offsetting a vivid acidity, setting the stage for peach, lime and mineral flavors. Juicy and clean, it's expressive of place. Drink now through 2030.

name: Riesling Eiswein Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg NR. 55 (AP 19)
review: A live-wire Riesling, crackling with acidity and apricot, pineapple and lemon flavors. Lightweight, but what a jolt of flavor, ending with a mineral aftertaste. Drink now through 2015.

name: Riesling Feinste Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg Fuder No. 123
review: Light yellow, with a green reflection. Piercing aromas and flavors of smoke and vanilla cream are punctuated by racy acidity in this delicate, fresh, mouthwatering Riesling. Fine length and finesse. From one of the best vintages of the 1960s.--German Riesling non-blind vertical (April 2008). Drink now through 2028.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Mosel Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg GG
review: A very minerally aroma leads to juicy yet refined flavors of apple pastry, dried pineapple, apricot jam and quince. Intense and mouthfilling, with plenty of slate and mineral notes and a finish filled with hints of pepper and chalk. Best from 2014 through 2026. 300 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel Karthäuserhofberg
review: Intense and sleek, with concentrated nectarine, lime and slate flavors that give this plenty of verve. Quite smoky midpalate, with a powerful, seamless finish that oozes minerality. Drink now through 2030.

name: Riesling Auslese Gold Cap Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg NR. 52 (AP 15)
review: There's a vivid underlying acidity here and it's balanced by a richness and density that gives this white dimension and length. Honey is the main flavor theme, along with apricot and lime. Fine, lip-smacking finish. Best from 2008 through 2025.
