name: Riesling Auslese Long Gold Cap Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg NR. 52 (AP 16)
review: Very well done. Vivid pineapple, apricot and candied lemon peel notes and a bracing structure lend distinction to this vivacious auslese. It's intense and harmonious, with a thick, creamy texture and long finish. Best from 2005 through 2015.

name: Riesling Auslese Long Gold Cap Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg NR. 53 (AP 16)
review: This is forward initially, showing apricot, lime and dried apple notes before the bracing acidity sweeps in and leaves a citrus tanginess on the palate. Similar to an eiswein in character, with a sweet-tart profile. It needs time to integrate. Best from 2008 through 2030.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: A rich, creamy white, boasting peach, black currant and vanilla flavors. Hard not to drink this now, but the vibrant structure will allow this to age gracefully. Drink now through 2032. 150 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: The picture of purity and clarity. Peach and nectarine flavors overlay the citrus component, while the vivid structure keeps this racy and linear. Light and delicate, yet needs time to integrate more fully. Excellent length. Best from 2012 through 2038. 400 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg NR. 35 (AP 16)
review: Seems to have a bit more development. Terrific structure drives the lime, peach and slate notes, and there's even a touch of smoke, followed by a great Key lime pie aftertaste. Drink now through 2030. 100 cases made.

name: Riesling Eiswein Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg NR. 48 (AP 18)
review: Sleek and precise, with the concentrated nectarine, lemon and custard notes etched onto the bracing structure. Good crisp finish. Drink now through 2015.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: Lithe and racy, this is full of lime and mineral flavors. A bit jangled now, but has the delicacy and crispness that make Mosel kabinett so special. Fine length. Give this time. Best from 2008 through 2018. 250 cases imported.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel Karthäuserhofberg
review: Effusively fruity and redolent of red peach and apricot preserves, this is well-spiced and very plush. Honeyed notes extend on the enveloping finish, with lively acidity. Very refined.  Drink now through 2030. 100 cases imported.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel Karthäuserhofberg
review: Maintains a fine balance between the luscious apple and ripe grapefruit flavors, backed by plenty of fresh acidity. Gains power midpalate, with a finish of tarragon and cream. Excellent focus.  Drink now through 2038. 250 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Gold Cap Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: Fine concentration here, matched by a gossamer texture and juicy acidity, all of which frame the peach, vanilla and lime notes. In the end, a delicate Riesling. Drink now through 2018. 70 cases imported.

name: Riesling Auslese Gold Cap Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg NR. 49 (AP 17)
review: A sweet-tart component gives this snap, while the vanilla, apricot and nectarine flavors cozy up to the plush texture. Has fine concentration and length. Drink now through 2030. 50 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel Karthäuserhofberg
review: Shows good focus to the mineral, spice and fresh-sliced white fruit flavors. Features interesting tropical accents, with plenty of dried apricot and jellied citrus notes. The broad, rich finish offers some licorice hints. Drink now through 2028. 165 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Trocken Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg S
review: A dry style, with flavors in the range of lanolin, spice and mineral, rather than fruit. This is ripe, though firm and slightly austere on the finish now, where the mineral element shines. Loads of energy. Best from 2010 through 2018. 50 cases made.

name: Riesling Eiswein Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg (AP 36)
review: (Auction wine). Vivid and exciting. Starts off slowly, then builds on the palate. Wonderful sweet-and-sour, lemon-and-lime and orange character. Full-bodied and very sweet, with zingy acidity. Best after 1998.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel Karthäuserhofberg
review: Luscious flavors of peach and apricot preserves are explosively fruity. Offers a creamy texture, with a long finish of spice and pear compote. An exuberant style. Drink now through 2020. 450 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Mosel Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg GG
review: Fruity and pure, with rapierlike acidity behind the green apple, pear and peach flavors. Powerfully structured lemon-lime notes show midpalate. Hints of savory herb emerge on the minerally finish. Best from 2018 through 2024. 900 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel Karthäuserhofberg
review: Offers a ripe aroma, with flavors to match, including apple, pear and grapefruit. Intense notes of sea salt and mineral linger on the crackling finish, which features hints of anise. Drink now through 2032. 200 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: A broad style, awash with honey, butter, peach, lime and slate notes. Well-integrated and lush, yet backed by a firm structure. The finish lingers, with honey and mineral accents. Better than previously reviewed. Drink now through 2032. 500 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: This delivers the essence of crisp green apple, showing plenty of citrus zest and pear flavors. Very minerally as well, with a crisp, airy finish that features notes of tarragon and lemon curd. Drink now through 2038. 80 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: Creamy and round, with a freshness despite the soft structure. The peach, lime and vanilla notes are pure and enticing, ending in a mouthwatering finish. Drink now through 2018. 25 cases imported.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg (AP 6)
review: Steely and lively, with plenty of concentration. Has powerful mineral, pine and sweet fruit aromas, intense lemon and lime flavors and steely acidity. Full-bodied and sweet. Drinkable now.

name: Riesling Eiswein Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg NR. 56 (AP 24)
review: Delicate, showing peach, grapefruit and lime flavors, with an intense acidity keeping it focused and long on the finish. On the tart side now, but give it a few years to integrate. Best from 2012 through 2030. 25 cases made.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: The cool aromas and flavors of violet, wet stone and blueberry are fascinating, with herb and savory accents. Sleek and bright, with a mouthwatering finish. Drink now through 2020. 500 cases made.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: A sleek, refined Riesling, sporting apricot, honeydew and mandarin orange aromas and flavors. Has a slate accent that shines through on the finish and a clean, refreshing aftertaste. Drink now through 2025. 200 cases imported.

name: Riesling Spätlese Trocken Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: Dry, with terrific balance between the juicy peach and spice flavors, the bright structure and the alcohol. The slate core lurks beneath it all. Fine length. Drink now through 2012. 100 cases imported.

name: Riesling Auslese Gold Cap Mosel-Saar-Ruwar Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg (AP 41)
review: Intense dried peach and spice aromas with a touch of dried fruit. Medium-bodied and very sweeet, with marvelous ripe fruit flavors and a very long, juicy finish. Drinkable now, but can age.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: Another fruit explosion; extremely vibrant, with freshly cut green apple and melon aromas and lots of fresh fruit flavor. Full-bodied and medium sweet, with high acidity. Drinkable now.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg NR. 50 (AP 13)
review: A sweet auslese, perhaps marked by botrytis, displaying a candied edge to the rhubarb, apricot, pineapple and lemon flavors. Good vibrant structure and length. This is sweet enough to handle fruit tarts. Drink now through 2015.

name: Riesling Auslese Trocken Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: An elegant style, with a racy underpinning keeping this focused and full of verve. Detailed flavors of peach, melon, apricot and mineral ride it out through the long finish. Drink now through 2018. 250 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Trocken Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: Smells like lemon cream, then surprises with its dryness on the palate. Has a touch of carbonic gas, which gives this freshness but also a hardness, with citrus, mineral and white pepper notes. Fine balance and length. Drink now through 2012. 50 cases imported.

name: Riesling Kabinett Feinherb Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: Languid aromas of peach, citrus and mineral encircle a core of firm acidity in this off-dry Riesling. Balanced and long. Better then previously reviewed. Drink now through 2018. 400 cases made.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: Offers an enticing steely firmness, with a flush of passion fruit, green apple and mineral flavors, accompanied by ripe orange and melon notes. Savory herb hints show on the fresh finish. Drink now through 2022. 300 cases made.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel Karthäuserhofberg
review: A juicy Riesling, displaying tangerine and citrus zest flavors that are bright and crisp. Light on its feet, with a long aftertaste of mineral and spice. Very refreshing. Drink now through 2022.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: A very ripe version, with apricot, mango, vanilla and spice flavors. Lush and filigreed, with vibrant acidity. There's a mineral element and a tactile feel on the finish. Better than previously reviewed. Drink now through 2022. 400 cases made.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: A thoroughbred. Intense and spicy, this white is packed with slate, lime and tropical fruit nuances, all tightly wound on a sleek, racy frame. Mouthwatering finish, with an aftertaste of passion fruit. Drink now through 2007. 600 cases made.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: Young, austere and not giving much right now other than hints of apricot and slate. Concentrated though, with a stony taste and incredible length. Best from 2002 through 2012.

name: Riesling Kabinett Trocken Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: A vivid dry Riesling, this offers peach, lemon and plenty of spice and mineral notes. Rich, verging on medium-bodied, with a lingering white pepper aftertaste. Drink now through 2015. 300 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Mosel Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg GG
review: The well-defined apple, white cherry and wild plum flavors are given plenty of life by fresh acidity. Very juicy on the finish, which sports lingering notes of pastry and allspice. Complex and satisfying. Drink now through 2018. 400 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: Lime, apple and grapefruit notes collaborate with the vibrant structure and weightless profile, leaving a vivid impression on the palate. A racy Riesling, with a mouthwatering mineral finish. Best from 2011 through 2025. 500 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: Some floral elements enhance this white, which also shows red berry and citrus. It's silky and refreshing, with a crisp, citrus- and mineral-tinged finish. Drink now through 2022. 200 cases imported.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: Still closed, with some carbonic gas lifting the apple and peach flavors. Rich midpalate, with well-integrated acidity. Slim, yet ripe and crisp on the finish. Best from 2008 through 2016. 200 cases imported.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: An energetic white that awakens the palate with its succulent lime, apple and peach notes that are well-defined by the sleek structure. Fine persistence through the lingering citrus finish. Best from 2007 through 2020. 175 cases imported.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: Pure and filigreed, evoking spice and mineral notes, this sleek white exhibits terroir and character. Lightweight and intense, with a tangy aftertaste. Drink now through 2012.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: The super-focused fruit in this wine zeros in on your palate. Delightfully perfumed, with plenty of cantaloupe and apple aromas. Medium-bodied and sweet, with intensely focused apple flavors and super-crisp acidity. Gains a lot in the glass. Try now.

name: Riesling Spätlese Trocken Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: Dry and tangy, with grapefruit, peach and white pepper notes. The acidity is pronounced and this stays elegant and fresh. Nice mineral undercurrent. Drink now through 2016. 300 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: Lean and tight, this is driven by its racy structure. Lime and grapefruit flavors pick up tangerine and apricot shadings. It ends with a slight tartness. Best from 2009 through 2022.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: Lovely ripe apricot and pineapple aromas and flavors combine with a luscious texture and firm backbone in this mouthwatering white. Fine harmony, with pure flavors and a lingering finish. Drink now through 2008. 200 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg (AP 30)
review: A searing, intense wine that vibrates with apple, peach and slate flavors. Laserlike focus, precision balance and fruity on the finish. For fans of a delicate style of auslese. 110 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg NR. 33 (AP 14)
review: Sleek and vivid in its structure, with a sweet, tart, eiswein character; apricot and herbal flavors lack expression today. Difficult to assess where this is going. Best after 2005. 1,300 cases made.

name: Riesling Kabinett Feinherb Mosel Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg Schieferkristall
review: A racy style, displaying a focused core of mineral, slate and peach flavors that are bright and finely textured. The finish features hints of ruby grapefruit and glazed citrus. Drink now through 2018.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: Juicy and fresh-tasting, with lots of apple, pear and quince flavors that feature a citrus twist. The spicy finish features powerful mineral notes. Drink now through 2022. 50 cases made.

name: Riesling QbA Feinherb Mosel
review: Alluring tones of peach, orange and slate mark this off-dry white, whose bright acidity keeps it focused and lively, with a tangy finish. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Riesling QbA Feinherb Mosel Ruwer
review: Juicy, with a crisp mix of fresh-cut apple, Asian pear and tangerine flavors that are balanced with some appealing herbal notes. Offers fresh-squeezed citrus on the finish. Impressive for the category. Drink now through 2015.

name: Riesling QbA Trocken Mosel Karthäuserhofberg
review: Crushed granite notes bring a sense of power to the lemon-lime flavors. The taut, focused finish features green apple and spice. Drink now through 2015. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 1,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: Herb, spice and mineral notes permeate this rich Riesling, lending it a good expression of place. Balanced, it lingers nicely on the finish. Drink now through 2012. 150 cases imported.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: Taut and racy, this needs time to unravel its mineral, peach and floral flavors, complex and intense, dancing across the palate. Lingering finish.

name: Riesling Spätlese Trocken Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: Ripe and juicy, yet elegant. Nectarine, orange and spice notes mingle with the vibrant structure, turning spicy on the finish. More assertive than harmonious, and very dry. Better than previously reviewed. Drink now through 2015. 500 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Gold Cap Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg (AP 43)
review: Plenty of fresh-crushed fruit character and sweetness. Medium-to-full body, with mineral and licorice flavors and a sweet finish. Drink or hold.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg (AP 14)
review: The spice aromas are attractive, and this white is lighter and more elegant, with juicy acidity. Not that complex, with moderate length. Drink now through 2025. 50 cases imported.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg (AP 16)
review: Needed time to develop in the bottle; may still be a little awkward and need to move up a few notches. Medium-bodied and sweet, with discreet lemon and fruit aromas, steely acidity and a rather lean fruit structure. Try now.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg (AP 4)
review: Understated in the aromas and elegant on the palate. Could move up a few points in a few years. Medium-bodied and sweet, offering fresh melon and apple aromas, creamy apple flavors, very high acidity and a long, zingy finish. Drink now.

name: Riesling Auslese Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: Steely and fresh, with bubbly melon and fruit character. Medium-to-full body, medium sweetness and a fresh, crisp finish. Drinkable now.

name: Riesling Kabinett Feinherb Mosel Karthäuserhofberg Schieferkristall
review: A savory style, with ripe apple and white cherry flavors that feature hints of smoke. Well-balanced and a touch off-dry, offering a spicy and juicy finish. Drink now through 2015.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: Racy and crystalline, with persistent apple, spice and lime aromas and flavors. It has a subtle finish, yet I like the integration. Drink now through 2010.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: A delicate 2003 kabinett, exhibiting peach, citrus and orange notes on a moderately firm structure. Clamps up on the finish, detracting a little from its overall appeal.  Drink now through 2012. 100 cases imported.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: Extremely classy, with excellent concentration. A serious wine, with delicate yet intense aromas of minerals, limes and lemons. Medium-bodied and off-dry, packed to the brim with fruit and excellent acidity. Shows lots of flavor on the crisp finish. Drinkable now.

name: Riesling Kabinett Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: Crystal clear and fresh, with delicate apple and melon aromas and flavors. Light-bodied, barely sweet, with fresh, fruity acidity. Pleasing finish although very crisp. Drink now.

name: Riesling QbA Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhof
review: Delicious and packed with fruit; perfect for sipping in warm weather. Shows intense lemon and grapefruit aromas, a round yet crisp texture and loads of lemony apple flavors. Medium-bodied and medium sweet. Drinkable now.

name: Riesling QbA Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: A mix of apple, peach and lime notes sits brightly on the lightweight frame of this delicate, focused white. Harmonious and flavorful, fading nicely. Drink now through 2010. 50 cases imported.

name: Riesling QbA Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: Extremely fresh Riesling with loads of lemon rind and mineral character. Medium-bodied, off-dry and flavorful. Citrus flavors go on and on. Drink or hold.

name: Riesling Spätlese Feinherb Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: The bracing acidity makes this feel like a dry Riesling, rather than feinherb. Shows floral and pine aromas, peach and lime flavors, with a mouthwatering finish. Drink now through 2018. 500 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: Lovely richness here, peach and apricot flavors and a ripe, juicy acidity. Round and lip-smacking, it's delicious now and should develop well over the medium-term. Drink now through 2005. 400 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Trocken Mosel Karthäuserhof Alte Reben
review: Firm and filigreed, with good depth to the berry, cherry and currant flavors supported by a frame of zesty acidity. White pepper accents impart a savory herbal hint on the finish. Drink now through 88.

name: Riesling Spätlese Trocken Mosel Karthäuserhofberg Alte Reben
review: Well-crafted, displaying plenty of structure behind the mineral, white pepper and blood orange flavors in this pure-tasting white. The long finish is filled with sea salt and gooseberry notes. Drink now through 2018. Tasted twice, with consistent notes.

name: Riesling Kabinett Halbtrocken Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: Crystal clear and off dry, this white's flavors revolve around mineral and spice, with a touch of almond. Shows density and concentration. Drink now through 2004.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: Bright and peachy, with hints of smoke and lime in a lightly sweet style. It's backed by a vibrant structure and moderate length. Drink now through 2009. 3,800 cases made.

name: Riesling QbA Feinherb Mosel
review: Interesting notes of lanolin and spice give this some lift. Pear, apple and peach flavors dominate the fruit spectrum, while the finish features hints of cream. Drink now through 2015.

name: Riesling QbA Feinherb Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: A soft, gentle Riesling, showing peach and apple flavors, picking up a citrus acidity by the finish. Nicely balanced and fresh. Drink now through 2010.

name: Riesling Spätlese Feinherb Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: Almost bone-dry, this offers grapefruit and floral notes focused by a sharp acidity. It finishes on the short side. Drink now through 2009. 30 cases imported.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: Attractive flavors of orange and peach, but also mineral and herbal components. Densely textured, this needs time. Drink now through 2005. 2,600 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: Very fresh, with lots of crushed grape and melon character. Medium-bodied, lightly sweet, crisp acidity and an earthy, fruity finish. Drink now.

name: Riesling Spätlese Trocken Mosel Karthäuserhofberg Tyrell's Edition
review: Austere, with a savory edge to the apple and lemon-lime flavors. Finishes a touch soft, with some custard notes. Drink now.

name: Riesling Auslese Gold Cap Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg (AP 19)
review: Tasting this is like biting into a ripe honeydew melon. Medium body and sweetness, with delicious fruit flavors and a crisp finish. Drinkable now, but this can age.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: Very pure and well-delineated, unfolding its slate, apple and citrus notes on a wave of bright acidity. This should develop beautifully. Drink now through 2005. 6,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: Extremely fresh wine with vivid peach, melon character. Medium-bodied and slightly sweet, this wine is a live wire with crisp acidity and jazzy fruit flavors. This was the better of two bottles. Drink now.

name: Riesling Auslese Gold Cap Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: Doesn't have the weight of a Gold Cap. Yet it shows pretty fresh fruit and a pleasant sweetness with a medium body and a medium finish. Drink now.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: As a top spätlese, great. But as an auslese? Still, this is clean and fresh, with lovely honey, pie crust and apple character. Medium body and lightly sweet, showing crisp acidity to balance. Drinkable now.

name: Riesling Auslese Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg (AP 30)
review: Medium-weight for an auslese. Yet it shows attractive fresh fruit and pleasant sweetness, with medium body and finish.

name: Riesling Kabinett Feinherb Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: A light style, with lemon and mineral notes. It has adequate acidity, but lacks focus. It firms up on the finish, so may need a little time. Drink now through 2012. 100 cases imported.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: Lots of apple and peach aromas flow from this medium-bodied, slightly sweet wine. Clean acidity gives the finish an extra push. Drinkable now or try aging.

name: Riesling QbA Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: This needs time. Lean and tangy, with lip-smacking acidity, yet there are apple and mineral notes too. Drink now through 2007. 2,500 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Trocken Mosel Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: A mix of petrol and nectarine aromas and flavors, backed by a firm structure. More angle than curves right now, but may soften up with time. Best from 2011 through 2015. 500 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg (AP 12)
review: This has great structure but the flavors are muted, finishing short. Best after 2005.

name: Riesling Auslese Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: This is an auslese? Crisp, sharp and lovely, showing a great backbone of acidity and lots of lime and citrus flavors. The texture is barely of spÑtlese quality, as it delivers a lively, vibrant, honey-tinged finish.  Try now.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: Fresh and clean, offering lemon and mineral aromas and flavors. It's medium-bodied, off-dry and has a light finish. Drink now.

name: Riesling QbA Halbtrocken Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: Round and fruity, this halbtrocken evokes apple, peach and spice flavors, with a firm, citruslike acidity underneath. Drink now through 2003.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: Extremely fresh and vibrant, but a little bottle sick. Marvelously lively fruit and refreshing acidity, but not terribly concentrated. Drinkable now; maybe better with age.

name: Riesling Spätlese Trocken Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: Bright and juicy, if austere in flavor, with modest white peach, apple and mineral notes. Very firm, it ends with a lemony tang. Drink now through 2006.

name: Riesling Eiswein Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg (AP 34)
review: More like a big spätlese than a proper eiswein. Medium-to-light body, a fresh lemon and apple character and a sweet finish.

name: Riesling Kabinett Halbtrocken Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: A very crisp and lemony white. Light-bodied and dry, this has fresh, lively acidity but comes off a bit neutral. Best after 1998. Drink now.

name: Riesling Kabinett Halbtrocken Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: Extremely fresh and a bit spritzy. Crisp citrus, pear and green apple flavors liven up the finish, leaving you with an unusually mouth-puckering taste for a '92.

name: Riesling QbA Feinherb Mosel-Saar-Ruwer
review: Firm and bracing, with lanolin, straw and slate notes. Awkward and slightly coarse on the finish. Drink now through 2012. 500 cases made.

name: Riesling QbA Halbtrocken Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: Like biting into a ripe Bosc pear, this delicate, pretty Riesling is crisp, clean and fresh, with a supple texture. Drinkable now.

name: Riesling QbA Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: Appealing floral and melon character makes this wine very easy to enjoy. Light-bodied and plenty of flavor. A supple finish, too. Drinkable now.

name: Riesling Kabinett Halbtrocken Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: This tastes more dry than off-dry, with a streak of peach flavor, but austere overall, with a crisp finish. Drink now.

name: Riesling Spätlese Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: Very spritzy, fruity and light, with moderate pear and grapefruit notes. Drink as an aperitif.

name: Riesling QbA Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Eitelsbacher Karthäuserhofberg
review: Uninspiring, this has decent citrus character but it's rather light, lightly sweet--not showing much. Mundane.

name: Naoussa
review: Quite rustic, with leather and dried cherry flavors. Ash notes on the finish. Xynomavro. 1,200 cases made.

name: Naoussa
review: Mature, astringent red, with talcum powder flavors and bitter cherry notes. 300 cases imported.

name: Naoussa
review: Redolent of red cherries and menthol. An extreme style. Not for everyone. 300 cases imported.

name: Syrah Red Mountain Open Highway
review: Bright and jazzy, lively with cherry and raspberry flavors, balanced by lively acidity and sleek tannins, dancing through the finish. Drink now through 2020. 100 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Dijon 777
review: Dark and chocolaty, delivering unctuous black cherry flavors with cocoa overtones before hitting a wall of drying tannins on the finish. Doubtful that the texture will soften much, but the flavors are compelling. Best after 2018. 188 cases made.

name: Riesling Kabinett Halbtrocken Pfalz Freinsheimer Oschelskopf
review: Medium bodied, with a spicy character, this open-textured Riesling evokes apple and white pepper notes in an off-dry style. Drink now through 2005.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Proprietor's Reserve
review: Serves up complex layers of ripe plum and black cherry that pick up black licorice and mineral notes, ending with a long, persistent finish. Drink now through 2020. 274 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Proprietor's Reserve
review: A rich, sappy, full-bodied effort, showing spicy plum, mulled apple and apple pie spiciness, with blueberry and blackberry touches. Full-bodied and concentrated, this is still a bit rough around the edges, but it's well-structured, with an appealing core of flavors. Drink now through 2016. 336 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Jaden & Keira's Cuvée
review: Aromas of earthy raspberry, dried herb and berry are accented by notees of anise and licorice in this red, which firms up midpalate, turning tannic and remaining so, offset by the ample fruit gushing through the finish. Drink now. 320 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Jaden & Keira's Cuvée
review: A fragrant, delicate style, with a trim mix of subtle plum and cherry notes, showing spice and floral scents and a splash of cola on the lingering finish. Drink now through 2022. 269 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Jaden & Keira's Cuvée
review: Well-made, intense and balanced. Full-bodied, with ripe plum and black cherry fruit that's direct and focused, gaining depth and complexity on the finish. Drink now through 2015. 400 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Jason & Aiden's Block
review: Well-proportioned, with a supple texture leading to the ripe plum and black cherry flavors, gaining a touch of black licorice and ending with firm tannins. Drink now. 123 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Proprietor's Reserve
review: A gutsy style of Pinot, dense, extracted and tannic, featuring a complex mix of flavors that lean toward dark berry, licorice, loamy earth and cedary oak. Drink now. 295 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Proprietor's Reserve
review: Rich and intense, with a potent mix of dried herb, mint, black tea and wild berry notes. Turns tannic and ends that way. There's lots to admire here. Time should be an asset. Drink now through 2022. 228 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Dry, herbal and savory, yet with a pleasing mix of berry fruit, which has a spicy edge that's quite appealing. Drink now through 2011. 351 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Jaden & Keira's Cuvée
review: Offers a floral, spicy cola edge, with savory dried berry, ending with an earthy-leathery accent on the finish. Drink now through 2020. 356 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Jaden & Keira's Cuvée
review: Pure and silky, this light style boasts fleshy plum and black cherry flavors, ending with a supple texture. Drink now through 2018. 252 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Proprietor's Reserve
review: This restrained and well-proportioned Pinot offers subtle black cherry, mineral and loamy earth notes, with a dash of cedar, presented on a medium-bodied frame. Drink now through 2017. 219 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Proprietor's Reserve
review: Notably herbal, with dried berry, herb, sage and hints of mineral and licorice. Rich and well-balanced, gaining depth and complexity and ending with firm, supple tannins. Drink now through 2011. 393 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Beckstoffer Bourn Vineyard
review: Pure and supple, with a delicate weight and mouthfeel to the dark berry, gravel and spicy earth notes. Ends clean and refreshing, maintaining a graceful style. Drink now through 2028. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 400 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon South Australia
review: Ripe and open-textured, not especially deep or complex, but it has nice blueberry, currant and cedar flavors. Drink now through 2003. 3,000 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay South Eastern Australia
review: Soft, fruity and appealing for its melon and spice flavors. Drink now. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay South Eastern Australia
review: Simple and juicy, with refreshing pear and spice flavors on a modest frame. Drink now. 2,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz-Cabernet Australia
review: Bright and appealing for its raspberry and pepper flavors. Drink now. 8,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Australia
review: Light and soft, with pretty plum and berry flavors, finishing mildly grainy in texture. Drink now. 8,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Australia
review: Ripe and toasty, with apricot and spice flavors on a soft finish, bordering on flabby. 5,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley Dolce de Daneen Late Harvest
review: Sweet, silky and refined, a lovely dessert wine with pear, lemon pie and gentle spice flavors, lingering well. Drink now through 2010. 100 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley
review: Light and appealing for its peach, pear and subtle spice flavors, lingering gently. Drink now. 275 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley
review: A bit tart and nutty, with grapefruit pith notes on the finish. Drink now. 427 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Rich and intense, with a chewy core of earthy currant and blackberry fruit that has a nice mineral edge, with a mix of smoky oak, herb and sage. The tannins are firm but integrated. Best from 2009 through 2017. 2,152 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Rutherford Sacrashe Vineyard
review: Complex, showing a mix of dried currant, herb, sage and tobacco, with a green, cedary edge. Finishes with lively acidity and firm yet chewy tannins. Best from 2008 through 2011. 2,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Rutherford Sacrashe Vineyard
review: A firm, intense, concentrated style, with layers of mineral, sage, currant, cedar and blackberry. Admirable for its restraint and balance and tapered finish. This bottle showed better than earlier ones, which had a pronounced leathery character. Better than previously reviewed. Drink now through 2009. 1,371 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Rutherford Sacrashe Vineyard Reserve
review: A rustic, chewy style, with earthy currant, blackberry, cedar and tar, finishing with concentrated flavor along with coarse tannins. Time in the bottle may work to its advantage. Drink now through 2009. 967 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Rutherford Sacrashe Vineyard
review: Appealing for its supple texture and delicate structure. Notes of blackberry, pencil lead and cedar, with a finish that is muted by firm tannins. Drink now through 2008. 994 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Santa Cruz Mountains
review: Offers ripe plum, wild berry, cedar and mineral flavors, with touches of tobacco and road tar. Full-bodied and graceful, lingering on the finish. Supple and generous for a young Kathryn Kennedy. Best from 2012 through 2024. 400 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Santa Cruz Mountains
review: Aging beautifully. Very Bordeaux-like with its mix of mature plum, cedar and cigar box notes and firm tannins; the flavors are broad and expansive, persistent on the long finish.—2001 California Cabernet blind retrospective (June 2011). Best from 2018 through . 600 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Santa Cruz Mountains
review: Beautifully crafted. Elegant, refined and complex, with a supple, polished band of anise, currant, black cherry and toasty oak, finishing with a long stream of flavors. Best from 2002 through 2009. 1,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Santa Cruz Mountains
review: A little known Cabernet that's elegant yet powerful. Brimming with delicious black cherry and currant flavors, a touch of oak and great concentration. Firmly structured and tannic, but the fruit just keeps coming through the finish. Tempting now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Santa Cruz Mountains
review: Aging beautifully, with a healthy dark color, lots of rich currant, black cherry, chocolate and spice flavors, and a smooth, polished texture right up to the finish, where it dries ever so slightly with tannin.--1987 California Cabernet horizontal. Drink now through 2002.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Santa Cruz Mountains
review: Exhibits a firm core of cedar, currant, spice and licorice, offering a classy, Bordeaux-like expression of structure, grace and refinement. Clean on the finish. Drink now through 2024. 600 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Santa Cruz Mountains
review: A tight, tart, richly flavored wine with tightly packed currant and berry flavors and firm, rustic tannins but, on the finish, the flavors are long and true. There's a lot to like in this wine, but it needs cellaring into 2001 to 2002. 700 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Cruz Mountains Maridon Vineyard
review: Packs in a lot of attractive ripe plum, wild berry, spice and black cherry, with a smooth, supple texture and long, rich aftertaste. Best from 2000 through 2006. 180 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Santa Cruz Mountains
review: Earthy and oaky, with a potent tannin level, it is nonetheless a rich and powerful young wine that will need another three to five years minimum to show its full potential. Best after 1997. 180 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Santa Cruz Mountains Small Lot Cabernet
review: An attractive wine, yet with its pure up-front ripeness and suppleness it's also easy to enjoy, with plum and black cherry at the core. Maintains its focus and ends with subtle cedar and fresh earth notes. Drink now through 2021. 800 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc California
review: Key lime and honeydew melon flavors are ripe and tangy, with lemon thyme details on the juicy, succulent finish. Drink now. 1,100 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc California
review: The ripe, tangy peach flavors have a bright acidity and juicy punch from the lemon and grapefruit notes. Sophisticated herbal shadings and a pleasant minerality impart fresh aromas and flavors on the finish. Drink now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Santa Cruz Mountains
review: Offers aromas of red and black licorice, with spice, cedar, currant and berry notes. Enjoyable now despite the firm tannic backbone and crushed rock flavors. Drink now through 2021. 600 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Santa Cruz Mountains
review: Dry and earthy, appealing for its dried/roasted herb and dried berry flavors, which gain richness and depth on the long finish. Tannins are firm and gripping.—2002 California Cabernet blind retrospective (May 2012). Drink now through 2018. 700 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Santa Cruz Mountains
review: Austere, with a pleasant mineral and earth quality and a tight beam of currant, cherry and wild berry flavors that fan out nicely. No mistaking its tannic strength, but it's well made and balanced. Best from 2005 through 2012. 600 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Santa Cruz Mountains
review: Tight, lean and very concentrated, with a distinctive earthy, dusty blackberry flavor. Finishes with complexity and length. Best from 2001 through 2008. 700 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Santa Cruz Mountains
review: Ripe, bold flavors, with tiers of currant, herb, black cherry and oak notes, are tightly packed together, and hints of mint and tea peek through on the finish. Has good intensity and depth of flavor. Drinkable now.

name: Lateral California
review: Sleek and impeccably balanced, with a complex core of ripe currant, plum and scents of mineral, fresh earth and a hint of hazelnut. Fans of understated (and not superripe) Cabernets will find this remarkably Bordeaux-like in its restraint and elegance. Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2012. 3,800 cases made.

name: Lateral California
review: Good intensity and focus, with a creamy texture to the complex plum, anise and black cherry fruit, finishing with herb and leathery notes. Shows off lots of flavors, with a mix of Bordeaux varieties. Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon, Malbec and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2008. 1,800 cases made.

name: Lateral California
review: Rustic, with a barnyard edge to the complex leather, mushroom, currant, plum and sage flavors. Starts plush but firms up on the finish where the flavors continue to develop. Best from 2000 through 2005. 1,750 cases made.

name: Lateral California
review: Firm, focused and spicy, with generous cherry, cinnamon and raspberry flavors melding nicely on the balanced, harmonious finish. Drinkable now. 600 cases made.

name: Lateral Napa Valley
review: Presents the herbal side of dried currant, tobacco, herb and cedar. For all its tannic flex, this full-bodied red ends with a lingering, detailed finish. Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon, Malbec and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2019. 2,700 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Cruz Mountains
review: Cherry cola, raspberry and pleasant earth and mineral flavors are vibrant and spicy, picking up a distinctive peppery scent. Drink now through 2011. 300 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Cruz Mountains Maridon Vineyard
review: Distinctive for its intense and deeply concentrated white pepper, wild berry and raspberry-scented flavors. Massive tannins quickly take a gripping hold, making this one cellar bound short-term. Best from 2004 through 2012. 250 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Cruz Mountains Maridon Vineyard Reserve
review: Smooth-textured, with earthy, peppery wild berry flavors that are supple and elegant. Finishes with ripe, fleshy tannins. Drink now through 2011. 200 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Santa Cruz Mountains
review: Tight and firm, marked by loamy earth, mineral, dried currant and berry flavors that retain their earthier profile in a pleasant way. Full-bodied, with chewy, structured tannins. Drink now through 2018. 900 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Santa Cruz Mountains
review: Tight, earthy and leathery, with tar, tobacco and earthy cherry and berry-laced fruit. Firms up on the finish, where the tannins have a strong presence. Best from 2001 through 2009. 700 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Santa Cruz Mountains
review: An attractive blend of ripe plum, cherry and currant flavors. Finishes with a slightly nutty edge to the tannins. Best after 1997. 600 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Santa Cruz Mountains
review: This walks a tightrope between earthy juniper berry and peppery cherry notes. Drinkable now. 600 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Santa Cruz Mountains
review: Tight and firm, with lots of acidity and tannins. Underneath, the black cherry, currant, herb and cedary oak flavors are intense and tart. Typical of the intensity you find in many Santa Cruz Cabernets; best to cellar until 1998, but even then it may be tannic. 400 cases made.

name: Lateral California
review: Firm, focused and concentrated, with an austere, underlying foundation of rich earth, mineral and pebble, exhibiting hints of herb, dried currant and dusty, cedary oak. Finishes with drying tannins. Slightly reminiscent of Ausone. Decant. Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2011. 4,000 cases made.

name: Lateral California
review: Deliciously rich and fruity, with layers of ripe plum, cherry, currant and raspberry that have a nice smoky edge. Medium-bodied but not too tannic. Drink now. 200 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc California
review: A tangy white, offering a solid mix of lemon, lime and tangerine flavors, with accents of grapefruit zest and a mouthwatering finish. Drink now. 1,300 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc California
review: Vibrant lime, grapefruit and passion fruit notes are juicy and defined by a refreshing acidity. Kaffir lime flavors sneak in on the finish, which is just a touch coarse. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Cruz Mountains
review: Firm and peppery, with a beefy wild berry, floral and cranberry scent, it's firm and concentrated with a nice boost of acidity and tannins on the finish. Drink now through 2009. 300 cases made.

name: Lateral California
review: A dark rosé color, with earthy, floral, plum and toasty vanilla notes, turning herbal and complex, though the color is deceptively light. Drink now through 2004. 2,000 cases made.

name: Lateral California
review: Offers good ripe cherry, plum and wild berry character, turning supple and complex, with coffee, herb and cedar notes and firm, dry tannins. Drink now through 2002. 1,000 cases made.

name: Lateral California
review: Openly fruity, with jammy cherry and berry notes of medium depth and richness. Mild tannins and pleasant aftertaste. Best after 1997. 700 cases made.

name: Lateral California
review: Ripe and pleasant in flavor, with an austere bite of tannin on the finish, echoing currant, plum and tar on the full-bodied finish. A nice mouthful to try now. 50 percent Cabernet Franc, 40 percent Merlot and 10 percent Cabernet Sauvignon. 650 cases made.

name: Lateral California
review: Oaky, spicy and almost chocolaty, with a velvety texture and modest berry and dill flavors that smooth out on the finish. Drinkable now. 350 cases made.

name: Merlot Santa Cruz Mountains Serious
review: Sleek and supple, with notes of succulent cherry, cedar and fresh herb. Drink now through 2017. 300 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc California
review: Green, grassy notes up front give way to vividly crisp and clean lemon-lime, grapefruit and green apple flavors, on a light body. Drink now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc North Coast
review: Green apple and lime flavors are delicate and refreshing, with an accent of fresh thyme. Focused finish. Drink now. 1,350 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Santa Cruz Mountains
review: At a good drinking place, this is mature and firmly tannic, with youthful flavors moving toward more mature ones. The core of dusty berry and loamy earth ends up on the dry, cedary side.2005 California Cabernet blind retrospective (September 2015). Drink now. 600 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc California
review: Pleasant in a grassy, fresh herb way, with plenty of fresh and crisp flavors of green apple, lime and lemon. Drink now. 1,400 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc California
review: Tart green apple, lemon-lime and grass flavors are served up with bright intensity. Drink now. 800 cases made.

name: Lateral California
review: Tart and austere, but well-structured, with fresh earth, currant and vanilla notes and strong herbal and cedar flavors that finish with dry, dusty tannins. Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot. Best from 2009 through 2012. 4,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc California
review: Tart, with lemony notes, grapefruit and melon flavors and good acidity. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Santa Cruz Mountains
review: Simple, showing modest cedar, dried sage and mint, with dried cherry and pomegranate notes. Ends on a dry note. Drink now through 2009. 700 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Santa Cruz Mountains Small Lot
review: Dry, austere and simple, with hints of cedar, dried blueberry and sage. Drink now through 2009. 600 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Santa Cruz Mountains Small Lot Cabernet
review: Smells green and herbal, with a strong oak presence. The underlying fruit is rich and complex, but the issue is whether the oak will subside. Best from 2010 through 2016. 900 cases made.

name: Lateral Red California
review: Serves up a modest band of spicy currant and cherry before losing its intensity. Best now to 2000. 700 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Cruz Mountains
review: Smells ripe, but it's light and simple, with pepper and berry notes. Drink now. 600 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Santa Cruz Mountains
review: Austere, with a trim band of herb, mineral and tart currant flavors of modest depth. Tannic. Best from 2009 through 2014. 400 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Santa Cruz Mountains Small Lot Cabernet
review: Notably herbal and earthy, with a tarry edge to the minty earth and iodine scents that give this a rustic personality. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Lateral California
review: Pleasant cherry fruit with fennel and vanilla and a tight structure and bold, earthy tannins that turn leathery and overwhelming. Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot. Best after 2006. 3,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Santa Cruz Mountains
review: Rustic and chewy, with dried currant, sage, dill and sweet-sour soylike flavors that end up dried out.—1999 California Cabernet blind retrospective (2009). Drink now. 800 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Santa Cruz Mountains
review: Lean and tannic, with modest currant aromas and flavors that have strong tobacco and moss overtones. Drink now.

name: Syrah Santa Cruz Mountains Maridon Vineyard Reserve
review: Smells underripe, with minty camphor aromas and a dry, chalky texture, with just a hint of dried berry fruit mingling with mineral notes. Decant. Drink now through 2009. 250 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Cruz Mountains
review: Leathery, with plum flavors highlighted by firm structure and cedary oak. 400 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough Block 36 Reserve
review: Concentrated, with toasty oak framing fresh herb, spice box and tangy berry flavors. Herb-tinged tannins, mineral and cedar carry through the finish. Drink now through 2010. 370 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Marlborough Godfrey Reserve
review: Subtle, with an intriguing weave of roasted hazelnut, mineral, lemon and pear flavors. Brown butter and toasty oak notes melt through the finish. Drink now through 2008. 557 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Marlborough Single Vineyard
review: Focused and harmonious, with very good concentration to the sweet quince paste, pear and green almond notes. Finishes slightly sweet, with a hint of rose and Meyer lemon acidity. Drink now. 1,137 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough Block 36 Reserve
review: Supple and intense, with wild berry, stone and dried cherry flavors. Fresh herb, spice and cedar notes lift the aromas, and streamlined, firm tannins focus the finish. Drink now through 2010. 442 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough Block 36 Reserve
review: Tart on balance, but polished in texture, with raspberry and plum flavors that persist against earthy, spicy notes on the fine finish. Drink now through 2008. 645 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Vineyard Select
review: Offers up vibrant, balanced intensity to lime juice, baby powder and gooseberry flavors, with minerality and grassiness lingering on the finish. Drink now. 2,735 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Vineyard Select
review: Green apple and floral notes add interesting aspects to the lime and rose bush flavors, lingering nicely on the tart finish. Drink now. 2,280 cases made.

name: Merlot Marlborough 15 Rows Reserve
review: Dark and dense in color, showing lots of oak, but it's more elegant in the mouth, offering cherry and tangy spice notes that hover over the finish. Best from 2005 through 2008. 241 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Vineyard Select
review: Tart and tangy, lively with citrus, green apple and onion skin flavors, finishing with a peppery note. Drink now. 2,400 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Vineyard Select
review: Crisp, tart style offers a perfumy edge to the lime and green pear flavors. Drink now. 2,400 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Marlborough Godfrey Reserve
review: Firm lemon-rind undertones support green pear, Fuji apple and chalky stone notes. Cedary oak lingers in the finish. Drink now through 2009. 294 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Marlborough Godfrey Reserve
review: On the oaky side, but it's not clumsy, just a juicy pineapple- and lime-flavored wine with lots of toasty oak around it. Drink now through 2007. 696 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Marlborough Godfrey Reserve
review: Light and lively, with delicate citrus and peach flavors, folding in some pineapple on the finish. Drink now. 652 cases made.

name: Merlot Marlborough 15 Rows Reserve
review: Firm, with very good concentration to the fresh herb, black cherry and peat moss flavors. Solid tannins and cedary oak grip the finish. Drink now through 2009. 260 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Vineyard Select
review: Jalapeño and grass flavors frame tangy citrus notes. Drink now. 4,656 cases made.

name: Merlot Marlborough 15 Rows Reserve
review: Firm and tart, with fresh herb, green and black olive and berry flavors. Solid tannins and earthiness linger. Drink now through 2007. 247 cases made.

name: Merlot Marlborough 15 Rows Reserve
review: Firm and tart, with plum, cherry and sassafras flavors that pick up green olive and gripping leather undertones in the finish. Drink now through 2006. 295 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough Block 36 Reserve
review: Tart, with a gamy edge to the raspberry and cherry fruit, but it's short on charm. Drink now. 419 cases made.

name: Wadi Katlav Judean Hills
review: A supple-edged red, with a plump core of muddled plum, dried berry and tobacco leaf. Spicy and earthy aromas linger into the chewy finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Petit Verdot and Cabernet Franc. Kosher. Drink now. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 1,500 cases made.

name: Shiraz Coonawarra Prodigy
review: Ripe in flavor, with crisp acidity to balance the plump plum, blackberry and black pepper aromas and flavors, which linger on the sweet-spice finish. Drink now through 2010. 175 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coonawarra Odyssey
review: Deep, dark and intense, delivering a juicy core of plum, mineral and blackberry flavors, with a touch of fresh mint and tobacco. Thick and generous on the velvety finish. Drink now through 2030. 1,562 cases made.

name: Shiraz Coonawarra Prodigy
review: Supple texture, gamy flavors, with a core of blueberry and plum fruit that makes a run at the finish, sweetened with spicy oak. Drink now through 2010. 250 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coonawarra Odyssey
review: Supple, polished and generous with its blackberry, currant, mint and spice flavors that linger effortlessly on the smooth finish. Best after 2001. 900 cases made.

name: Shiraz Coonawarra Prodigy
review: Soft and ripe, this is generous with its spicy, toasted bread-accented blackberry flavors, finishing rich and supple. Drink now through 2016. 1,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coonawarra
review: Focused and supple, generous with its pretty currant and black cherry flavors, hinting at tar and herbs on the finish. Tannins are firm but not too tough. Best after 2001. 3,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coonawarra Founder's Block
review: Savory and polished, with fresh herb and spice overtones to the well-aligned berry flavors, finishing with a coffee note. Drink now through 2014. 15,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coonawarra Odyssey
review: Densely packed with minty, licorice-scented blackberry and smoke flavors, which linger on the firm, espresso-tinged finish. Needs time to emerge. Best from 2005 through 2012. 120 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coonawarra Odyssey
review: Mature and generous, its ripe black cherry and herb flavors glowing through the layers of fine-grained tannins. Flavors echo nicely on the finish. Approachable now. Best from 2000 through 2005. 3,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Coonawarra
review: Rich, ripe and powerful, dense with apple, spice and mineral flavors, echoing with buttery overtones on the solid finish. Impressive now, but may gain finesse with cellaring until 1998. 4,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Coonawarra
review: Fresh and supple, capturing a range of pretty Merlot flavors from mulberries to currants to mineral to cedar. Graceful, it finishes with smooth texture and balance. Drink now through 2002. 1,500 cases made.

name: Merlot Coonawarra Founder's Block
review: Gravelly flavors and slightly gritty tannins characterize this mature-tasting Merlot, with cherry and herb flavors making an appearance as the finish lingers. Drink now through 2014. 7,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Coonawarra Prodigy
review: Smooth, an aristocratic style that layers its cedary oak with ripe, broad plum and leather flavors, finishing with a touch of gaminess. Drink now through 2012. 72 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coonawarra
review: Lithe, lean, gentle style offers a nice balance of berry and leafy herbal flavors, the fruit persists on the supple finish. Drink now through 2009. 106 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coonawarra
review: Dense in color and flavor without a lot of weight, melding a harmonious chorus of earthy blackberry and plum notes with a mossy edge. Best from 2000 or 2002. 1,200 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coonawarra
review: A solid effort that packs plenty of black pepper-scented berry and currant flavors into a chewy frame. Has the length to warrant cellaring until 2000 or 2002.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coonawarra Odyssey
review: Has a sense of grace and refinement, an aristocratic feel to the fine-textured blueberry, plum and distinctly herbal flavors, picking up a green bean note on the extended finish. Drink now through 2012. 1,714 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coonawarra Odyssey
review: Ripe in flavor, soft in texture, with a spicy-oak note running through the broad blackberry and cedar flavors. Drink now through 2007. 160 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Coonawarra
review: Crisp in texture and extra-generous in flavor, giving a lovely mouthful of rich pear, apple and dusky, earthy notes that linger gently on the supple finish. Drink now through 2001. 3,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Coonawarra Founder's Block
review: Bright and lively, this is silky in texture, with pretty pear and floral flavors. Drink now through 2014. 1,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Coonawarra
review: Bright and lively, sporting distinctive passion fruit, pineapple and herb flavors on a racy frame. Drink now. 1,800 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coonawarra Founder's Block
review: Light and airy. A crisp green note mingles with plum and cassis flavors on a medium frame. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Coonawarra
review: Rich in texture, with barrel-fermented spice running through the butterscotch-based flavors, which echo delicately on the round finish. Drink now through 2004. 450 cases imported.

name: Merlot Coonawarra
review: Firm in texture, with a vegetal edge to the black cherry flavors, finishing with refinement. Drink now through 2014. 5,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Coonawarra
review: Smooth in texture, with green pepper and cedar notes chiming in with the basic black currant flavors. Drink now through 2004. 300 cases imported.

name: Merlot Coonawarra
review: Smooth and generous with its mint-scented cherry and earth flavors, hanging appealingly on a crisp frame, finishing with polish and elegance. Nice now, better with a little cellaring. Best after 2000.

name: Merlot Coonawarra
review: Starts off aristocratically, with elegant structure and a nice range of herb, tobacco- and chocolate-scented cherry flavors, fading a bit on the velvety finish. Best after 1998. 1,500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Coonawarra
review: A distinctively herbal Sauvignon Blanc, with rosemary and sage overtones to its green gooseberry flavors, which linger nicely. 1,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Coonawarra
review: Light and crisp, with a peppery, spicy overlay to the lemon candy flavors. Drink now. 700 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Coonawarra
review: Firm in texture and juicy in flavor, with lime-scented apple and floral aromas and flavors on a lean frame. Drink now. 100 cases imported.

name: Merlot Coonawarra
review: Has the structure and the balance, but the modest Merlot flavors never quite burst through the surface of fine tannins. May be at its best after 1997.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Coonawarra
review: Distinctly varietal, with herb, anise and apple flavors jostling for attention. Drink soon.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coonawarra
review: Lean and earthy, with beet and spice flavors, finishing with thyme and coriander notes. Drink now through 2014. 7,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coonawarra
review: Strives for elegance, but veers off to vegetal, herbal flavors. Drink now. 670 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Coonawarra
review: Bright and tangy with lime, then it gets a thwack of fresh-sawed wood, finishing with a bitter edge.   236 cases imported.

name: Syrah Coonawarra
review: Earthy, gamy flavors win out. 500 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Coonawarra
review: A strong gamy streak makes this medium-weight red a matter of personal taste. 700 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Coonawarra
review: Rather simple style with tart fruit and an herbal aroma. It's medium bodied and would work well with sea food.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: This shows tangy citrus flavors and a touch of key lime pie on a light body, highlighted by plenty of fresh herbal notes. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Tangy and refreshing, with clean and crisp flavors of lime, passion fruit and citrus, offering a focused finish. Drink now. 12,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Citrus, apple and pear notes have a touch of spice and apple blossom details, joined by a whiff of chives and a modest acidity. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Xinomavro Naoussa Averoff
review: An elegant red, with a firm backbone of acidity, offering flavors of dried cherry, sandalwood and damson plum, matched to plenty of savory notes. Fig and raspberry details show on the tannic finish. Drink now through 2020. 1,125 cases made.

name: Xinomavro Naoussa Averoff
review: Pure and refined, offering sweet cherry and spice flavors, with notes of raspberry, mineral and spice. Well-structured, showing fresh, vibrant acidity, with a lush finish of smoke, cedar and sandalwood. Drink now through 2017. 112 cases imported.

name: Péloponnèse Strofilia
review: A well-proportioned red, with concentrated flavors of graphite, dried plum and cherry, flanked by espresso notes. The firm finish of baker's chocolate has some dusty edges. Agiorgitiko, Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah. Drink now through 2018. 2,200 cases made.

name: Péloponnèse Strofilia
review: There's a concentrated mineral and leafy component to the fresh and juicy red plum and cherry flavors. The crisp finish is focused and well-structured. Agiorgitiko, Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah. Drink now through 2018. 56 cases imported.

name: Agiorgitiko Nemea Strofilia
review: Offers a meaty aroma, with plenty of peppery notes to the currant and wild plum flavors. Tightly wound, with some floral accents to the crisp, minerally finish. Drink now through 2016. 56 cases imported.

name: Greece
review: Hearty, robust red, with inky and smoky flavors, and plenty of dark, plummy notes. Spice notes linger on the finish. Cabernet Sauvignon and Aghiorghitiko. Drink now. 39,000 cases made.

name: Agiorgitiko Péloponnèse Fresco Averoff
review: Broad-shouldered, with concentrated dried cherry and red plum flavors and some wild strawberry notes. Spice-filled finish features creamy notes. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Savatiano-Roditis Vin de Pays de Centrale Gréce Fresco Averoff
review: Interesting for its mix of grapefruit, mineral and pineapple flavors. The short finish features spicy accents. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Greece Flogero
review: Inky aroma, with dried cherry and red plum flavors, which turn just a tad astringent on the finish. Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Drink now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Traminer Ioannina
review: Offers a floral aroma, with flavors to match and plenty of peach and herbal notes. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Xinomavro Naoussa
review: Rustic and rough-hewn, with dried cherry flavors and smoky notes. 2,000 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay California Gold Canyon
review: Smooth in texture and modestly proportioned, with earthy aromas, creamy, pearlike flavors and a short finish. Subtle but satisfying. 1,000 cases made.

name: Merlot California Highlands
review: An awkward wine that's hard to distinguish as Merlot, with a mix of vegetal and chocolate flavors. Thin in the middle and spicy on the finish. 1,500 cases made.

name: Emir de Nev ehir Turkey Çankaya
review: Crisp and fresh, offering floral overtones to the freshly cut apple and pear flavors. Honey and cream fill the zesty finish. Drink now. 3,000 cases imported.

name: Öküzgözü d'Elazig Turkey Yakut
review: This lively red shows juicy red plum, cherry and currant flavors. The crisp finish features raspberry and piecrust notes. Drink now. 3,000 cases imported.

name: Kalecik Karasi-Syrah Turkey Vinart
review: There's a chocolaty essence to this ripe, full-bodied red. Features lots of peppery notes along with kirsch and crushed red berry flavors, finishing with touches of slate. Drink now. 100 cases imported.

name: Syrah Turkey Egeo
review: A ripe red, showing good definition to its dark plum and cherry flavors. Mocha and dark chocolate mark the muscular finish. Drink now. 100 cases imported.

name: Kalecik Karasi Turkey
review: This red features spiced cherry and red plum flavors, with some notes of licorice and cream, which extend into the finish. Drink now. 300 cases imported.

name: Narince Turkey Tokat
review: Offers an interesting mix of almond, mineral and glazed citrus flavors that are balanced and ripe. Finishes with buttercream. Drink now. 100 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Turkey Côtes d'Avanos
review: A fruity white, with gooseberry, quince and fig flavors that give this an exotic edge. Fresh and juicy on the finish. Drink now. 50 cases imported.

name: Narince Turkey Cappadocia
review: A buttery white, with ripe pear and apricot flavors. The spicy finish features smoky notes. Drink now. 833 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Turkey Egeo
review: There are lots of quince and stone fruit flavors in this ripe white. Hints of slate mark the finish. Drink now. 100 cases imported.

name: Syrah Turkey Pendore
review: A ripe red, offering mocha and dark chocolate flavors, with some smoky notes on the finish. Drink now. 50 cases imported.

name: Bo azkere Turkey
review: A spicy style, with some flavors of chocolate-covered cherry. Turns a touch astringent on the finish. Drink now. 100 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Turkey Egeo
review: A touch stewy, with some berry and cherry flavors. Drink now. 100 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Central Otago
review: Polished, refined and beautifully focused to show off its floral blackberry fruit and pepper-cream overtones, lingering elegantly on the finish. Drink now through 2017. 272 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Central Otago Reserve
review: Crushed stone and lavender notes are distinctive. Plum and cherry flavors have some traction, with velvety tannins and persistence on the finish. Drink now through 2016. 150 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Central Otago
review: Crisp and lively, with a sweet edge to the lemon and grapefruit flavors, lingering gently. Drink now. 624 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon McLaren Vale Cuthbert Amery Vineyard
review: Broad and expressive, with a transparency to the black cherry, sassafras and floral flavors, coming together harmoniously on the finish. Has depth and a savory appeal. Best from 2018 through 2022. 502 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Block 6 Amery Vineyard
review: Firm in texture, with gritty tannins around ripe blackberry, black plum and cocoa powder flavors that persist on the expressive finish. Delivers depth and power without great weight. Best from 2018 through 2022. 797 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Block 6 Amery Vineyard
review: Peppery up front, with savory and cedar accents amid dense, gripping tannins and black licorice-scented blackberry and espresso flavors. Drink now through 2030. 300 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Block 6 Amery Vineyard
review: A firm, chewy style, this offers spicy black cherry and herb flavors wrapped in a blanket of tannins, with fruit and violet notes peeking through on the finish. Best from 2016 through 2020. 1,025 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon McLaren Vale Cuthbert Amery Vineyard
review: Generous, vibrant and distinctive, with iron and mineral notes accenting the currant and plum fruit, coming together harmoniously. Drink now through 2016. 480 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Basket Pressed Amery Vineyard
review: Narrowly focused, with juicy blackberry, black plum and licorice flavors on a lean frame, persisting against gravelly tannins. Best after 2015. 3,187 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Basket Pressed Amery Vineyard
review: Dark and spicy, with an open feel to the currant and blackberry flavors, shaded with licorice and herbal notes as the finish lingers. Drink now through 2018. 5,740 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Block 6 Amery Vineyard
review: Dark and spicy, with earthy undertones to the licorice-accented dark berry flavors, gliding to a soft finish. Drink now through 2017. 994 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Amery Vineyards Block 6
review: Has a peppery, ever so slightly bitter undertone to the ripe berry and green olive flavors, playing against fine-grained tannins on a medium-weight frame. Drink now through 2012. 200 cases imported.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Basket Pressed Amery Vineyard
review: Smooth and inviting, featuring berry and spice flavors, with a polished texture that persists into a distinctively meaty finish. Drink now through 2017. 4,300 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Hillside Amery Vineyard
review: Firm and focused, juicy with cherry, chocolate and licorice flavors that come together harmoniously, finishing with a lilt and crisp tannins. Best after 2016. 1,375 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Hillside Amery Vineyard
review: Aims for restraint, shading the blackberry and licorice flavors with hints of crème fraîche and clove, lingering gently. Drink now through 2017. 2,220 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Hillside Amery Vineyard
review: On the lean side, with savory notes around a modest core of blackberry and licorice flavors. A buzz of tannins emerges on the finish. Best after 2015. 1,455 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon McLaren Vale Cuthbert Amery Vineyard
review: Spice and tomato leaf overtones add interest to this solid red, finishing with a touch of black pepper. Drink now. 513 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale
review: Distinctive stuff. Ripe, rich and exotic, a powerful mouthful of berry, cherry and floral flavors, mixing intriguing sweet spice and peppery notes into the long finish. Drink now through 2010. 850 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Block 6
review: Polished, generous and appealing for its cascade of blackberry, plum and sweet spices that linger on the finish. Hints of chocolate and espresso as the finish sails on and on. Has miles to go. Drink now through 2015. 1,046 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Hillside
review: Polished in texture and appealing for its spicy plum and berry flavors, a stylish wine with elegance and grace, hinting at cedar and vanilla on the fine-grained finish. Drink now. 850 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon McLaren Vale
review: Rich and generous, with a whoosh of black cherry and green olive flavor that rides over juicy acidity, firm tannins backing up the long finish. Best from 2008 through 2015. 256 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon McLaren Vale
review: Rich and generous, a plump mouthful of ripe plum and licorice flavors playing against firm tannins that make the finish serious. Best from 2009 through 2014. 1,600 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon McLaren Vale
review: Soft, round and generous with its cherry and plum fruit, echoing nicely on the fine-grained, harmonious finish. Drink now through 2005. 900 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale
review: Firm, with ripe, almost dried blackberry, blueberry and spice flavors, finishing with slightly drying tannins. Needs time to soften. Best after 2007. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale
review: Bright in flavors, sturdy in structure, with perfumy blackberry and vanilla flavors that echo on a crisp finish. Drink now. 850 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Block 6
review: Very dense, with smoky, licorice-scented black fruit flavors. Firmly tannic on the finish. Needs time to settle down. Best after 2008. 200 cases imported.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Block 6
review: The flavors center on ripe blueberry and dark plum, overlaid with smoky oak, with a firm texture and fine tannins that remain polished through the finish. Best from 2006 through 2012. 1,170 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Hillside
review: Distinctive for its pickle barrel, dill and peppery grace notes around a core of black cherry and vanilla flavors, finishing firm and a bit chewy. Best from 2003 through 2010. 850 cases made.

name: Merlot McLaren Vale
review: Tart and tangy, with ripe currant, cherry and spice flavors bursting through the fine tannins on the finish. Drink now through 2003. 900 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale
review: Lithe and lively, with lovely blueberry and plum flavors that fill the mouth without becoming heavy. The fine-grained tannins add a refined structure. It does a diminuendo on the finish. Drink now through 2010. 2,500 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Block 6
review: A gamy character gets in the way of the ripe plum and floral flavors in this firm-textured red. The finish has enough richness to strike a balance. Best after 2008. 1,400 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Hillside
review: On the crisp side, with an earthy edge to the olive and dried berry flavors, persisting on the lively finish. Best after 2007. 800 cases imported.

name: Shiraz-Mourvèdre-Grenache McLaren Vale
review: On the light side, with pretty blueberry and plum aromas and flavors shaded delicately with a touch of vanilla cream. Drink now through 2004. 126 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon McLaren Vale
review: Plump, ripe style, offering generous currant and plum flavors, finishing with a smoky note and firm tannins. Drink now through 2007. 500 cases imported.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Hillside
review: Bright and chewy, with an earthy edge to the blackberry and white pepper flavors. Drink now. 4,280 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Hillside
review: Earthy, gamy flavors get stronger with each sip, taking this down for me.   2,554 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale
review: Extremely earthy and vegetal. 500 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Yamhill-Carlton District Marsh Estate Vineyard
review: Light, sleek and refreshing, this polished style features a tight bead of pear and apple fruit. Shows intensity and finesse. Drink now through 2015. 190 cases made.

name: Öküzgözü Elazig Vintage Single Vineyard Collectible Series #5
review: Well-meshed and balanced, with polished tannins and a subtle note of smoke underscoring the gushy black currant and sun-dried black cherry fruit and licorice and date flavors. Drink now through 2019. 725 cases made.

name: Öküzgözü-Bogazkere Elazig Buzbag Rezerv
review: Hints of spice and bacon fat accent this medium-bodied red, offering lightly grippy tannins and subtle flavors of black cherry, black currant, grilled thyme and gumdrop. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Urla-Thrace Imperial
review: A medium-bodied red, with light tannins and hints of graphite and smoky earth mixing with dried currant, anise and herb notes. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Öküzgözü Elazig
review: A ripe red, redolent of black currant and marzipan. The tannic finish is well-spiced, with dark chocolate notes.  Drink now. 350 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma County Ashton Vineyard
review: Young, tight and tannic, with a distinct, mintlike edge to the cherry and berry flavors. Best to give it a year or two of cellaring to soften. 175 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Carneros Boonfly's Hill
review: Deliciously complex, rich and layered, with a mix of fig, apricot, spice and smoky, toasty oak, all fanning out to subtle nuances and ending with a wonderful finish. Drink now through 2014. 90 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Carneros Primo's Hill
review: Enticing aromas of fresh earth and new oak lead to a supple mix of red and black fruit that's fresh and lively, gaining depth and persistence on the finish. Drink now through 2022. 125 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Carneros Primo's Hill
review: Delivers a tight, focused beam of dried berry, roasted herb, sage and black cherry flavors that toe a tight line from start to finish, ending with an aftertaste of berry and crushed rock. Drink now through 2019. 153 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Carneros Boon Fly's Hill
review: Offering a fruit bowl of aromas and flavors, this is ripe, intense, pure and focused, picking up a cedar-hazelnut-nutmeg touch on the finish that ends with an intriguing anise twist. Drink now through 2018. 227 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Carneros Primo's Hill
review: Well-made, striking a pleasant balance between ripe plum, black cherry, smoke and herbal flavors. Full-bodied and fleshy, unfolding to reveal extra nuances, with a touch of rhubarb on the finish. Drink now through 2017. 210 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Carneros Primo's Hill
