review: Dark and rich for the vintage, with ripe plum, black cherry, floral and spice notes, turning meaty and herbal, with a complex aftertaste. A new brand from Peter Molnar and Michael Terrien, winemaker for Acacia. Drink now through 2006. 150 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Carneros Boon Fly's Hill
review: Intense and vibrant, full-bodied, with firm, tight notes of spice, citrus, pear and subtle hazelnut, gaining depth on the finish. Drink now through 2015. 92 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Carneros Primo's Hill
review: Firm and focused, with a toasty, spicy cedar edge and trim berry, cherry and currant flavors. There's a hint of fragrant citrus peel, mineral and tobacco, giving it some sophistication. Drink now through 2016. 198 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Carneros Primo's Hill
review: A spice bomb, rich and tightly wound, with black cherry, ripe raspberry and vanilla flavors that offer good depth, with coffee-scented tannins that are firm and drying. Drink now through 2008. 550 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Carneros Boon Fly's Hill
review: Elegant and stylish, this light- to medium-weight Chardonnay offers subtle touches of peach, spice and honeydew melon. Drink now. 187 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Carneros Primo's Hill
review: Earthy, bordering on barnyardy, with dry, loamy herb, dried berry, sage and cedary oak flavors. Drink now through 2011. 230 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Carneros Primo's Hill
review: A bit sweaty and earthy, lean and funky, seemingly robbed of its fruit. 1,183 cases made.

name: Red Paso Robles
review: An eccentric blend that's a pleasure to drink, offering boysenberry and black licorice aromas and zesty dried cherry, sassafras and roasted herb flavors. Syrah and Merlot. Drink now through 2018. 450 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Oregon
review: Zesty, bright and floral, with an aroma of carnations mingling with the apple and melon flavors, finishing a bit crisp. Drink now. 100 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma Valley Montecillo Vineyard
review: This intense Zin is loaded with personality, offering bold black cherry and licorice aromas and briary plum, espresso and roasted herb flavors wrapped in firm tannins. Best after 2014. 175 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Rutherford Beckstoffer Georges III
review: Rustic and rough around the edges, featuring a chunky core of dark berry, crushed rock and subtle earth, with spicy scents. There's plenty here to chew on. Drink now through 2023. 100 cases made.

name: Petite Sirah Rockpile
review: Chewy and rustic, with thick espresso, cream soda, blackberry jam and toasted coconut notes. The flavors and tannins both pack a wallop, but there's plenty of personality lingering on the finish. Drink now through 2026. 100 cases made.

name: Petite Sirah Rockpile
review: The wild blackberry and strawberry flavors are tightly wound with dense, drying tannins. The details of toffee, tobacco, dried anise and espresso give plenty of reason to go in for another sip. Drink now through 2018. 100 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Buchignani Vineyard
review: Zesty and spicy, with aromas of raspberry and underbrush leading to straightforward flavors of black cherry, mint and cracked pepper. Drink now through 2022. 365 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma Valley Montecillo Vineyard
review: The berry pie aromas lead to soft black cherry, caramel and spice flavors. Drink now through 2017. 200 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Buchignani Vineyard
review: Zesty if rustic, with spicy cherry aromas and flavors that focus on dried sage and underbrush. Drink now through 2017. 330 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Rutherford Beckstoffer Georges III
review: Doesn't quite commit to ripe, rich flavors, preferring a more structured minerality, with dried herb and savory notes. Leaves you hoping for a touch more ripeness. Drink now through 2018. 341 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Buchignani Vineyard
review: A bit muddled, with raspberry, spice and herb notes. Drink now. 225 cases made.

name: Petite Sirah Rockpile
review: Drying tannins and herbal flavors overshadow the trim berry and cherry notes, with a pepper and mineral edge. Drink now. 205 cases made.

name: Merlot Sonoma Valley
review: Offers modest cherry, cedar and herb notes. Drink now. 336 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Buchignani Vineyard
review: Offers briary cherry and spice notes and rustic, dusty tannins. Drink now. 275 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma Valley Montecillo Vineyard
review: Lean and quite herbal, with notes of cherry and cedar. Drink now through 2016. 190 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma Valley Montecillo Vineyard
review: Dried out, with savory herb and mineral notes. Sound but unexciting. Drink now through 2017. 223 cases made.

name: Charmat New Yo
review: Kosher. A sweet, simple sparkling wine with floral, bubble-gum aromas, and sugary, bananalike flavors. Probably best mixed with orange juice.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley
review: Has a streak of wildness, with lots of spice, dried blueberry and currant aromas that are rich and focused, picking up complex herb, tea and orange zest, ending with a pretty perfumed edge. Gains body on the finish. Drink now through 2012. 143 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley
review: Supple, graceful and fleshy, with subtle, spice-laced cola, berry, cedar and black tea flavors. Medium-weight, ending with lingering spicy notes. Drink now through 2018. 225 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley
review: Supple flavors of plum and black cherry have a spicy, minty edge in this medium- to full-bodied red, which shows a good tannic backbone, and a complex finish. Drink now through 2018. 250 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley
review: Pure, ripe black cherry and raspberry fruit form the core. Full-bodied, complex, focused and delicate, picking up spice and cola notes on the finish. Drink now through 2013. 243 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Knights Valley
review: Lots of rich, complex flavors--layers of fig, vanilla, toasty oak and apricot--fan out, turning polished and elegant. Drink now through 2005. 280 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Buena Tierra Vineyard
review: Vibrant, with rich, lively, detailed flavors built around spicy pear, citrus, honeysuckle and fig. Finishes with a long, complex aftertaste and pretty, smoky oak nuances. Drink now through 2007. 212 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley
review: Smooth, rich and creamy, with lots of pretty ripe pear, spice, vanilla, honeysuckle and hazelnut flavors. Gains complexity and depth, maintaining a sense of elegance and finesse. Drink now through 2006. 210 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Buena Tierra Vineyard
review: Rich and creamy, with a complex array of spice, fig, apricot and vanilla, with those flavors fanning out smoothly on the palate, ending with an elegant aftertaste. Drink now through 2007. 210 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Ritchie Vineyard
review: Wonderful richness, polish and finesse, with creamy oak leading to a tasty mix of ripe pear, apricot and fig flavors, ending with subtle hazelnut and cedary oak notes and a touch of smoke and vanilla. Drink now. 123 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Poplar Vineyard
review: Rich and complex, both refined and elegant and offering ripe, lively pear, fig and honeysuckle, finishing with a flash of toasty oak. Drink now through 2007. 192 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Alexander Valley
review: Ripe and elegant, with an earthy, tarry edge to the plummy, pruny Zinfandel flavors. Finishes with supple tannins and good length. Drink now through 2002. 390 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Knights Valley
review: A modestly proportioned, ripe and complex wine with layers of pear, spice and light toasty oak. An elegant, understated style that drinks well now. 207 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley
review: A delicate style, with medium-bodied cherry, raspberry and strawberry notes that are elegant and fleshy, with just the right amount of acidity and tannin. Drink now. 820 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley
review: Supple and harmonious, with smooth-textured cherry, vanilla and anise-scented flavors. Mild tannins. Drink now through 2006. 780 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley
review: A solid dose of charry oak leads the spicy cherry, cola and berry flavors. Opens up after a little while, but keeps its oaky character. Drink now through 2005. 780 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley
review: Well oaked, with an elegant band of spicy cherry and plum flavors. Well balanced. Finishes with soft tannins and good length. New from Eugenia Keegan, formerly of Bouchaine Vineyards. 244 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley
review: Hints of leather, earth, charcoal and stewed plum are presented in a supple, elegant package that ultimately leaves you wishing for a shade more fruit complexity. Drink now. 425 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley
review: A bit funky, with earthy, leathery flavors presiding over modest green plum and tealike notes. Turns dry on the finish. Drink now through 2005 . 988 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley
review: Simple, with a modest band of dried cherry, oak, spice and vanilla, turning dry and leathery on the finish. Best soon. 425 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley E-Block
review: Light scents of cherry and berry are framed by cedary oak and subtle earthy notes that turn simple and fade on the finish. Drink now. 190 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills Reserve
review: Chewy tannins clamp down on modest blackberry flavors, a hint of gaminess working through the firm finish. Best after 2018. 196 cases made.

name: Syrah Cochise County Three Sisters
review: This has a heady ripeness, with dark blackberry compote, plum sauce and blueberry preserves notes, but there's a lacing of mesquite and singed vanilla that lends texture and length on the finish, keeping this honest. Drink now. 539 cases made.

name: Syrah Cochise County Three Sisters
review: Quite ripe, with boysenberry, fig paste and currant confiture notes woven with licorice snap and espresso notes. Stays nice and creamy through the smoke-tinged finish. Almost heady in the end, but pulls it off. Drink now. 971 cases made.

name: Viognier Cochise County Best Friends
review: Ripe and broad, but with good cut, as star anise, dried pineapple and white peach flavors fill out through the juicy finish. Very tasty. Drink now. 55 cases made.

name: Partners Cochise County
review: Ripe, fleshy and smoky, with mulled fig, plum sauce and spice bread notes liberally laced with black tea and roasted vanilla bean. A touch shy on focus in the end, but with good range. Grenache, Syrah, and Mourvèdre. Drink now. 264 cases made.

name: Shiraz Cochise County Keeling Brothers
review: Quite ripe and a touch heady, with raisin, dark plum, prune and cocoa notes framed by mocha and spice. Plush in feel, but perhaps a touch extreme in style for some tastes. Drink now. 42 cases made.

name: Shiraz Cochise County Keeling Brothers
review: This is dark and toasty, with raisin, roasted plum and fig jam flavors liberally coated with a roasted vanilla note. Drink now. 72 cases made.

name: Syrah Cochise County Home Place Reserve
review: This sports fig, prune and plum notes along with fruitcake and toasted raisin notes. Plush and mouthfilling, but a touch shy on freshness and purity. Drink now. 96 cases made.

name: Syrah Cochise County Three Sisters
review: This has heft, with baker's chocolate, plum, prune and ample roasted wood notes, but there's good flesh and polish, with enough definition on the finish for balance. Drink now. 431 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Cochise County Best Friends
review: Juicy and fresh, showing open-knit apple, pear and peach notes liberally laced with a buttery note. Drink now. 76 cases made.

name: Grenache Cochise County Two Reds
review: Lively, with raspberry and mulled cherry fruit flavors laced with spice and incense notes. A touch jammy on the finish, but stays supple enough. Drink now. 631 cases made.

name: Shiraz Cochise County Keeling Brothers
review: Rather overt style, with thickly layered plum, prune and blackberry jam notes, liberally framed with roasted spice and toast. A touch heady in the end, but may have some fans. Drink now. 44 cases made.

name: Syrah Cochise County Home Place Reserve
review: A dark, toasty style, with lots of cocoa and espresso notes leading the way for the core of plum sauce and melted licorice. The thick, toasty edge reasserts itself quickly on the finish, leaving a somewhat heavy-handed feel in the end. Drink now. 47 cases made.

name: Syrah Cochise County Home Place Reserve
review: Mature, with soft raisin, cinnamon, baked plum and licorice notes held together by a toasty frame. Drink now. 72 cases made.

name: Turtle Creek Caldera Cochise County
review: A late-harvest style, offering ripe blueberry, chocolate-covered blackberry and raisin toast notes, with the raisined edge lingering on the lightly firm finish. Syrah. Drink now. 101 cases made.

name: Partners Cochise County
review: Ripe and friendly, with a mix of blueberry and raisin notes laced with a pain d'épices note, but turning a touch airy in the end. Grenache, Syrah, Mourvèdre and Petite Syrah. Drink now. 485 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Concentrated and rich, with enough tannin to dictate a few years in the cellar. Plum, anise, black cherry, smoke and vanilla in great intensity, structure and length. Wonderful character and depth.

name: Merlot Napa Valley
review: High in extract and tannin, this richly textured Merlot has lots of gutsy flavors. You get cherry, tobacco and plummy flavors that are deep and structured.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Intense, deep, rich and concentrated, with a satiny texture and layers of smoke, plum, black currant and olive flavors that are full-bodied and long on the finish. Drinkable now. 3,395 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Elegant and intense, with pretty pear, spice, and oak flavors, a silky texture and excellent tension between fruit and acidity. Quite complex honey and butterscotch notes sneak in on the finish. Drink now to 1993. 4,000 cases made.

name: Mernet Reserve Napa Valley
review: Brawny and austere, with a formidable tannic backbone and loads of blackberry, black cherry, herb and black olive flavors. Concentration lingers, along with cedar and vanilla notes from toasty oak. Firm tannins will benefit from short-term cellaring. Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Best from 2004 through 2012. 300 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley
review: Tightly wound, with a firm concentration of plum, currant, cherry and spice flavors, flanked by firm tannins and structure with toasty oak and the kind of aftertaste that brings you back for a second and third glass. Alluring now but can age up to a decade. Best in about 1994.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: A big, zesty wine that's loaded with spice, toasted nuts, creamy tropical fruit and plenty of distinctive oak, plus it has the balance and complexity to pull it off. Drink now through 2008. 1,850 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Ripe, rich and intensely flavored, offering plenty of smoky, toasty oak, blackberry, black cherry and green olive. Herbal notes linger, along with concentrated fruit and burly tannins, on the finish. Drink now through 2011. 3,300 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Tart and crisp lemon, grapefruit and hints of pear, an elegant and refined style that finishes in a fruity aftertaste. 2,025 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley
review: Deftly balanced, with smoke, blackberry, black currant and herbal notes are ripe and concentrated, with firm tannin that carries through a lingering finish nicely accented by toasty oak. Drink now through 2007. 2,460 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley
review: Lean, rich and concentrated, with pretty herb, raspberry, currant and spicy Merlot flavors that are impeccably balanced and framed by toasty oak and firm tannins. Drink now to 1995.

name: Merlot Napa Valley Vintners Selection
review: Smooth and polished, with a lovely vanilla and spice edge to the polished currant and blackberry flavors. Finishes as strong as it starts. Gets a little tannic on the aftertaste, suggesting that optimum drinking should be around 1995 to '97. 475 cases made.

name: Merlot Spring Mountain District Mailbox Vineyard Reserve
review: Dense and firmly built, yet has a sense of style and plushness. Aromas of red currant, sage and spicy mocha lead to lingering flavors of plum and dried herb. Drink now through 2015. 330 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Austere, with a crisp, concentrated band of earthy currant, cedar, tar and spicy flavors. Acidity and tannins dominate on the finish. Best from 2000 through 2007. 2,590 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Big, intense and powerful, a tannic wine with the flavor behind it to balance it; although some felt it was too tannic.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Spring Mountain District Hillside Estate
review: Flavors are multitiered and complex, showing black currant, cassis, anise and herbs. Tannins are a bit rustic. Best from 2000 through 2004. 2,095 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Rich and smoky, with toasty oak flavors that add dimension and depth to the ripe pear and apple notes.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Lean and crisp, with bracing acidity and tart lemon, pineapple, peach and vanilla flavors that are clean and refreshing. Relies more on subtlety than power. Drink now.

name: Merlot Napa Valley
review: Supple and concentrated plum, mineral and cassis notes are framed by fine-grained tannins. The flavors soar on the finish. Drink now through 2003. 3,262 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley
review: Young and tight, with a firm band of earthy currant, sage, mineral, cedar and spice. Finishes with chewy tannins and a twinge of bitterness; best to cellar short-term. One of the better Keenan Merlots of late. 2,500 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley Carneros
review: Concentrated, with very good depth to black currant, cherry and wild berry flavors. Firm, herbal structure and cedary oak fold into an intense finish. Drink now through 2007. 485 cases made.

name: Mernet Reserve Napa Valley
review: Firm and sleek, with a tight band of black cherry, currant and touches of cedary oak flavors. Solid structure grips the finish, but the fruit flavors push through. Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Drink now through 2007. 300 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Currant, cherry and plum flavors start supple, with generous cedary oak and herb accents and gripping tannins on the finish. Drink now through 2010. 3,290 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Fragrant and chewy, with currant, toasty oak, fresh herb and subtle lavender and violet nuances. Nicely focused through the solid tannin of the finish. Drink now through 2007. 2,450 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Very firm and tart, with sharp berry and toast aromas and flavors supported by crisp acidity and a minimum of tannin. Showed much more richness and complexity from the barrel, before bottling. 2,800 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Tasted from magnum. Tastes raw and intense, high in acidity and tannin, with ripe, chewy, rugged plum, currant, earth, cedar and tarry flavors that finish with chewy tannins. This wine isn't fading, so further cellaring might help; a curious wine that seems suspended in time.--1979 California Cabernet retrospective. Drink now through 2005. 2,950 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Compact, crisp and minerally, with citrus, pear and mild oak notes that linger on the finish. Needs time to unfold. Best from 2000 through 2003. 1,823 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Crisp and clean, with attractive earthy pear, citrus and spice flavors and a lingering finish. Can stand short-term cellaring; try through 2001. 2,300 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley
review: Concentrated and dense, with black currant and tobacco aromas and flavors, finishing with ripe and firm tannins. Best after 2007. 3,475 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley
review: Chewy but flavorful, showing plenty of smoke and berry flavors that linger on the tight finish. Needs until 2000 to soften.

name: Merlot Napa Valley
review: Smooth and harmonious, with a supple band of ripe cherry, currant and vanilla flavors. Nice sense of balance and proportion, although the tannins are quite assertive on the finish. 2,700 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley Carneros
review: Dense tobacco, roasted herb, tar, and sea salt notes mingle with plum and tart currant flavors, with rustic and chewy tannins. Drink now through 2008. 500 cases made.

name: Merlot Spring Mountain District Reserve
review: Firm, with very good intensity to fresh herb, green olive and black currant tones, accented by cedary oak and tart, solid structure. Drink now through 2007. 276 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: With a strong mint and menthol streak, this has more character than most, tending toward earthy flavors over fruit. Best from 1997. 1,850 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Aromatic and flavorful, with more currant and berry flavors than most '88s. Turns a little tannic and tight on the finish, but is a generous wine from start to finish. Best after 1995.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: A clean, well-balanced streamlined effort, with leaf, green fig and touches of nutmeg and cedar, before tapering off. Drink now. 1,920 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Marked by a ripe pear and pineapple edge, it hits a few sour notes along the way but holds its balance before finishing with a earthy note. 2,160 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Plenty of intense, attractive pear and apple flavors, but it's hard and lean, straightforward and not offering much finesse or complexity. May gain with bottle time.

name: Merlot Napa Valley
review: Cedar, black licorice and currant flavors have good depth, with firm structure and lingering herbal notes. Drink now through 2007. 2,340 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley
review: Firm, with currant, herb and leather notes wrapped within dry tannins. Drink now through 2003. 2,175 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Lean and lively, with sharply focused lemon and grapefruit flavors to balance a serious component of fresh oak that extends into the long finish. 4,800 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley
review: Firm and tight, with gritty tannins, but also has enough ripe plum, blueberry and cherry flavors that turn supple and smooth. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Tight and firm with a narrow band of plum, currant and leathery, earthy flavors. Austere in style with dry, crisp tannins, it's best to cellar until 1995 for it to soften. 3,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Spring Mountain District Reserve
review: Distinctively smoky and charry, with a green twang to the cherry and plum flavors, which are intense, tannic and drying. Drink now through 2012. 280 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: One-dimensional, with pleasant citrus, oak and spice flavors. Drink now. 1,690 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Curious. A bit musty, with tart citrus, pear and grassy flavors. Drink now. 1,560 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: A solid effort, with ripe lemon and pear flavors that turn spicy from oak. Balanced, flavorful and drinkable now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley Hillside
review: A juicy wine with spicy citrus, grapefruit and tart pear notes that finish crisply. 1,750 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley
review: Firm and a bit austere, showing trim bands of currant, tea and herb flavors, but what stands out is the crispness and acidity. 2,500 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley
review: A tough, chewy, tannic young wine that isn't showing much in the way of fruit. Earthy, leathery flavors bite down on the finish. It's hard to predict where this is headed, but it could use time to settle down and hopefully evolve to a point where it offers more fruit. 1,900 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley
review: Lots of weedy, tobacco flavors but some lovely plum, too with anise and spicy oak. It's an elegant style that gets tart and woody on the finish.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: A tight, lean, compact 1987 with plenty of oak and spicy pear flavor that is attractive for its concentration and depth. Give it until 1990, then it may be better.

name: Merlot Napa Valley
review: A rough-hewn wine, with hard oak and tannins overshadowing the currant and berry notes. Time may soften the edges, but for now it's a gamble to age. Drink now. 3,150 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Hard, lean and tangy with spicy oak flavors and ripe currant and plummy flavors that get oaky on the finish. Well balanced and not too tannic.

name: Zinfandel Napa Valley
review: Muddled, with a stemmy, tannic edge to the moderately ripe cherry and berry. Turns dry and austere. 100 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: True to form, this smells attractive, but is chunky and clumsy on the palate, with hard, oaky Cabernet flavors. Might be more palatable with food, but a difficult wine to love.--1978 California Cabernet horizontal.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley Hillside
review: A bit brackish, with a strong earthy, leesy edge, finishing with a metallic note, little fruit. 150 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley
review: Lean and dry, with plum and cedar aromas and dry cherry, mineral and leather flavors that finish with chewy tannins. 2,020 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley Ann's Vineyard
review: Tart, lean and austere, with crisp citrus, green apple and rather simple flavors. Lacks body and finesse.

name: Mernet Reserve Napa Valley
review: A tight, dense style with firm tannins wrapped around a core of earthy currant, cedar, tar and a sour, stemmy finish that leaves a mouthpuckering sensation. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc. 280 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Hard-edged and leathery with a young, green streak to the currant and cedar flavors. Aggressive tannins are unpleasant. 2,349 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley
review: Shows funky aromas and earthy, bitter flavors. 4,070 cases made.

name: Merlot Spring Mountain District Mailbox Vineyard Reserve
review: Coarse and earthy, with plum and mineral aromas, dry, bitter flavors and chewy tannins. 300 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Smells stinky and sour, void of fresh fruit. 850 cases made.

name: Syrah Stellenbosch
review: A dark, engaging, juicy style, with lots of blackberry, bramble, crushed plum and singed anise notes. This is layered with toast and espresso, displaying drive and sharp definition through to the mouthfilling finish. Drink now through 2016. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 130 cases made.

name: Syrah Stellenbosch Steepside
review: Lush and layered, with warm plum, boysenberry and blackberry compote notes stretched out over melted licorice and ganache flavors. The long, spice-infused finish lets the fruit drip slowly. A hedonist's delight. Drink now through 2020. 72 cases made.

name: Terrasse Stellenbosch
review: This bristles with quinine, mirabelle plum, blanched almond and lemon pith notes, while crackling acidity runs underneath. Rich melon and yellow apple details fill in through the finish, adding bass to match the treble. Chenin Blanc, Viognier, Sauvignon Blanc and Chardonnay. Drink now through 2019. 625 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch Riverside
review: A friendly, creamy style, with white peach, quince and yellow apple fruit flavors gliding through, backed by a salted butter edge on the finish. This has some depth and seems likely to unwind a bit more with modest cellaring. Drink now through 2018. 48 cases made.

name: Syrah Stellenbosch
review: A ripe, lush style, with warm raspberry, boysenberry and blackberry confiture flavors gushing forth, backed by black licorice and singed apple wood notes. Has the spine for balance, but this is aimed at the fruit-bomb crowd. Drink now through 2020. 466 cases made.

name: Syrah Stellenbosch
review: A dark, structured style, with charcoal and espresso framing the core of black Mission fig, boysenberry and black currant fruit. Offers a note of singed apple wood and a whiff of anise on the finish, which has ample grip. Drink now through 2016. 130 cases made.

name: Terrasse Stellenbosch
review: Lush, opulent and inviting, offering creamed peach, melon and heather notes lined with toasted hazelnut and warm pie-crust accents. Stays focused and defined, with a long, alluring finish. Chenin Blanc, Chardonnay, Sauvignon Blanc and Viognier. Drink now through 2014. 145 cases made.

name: Fleurfontein Stellenbosch
review: Lovely dried apricot, nectarine and peach flavors are carried by lively acidity, despite the overall unctuous feel, while candied ginger and honey notes fill in on the finish. A delicious dessert wine. Drink now through 2018. 82 cases made.

name: Stellenbosch
review: This fleshy red shows a roasted edge to the mix of tobacco, currant, blackberry and alder notes, melding through the slightly grainy, mature finish, where a backdrop of sage and savory awaits. Displays fine range and character, though this is a bit burly overall. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2015. 112 cases made.

name: Syrah Stellenbosch
review: A ripe, lush style, with lots of layered fig sauce, crushed plum and boysenberry confiture flavors, intertwined with hints of warm cocoa, singed anise and fruitcake. Rock-solid. Drink now through 2016. 285 cases made.

name: Terrasse Stellenbosch
review: Offers a ripe, rounded feel, with creamed melon, lemon shortbread and white ginger notes forming the core and leading to a long, verbena-filled finish. Modestly toasted in the end, allowing the fruit to win out easily. Chenin Blanc, Sauvignon Blanc, Chardonnay and Viognier. Drink now through 2018. 350 cases made.

name: Terrasse Stellenbosch
review: A plump, lightly toasted style, with a modest piecrust frame around the creamed yellow apple, heather honey and pineapple notes. Offers a lush, flattering finish. Chenin Blanc, Chardonnay, Viognier and Sauvignon Blanc. Drink now. 790 cases made.

name: Terrasse Stellenbosch
review: This sports brioche and creamed peach notes, but has nice cut and definition. Tightly beaded acidity and lively green almond and apple notes cut through the finish. Chenin Blanc, Chardonnay and Viognier. Drink now. 144 cases made.

name: Stellenbosch
review: A dark, toasty style, with coffee and roasted cedar notes framing a core of steeped black currant and blackberry fruit flavors. Tobacco and charcoal edges underscore the slightly chewy finish. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Petit Verdot, Malbec and Syrah. Drink now through 2017. 488 cases made.

name: Terrasse Stellenbosch
review: A flattering style, with white ginger, piecrust and salted butter notes weaving around a core of white peach and creamed yellow apple fruit. The rounded finish lets the butter accent linger. Chenin Blanc, Chardonnay, Sauvignon Blanc and Viognier. Drink now. 275 cases made.

name: Stellenbosch
review: Slightly rugged style, with bittersweet cocoa, leather and olive notes running along the edges of dried currant and mulled plum flavors. Leathery edge hangs on the finish. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Syrah. Drink now. 200 cases made.

name: Stellenbosch
review: Dark, showing a mouthfilling core of damson plum, blackberry and loganberry fruit, laced with a faint herb note, all pushed by ample spicy toast on the finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Syrah. Drink now. 108 cases made.

name: Merlot Stellenbosch
review: Soft, with a lightly smoky frame around mature notes of mulled currant and cherry fruit, and hints of dried mint and sage. Ends with a sous-bois echo. Drink now. 283 cases made.

name: Stellenbosch
review: Maturing, with sage and mulled spice notes starting to lead the way for a core of blackberry and black currant fruit. A toasty, lightly raisined edge marks the finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Syrah. Drink now. 112 cases made.

name: Fleurfontein Stellenbosch
review: Soft and open-knit, with brioche, pineapple and white peach flavors that lose a little focus on the finish. Sauvignon Blanc and Chenin Blanc. Drink now. 46 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Graacher Himmelreich
review: Ripe and creamy, with herbal notes gracing the peach and apple flavors. Well-integrated and lightweight, with a mouthwatering finish. Drink now through 2012.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: A real stunner, rich and plush, with layers of plum, currant, blackberry, raspberry and subtle mocha notes. The pure fleshiness of the texture is admirable, sustaining the flavors on a long, layered finish that keeps pumping out fruit. Drink now through 2028. 965 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Opens with lavish, seductive vanilla bean and mocha-scented oak notes, blending nicely with a core of rich dark berry, licorice and roasted coffee, gliding along smoothly and ending with a long, elegant finish. The fruit rides the oak in an engaging style. Best from 2017 through 2027. 600 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yountville
review: Beautifully crafted, focused on a core of black licorice and mocha-tinged blackberry, with currant and wild berry details. Tightly focused, pure and persistent through the finish. The tannins are well-integrated and the finish sails on gracefully.2004 California Cabernet blind retrospective (August 2014). Drink now through 2028. 230 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Centered on a tight, structured mix of dark berry, currant, licorice and spicy, cedary oak that casts touches of mocha and herb. Intense without being weighty, this is balanced, persistent and well done. Drink now through 2030. 1,013 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yountville
review: A rich, creamy style, with a pleasant touch of vanilla- and mocha-laced oak. Underneath, the dark berry, dried herb, cedar and spice flavors are balanced and well-knit, maintaining focus through the long finish. Drink now through 2024. 375 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yountville
review: Rich and notably herbal, with a firm core of dried currant, loamy earth, roasted herb and tobacco flavors, ending with tannins that are ripe and gripping. Best from 2014 through 2025. 785 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yountville
review: Smooth-textured, with luxurious fruit purity weaving together a supple mix of dusty blackberry and wild berry, light loamy earth, subtle cedar and, most convincingly, the graceful exit touching on tea and herb notes and turning to satin.2006 California Cabernet blind retrospective (December 2015). Drink now through 2022. 500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yountville
review: Aromas of roasted herb, sage, dried berry, cedar and cigar box give this full-bodied red a nice Bordeaux-like scent. Turns detailed midpalate, ending with a minerally edge. Best from 2013 through 2021. 500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yountville
review: Broad and expressive, with a tasty range of vanilla- and mocha-laced currant and blackberry flavors, turning supple midpalate without losing muscle or tannic flex.--Blind 2007 California Cabernet retrospective (January 2017). Drink now through 2024. 650 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley
review: Spicy, with honeysuckle, vanilla bean and nutmeg accents to the apricot and peach core. There's a savory, saline grace note on the finish, and plenty of acidity to keep the flavors fresh and vibrant. Drink now. 210 cases made.

name: Syrah Napa Valley Page-Nord Vineyard
review: This has wonderful intensity, depth and structure, offering taut, mineral- and pebble-laced dried berry and currant flavors, with blueberry, shoe polish, sage and underbrush notes, yet the finish features a mix of berries and mineral. Drink now through 2018. 273 cases made.

name: Inspirado Napa Valley
review: Combines richness with depth and elegance, offering a refined mix of red and dark berry, anise, mocha and cedary oak notes. Long, lingering finish. Drink now through 2026. 624 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley
review: Rich, offering lanolin and toast accents to the lemon curd and marmalade flavors. Luscious in texture, with a juicy finish. Spice and dried honeysuckle details linger. Drink now. 406 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Tightly wound, with firm snappy tannins throughout, framing the ripe dark berry, mocha, cedar and licorice notes. Should come around well, boasting fresh, lively acidity and lingering flavors. Drink now through 2023. 360 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley
review: Aromatic and delicate, displaying notes of apple blossom, slate, spicy Meyer lemon, nectarine, tangerine and dried mango. This is lovely for its finesse and refreshing acidity. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Syrah Napa Valley Page-Nord Vineyard
review: Rustic and gutsy, dense and chewy, with pebble-laced tannins wrapped around dried berry, cedar and tobacco, ending with a dash of mocha. Needs time. Best from 2013 through 2024. 280 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yountville
review: Solid and persistent, with a rich mix of dark berry, mocha, espresso and dried herb flavors, this is still edgy from tannins. Holding for now, but hasn't gained.2005 California Cabernet blind retrospective (September 2015). Drink now through 2018. 850 cases made.

name: Inspirado Napa Valley
review: From a cooler vintage, the flavors tilt toward tobacco, herb and dried berry. Clean and balanced, with firm tannins and good length. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Petit Verdot and Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2024. 425 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley
review: Toasted coconut and vanilla bean notes impart a rich, smooth character to the pear and peach flavors. Offers juicy acidity and a spicy finish. Drink now. 374 cases made.

name: Syrah Napa Valley Page-Nord Vineyard
review: Rough-hewn, dense and chewy, with meaty, peppery dried berry, roasted herb, sage, cedar and mineral flavors. Full-bodied, yet loses its velocity on the finish. Best from 2013 through 2020. 280 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Oro
review: The core of dark berry, spice, plum and blackberry flavors is slow to unfold, offering a glimpse of mocha and tobacco on the finish. Drink now through 2028. 50 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yountville
review: Savory aromas of herb, tea and red currant, with tobacco, sage, dusty berry and light oak. Complex and balanced. Better than previously reviewed. Drink now through 2011. 200 cases made.

name: Robola of Cephalonia San Gerassimo
review: Lush and ripe, with apple tart and white cherry flavors. Beeswax and salted almond notes appear in the mix, complemented by some minty accents. Finishes with a hint of celery salt. Drink now through 2016. 2,000 cases made.

name: Viognier South Eastern Australia Per Diem Bloodhorse
review: Lively, fragrant and generous with its floral, pear and grapefruit flavors, finishing with a smooth edge to the raw fruit. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Sémillon Hunter Valley
review: Light, tart, a zingy young wine with lime, mint and floral aromas and flavors, showing some length. Needs time to fill out. Best after 2011. 800 cases made.

name: Per Diem South Australia
review: Light and fragrant, with a slightly earthy note weaving through the transparent raspberry flavors. Grenache, Mataro and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2010. 1,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Hunter Valley Kester
review: Gamy flavors predominate in this earthy red, offering just enough red berry character to keep it honest. Drink now through 2011. 500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Oakville
review: Firm, with chunky currant, spice, leather and earth notes that are focused and concentrated, finishing with a rustic edge and chewy tannins, but plenty of authenticity. Winery formerly called Kelham MacLean. Drink now through 2008. 2,232 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Oakville Reserve
review: Sleek and well-balanced, with appealing red cherry, blackberry and currant flavors that are rich and focused, finishing with chewy, rustic tannins and cedary oak flavors. Winery formerly Kelham MacLean. Drink now through 2007. 260 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Oakville Reserve
review: Firm and spicy, with good depth to tobacco, leather, blackberry and chocolate flavors. Toasty oak and solid tannins underscore the finish. Drink now through 2007. 325 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Oakville
review: Dominated by toasty oak flavors of vanilla and cream, with overtones of pineapple, pear and tangy lemon. Drink now. 1,160 cases made.

name: Merlot Oakville
review: Intense earthy, leathery flavors are more prominent than the currant and plum flavors underneath. Bitter notes on the aftertaste. Drink now. 450 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Oakville
review: Crisp and refreshing, with clean, polished, elegant grapefruit, passion fruit, tangerine and tart peach flavors. Wonderful balance and finesse tame the grape's aggressive tendencies. Drink now through 2002. 1,625 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Oakville
review: Shows pronounced citrus and white bean flavors carry through the tart finish. Drink now. 920 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley Block 21
review: Refreshing, offering a good mix of lemon, lime and quince flavors, with a medium body and crisp acidity. Drink now. 390 cases made.

name: Riesling Trockenbeerenauslese Gold Cap Rheinhessen
review: Superthick and intense, featuring passion fruit, apricot, orange and honey aromas and flavors married to a racy structure. It's impressive and packed with personality, turning just a bit cloying on the finish. Still, a classic TBA. Drink now through 2025. 25 cases made.

name: Riesling Trockenbeerenauslese Rheinhessen Dalsheimer Hubacker
review: Very spicy, like a Scheurebe, appealing for its exotic tropical fruit component, silky texture and impeccable balance. Concentrated and delicate at the same time, with a long, fresh finish. Drink now through 2030. 5 cases imported.

name: Riesling Trockenbeerenauslese Rheinhessen Westhofener Morstein
review: A big, rich TBA, packed with apricot, orange and honey notes underscored by a latent acidity. More powerful than the Dalsheimer Hubacker and perhaps longer-lived, but I prefer the finesse of its sibling. Drink now through 2035. 5 cases imported.

name: Riesling Auslese Gold Cap*** Rheinhessen Westhofener Morstein
review: This is sweet and bracing at once, bookending its apricot, passion fruit and grapefruit notes. Botrytis adds spice and exotic accents. All the elements are there, but they need time to mesh. Fine length. Best from 2008 through 2025.

name: Riesling Auslese*** Rheinhessen Dalsheimer Hubacker
review: Very concentrated, yet light as a feather, this paradox features apricot, pineapple, passion fruit and mineral notes. An intense, live-wire Riesling auslese--so intense it's drying on the finish, so give it a year or two to settle down. Endless finish.  Best from 2006 through 2025. 120 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Gold Cap*** Rheinhessen Dalsheimer Hubacker
review: This has an edge of botrytis to it, lending both a pungent element and an ethereal quality due to the concentrated acidity. Apricot, orange and honey notes ride the incisive structure to a long, lingering finish. A racy style for '03. Drink now through 2025. 10 cases imported.

name: Riesling Trockenbeerenauslese Gold Cap Rheinhessen Westhofener Kirchspiel
review: Harmony is the hallmark of this opulent, well-integrated TBA. Lemon candy, apricot, honey and spice notes mingle and the concentration is offset by its lively structure. Terrific length and seamless from start to finish. Drink now through 2040. 24 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast Precioso
review: A rich, elegant, stylish wine that shows how refined and delicate Chardonnay can be, offering subtle pear, hazelnut, honey, floral and spice notes that are supple and tightly focused. Drink now through 2011. 24 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Gold Cap*** Rheinhessen Dalsheimer Hubacker
review: This is concentrated and lush, sporting apricot and passion fruit flavors. The sweetness seems to be covering the structure now, but the acidity is present and well-integrated. Nice grapefruit tang on the finish. Best from 2008 through 2030. 85 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Rheinhessen Dalsheimer Hubacker
review: A rich, juicy auslese, evoking passion fruit, apricot and vanilla custard flavors. It's forward, yet with an intensity and length that belies its extroverted personality. Long apricot aftertaste. Drink now through 2025.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast La Cruz Vineyard
review: What a treat. Ultrarich and creamy, with layers of complex fig, apricot, vanilla and nutmeg, turning smooth and polished, finishing in a rich, full-bodied aftertaste. Drink now through 2006. 855 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast La Cruz Vineyard
review: Deep, with rich, well-defined blueberry and raspberry flavors that are floral-scented, spicy and layered, ending with fine-grained, black tea-laced tannins. Drink now through 2021. 1,189 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Rheinhessen Dalsheimer Hubacker (AP 42)
review: Very intense, with some botrytis lending concentration and exotic, honeyed character to this apricot and passion fruit-flavored white. There's a vibrant structure and apparent weightlessness, despite its richness. Drink now through 2020. 5 cases imported.

name: Riesling Auslese Rheinhessen Dalsheimer Hubacker (AP 42)
review: Though showing extra concentration and intensity, this apricot- and grapefruit-infused Riesling is still lightweight and open-textured. The acidity sticks out now, so be patient with this baby. Best from 2005 through 2020. 120 cases made.

name: Riesling Beerenauslese Rheinhessen PIUS
review: Very pure and elegant, this BA combines pear, peach and quince notes with a delicate structure. Though concentrated, it remains balanced and graceful through the long finish. Drink now through 2025. 5 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast La Cruz Vineyard
review: Firm and concentrated, this wine exhibits a vibrant core of ripe pear, cream, hazelnut and nutmeg flavors that fold together nicely, holding a tight focus and finishing with a long beam of ripe, juicy, lively fruit. Another excellent offering from this up-and-coming winery. Drink now through 2008. 2,042 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast El Coro
review: Finds the balance between restraint and fleshy ripe cherry, plum, and currant flavors. Smooth and silky, with spice box, clove and tobacco flavors mingle with mineral nuances and a long, detailed finish. Drink now through 2014. 309 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Precioso
review: Strikingly elegant and graceful, with delicate raspberry and black cherry notes that tiptoe on the palate, offering red candy and red licorice accents, maintaining a supple, refined texture and understated aromas. Drink now through 2020. 46 cases made.

name: Rôtie Sonoma Coast
review: A stylish Rhône-style blend, offering classy aromas and flavors, with roasted dark berry, hot brick, gravelly earth, spice, dried herb, leather and tobacco notes. The finish sails on, picking up game and roasted herb nuances, ending with firm, fine-grained tannins. Syrah and Viognier. Drink now through 2022. 429 cases made.

name: Rieslaner Trockenbeerenauslese Gold Cap Rheinhessen Monsheimer Silberberg
review: Thick and mouthcoating, with apricot, pear, spice and honey flavors wrapped around a racy structure. Drink now through 2006.

name: Riesling Auslese Rheinhessen Dalsheimer Hubacker (AP 23)
review: Light and open-knit, evoking peach, grapefruit and mineral aromas and flavors that seemingly float across the palate, held in relief only by the firm structure. Lovely, lingering finish. Drink now through 2015. 300 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Rheinhessen Dalsheimer Hubacker (AP 41)
review: Like drinking a fruit cocktail. This tasty Riesling presents a mix of tropical fruit, citrus and mineral in a smooth, yet fresh, profile. It's balanced and seamless, with concentrated flavors that linger nicely on the aftertaste. Drink now through 2020. 5 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast La Cruz Vineyard
review: Intense, with a tight, flinty core of peach, mineral, nectarine and nectarine pit flavors. Medium- to full-bodied, focused and persistent, with a long, vibrant, lingering finish. Should reward cellaring. Drink now through 2018. 507 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast Oro De Plata
review: Intense, with ripe, vibrant, zesty fruit flavors built around ripe nectarine, tangerine, lemony citrus and grapefruit, but it's the acidity that keeps the flavors dancing. Drink now through 2008. 653 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Precioso
review: Delicate, with elegant ripe cranberry and black cherry flavors that show spice and floral scents. Gains momentum, finishing with fine-grained tannins. Best from 2013 through 2023. 50 cases made.

name: Rôtie Sonoma Coast
review: Focused and elegantly complex, with raspberry and rose petal aromas and balanced flavors of blueberry, anise and spice that linger. Syrah and Viognier. Drink now through 2025. 547 cases made.

name: Riesling Eiswein Gold Cap Rheinhessen Dalsheimer Hubacker
review: Terrific. Thick and intense, with apricot, grapefruit and orange peel notes, all supported by racy acidity. Drink now through 2008.

name: Riesling Spätlese Gold Cap Rheinhessen Dalsheimer Hubacker 26
review: This bursts with tropical fruit, citrus and mineral nuances allied to a rich, creamy texture. It's underscored by a lively structure, lingering on the finish. Drink now through 2018. 250 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Rheinhessen Dalsheimer Hubacker
review: Tangy, this evokes the soils where it is grown, offering plenty of mineral, grapefruit and pineapple notes on a slim, lively frame. Well-defined and balanced, with a lingering aftertaste. Drink now through 2018. 50 cases imported.

name: Riesling Spätlese Rheinhessen Dalsheimer Hubacker
review: A supple, creamy version, densely flavored with herbs and vanilla custard and laced with minerals on the finish. In an elegant style, but not as racy as some in this category. Drink now through 2012. 400 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast La Cruz Vineyard
review: Understated, presenting green apple and honeydew flavors, with a dash of hazelnut-tinged oak adding a teasing edge. Gains depth on the finish. Drink now through 2019. 496 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast La Cruz Vineyard
review: Seductive honeysuckle and floral scents join ripe pear, green fig and honeydew melon flavors in this smooth, tapered, elegant effort, all leading to a delicate, layered finish. Drink now through 2017. 774 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast La Cruz Vineyard
review: Serves up a mix of ripe, mature pear, citrus, hazelnut and cedary oak flavors that fan out on the palate, offering concentration and depth, with a spicy cream and anise aftertaste. Drink now through 2009. 2,254 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast La Cruz Vineyard
review: The fruit stars in this sleek, refreshing wine, with a beam of green apple, melon, lemon and light hazelnut shadings, gaining complexity on a long, layered finish. Drink now. 2,859 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast Precioso
review: Ripe, subtle pear, melon and citrus notes are fragrant and delicate, picking up a nice touch of light toasty-cedary oak on the finish. Drink now through 2014. 97 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast La Cruz Vineyard
review: Intense and focused, with a tight, firm beam of black cherry and blackberry flavors that offer hints of violets, exotic spices and mineral flavors, finishing with a nice tension between the acidity, fruit and tannins. Drink now through 2008. 755 cases made.

name: Rôtie Sonoma Coast
review: This blend shows subtle power, offering aromas of smoky blueberry and mineral, with complex, sleek flavors of raspberry, cracked pepper and grilled herb that gain momentum on the finish. Syrah and Viognier. Drink now through 2022. 465 cases made.

name: Rieslaner Beerenauslese Rheinhessen Monsheimer Silberberg
review: Unctuous, yet bright and focused, full of apricot and orange aromas and flavors. Balanced, it ends with a clean finish. Drink now through 2005.

name: Riesling Auslese Rheinhessen Dalsheimer Hubacker
review: Sweet and lissome, this auslese bursts with concentrated apricot, nectarine and lime flavors on a vibrant structure. Drink now through 2006.

name: Riesling Kabinett Rheinhessen
review: Aromatic, succulent and silky, this hits all the high points, showing peach, lime and slate notes, with terrific balance and purity. Capped by a long, tangy finish. Drink now through 2015. 150 cases imported.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Rheinhessen Kirschspiel
review: Bone-dry and tangy, with apricot, peach and floral notes giving way to the firm structure. Fine density and persistence, with a lingering finish. Drink now through 2008. 10 cases imported.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Rheinhessen Morstein
review: Ripe, full-bodied and round, this nonetheless has good acidity focusing the peach, grapefruit and mineral notes. Open and accessible, with a long finish. Drink now through 2008. 10 cases imported.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Dalsheim Hubacker
review: Enticing aromas of flowers, passion fruit and apricot mark this intense, elegant white. Dry, it has a lively structure and very good concentration. Fine mouthwatering finish. Drink now through 2012.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen G-Max
review: Passion fruit, mango, apricot and grapefruit aromas and flavors mingle in this full-bodied, dry white. It's tangy and concentrated, with a rich middle and long, citrusy finish. Drink now through 2012. 125 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Westhofen Kirchspiel
review: Lovely aromas of pineapple, passion fruit and nectarine introduce this delicate, dry white. It's vibrant and tangy, with a grapefruit peel note on the mouthwatering finish. Drink now through 2012. 800 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Gold Cap Rheinhessen Dalsheimer Hubacker
review: Rich and on the sweeter side of spätlese, with a snappy, light-bodied structure supporting the peach, lime and mineral notes. Give it some time to harmonize. Drink now through 2015. 250 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Rheinhessen Dalsheimer Hubacker
review: Bright passion fruit, grapefruit and dusty stone notes are corralled by racy acidity in this elegant, intense white. It shows fine clarity and a long, mineral-tinged finish. Drink now through 2018. 335 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast La Cruz Vineyard
review: Fresh, intense and vibrant, with snappy citrus, green apple, fig and melon flavors that are full-bodied, elegant and stylish. Drink now through 2014. 806 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast La Cruz Vineyard
review: Lots of everything rolled into this ripe, rich, oaky style, with opulent pear, fig and apricot flavors, framed by smoky, toasty oak, making it a big mouthful of flavorful wine. Drink now through 2006. 1,200 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast Oro De Plata
review: Offers an understated mix of chalky mineral, green apple, white peach and honeydew melon flavors, lingering pleasantly on the finish. Drink now through 2019. 514 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast Oro De Plata
review: Trim and focused, intense and lively, with subtle citrus, green apple and honeydew melon flavors that are pure and lingering. Drink now through 2012. 2,425 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast Precioso
review: Fragrant floral scents and elegant white peach and honeydew melon form the core flavors in this stylish effort. Delicate finish. Drink now through 2019. 50 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast El Coro
review: Marked by dusty, savory wild berry, cherry and anise flavors, this is firm, clean and focused, with a lively finish supported by tannins and acidity, giving this a cleansing quality. Drink now through 2024. 422 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast El Coro
review: Elegant and refined, with ripe, firm, high-toned cherry and berry fruit supported by fine-grain tannins and a spicy, earthy finish. Drink now through 2021. 308 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast La Cruz Vineyard
review: Medium-weight and centered on delicate wilted rose, cherry, watermelon and raspberry flavors. The toasty oak adds a nice dimension. Drink now through 2020. 816 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast La Cruz Vineyard
review: Offers aromas of cola, herb and tea, with more cherry Pinot fruit on the palate. Intense, focused, persistent and elegant, with a spicy aftertaste. Drink now through 2010. 3,800 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Precioso
review: A fragrant, delicate style, with understated blackberry, spice, cedar and crushed rock notes. Ends in a pleasingly restrained manner, revealing a subtle aftertaste. Drink now through 2020. 70 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Rheinhessen Dalsheimer Hubacker (AP 25)
review: Shy in aroma, yet sweet and juicy on the palate, with forward, appealing notes of apricot and grapefruit. Drink now through 2003.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast La Cruz Vineyard
review: Young, raw and pithy, with a woodsy, cedary edge. Tannic and pithy for now but should mellow with time, allowing the core flavors of citrus, nectarine and tangerine to soften. Drink now. 1,080 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast La Cruz Vineyard
review: Intense and still raw in texture, with a woody edge. The core of green apple, pear and citrus flavors is fresh and pithy. A good bet to gain with time. Drink now. 818 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast La Cruz Vineyard
review: Well-proportioned, with a mix of citrus, green apple, floral and spice notes, showing touches of toasty vanilla and cedary oak, all well-focused. Ends with a leesy, citrusy aftertaste. Drink now through 2020. 635 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast La Cruz Vineyard
review: Elegantly styled, with a rich core of honeysuckle, melon, spice, subtle pear and apple. Ends with clean earth and citrus shadings. Drink now through 2017. 785 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast Oro De Plata
review: Offers aromas of pithy citrus skin and lychee nut, with white peach and nectarine notes. Drink now. 836 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast Oro De Plata
review: Delivers a fresh, clean beam of apple and honeydew flavors, shaded by zingy acidity and a pithy, citrusy texture. Drink now. 811 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast Oro De Plata
review: Fresh and lively, with a pithy citrus peel edge to the lemon, grapefruit and white peach notes. Maintains focus, ending pure and clean. Drink now through 2020. 759 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast Oro De Plata
review: Clean and refreshing, with ripe, vibrant peach, nectarine and melon flavors that have a slight pithy edge. Ends with a return to the white peach freshness. Drink now through 2010. 2,800 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast Oro De Plata
review: Refreshingly crisp and flinty, with the emphasis on vivid fruit flavors. It exhibits lively grapefruit, green pear and spicy floral notes that are deceptively concentrated. Drink now through 2010. 1,900 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast El Coro
review: Firm, fine-grained tannins are evident from the start, with dusty berry, cedar, anise and dried herb flavors that are pleasing now and should gain, but the dryness of the tannins is a concern. Drink now through 2020. 396 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast El Coro
review: Offers a tight core of spice, earth and cola-laced red berry, with touches of anise, herb and light cedar. Drink now through 2022. 350 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast El Coro
review: Firm and moderately rich, with full-bodied plum, spice, raspberry and floral scents, ending with mild tannins and fading on the finish. Drink now through 2019. 368 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast El Coro
review: A ripe, opulent style, with juicy cherry, raspberry and floral scents, ending with a touch of spice and licorice. Drink now through 2019. 465 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast El Coro
review: Supple and fleshy, with ripe, pretty plum, black cherry and raspberry notes. Medium-bodied, this gains traction on the finish, returning to its subtle aftertaste. Drink now through 2018. 199 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast La Cruz Vineyard
review: Vibrant and elegant, centered on cherry, watermelon and light raspberry notes that are fresh and lively, ending with fine-grained tannins. Drink now through 2022. 1,116 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast La Cruz Vineyard
review: Offers light spice, plum and violet scents, with pure, firm black licorice notes. Medium-weight, well-proportioned and persistent, if on a modest scale. Drink now through 2019. 677 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast La Cruz Vineyard
review: A graceful, elegant style, with medium-weight cherry, plum, spice and tea notes. Soothing finish. Drink now through 2018. 908 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast La Cruz Vineyard
review: A fragrant, delicate style, medium-bodied, featuring pleasant earth, ripe cherry and plum notes that have a sweet edge. Ends with pebbly tannins. Drink now through 2015. 510 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast La Cruz Vineyard
review: Loamy earth, forest floor and dried cherry fruit give this a decadent edge. Intense and well-proportioned, ending on a delicate note. Drink now through 2011. 2,452 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast La Cruz Vineyard
review: Firm and concentrated, with a tight band of spicy, earthy black cherry and blackberry fruit that turns to red plum jam. Firm tannins on the finish give the flavors structure and detail. Drink now through 2009. 2,223 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Precioso
review: Offering a subtle mix of plum and cherry, with jazzy toasty oak nuances, this exhibits a delicate balance, with touches of cedar, anise and mineral on the finish. Drink now through 2022. 69 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Precioso
review: Sharply focused on a beam of black cherry and strawberry fruit. Lively acidity gives the fruit a mouthwatering sensation, picking up a hint of blueberry. Drink now through 2011. 219 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Precioso
review: An elegant style, spicy and floral, with dried berry, black cherry and hints of cedar, anise and sage that are clean and vibrant. Drink now through 2012. 24 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Precioso
review: Tightly wound, this is framed by firm tannins and taut cola, cherry, spice and cedar notes. Needs aeration. Best from 2008 through 2012. 23 cases made.

name: Rosé Sonoma Coast
review: Delicate and pretty, with cherry blossom aromas and soft flavors of peach, vanilla and raspberry. Drink now. 148 cases made.

name: Rôtie Sonoma Coast
review: Very dense and concentrated, with big, aggressive and persistent tannins dominating the snappy blackberry, graphite and cedary notes. Syrah and Viognier. Drink now through 2026. 400 cases made.

name: Syrah Sonoma Coast La Cruz Vineyard
review: Distinctive for its smoky, baconlike meatiness, this firm red shows dried berry, mineral, cedar and underbrush flavors. Full-bodied, complete and complex, yet tight and in need of cellaring and decanting. Best from 2013 through 2023. 139 cases made.

name: Syrah Sonoma Coast La Cruz Vineyard
review: At points elegant and rustic, with mineral, dried herb, sage, dried berry and savory notes that are full-bodied. Maintains its loamy earth profile. Drink now through 2017. 308 cases made.

name: Syrah Sonoma Coast La Cruz Vineyard
review: Sleek, with a lean mix of dried berry, mineral, black cherry and dusty sage notes that end with a lively mix of fresh fruit flavors. Drink now through 2011. 800 cases made.

name: Riesling QbA Rheinhessen
review: A tasty Riesling, balanced and vibrant, exhibiting apricot, lime and mineral flavors, all displayed in a lightweight profile. Good, lingering finish. Drink now through 2006. 850 cases made.

name: Riesling QbA Trocken Rheinhessen von der Fels
review: Plenty of mineral, lime and grapefruit flavors highlight this firm, focused Riesling. It's dry and lingers nicely on the finish. Drink now through 2006. 800 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Rheinhessen G-Max
review: Deeply colored and delicately flavored, with floral, peach and mineral notes supported by a lively structure. Rich and ample, showing harmony and length. Drink now through 2009. 20 cases imported.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen G-Max
review: Very ripe in aroma, followed by talcum powder, peach and floral flavors in a firm, yet balanced, medium-bodied presentation. It maintains a sense of harmony and fruit throughout. Drink now through 2008. 110 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Trocken Rheinhessen Westhofen Morstein
review: Spicy and rich, on an elegant frame, this dry Riesling offers grapefruit, white pepper and stone flavors. Tactile finish. Drink now through 2009.

name: Riesling Spätlese Gold Cap Rheinhessen Westhofener Kirchspiel
review: This is zingy, with a laserlike structure focusing the grapefruit and pine forest notes. It's very tight now and balanced on the acidic side, yet has enough richness too. Best from 2008 through 2018.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast La Cruz Vineyard
review: Lemony citrus aromas and firm flavors of lemon and pear are intense and a bit raw, but the fruit flavors push through on the finish. Cellar short term. Drink now through 2009. 3,038 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast Oro De Plata
review: Medium-weight, with a lime-citrus and green apple core. Clean, fresh and vibrant. Drink now through 2017. 698 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast Oro De Plata
review: Floral geranium scents fold into ripe pear and melon notes that are full-bodied and layered, as this relies on its loamy earthiness as the core flavor. Drink now through 2016. 704 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast Oro De Plata
review: Refreshing, with a complex mix of ripe pear, citrus and nectarine fruit that is lively and complex, ending with a creamy mix of ripe fruit and hazelnut-tinged oak. Drink now. 960 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Sonoma Coast La Cruz Vineyard
review: Apple and melon flavors are smooth and supple, with details of white flowers and lemon zest that are softly juicy. Drink now. 286 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Sonoma Coast La Cruz Vineyard
review: Round and refreshing, offering yellow apple, mandarin orange, fig and lemon zest notes, with a very spicy finish. Drink now. 284 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Sonoma Coast La Cruz Vineyard
review: Smooth and elegant, with soft acidity and pretty pear, apple and citrus notes, finishing with a pleasant touch of almond skin. Drink now. 338 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Sonoma Coast La Cruz Vineyard
review: Crisp and a bit pithy, with a medley of citrus, melon and a hint of vanilla. A very pleasing, straightforward style that leaves your mouth watering for another sip. Drink now. 490 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast La Cruz Vineyard
review: Taut, with a core of dusty, savory berry, anise, sage and underbrush. Offers modest complexity and depth now, though this is well-built and will gain with time. Drink now through 2022. 728 cases made.

name: Syrah Sonoma Coast La Cruz Vineyard
review: Firm, rich, vibrant and full-bodied, with a grainy mineral edge to the ripe cherry and wild berry fruit, ending with chewy, earthy tannins. Drink now through 2015. 788 cases made.

name: Syrah Sonoma Coast La Cruz Vineyard
review: Taut, with a firm band of juicy blackberry, huckleberry and wild berry fruit, supported by chewy tannins and enlivened by crisp acidity. Ends with a cleansing aftertaste. Best from 2007 through 2011. 371 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Rheinhessen Hubacker
review: Shows a strong mineral component, with apple and vanilla pastry flavors. Starts out rich but turns shy in the end. Drink now. 10 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast La Cruz Vineyard
review: A subtle, delicate style that offers light citrus, green apple and cedary oak, with hints of mineral and spice. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Sonoma Coast La Cruz Vineyard
review: A richer, fuller expression of Pinot Gris, featuring ripe peach, apricot and pear flavors that have a lushness to them, with spicy details and enough acidity to keep the flavors fresh. Drink now. 303 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Sonoma Coast La Cruz Vineyard
review: A lean and refreshing style, with bright Meyer lemon and apple flavors, light body, steely notes and crisp acidity that persists on the finish. Drink now. 434 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast La Cruz Vineyard
review: Firm, even grainy tannins give this traction, and the plum and cherry flavors are ripe and appealing, if ultimately simple. Drink now through 2019. 377 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast La Cruz Vineyard
review: Earth and mushroom aromas have a restrained, stemmy edge, giving this a dry, tannic backbone. Concentrated and backward, it's tough going right now, though the hints of cherry and wild berry offer complexity and depth. Best from 2006 through 2011. 1,200 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Sonoma Coast La Cruz Vineyard
review: Melon, pear and nectarine flavors are broad, with a slightly coarse acidity and a touch of dried pineapple on the finish. Drink now. 420 cases made.

name: Casa Sonoma Coast
review: Offers modest notes of tart plum, herb and mineral. Syrah, Carignane and Grenache. Drink now through 2023. 891 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast La Cruz Vineyard
review: Marked by a cherry-strawberry-rhubarb pie flavor, this is elegant and delicate, if a bit dilute on the finish. Drink now through 2010. 2,940 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast Precioso
review: Tastes mature, with rich fig, melon, toasty oak, citrus and tangerine flavors that end with a woody toothpick finish. Drink now. 18 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Sonoma Coast La Cruz Vineyard
review: Melon, peach and mineral flavors are tasty and intense, with an herbal edge and juicy acidity. Drink now. 329 cases made.

name: Syrah Sonoma Coast La Cruz Vineyard
review: A bit trim, with earthy wild berry and raspberry fruit that comes up simple. Drink now. 907 cases made.

name: Napa Valley
review: Marked by a strong, herbal, spicy bell pepper note that tilts toward tomato and underbrush flavors. The texture is supple, but the finish turns gritty. Best to decant and enjoy soon. Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Drink now through 2024. 443 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: A powerful expression of Cabernet, built with torque to the dense dark berry, loamy earth, mocha, espresso, dried herb and cedary notes. This fans out, gaining depth and dimension, ending with an intriguing interplay of flavors and texture. Drink now through 2026. 722 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: A mouthful of pleasure, with a core of rich, supple blackberry, mocha, currant, exotic spice and light cedar flavors, all deftly proportioned and sharply focused. Most pleasing on the finish, where the flavors sail on. Drink now through 2024. 997 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: A seductive style that's firm, intense and concentrated. Tight and focused, with a core of minty currant, blackberry and wild berry fruit, framed by rich, earthy and chewy tannins. Best from 2009 through 2015. 500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Shows exquisite balance, with supple black cherry, plum and currant fruit that's elegant, refined and focused. Finishes with ripe, fine-grained tannins and the right dose of acidity. Drink now through 2012. 300 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley
review: Crisp and clean, showing plenty of intensity to the bright lemon, lemongrass, lime and grapefruit flavors, with flinty, gunmetal overtones and a refreshing finish. Drink now. 1,092 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: A touch racy, with more dusty, cedary oak and gravelly earth notes than pure fruit flavors, a tannic rusticity carrying through the finish. Drink now through 2027. 900 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Offers a broad, rich array of blackberry, wild berry, anise and red licorice that is intense and potent. Ragged around the edges, with chewy tannins, but pulls together on the finish. Drink now through 2026. 920 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley
review: Light and lithe, but packs a punch of passion fruit and lemon-lime flavors, with a bright acidity on the finish. Drink now. 875 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley
review: Citrus and peach flavors have a toasty edge, and hay and chamomile details emerg on the spicy finish, with firm acidity. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Dry and savory, with charry herb, dried currant, nutmeg and hazelnut flavors, giving this a woodsy texture and flavor. Best from 2010 through 2015. 700 cases made.

name: Meritage Napa Valley
review: Offers ripe, spicy currant and cedary, toasty oak, with well-integrated tannins. Medium weight. While thoroughly enjoyable, it's modest compared with the top '97s, lacking their richness, depth and complexity. Drink now through 2006. 150 cases made.

name: Chardonnay South Eastern Australia
review: Soft and easygoing, with spicy pear flavors. Drink now. 23,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Carneros Unfiltered
review: Soft and light in texture and flavor, but what it has is awfully appealing, especially the plum and currant flavors that linger on the finish, hinting at spice and toast. Drinkable now.

name: Chardonnay Hawkes Bay
review: This one has a panoply of character on a lithe, refined frame, offering pear, anise, mint and citrus notes in profusion, as the flavors echo on the long finish. Drink now through 2005. 1,992 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Hawkes Bay
review: Ripe and round, a lovely mouthful of peach, vanilla and tropical fruit flavors that echo on the finish. Not a big wine, it's light and gentle. Drink now through 2002. 2,650 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Hawkes Bay
review: Soft and round, with spicy peach and smoke flavors swirling nicely across an open, airy frame. The spicy flavors linger nicely on the finish. Drink now through 2005. 3,250 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Hawkes Bay
review: Bright and fruity, with pear and passion fruit at the core. Finishes with pretty touches of vanilla and spice, all of which linger effortlessly on the finish. Drink now. 4,600 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Hawkes Bay The Vista
review: Crisp and silky, with grapefruit, lime and mineral flavors that hover convincingly on the light finish. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Hawkes Bay The Distinction
review: Aromatic and fleshy, with very good concentration to peach, honeysuckle and apricot flavors underscored by cinnamon spicy oak and gravel nuances. Lemony acidity keeps it lively. Drink now through 2009. 547 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Hawkes Bay
review: Has pretty Gewürz aromas and flavors, with a streak of honey running through the modestly sweet pineapple and pear, finishing with a touch of rose petal. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Hawkes Bay
review: Crisp and lively, with peppery lime and green apple aromas and flavors, finishing with a distinctive touch of green olive and citrus. Drink now. 1,534 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Hawkes Bay
review: Fragrant and dry, appealing for its generous pear, litchi and tropical fruit aromas and flavors, finishing soft and almost delicate. Drink now. 600 cases made.

name: Merlot Hawkes Bay
review: Ripe and generous, a silky-textured mouthful of pretty blackberry and currant, finishing generous and smooth, with more than a hint of spicy oak. Drink now through 2001. 1,100 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Hawkes Bay
review: Bright and juicy, with green pea-tinged lime and green pineapple flavors, lingering on the relatively gentle finish. Drink now. 6,150 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Hawkes Bay
review: Soft and round, with herbal pear and mineral flavors, finishing smoothly with a touch of spicy vanilla. Drink now. 7,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Hawkes Bay
review: Bright and peppery, with a metallic twang to the lively citrus and apple fruit. Drink now. 2,500 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Hawkes Bay
review: Polished in texture, zingy in flavor, offering citrus, pineapple and herb notes on a supple frame. Drink now. 1,130 cases made.

name: Sémillon Hawkes Bay The Distinction
review: Tart and intense, with bracing lemon-lime acidity framing wax, quince and green pear flavors. Drink now through 2007. 785 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Hawkes Bay
review: Melds lemony tanginess with green pear, tart apple and fig flavors. Intensity carries through a vibrant finish. Drink now through 2006. 8,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Hawkes Bay The Distinction
review: Smoky, toasty style has a rich texture and a touch of bitterness on the creamy finish. Drink now through 2008. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Hawkes Bay The Vista
review: Yellow apple, quince, grass and scallion flavors have very good concentration. Drink now. 3,560 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Hawkes Bay The Distinction
review: Serves up good depth to pear, quince and vanilla flavors, with lingering lemony acidity. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Hawkes Bay
review: Ripe and concentrated, firmly tannic, with a vegetal edge reminiscent of tomatoes, weaving through the black cherry and smoke flavors. Best from 2002 through 2006. 2,424 cases made.

name: Merlot Hawkes Bay The Distinction
review: Leathery flavors underscore herb, black pepper and tangy berry tones. Drink now through 2007. 6,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Hawkes Bay The Distinction
review: Yellow apple, green pear and lemon rind flavors have good depth. Drink now. 564 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Hawkes Bay The Reserve
review: Smells ripe, tastes tangy, with a tart edge to the classic Zin flavors of raspberries and a slightly green, peppery edge. Drink now through 2007. 1,400 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Hawkes Bay
review: Has more polish than most Kiwi Sauvignons, but a bit less flavor as well, with pretty apple and herb notes. Drink now. 600 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Cucamonga Valley Lopez Ranch
review: Medium-weight, with blackberry, earth and spice flavors that linger on the soft finish, adding mild tannins. Drink now. 9,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel California Mad
