review: Shows a narrow range of tart blackberry and boysenberry flavors, turning lean with a minty edge. Drink now. 7,500 cases made.

name: Zinfandel California Mad
review: Simple but refreshing, with a bright acidity and strawberry and spice notes. Drink now. 6,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel California Mad Zin
review: Black cherry and spicy oak flavors, with a tart edge. Drink now. 7,360 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sta. Rita Hills
review: Richly spiced and filled with plush red fruit flavors wrapped inside suave tannins. This offers a complex mix of dried raspberry and cherry tart flavors, with hints of tangerine and dried mint. The minerally and spicy finish lingers effortlessly. Drink now through 2023. 413 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sta. Rita Hills Rita's Crown Vineyard
review: Plush and filled with focused flavors of dark cherry, plum tart and currant, plus elegant notes of sandalwood. The rich finish has chocolate accents, and hints of white pepper. Drink now through 2020. 279 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sta. Rita Hills
review: Tightly wound and well-centered, this offers a firm, rich measure of earth and anise-laced dark berry, spice and floral scents. Ends with dusty tannins. Drink now. 416 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sta. Rita Hills Rita's Crown Vineyard
review: A trim style, with strawberry and raspberry notes in a medium-weight style, turning dusty and cedary and fading on the finish. Drink now. 623 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Maria Valley Bien Nacido Vineyard
review: Firmly tannic, with spice, pepper, wild berry and beefy flavors that pick up a touch of cedar and camphor on the finish, ending with a dry, leathery aftertaste. Drink now through 2009. 245 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Barbara County
review: A rich, spicy, earthy style, with oregano, bay leaf and dried berry flavors, ending with tannins that turn dry and clamp down. 441 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Maria Valley Bien Nacido Vineyard
review: Shows unappetizing dirty, metallic, leathery flavors. 392 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch The FMC
review: A creamy style, with judicious toasted brioche and shortbread notes caressing the lemon curd, orange blossom, quince and yellow apple flavors. The long finish is lush in feel, but this stays pure and racy. Should age well. Drink now through 2016. 300 cases imported.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch The FMC
review: Rich but very stylish, with mango, peach and fig flavors harnessed by blanched almond, floral and mineral notes. Long, juicy finish lets a heather note linger. Drink now through 2011. 480 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch The FMC
review: Bold, with richly layered graham, persimmon and chamomile notes, but also restrained, thanks to fine acidity. Alluring hazelnut, brioche and paraffin notes fill out the back end. The long finish lets a heather honey note linger. Should age really well. Drink now through 2013. 420 cases made.

name: Noble Late Harvest T Stellenbosch
review: A dense, ripe and tropical style, displaying mango, papaya and persimmon notes melded together and backed by maple, date and dried blood orange accents. The long, lush finish features an echo of green tea. Chenin Blanc. Drink now through 2015. 50 cases imported.

name: The Gypsy Stellenbosch
review: Rich but perfumy, with silky-textured raspberry ganache and red cherry flavors laced with alluring spice, incense and black tea notes. The long finish lets additional red currant and mineral notes chime in. Grenache, Syrah and Mourvèdre. Drink now through 2013. 215 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch The FMC
review: This has a broad, honeyed edge, with melon, pear and toasted almond notes carrying through a ginger-laced finish. Features a toasted frame, but there's a brightness within the core, giving this balance and energy to match the weight. Drink now through 2018. 300 cases imported.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch The FMC
review: Nicely toasty but well-integrated, with a lovely buttered brioche and toasted macadamia nut frame to the core of creamed melon, fig and pear fruit. The long, lush finish lets in a flicker of honeysuckle. Shows depth and grace. Drink now through 2015. 250 cases imported.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch The FMC
review: Ripe and lush, with delicious creamed pear, ginger, heather and fig kept honest by fresh acidity that's well-embedded on the toasty finish. This really stretches out in the glass too, with pear eau-de-vie and hazelnut oil notes lingering on the finish. Gorgeous. Drink now through 2014. 200 cases imported.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch The FMC
review: A very ripe, exotic style, with a toasted hazelnut aroma leading the way for almond tuile, fig and glazed pear notes. The lush finish lets additional papaya and creamed peach notes chime in. This has an off-dry hint, but stays balanced. A flashy style for sure, but pulls it off. Drink now through 2011. 515 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch The FMC
review: Quite bold, with richly layered notes of roasted almond, fig, quince, honey and buttered brioche. Creamy, but stays pure and defined through the long finish. Very impressive. Drink now through 2008. 100 cases imported.

name: Dirty Little Secret One Western Cape
review: Intense, with a gorgeous display of creamed yellow apple, quince, heather and white ginger notes, inlaid with whiffs of verbena, fennel and chamomile. The long finish presents richness without sacrificing detail. Chenin Blanc. Drink now through 2019. 400 cases made.

name: Noble Late Harvest T Stellenbosch
review: There's good energy here, with candied ginger peel, mango, dried orange, apricot and nectarine notes all coiled together and backed by a tangy ginger streak on the finish. Just a touch tight now, but should cellar well. Drink now through 2020. 100 cases imported.

name: Noble Late Harvest T Stellenbosch
review: Very enticing, with glazed peach, ginger and creamed pear notes backed by a lingering note of orange zest. Plump and racy, with the contrast bringing you back for another sip. Great length. Chenin Blanc. Drink now through 2015. 50 cases imported.

name: Noble Late Harvest T Stellenbosch
review: Delicious, with dried apricot, caramel crème, nutmeg and blood orange aromas and flavors rippling from start to finish. The mouthwatering finish offsets the sweetness wonderfully, and an enticing clove note lingers. Chenin Blanc. Drink now through 2012. 180 cases made.

name: The Gypsy Western Cape
review: Alluring, with a lightly mulled edge to the core of red currant, plum and raspberry fruit, while dark tea, cocoa and smoldering tobacco notes hang through the finish. A lightly dusty structure underscores this wine. Grenache, Syrah and Mourvèdre. Drink now through 2016. 50 cases imported.

name: The Gypsy Western Cape
review: Dense but silky, with stylish red and black cherry, plum and currant fruit stitched with notes of black tea, singed bay leaf and pepper. A mesquite note ties up the finish. Grenache and Syrah. Drink now through 2015. 180 cases imported.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch The FMC
review: A broad, creamy style, with flattering yellow apple, melon and almond cream notes gliding through, backed by light honeysuckle and ginger accents on the finish. Nice underlying acidity keeps this honest. Drink now through 2018. 350 cases imported.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch The FMC
review: A frankly ripe, toasted style, with warm piecrust, sweetened butter and creamed pineapple and melon flavors all gliding along. Ginger and toast line the flattering finish. Despite the opulence, this features subtle length and cut for balance, with a lingering honeysuckle hint at the very end. Drink now through 2017. 400 cases imported.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch The FMC
review: Big, with alluring graham and ginger aromas followed by a layered palate of cardamom, fig, piecrust, nectarine and persimmon. Rich but dry and focused, with a long, detailed finish. Lovely. Drink now through 2010. 620 cases made.

name: Noble Late Harvest T Stellenbosch
review: This dessert wine lets intense dried apricot, peach and tangerine notes stream through, backed by maple and green tea accents that impart a nice sweet and sour interplay through the juicy finish. Chenin Blanc. Drink now through 2019. 100 cases imported.

name: Noble Late Harvest T Stellenbosch
review: Quite ripe and lush, offering a delicious mix of creamed mango and papaya fruit laced with hints of maple, honey and apricot, all allied to a broad, fleshy frame, with a long finish. Delicious. Chenin Blanc. Drink now through 2013. 50 cases imported.

name: Noble Late Harvest T Stellenbosch
review: This has all the lush papaya, pineapple and mango fruit of youth, but has a burnished, rounded texture from aging, along with orange peel, spice, date and caramel notes on the finish. Superb. Chenin Blanc. Drink now through 2006. 400 cases made.

name: Syrah-Grenache Stellenbosch The Gypsy
review: Restrained now, but with a large core of fleshy-textured black currant, fig and bittersweet cocoa notes, backed by ample, fine-grained tannins and a long, dense finish where toast and white pepper notes check in. Rich, but not at all bombastic. Offers fine cellaring potential. Drink now through 2011. 320 cases made.

name: The Gypsy Western Cape
review: Soft but persistent, with a perfumed black tea edge leading the way for silky black cherry, black currant and plum fruit flavors that glide through the tea-infused finish. Good latent grip on the back end adds depth. Grenache, Syrah and Mourvèdre. Drink now through 2016.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch Reserve
review: Juicy and well-focused, with mouthwatering pear, fig and apple notes laced with brioche and persimmon. Shows good cut on the finish. Drink now through 2013. 1,250 cases imported.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch The FMC
review: Bold, with graham, honey, orange peel, nectarine and cardamom flavors driven by live-wire acidity. Rich, structured and focused, with a long finish. Shows obvious wood treatment, but has plenty of stuffing to back it up. Drink now through 2007. 150 cases imported.

name: Grenache-Syrah Western Cape The Gypsy
review: This is inviting, with a whiff of freshly brewed espresso giving way to black tea, cocoa powder, mulled plum, currant sauce and roasted mesquite notes. This has weight but stays stylish, with a long, velvety finish. Drink now through 2012. 50 cases imported.

name: Grenache-Syrah Western Cape The Gypsy
review: Fleshy, open and inviting, with dark cocoa powder, tobacco, black currant and fig notes carried by fine-grained and supple tannins. The long, velvety finish has a lingering hint of black tea, with nice latent power in reserve. Drink now through 2009. 25 cases imported.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch
review: Nice racy almond, fig and chamomile notes, with a minerally finish. Drink now. 11,770 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch Forrester Meinert
review: Lovely dried mango and papaya fruit here, with additional ginger, peach and floral hints. Just a touch shy on concentration, but a fine, smooth mouthfeel, and a pretty, lingering finish. Drink now through 2004. 200 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch Old Vine Reserve
review: A bright, fresh style, with honeysuckle and jasmine notes leading the way for yellow apple and white peach flavors. Lively, crunchy acidity supports the finish. Drink now. 3,000 cases imported.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch Old Vine Reserve
review: Juicy, with kiwifruit, pear and green almond flavors that show good drive through the creamy-edged finish. Drink now. 3,000 cases imported.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch Old Vine Reserve
review: Offers an unadorned, crunchy feel, featuring Key lime, green almond and pear skin notes, with a light, open-knit finish. Refreshing, with good length. Drink now. 3,000 cases imported.

name: Noble Late Harvest T Stellenbosch
review: Medium-sweet, with dried apricot, nectarine and orange peel notes backed by a hint of green tea. Stays lively on the finish. Chenin Blanc. Drink now. 850 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Stellenbosch
review: Lovely expression of Sauvignon, with gooseberry, lemon peel, lime, chalk and peach flavors that don't quit. Hints of smoke and paraffin chime in on the chiseled finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Stellenbosch
review: Tight and chiseled, this Sauvignon has racy lemon zest and lemon curd notes, with hints of flowers, minerals and grass. Long, precise finish. Very nice. Drink now.

name: Brut Stellenbosch Sparklehorse
review: Broad and generous in feel, this sparkler lets yellow apple, melon and biscuit flavors fan out, with a light citrus peel edge through the finish to keep this honest. Chenin Blanc. Drink now. 325 cases made.

name: Brut Stellenbosch Sparklehorse
review: A toasty-style sparkler, with notes of biscuit and piecrust followed by almond, fig and pear flavors. The lively mousse adds energy through the finish. Chenin Blanc. Drink now. 100 cases imported.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch
review: A delicious, medium-weight, juicy version, with mouthwatering peach, green plum and chamomile notes that extend through the green fig-tinged finish. Drink now. 8,330 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch
review: Light-bodied, but with a nice crunchy underpinning that holds the fresh tangerine, nectarine and floral notes together. Juicy finish. Drink now through 2010. 8,000 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch
review: Juicy, with medium-weight almond, fig and lime notes followed by a finish that has just a hint of sweetness but stays fresh. Drink now. 2,000 cases imported.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch
review: Tasty white peach, honeysuckle, chamomile and almond flavors stay lively through the bright, crunchy finish. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch Old Vine Reserve
review: Ripe, with an almost unctuous feel, exhibiting creamed plum, green melon and green fig fruit flavors that roll along, backed by hints of white ginger and piecrust. Stays juicy enough on the finish. Drink now. 4,000 cases imported.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch Old Vine Reserve
review: A bright, fresh style, with lime zest, honeysuckle, green apple and pear notes wound together. Lively acidity adds bounce to the finish. Drink now. 4,000 cases imported.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch Old Vine Reserve
review: A juicy, forward style, with green plum, pear and green melon notes backed by a fresh, unadorned finish. Refreshing. Drink now. 2,592 cases imported.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch Petit
review: A bright, unadorned style, with green almond and pear notes that breeze along, gilded with a verbena accent on the finish. Drink now. 8,000 cases imported.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch Petit
review: Vibrant, showing green plum, green almond and pear skin notes that display a juicy, vigorous feel through the medium-weight finish. Drink now. 10,000 cases imported.

name: Chenin Blanc Western Cape Petit
review: This is juicy, with green melon, green fig and quince notes backed by a bright, crunchy finish. Textbook. Drink now. 17,500 cases imported.

name: Grenache-Syrah Stellenbosch The Gypsy
review: Quite toasty, with mocha and cocoa notes leading the way for fleshy plum, currant and briar flavors. Fleshy finish shows coffee and mineral hints. For fans of the style. Drink now through 2007. 215 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Stellenbosch
review: A soft style, offering a hint of brioche along with straw, white peach and lemon curd notes. A touch shy on zip, this features a flattering feel that some will enjoy. Drink now. 63 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Stellenbosch
review: Shows good richness and focus, with lemon peel, honeysuckle and pink grapefruit notes that linger through the medium-weight finish. Drink now. 8,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz-Grenache Western Cape
review: Enticing cocoa, black cherry and incense notes work through this soft-textured, medium-weight offering, which turns elegant and dusty on the finish. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: The FMC Stellenbosch
review: Rather rich and soft, offering forward pineapple gelée, lemon sherbet, warm apple and glazed pear flavors gliding along, with a honeyed edge to the toasted finish. A little shy on zip but will certainly win some fans. Drink now. 620 cases made.

name: The Gypsy Western Cape
review: Soft, with mature black tea and mulling spice accents emerging from the core of fleshy cherry and plum flavors. Tea and sandlwood line the finish, which still has good energy despite the late release. Grenache, Syrah and Mourvèdre. Drink now through 2018. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 270 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Stellenbosch Petit
review: Direct, with pear, green apple and quince notes that stay fresh on the lightly buttered finish. Drink now. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Western Cape Petit
review: A ripe, focused version, with textbook apple and pear fruit forming the core, while enticing hazelnut and singed brioche notes race underneath. Just a touch shy on zip, but Chardonnay fans will dig the fruit. Drink now. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Western Cape Petit
review: Friendly and open-knit, with lots of honeysuckle, white ginger and yellow apple flavors streaming through. Drink now. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch
review: Quite mature, with lemon curd, flan, honeysuckle and chamomile notes, and a crisp, lively finish. Nicely done, but drink up. Drink now.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch Petit
review: Friendly, with fresh-cut green melon and green almond notes, lined with a hint of makrut lime. Offers a bright, unadorned finish. Drink now. 10,000 cases imported.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch Petit
review: Shows delightful floral, heather, candied lime peel and quince notes on a bright, unadorned frame. Drink now. 100,000 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch Petit
review: Tasty Chenin, with crunchy texture and freshly cut melon, white peach and floral notes. Plump finish. Drink now. 60,000 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch Petit
review: Fleshy, with citrus, peach and melon fruit, followed by hints of mineral and chamomile flower. Nice, firm finish. Drink now. 15,000 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch Petit
review: Rich and forward, this plump white sports honey, nectarine and star fruit flavors, with a full, round texture and finish. Lacks Chenin's bracing edge, but solid. Drink now. 29,000 cases made.

name: Grenache-Syrah Stellenbosch The Gypsy
review: Mature, with grainy cedar and vanilla shadings to the black cherry and currant fruit. Smoky finish. Nice, but the late release hasn't given it anything extra. Drink now. 205 cases made.

name: Merlot Stellenbosch Reserve
review: Gentle-edged cherry and blood orange fruit notes are flecked with light savory and mint accents. Cedary echo on the finish. Drink now. 200 cases imported.

name: Pinotage Western Cape Petit
review: Rich and polished, with dark plum, anise and black currant fruit that's liberally toasted but lively enough through the finish. Drink now. 6,000 cases imported.

name: Renegade Western Cape
review: Direct, delivering lightly mulled cherry and raspberry fruit lined with light cinnamon, tea and incense notes. Shiraz, Grenache and Mourvèdre. Drink now. 1,100 cases made.

name: Renegade Western Cape
review: Shows some maturity, with perfumy singed cedar and mulled spice notes running along the edges of the lightly steeped cherry and plum fruit core. Toasted vanilla edge on the finish. Shiraz, Grenache and Mourvèdre. Drink now. 400 cases imported.

name: Renegade Western Cape
review: Light herb and cedar notes mingle with mulled damson plum and cherry paste flavors. Features a cedary frame on the finish, but the mouthfeel remains gentle overall. Grenache, Shiraz and Mourvèdre. Drink now. 100 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Stellenbosch
review: Direct, with a crunchy edge to the lime and gooseberry notes, which bounce through the light-bodied finish. Drink now. 800 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Stellenbosch
review: Offers bouncy white peach and melon rind notes, with hints of lemon and chamomile. Drink now. 600 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Stellenbosch
review: A juicy, ripe style, offering candied citrus peel, straw and lemon pound cake notes, followed by a friendly, open-knit finish. Drink now. 1,200 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Stellenbosch
review: Nice tangy chive, pea and herb notes run through this lively white, with a lingering hint of sea salt. Drink now. 2,000 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Stellenbosch
review: A very accessible style, with lively chive, lime and flint flavors, backed by a hint of kiwi on the fresh finish. Tasty. Drink now. 7,500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Stellenbosch
review: Bright, with peach, candied lemon peel and floral notes. Turns a bit light in the end, but fresh and lively. Drink now. 5,700 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Western Cape Reserve
review: Juicy, with lemon pith, gooseberry and white asparagus notes. Lively finish. Drink now. 700 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Western Cape Reserve
review: Bright and herbal, with lively thyme, chive and mâche notes backed by a hint of lemon pulp. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch Petit
review: A fresh version, offering pear, green melon and green almond notes on a plump frame. Shows good zip on the finish for balance. Drink now. 8,000 cases imported.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch Petit
review: A clean, friendly version, with green plum and green almond notes backed by a refreshing, floral-tinged finish. Drink now. 66,665 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch Petit
review: A great introduction to Chenin, with clean-cut lime, chamomile and lemon verbena flavors, followed by a bright, easy finish. Drink now. 25,000 cases imported.

name: Chenin Blanc Western Cape Petit
review: This delivers a direct yellow apple and white ginger profile, with a light hint of shortbread on the finish. Drink now. 8,000 cases imported.

name: Chenin Blanc Western Cape Petit
review: A clean, quick, unadorned style, with lively lime, apple and pear notes that leave a refreshing feel on the finish. Drink now.

name: Merlot Stellenbosch
review: Soft and forward, with a strong minty note running through the friendly core of plum and black cherry fruit. Drink now. 200 cases imported.

name: Noble Late Harvest T Stellenbosch
review: Quite mature, with good maple and orange peel flavors up front and nice texture, but fading a bit on the back end as the concentration is waning. Drink now.

name: Pinotage Paarl Petit
review: Easygoing, modern style, with lots of fresh plum and boysenberry fruit, and sweet vanilla and toast on the finish. Drink now. 3,500 cases made.

name: Pinotage Stellenbosch Petit
review: The fresh cherry pie and blackberry flavors are lined with a notes of roasted vanilla bean. The lightly firm finish keeps this honest enough. Drink now. 2,000 cases imported.

name: Pinotage Stellenbosch Petit
review: Soft and fruity, with plum, blackberry and vanilla notes that mingle on the open-knit finish. A dash of grip keeps it honest. Drink now. 20,830 cases made.

name: Renegade Western Cape
review: Displays a toasty, slightly cedary frame, with dried cherry, plum and black currant fruit backed by a tobacco edge. Shiraz, Grenache and Mourvèdre. Drink now. 100 cases imported.

name: Rosé Petit Western Cape
review: This has a nice spicy edge, with dried cherry and strawberry fruit at the core. A fresh tobacco leaf note on the finish hangs nicely. Drink now. 100 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Stellenbosch Petit
review: This has good zip, with bright lemon zest and honeysuckle notes, backed by a light shortbread accent on the finish. Drink now. 1,500 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Stellenbosch Petit
review: Friendly cherry and plum jam notes are inlaid with modest anise and powdered vanilla hints. Soft, lightly dusty-edged finish. Drink now. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch
review: Pretty honeycomb and butter flavors to this wine, with a round, creamy texture and a lively, bracing finish that brings you back for more. A solid introduction to the grape. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch
review: An intriguing chamomile note is backed by honey and a hint of citrus in this smooth, satisfying white. Vibrant acidity adds a tangy feel to the finish. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch Petit
review: Bright, with lime, starfruit and almond notes and a light, fresh finish. Drink now. 60,000 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch Petit
review: Juicy, with medium-weight orange peel, mineral and honeysuckle notes, with a lively finish. Nicely done. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now.

name: Grenache-Syrah Stellenbosch
review: Juicy, vivid berry aromas burst from the glass in this elegant red. Laced with currant and herbal flavors supported by a firm structure, with some astringency at the end. Drink now through 2001. 1,150 cases made.

name: Pinotage Stellenbosch Petit
review: Forward, with cherry pie and strawberry compote flavors laced with light vanilla and licorice notes. Drink now. 3,000 cases imported.

name: Pinotage Stellenbosch Petit
review: Round and friendly, with cherry, grape and plum notes coated with a thin licorice layer. Drink now. 3,000 cases imported.

name: Pinotage Stellenbosch Petit
review: Soft, with medium-weight plum fruit, modest toast and a hint of briar on the finish. Drink now. 4,000 cases imported.

name: Pinotage Western Cape Petit
review: A light, forward style, with easy damson plum and cherry notes that show a light dusting of vanilla on the finish. Drink now. 1,800 cases imported.

name: Rosé Petit Stellenbosch
review: This rosé delivers good strawberry and watermelon notes, with a fresh, lightly firm finish. Grenache. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Stellenbosch
review: Light and forward, with a mix of chamomile, thyme and lemon. A light, lacy finish. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Stellenbosch Petit
review: Direct, with lightly mulled currant and black cherry fruit, liberally lined with roasted vanilla and cinnamon notes. Drink now. 2,500 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot Stellenbosch Petit
review: Forward, offering berry, grilled herb, vanilla and grapey notes, with a soft, slightly jammy edge on the finish. Drink now. 3,000 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot Western Cape Petit
review: This up-front style offers light-bodied cherry pit and pomegranate fruit, laced with a light herb note. Drink now. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch
review: Ginger, apple and cardamom notes run through this round Chenin, with a hint of earth. Not as sharply defined as the better examples, but has a nice range of flavors. Drink now. 25,000 cases made.

name: Grenache-Syrah Stellenbosch
review: A bit firm throughout, but with good medium-weight black cherry and smoke notes. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now.

name: Grenache-Syrah Stellenbosch The Gypsy
review: Mint, berry and mocha notes run through this, with an ambitious smoky, bacony edge. Turns a bit charry on the finish. Drink now through 2004. 150 cases made.

name: Merlot Stellenbosch
review: Soft, with a very light structure and modest plum and cherry fruit that shows a slightly jammy hint on the finish. Drink now. 8,000 cases made.

name: Pinotage Stellenbosch Petit
review: Ebullient cherry and steeped strawberry notes show a veneer of red licorice. Drink now. 3,000 cases imported.

name: Pinotage Stellenbosch Petit
review: More fresh fruit and flesh here than usual for Pinotage, with good plum and briar flavors. Picks up a rustic edge on the finish, but still an excellent value. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Renegade Stellenbosch
review: A friendly, soft, grapey style, with some plum and vanilla notes and a flicker of cocoa at the very end. Drink now. 250 cases imported.

name: Rosé Petit Western Cape
review: This rosé is light and direct, with a faint off-dry edge to the watermelon and white cherry flavors. Grenache. Drink now. 1,500 cases imported.

name: Rosé Petit Western Cape
review: A light, breezy style, with strawberry and red currant notes bolstered by a floral hint on the finish. Grenache. Drink now. 550 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Stellenbosch
review: Soft and forward, with lemon peel, pink grapefruit and floral notes. Drink now. 6,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot Western Cape Petit
review: Shows modest plum, herb and roasted vanilla notes, with the herb edge lingering on the finish. Drink now. 653 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot Western Cape Petit
review: Light and forward, with modest cherry and herb notes backed by a smoky edge on the finish. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch
review: Broad and richly structured, there's concentration to the almond and apple flavors, yet it's soft and tails off on the finish. Drink now. 4,500 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch Petit
review: Attractive, in a moderately firm, rich style, evoking flavors of chamomile, almond and baked apple. Citrus notes peek through on the finish. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Merlot Stellenbosch
review: Lightly baked plum fruit is laced with modest tobacco and herb notes. Soft finish. The better of two bottles tasted. Drink now. 200 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Stellenbosch
review: Shows more nut and straw notes, and a round, touch earthy finish. Good, but lacks zip. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now.

name: Shiraz-Grenache Western Cape
review: Shows medium-weight, slightly jammy plum and blackberry fruit notes, with a dash of toast on the back end. Starting to lose its freshness as it feels a touch cooked. The better of two bottles tasted. Drink now. 200 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot Western Cape Petit
review: Soft and easy, with lightly jammy cherry and pomegranate notes and a dash of vanilla on the dusty finish. Drink now. 2,000 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot Western Cape Petit
review: Crisp up front, with modest cherry and herb notes backed by a vanilla hint. This has a slightly candied finish. Drink now. 25,000 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch Petit
review: Has good varietal notes of ginger, orange blossom and peach, but turns soft in the end, with the normal bracing streak. Still good, though. Drink now. 15,000 cases made.

name: Fumé Blanc Stellenbosch
review: Mature, this white offers new oak nuances, lending a butterscotch element to the melon and citrus flavors. The wood character dominates, and the palate is on the dilute side. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Stellenbosch Reserve
review: Rather light, with plum skin and cherry hints, laced with cedar and earth notes. Drink now. 250 cases imported.

name: The Gypsy Western Cape
review: Fading, with soft mulled plum and cherry fruit giving way to menthol and sous bois notes. Hurry. Past its prime. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 230 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch Petit
review: Soft, with peach and lemon flavor and a slightly chalky finish. Drink now. 15,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Stellenbosch
review: Light, with basic red plum fruit and a noticeable herbal streak. Drink now. 3,875 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Dundee Hills Nysa Vineyard
review: Supple, round and graceful, this is impressive for its clarity, centering on gorgeous currant and plum fruit, framed with hints of spice and dried cherry. The finish sails on and on. Drink now through 2018. 428 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley McCrone Vineyard
review: Gorgeous stuff. Lithe and supple, with creamy dark berry and floral flavors. Blackberry and currant character lingers effortlessly on the finish. Balanced, with just enough refreshing acidity. Drink now through 2014. 385 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Abbot Claim Vineyard
review: Light in weight and texture, with complex, mineral-accented blackberry, red cherry, whole grain and spice flavors that flow easily into the long, expressive finish. Drink now through 2018. 1,187 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Abbott Claim Vineyard
review: Sleek and focused, restrained in style but presenting ripe blueberry, plum and floral flavors that glide into a long, lithe finish. Sleek and deep, lingering with harmony. Drink now through 2024. 400 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District McCrone Vineyard
review: Lithe, open-textured and inviting, with peach and mango overtones to the black cherry and floral flavors, coming together harmoniously and finishing with a hint of wet gravel that lends a savory character to the long finish. Drink now through 2022. 480 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Savoya Vineyard
review: Sleek, polished and inviting for its vivid range of mineral-accented cherry, toast, licorice and spice flavors that float easily over a generous frame, finishing long and especially harmonious. A hint of orange peel and tea leaf adds a mature note. Drink now through 2022. 923 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Tanager Vineyard
review: Supple, focused and expressive, offering blackberry, currant, sassafras and floral flavors wrapped in powdery tannins and gliding into the long, vivid finish. Best from 2018 through 2024. 821 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Dundee Hills Nysa Vineyard
review: Polished, generous and refined, this is very well-focused, with raspberry, cinnamon, red cherry and sandalwood flavors that persist enticingly on the long, harmonious finish. Drink now through 2016. 445 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills Canary Hill Vineyard
review: Supple and velvety, with layered flavors of cherry, blueberry, currant and spice set on an open-weave texture. The finish hovers with persistence and point. Drink now through 2024. 1,257 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills Canary Hill Vineyard
review: Big flavors on a polished frame make this intensely focused wine dance nicely, offering currant, blackberry and plum fruit, with hints of pepper and spice as the finish lingers effortlessly. Drink now through 2018. 1,471 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills Carter Vineyard
review: Endowed with layers of ripe plum, dark berry, dried flowers and savory, meaty nuances, this medium-weight wine has tremendous presence and harmony, right through the long and expressive finish. Best from 2017 through 2023. 1,092 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir McMinnville Meredith Mitchell Vineyard
review: Polished, open-textured and beautifully aromatic, a noseful and mouthful of blueberry, cranberry and plum fruit, shaded with hints of white pepper and cedar. The finish comes together seamlessly and lingers impressively. Best from 2009 through 2015. 260 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Abbey Ridge Vineyard
review: Lithe and juicy, an Oregon red with a beautifully focused band of raspberry, rose petal and chocolate notes swirling though the lively finish. Strikes a harmonious balance and lets the flavors sing. Drink now through 2009. 280 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Canary Hill Vineyard
review: Lush and velvety, but beautifully restrained, the better to let the plum, blackberry and minty cream flavors spill gently over the tongue. The flavors linger against ultrarefined tannins on the long, delicate finish. Drink now through 2014. 700 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Carter Vineyard
review: Lithe and open-textured, a basically delicate Pinot, with a gorgeous thread of blackberry, currant and vaguely minty flavors that persist on a long, velvety finish, balanced against refreshing acidity. Drink now through 2014. 675 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Freedom Hill Vineyard
review: Sleek and silky, brimming with cinnamon-accented raspberry and cherry fruit, riding over a veil of polished tannins on an open frame and finishing with finesse. Drink now through 2020. 737 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Guadalupe Vineyard
review: Bright and jazzy, a terrific mouthful of raspberry, strawberry and red plum flavors that wash over the palate beautifully, while sneaking in superfine tannins that let the flavors sail on and on. Drink now through 2010. 510 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Shea Vineyard
review: Strikes a wonderful balance between generous cherry, strawberry and guava fruit against spice and mineral flavors that mingle effortlessly on the long, generous, lively finish. Has a great future. Better than previously reviewed. Drink now through 2012. 584 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Shea Vineyard
review: One of Oregon Pinot Noir specialist Ken Wright's new releases, this has a purity of flavor and a graceful balance that are totally disarming. A seductive wine, its pretty raspberry, black cherry and floral aromas and flavors linger enticingly on the open-textured finish. Best from 2001 through 2008. 360 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Abbott Claim Vineyard
review: Lithe and expressive, this is light on its feet but packed with red berry, cinnamon, floral and spice flavors that flow harmoniously through the refined tannins on the finish. Offers presence and depth. Drink now through 2022. 738 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Abbott Claim Vineyard
review: A hint of green olive adds piquancy to the light, vivid raspberry and guava fruit, coming together with refinement and purity as the finish lingers deftly. Shows depth and transparency. Drink now through 2020. 833 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Abbott Claim Vineyard
review: Light on its feet, but shows some flesh to the raspberry, cherry, cream and cinnamon flavors, pulsing gently against polished tannins on the long, expressive finish. Drink now through 2019. 814 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Angela
review: Lithe and light, this is open-textured, an expressive wine, with floral and balsamic accents to the effusive raspberry and red plum fruit, lingering as the finish waxes. Impressive length and balance. Drink now through 2015. 300 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Bonnie Jean Vineyard
review: Fresh, vibrant and tremendously expressive, with red berry, black cherry, toast and black pepper flavors in a weightless but powerful package, lingering beautifully on the refined finish. Drink now through 2022. 55 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District McCrone Vineyard
review: Silky, supple and distinctive for the deep mineral flavors that weave through dark berry, cherry and currant fruit, sailing easily into a cloud of fine tannins on the long, expressive finish. Drink now through 2018. 920 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Savoya Vineyard
review: A focused, harmonious and distinctive red, offering blackberry, anise seed and charred meat flavors, with delicate tannins complementing a finish of intensity and finesse. Best from 2015 through 2020. 892 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Shea Vineyard
review: Taut and deftly wrought, with pretty mulberry and pomegranate flavors on a transparent frame, veiling the extended finish in delicately peppery tannins. Has presence and persistence. Best from 2018 through 2024. 1,465 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Shea Vineyard
review: This vivid red is firm in texture and racy in flavor, offering mineral-accented currant, pomegranate and blackberry flavors that zing through the fine-grained finish. This has style and vitality. Drink now through 2018. 834 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Dundee Hills Nysa Vineyard
review: Light and crisp, brimming with spicy raspberry and cherry flavors that play against polished tannins, zipping onto the long and expressive finish. Will benefit from cellaring. Best after 2015. 451 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills Carter Vineyard
review: Velvety and generous, delivering a lithe mouthful of orange peel-scented raspberry and guava flavors that linger effortlessly against creamy, polished tannins. Drink now through 2019. 1,208 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills Carter Vineyard
review: Bright, youthful and focused, with juicy blackberry, currant and sugar plum flavors that zing across the palate and linger on the refined finish. Best from 2010 through 2016. 1,600 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir McMinnville Meredith Mitchell Vineyard
review: Sleek and savory, with meaty, earthy accents around a vibrant core of plum and currant fruit, lingering effortlessly against fine tannins on the finish. Drink now through 2022. 477 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir McMinnville Meredith Mitchell Vineyard
review: Offers a bright red color and vivid flavors, with a peppermint note adding interest to the raspberry and spice profile. Lingers effortlessly on the finish. Drink now through 2020. 514 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir McMinnville Meredith Mitchell Vineyard
review: Firm tannins surround a supple core of dark berry, cherry and sassafras in the flavor profile, with a hint of chocolate. The flavors linger smoothly as the prickle of the tannins fades. Best from 2013 through 2020. 601 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Ribbon Ridge Bryce Vineyard
review: Lithe, expansive and open-textured, with a transparency to the orange peel-accented red berry and spice flavors, lingering with presence on the deftly woven finish. Drink now through 2024. 827 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Taut and focused, centering on black cherry and mint flavors, riding easily over the highly refined tannins into a long and spacious finish. Has plenty of energy and room to develop more with cellaring. Drink now through 2022. 5,879 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Abbey Heights Whistling Ridge
review: Disarming for its delicious fruit, centering around plum and anise, with a touch of tar on the chewy finish. Should develop into an opulent wine by 1998 to 2000. 50 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Arcus Vineyard
review: A seductive wine, soft and gentle, unfolding its ripe blackberry, cherry and spice flavors with grace, echoing the fruit flavors on a supple frame. Finishes with impressive length, too. Drink now through 2008. 145 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Arcus Vineyard
review: Bright, crisp and focused, this vibrant wine offers a cascade of blueberry, blackberry and vanilla-spice notes that linger on the juicy finish. Drink now through 2006 . 75 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Freedom Hill Vineyard
review: Lithe, supple, with gently spicy berry, cherry and stony, mineral overtones, finishing with a tart note that keeps it all in remarkable balance, finishing long and generous. Better than previously reviewed. Drink now through 2012. 324 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Guadalupe Vineyard
review: Tangy and light in texture, with a delicate earthy strand running through the raspberry and floral flavors, finishing with persistence and finesse. Best after 2017. 781 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Guadalupe Vineyard
review: Sleek and appealing, offering white pepper-accented dark berry and roasted meat flavors that glide through polished tannins to the long, transparent finish. Drink now through 2018. 778 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Guadalupe Vineyard
review: Bright and jazzy, with refreshing acidity to balance focused blueberry, currant and plum flavors, which sail through the nonstop, racy finish. White pepper and hints of smoke make it even more interesting. Best from 2008 through 2014. 550 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Abbott Claim Vineyard
review: A seductive style, bordering on plush, but not at all heavy, with a lean, lithe frame supporting a beautiful bead of blueberry, plum, espresso and spice aromas and flavors, persisting on the elegant finish. Drink now through 2015. 480 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Bonnie Jean Vineyard
review: Light and zingy, with a refreshing tang to the raspberry, chocolate and floral flavors as they zip through a long, lively finish. Best from 2018 through 2024. 1,377 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District McCrone Vineyard
review: Fresh, vibrant and deftly balanced, offering transparent cherry, raspberry and loam flavors, with refined tannins and lacy acidity. Comes together with remarkable harmony and length. Drink now through 2020. 607 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District McCrone Vineyard
review: Tangy, with a live-wire backbone of acid and tannins against refined cherry, pepper and nutmeg flavors, gliding easily into the long, graceful finish. Best from 2013 through 2019. 634 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Savoya Vineyard
review: Crisp in texture, with a thin veil of tight tannins around the dark berry, pepper and sandalwood flavors, lingering on the expressive finish. Drink now through 2019. 879 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Savoya Vineyard
review: Supple, open-textured and inviting, letting its plum, currant and sweet spice flavors float easily through the refined texture, hovering over the long, delicate finish. Drink now through 2018. 1,790 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Shea Vineyard
review: Supple, generous and expressive on an open frame that lets the flavors float, with a tinge of crisp tannins impinging slightly on the black cherry and Earl Grey tea flavors, which linger on the elegant finish. Drink now through 2022. 1,273 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Washington Celilo Vineyard
review: This taut white is brilliantly focused and layered with mineral and spice notes between pineapple and quince flavors. Persists gently on the lively finish. Drink now through 2020. 1,110 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Dundee Hills Nysa Vineyard
review: Supple and open-textured, with a spacious feel to the plum and currant fruit, shaded with hints of black pepper and wet gravel aromatics as the finish lingers against lightly crunchy tannins. Best from 2016 through 2022. 282 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills Canary Hill Vineyard
review: This is a bit raw, but vibrant with blackberry, peach, crème brûlée and spice flavors on a taut frame, finishing with pizzazz. Needs time to soften the edges, but it's a bud waiting to blossom. Best from 2016 through 2022. 891 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills Carter Vineyard
review: Light on its feet, with pretty plum and currant fruit on an open-textured frame, with fine tannins underlying the long, delicate finish. Drink now through 2020. 1,152 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir McMinnville Meredith Mitchell Vineyard
review: Tight, with crisp tannins around a lithe core of raspberry and plum fruit that persists into the long finish, shaded with floral and leafy notes. Best from 2013 through 2019. 460 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Velvety, spicy and appealing, featuring a broad texture without excess weight, this red delivers dark berry and plum flavors accented by clove and cinnamon overtones. Refined, this lingers impressively on the finish. Drink now through 2018. 5,741 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Canary Hill Vineyard
review: Ripe and distinctive for a minty, gamy edge to the rich cherry, strawberry jam and spice flavors, persisting impressively on the lively finish. Needs time to settle in. Best after 2005. 810 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Canary Hill Vineyard
review: Bright, smooth and ravishing for its up-front raspberry and strawberry flavors, shaded with delicate tobacco and nutmeg nuances. Finishes gently, with plenty of flavor echoing. Best from 1999 through 2005. 299 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Carter Vineyard
review: Dark and beautifully focused, with blackberry and dusky spice flavors aiming through a veil of fine-grained tannins, and persisting on the long, elegant finish. Drink now through 2006. 350 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Carter Vineyard
review: This feels refined, letting its black cherry and tobacco flavors zing through a fine veil of tannins and linger appreciatively on the long, lively finish.--1998 Oregon blind retrospective (September 2008). Drink now through 2011. 265 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Carter Vineyard
review: Silky smooth, polished and elegant, balancing its blackberry, blueberry and currant flavors against a spicy note. Delicious now, but should improve through 1998 or 1999. 200 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Elton Vineyard
review: Firm and crisp, nicely packed with blueberry, currant and white pepper flavors that linger on the finish, hinting at mineral notes. Drink now through 2008. 125 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Freedom Hill Vineyard
review: Supple and expressive, with raspberry and clotted cream overtones to the currant and gentle smoke flavors, finishing with harmony and transparency. Best from 2018 through 2024. 1,091 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Freedom Hill Vineyard
review: Soft, ripe and generous, showing a lovely transparency to the cherry, spice and delicate licorice flavors, persisting intently as the finish lingers. Drink now through 2020. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 553 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Freedom Hill Vineyard
review: Light on its feet, with a creamy feel to the red berry, tea and orange peel flavors, with mellow tannins. Finishes with finesse and intensity. The tannins are mellow. Drink now through 2019. 584 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Freedom Hill Vineyard
review: Firm in texture, bursting with blueberry and dark plum fruit against racy acidity, which keeps everything zinging along. The fruit persists admirably as the finish comes together in deft balance, the refined tannins receding into the background. Best from 2008 through 2014. 460 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Freedom Hill Vineyard
review: Lovely, polished and generous with its raspberry, currant and dusky spice flavors, echoing on the fine-grained finish with mineral and earthy touches, lingering with a flourish. Drink now through 2008. 420 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Guadalupe Vineyard
review: Light and refined, with a veil of nubby tannins wrapping the lively cherry and pomegranate flavors as they dance deftly into a long and expressive finish. Best from 2018 through 2022. 1,090 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Guadalupe Vineyard
review: Fresh and lively, with juicy flavors of cherry and raspberry at the core, showing glints of white chocolate and peppermint as the finish lingers easily. A zingy wine. Drink now through 2019. 893 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Guadalupe Vineyard
review: Focused and tangy, with pretty guava and wild raspberry flavors playing against white pepper and fine tannins. Offers complexity and length, finishing with zip. Drink now through 2017. 851 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Guadalupe Vineyard
review: Firm in texture, with a strong pepper note that hovers over the delicate raspberry and cinnamon flavors, lingering on the focused, light-weight finish. Best from 2012 through 2018. 1,107 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Guadalupe Vineyard
review: Dark, dense and beautifully focused, showing black cherry, licorice and peppery-floral aromas and flavors that last and last on the firm finish. Best from 2004 through 2008. 690 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Meredith Mitchell Vineyard
review: Tangy, lively and bursting with raspberry and currant flavors, shaded with dusky spice and sharp acidity as the finish lingers impressively. Give it time to settle in. Best from 2008 through 2014. 280 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Meredith Mitchell Vineyard
review: Firm and fine in texture, with a bright core of raspberry and boysenberry flavors, overtones of earth and floral notes weaving through the finish. Best from 2005 through 2012. 180 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Meredith Mitchell Vineyard
review: Bright in flavor, supple in texture, with pretty raspberry and white chocolate aromas and flavors, finishing with remarkable harmony and length. Drink now through 2008. 170 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Nysa Vineyard
review: Smooth, with a spice box array of grace notes to the finely focused raspberry, cherry and leather flavors, remaining fresh and lively through the juicy finish. Drink now through 2013. 220 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Savoya Vineyard
review: On the tart side, but brilliantly ripe and supple, tightly packed with blueberry, blackberry and currant flavors, touching on olive notes as the firm tannins wrap the edges of the finish. Best from 2006 through 2012. 306 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Shea Vineyard
review: Lean and lithe, a bundle of red cherry, raspberry and peppery spice aromas and flavors on a zingy bed of acidity and freshness, persisting nicely on the polished finish. Best from 2008 through 2014. 720 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Shea Vineyard
review: Ripe in flavor, open in texture, nicely packed with currant and blackberry flavors wrapped in a layer of fine tannins. Best from 2004 through 2007. 580 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Wahle Vineyard
review: Smooth, ripe and polished, with deep cherry, blackberry and dusky spice flavors, finishing with just the right touch of sweet oak to round things out. Tannins are beautifully submerged. Drink now through 2007. 140 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Wahle Vineyard
review: Bright and generous, this is a remarkably elegant wine, almost crisp in texture up front, unfolding its berry, spice and sassafras flavors on a supple frame. Drink now through 2005 . 70 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Whistling Ridge Vineyard
review: Lithe and silky, with a minty-herbal edge to the pretty raspberry and cream flavors, finishing with fine tannins that let the flavors sing on and on. Drink now through 2006. 115 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Abbott Claim Vineyard
review: Light, expressive and open-textured, with a lovely transparency to the pure plum and currant fruit, shaded by smoke and paprika notes as the finish builds momentum without gaining weight. Drink now through 2021. 663 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Abbott Claim Vineyard
review: Dark, almost syrupy, this isn't sweet, but very silky and open in texture, showing tar-scented currant and licorice flavors that linger on the polished finish. Drink now through 2016. 1,723 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Bonnie Jean Vineyard
review: Light-footed, broad and generous, with plum and red currant flavors, floating serenely and harmoniously into a deft finish. Has presence and a sense of reserve. Drink now through 2021. 479 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Shea Vineyard
review: Supple, expressive and generous, with ripe currant, blueberry and coffee flavors on a lovely open transparency, coming together harmoniously on the long and refined finish. Drink now through 2021. 1,062 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Tanager Vineyard
review: Polished, open-textured and expressive, offering spice and roasted walnut overtones to the dark berry flavors, lingering gently against refined tannins. Has depth and presence. Drink now through 2022. 320 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Washington Celilo Vineyard
review: Rich in flavor, elegant in structure, a wine of charm, grace and depth, offering pear, fresh orange, pineapple and spice notes that keep lingering on the round finish. Drink now through 2007. 430 cases made.

name: Pinot Blanc Willamette Valley
review: Polished in texture and expressive in flavor, with pear and melon at the core, shaded with cream and spice notes that mingle seamlessly with the fruit as the finish rolls on. Drink now through 2011. 345 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Dundee Hills Latchkey Vineyard
review: Supple and expansive, light-footed but generous, with spicy, meaty red berry flavors. Has presence, letting the fruit play against fine tannins on the long, focused finish. Best from 2018 through 2022. 596 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Dundee Hills Nysa Vineyard
review: Light and fragrant, with an iodine note weaving through the red berry and spice flavors, lingering easily against refined tannins. Drink now through 2017. 495 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Dundee Hills Nysa Vineyard
review: Polished and tangy, with focused blackberry and cherry flavors on a narrow frame, persisting impressively on the finish. Needs time to gain some flesh. Best from 2009 through 2013. 205 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills Canary Hill Vineyard
review: Light and crisp, with a green tea tang to the delicate plum and cranberry flavors, lingering gently but intently on the polished finish. Drink now through 2020. 806 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills Canary Hill Vineyard
review: Fresh and focused, with a veil of crisp tannins underlining the blackberry, pear and sweet anise flavors on a deftly balanced frame. Features intensity without weight. Best from 2015 through 2020. 892 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills Canary Hill Vineyard
review: A zingy red, with juicy acidity behind the guava, berry and floral flavors, finishing with persistence and zip. Drink now through 2017. 901 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills Carter Vineyard
review: Firm and focused, with spicy, savory overtones to the blueberry and tomato leaf flavors, lingering easily on a fine-grained finish. Best from 2018 through 2024. 1,511 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills Carter Vineyard
review: Light and tangy, with juicy raspberry fruit and lively acidity, coming together harmoniously on the extended, loam-accented finish. Best from 2015 through 2018. 983 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills Carter Vineyard
review: Lithe and supple, this seductive wine offers meaty character under a layer of cherry and mineral flavors that linger nicely on the well-formed finish. Drink now through 2018. 2,203 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills Elton Vineyard
review: Light and lilting, with lovely raspberry, wild strawberry and rose petal aromas and flavors, lingering on the refined, focused finish. Drink now through 2014. 363 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Ribbon Ridge Bryce Vineyard
review: Supple and expressive, with ripe currant and dark plum flavors on a transparent frame, dancing deftly into a long finish. This has presence without much weight. Drink now through 2020. 265 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Light and satiny, with modest tannins around a delicate core of cherry, raspberry and coffee flavors, fleshing out more on the long finish. Drink now through 2017. 4,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Satiny-smooth, ripe and supple, packed with black cherry, blackberry and earthy notes that take on hints of thyme and floral flavors. The finish lingers enticingly. Try in 1998. 2,100 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Abbey Heights
review: One for the cellar. It's firm and chewy now, with a strong current of berry and spice flavors fighting through the fine tannins. Give it until 1999. 125 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Abbott Claim Vineyard
review: Polished and airy in texture, glowing with blackberry and floral aromas and flavors. A lingering, beautifully focused finish, with refined tannins and enough acidity to make it lively. Best from 2007 through 2011. 255 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Canary Hill Vineyard
review: Supple and seductive, weaving its plum and berry flavors through a fine veil of tannins, emerging on the lovely finish to echo nicely. Drink now through 2007. 750 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Canary Hill Vineyard
review: Bright, juicy, distinctive for the floral, citrusy edge to the core of blackberry and spice flavors. Everything lingers nicely on the long finish. Drink now through 2006 . 480 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Carter Vineyard
review: Dark and rangy, with cherry, herb and sweet spice flavors that battle it out on the long, generous, rough-hewn finish. Needs time to sand off the edges. Best after 2007. 800 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Carter Vineyard
review: Bright and zippy, nicely packed with blackberry and mineral flavors, which echo impressively on the firm finish. Drink now through 2008. 750 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Carter Vineyard
review: Bright, focused and generous with its currant, berry and spice flavors, finishing smooth. Spicy oak notes are nicely balanced with zingy acidity. Best from 2004 through 2007. 342 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Elton Vineyard
review: This is firm in texture and generous with its pretty blackberry and dusky spice flavors, shading it all with sweet vanilla notes as the fruit and spice echo on the finish. Drink now through 2006. 160 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Elton Vineyard
review: Crisp in texture and nicely focused, showing off blackberry and currant fruit that echoes generously on the lively finish. Tannins are refined. Drink now through 2006. 140 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Freedom Hill Vineyard
review: Light in weight, this shows grippy tannins around a fresh-tasting core of cherry, currant and mineral flavors. A floral note lingers on the finish. Best from 2012 through 2016. 660 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Freedom Hill Vineyard
review: Lithe and appealing for its juicy blackberry and raspberry flavors, gaining intensity as they sail through the finish, picking up hints of licorice and pepper. Drink now through 2013. 669 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Freedom Hill Vineyard
review: Smooth, ripe and generous with its cherry and orange peel flavors, lingering expressively on the polished, slightly hot finish. Drink now through 2014. 614 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Freedom Hill Vineyard
review: Firm in texture, nicely packed with black cherry and berry flavors, finishing on chewy tannins and echoing the fruit and dusky spice notes. Best from 2003 through 2006. 220 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Guadalupe Vineyard
review: Ripe, supple and generous with its blackberry and cherry flavors, lingering nicely on the gently earthy but open-textured finish. Best from 2005 through 2010. 524 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Guadalupe Vineyard
review: Especially youthful, with a gamy edge to the dense blackberry and currant flavors, all balancing on a sharp edge of acidity. Finishes balanced and refined, but needs time to come together. Best from 2001 through 2007. 480 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley McCrone Vineyard
review: Big and broad, with fine but chewy tannins around a rich core of currant and black cherry fruit that emerges with intensity on the generous finish. Best from 2006 through 2012. 432 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley McCrone Vineyard
review: Smooth and polished, generous with its spicy berry and cherry flavors that grow with each sip. Finish echoes cinnamon and nutmeg. Needs time to settle down, but it's a winner. Best after 2001. 145 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Nysa Vineyard
review: Lean and spicy, with red cherry at the core and hints of mint, rosemary and white pepper swirling around the lithe, fine-grained finish. A delicate wine that surprises with its persistence and intensity. Drink now through 2012. 280 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Nysa Vineyard
review: A crisp, lithe style, bright and jazzy, brimming with raspberry, white pepper and mineral flavors that last nicely on the crisp-grained finish. Drink now through 2008. 235 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Nysa Vineyard
review: Lighter than the rest, with a crunch to the tannins that keeps the delicate cherry and earth flavors from rising as high as they might. But this has elegance and balance, and there's something compelling about its refinement.--1998 Oregon blind retrospective (September 2008). Drink now. 130 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Shea Vineyard
review: Youthful and vibrant, and very Burgundian, with firm but refined tannins around a lovely core of raspberry, chocolate and spice flavors that linger nicely on the round finish. Best from 2003 through 2009. 630 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Shea Vineyard
review: A solidly built, chunky red. The spicy, toasty black cherry and plum flavors need until 1998 to soften and pick up a bit of polish. 125 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Wahle Vineyard
review: Broad and generous, a ripe red with plump cherry, plum and tar flavors, fnishing with enough chunky tannins to want cellaring. Best from 2006 through 2012. 220 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Wahle Vineyard
review: Ripe and polished, with plump blackberry and currant flavors on a smooth frame, finishing with generosity. Drink now through 2005. 135 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Wahle Vineyard
review: Smooth and stylish, a velvety wine with harmonious red berry, cinnamon and pepper flavors that linger on the elegant, nicely focused finish. Drink now. 90 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District McCrone Vineyard
review: Light and tangy, with a delicate burr of tannins surrounding the transparent core of pomegranate and floral flavors, lingering easily on the taut finish. Best from 2018 through 2022. 979 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District McCrone Vineyard
review: Polished, round and engaging for its cherry, spice and wet earth aromas and flavors, persisting nicely on the fine-grained finish. Drink now through 2014. 1,282 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Savoya Vineyard
review: Offers firm tannins, with crisp acidity supporting the cherry, raspberry and spice flavors as they focus into a sharp finish. Needs time to gain flesh. Best after 2018. 1,175 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Savoya Vineyard
review: This light and savory red features wet earth and autumn leaf overtones to its cherry flavors. Finishes gently, with harmony and persistence. Drink now through 2021. 821 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Washington Celilo Vineyard
review: Bright, jazzy style that brims with effusive fruit flavors, centering on lime-scented peach and apple notes, finishing with citrus and slate notes. Very lively, it should become richer with cellaring. Drink now through 2005. 320 cases made.

name: Pinot Blanc Willamette Valley
review: Light and distinctive for a smoked-almond note that weaves through the green apple and green melon flavors, lingering gently. Drink now through 2010. 349 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills Carter Vineyard
review: Tangy, with firm tannins around a juicy core of peppery raspberry and cherry flavors, lingering on the vibrant finish. Drink now through 2013. 1,317 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir McMinnville Meredith Mitchell Vineyard
review: Bright and sleek, with lively acidity to support the blackberry and plum flavors, a hint of pickle barrel on the gently lingering finish. Drink now through 2020. 399 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Ribbon Ridge Bryce Vineyard
review: Firm in texture and tightly wound, with grippy tannins around a lithe core of cherry and cinnamon flavors that hover over the long, earthy finish. Best from 2016 through 2020. 340 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Canary Hill Vineyard
review: Open-textured, tangy style, offering blackberry, floral and tangerine peel flavors on a fine-grained frame, finishing with a sense of freshness. Drink now through 2005. 680 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Canary Hill Vineyard
review: Bright and generous, a juicy wine tingling with blackberry, anise and sweet vanilla flavors, which linger on the lively finish. Drink now through 2005. 660 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Carter Vineyard
review: Bright and intense, with pretty black cherry and licorice notes swirling around on a velvety texture. Finishes with a twang of tartness. Has more depth and length than most '97s. Drink now through 2003. 470 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Carter Vineyard
review: Light and focused, with pretty raspberry and spice flavors persisting on the gleaming finish. Packs lots of character into a lean, lithe package. Nice now; better with some cellaring. Best from 1999 through 2002. 339 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Elton Vineyard
review: On the lean side, with lively acidity to balance the plush berry and cherry fruit, finishing with an earthy edge and firm, fine tannins. Best from 2006 through 2012. 215 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Freedom Hill Vineyard
review: Light and sleek, with pretty, floral-accented raspberry and white tea flavors on a slender frame, lingering easily on the finish. Drink now through 2019. 676 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Guadalupe Vineyard
review: Smooth and generous with its dark berry, cola and spice flavors, lingering effortlessly on the round, velvety, slightly hot finish. Drink now through 2013. 750 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley McCrone Vineyard
review: Ripe and round, distinctive for a minty, herbal edge to the broad cherry and toasty spice flavors. Lingering finish. Drink now through 2011. 418 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley McCrone Vineyard
review: On the lean side, a lithe red with tar, black cherry and smoke flavors that linger among the crisp tannins on the finish. Best from 2004 through 2007. 230 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley NysaVineyard
review: On the light side, but open-textured and nicely focused to highlight very pretty plum and currant aromas and flavors, which echo on the fine-grained finish. Drink now through 2005. 280 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Shea Vineyard
review: Soft, supple and generous with its blueberry, currant and cherry wood aromas and flavors, all in a gentle frame that already feels elegant. Finishes with enough intensity to merit cellaring. Best from 1999 through 2003. 158 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Abbot Claim Vineyard
review: Light and bright, with a spicy edge to the red cherry, floral and wet earth flavors, lingering on the expressive finish. Best from 2010 through 2014. 1,530 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Shea Vineyard
review: Fresh and taut, with a minty edge to the dark berry and tobacco flavors, finishing with savory notes. Shows style and intensity. Best from 2014 through 2018. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 883 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Shea Vineyard
review: Tight tannins surround a juicy core of blackberry and floral flavors, which push against the gritty texture on the finish. Needs cellaring to soften. Best after 2013. 1,115 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon California Cardinale
review: You'd have to travel far to find a more complex and concentrated wine, from the first taste of currant, cherry and plum to the last waft of buttery oak and plum on the long finish. The extraordinary structure and integrated tannins should last beyond 2000. 1,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon California Proprietor's Reserve
review: Sleek and elegant with an overlay of toasty French oak, layers of spice, currant, cassis and cherry flavors that are very attractive, beautifully balanced, supple tannins and a long, satisfying finish. Best after 1992.

name: Cardinale Meritage California
review: Rich, ripe and concentrated, bursting with plum, blueberry and currant aromas and flavors laced with spicy, chocolaty oak that echoes vanilla and cinnamon on the long finish. Keeps pumping out the flavor for minutes on end. A really classy mouthful; should develop and soften. Best from 1997 through 2000. 1,900 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Alexander Valley Jackson Estate Hawkeye Mountain
review: Plump and juicy, deftly balanced and supple in texture, with pure plum and blackberry flavors at the core, showing touches of cherry, currant, anise and cedar around the edges. Ends charming and graceful, with fine-grained tannins. Drink now through 2034. 537 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Stature
review: Remarkably elegant and polished, with ripe, sweet, juicy plum and wild berry, turning elegant and sophisticated, with a long, detailed finish. Best from 2002 through 2012. 3,100 cases made.

name: Merlot Alexander Valley
review: Effusively fruity, bursting with cherry aroma and flavor, complicated by other berries and the right touch of oak, beautifully structured, firm, tight and long. Needs time to lose the tannic toughness on the finish. Best after 1991.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Alexander Valley Great Estates
review: A tremendous effort, very rich and full-bodied, with plush tannins wrapped around a complex, concentrated core of earthy currant, toasty oak, hints of sage and chocolate and rich black cherry fruit. Beautifully focused, elegant and tapered on the long, detailed finish. Drink now through 2008. 4,280 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Stature Limited Release
review: Austere and tannic, yet it's a very deliberate, seamless style, with layers of rich currant, plum and black cherry fruit, plus hints of toast, anise, sage, cedar and berry, all tightly wound and sharply focused. Complex, concentrated aftertaste. Best from 2002 through 2008. 3,055 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Monterey Great Estates
review: Maintains a sense of elegance and finesse, even with its rich, creamy core of earth, pear, fig, citrus, hazelnut and nectarine flavors. Long and complex on the finish. Drink now through 2005. 4,029 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Maria Valley Stature Limited Release
review: A rich, unctuous, almost syrupy style, deeply concentrated and packed with exotic fruit and fancy oak barrel flavors. Lots of tropical fruit, pineapple, pear and honeysuckle flavors have a wonderful perfumed character, finishing with a gush of juicy flavors. Drink now through 2007. 381 cases made.

name: Merlot Bennett Valley Jackson Estate Taylor Peak
review: Polished and well-structured, exhibiting the supple texture you expect in a top Merlot. Features a complex core, with aromas of blackberry and dried herb opening to flavors of black cherry, spice and lead pencil. Drink now through 2021. 518 cases made.

name: Syrah Sonoma Valley Durell Vineyard
review: Supple and rich, with spicy cherry aromas and flavors, beautiful overtones of sweet oak and cinnamon; voluptuous and succulent—you could drink it now in a fit of sheer hedonism, but give it till 1991 or '92 for the full effect.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Alexander Valley Jackson Estate Hawkeye Mountain
review: Charming, with a mix of rustic dusty berry and hot brick flavors, fine-grained tannins and subtle hints of gravelly tobacco. Gains depth and nuance on the finish. Drink now through 2026. 3,202 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon California Grand Reserve
review: Firm and deeply concentrated, with a solid tannic punch to the blackberry, currant, coffee and plum flavors, this broad-appellation Cabernet reflects the strength of the vintage throughout the state. Best from 2001 through 2007. 4,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon California Grand Reserve
review: Dense and chewy, but has all the ingredients for greatness, with tiers of black cherry, currant, anise and plum, finishing with chunky tannins that let the fruit glide through. Finishes spicy.

name: Cardinale Meritage California
review: Shows off its ripe black cherry, currant and wild berry flavors that stretch to a jammy edge, adding pretty spice and anise and firm tannins. Well crafted; best in 1999.

name: Cardinale Meritage California
review: Bold, ripe, smooth and polished. The layers of plum, currant, cherry and blueberry flavors are focused and lively right through the finish. Has the tannin and concentration for cellaring through the decade. 3,190 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Anderson Valley De Patie Vineyard
review: Classy and complex. A lovely, clean and stylishly oaky wine, with loads of sweet vanilla, butter, pear and apple flavors and a touch of nutmeg. Smoky, rich and long-lasting on the finish.

name: Chardonnay Arroyo Seco Great Estates
review: Offers a floral bouquet, with rich, spicy apple, pear, fig and melon flavors, turning elegant and refined, finishing with touches of hazelnut and toasty oak. Drink now through 2005. 1,328 cases made.

name: Chardonnay California Grand Reserve
review: Elegant and flavorful, ripe and creamy, with juicy pear, apple, melon and fig notes that fan out on the finish where nice touch of spicy oak adds dimension.

name: Chardonnay California Vintner's Reserve
review: Plush, with loads of richness to the well-honed flavors of beeswax, baked pear and lemon tart. Minerally midpalate, with a fresh and zesty finish that finishes with pastry notes. Drink now through 2020. 100,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Maria Valley Camelot Vineyard
review: Ripe, rich and complex, with tiers of spice, toast, honey and nectarine accented by hints of peach and pineapple. A up-front and openly fruity style that is appealing now.

name: Chardonnay Santa Maria Valley Camelot Vineyard Single Vineyard Series
review: Brimming with complex flavors, this California Chardonnay offers a harmonious blend of ripe pear, nectarine, pineapple and spice, with smoky, toasty oak filling in the gaps nicely. Drink now through 2002. 62,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Maria Valley Jackson Estate Camelot Highlands
review: Deeply spiced and buttery, with concentrated flavors of pear tart, apple pastry and ripe melon that glide across the palate. Ginger and toasty notes show on the rich, creamy finish. Drink now through 2022. 1,991 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Maria Valley Jackson Estate Camelot Highlands
review: Offers lots of subtlety and polish, from the light, vanilla-accented toasty oak notes to the rich, creamy fig, honeydew, white peach and apricot flavors. Intense and elegant. Drink now. 2,037 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Maria Valley Stature Limited Release
review: A beautiful orchestration of ripe fruit and oak, with touches of creamy, toasty oak wrapped around layers of lemon- and nectarine-scented pear and apple. Long, lingering aftertaste. Drink now through 2006. 148 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Maria Valley Stature Limited Release
review: Remarkably complex, with rich tropical fruit flavors framed by pretty toast, vanilla and smoky oak notes. The core flavors of peach, fig and nectarine are bright and complex, gaining nuance on the finish. Drink now through 2005. 232 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir California Vintner's Reserve
