review: Deftly balanced, this is slow to build nuance and complexity, unfolding to reveal tiers of spicy raspberry, black cherry and wilted rose. Though medium-weight, the flavors build intensity. Drink now through 2020. 50,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Monterey County Great Estates
review: A real mouthful, with rich, plush, chocolaty plum and blackberry fruit that's complex and concentrated, picking up herb, mocha and black cherry nuances. Shows a trace of heat on the finish, but also a gush of rich fruit flavors. Drink now through 2007. 2,180 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Alexander Valley Jackson Estate
review: Offers a cedary, woodsy edge, with dried dark berry, oak, espresso and gravelly notes. Slow to expand but does so pleasantly, ending more complex. Mineral and graphite elements emerge on the aftertaste. Drink now through 2026. 2,081 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon California Grand Reserve
review: Lots of upfront spicy and plummy flavors, turning elegant and refined. Finishes with a spicy richness and firm, supple tannins. Best from 2000 through 2007. 6,539 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon California Grand Reserve
review: A complex, well-structured, intensely flavored wine, with layers of currant, plum, black cherry and wild berry. Finishes with ripe, well-integrated tannins. Best from 1999 through 2005. 4,277 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Stature Limited Release
review: This lovely Cabernet is rich and polished, with firm tannins supporting a sleek core of sweet, juicy currant and blackberry fruit. Shows a touch of fresh leather, plum and lavender, hints of cedar and spice and a firm backbone. Excellent balance. Drink now through 2010. 466 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma County Vintner's Reserve
review: Drinks clean and easy, yet offers substance and depth. An elegant style, supple and graceful, with tender plum, currant and blackberry notes shaded by licorice, light earth and oak. Drink now through 2022. 50,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay California Grand Reserve
review: Intense yet with a sense of elegance and finesse, with ripe pear, melon, nutmeg and apple flavors. Finishes with a light touch of oak and a fruity aftertaste.

name: Chardonnay California Grand Reserve
review: Effusively fruity, with pretty pear, spice, pineapple and creamy vanilla flavors that fold together nicely in a seamless, elegant package. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay California Proprietor's Grand Reserve
review: Rich and generous, offering lots of buttery complexity supported by a solid core of grapefruit and pineapple crispness that extends into a long finish. Drinkable now, but has the stuff to age through 1993. 25,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay California The Proprietor's
review: Loaded with flavor, rich honey, apple, toasty oak, spice and clove flavors that are sikly smooth on the palate, round and full bodied. Long finish wit h sweet fruit impressions. Off-dry style.

name: Chardonnay Santa Maria Valley Camelot Vineyard
review: Smooth, ripe and creamy, striking a nice balance between its rich pear, fig, melon and spice character and the toasty, buttery oak. Finishes with a creamy flavor and texture. Keeps up the track record for this leading California winery. 10,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Maria Valley Camelot Vineyard
review: Wonderfully delicious Santa Maria Chardonnay. Broad, ripe, smooth, rich and creamy with pretty pear, spice and hazelnut flavors that are elegant and lively, showing toasty oak notes on the finish. Bracing acidity keeps the fruit fresh and lively. Drink now.

name: Merlot California Grand Reserve
review: Rich and fruity, boasting lots of plum, black cherry, currant and spicy mint notes, cedary oak and plush tannins. Packs a wallop with its flavor.

name: Merlot Sonoma County Grand Reserve
review: Jammed with fruit and well-structured, this offers bold black raspberry and mocha aromas and appealingly zesty red currant, spiced herb and toast flavors. Drink now through 2020. 19,914 cases made.

name: Merlot Sonoma County Vintner's Reserve
review: Zesty and polished, with red currant aromas and well-structured dark cherry, caramel and herb flavors, finishing with ripe tannins. Drink now through 2017.

name: Pinot Noir Anderson Valley Jackson Estate Outland Ridge
review: Distinctive for the rich, extracted flavors of earth, wild berry, gravel, road tar and licorice. Impressive on the finish, where the tannins offer grip and a measure of suppleness. Drink now through 2022. 1,024 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Lake County Vintner's Reserve
review: With powerful grassy, fruity aromas, full, crisp flavors and a lingering, light finish, this is unmistakably Sauvignon Blanc. Herbs, vanilla and tasty peach flavors fill out the profile. 80,000 cases made.

name: Syrah Sonoma Valley Durell Vineyard
review: Ripe, round and generous, with a burst of plum and berry flavors surrounded by nuances of vanilla, toast and black pepper. With its firm texture, it could use cellaring until 1992 to soften the tannin, but you could drink it now with hearty food.

name: Zinfandel Anderson Valley DuPratt Vineyard
review: Ripe and focused, with richness, elegance and plenty of plum, raspberry, vanilla and toast aromas and flavors. Echoes coffee and cocoa notes on the long finish. Shows maturity but has plenty of life. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel California Grand Reserve
review: Delivers a ripe, complex, supple core of blackberry and cherry flavors, dashes of spice and sage and adds subtle earth notes. Turns elegant and complex on the finish, where the tannins are soft and fleshy. Ready now through 2000. 1,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Alexander Valley Buckeye Vineyard Single Vineyard Series
review: Features tangy yet rich blackberry, black cherry, currant, vanilla and mocha flavors, all framed by very firm but ripe tannins. Needs time to unwind. Best from 2001 through 2008. 3,410 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon California Grand Reserve
review: This features bright, ripe and rich currant, black cherry and spice flavors that are focused and concentrated. Finishes with a burst of sweet fruit; best after 1998.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Great Estates
review: Serves up a lot of flavor, with mocha-laced currant and black cherry fruit that's sweet tasting and supple, before firming and flexing its tannic muscles on the finish. Best from 2003 through 2009. 4,659 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Arroyo Seco Great Estates
review: A delicious mouthful of Chardonnay, from its ripe, floral and fruity aromas to its rich layers of spicy pear, tangerine and nectarine, finishing with a sweet fruit aftertaste. Drink now through 2005. 2,596 cases made.

name: Chardonnay California Grand Reserve
review: Clean, with ripe, moderately rich and complex pear, fig, apple and smoky oak nuances. Finishes with a sense of elegance and polish and hints of pear and lime. Drink now through 2000.

name: Chardonnay California Vintner's Reserve
review: Ripe, round and lush, with spicy overtones to the lovely peach and pineapple aromas and flavors, harmonious and beautifully balanced. Drink now. 180,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Maria Valley Camelot Vineyard
review: Ripe, smooth and intense, with buttery pear and apple flavors welling up through layers of spice and toast notes. Finishes soft, round and beautifully balanced. Drinkable now.

name: Chardonnay Santa Maria Valley Camelot Vineyard Single Vineyard Series
review: Ripe and flavorful, with lots of spice, rich fig, pear and subtle honey notes. Turns smooth and creamy. Drink now through 2002. 38,527 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Maria Valley Jackson Estate
review: Lush and open-textured, with concentrated flavors of ripe apple, pear, dried peach and melon. Creamy midpalate, offering butter and spice notes on the juicy finish. Drink now through 2020. 6,263 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast Great Estates
review: Fragrant fruit and floral aromas lead to an elegant band of spicy pear, apple, tangerine and apricot flavors that are focused, complex and concentrated. Finishes with a clean, zesty aftertaste. Drink now through 2008. 2,426 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast Great Estates
review: Packs in lots of ripe, rich, complex flavors, with buttery pear, fig, apricot and earthy citrus, finishing with pretty, toasty oak and a long, complex aftertaste. Drink now through 2006. 3,625 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast Great Estates
review: Features a tight beam of citrus, pear and lemon drop, and subtle nutmeg shades that are deep and complex, finishing with a lively aftertaste. Drink now through 2006. 2,121 cases made.

name: Merlot Sonoma County Vintner's Reserve
review: There's good cut to this minerally red, which features luscious raspberry, dark plum and blackberry flavors. Well-structured, with a spicy and chocolaty finish. Drink now through 2020. 100,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Sonoma County Vintner's Reserve
review: Sleek and well-built, with appealing notes of black cherry, spicy toast and herb. Drink now through 2023. 50,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Sonoma County Vintner's Reserve
review: Spry and well-balanced, with appealing aromas of currant and tomato leaf and focused flavors of cherry, spiced herb and cedar. Drink now through 2020. 50,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Anderson Valley Jackson Estate
review: A subtle, graceful style, with a layered mix of delicate wild berry, gravel, blackberry, road tar, cedar and dried herb flavors, framed by fine-grained tannins. Lingers on the finish. Drink now through 2020. 3,445 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir California Vintner's Reserve
review: Well done, with a rich core of berry, plum, spice and light oak, building depth and dimension. Tapers off on the finish. Drink now through 2018. 50,000 cases made.

name: Royale Meritage California
review: Bright and intriguing, with passion fruit, citrus and pear flavors that just don't quit. If there is oak, it is well submerged. Delicious to drink now.

name: Summation Vintner's Reserve California
review: The jammy blackberry and smoky spice aromas open to zesty and easygoing plum, licorice and bitter chocolate flavors. Syrah, Zinfandel, Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Petite Sirah. Drink now through 2019.

name: Syrah Sonoma Valley Durell Vineyard
review: Ripe and smooth, with generous berry and plum aromas and flavors nicely tuned by a light touch of new oak. The tannins are well integrated, and it is intense and elegant on the long finish. Drinkable now.

name: Zinfandel California Proprietor's Grand Reserve
review: A dark, inky, richly flavored Zinfandel that packs in lots of spicy raspberry, cherry and wild berry flavors and stays in focus, finishing with a long, lingering aftertaste. An exciting, elegant 1990 that's fun to drink now and should age well through 1997.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Alexander Valley Buckeye Vineyard Single Vineyard Series
review: Smooth, ripe and lush, with a pretty core of herb-accented plum and cherry flavors. Turns supple and fleshy on the finish. Ready to drink.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Alexander Valley Great Estates
review: Intense, with a complex mix of dry, dusty berry, currant, black cherry, cedar, mineral and anise. Depth and richness to the flavors. Turns dry and firmly tannic on the finish. Best from 2003 through 2009. 4,445 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Alexander Valley Jackson Estate
review: Strong cedary oak shows throughout, with firm, gravelly dark berry, mineral, wood and sage notes, making for a rustic, roughhewn effort. Best from 2018 through 2026. 9,515 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Alexander Valley Jackson Estate
review: Displays sturdy, gripping, earth- and herb-laced tannins that tilt toward the drying side, revealing a savory personality and supple texture. Drink now through 2023. 8,123 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Great Estates
review: Ripe and firm, with a burst of blackberry, violet and black cherry flavors. Herb, cedar and earth tones fold in on the finish, where there's a trace of heat. Drink now through 2007. 5,036 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma County Grand Reserve
review: Smooth-textured, with pure, ripe cherry, plum and wild berry notes that are supple and graceful. Easy to drink and nicely proportioned. Drink now through 2020.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma County Grand Reserve
review: This supple, graceful red shows medium-weight currant, mineral, black licorice and spice notes. Well-proportioned, ending clean and pure. Drink now through 2018.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma County Vintner's Reserve
review: Herb, dill and cedar notes are prominent amid taut, dry dark berry and cigar box flavors. Ends as it begins, with a tight structure. Drink now through 2028. 100,000 cases made.

name: Cardinale Meritage California
review: Firm and tight, with crisp tannins and plenty of toasty, buttery oak, but the currant and plum flavors are chunky, bright and lively. This is a solid 1989 that needs cellaring; it should be softer and more complex in 1996.

name: Chardonnay Arroyo Seco Paradise Vineyard Single Vineyard Series
review: A touch earthy, it works its way into more mainstream fruit flavors, with ripe pear, apricot and toasty oak. Finishes with complex oak and more fruit. Drink now through 2001.

name: Chardonnay California Avant
review: This robust wine offers oaky overtones to the flavors of apple, pear and allspice. Finishes with notes of dried mint and cardamom. Drink now through 2020. 50,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay California Avant
review: A nervy style, featuring vibrant acidity that enlivens the core of grapefruit and lemon-citrus flavors, ending long and clean, with a lemon peel bite. Drink now through 2019.

name: Chardonnay California Grand Reserve
review: Bright and easy-drinking, with tangy peach pit, pear and pretty honey notes, picking up richer, toasty oak character on the finish. Drink now. 50,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay California Grand Reserve
review: Ripe and polished, with creamy pear and hints of apple and spice, turning to citrus and spicy, anise-tinged oak. Drink now through 2001. 62,305 cases made.

name: Chardonnay California The Proprietor's
review: Effusively fruity, moderately rich and complex with a trace of sweet Chardonnay fruit that echos honey, melon, pear and subtle oak flavors and hints of tropical fruit. Smooth and lush texture. Drink 1990 to '92. 21,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay California Vintner's Reserve
review: Displays a mix of fresh, lively, snappy citrus, nectarine and tangerine flavors that turn supple and fleshy. Drink now through 2020.

name: Chardonnay Monterey Great Estates
review: Smells fresh and fragrant, with a rich array of lively tangerine, nectarine, pear and earthy honeysuckle flavors. Long and complex on the finish, with a nice touch of spice. Drink now through 2004. 2,616 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Monterey-Santa Barbara Counties Grand Reserve
review: Deftly balanced, offering creamy oak notes, with touches of ripe pear, butterscotch and baked apple. A pleasant spiciness shows on the finish. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay Monterey-Santa Barbara-Sonoma Counties Grand Reserve
review: Fresh scents of peach and citrus lead to a tight, lemony beam of flavors, picking up hints of vanilla, and finishing with a burst of fruit and complexity. Drink now through 2008. 50,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Barbara-Monterey Counties Grand Reserve
review: Clean, pure aromas of honeysuckle, honeydew, light oak and baking spices give this lots of energy and a persistent aftertaste. The texture shows a touch of pithy citrus skin. Drink now. 50,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Barbara-Monterey Counties Grand Reserve
review: Clean and snappy, with floral and white peach aromas and mouthwatering flinty grapefruit and citrus notes. Drink now through 2017.

name: Chardonnay Santa Maria Valley Camelot Vineyard
review: Offers attractive ripe pear, apple, honey and citrus notes and holds its focus on the finish, where it turns elegant.

name: Chardonnay Santa Maria Valley Camelot Vineyard Single Vineyard Series
review: Rich and refreshing, with pretty oak shading the fig, vanilla, citrus, mocha and tangerine flavors. Drink now through 2003. 22,098 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Maria Valley Jackson Estate
review: Rich fig and smoky oak notes fold together in this full-bodied effort. The fruit is ripe and tilts toward pear, melon and apple flavors, while the oak adds a nice touch. Ends clean and pure. Drink now. 12,627 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Maria Valley Jackson Estate
review: Nicely done in an oaky style, with toast and smoke notes holding the upper hand over white peach and nectarine flavors. Drink now. 12,293 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Maria Valley Stature Limited Release
review: An exotic, flavorful wine, with tasty pear, peach, vanilla and smoky marshmallow flavors that show a bit of rawness from oak on the finish. Drink now. 582 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Great Estates
review: Nicely proportioned, with rich, intense, smoky, toasty oak built around the core of pear, fig and citrus flavors. Gains complexity and nuance. Drink now through 2005. 1,177 cases made.

name: Merlot Sonoma County Grand Reserve
review: Solidly built, with aromas of currant and cedar leading to firm flavors of cherry, herb and spice. Drink now through 2023. 14,216 cases made.

name: Merlot Sonoma County Great Estates
review: Supple textured, with a mix of creamy mocha, earth, mineral and currant flavors and a touch of rustic earthiness. Complex and concentrated, with a twinge of vegetal herbaceousness and gritty tannins. Drink now through 2008. 4,274 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir California Grand Reserve
review: Supple and elegant, marked by toasty oak, and the ripe cherry and spicy plum flavors glide past the soft tannins.

name: Pinot Noir California Vintner's Reserve
review: Tight, with a firm beam of cola-laced dried berry and sour cherry flavors. Gains and expands, with a slightly stemmy ending. Drink now through 2019.

name: Pinot Noir California Vintner's Reserve
review: Smooth and polished, with complex black cherry, anise, spice and tasty oak. All well-balanced, finishing with an alluring, even delicate aftertaste. Ready now.

name: Pinot Noir Carneros Stature Limited Release
review: Supple, with a fleshy texture and delicate black cherry, plum and blackberry flavors. Finishes with mineral, sage and dried fruit notes, supported by firm tannins. Drink now through 2006. 54 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Monterey-Santa Barbara Counties Grand Reserve
review: Fruity aromas of raspberry and blackberry are shaded by light oak and fresh earth accents. The acidity is fresh and lively, and the tannins show a firm, herbal edge. Drink now through 2024. 5,037 cases made.

name: Riesling Monterey County Vintner's Reserve
review: Vibrant and juicy, with plenty of lime juice accenting the pear, peach and yellow apple flavors. Fresh and pure on the finish. Drink now. 40,000 cases made.

name: Rosé Vintner's Reserve California
review: Delicate and pretty, with floral strawberry and watermelon flavors. Drink now. 6,007 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc California Vintner's Reserve
review: Appealing for its juicy acidity and lively citrus, ripe peach and pineapple flavors, with a hint of minerality. There's good intensity, and the flavors linger on the long finish. Drink now. 250,000 cases made.

name: Summation California
review: An intriguing blend, featuring smoky black cherry and spice aromas, with notes of zesty plum, toasted anise and tar. Zinfandel, Syrah, Merlot, Grenache and Petite Sirah. Drink now through 2018.

name: Summation Vintner's Reserve California
review: A zesty blend, featuring nicely focused flavors of baked cherry, licorice and smoked pepper, with just enough tannic bite to maintain interest. Zinfandel, Merlot, Syrah, Cabernet Sauvignon, Petite Sirah, Grenache and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2017.

name: Syrah California Grand Reserve
review: A rich and mouth-filling, beautifully balanced red, with blackberry, black cherry and black pepper flavors competing for attention. Drinkable now as an effusively fruity wine; may be best from 1996.

name: Syrah California Proprietor's Grand Reserve
review: Bold, rich and spicy, with plush, jammy plum, raspberry and cherry flavors that are smooth and polished. Has depth and concentration and the flavors linger; inviting to drink now, or cellar through 1996.

name: Syrah Santa Barbara County Vintner's Reserve
review: Soft but zesty, with easygoing notes of black raspberry, orange zest and bittersweet chocolate. Drink now through 2023. 23,149 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Anderson Valley DuPratt Vineyard
review: Has a wonderful sense of harmony and finesse, with spicy, peppery cherry and raspberry flavors playing off toasty, buttery oak notes. Offers fine balance, crisp acidity and a long, fruity finish. Tasty now, but should hold well through 1998.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Great Estates
review: Complex, weaving together ripe plum, blackberry, mineral, sage and tea notes, elegantly balanced, long and flavorful on the finish. Drink now through 2006. 1,288 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Mendocino
review: Earthy and complex, with fresh, ripe cherry, plum and raspberry flavors that are rich and intense and finish with fine length. The tannins are well proportioned. Drink now to 1994. 12,000 cases made.

name: Avant Red Blend California
review: A pleasant quaff, with easygoing flavors of ripe cherry, sweet toasty oak and spice. Merlot, Syrah, Malbec, Cabernet Sauvignon and Carignane. Drink now through 2017.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Alexander Valley Buckeye Vineyard Single Vineyard Series
review: Firm texture and pretty fruit flavors promise much in this well-modulated wine, which echoes its plum and black cherry flavors enticingly on the chewy finish. Best after 2000. 3,571 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Alexander Valley Great Estates
review: Firm and concentrated, with wild berry, violet, blackberry and plum flavors. Cedary overtones and solid tannins extend through a vibrant, lingering finish. Drink now through 2007. 2,537 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon California Grand Reserve
review: Crisp, with firm tannins and just enough spicy currant and berry flavor to give it the depth and complexity you might hope for at this price.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon California Grand Reserve
review: Dark, rich, chocolaty and still firmly tannic, with ripe cherry, herb and dusty cedar notes, touches of mineral and metallic flavors. Appears to be drying out, so best soon.--California Cabernet retrospective. Drink now through 2004. 9,860 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon California Proprietor's Grand Reserve
review: Smooth, spicy and generously fruity, offering currant, berry and vanilla aromas and flavors that keep shining through the finish. The tannins are well submerged, but should keep this developing through 1996.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon California Vintner's Reserve
review: Ripe and juicy, with fleshy plum, blackberry and wild berry fruit that's well-centered and supple in texture, with a touch of leather and mineral. Drink now through 2007. 50,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma County Grand Reserve
review: The tannins are assertive and dominant, with a savory tobacco leaf presence amid dried berry and anise flavors. A cedary oak note weighs in. Drink now. 50,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma County Grand Reserve
review: A fairly dry and tannic offering, dense and chewy, with dark berry notes and earth-laced fruit buried underneath. Drink now through 2023. 40,028 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Arroyo Seco Paradise Vineyard Single Vineyard Series
review: Clean and attractive, with a core of ripe peach and citrus flavors. Fans out on the finish, picking up toasty oak and spice notes. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay California Avant
review: Offers a subtle mix of tropical fruit, pineapple, guava and floral scents. Drink now through 2017.

name: Chardonnay California Grand Reserve
review: Ripe and juicy, with layers of peach, pear, citrus, butter and light coconut-toasty oak flavors. Drink now through 2002. 65,853 cases made.

name: Chardonnay California Grand Reserve
review: Strikes a nice balance between ripe, polished pear and hazelnut flavors with light oak shadings. Elegant and refined, it turns smooth and spicy on the finish. Ready now.

name: Chardonnay California Vintner's Reserve
review: Features flavors centered on white flower, white peach, spice, honeysuckle and spice. Easy to enjoy. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay California Vintner's Reserve
review: One of the better Vintner's Reserves of late, smooth, ripe and creamy, with complex pear, apple and spice notes that are supple and tender. Drink now through 2000.

name: Chardonnay California Vintner's Reserve
review: Features ripe, intense, concentrated flavors of pear, spice, apple and hazelnut that are pure and refreshing, if a tad on the sweet side.

name: Chardonnay Monterey-Santa Barbara Counties Grand Reserve
review: Richly spiced, with ripe apple, pear tart and dried apricot flavors. Buttery notes carry through to the creamy finish, with dried savory herb accents. Drink now. 100,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Maria Valley Camelot Bench Estate Series
review: Refreshing, with its mix of lemon, tangerine and pineapple notes, which are intensified by a toasted marshmallow note that lingers on the finish. Drink now through 2006. 22,873 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Maria Valley Camelot Highlands Highland Estates
review: Serves up lots of ripe, juicy pear, apple and melon flavors with a nice citrus accent. Smooth. The flavors glide across the palate, ending with a complex aftertaste that echoes the flavors. Drink now. 220 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Durell Vineyard
review: Ripe, generous and sharply focused, this lean-textured wine is bursting with flavors. Pear, apple, fig and spice aromas and flavors keep darting over the palate through the long, generous finish. Drinkable now.

name: Merlot California Grand Reserve
review: Lively, with good depth to fresh herb, plum and currant flavors, nicely underscored by firm tannins and toasty oak. Drink now through 2005. 2,200 cases made.

name: Merlot California Grand Reserve
review: Very ripe and oaky, with stewed plum and black cherry flavors tilting toward jammy; seems high in alcohol. May harmonize with time. Drink now through 2006. 2,200 cases made.

name: Merlot California Vintner's Reserve
review: Serves up a pretty array of ripe, supple cherry, plum and strawberry flavors with appealing spice notes. Finishes with firm tannins and turns diffuse. Ready now through 1998.

name: Merlot North Coast Stature Limited Release
review: Struggles to find a focus, at first an intense style, with spicy currant, mint and cedary flavors that turn muddled by earthy, mulchy notes. Straightens out on the finish, so short-term cellaring is best. But it's expensive for what you get. Drink now through 2007. 216 cases made.

name: Merlot Sonoma County The Proprietor's
review: Well proportioned with ripe currant and cherry flavors and toasty oak notes that add amplitude to the flavors. The tannins finish strong with a hint of herbs and spice. Best to start drinking now to 1996. 6,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Anderson Valley Jackson Estate
review: Loamy earth dominates the modest berry flavors in this medium weight effort, more solid than special. Drink now through 2020. 3,292 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Anderson Valley Jackson Estate
review: Presents a modest mix of dusty red berry, savory herb and light cedar notes, in a style that's balanced yet short on dimension. Drink now. 5,874 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Arroyo Seco Seco Highlands Highland Estates
review: A rustic style, with a rich band of anise, wild berry and cherry fruit that's concentrated. Unfolds to reveal an earthy, mineral scent. Drink now through 2008. 839 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir California Vintner's Reserve
review: Supple, with some meaty hints to the dried berry and cherry tart flavors. The spicy finish has some richness. Drink now. 41,770 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Monterey County Great Estates
review: A delicate, suble style, weaving together hints of smoke, charred wood, wet earthen floor and cherry-raspberry flavors that linger. Mild tannins. Drink now through 2005. 2,238 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Stature Limited Release
review: Firm and spicy, with cola, mustard seed, earth and black cherry flavors, finishing with a touch of bitterness from tannins. A solid effort. Drink now through 2005. 83 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Stature Limited Release
review: Nicely perfumed rose petal, plum and black cherry aromas make an easy, graceful entry on the palate, showing a hint of tartness but also zesty raspberry and wild berry notes. Clean and well structured. First bottle corky. Drink now through 2009. 202 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc California Grand Reserve
review: Fresh and spicy, a simple, fruity wine with bright, citrusy flavors that last and last on the lively finish.

name: Sauvignon Blanc California Grand Reserve
review: Crisp and bright, offering some nice herbal grace notes to the lemony melody. A stylish wine that remains lively through the long finish. Refreshing. Drink now.

name: Sauvignon Blanc California Vintner's Reserve
review: Traces of smoke and floral honeysuckle notes add some charm to the core of juicy lemon, lime and green apple flavors. Offers a great fleshy texture. Drink now.

name: Sauvignon Blanc California Vintner's Reserve
review: Ripe, rich, spicy flavors of peach and nectarine have great focus and intensity, with juicy citrus notes and a long, lingering finish. Drink now. 200,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Marin County
review: Simple, earthy herb and dried berry flavors are tired. Drink now. 160 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Ripe and full-bodied, with penetrating black cherry, currant and black olive, teetering on jammy, sweet and rich. Unfolds to reveal extra flavor nuances of blackberry, hazelnut and spice. Drink now through 2015. 765 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Napa Valley Caitlin's Select
review: Serves up a rich, generous mix of dark berry fruit, with touches of spice, cedar, plum and blackberry. Well-proportioned, full-bodied and focused, ending with a lingering finish of dark berry, black licorice and spice. Drink now through 2020. 747 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Calistoga Chris's Cuvée
review: Smooth, rich and layered, with dense blackberry, cherry, roasted coffee and mocha notes, fanning out and gaining depth on the finish. Drink now through 2026. 505 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Calistoga Chris's Cuvée
review: Rustic in style, with chewy tannins built around a core of chunky plum and dark berry, unfolding to notes of cedar and licorice. Ends with dusty, crushed rock tannins. Best from 2014 through 2024. 500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Chris's Cuvée
review: Solid and chunky, with lively, rich, focused plum, wild berry and blueberry fruit that's complex and layered, firming midpalate and ending with a finish that highlights the fruit themes. Best from 2012 through 2019. 605 cases made.

name: Merlot Calistoga
review: Bold aromas of black currant and espresso lead to dense, rich flavors of black raspberry, mocha and spicy cedar. Drink now through 2020. 285 cases made.

name: Pickett Road Red Calistoga
review: Vibrant and ripe, with cherry and pencil lead aromas and zesty flavors of blueberry, fresh herb and cedar. Merlot and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2018. 212 cases made.

name: Pickett Road Red Napa Valley
review: Rich yet gutsy, delivering black currant and olive aromas that lead to firm, layered flavors of plum, bittersweet chocolate and cedar. Merlot, Petit Verdot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2012. 496 cases made.

name: Merlot Calistoga
review: Fleshy and appealingly ripe, with black cherry and toasty herb aromas and supple flavors wrapped around a tight core of currant, mineral and cedar. Drink now through 2019. 400 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley
review: Bright and aromatic, displaying lemon meringue, lime zest and peach blossom notes that are pretty and sophisticated, with a juicy core and terrific persistence. Drink now. 226 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Calistoga Chris's Cuvée
review: Dusty, savory herb notes weigh heavily on the core earthy and berry flavors. Some will find this alluring. The tannins are drying. Drink now through 2026. 650 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Calistoga Chris's Cuvée
review: Exhibits dark berry, smoke, mocha and cedar accents in a full-bodied style, with taut tannins. Ends with good length and subtle flavor nuances. Drink now through 2021. 509 cases made.

name: Petite Sirah Calistoga
review: There's a savory soy edge to the dense plum and black cherry flavors, with chewy tannins and highlights of tea and spice on the finish. Drink now through 2026. 100 cases made.

name: Pickett Road White Calistoga
review: Fresh pineapple and lemon notes lend a crisp edge to the peach, melon and apple flavors, with plenty of aromatic highlights from the spice and dried floral details. Grenache Blanc, Marsanne and Viognier. Drink now. 288 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Calistoga
review: The orange blossom, fleshy melon and apricot flavors are intense and spicy, with plenty of follow-through on the juicy finish. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Calistoga
review: There's good intensity to the tangy, juicy peach, apricot and dried mango flavors. A good beam of acidity runs through the wine, with juicy results. Drink now. 442 cases made.

name: Merlot Calistoga
review: Tautly built, with a core of firm tannins paired with reserved flavors of currant, cedar and dusty herb. Drink now through 2026. 400 cases made.

name: Merlot Calistoga
review: Quite ripe and blowsy, with appealing baked cherry and spice flavors. Drink now through 2017. 450 cases made.

name: Petite Sirah Calistoga
review: Opens with a mouthful of chewy tannins and notes of toasted spice and nut. Plum, cherry and black tea accents on the finish. Drink now. 190 cases made.

name: Pickett Road White Calistoga
review: Tangy, with pungent citrus, apple and peach notes, vivid acidity and an herbal accent on the finish. Grenache Blanc, Marsanne and Viognier. Drink now. 330 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Calistoga
review: Tangy melon, dried mango and citrus flavors are fleshy and juicy, with floral details on the finish. Drink now. 830 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Calistoga
review: The citrus, spice and melon flavors are robust, with a good amount of acidity. Spicy finish. Drink now. 445 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley
review: Tight and rather hard, with cherry and tomato leaf aromas and tart plum and dry, cedary flavors. Drink now. 195 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley
review: Intense and ripe, but offers both sweet and sour notes, plus aromas of plum, cayenne and toasty oak. Drink now. 200 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Napa Valley Caitlin's Select
review: Wild berry and currant flavors, along with some rough tannins, veer toward balsamic notes, with a dull finish. 557 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley
review: Offers odd aromas of peat moss and cedar, with earthy, herb flavors. 192 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Ripe and fleshy, with melon, kiwifruit and peach flavors that show richness in addition to a crisp, vibrant finish, revealing a hint of lemongrass. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Fresh and zingy, with pretty grapefruit and green papaya flavors that remain refreshing through the open-textured finish. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Syrah Waiheke Island
review: This is lively, tangy and peppery in both aroma and flavor, with the currant and plum fruit balancing the spiciness nicely, hinting at mineral notes as the finish lingers. Drink now through 2013. 280 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Berakah Estate
review: Bright and lively, with an oily character that plays beautifully off the vivid lime, passion fruit and white peach flavors that echo on the zingy finish. Drink now. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Berakah Estate
review: A sense of sweetness to the apricot, pear and citrus flavors balances the jazzy acidity and lingers on the finish. Drink now. 400 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Bright, with fine vibrancy to lime skin, grass and grapefruit flavors. Crushed stone notes accent the finish. Drink now. 1,800 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Tart and lively, with lime, grass and green pear flavors. Tangy acidity lingers with sweet pea notes. Drink now. 1,800 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Waiheke Island
review: Peach, pear and citrus flavors have a nice fleshy quality, leading to tangy acidity and mineral notes on the finish. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Distinctive white pepper notes add aromatic lift to the light and crisp lemon-lime flavors. Drink now. 1,800 cases made.

name: Syrah Yakima Valley Reserve
review: Bright and jazzy, with a lively balance of acidity to the ripe blackberry and plum flavors, persisting nicely against fine tannins into the finish. Drink now through 2019. 187 cases made.

name: Tempranillo Columbia Valley Reserve
review: Lithe, expressive and appealing, with ripe plum and floral flavors. A hint of pepper and thyme weaves through the finish. Drink now through 2018. 121 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Maria Valley Sierra Madre Vineyards
review: Flinty peach, tangerine and nectarine flavors have a smoky, toasty edge that provides a rich mouthfeel. The oak adds a complex flavor dimension. Drink now through 2011. 1,225 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Santa Maria Valley Santa Maria Cuvée
review: Still a touch green, with herb, green apple, spice and pithy citrus notes that are complex and elegant, if a bit simple on the finish. Drink now through 2010. 3,500 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Maria Valley Nielson Vineyard
review: Tight and flinty, with fresh loamy earth, mineral, blackberry and boysenberry fruit that's intense and concentrated. Drink now through 2011. 90 cases made.

name: Viognier Paso Robles Live Oak Vineyard
review: Effusively fragrant floral notes, with peach, nectarine and apricot flavors. Persistent and juicy, with a long, spicy finish. Drink now. 90 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Maria Valley Sierra Madre Vineyards
review: Complex, with savory herb, dried currant, wild berry and spicy black and red licorice flavors, turning elegant and persistent. Drink now through 2012. 343 cases made.

name: Albariño Santa Maria Valley Riverbench Vineyard
review: Juicy and crisp, with spicy lemon and pear flavors and a touch of spice on the finish. Drink now. 354 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Maria Valley Bien Nacido Vineyard
review: Savory herb, dried berry, earth and herbal flavors give this a taut, trim structure. It picks up depth on the finish, but never outgrows its herbal qualities. Drink now through 2011. 238 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Maria Valley Santa Maria Cuvée
review: An earthy style that's pungent and marked by smoked herb, tar, dried berry and mineral more than pure fruit. Drink now. 6,317 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Ynez Valley Larner Vineyard
review: Rich and savory, with a medley of herb, spice, wild berry and blackberry flavors that are elegant and well-proportioned, with a hint of ginger and firm tannins. Drink now through 2012. 208 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Ynez Valley Purisima Mountain Vineyard
review: Tight, intense and concentrated, with vibrant wild berry, blackberry and a mix of herb, sage and pepper notes. The tannins and acidity provide a crisp mouthfeel, and this shows some heat from midpalate on. Drink now through 2012. 96 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Rita Hills Lafond Vineyard
review: Concentrated and brawny, with an assortment of chewy berry, beef, pomegranate and freshly ground black pepper flavors. Tannins are firm but ripe, with lingering cedar character. Drink now through 2008. 250 cases made.

name: Grenache Santa Ynez Valley Larner Vineyard
review: Spice, pepper and wild berry jam aromas fold over to the palate, where they're ripe, balanced and fruity, with moderate tannins. Drink now through 2009. 180 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Rita Hills Clos Pepe Vineyard
review: Tightly wound, firm and focused, with blueberry and wild berry scents that are intense and vibrant, with good acidity and tannins. Should benefit from short-term cellaring. Drink now through 20111. 95 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Rita Hills Evans Ranch
review: Ripe and luscious, with delicate aromas of white pepper, black raspberry and earth. Nicely complex, with vanilla, black cherry and lots of spice. Drink now. 189 cases made.

name: Grenache Santa Ynez Valley Larner Vineyard
review: Tight, intense and vibrant, with snappy crushed berry, black cherry and spicy, peppery, minerally notes that are firm and focused and best served by short-term cellaring. Best from 2010 through 2014. 322 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Barbara County Four Play
review: Intense, firm and spicy, with savory herb, pepper, dried berry and a gamy meat edge. Turns dry and minerally on the finish. Drink now through 2014. 448 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Barbara County Verna's Vineyard
review: Marked by herb, beef, dried berry, sage and underbrush flavors. Intense, full-bodied, complex and spicy, ending with firm tannins. Drink now through 2014. 139 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Rita Hills Babcock Vineyard
review: Medium-weight candied cherry and berry flavors are simple yet appealing. Drink now. 200 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Strikes a nice balance between ripe, spicy Chardonnay flavors and pale oak shadings, creating a clean wine, delicate and understated but building to a complex aftertaste, with pear, apple and hazelnut notes. Impressive. 1,727 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Sleek and elegant, with a racy edge to the grapefruit, tart apple and melon notes, finishing with a crisp, clean aftertaste. Drink now through 2001. 3,009 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Intense and lively, with a complex, concentrated range of toasty oak, spicy pear and creamy vanilla. Youthful and tight now, but the flavors keep pumping out on the finish. Should drink well through 1996. 1,125 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley Carneros
review: Elegant and concentrated, with firm, intense pear and pineapple flavors that are crisp and lively, with subtle oak shadings adding dimension and texture. Well balanced and complex on the finish. Drink now to 1994. 1,373 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Ripe fruit and toasty oak fold together nicely, with complex pear, apple, citrus and woody flavors that add depth and dimension. Drink now through 2001. 2,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Firm and supple, with spicy pear, toasty oak and light, earthy flavors, finishing with a burst of fruit. Drinks well now. 692 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Carneros
review: Tight, firm and intense. A nice core of currant, herb and spice flavors turns dry and tannic, but a burst of fruit on the finish keeps it interesting. Drink now to '99. 1,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley Carneros
review: Tastes like it's made from a strong Muscat clone, with spice and floral flavors and honey and oak notes on the finish. Has a pretty aftertaste. Drink now to 1993. Much better than a bottle tasted earlier.

name: Pinot Noir Carneros
review: Serves up a pretty array of ripe plum and strawberry jam flavors, with a smooth, polished texture and fine length. Offers a measure of elegance and grace. Drinks well now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Carneros
review: Tight and firm, softening a bit in texture, with herb, cherry and cedar notes. Drink now. 880 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: A spicy, herbaceous style that should pair well with spicy foods. Well-balanced, supple and medium-bodied, with touches of bell pepper, black cherry and candied cherry. Good acidity and supple tannins. Drink now through 2007. 996 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Serves up a nice core of ripe pear and apple, but the flavors lack the extra dimensions and finesse you might hope for at this price. 1,100 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Carneros
review: A bit disjointed now, the ripe plum and black cherry flavors aren't quite in sync with the spicy oak, and the tannins merit another year or two in the bottle. 2,042 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Carneros
review: Solid, with generous, smoothly integrated black cherry, black currant, toast and spice flavors. Finishes firm and focused. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley
review: Butter and vanilla tones weave nicely into peach, anise and fig flavors. Drink now. 225 cases made.

name: Dolcetto Napa Valley
review: A blue bottle? Seems appropriate for a fresh, snappy wine, with nice blueberry and plum aromas and flavors. Gets a little tannic on the finish, but food should take care of that. Drinkable now. 75 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Carneros
review: Minty, with tobacco, red currant and tart cranberry flavors. Drink now. 3,302 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Carneros
review: Starts off with smoky, plummy notes, but on the palate it shows a stemmy, slightly bitter edge. Regains speed on the finish with a cherry and cedar core couched in firm tannins. Color is light. Drink now through 2002. 2,250 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Carneros
review: Marked by spicy, peppery flavors, it's an elegant, understated style with hints of herb and cherry, on the lighter side. 2,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Carneros
review: An earthy, juniper flavor overrides the spicy cherry and plum notes now, which we find rather clumsy. The finish shows off more wood and more of the juniper flavor, but with time it may come together. Drinkable now. 1,027 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Firm, flavorful and definitely earthy, with a strong core of blackberry and currant flavors shaded by leathery undertones. Drinkable now.

name: Pinot Noir Carneros Reserve
review: Eucalyptus and menthol notes are dominant in this wine of some depth, and a dry structure underlies the red fruit flavors. Drink now through 2002. 350 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley Carneros
review: Has spicy, perfumed aromas and flavors, but turns brackish on the palate and loses its velocity and focus. May become better knit with time. Drinkable now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Carneros
review: Modest sour cherry, tobacco and cola aromas and flavors, ending with dry, leathery tannins. 1,222 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma County Artist Series
review: Spicy, floral and perfumed Cabernet, a late-release from the '96 vintage, showing off earthy, cedary black cherry and blackberry flavors, and pretty, toast- and vanilla-scented notes. Unusually supple and polished version of this wine. Drink now through 2007. 4,300 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma Valley Artist Series
review: A rich, massive, mouthful of Cabernet with loads of cassis, currants, plum and cherry that's very bright, concentrated and intense, framed by tannin and oak. A long-termer with an underlying feel of elegance. Another terrific Artist Series.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma Valley Artist Series 20th Anniversary
review: Beautifully crafted, sleek and elegant, sharply focused on ripe, rich cherry, currant, plum and berry. Picks up pretty floral and spicy nuances and the tannins, while firm, are supple and integrated. Best from 2000 through 2007. 3,200 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma Valley Artist Series
Chardonnay Santa Maria-Sonoma Valley Reserve
review: Shows a spicy, Muscat-like edge and complex, interesting flavors of tropical fruits, pear, guava, citrus and spice. A delicious blend of Sonoma Valley and Santa Maria Valley grapes. 2,092 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma Valley Jack London Vineyard
review: Big and still jammed with fruit, offering black cherry and toasted spice aromas and ripe, rich flavors of huckleberry, caramel and anise.Blind '94/'04 California Zinfandel retrospective (March 2014). Drink now through 2018. 4,237 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma County Artist Series
review: This is a classy, Bordeaux-like rendition, displaying firm, tight cedar accents and crushed rock tannins that lead to a dense, firm core of dark, rich berry, dried herb, green olive and tobacco leaf notes. Ends with gripping tannins cloaked around juicy fruit. Drink now through 2024. 1,016 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma Valley
review: Firm, focused and flavorful, offering distinctive spice and mint-tinged Cabernet characteristics, lots of currant and plum flavors and more richness, depth and concentration than most '89s. Oak seasoning adds a nice dimension, and the tannins are sufficient to warrant cellaring through 1995 to '98. 23,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma Valley
review: A big, brawny style that's tight, closed and packed with rich, ripe plum, currant and black cherry flavors and a good dose of tannin and oak on the finish. May be ready by 1997.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma Valley Artist Series
review: Smooth, ripe and complex, with a pretty array of spicy currant, black cherry, anise, sage and cedary oak flavors. Rich and concentrated. Most of the tannin has softened quite enjoyably.--1987 California Cabernet horizontal. Drink now through 2002. 4,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma Valley Artist Series
review: Deep and intense, with a sense of elegance surrounding the black cherry, mint and curant flavors. The tannins are firm and gritty but the fruit fights through on the finish. Needs cellaring. Begin drinking 1993 to '95.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma Valley Jack London Vineyard
review: Concentrated and tannic with a soft underlying feel. Plenty of rich chocolate, cherry and berry flavors that are velvety on the palate before the tannins take over. Best yet from this vineyard. Needs cellaring.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Reserve
review: Ripe and generous, with broad-brush marshmallow, peach, cream and pear flavors that unfold on an intense, toasty finish. Deftly balanced, with pretty smoky, toasty oak shadings, it finishes with a burst of complexity. Drink now through 2007. 2,100 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Reserve
review: Intense and lively, showing a ripe, rich, focused core of spicy pear, vanilla and hazelnut flavors that are finely balanced. Stays rich without being heavy and keeps repeating the fresh fruit flavors on the finish. Drink now. First Reserve Chardonnay from Kenwood. 3,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Sonoma County
review: Tangy, with high-toned lemon-lime, grapefruit, fig and peach flavors. Already harmonious, with a bright vibrancy that will complement food. Kenwood's at the top of its Sauvignon game. Drink now through 2007. 78,000 cases made.

name: Murasaki Napa Valley
review: Beautifully crafted, intense and richly flavored without being weighty, offering a mix of dried berry, dried herb, cedar, black licorice and gravel. The flavors roll together on a long, complex finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Petit Verdot, Cabernet Franc and Malbec. Drink now through 2024. 717 cases made.

name: Rindo Napa Valley
review: Beautifully crafted, sleek and elegant, with rich, complex espresso, dried currant, black licorice and cigar box flavors. Firm, balanced, long and detailed. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2024. 3,740 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Ai
review: Muscular and austere, with a tight, taut band of dried berry, cedar, tobacco and crushed rock. A wine that begs for aeration or cellaring. Ends with an attractive black licorice edge. Best from 2014 through 2024. 1,100 cases made.

name: Rindo Napa Valley
review: A sleek, racy, herbaceous style, with smoky charred oak aromas joined by ripe plum and cherry flavors. Ends with supple, fine-grained tannins, good length and a supple texture. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2026.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley Asatsuyu
review: A zingy, pure lemon note at the core of this wine is wrapped in nuances of smoke, dried flowers, marmalade, mineral and touches of celery leaf. Pure and detailed, displaying a seamless, crisp body. Drink now. 802 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley Asatsuyu
review: Displays a distinctive and impressive beam of lemon curd and butter notes, with a rich, full texture, plenty of acidity and a wonderful core of ripe citrus, melon, spice, smoke and tropical details that expand on the lingering finish. Drink now. 600 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Ai
review: Very tight and reminiscent of a Bordeaux, this offers lots of cedary cigar box and tobacco flavors and dried berry, herb and dill accents. Maintains a dry profile through the finish. Drink now through 2022.

name: Murasaki Napa Valley
review: Dense and chewy, with a wide range of dried dark berry, dill, celery seed and cedar notes. This is reminiscent of a Bordeaux, right down to the need for cellar time. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Merlot and Petit Verdot. Best from 2015 through 2024.

name: Rindo Napa Valley
review: Well-made, presenting a dry, savory style, with tight dried herb, cedar, tobacco leaf and dried berry. This will appeal to some more than others. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Petit Verdot and Malbec. Drink now through 2021. 4,433 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley Asatsuyu
review: Featuring zingy acidity, this offers lime flavors, crisp lemon notes and a clean, refreshing finish. Touches of lemon meringue and dried rose petal show charm. Drink now. 936 cases made.

name: Rindo Napa Valley
review: This is firm, framed by drying dill and cedar-laced oak notes. The fruit struggles against the wood. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Merlot and Petit Verdot. Drink now.

name: Commandaria St.-Jo
review: Nicely crafted, with delicious flavors of maple, baked apple, tangerine and spice. Well-proportioned and lively, with a clean finish. Drink now. 30,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley Carneros
review: Intense and concentrated, with a wonderful entry that highlights Merlot's rich earthy currant, exotic spice, mineral and leafy, tobacco flavors. Firms up at midpalate, where it turns savory, with a mix of clove, currant and cigar box aromas. Firmly tannic, so short-term cellaring should work to its advantage. Made by Clos du Val Cabernet winemaker Kian Tavakoli. A very impressive debut. Drink now through 2009. 100 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley Carneros
review: This wine exhibits ripe, zesty black cherry, blackberry and spicy floral scents enlivened by acidity, almost Zinfandel-like with its berry fruitiness. Drink now. 187 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley Carneros
review: A mix of supple cherry and wild berry fruit with chewy, leathery tannins makes for a complex wine that's a bit dry and cedary on the finish, turning leathery. 191 cases made.

name: SUMO Amador County
review: Shows excellent purity and intensity to the huckleberry and blueberry coulis flavors, with supple, velvety tannins and an aromatic lift from violet and white pepper details. Notes of sandalwood, black walnut, Earl Grey tea and nutmeg gain momentum on the tremendous finish, where the details and elegance persist. Petite Sirah, Syrah and Viognier. Drink now through 2030. 220 cases made.

name: Caldera El Dorado
review: Distinctive and floral aromas of orange zest and blueberry open to boldly flavored and richly structured accents of wild berry, black olive, crushed stone and wild game. The tannins are elegantly styled. Mourvèdre, Grenache and Counoise. Drink now through 2028. 150 cases made.

name: Caldera El Dorado
review: Explodes with dark berry, road tar, hot brick, tobacco and cigar notes that command attention, with reverberating flavors of black licorice and subtle volcanic earth that are grainy and gripping. Mourvèdre, Grenache and Counoise. Best from 2015 through 2028. 150 cases made.

name: Lithic Amador County
review: Edgy and rustic, with a dense, potent core of road tar, dark berry, black licorice and raspberry, this is a vital young wine that begs for cellaring, delivering purity, complexity and density. Grenache, Mourvèdre and Syrah. Best from 2015 through 2028. 230 cases made.

name: Lithic Amador County
review: Beautifully crafted, intense and vibrant, with a firm mix of loamy earth, mineral, plum and blackberry. Full-bodied and tightly wound, this one begs for cellaring, ending with a strong flex of ripe tannins. Grenache, Mourvèdre and Syrah. Best from 2014 through 2024. 190 cases made.

name: Lithic Amador County
review: Refreshingly rich, layered and complex, offering vivid, juicy, grapey dark berry fruit, with touches of red and black licorice, blueberry, blackberry, mineral and loamy earth. Ends with a savory mix of dried and roasted herb and espresso notes, sailing on the finish. Grenache, Mourvèdre and Syrah. Drink now through 2020. 170 cases made.

name: SUM  Amador County
review: A big, rich, hearty style that packs lots of dense dark berry, sage, dried herb and savory flavors, with chicory, coffee and underbrush notes in the background. Despite the size, tannic muscle and torque on display, there's a gracefulness to the texture and mouthfeel. Petite Sirah, Syrah and Viognier. Drink now through 2026. 200 cases made.

name: Sumo Amador County
review: A rich, explosive mix of blueberry, blackberry and dried berry, with crushed rock, roasted coffee, mineral and cedar accents. Despite displaying power and intensity, this shows a touch of subtlety and finesse. Petite Sirah, Syrah and Viognier. Drink now through 2027. 150 cases made.

name: SUMO Amador County
review: Highly detailed, with fresh pepper, floral, spice, savory and licorice accents to the vivid, deep core of wild blackberry flavor. Rustic, firm tannins give this wine a pleasant chewy quality, with the flavors soaring on the finish. Petite Sirah, Syrah and Viognier. Drink now through 2020. 90 cases made.

name: Caldera El Dorado
review: A distinctive wine that packs a wallop, with dense notes of metal, graphite and charcoal amid mineral and dark berry flavors, framed by chewy, gutsy tannins and ending with hints of game meat, creosote and pencil lead. Mourvèdre, Grenache and Counoise. Drink now through 2028. 140 cases made.

name: Caldera El Dorado
review: Dense and complex, with intense baking spice, white pepper and dried berry flavors that gain richness and texture, firming nicely on the finish with a touch of fresh tobacco leaf. Mourvèdre, Grenache and Counoise. Best from 2013 through 2024. 140 cases made.

name: Caldera El Dorado
review: There's a wonderful complexity of aromas and flavors, with scorched earth, hot brick wall, juicy plum and cherry fruit that's reminiscent of Châteauneuf-du-Pape in its texture, structure, range of flavor, delicacy and finesse. Mourvèdre, Grenache and Counoise. Drink now through 2020. 90 cases made.

name: El Diablo Russian River Valley
review: Complex and supple, with bold aromas of black raspberry, wet stone and Asian spice, all layered with rich flavors of smoky blackberry, bitter chocolate and orange zest. Finishes with firm but fleshy tannins. Grenache and Syrah. Drink now through 2024. 100 cases made.

name: Grenache Knights Valley N=1
review: Firm and structured, with an enticing mix of mineral, dried berry, sage and floral scents. Medium- to full-bodied, ending with a nice burst of layered black cherry, blackberry, nutmeg and spice. Drink now through 2017. 60 cases made.

name: Hangman's Carneros
review: Fresh and plump, with a brooding personality lingering in the background. Floral aromas of raspberry and huckleberry combine with rich, layered flavors of black cherry, toasty vanilla and lots of cinnamon spice. Syrah and Viognier. Drink now through 2027. 110 cases made.

name: Lithic Amador County
review: Deeply structured and rich in character without giving up elegance. Bold aromas of smoky meat, crushed rock and blackberry open to layered flavors of licorice, black olive and cracked pepper that linger toward firm yet ripe tannins. Mourvèdre, Grenache and Syrah. Best from 2018 through 2028. 250 cases made.

name: Lithic Amador County
review: Power meets finesse in this blend, which offers distinctive aromas of black olive and black raspberry, with accents of licorice and pepper. The flavors are layered and complex, delivering notes of blackberry, crushed rock and espresso. The tannins are big but ripe. Grenache, Mourvèdre and Syrah. Drink now through 2027. 295 cases made.

name: Lithic Amador County
review: Offers a wonderful mix of ripe blackberry flavors, with floral, black licorice, raspberry jam, loamy earth and gravel details. Gains depth and holds focus on the long, intricate aftertaste, where subtle wood and espresso notes add dimension. Grenache, Mourvèdre and Syrah. Drink now through 2028. 295 cases made.

name: Lithic Amador County
review: Offers a sturdy, muscular mix of dried dark berry, loamy earth, espresso, graphite and cedar. This full-bodied red shows excellent depth, ending with tannins that reveal a touch of leather. Grenache, Mourvèdre and Syrah. Best from 2013 through 2023. 195 cases made.

name: Mars Moon Mountain District
review: Well-built and keenly focused, this blend offers an array of flavors, from raspberry jam and dried cherry to spiced cinnamon, loamy mineral and chunky chocolate. The flavors glide toward a plush finish. Grenache, Syrah and Mourvèdre. Drink now through 2024. 250 cases made.

name: Red Slope Knights Valley
review: Tight and structured, with firm, vivid, spicy blackberry, black cherry, pepper and cedar flavors that are sharply focused and persistent on the finish, where the tannins are chewy. Grenache and Syrah. Drink now through 2024. 180 cases made.

name: Red Slope Knights Valley
review: Firm and spicy, with a medley of dried currant, dark berry, tobacco leaf, herb and mineral notes. Full-bodied, complex and structured, ending with a long, persistent finish that dwells on the earthy tobacco flavors. Grenache and Syrah. Best from 2012 through 2020. 195 cases made.

name: Syrah Fair Play Diamond Bar
review: Bold, rich and layered, with firm tannins cloaking the juicy blackberry and wild berry notes, accented by touches of berry jam, anise and cedar. Gains depth and amplitude, revealing subtle berry and spice hints. Ends with gripping tannins. Drink now through 2027. 80 cases made.

name: Syrah Knights Valley Kingpin Rows
review: This well-proportioned red is focused on ripe, juicy dark berry, with touches of dark chocolate, cedar, crushed rock and dried herb. Very tightly wound, but gains on the finish, where the depth and concentration are more evident. Best from 2014 through 2024. 100 cases made.

name: Syrah Knights Valley Kingpin Rows
review: Firm and concentrated, with dried berry, roasted coffee, mineral, cedar, tar and tobacco character. Medium- to full-bodied, gaining weight and depth on the finish, where the flavors fold together nicely. Ends with subtle flavor nuances. Drink now through 2018. 135 cases made.

name: Syrah Knights Valley Kingpin Rows
review: Vivid wild berry and raspberry fruit is firm and spicy, with a touch of jam and a floral stemmy scent. Rich, full-bodied, expansive and layered, this detailed red ends with subtle earth and berry notes. Best from 2011 through 2020. 96 cases made.

name: Syrah Sonoma Coast Fuego Y Mar
review: Combines power with polished structure, offering aromas of blackberry, crushed stone and Chinese five-spice powder and complex flavors of currant, espresso and smoky bacon. Drink now through 2028. 85 cases made.

name: Caldera El Dorado
review: Loaded with personality, this offers distinctive aromas of melted black licorice, blackberry and lead pencil. Shows great focus and structure, delivering powerful flavors of black raspberry, smoky pepper beef and mineral. Big tannins frame the finish. Mourvèdre, Grenache and Counoise. Drink now through 2027. 140 cases made.

name: Caldera El Dorado
review: This muscle-bound effort is firm and intense, with a smoky, meaty edge to the dried berry, sage and underbrush flavors. Full-bodied and tannic, this begs for cellaring. Mourvèdre, Grenache and Counoise. Best from 2014 through 2024. 90 cases made.

name: Grenache Russian River Valley Basilisk
review: A plush red, backed by a complex core. Floral raspberry and white pepper aromas open to layered flavors of blueberry, loam and licorice. Drink now through 2024. 60 cases made.

name: Grenache Russian River Valley Basilisk
review: Pure, rich and layered, with notes of fresh-turned loamy earth and elements of road tar, black licorice and graphite. Ends with a crushed rock character. Best from 2015 through 2026. 60 cases made.

name: Red Slope Knights Valley
review: Pure and rich, with vivid red berry, candy apple and raspberry fruit, accented by crushed rock, cedar and tobacco leaf notes. Gains depth, ending with elegant lift and firm tannins that give the flavors traction. Grenache and Syrah. Better than previously reviewed. Drink now through 2024. 150 cases made.

name: SUMŌ Amador County
review: Rich and concentrated, this features a burly core of lively tannins encased in flavors of dried blueberry, Asian five-spice powder and nutmeg. Builds power and finesse toward the end. Petite Sirah, Syrah and Viognier. Drink now through 2029. 290 cases made.

name: SUMO Amador County
review: Muscle-bound, intense and tannic, featuring tiered flavors of fennel, dried berry, soy and violet. This is full-blown, with dense, chewy tannins yet an underlying suppleness in texture. Petite Sirah, Syrah and Viognier. Best from 2014 through 2024. 60 cases made.

name: SUMO Amador County
review: Bold, rich and wonderfully expressive, offering an intriguing mix of gingerbread, dark chocolate, blackberry, floral, mahogany, tobacco and black cherry flavors. Lush and thick, with a mouthful of hearty tannins. Petite Sirah, Syrah and Viognier. Drink now through 2020. 50 cases made.

name: El Diablo Russian River Valley
review: Jammed with complex, ripe fruit, this offers aromas of huckleberry and fruitcake spices to the plump flavors of dried berry, licorice and orange zest. Grenache and Syrah. Drink now through 2026. 100 cases made.

name: El Diablo Russian River Valley
review: Distinctive aromas of boysenberry and smoked pepper beef lead to supple and racy flavors of raspberry, orange zest and espresso that linger alongside ripe tannins. Grenache and Syrah. Drink now through 2024. 100 cases made.

name: Grenache Russian River Valley Basilisk
review: Plump and silky, with lovely rose petal and raspberry aromas and precise, expressive flavors of blueberry and cherry, showing smoky sage and pepper accents. Drink now through 2026. 180 cases made.

name: Hangman's Carneros
review: Showing a distinctive and appealingly gamy streak, this offers smoky bacon fat and blueberry aromas and brooding but well-built flavors of blackberry, savory herb and pepper. Syrah and Viognier. Drink now through 2028. 110 cases made.

name: Red Slope Knights Valley
review: Complex aromas of ripe plum, blackberry, pepper and spice turn supple and elegant on the palate. Rich without being heavy, this supple-textured red ends with a long, layered finish. Wows you with finesse. Grenache and Syrah. Drink now through 2014. 162 cases made.

name: SUM  Amador County
review: Fully ripened, with plum, blackberry and wild berry notes. Chewy and tannic, with iodine and creosote accents. Ends with a crushed rock minerality. Petite Sirah, Syrah and Viognier. Drink now through 2021. 190 cases made.

name: Syrah Sonoma Coast Fuego Y Mar
review: Tightly wound and brooding, with a dense core of minerally tannins, plus notes of blueberry, plum, tar, smoky cracked pepper and grilled anise. Needs time. Best from 2017 through 2024. 85 cases made.

name: Syrah Sonoma Coast Fuego Y Mar
review: Broodingly dark in color, this combines power with finesse. Blackberry and loamy earth aromas lead to concentrated flavors of black raspberry, smoky cracked pepper and anise, all framed by big, ripe tannins. Drink now through 2024. 80 cases made.

name: Grenache Russian River Valley Basilisk
review: Dense and tightly wound, but there's a core of rich fruit showing black raspberry, mineral, smoky herb and pepper flavors. Best from 2017 through 2026. 150 cases made.

name: Syrah Knights Valley Kingpin Rows
review: A rich, dense, earthy style, with concentrated, herb- and sage-laced dried berry, currant, graphite and tar. Big and powerful, young and unbridled, this needs time to settle down. Best from 2010 through 2016. 85 cases made.

name: Suo Collection No. 2 Stellenbosch
review: A solid, gutsy style, presenting a mix of warm currant, fig and blackberry paste flavors, wrapped with licorice root and espresso accents. Shows some brambly grip on the finish, with an echo of humus. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Malbec. Drink now through 2019. 150 cases made.

name: Collection No. 1 Stellenbosch
review: This old-school version offers a mix of sage, mint and tobacco leaf notes wrapped around a core of dried currant, plum and blackberry fruit flavors. Licorice root and loam details underscore the finish, lending a toothy feel. For fans of the style. Cabernet Sauvignon, Sangiovese, Malbec and Merlot. Drink now. 180 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Les Collines
review: Tannins swarm over the dark plum and blackberry flavors. Licorice and green olive notes add to the interest as the finish locks in and keeps resonating. Needs time in the cellar to soften the tannins. Best after 2018. 123 cases made.

name: Grenache Snipes Mountain Upland Vineyard
review: Lithe and expressive, with pretty pomegranate and red cherry flavors that hint at black tea and rare roast beef as the finish lingers against polished tannins. Drink now through 2019. 120 cases made.

name: Côtes du Rhône
review: Juicy and open, with a mix of black currant and black cherry fruit backed by singed cedar details. Shows a good mineral twinge through the finish. Drink now. 19,000 cases imported.

name: Côtes du Rhône
review: Juicy and focused, with red plum and currant fruit mixed with briar, mineral and garrigue hints. Nicely done. Drink now. 8,000 cases made.

name: Côtes du Rhône Cypress Cuvée
review: Dark and toasty, featuring strong bay and espresso notes followed by braised fig and steeped black cherry accents. Slightly rustic through the finish, with bay and game hints lingering. Drink now. 1,389 cases imported.

name: Côtes du Rhône
review: Pretty plum and raspberry coulis flavors are lined with subtle anise and singed cinnamon hints. Light-bodied but with good energy through the finish. Drink now. 12,060 cases imported.

name: Beaujolais
review: Lush and fruity, with pretty black cherry, pepper, plum and spice flavors. Forward and attractive. Drink now.

name: Côtes du Rhône
review: Lean and firm, with impressive concentration of cherry and berry aromas and flavors, velvety texture and good length. Needs to shed some tannin. Drink now.

name: Reserve Napa Valley
review: A sumptuous expression of rich, polished Cabernet, this unfolds gracefully, offering a smooth-textured mix of currant and blueberry flavors shaded by dusty, cedary oak and dried herb notes. The tannins deliver traction, definition and depth. Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Drink now through 2032. 285 cases made.

name: Reserve Napa Valley
review: Though rich and expressive, this features a welcome touch of suppleness from the texture, easing the entry of the dark berry, loamy earth, savory herb and cedary oak notes. There's no mistaking the authority of the flavors. Finishes with gripping tannins and a modest measure of finesse. Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Best from 2019 through 2030. 280 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Moderately rich and marked by flavors of hard red candy and cherry, succeeding in delicacy and finesse, restraint and balance. Impressive on the finish, where the subtle flavors build. Drink now. 150 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Rich and extracted, with chewy anise, blackberry, cherry, loamy earth and light oak notes, ending with a strong tannic presence that gives the flavors traction. Drink now through 2021. 175 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley
review: Fresh pear, citrus and dried mango notes are spicy, with dried chamomile accents on the finish. Drink now. 386 cases made.

name: Sémillon North Coast
review: Complex and ripe, with fine depth to wet hay, spicy oak, melon and tangy lemon-lime character. Passion fruit and citrus rind flavors stay focused on the generous finish. Drink now. 4,324 cases made.

name: Syrah Lodi
review: Concentrated, with espresso bean, semisweet chocolate and herb flavors, with firm tannins and loads of charry oak in the finish. Drink now through 2007. 2,850 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Carneros Hudson Vineyards
review: Openly rich and complex, with exotic tropical fruit unfolding to layers of guava, pineapple and spiced apple scents that provide a wonderful range of ripe fruit flavors. Drink now through 2011. 311 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast Rockbreak
review: Marked by rich, honeyed flavors, this offers honeysuckle, fig, pineapple and apricot notes, turning spicy and oaky on the finish. Drink now through 2018. 186 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Vadim's Watch
review: Featuring light-scented jasmine, black tea and earth-laced blueberry and raspberry flavors, this aims for delicacy and subtlety, ending with notes of savory herb and anise. Drink now through 2020. 235 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Carneros Hudson Vineyards
review: Smooth, rich and creamy, full-bodied, with complex, layered smoky fig, marshmallow and pear flavors. Drink now through 2011. 336 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Carneros Hudson Vineyards
review: Intense and full-bodied, offering hints of citrus, green pear and apple, with light hazelnut notes that still need time to come together. Drink now through 2012. 580 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Mendocino County Alder Springs Vineyard
review: Offers a medium-weight mix of vanilla-laced oak, with modest green apple and pear scents that are focused and delicate. Drink now through 2018. 124 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley The Old Vines
review: Smooth, with ripe pear, honeydew melon, spice and light spicy oak, gaining depth and complexity. Drink now through 2011. 240 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Bacigalupi Vineyard
review: Marked by ripe pear, apple and touches of tropical fruit, this displays a direct style, ending with a touch of butterscotch and oak. Drink now through 2018. 156 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Halfmile
review: Exhibits a mix of black tea, savory herb and rustic berry notes, with gravelly earth accents and grainy tannins, never quite shaking the green flavor. Drink now. 200 cases made.

name: 4 Cepages' Reserve Barossa
review: Menthol-eucalyptus notes weave through this savory Cabernet blend, playing deftly over fine tannins as the lithe structure lets the flavors linger. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Best from 2016 through 2021. 800 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley
review: Ripe and generous, a smooth-textured wine, with layers of rich pear, caramel, spice and honey flavors that echo enticingly on the long finish. Drink now through 2006. 570 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: A stylish wine, rich and ripe in flavor, still tannic, but shows layers of earthy spice and bay leaf weaving through the classic Cabernet flavors, hinting at violets and cedar on the long finish. Forming up nicely. Best from 2004 through 2010. 2,265 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: Distinctive for its spicy, bayleaf-scented berry and coffee flavors, harmonious in the way it wraps it all in a firm blanket of gentle tannins, finishing with style and grace. Drink now through 2007. 1,080 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Falcon Series
review: Focused and generous, with savory overtones to the currant and blueberry fruit, dancing through refined tannins on the open-weave finish and lingering with precision. Drink now through 2020. 4,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yakima Valley Winemakers Select Series
review: Sleek and refined, with floral black cherry aromas and expressive plum, espresso and spice flavors that linger toward refined tannins. Drink now through 2023. 627 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Yakima Valley Estate
review: Bright and juicy, beautifully proportioned to show a glowing core of apple, pear and pineapple fruit, shaded with hints of pepper and spice as the flavors linger effortlessly. Drink now through 2007. 643 cases made.

name: Syrah Yakima Valley Signature Edition
review: Dark, dense and packed with flavor, a rambunctious red that pours out its blackberry, black cherry, anise and black pepper flavors over a solid frame. Has fine-grained tannins that don't really get in the way, but will benefit from cellaring. Drink now through 2008. 91 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: A stylish Cabernet, firm, focused and distinctive, offering layers of herb-scented berry and smoke flavors that remain rich and generous through the crisp finish. Worth cellaring. Best from 2003 through 2008. 1,680 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yakima Valley Signature Series Old Vine
review: Lithe and sleek, with an airy feel to the dark berry and coffee flavors, finishing with gentle persistence on an open texture. Drink now through 2017. 180 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Yakima Valley Falcon Series Kestrel View Estate Vineyard Old Vine
review: Vibrant, with apple, pear, quince and lime flower character, which sails easily into an expressive finish. Drink now through 2013. 864 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Yakima Valley Winemaker Select Estate Old Vine
review: Lithe and appealing for its gently spicy pear, citrus and melon aromas and flavors, weaving together beautifully through the silky finish. Drink now through 2010. 72 cases made.

name: Malbec Yakima Valley Winemaker Select
review: Supple and bursting with fruit, offering currant, plum and red berry character on a juicy, open-textured frame. Finishes with pizzazz. Drink now through 2014. 264 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: Ripe, rich and chewy, with layers of ripe berry and spicy oak competing for attention, all of it harmonizing on the generous finish. Drink now through 2006. 2,182 cases made.

name: Merlot Yakima Valley Signature Edition Estate Old Vine
review: Firm, rich and generous with its blueberry-scented plum and berry flavors becoming plump and round as they persist on the finish. Tannins are very fine. Drink now through 2006. 112 cases made.

name: Syrah Yakima Valley
