review: Ripe, plump and disctinctive for a peachlike note that weaves through the blackberry and tobacco flavors, finishing with firm tannins that let the flavors linger on and on. Drink now through 2005. 1,177 cases made.

name: Syrah Yakima Valley Signature Edition Co-Ferment Estate
review: Broad and juicy. A lively mouthful of ripe berry, sweet spice and something like peach, mingling beautifully on the long, open-textured finish. Cofermented with 8 percent Viognier. Drink now through 2010. 225 cases made.

name: Viognier Yakima Valley Kestrel View Estate Vineyard
review: Bright and appealing for its graceful texture and juicy lemon, peach and buttermilk aromas and flavors, lingering gently on the dry finish. Drink now through 2009. 487 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: Dark and dense, with a chewy texture underlining the currant and plum flavors. Offers hints of smoke and chocolate on the nicely lingering finish. Best from 2011 through 2016. 2,096 cases made.

name: Mourvèdre Yakima Valley Winemaker Select
review: Smooth and tangy, with a meaty, mineral streak running through the dark fruit flavors, lingering nicely. Drink now. 275 cases made.

name: Viognier Yakima Valley Kestrel View Estate Vineyard
review: A crisp, lively style of Viognier that has the requisite honeysuckle and pear aromas and flavors, finishing with a distinct lime note and zingy acidity. Drink now through 2006. 503 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Yakima Valley Winemaker Select
review: Smooth and round, with a sharp mineral and herbal undercurrent to the berry and earth flavors, lingering on the refined finish. Drink now through 2013. 250 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yakima Valley
review: Bright and juicy, this is a live-wire mouthful of pretty currant and plum fruit, shaded with white pepper and vanilla as the finish lingers on an open texture. Drink now through 2010. 1,502 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Yakima Valley
review: Rich in texture, with tons of spice notes around a core of bright pear flavor, finishing with some length and lively acidity to balance. Drink now through 2004. 577 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Yakima Valley Falcon Series
review: Snappy and easy to drink, with notes of apple, star fruit and lime. Drink now. 1,890 cases made.

name: Merlot Yakima Valley Signature Edition Boushey Vineyard
review: Firm and chewy, with a rough grain to the texture and distinct peppery note to the cherry and mint flavors. Best from 2004 through 2008. 117 cases made.

name: Merlot Yakima Valley Signature Edition Estate Old Vine
review: Bright and juicy, this is a lively mouthful of raspberry, cream and delicately floral flavors, which echo nicely. Drink now through 2003. 112 cases made.

name: Merlot-Cabernet Columbia Valley Raptor Red
review: Earthy, gamy flavors add distinctive character to this open-textured red; generous berry and cherry flavors compete with the earthy notes on the finish. Best after 2002. 192 cases made.

name: Port Yakima Valley Signature Edition
review: This smells like blueberry pie, but is somehow not quite so sweet, the focused flavors riding easily over fine tannins. Tinta Roriz, Barbera and Syrah. Drink now. 245 cases made.

name: Rosé Yakima Valley
review: Light and fragrant, brimming with refreshing watermelon and raspberry fruit, this is barely off-dry as it zips across the palate. Sangiovese, Syrah, Merlot, Malbec, Cabernet Franc, Mourvèdre, Petit Verdot and Tempranillo. Drink now. 580 cases made.

name: Sangiovese Yakima Valley Kestrel View Estate Vineyard
review: Distinctive stuff, with a meaty, gamy character at the forefront, adding interest to the rich, ripe cherry and raspberry fruit, lingering nicely on the generous finish. Drink now through 2008. 745 cases made.

name: Syrah Yakima Valley Falcon Series
review: Straightforward and focused, with appealing raspberry, smoky herb and spice flavors. Drink now through 2020. 812 cases made.

name: Syrah Yakima Valley Kestrel View Estate Vineyard
review: Bright, lively and juicy, with blackberry, white pepper and hints of dried cherry as the finish rolls on and on. Has some tannins to lose. Best from 2007 through 2011. 1,015 cases made.

name: Syrah Yakima Valley Signature Edition Estate
review: Broad and generous, nicely packed with blackberry and pepper flavors, echoing nicely on the solid finish. Best from 2003 through 2006. 190 cases made.

name: Syrah Yakima Valley Winemaker Select Co-ferment Estate
review: Lithe and open-textured, with polished tannins around a silky core of boysenberry and red plum fruit, picking up wet earth notes as the finish lingers. Drink now through 2013. 345 cases made.

name: Syrah Yakima Valley Winemaker Select Estate Co-Ferment
review: Ripe, almost jammy, but this stays on the fresh side, offering a silky texture and flavors of raspberry and plum that last on the finish. Drink now through 2011. 344 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yakima Valley
review: Firm and juicy, with a layer of gritty tannins over a core of ripe berry and a touch of stalkiness on the finish. Drink now through 2007. 2,461 cases made.

name: Lady In Red 4th Edition Columbia Valley
review: Polished and appealing, with juicy cherry and herb flavors that linger on the supple finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Syrah and Sangiovese. Drink now. 12,200 cases made.

name: Merlot Yakima Valley
review: Firm, with black pepper, cherry and cedar aromas and flavors that linger on the chewy finish. Tightly wound, this needs time in the cellar to soften. Best after 2007. 1,704 cases made.

name: Raptor Red Signature Edition Yakima Valley
review: Graceful, elegant style, with a minty edge to the currant and berry flavors, finishing with an interesting tarry note. Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2007. 219 cases made.

name: Syrah Yakima Valley
review: Crisp and dense, marked by oak on the nose, with a distinct gamy edge to the solid berry flavors, finishing with a light bite of tannin as the flavors echo. Best from 2003 through 2005. 851 cases made.

name: Syrah Yakima Valley Signature Edition Estate
review: Smooth and refined, with smoky, gamy aromas and flavors around a core of blackberry and pepper flavors, finishing with polish. Drink now through 2006. 165 cases made.

name: Viognier Yakima Valley Kestrel View Estate Vineyard
review: On the crisp side, with pretty pear and apricot fruit popping through against a hint of floral spice. Drink now. 439 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yakima Valley
review: Lithe, with crisp acidity against modest blueberry and sage flavors. Drink now through 2010. 1,426 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Yakima Valley
review: Crisp and straightforward, with hints of apple and spiced lemon. Drink now. 2,151 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: On the crisp side, with a nice layer of cherry and mineral flavor at the core, finishing with a tart edge. Drink now through 2004. 2,001 cases made.

name: Merlot Yakima Valley
review: Crisp and refined, with a tobacco note weaving through the modest red berry flavors. Drink now through 2011. 1,683 cases made.

name: Syrah Yakima Valley Kestrel View Estate Vineyard
review: Firm in texture, this is an effort at an elegant style of Syrah that folds in green olive and mineral overtones to the modest blackberry flavors. Finishes with refined tannins. Drink now through 2010. 992 cases made.

name: Trinity Limited Release Amador County
review: Rich, smoky, tarry licorice notes lead the way to a charry palate backed by nice currant and blackberry flavors. Roughish finish. Should age well. A blend of Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. 35 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yakima Valley Signature Edition Estate Old Vine
review: Rich in flavor, but a bit leathery as well, with a metallic edge to the cherry and vanilla flavors, finishing with fine tannins. Drink now through 2005. 109 cases made.

name: Drop Dead Red Second Edition Yakima Valley
review: Pleasant blackberry and herb flavors characterize this easy-drinking red. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Malbec. Drink now. 7,200 cases made.

name: Kestrel View Estate Vineyard Rosé Yakima Valley
review: Soft and appealing for its juicy strawberry and watermelon flavors, finishing dry. Merlot, Sangiovese, Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah, Cabernet Franc, Viognier and Malbec. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Merlot Yakima Valley
review: Lean and focused, with more red pepper character than fruit, finishing with persistence. Drink now. 1,908 cases made.

name: Merlot Yakima Valley
review: On the lean side, with peppery, herbal cherry and earth flavors, lingering against chewy tannins. Best after 2007. 1,057 cases made.

name: Raptor Red Signature Edition Yakima Valley
review: Firm in texture, with gamy, vegetal notes intruding on the generous cherry and currant flavors. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Malbec. Best after 2008. 58 cases made.

name: Viognier Yakima Valley Kestrel View Estate Vineyard
review: Raisiny, tasting sweet, with intense spiciness working hard to balance the lack of freshness. Drink now. 570 cases made.

name: Merlot-Cabernet Sauvignon Yakima Valley Raptor Red Signature Edition
review: Distinctly earthy, with a sharp edge to the currant and floral flavors, finishing with more earthy notes. Drink now. 192 cases made.

name: Syrah Yakima Valley Falcon Series
review: Crisp and taut, with firm tannins and tangy acidity playing against ripe cherry and pepper flavors. Best after 2017. 1,207 cases made.

name: Syrah Yakima Valley Winemaker Select Estate Co-Ferment
review: Lean and tight, with a vinegary edge to the spicy dark berry flavors. Syrah with Viognier. Drink now. 251 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Yakima Valley Kestrel View Estate Vineyard Old Vine
review: Light and spicy, with a tobacco note against modest citrusy flavors. Drink now. 302 cases made.

name: Merlot Yakima Valley
review: Firm in texture, with earthy dark berry and herb flavors, finishing a bit acrid and earthy. Drink now through 2005. 2,573 cases made.

name: Merlot Sierra Foothills Limited Release
review: Shows pretty plum flavors with hints of earth and mushrooms. Tannins and acids are a bit pronounced, however. Short finish. Drink now through 2002. 214 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Yakima Valley Kestrel View Estate Vineyard Old Vine
review: Earthy, sour flavors are not appealing.   373 cases made.

name: Merlot Yakima Valley
review: Earthy, gamy flavors take this out of bounds.   3,261 cases made.

name: Syrah Yakima Valley Kestrel View Estate Vineyard
review: Strong chemical aromas rob this one of charm. 1,773 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yakima Valley
review: Funky, earthy flavors get in the way. Turns slightly sour on the finish.   3,018 cases made.

name: Sangiovese Yakima Valley Kestrel View Estate Vineyard
review: Earthy and exceedingly gamy. 757 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Monticello Estate Reserve
review: This polished red offers cherry and plum flavors, with savory notes of cedar and black olive. Light, firm tannins and lively acidity keep this balanced through the fruity, spicy finish. Drink now through 2018. 350 cases made.

name: Petit Verdot Monticello
review: Ripe, with ebullient cassis, bing cherry preserves and plum flavors that are nicely integrated with a singed vanilla bean note. Juicy finish. Rock-solid varietal character. Drink now. 100 cases made.

name: Viognier Monticello
review: Plump and round, with nice weight to the fennel, apple and anise notes, backed by a hint of bitter almond that adds freshness on the finish. There's good latent length as well. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Viognier Monticello Estate Reserve
review: Aromatic and friendly, with pretty peach, pear, anise and melon notes that glide through the creamy finish. Nice weight and length. Drink now. 245 cases made.

name: Viognier Monticello Signature Series
review: This polished white displays good density, with smoke and toast notes framing subdued pear and melon flavors. Firm acidity keeps this focused through the buttery finish. Drink now. 400 cases made.

name: Viognier Virginia Les Vents d'Anges Hommage à Geneviève
review: A very bright, juicy style, with a lively floral lead note backed by lots of yellow apple, honeydew melon and anise. Quince and fig check in on the just off-dry finish. A crowd-pleasing style. Drink now. 600 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Monticello Estate Reserve
review: Solid, with a nicely focused beam of red- and black-currant fruit laced with roasted tobacco leaf and a hint of cedar. Fresh acidity knits it all nicely on the finish. Drink now. 290 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Monticello Signature Series
review: This polished white delivers pear, melon, vanilla and spice flavors in a creamy texture, with firm, underlying acidity. Well-knit, showing good depth. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Viognier Monticello Edgewood Estate Reserve
review: Tasty, with a flinty note offsetting the plump toast, pear, anise and star fruit flavors. Nice creamy texture too. Solid effort. From Virginia. Drink now. 65 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Monticello
review: Bright, slightly high-pitched acidity carries the lively cassis, cherry and toasted vanilla notes, with a lingering note of singed tobacco leaf. Drink now. 200 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Monticello Estate Reserve
review: Ripe and nicely polished, with sweet spice and toast notes guiding the core of black cherry and plum fruit. Shows a nice dash of blueberry on the finish. Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Monticello
review: Good bouncy pear, toast, fig and flint notes, with a crisp texture keeping it all together. Nicely done. From Virginia. Drink now. 200 cases made.

name: Viognier Monticello
review: Clean and fresh, with soft-textured peach and almond notes that deliver good varietal character. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Monticello
review: Offers a good mix of snappy black cherry and red currant fruit, with judicious toast in the background. There's a hint of fresh green tobacco on the finish. Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot Monticello Heritage Estate Reserve
review: Forward, offering blackberry cobbler and cherry notes laced with a streak of licorice. Open-knit, toasty finish. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Viognier Monticello
review: A bit top-heavy, with toast and apricot aromas and flavors and a slightly sweet-edged finish. But the plump, fresh feel and the oaky profile will have some fans. From Virginia. Drink now. 50 cases made.

name: Viognier Monticello Estate Reserve
review: Very plump and rounded, with friendly peach, anise and melon flavors carried by a flattering buttery note. Drink now. 150 cases made.

name: Merlot Monticello
review: Slightly crisp, with red plum fruit and hints of spice in the background. Drink now. 150 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley
review: Generous ripe plum, black cherry, wild berry and raspberry are fleshy, rich and complex. Full-bodied, intense and layered, ending with firm tannins. Drink now through 2017. 493 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Ketcham Vineyard
review: A ripe, full-bodied, rich and layered Pinot, showing ripe plum and cherry jam aromas, with touches of wilted rose and spice, ending with a pure ripe berry persistence. Drink now through 2017. 490 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley
review: Full-bodied and rich, offering savory herb, dried berry, sage, dried currant and spicy floral scents. Balanced, focused and persistent. Drink now through 2013. 760 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley
review: Shows good intensity and depth of flavor, with notes of savory herb, dried berry, fresh earth and dried flowers. Ends up drier on the finish. Drink now through 2018. 901 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Ketcham Vineyard
review: Crushed rock and slate earthiness gives the berry flavors a complex if drying sensation. Drink now through 2016. 189 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley
review: Aromas of smoky herb and black cherry are dry and austere on the palate. Shows a touch of fleshiness midpalate before turning tannic, with a mineral edge. Drink now through 2011. 496 cases made.

name: Pinot Grigio Alto Adige
review: A light-bodied white that's fresh, balanced and minerally, showing notes of yellow pear, orchard blossom, stone and pickled ginger. Clean-cut finish. Drink now through 2018. 3,500 cases made.

name: Müller-Thurgau Alto Adige
review: A lithe, mouthwatering white, with clementine, chalk, apricot and floral notes. Drink now. 4,400 cases made.

name: Pinot Bianco Alto Adige
review: A subtle, creamy white, with spice and mineral notes underscoring ripe pear and lemon zest flavors. Drink now. 4,100 cases made.

name: Pinot Bianco Alto Adige
review: Clean and crisp, this well-knit white shows lots of minerally stone and saline notes, as well as flavors of yellow pear, kiwifruit and ground white pepper. Drink now through 2018. 2,553 cases made.

name: Pinot Grigio Alto Adige
review: A straightforward white, offering hints of Dijon pear, fresh earth and spring blossom. Zesty. Drink now. 3,840 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: This bright and lively white offers jalapeño-accented green apple and melon flavors that sail easily through the fresh finish. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Dry 20 Rows Vineyard
review: Precise, dry and taut, with a lovely chalky minerality running underneath the mix of thistle, lime, pippen apple and jasmine notes. Long, tightly focused finish. Drink now through 2021. 120 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Dry Falling Man Vineyard
review: This has ripeness and drive, with juicy yellow apple, peach and persimmon notes forming the core, all carried by dried chamomile, pine and jicama streaks through the finish. Very distinctive, showing serious range and length. Best from 2018 through 2023. 66 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Semi-Dry
review: Pure and wonderfully defined, with white peach, jasmine, honeysuckle, yellow apple and mirabelle notes that are bright and engaging from start to finish. Lovely mineral zing through the racy finish. Drink now through 2022. 292 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Dry Evergreen Lek Vineyard
review: A light talc edge leads the way, followed by lime pith, yellow apple and jicama flavors. A slate accent underscores the finish, which is pure and bone-dry. Best from 2018 through 2022. 88 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Dry Falling Man Vineyard
review: A bracing, racy style, with talc, pine, pippin apple and fennel notes that zip through a long, slate-accented finish. Well done. Drink now through 2017. 175 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Dry Falling Man Vineyard
review: Taut, with jasmine, Key lime and fennel notes lending a bracing edge, hinting at flavors of green apple, green almond and pear skin. The long finish shows buried, energetic acidity. Drink now through 2017. 205 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Dry Falling Man Vineyard
review: Mouthfilling and racy, with fennel, green almond and pear flavors carried by tense acidity that lends ample cut on the finish. An alluring yellow apple note lurks in the background and should emerge more with modest cellaring. Drink now through 2015. 103 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Dry Goldman Vineyard
review: Lively and focused, with a minerally edge that drives the yellow apple, fennel seed and chamomile notes along. Fresh-cut white peach and jicama notes fill in on the finish. This has range and drive. Drink now through 2022. 101 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Dry Goldman Vineyard
review: A dry, steely style, with taut lime, slate and pippin apple notes laced with fennel and star fruit hints. The crisp, almost bony finish shows excellent length and drive. For fans of the dry style. Drink now through 2015. 121 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes TBA Late Harvest Select Lucie Vineyard
review: Intense, with a musky edge giving way to date, dried apricot, roasted peach and clove notes. Offers a thick, mouthcoating feel, with golden raisin and quince paste flavors holding the finish. Shows mature elements already, but the density and sweetness will let this last in the cellar. Drink now through 2017. 4 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Dry
review: Bracing and fresh, with a mix of fennel, key lime, kiwi core and green apple notes that are nicely focused through the finish. Drink now for the zing or cellar a touch to let it broaden. Drink now through 2020. 309 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Dry
review: This ripples with energy, as fennel, pippin apple and mouthwatering slate notes drive from start to finish. Shows lots of zip and focus through the finish. Drink now through 2020. 208 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Dry Eastside
review: Focused and steely, with fennel, green apple skin, green almond and Key lime notes all stitched together, backed by finely beaded acidity on the pure, stone-tinged finish. Drink now through 2016. 212 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Dry Evergreen Lek Vineyard
review: This has a racy edge, with fennel and apple skin notes zipping along, backed by melon rind, jasmine and pear notes. Drink now through 2016. 225 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Dry Evergreen Lek Vineyard
review: This has cut and drive, with tangy fennel seed, white peach, jasmine and citrus oil notes that ripple through the long, stony finish. A hint of lanolin hangs in the background. Very dry. Drink now through 2014. 96 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Dry Evergreen Lek Vineyard
review: This has nice vivacity, with McIntosh apple at the core, offset by lime, kiwifruit and green fig notes. Ends with a crunchy, mouthwatering finish. Drink now through 2014. 100 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Dry Falling Man Vineyard
review: This is long and pure, with precision to the Jonagold apple, blanched almond, chamomile and citrus oil notes. The tangy, driven finish has solid length. Drink now through 2014. 115 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Dry Falling Man Vineyard
review: A dry, taut, piercing style, with jasmine and honeysuckle backed by slate, yellow apple and verbena notes. Long and pure on the finish. Very fine. Drink now through 2014. 105 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Dry
review: This has a light slate edge running alongside the core of green almond and green apple fruit, with a lingering fennel note running through the finish. Drink now through 2016. 310 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Dry
review: Grapefruit rind, persimmon, white peach and verbena notes mix in this tangy, idiosyncratic offering, with a long, taut, talc-coated finish. Drink now through 2013. 125 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Dry Eastside
review: Fresh and racy, with a clean edge to the quince, ginger and anise notes, lingering pleasantly through the finish. Drink now. 110 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Dry Evergreen Lek Vineyard
review: Distinctive, with a bolt of cardamom leading the way for energetic dried apricot, peach and ginger notes. The bitter, almond-edged finish is quite dry. Drink now through 2016. 169 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Dry Evergreen Lek Vineyard
review: Ripe, but with a steely spine, holding the anise and apple notes tightly wound for now, while a snappy minerality drives the finish. Should flesh out with brief cellaring. Drink now through 2012. 164 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Dry Goldman Vineyard
review: A fresh, light style, with taut lime and chalk notes leading the way for unadorned pippin apple fruit and a bracing finish. For fans of the dry style. Drink now through 2012. 148 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Semi-Dry
review: Taut for an off-dry style, with pippin apple and slate notes forming the core while fennel and honeysuckle flavors fill in through the zippy finish. Drink now through 2020. 270 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Semi-Dry
review: This is dry along the edges, with a plump core, offering lemon curd, dried pineapple and star fruit notes. The finish picks up fennel and Meyer lemon details, showing good zip and cut. Drink now through 2015. 144 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Dry Goldman Vineyard
review: Solid, with nice cut to the lime, jasmine and slate flavors that show excellent length on the finish. A jasmine note lingers nicely. Drink now through 2011. 125 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Semi-Dry
review: This has a lively lime and slate spine running through the yellow apple and anise notes. Stays nicely focused on the finish, with juicy acidity. Drink now. 433 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Semi-Dry
review: Ripe but nicely defined, with a core of McIntosh apple and anise notes backed by a lively streak of lime. The fresh, racy finish has nice length. Drink now. 220 cases made.

name: Vignoles Finger Lakes Turkey Run Vineyard
review: Quite tangy, with lemon pith and gooseberry notes streaming through, backed by a streak of quinine. Has energy and length, and begs for oysters or goat cheese crostini. Drink now. 107 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Dry
review: Layered flavors of freshly cut yellow apple, melon, lemon curd and verbena carry through the creamy-edged finish. Drink now. 350 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Dry Evergreen Lek Vineyard
review: Taut, with pine, pippin apple and slate notes that stay tangy through the medium-weight, bony finish. Drink now through 2011. 132 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Dry Falling Man Vineyard
review: Really bright, with a streak of honeysuckle running through the yellow and green apple fruit. The finish is fresh and invigorating. Drink now. 129 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Semi-Dry
review: Friendly, with pear, ginger and spiced apple notes that bounce through the off-dry finish. Drink now. 370 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Finger Lakes
review: Light and fresh, with snappy cherry, red currant and pomegranate fruit that shows a light dusting of toasty vanilla. Drink now. 401 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Semi-Dry
review: On the softer side, showing yellow apple and quince notes, with a modestly juicy edge on the finish. Drink now. 181 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Finger Lakes
review: Light-bodied, with clean cherry and pomegranate notes and a dash of tea on the finish. Drink now. 183 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Finger Lakes
review: Shows a core of slightly crisp red currant and pomegranate fruit laced with a prominent tobacco leaf note. Drink now. 154 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Finger Lakes
review: Light, with gentle cherry and tea notes complemented by a flash of mulled vanilla bean on the finish. Drink now. 433 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Semi-Dry
review: Broad in feel, with apricot, ginger and nectarine notes that have weight and spice, but feel a bit loosely knit in the end. Drink now. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 231 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Semi-Dry
review: Light, with straightforward pear and fig notes backed by modest acidity on the finish. Drink now. 214 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Finger Lakes
review: Savory and pepper hints run through light-bodied cherry and blood orange fruit flavors. Light tea-infused finish. Drink now. 343 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Finger Lakes
review: Fresh, with honeysuckle, ginger, white peach and grapefruit notes forming a lively mix, with the grapefruit hint winning out on the zippy finish. Well done. Drink now. 441 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Finger Lakes
review: Features a bitter grapefruit and lychee core, with floral edges and a lingering tangerine echo. Stays crunchy and bright overall. Drink now. 189 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Dry
review: This offers a mix of fennel, lemon pith, jasmine and yellow apple skin notes, with a mouthwatering edge to the finish. Drink now through 2017. 380 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Humphreys Vineyard
review: This has a lively lemon-pith edge, with racy fennel, apple skin and star fruit notes. Good cut through the finish. Drink now through 2017. 200 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Humphreys Vineyard
review: This shows good cut from the start, with fennel, jasmine and citrus oil notes racing along. The finish fills out with red and yellow apple flavors. Drink now through 2014. 126 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Finger Lakes
review: Good lychee, pink grapefruit and nectarine notes drive along, backed by a twinge of bitter orange on the finish. Tasty. Drink now. 326 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Finger Lakes
review: A bright, tangy version, with grapefruit zest, fennel seed, white peach and lychee notes coursing along. Drink now. 335 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Finger Lakes
review: Features tangerine, lime and quince notes mixed together, with good weight and mouthfeel. A light almond hint frames the finish. Drink now. 590 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Finger Lakes Dynamite Vineyard
review: Rounded and ripe, with tasty peach, nectarine and lychee notes that meld nicely through the bitter almond-accented finish. Drink now. 145 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Finger Lakes Dynamite Vineyard
review: This forward white delivers melon and peach flavors lined with a subtle ginger note. A hint of bitter almond checks in on the finish. Drink now. 134 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Finger Lakes Pre-Emption Vineyard
review: A floral style, offering a honeysuckle note that gives way to white peach, straw and verbena flavors. Features a light-bodied, lemon zesttinged finish. Drink now. 168 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Finger Lakes Pre-Emption Vineyard
review: An open, breezy style, showing white peach and Key lime notes at the core, with an echo of dried pineapple on the juicy finish. Drink now. 177 cases made.

name: Merlot Finger Lakes
review: Singed bay and savory notes line the core of cherry and black currant fruit, lending texture and length to the finish. Drink now. 147 cases made.

name: Miller's Cove Finger Lakes
review: Solid, with nice concentration to the plum and black cherry fruit that's laid over cedar, roasted vanilla and mineral notes. Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now. 320 cases made.

name: Miller's Cove Red New York
review: Offers well-meshed dark blackberry and bramble notes, with modest toast and a lingering vanilla hint. Drink now. 421 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Finger Lakes
review: This is juicy and fresh, with ripe red and black cherry fruit layered with subtle spice notes. Shows more depth and polish than most Finger Lakes Pinots. Drink now. 150 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes
review: The yellow apple, straw and honeysuckle notes have a taut edge, while melon and verbena accents play out on the finish. Drink now. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 1,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes
review: Shows good ripeness, with McIntosh apple and anise flavors offset by bracing talc and jicama notes. Focused minerality drives the finish. Drink now through 2014. 825 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Humphreys Vineyard
review: Juicy, with a range of peach, pear and fennel notes that give way to an apple skin edge on the finish. Shows good range and definition. Drink now. 360 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Finger Lakes Reserve
review: A fresh red, with cherry and red currant fruit lightly peppered with herb notes. A dash of cherry pit keeps the finish tangy. Drink now. 150 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Finger Lakes Reserve
review: Has a nice bit of grip carrying the dark currant, cedar and shaved vanilla notes. Solid finish shows a whiff of coffee, but stays fresh. Drink now through 2010. 175 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Finger Lakes
review: Light, but fresh and persistent, this features bright lychee and quince notes leading to a flash of grapefruit oil on the finish. Drink now. 340 cases made.

name: Miller's Cove Finger Lakes
review: Solid, with ripe black cherry and blackberry fruit backed by obvious but integrated toast. The dark, modestly juicy finish lingers nicely. Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now. 404 cases made.

name: Miller's Cove Red New York
review: Plum and black cherry fruit is laced with bacon and singed cedar notes, with a nicely focused finish. Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now. 380 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Semi Sweet
review: Frankly ripe, this white boasts pineapple, peach and nectarine flavors backed only by a light floral note, with the fruit holding sway on the finish. A bit obvious in style. Drink now. 400 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Semi Sweet
review: Has a frankly off-dry edge, with ginger and graham cracker notes leading the way, backed by McIntosh apple and peach flavors. Delivers a broad, easy finish. Drink now. 280 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Semi Sweet
review: Not dense, but persistent enough, with good vibrancy to the green apple and lime notes, showing a flash of fennel. Drink now. 590 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Semi Sweet
review: Solid, with a juicy, direct beam of anise, apple and pear flavors backed by a twinge of bitter almond on the finish. Drink now. 580 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Semi Sweet
review: Off-dry and nicely focused, offering McIntosh apple, anise and jasmine notes backed by a hint of pear. Stays bright on the finish. Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Finger Lakes
review: Rather toasted, with butter and brioche holding sway over creamed yellow apple fruit. For fans of the style. Drink now. 258 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Finger Lakes
review: Subtle, with only a light toast shading to the gentle apple and pear fruit. Ends with a soft but lingering finish. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Finger Lakes
review: A crisp, lightly adorned style, showing yellow and green apple fruit backed by a hint of melon rind on the finish. Drink now. 425 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Finger Lakes
review: Fresh, with nice lychee and watermelon notes backed by a lightly spicy finish. Drink now. 420 cases made.

name: Lemberger Finger Lakes
review: Soft but fresh, with a mix of blueberry and bergamot notes, offering a light kiss of vanilla on the rounded finish. Drink now. 168 cases made.

name: Merlot New York
review: An unadorned style, with just a hint of singed cedar. Emphasizes the plum, dried cherry and blackberry fruit. Gentle spice shadings appear on the finish. Drink now. 315 cases made.

name: Merlot New York
review: Light but fresh, showing lightly mulled plum and cherry notes, with a dash of sweet tea on the finish. Drink now. 275 cases made.

name: Miller's Cove Red Finger Lakes
review: Friendly plum, blackberry and licorice notes are mixed together, with a juicy edge on the finish. Drink now. 460 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Finger Lakes
review: This has a briary edge to the spice, cherry and blackberry core. Not dense, but with good vivacity. Drink now. 150 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes
review: Direct, with lime, McIntosh apple and lemon zest notes that race through the fresh yet light finish. Drink now. 645 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes
review: This has a mix of red and green apple fruit flavors that lead to an open-knit, anise-tinged finish. Drink now.

name: Vignoles Finger Lakes Dessert Wine
review: Sweet and forward, with creamed peach and candied citrus notes on an open, accessible frame. Drink now. 210 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Finger Lakes
review: Offers a good mix of red and black cherry fruit, with a note of aged tobacco weaving through the finish. Drink now. 168 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Finger Lakes
review: Good medium-weight black cherry fruit, with fresh olive and toast notes on the finish. Drink now. 230 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Finger Lakes
review: A very friendly style, with butter and melon notes that linger with a hint of banana on the round, easy finish. Drink now. 80 cases made.

name: Epic Reserve Finger Lakes
review: Modest tobacco leaf, cherry pit and pomegranate notes are followed by a crisp, lively finish. Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Drink now. 225 cases made.

name: Lemberger Finger Lakes
review: Fresh and light, with breezy cherry and red licorice notes backed by a dash of spice on the finish. Drink now.

name: Merlot Finger Lakes
review: Direct and unadorned, with cherry fruit and a hint of red licorice. Drink now. 140 cases made.

name: Miller's Cove New York
review: Quite jammy and forward, with dark plum and crushed blackberry fruit laced with sweet toast. This has weight, but feels a bit gussied up, lacking some definition. Drink now.

name: Miller's Cove Red New York
review: A dash of sweet mocha toast covers basic plum and mulled black cherry fruit. A bit obvious, but stays fresh enough through the finish. Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now. 340 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Finger Lakes
review: Good peach and floral notes, with a lingering hint of citrus peel on the finish. Drink now. 275 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes
review: This has open-knit apricot and peach notes that maintain only modest intensity on the finish. Drink now. 590 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes
review: Forward, with round apple, melon and lime flavors. Modest finish. Drink now. 320 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Reserve
review: Soft and forward, with a mix of grapefruit, lime and white peach notes. Modestly juicy finish. Drink now. 150 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Semi-Sweet
review: Forward, with ginger, cardamom and baked apple notes. This has good zip, though not a lot of range. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Franc Finger Lakes
review: Light, with a leafy edge to the soft cherry and mulled strawberry fruit. Drink now.

name: Epic Reserve New York
review: Light-bodied, with black cherry and currant fruit integrated nicely with tobacco and cedar hints. Drink now. 235 cases made.

name: Lemberger Finger Lakes
review: Good red and black cherry fruit, with a fresh, lightly spiced finish. Drink now. 255 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes
review: On the soft side, with easygoing apple, piecrust and fennel notes that carry loosely through the finish. Drink now. 715 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Finger Lakes
review: Light, with modest cherry, pepper and leafy notes. A hint of tea shows on the finish. Drink now. 168 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Finger Lakes
review: Soft, with modest cherry fruit and a note of tobacco on the finish. Drink now. 217 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Finger Lakes Reserve
review: Slightly firm, with a mature edge to the black cherry, tobacco and toast notes. Shows a sage hint on the slightly woody-feeling finish. Drink now. 220 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Finger Lakes
review: Overtly buttery, but pulls it off, with some melon and pear notes that manage to push through. Drink now. 421 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Finger Lakes
review: Offers a light mix of lime, melon and herb notes, with the herb edge peaking out more on the finish. Drink now.

name: Gewürztraminer Finger Lakes
review: Bold grapefruit rind aroma is followed by a soft, demure palate of modest grapefruit and lychee hints. Drink now. 450 cases made.

name: Lemberger Finger Lakes
review: Light-bodied, with cherry, earth and game notes. Soft finish. Drink now. 525 cases made.

name: Merlot New York Reserve
review: Forward with a mix of toast, cherry, rhubarb and herb notes that stay round and easy through the finish. Drink now. 235 cases made.

name: Epic Reserve Finger Lakes
review: Toasty, with slightly jammy plum and grapey fruit behind it. Shows fleshy, spicy notes on the finish. Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon, Corot Noir and Merlot. Drink now. 310 cases made.

name: Lemberger Finger Lakes
review: Light and forward, with strawberry coulis and cherry fruit flavors, flirting with a cloying element through the finish. Drink now. 180 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes
review: Rather soft for the vintage, with slightly blowsy apple and anise hints that lose some focus on the finish. Drink now. 366 cases made.

name: Crooked Lake White Finger Lakes
review: Soft and forward, with an off-dry feel to modest lime and almond notes. Picnic quaffer. Vignoles and Vidal. Drink now. 547 cases made.

name: Dry Rosé Wiltberger Vineyard Finger Lakes
review: The light leafy and strawberry notes are backed by a slightly off-dry hint on the finish. Cabernet Franc and Lemberger. Drink now. 101 cases made.

name: Celebrate Finger Lakes
review: Light, with basic candied lime and fruit cocktail notes. Vidal Blanc, Riesling and Cayuga White. 470 cases made.

name: Crooked Lake Red Finger Lakes
review: Soft and forward, with slightly jammy cherry fruit backed by hints of mint and sage. Turns slightly cloying on the finish. 590 cases made.

name: Vignoles Finger Lakes
review: Modest lime and pippin notes, with a short, crisp finish. 410 cases made.

name: Merlot New York
review: Slightly stewed, with cooked plum and rhubarb notes that fail to mesh in the end. 170 cases made.

name: Vignoles Finger Lakes
review: Soft, with an off-dry feel to the mature, slightly blowsy lime candy and apple butter notes. 547 cases made.

name: Celebrate Finger Lakes White
review: Soft, with a bubble gum background behind the banana and lime flavors. Clean, but simple. Vidal Blanc, Riesling and Cayuga White. 315 cases made.

name: La Fraternité Yakima Valley
review: Polished and juicy, with lively balance to the peppermint-accented red berry flavors, lingering easily on the finish. Grenache, Mourvèdre and Syrah. Drink now through 2017. 279 cases made.

name: En Hommage Columbia Valley
review: Soft and spicy, with peach and clove accents to the supple blueberry and plum flavors, gliding into an open-textured finish. Syrah, Grenache and Mourvèdre. Drink now through 2017. 196 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Anderson Valley Wendling Vineyard
review: Distinct for the dusty, savory wild berry and herbal flavors that are also firmly tannic and even drying, ending rather abruptly. Drink now through 2023. 320 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough A Sidney Frank Selection
review: Bright and zingy, with lime and mineral flavors at the core. A hint of green garlic sneaks into the finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: R'Own Style Blend Paso Robles
review: Strikes a nice balance between ripe, supple wild berry, plum, spice, cedar and mineral flavors and hints of anise, turning sleek and delicate on the finish, with fine-grain tannins. Syrah, Grenache, Zinfandel and Viognier. Drink now through 2017. 900 cases made.

name: White Kuvée Paso Robles
review: Peach and apricot flavors are tangy on a medium body, with fresh acidity, terrific balance and spice and floral details. Viognier and Roussanne. Drink now. 450 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Tangy, with Key lime, coconut water and lemon zest flavors that mingle with zingy acidity. Drink now. 28,000 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Barbara County Great Oaks Ranch Vineyard
review: Kosher. Earthy, with beef, black cherry and currant flavors that finish with firm tannins and cedary oak. Drink now through 2006. 200 cases made.

name: Malvasia Bianca Arizona
review: Fresh, with a lightly spicy edge to the tangerine and clementine notes, followed by hints of honey and wax on the finish. Drink now. 75 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Arizona
review: Off-dry in feel, with soft, creamy-edged melon, almond and ginger notes followed by a hint of dried pineapple on the finish. Drink now. 120 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Arizona
review: A ripe, thick-textured style, with hazelnut and citrus oil notes laced with a streak of bitter orange, followed by a waxy finish. Interesting, but not for everyone. Drink now. 175 cases made.

name: Magdelena America
review: Soft and inviting, with mulled plum and blackberry fruit laced with hints of toast and tobacco. Petit Verdot and Barbera. Drink now. 175 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Arizona
review: Juicy and forward, with good peach, butter and heather notes. Soft finish. Drink now. 150 cases made.

name: Tempranillo Arizona
review: Fleshy and smoky, featuring nice raisin, fig, vanilla and cinnamon notes that are a touch heady in the end. Drink now. 150 cases made.

name: Tempranillo Soñoita Estate
review: Dark and broad, with a thick coating of bittersweet chocolate covering a core of roasted plum and loganberry fruit. Persistent, but with more weight than purity. Drink now. 175 cases made.

name: Viognier Soñoita Estate
review: Firm, with peach pit and melon rind notes holding sway over slightly firm pear and bitter almond flavors. Drink now. 175 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Arizona
review: A touch heady, with cherry compote and melted raisin notes backed by a spice-tinged finish. Drink now. 225 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Arizona
review: Racy in feel, with modest peach and chamomile notes, backed by an aggressive onion streak on the finish that leaves a rancid feel. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 150 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Altenberg
review: A distinctive, off-dry Gewürztraminer, with dried apricot and spice aromas. Medium-bodied and lightly sweet, with earthy, grassy, dried apricot flavors and a long, spicy finish. Drink now.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Grand Cru Furstentum
review: A full-blown vendange tardive-style wine, with lots of fruit and acidity. Big and rich; should be perfect with fruit or as an aperitif. Drinkable now.

name: Pinot Blanc Alsace
review: Packed with fruit. Full-bodied and lightly sweet, with dense fruit structure and lots of tropical fruit aromas and flavors and a peppery finish. Drinkable now.

name: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Schlossberg
review: Ripe and powerful, albeit a bit one-dimensional. Has honey, peach and cream aromas. Medium-bodied and dry, with ripe pineapple flavor and a lingering finish. Try now.

name: Pinot Blanc Alsace The Furst
review: A light-bodied white, featuring tangy apple, tangerine and white peach flavors, with a nice baseline of juicy acidity. Modest finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace
review: Attractive and flamboyant, with lots of fruit; great as an aperitif. Offers intense tropical fruit and pie crust aromas. Full-bodied, with a slightly off-dry, rich, fat yet elegant fruit structure and a very powerful finish. Drinkable now.

name: Tokay Pinot Gris Alsace
review: Elegant and ripe, with smoky, spicy fruit aromas and flavors. Medium-bodied and lightly off-dry, with ripe peach and coconut flavors and a fresh finish. Drinkable now.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace
review: Offers light, elegant fruit, with almond and citrus aromas; melts like butter in the mouth. Medium-bodied and slightly off-dry, with medium-rich lemon, spice and tropical fruit flavors and a fresh finish. Drinkable now.

name: Tokay Pinot Gris Alsace
review: Sweet, with candied-fruit flavors of apricot and orange that dissipate quickly. Lacks structure and depth. Drink now.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace
review: Ripe, soft and thickly textured, this straightforward, ginger and litchi-flavored white finishes short.

name: Riesling Alsace Anne de K
review: Fresh, with delicate acidity, this offers pleasing notes of orchard blossom, apricot and mandarin orange, balanced with a hint of fleur de sel on the finish. Drink now through 2018.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Anne de K
review: A smoky vein of minerality runs through the well-meshed flavors of baked apricot, cantaloupe, orange granita and orchard blossom. Clean and focused, with a juicy finish. Drink now through 2018.

name: Brut Blanc de Blancs Crémant d'Alsace Anne de K
review: Fine and creamy in texture, offering crisp acidity to balance the well-meshed mix of poached apple and pear fruit, accented by notes of pastry and lemon parfait. Drink now through 2017. 8,000 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Alsace Anne de K
review: Soft and floral, showing just enough zip for balance. This features flavors of lychee, blood orange and grapefruit zest, with a lightly smoky finish. Drink now through 2016.

name: Pinot Blanc Alsace Anne de K
review: Hints of grapefruit zest and stone mix with star fruit and crunchy white peach flavors in this light-bodied, tangy white. Drink now. 3,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Blanc Alsace Anne de K
review: Light-bodied and fresh, this round white offers a smoky base note and hints of poached pear, candied ginger and lemon zest. Drink now.

name: Pinot Gris Alsace Altenbourg Anne de K Old Vines
review: Modest and lightly cloying, with hints of candied peach, baked apple, toasted almond and ginger. Drink now. 100 cases imported.

name: Riesling Alsace Anne de K
review: Tangy and straightforward, with hints of apple cider, beeswax and lemon peel. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Alsace Patergarten Anne de K Old Vines
review: A modest white, with tangy acidity and floral, creamed almond and melon notes. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Syrah Bennett Valley R Five
review: Dark and densely structured, with currant and stony mineral aromas and compact flavors of smoky plum, espresso and grilled herb. Will the fruit outlast the firm tannins? Best from 2018 through 2024. 600 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Rutherford
review: Elegant honeyed pear, yellow apple and melon flavors are supple and spicy, with enough acidity to keep the flavors fresh and lively. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: A cloak of smoky, cedary oak gives this a chewy edge, joining a rustic, roughhewn core of dark berry and spice flavors, ending gravelly. Best from 2019 through 2030. 550 cases made.

name: Alentejo Azamor Selected Vines
review: Dense, with plenty of sinew to the kirsch, dark plum and black currant flavors. Finishes with dark chocolate and graphite notes. Syrah, Touriga Franca, Alicante Bouschet and Trincadeira. Drink now through 2010. 800 cases made.

name: Petit Verdot Alentejo Azamor
review: Muscular red from Portugal, with plenty of fresh red plum flavors that are burnished by lively mineral and spice notes. Drink now. 800 cases made.

name: Alentejo Azamor
review: This offers stewy aromas of red fruits, with flavors to match. Short finish. Touriga Franca, Merlot, Trincadeira and others. 1,500 cases made.

name: Alentejo Azamor
review: Sweet cherry and spice are the hallmarks of this ripe red. Turns a touch candied on the finish. Syrah, Merlot, Touriga Nacional, Alicante Bouschet, Touriga Franca and Trincadeira. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay South Eastern Australia
review: Light and refreshing for its gentle apple and citrus flavor, finishing with a pleasant creamy texture. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz South Eastern Australia
review: Ripe and focused, with solid, one-dimensional berry flavors. Drink now. 15,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz South Eastern Australia
review: Fresh and appealing for its simple berry and spice flavors. A bit reduced, it can benefit from decanting. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Zinergy Paso Robles
review: Offers broad shoulders, but remains a bit hollow in the middle. Shows notes of baked cherry, licorice and smoky spice. Zinfandel, Petite Sirah and Grenache. Drink now through 2016. 105 cases made.

name: Shiraz Clare Valley Attunga 1865
review: Smoky, ripe, rich and seamless in the way it plays its cherry, currant, plum and toasty, spicy overtones together, rolling smoothly into the long, expressive finish. Drink now through 2021. 25 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley R
review: Velvety, graceful and generous with its cherry, licorice and cocoa flavors that swirl through the finish with hints of cardamom and clove. Not a powerhouse, but this has tremendous focus and a sense of elegance. The tannins are well-submerged. Best from 2010 through 2020. 50 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley R
review: Polished and generous, this is beautifully focused, plush and layered with cream, nutmeg and bittersweet chocolate-tinged blueberry, plum and currant flavors, which are wrapped neatly in refined tannins that let the finish roll on. Best from 2009 through 2020. 250 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Clare Valley Attunga 1865
review: Rich and ripe, loaded with dark berry and cherry fruit, weaving in undertones of mineral and tobacco as the finish sails on and on. This creates a great balance of power and finesse. The tannins are polished. Best from 2011 through 2020. 100 cases imported.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale M
review: Round, velvety and deliciously focused on plum and blackberry fruit, which remains fresh and vibrant as the finish sneaks in hints of coffee and cream and keeps sailing against a blanket of fine tannins. Best from 2011 through 2020. 50 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Clare Valley Attunga 1865
review: Dark, dense, powerful and rich, with Black Forest cake and blackberry flavors and sink-your-teeth-into them tannins. Muscular yet very generous, especially on the long finish, where the flavors crescendo, showing impeccable detail. Drink now through 2027. 250 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Clare Valley Covenant
review: Supple, polished, expressive and ripe, layering the blackberry, dark plum, floral and clove flavors onto an open-textured frame. The finish lingers attractively. Shows presence and harmony, with plenty of room to expand. Drink now through 2025. 375 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Clare Valley Covenant
review: Steely, powerful and focused, showing a welcome freshness to the licorice-accented blackberry, dark plum and black cherry flavors, lingering on the finish along with hints of pepper and clove. Best from 2012 through 2020. 750 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Clare Valley Oracle
review: This is polished, focused and beautifully expressive, with seductive blackberry, cream, sweet leather and spice flavors waxing and persisting through the long, generous finish. Drink now through 2016. 500 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Clare Valley Oracle
review: Warm, rich and supple, a seductive wine dripping with ripe blackberry, black cherry, vanilla and spice flavors that weave through the highly polished finish and last and last. Tannins are present, but nicely submerged. Best from 2002 through 2013. 600 cases made.

name: Riesling Clare Valley Killerman's Run
review: Intense, a succulent mix of peach, lime and lanolin notes. Hints of white flowers and a drizzle of honey add richness without getting in the way of the vibrant acidity. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Riesling Clare Valley Mort's Block
review: Light and elegant, floating flavors of pear, peach and citrus on a refined texture. The acidity kicks in on the long finish. Drink now through 2023. 200 cases imported.

name: Riesling Clare Valley Mort's Reserve
review: Light and steely, showing refinement to the dry, minerally apple and floral flavors as they glide into a long and harmonious finish. Drink now through 2025. 25 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Green's Vineyard
review: Velvety, round and focused, offering a meaty edge to the cinnamon-accented cherry and raspberry flavors, lingering against a mild grip of tannins. Best from 2013 through 2018. 50 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Green's Vineyard
review: Ripe and silky, brimming with mint-accented black cherry and tar flavors and maintaining its composure on the long, expressive finish. Best from 2012 through 2020. 50 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley R
review: Ripe and generous, this is wrapped with firm tannins around a core of fresh boysenberry and spice flavors. A big wine that finishes with amazing finesse. Best from 2013 through 2017. 25 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Testament
review: Plush and ripe, with a gorgeous range of blackberry, plum and thyme flavors that mingle effortlessly on the long, dense finish. Also hits some licorice notes. Best from 2010 through 2020. 750 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Clare Valley Attunga 1865
review: A medium-weight style, lithe and focused, offering currant and plum fruit that plays out against a nice hint of black pepper and anise seed as the finish lingers. Aims for elegance over power. Drink now through 2017. 50 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Clare Valley Covenant
review: Not for the faint of heart. Dense and intense, with chewy tannins and plenty of Earl Grey tea notes to complement the wild blackberry core. The tannins become chewy on the finish but don't get in the way of the wine's focus. Drink now through 2030. 375 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Clare Valley Covenant
review: This firm red shows fascinating cola and coffee overtones to its cherry and raspberry flavors, picking up a mineral note as the finish rolls on and on. Offers depth and transparency. Best from 2012 through 2020. 1,500 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Clare Valley Covenant
review: Has impressive concentration without getting heavy or dense, offering sleek cherry, blackberry, berry leaf and mineral flavors that keep swirling through the long, focused finish. The tannins are well-submerged. Best from 2010 through 2017. 500 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Clare Valley Oracle
review: Focused, with fleshy, sink-your-teeth-into-them tannins that provide a terrific structure for the juicy dark berry flavors and peppery accents. Persistent on the finish. Drink now through 2026. 295 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Clare Valley Oracle
review: Dark and velvety. A vivid mouthful of violet-scented blueberry, blackberry and plum on a creamy texture that lets the finish roll on and on. The tannins are well-integrated. Best from 2009 through 2016. 500 cases imported.

name: Grenache Clare Valley Duke Reserve
review: Black tea, walnut and sarsaparilla flavors are dark and brooding, on a velvety frame, with wild blackberry and blueberry flavors at the core. Plenty of personality and good concentration on the long finish. Drink now through 2023. 250 cases imported.

name: Riesling Clare Valley Killerman's Run
review: Light and tangy, with expressive flavors of peppery pineapple and citrus, persisting with vivid detail on the dry, open-weave finish. Drink now through 2020. 200 cases imported.

name: Riesling Watervale Mort's Block
review: Light and tart, with lively apple and lime flavors coming together tightly. The finish lingers with refinement. Drink now through 2018. 500 cases imported.

name: Riesling Watervale Mort's Block
review: Tight, bright and refreshing for its lime-scented apple and floral flavors that don't quit on the zingy finish. Drink now through 2019. 500 cases imported.

name: Riesling Watervale Mort's Block
review: This is tangy in structure, with waves of lime, pineapple, grapefruit and slate aromas and flavors that keep welling up against a steely frame. Has finesse and intensity right through the long finish. Drink now through 2015. 500 cases imported.

name: Riesling Watervale Mort's Reserve
review: Crisp, tight and distinctive, revealing mineral elements among the citrus and apple flavors, lingering intently on an open texture. Drink now through 2022. 25 cases imported.

name: Riesling Watervale Mort's Reserve
review: Light, bright and vibrant, with pear and lime aromas, picking up a floral note as the finish zips. Drink now through 2015. 50 cases imported.

name: Riesling Watervale Mort's Reserve
review: Sleek, vibrant and tingling with lime, green apple, star fruit and wet-stone aromas and flavors. A textbook Riesling that finishes dry and steely. Best from 2012 through 2020. 50 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Green's Vineyard
review: A vibrant, open-textured and expressive red, lifting its flavors of blackberry, licorice, pear and citrus buoyantly, floating easily into the long and focused finish. Drink now through 2020. 25 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Green's Vineyard
review: Firm, with prickly tannins around a supple core of cherry and berry flavors, hinting at coffee and mint as the finish lingers. Gets better and more cohesive with each sip. Drink now through 2020. 25 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Green's Vineyard
review: Smooth and round, picking up a light grip on the finish to support the dark berry, floral and chocolate flavors that linger nicely on the finish. Best from 2011 through 2016. 100 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Testament
review: Smooth in texture, dripping with ripe, tarry, licorice-accented blackberry and plum flavors. Finishes on a meaty note. Drink now through 2015. 500 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Testament
review: Big, ripe and generous, wrapping its bacon-scented blackberry and cherry flavors in several layers of fine tannins, lingering well. Drink now through 2015. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Clare Valley
review: Ripe, supple, focused and generous with its blackberry, anise, black pepper and vanilla flavors that mingle and linger on the long, velvety finish. Delicious now, with just enough sneaky acidity to keep it lively. Drink now through 2012.

name: Shiraz Clare Valley Attunga 1865
review: Rich, fresh earth and loam notes present an intriguing background for sandalwood-scented plum and cherry flavors, with velvety tannins lingering. Drink now through 2026. 25 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Clare Valley Attunga 1865
review: Broad and generous, this offers an expressive range of aromatics, with notes of green olive, aloe and ripe tomato wound around a supple core of dark fruit. Shows depth and intensity, holding power in reserve. Drink now through 2018. 25 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Clare Valley Oracle
review: Fresh and vibrant, this is juicy with dark berry and black pepper flavors that sail over refined tannins and linger on the open-textured finish. This has intensity, but wields it gently. Drink now through 2019. 200 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Clare Valley Oracle
review: Dense, chewy and tightly packed, with smoky, peppery accents adding depth to the brooding blackberry and licorice flavors. The finish persists against a layer of tannins. Needs time to soften. Best after 2013. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale M
review: Ripe and rich, with dark plum and blueberry flavors at the center, shaded with mineral and cola notes as the finish pushes successfully against fine tannins. Best from 2011 through 2016. 100 cases imported.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Parable
review: Dense and mouthcoating, not heavy but thick with cherry, molasses and spice flavors, lingering on the polished, peppery finish. Best after 2014. 50 cases imported.

name: Shiraz-Grenache Australia Killerman's Run
review: This vibrant, medium-weight red shows impressive presence to its flavors of pomegranate, guava and flowers, which dance with precision into the long finish. Drink now through 2018. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Clare Valley Blocks Road
review: Firm and chewy, with ripe currant and blackberry flavors bursting through, shaded with cedar and sage hints as the finish lingers. Best from 2011 through 2014. 500 cases imported.

name: Grenache Clare Valley The Duke
review: Soft and ripe, with a burr to the tannins wrapped around the lively, fresh blackberry and currant fruit, lingering easily on the polished finish. Drink now through 2012. 100 cases imported.

name: Grenache Clare Valley The Duke
review: Dark and dense, with an airy feel to the texture that lightens up the brooding black cherry and smoke flavors, lingering on the fine-grained finish. Drink now through 2014. 250 cases imported.

name: Riesling Clare Valley Killerman's Run
review: Mouthwatering and delicate up front, with an appealing touch of lanolin adding a savory quality to the lemon curd, pineapple and lime core. Shows plenty of intensity on the vibrant finish. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Riesling Watervale Mort's Block
review: Tight, dry and refreshing, with grapefruit, apple and floral flavors, persisting on the slightly raw finish. Best after 2014. 200 cases imported.

name: Riesling Watervale Mort's Block
review: Crisp, like biting into a fresh Asian pear, hinting at apricot as the dry finish persists nicely. Drink now through 2015. 500 cases imported.

name: Riesling Watervale Mort's Block
review: Dry and crisp, with tightly packed, tobacco-scented green apple, pineapple and gooseberry flavors, lingering effortlessly. Drink now through 2018. 500 cases imported.

name: Riesling Watervale Mort's Reserve
review: Light and silky, with a delicate almond note weaving through the lime, apple and floral flavors, lingering nicely. Drink now through 2018. 50 cases imported.

name: Riesling Watervale Mort's Reserve
review: Steely dry, with mouthwatering acidity to complement the citrusy apple and nutmeg aromas and flavors, finishing with vivid intensity. Needs time to open up a bit. Best from 2009 through 2015. 100 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Kavel's Flock
review: Fresh, vibrant and precise, beaming with cherry, raspberry and spice flavors that segue into hints of mint on the mildly tannic finish. Best from 2015 through 2018. 100 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley R
review: Ripe and distinctive for the mint and menthol overtones to the plump cherry and coffee flavors, lingering on the spicy finish. Best from 2011 through 2017. 100 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Clare Valley Covenant
review: Smooth and inviting, offering blackberry, black cherry, paprika and crème fraîche notes that mingle effortlessly on the refined, persistent finish. Drink now through 2018. 200 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Clare Valley Covenant
review: Plush, generous and well-focused, with fresh-tasting cherry and pomegranate flavors that meld nicely with mineral and white pepper notes, lingering against refined tannins. Drink now through 2018. 1,500 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Clare Valley Killerman's Run
review: Fresh and open-textured, this glows with black cherry, pear and citrus flavors, coming together into a dense and focused finish. A meaty note adds interest. Drink now through 2020. 800 cases imported.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale M
review: This firm Shiraz shows a bit of grit weaving through the deep ripe plum and coffee flavors, but that smoothes out quickly. Finishes with intensity. Drink now through 2017. 25 cases imported.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale M Reserve
review: Bright and jazzy, this delivers a lithe mouthful of cherry, roasted beet and licorice flavors, lingering on the polished finish. Drink now through 2015. 50 cases imported.

name: Shiraz South Australia Killerman's Run
review: Supple, ripe and refined, offering a generous, open-textured hit of blackberry, licorice and smoke flavors that linger easily against fine-grained tannins. Drink now through 2017. 5,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz South Australia Killerman's Run
review: This is smooth and graceful with oomph of tannins and acidity behind the licorice-accented cherry and blackberry flavors. Yet finishes harmoniously. Best from 2009 through 2015. 4,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz-Grenache South Australia Killerman's Run
review: Smooth and velvety, this red is generous with its blackberry and tar flavors, hinting at smoke as the finish lingers enticingly. Drink now through 2015. 2,000 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Clare Valley Blocks Road
review: Fresh herb notes of rosemary and bay leaf add a fragrant edge to the core of cassis flavors. The tannins are thick but polished, lingering with a hint of tobacco. Drink now through 2026. 425 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Clare Valley Blocks Road
review: Supple and expressive, lithe and appealing for its plum and currant flavors, nicely shaded with spice and herb notes, this lingers gently against polished tannins. Drink now through 2020. 425 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Clare Valley Blocks Road
review: This dense red is generous with its ripe currant, black olive and tar flavors, nicely packed into a solid frame, built for the cellar. Needs time to smooth the edges. Best after 2012. 500 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Clare Valley Blocks Road
review: Sleek and appealing for its ripe blackberry and currant fruit, smoky, tarry overtones, and lively balance and transparency on the finish. Drink now through 2013. 400 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Clare Valley Killerman's Run
review: Opens with a juicy mouthful of cherry and raspberry flavors, giving way to more substantial bass notes of spice, tobacco, fresh herb and licorice. Shows plenty of harmony on the finish. Drink now through 2027. 500 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Clare Valley Killerman's Run
review: Supple, with velvety tannins and a mix of plum, black licorice and spice box notes, lingering on the finish. Drink now through 2026. 500 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Clare Valley Killerman's Run
review: Velvety and refined, this red plays its detailed currant, plum and floral flavors against polished tannins on an open texture. The finish echoes nicely. Drink now through 2020. 500 cases imported.

name: Grenache Blend Clare Valley Killerman's Run
review: Dried violet and cream soda accents soften the edges of this dense, muscular red, with plum and wild berry flavors that linger pleasantly. Drink now through 2029. 300 cases imported.

name: Grenache Clare Valley Kelly 1932
review: Notably dense, firm and chewy, with cherry and plum flavors and a touch of black licorice. Compact and spicy on the finish. Drink now through 2022. 125 cases imported.

name: Grenache Clare Valley Prodigal
review: There is plenty of harmony to the black walnut, dark chocolate and framboise flavors at the core of this red, with a vibrant juicy note and spice accents on the velvety finish. Drink now through 2027. 295 cases imported.

name: Grenache Clare Valley Prodigal
review: Lithe, open-textured and appealing for its spicy red berry and red currant flavors, lingering on the silky finish. Drink now through 2013. 500 cases imported.

name: Grenache Clare Valley Prodigal
review: Dark, ripe and distinctive for its tarry blackberry and licorice flavors. More like a Shiraz than a Grenache, but a darned good one. Drink now through 2010. 400 cases imported.

name: Grenache Clare Valley The Duke
review: Taut, bright and generous, with juicy blackberry and dark plum flavors that zing through the finish against refreshing acidity and fine tannins. Drink now through 2015. 50 cases imported.

name: Riesling Clare Valley Mort's Block
review: Bright and crisp, with harmonious flavors of green apple, pear and lime. Light and refreshing on the finish. Drink now. 200 cases imported.

name: Riesling Clare Valley Mort's Block
review: Petrol and honeysuckle aromatics give a lift to the guava and lemon flavors. Very crisp on the finish. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Exodus
review: Dark and chewy, with a strong smoky note running through the black plum and pepper flavors. Narrows a bit on the tannic finish. Best after 2015. 25 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Clare Valley Covenant
review: Dark and tangy, with firm tannins around a lively core of tomato-accented blackberry and pepper flavors, lingering on the finish. Best from 2009 through 2014. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Clare Valley Oracle
review: This crisp style packs blackberry and licorice flavors into a tight package, framing the fruit and spice details with moderately gritty tannins. Best from 2015 through 2020. 200 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Clare Valley Oracle
review: Rich and ripe, with a smoky edge to the plush cherry, blackberry and mocha flavors, lingering impressively against polished tannins. Drink now through 2014. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Parable
review: This sturdy, chewy red is tannic but juicy, with spicy plum and blueberry flavors emerging nicely on the extensive finish. Best from 2013 through 2018. 500 cases imported.

name: Shiraz-Grenache South Australia Killerman's Run
review: Smooth and spicy, offering juicy blackberry and cherry flavors under a fragile blanket of fine tannins and scents of pepper and clove. Lingers well. Drink now through 2011. 2,500 cases imported.

name: The Medley Barossa Valley-Clare Valley
review: Supple and generous, with a nice sense of restraint to the tobacco-accented cherry and spice flavors, finishing with polished texture. Grenache, Shiraz and Mourvèdre. Drink now through 2013. 500 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Clare Valley Blocks Road
review: Fresh and vibrant, a lithe Cabernet, showing modest currant and floral flavors. Lingers gently. Drink now through 2016. 100 cases imported.

name: Grenache Clare Valley Prodigal
review: Wilted rose petal and white pepper accents are a nice touch to the bright cherry fruit flavors at the core, with a black tea finish. Drink now through 2020. 295 cases imported.

name: Killerman's Run Clare Valley
review: Firm, with juicy wild berry flavors and fresh herb highlights, fresh earth and black tea notes gaining momentum on the finish. Grenache, Shiraz and Mataro. Drink now through 2023. 500 cases imported.

name: Killerman's Run Clare Valley
review: Sleek and vibrant, with an undertone of bitter chocolate playing against refreshing, peppermint-accented berry flavors, lingering gently. Grenache, Shiraz and Mataro. Drink now through 2020. 300 cases imported.

name: Riesling Clare Valley Mort's Reserve
review: The lime, grapefruit and melon flavors are crisp and refreshing. Touches of almond and green apple skin show on the finish. Drink now. 25 cases imported.

name: Riesling Watervale Mort's Reserve
review: Light and polished, with spicy green berry and pineapple flavors, lingering well. Drink now through 2015. 100 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Clare Valley Covenant
review: Crisp in texture, not tart, but offering fine tannins around nicely modulated currant and plum fruit. Hints at mocha as the finish lingers. Drink now through 2017. 200 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Clare Valley Killerman's Run
review: There's a savory undertone providing appealing tension to the plump dark fruit flavors, with espresso, spice and tobacco accents. Harmonious and velvety on the finish. Drink now through 2027. 800 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Clare Valley Killerman's Run
review: Cherry and red berry flavors are accented by fresh herb, earth and dried floral notes in this open-knit red, with a savory detail lingering on the finish. Drink now through 2026. 800 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Clare Valley Oracle
review: Berry and plum notes have cedar, mineral, licorice and black tea accents. Dense and chewy on the finish, where all the flavors settle in harmony. Drink now through 2027. 295 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Clare Valley Oracle
review: Firm in texture, this red is lithe, not weighty, and plays out its plum, earth and licorice flavors, which echo nicely on the finish. Drink now through 2015. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Parable
review: Velvety and distinctly spicy, with cardamom and green olive flavors weaving through the dark berry fruit, mingling on the fine-grained finish. Best from 2008 through 2014. 750 cases imported.

name: Shiraz South Australia Killerman's Run
review: This velvety red is tight with blueberry, currant and crushed rock aromas and flavors, lingering easily. Drink now through 2014. 5,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz-Grenache South Australia Killerman's Run
review: Firm in texture, this red shows vibrant blackberry and floral flavors set on a tight frame, lingering well. Drink now through 2015. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz-Grenache South Australia Killerman's Run
review: Velvety, round and generous with its spicy blackberry and tar flavors, lingering on the open-textured finish. Drink now through 2012. 2,000 cases imported.

name: The Medley Barossa Valley-Clare Valley
review: Firm in texture, with ripe blackberry character and a layer of green, stalky flavors that edge in on the finish. Grenache, Shiraz and Mourvèdre. Best from 2009 through 2014. 500 cases imported.

name: The Medley GSM Clare-Barossa Valleys
review: Firm in texture, with chewy tannins around the dark berry and grapefruit flavors, persisting on the finish. Grenache, Shiraz and Mourvèdre. Best from 2015 through 2018. 100 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon South Australia Killerman's Run
review: Focused, ripe and appealing, offering clear blackberry and currant flavors, picking off herbal notes as firm tannins clamp down on the finish. Best after 2015. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Grenache Clare Valley Prodigal
review: Lean and peppery, with cherry and raspberry fruit mingling nicely with the spice on a lithe texture, finishing crisp. Drink now through 2013. 200 cases imported.

name: Grenache Clare Valley Prodigal
review: Soft and fragrant, a velvety-textured wine with orange peel-accented cherry and tobacco flavors. Drink now through 2012. 500 cases imported.

name: Riesling Clare Valley Killerman's Run
review: Crisp green apple flavors have a lemony edge, with notes of slate and dried flowers. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Exodus
review: Robust, with campfire and toasted spice notes and a mouthful of chewy tannins complementing the cherry and plum flavors. Finishes with a hint of espresso. Drink now through 2025. 225 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Clare Valley Killerman's Run
review: This has core notes of green tea and fresh herb, with firm tannins and wild berry flavors. Tobacco and cedar notes linger. Drink now through 2026. 800 cases imported.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Parable
review: Firm, focused and appealing for its deftly balanced berry, chocolate and spice, picking up a floral note as the finish recedes. Drink now through 2014. 500 cases imported.

name: Shiraz South Australia Killerman's Run
review: Supple and velvety, balancing cherry and spice flavors on a medium-weight frame. Lingers on the finish, with crisp acidity. Drink now through 2016. 1,500 cases imported.

name: Shiraz South Australia Killerman's Run
review: Soft and ripe, with pretty blackberry and peppery cream flavors. Drink now through 2010. 5,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz-Grenache South Australia Killerman's Run
review: On the lighter side, with ripe plum and berry fruit and spicy, licorice-accented overtones weaving through the medium-weight finish. Drink now through 2014. 2,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz-Grenache South Australia Killerman's Run
review: Ripe, chewy and distinctive for its dark chocolate, cherry and dried blueberry flavors, lingering on the slightly hot finish. Drink now through 2012. 2,000 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Clare Valley Killerman's Run
review: Minty, with candied cherry and black tea accents set on a medium body. A black licorice hint lingers. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon South Australia Killerman's Run
review: Modest in scope, with dark berry and licorice notes playing against a layer of fine tannins. Finishes with a hint of smoke. Drink now through 2014. 1,500 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon South Australia Killerman's Run
review: Bright, open-textured and appealing for its cherry and black olive flavors, finishing with no interference from the tannins. Drink now. 1,500 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Barossa Valley Crowhurst Reserve
review: Crisp in texture, featuring firm tannins around a tight core of black pepper and licorice, with a touch of fruit enlivening the finish. Best after 2015. 25 cases imported.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Miracle Hill
