review: Supple, ripe, focused and appealing, featuring molasses-accented black cherry and blackberry flavors that tighten up on the finish. Best after 2015. 25 cases imported.

name: Shiraz South Australia Killerman's Run
review: A bit tangy with tannins, but the red berry and spice flavors come through on the finish, despite a metallic edge. Drink now. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz South Australia Killerman's Run
review: This smooth red is modestly endowed with plum and coffee flavors, finishing on an earth note against drying tannins. Drink now through 2013. 5,000 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon South Australia Killerman's Run
review: Light and crisp, with drying tannins around a modest core of berry and herb flavors. Best after 2009. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Riesling Clare Valley Killerman's Run
review: Light, with a strong earthy streak to the modest, slightly metallic citrus flavors. Best after 2018. 500 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay California Angel Juice
review: Fresh, ripe green fig and peachy Chardonnay flavors are intense, elegant and stylish, ending with a baked apple pie flavor. Drink now. 9,300 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Central Coast
review: Sleek and spicy, with red cherry, red berry and cranberry notes that are clean and crisp. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon California
review: Herb and dried currant join savory earth, berry and cedary oak, gaining complexity, if on a modest scale. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Grigio California Angel Juice
review: Distractingly floral, with herb and chamomile notes overshadowing the simple citrus flavors within. A quaffably light body and juicy acidity give this some charm. Drink now. 15,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Western Australia
review: Distinctive and elegant, ripe, round and layered with earthy-mineral notes between the harmonious pear and citrus flavors, finishing long and elegant. Drink now through 2006. 1,200 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Western Australia
review: Firm and chewy, not harsh, but the fine-grained tannins frame a nice bead of smoky blackberry, sage and spice flavors. Best from 2000 through 2004. 1,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Western Australia
review: Supple and generous with its herb-scented cherry and currant flavors, which linger nicely on the velvety finish. Drink now through 2005. 2,200 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Western Australia
review: Firm and compact, with a tight band of cedary currant, coffee, anise and spice, finishing with a glimmer of stewed plum. Tannins are firm and dry. Drink now through 2008. 1,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Geographe
review: Has an earthy edge to the ripe berry and spice flavors, finishing firm. Needs time to soften. Best after 2005. 2,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Western Australia
review: Dark, with rich, peppery blackberry, wild berry, cedar and sage, turning tight and tannic. Best from 2001 through 2007. 1,500 cases made.

name: Shiraz Western Australia
review: Medium-weight, smooth, focused and appealing for the distinctive raspberry, nutmeg and cherry notes lingering on the firm finish. Drink now through 2002. 1,800 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Margaret River
review: Herbal, bordering on vegetal, a sturdy white, persistent if not quite elegant. Drink now. 2,200 cases made.

name: Shiraz Western Australia
review: A dark, chewy and dense red, with a hot edge to the peppery berry flavors. Not much charm here. Best after 2004. 3,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Western Australia
review: Tart and unpleasant for a soapy, wet-earth note. Excessively tart. 1,300 cases made.

name: Shiraz Langhorne Creek
review: Firm, round and generous with its gorgeous blackberry, currant, sandalwood, star anise and bacon aromas and flavors, finishing complex and elegant. Needs time to gain flesh. Best from 2011 through 2020. 450 cases made.

name: Blend Langhorne Creek
review: Plump, plush and seductive, appealing for its deep-pile texture and beautifully pure blueberry, plum and exotic spice aromas and flavors, which echo on the ripe finish. Cabernet Sauvignon and Shiraz. Drink now through 2007. 1,000 cases made.

name: Blend Langhorne Creek
review: A lithe red. Ripe and polished, with cherry, currant and herb flavors that glide effortlessly through the long finish. Shiraz and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2014. 1,900 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Langhorne Creek Seduction
review: Rich and ripe, with generous flavors of blackberry, plum, tar and spice that glide seamlessly through the polished finish, lingering impressively. Drink now through 2017. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Langhorne Creek
review: Ripe and supple, delivering a mouthful of blueberry, blackberry, plum and spice flavors that linger easily on the round finish. Drink now through 2015. 900 cases made.

name: Shiraz Langhorne Creek
review: Ripe, almost plush, and distinctive for its spicy, peppery overtones around a generous core of plum and berry flavors, finishing with a touch of cedary spice. Drink now through 2009. 1,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Langhorne Creek
review: Gorgeous aromas of spice, fruitcake and plum are set on a rich, lush and vibrant structure that drives the flavors to a satisfying conclusion. Lingering aftertaste of boysenberry. Drink now through 2003. 440 cases made.

name: Shiraz Langhorne Creek Scream
review: Spice, tobacco and cedar notes mingle with the rich, ripe currant and blackberry flavors. Polished and intense, fanning out on the velvety finish. Drink now through 2026. 500 cases imported.

name: Blend Langhorne Creek
review: Ripe and generous, a soft-textured melding of blackberry, licorice and black pepper flavors that roll through a nicely framed finish. Cabernet Sauvignon and Shiraz. Drink now through 2015. 900 cases made.

name: Blend Langhorne Creek
review: Rich, ripe and generous with its cherry, plum and herb flavors, hinting at leather and pepper as the flavors linger, finishing with a swarm of refined tannins. Cabernet Sauvignon and Shiraz. Best after 2005. 1,200 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Langhorne Creek
review: Has a lean, hard-edged structure, packing ripe blackberry and currant fruit into a lively range of flavors, which linger on the juicy finish. Best from 2005 through 2010. 900 cases made.

name: Shiraz Langhorne Creek
review: Smooth and generous. A gentle style of Shiraz that emerges with juicy cherry fruit and a hint of beet on the long finish. Drink now through 2012. 1,200 cases made.

name: Blend Langhorne Creek
review: Ripe and generous on a lively frame, with raspberry and spice flavors reminiscent of Grenache at the core, finishing smooth. Shiraz and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now. 1,795 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Langhorne Creek
review: Dark and ripe, this slick-textured red shows deep cherry and herb flavors that linger on the lean, polished finish. Drink now through 2012. 300 cases made.

name: Scaredy Cat Langhorne Creek
review: Tangy, with wild berry, sage and bay leaf flavors mingling on a velvety frame. Good follow-through on the finish. Cabernet Sauvignon and Shiraz. Drink now through 2026. 500 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Langhorne Creek
review: A deft combination of generous boysenberry and spice flavors against crisp, juicy acidity. A big wine that revs up to be lively through and through. Drink now through 2007. 500 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Sandtrap
review: Firm in texture, with a distinct minty note wafting through the cherry and spice flavors, lingering gently. Drink now through 2012. 850 cases made.

name: Shiraz Langhorne Creek
review: Bright and juicy, nicely focused to show off its blueberry and currant fruit, lingering on the cedary finish. Fine tannins need time to soften. Best from 2006 through 2010. 700 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Langhorne Creek Sneaky
review: Dark and spicy, showing liberal lashings of licorice to the stewed plum and dried blueberry flavors, finishing with generosity. Drink now through 2018. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Blend Langhorne Creek
review: Dark and juicy, with a strong green olive tone running through the licorice-infused black fruit flavors. Shiraz and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2010. 2,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Langhorne Creek
review: Smooth and generous, a lovely mouthful of berry and spice flavors on an open frame. Drink now through 2004. 900 cases made.

name: The Shadow Langhorne Creek
review: Generous, tangy berry and cherry flavors have spice, tobacco and cedar accents, finishing firm, with notes of nutmeg. Shiraz and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2028. 600 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Langhorne Creek
review: Firm in texture, with chewy tannins around a weak core of cedary berry flavors. Best after 2004. 900 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Langhorne Creek
review: Soft, with a stewed, meaty quality to the modest plum and herb flavors. Drink now. 450 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Concentrated and complex, with vivid passion fruit, grapefruit and tangy peach flavors. Vibrant minerality and tangy lime juice acidity keep thumping through the finish. Drink now. 65,000 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Gisborne Tietjen
review: Ripe, round and generous with its orange-scented pear and apricot flavors, weaving pretty spice and oak notes through the long finish. Drink now through 2005. 700 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Gisborne Tietjen
review: Ripe, open-textured and engagingly silky, with pear, apricot, vanilla and honey notes fanning out on the finish. Has style and class already, but should develop with cellaring. 200 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Gisborne Tietjen-Briant
review: Ripe, almost explosively so, but retains a sense of elegance as the apricot-scented pineapple and citrus flavors sail through the long, beautifully polished finish. Drink now through 2009. 2,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Fragrant and complex, with a refreshing burst of lime, guava, grapefruit and grass flavors. Wet stone, passion fruit and oyster shell accents add interest, with bright acidity highlighting the vivid finish. Another outstanding Sauvignon from a perennial success. Drink now. 175,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Concentrated and very intense, weaving together a harmonious medley of crushed stone, grapefruit and nut flavors. Savory herbs, grass and lime notes highlight the bright, vibrant finish. Drink now. 125,000 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Explosively aromatic, brimming with spice, herb and peppery character, surprisingly docile in the mouth, with lovely pear, apple, melon and mineral flavors that linger enticingly. Impeccably balanced. Drink now. 60,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Small Parcels Spitfire
review: Passion fruit, apricot and ruby grapefruit flavors are bright and juicy on a polished frame, with good intensity on the finish, where lemon verbena and candied ginger accents take over. Drink now. 7,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough SP Spitfire
review: This is aromatic with fresh herbs, especially sage, then bursts with pineapple, grapefruit and guava flavors in the mouth, skipping lightly through the vivid finish. Drink now. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Gisborne Tietjen-Briant
review: Fresh and vibrant, with pear, peach, spice and licorice flavors mingling attractively as they last on the long finish. Drink now through 2006. 800 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Central Otago Small Parcels Rise & Shine
review: Creamy, with accents of baking spices and vanilla bean to the ripe black cherry core. Toast and cocoa details linger on the finish. Drink now through 2026. 2,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Marlborough Dry
review: Bright, juicy and distinctive for its warm-slate and cold-apple flavors, letting the green apple character linger on a dry, long, lively finish. Drink now through 2010. 3,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Spicy honeysuckle notes add dimension to the core of juicy, fleshy apricot, nectarine and passion fruit flavors, with plenty of intensity and spice on the finish. Drink now. 950,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Tangy in style, with plenty of fresh green apple character adding depth to the grapefruit and guava flavors, lingering nicely. Drink now. 70,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Bright and generous. Impressively balanced to show touches of ripe melon against tart grapefruit and lime flavors that echo nicely on the lively, delicately herbal finish. Drink now. 35,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Bright and juicy, with racy herbal notes weaving through the ripe melon and tropical fruit flavors, which echo on the round finish. Drink now. 7,000 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough SP Spitfire
review: Succulent nectarine and apricot flavors are generous and sophisticated, with plenty of details of green tea, lime zest and white grapefruit. Refined and refreshing, especially on the finish. Drink now. 1,600 cases imported.

name: Tané New Zealand
review: The package suggests that this will be a big, raw-boned red, but it's actually smooth, polished and refined. Offers lovely plum, berry and spicy oak aromas and flavors that cascade beautifully through the elegant finish. Drink now through 2006. 650 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Gisborne Tietjen
review: Ripe and aromatic, a smooth-textured mouthful of pear and exotic spices, finishing round and generous. Drink now through 2002. 1,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Hawkes Bay Wild Grace Small Parcels
review: Toast, spice and cumin accents are fragrant and mingle well with tangerine, melon and peach flavors, finishing spicy. Good intensity. Drink now. 2,200 cases made.

name: Merlot Hawkes Bay Te Awanga
review: Smooth and round, with pretty berry, plum and black olive flavors that mingle with style and polish on the finish. Delicious already. Drink now through 2007. 500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Central Otago Rise and Shine Small Parcels
review: Generous, with clove and cinnamon accents to the pureed raspberry, cherry and pomegranate flavors, this is smooth, juicy and supple, with lingering toasted edges and baking spice notes that echo on the long finish. Drink now through 2030. 2,930 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Central Otago SP Rise-and-Shine Creek
review: Light in texture, with crisp juicy acidity to balance the refreshing raspberry and blackberry flavors, a floral note hovering over it all. Lingers well. Drink now through 2014. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir South Island
review: A distinctive touch of caraway seed balances the crisp cranberry and strawberry flavors, with dried herb and black tea notes on the juicy finish. Drink now through 2022. 16,000 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir South Island
review: A peppery, crisp expression of fresh raspberry, cherry and cranberry, with loamy, earthy details of spice, black tea and tobacco. Drink now through 2023. 18,000 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: A distinctive accent of fresh fennel adds interest to the grapefruit and lime flavors. Crisp and clean on the finish. Drink now. 1636160 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: An appealing note of ripe peach complements the core of crisp lemon and lime flavors, with a touch of peppery white flowers. Shows nice focus and persistence on the finish. Drink now. 550,000 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Fragrant and tropical, displaying pineapple, grapefruit, dragon fruit and melon flavors. There's a juicy acidity, with great persistence on the finish. Drink now. 360,000 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Elegant and vibrant, this mouthwatering wine offers lime and tequila flavors that are reminiscent of a margarita, but remains light, refined and distinctive. Drink now. 225,000 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Has a sense of ripeness and richness to go along with dead-on herbal and spicy flavors, hinting at apricot on the generous finish. Drink now. 575 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough McLean Vineyard
review: Crisp and zippy, with bright lime, pear and pineapple flavors that linger on the finish, echoing nicely as the texture rounds out. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc New Zealand
review: Bright, ripe and generous with its orange, pear and pepper aromas and flavors, which linger appealingly on the open-textured finish. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Brut New Zealand Rory
review: Has some richness and a layer of dusky spice that makes the honeyed pear flavors sing. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Hawkes Bay Wild Grace Small Parcels
review: Distinctively spicy and toasty, with a cedary edge to the melon, peach and citrus flavors, this smooth-textured, very juicy white finishes with a toasted nut and spice mix. Drink now through 2022. 1,640 cases made.

name: Pia New Zealand
review: Broader and richer than most New Zealand Chardonnays, this has plenty of pear, violet and caramel flavors that echo fragrantly on the finish. Drink now through 2004. 450 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Awatere Small Parcels Favourite Homestead
review: The pear, citrus and melon flavors in this white are fresh and sleek, with distinctive fresh hay and green tea notes. Honey, spice and floral details come in on the finish. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Pinot Gris Awatere Valley Small Parcels Favourite Homestead
review: Shows terrific intensity, with a touch of yellow raisin to the apricot, peach and citrus flavors, presenting a medium body and accents of spice and marmalade on the finish. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Pinot Gris Marlborough
review: Ripe and intense, with very good depth to quince, green pear and lime flavors. Salt, green almond and stone notes linger, with dried lemon skin on the finish. Drink now. 2,800 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough
review: Cherry and raspberry flavors hit the right note between ripe and tangy, with a bright acidity to amplify the fresh flavors. Herbal tea and fresh thyme flavors kick in on the finish. Drink now through 2018. 20,500 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough Anderson Vineyard
review: On the light side, but nicely fleshy in the end, with pretty currant and dusky spice flavors that echo on the fine-grained finish. Drink now through 2004. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough Anderson Vineyard
review: Bright and juicy, emphasizing pretty raspberry and currant flavors, with a lively finish, echoing the fruit flavors nicely. Drink now through 2004. 200 cases made.

name: Riesling Marlborough Dry
review: Dry in style and packed with flavor, zingy with floral apple and peach notes, finishing with a hit of white pepper. Delicious. Drink now through 2005. 1,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Awatere Valley
review: A bright, herbal style, with a spiky green bean edge to the lemony apple flavors. Drink now. 75 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Awatere Valley
review: Supple and soft, this gently spicy wine mixes pretty oak flavors with ripe fig and pineapple, the fruit echoing on the finish. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Really tangy, with Key lime pie, honeydew melon, passion fruit and green tea notes. Great juicy finish. Drink now. 390,000 cases imported.

name: Merlot Mendocino
review: This solid Merlot features red currant and tomato leaf aromas that follow through to cherry, herb and earthy spice notes. Modest tannins mark the finish. Drink now through 2016. 285 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Mendocino County
review: Very ripe and effusively fruity, with white peach, apple, melon and subtle spice shadings. Drinks clean and easy. Drink now. 230 cases made.

name: Napa Valley
review: Spice, dried currant, herb and black licorice give this a complex range of focused flavors. Full-bodied, balanced, with a touch of cedar, it has moments of sweet fruit yet is dry and herbaceous. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Best from 2010 through 2016. 100 cases made.

name: Napa Valley
review: Fresh, vibrant and vivid blueberry and blackberry fruit is elegant and zesty, with pretty spice and light cedary oak notes. Ends with a long, complex finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Best from 2010 through 2015. 100 cases made.

name: Merlot California
review: Intense, with grapey, floral and currant-laced flavor. An excellent value in everyday Merlot. 1,600 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Monterey County
review: Earthy with a slightly sour edge, but the ripe pear flavors come through. Still, a fair value at $6. 15,000 cases made.

name: Marsanne-Viognier-Roussanne Russian River Valley
review: Citrus, spice and musky floral notes are refreshing and highlighted by herbal flavors and a distinctive acidity. Drink now. 46 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Amber Ridge Vineyard
review: A mix of tangy black cherry, fresh earth, herb and sage provide a savory edge, ending with a fennel-anise note. Drink now. 47 cases made.

name: Roussanne Paso Robles Rustler James Berry Vineyard
review: Juicy, with ripe yellow apple, pear, peach, melon and pineapple flavors, this is succulent, refreshing and highlighted by touches of mineral, fresh ginger and floral notes. Focused and balanced, with a long, lingering finish. Drink now through 2020. 60 cases made.

name: Grenache Blanc Paso Robles Alice
review: A minerally sea salt note adds interest to the fresh ginger, pear and apple flavors. Crisp, with a touch of coarseness on the finish. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Roussanne Paso Robles Rustler James Berry Vineyard
review: Tangy and light-bodied, with plenty of floral details of lavender and jasmine to the bright, juicy lime and green apple notes. Ends with a mouthwatering finish. Drink now. 104 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Arroyo Grande Valley Talley Vineyard
review: Offers jasmine and honeysuckle notes, with white peach and nectarine accents and a leesy edge that steers this toward the dry side, ending with a pithy citrus hint. Drink now. 105 cases made.

name: Malbec Mendoza
review: Peppery notes fill this ripe red, which features lightly smoky flavors of olive, raspberry and wild cherry. Spicy finish. Drink now. 8,000 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills Roserock Vineyard
review: Brash and jazzy, letting its flavors pop through the refined tannins, offering lively raspberry, cherry, cinnamon and white pepper character that zips through a long and expressive finish. Drink now through 2018. 150 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon Backbone
review: Supple, velvety, generous and harmonious, this plays its currant, cherry, coffee and spice flavors over a gently curving frame. The finish picks up red berry notes and shows finesse. Drink now through 2018. 205 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon Domaine
review: Supple, generous and incredibly long, smooth and creamy in texture, with abundant black cherry, exotic spice and toasty flavors mingling effortlessly on the finish. Tempting already. Drink now through 2008. 200 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Croft Vineyard
review: Rich, seductive and opulent. It's brimming with berry, plum, exotic spice and delicate floral notes, sailing on and on as the finish spreads and turns deep-pile velvety. Tempting already. Drink now through 2008. 303 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir McMinnville Hyland Vineyard
review: Elegant and sleekly expressive, with savory raspberry aromas and supple yet dynamic cherry and spiced cinnamon flavors that glide easily toward the finish. Drink now through 2023. 216 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon Domaine
review: Smooth and polished, with a bit more density than most 2008s, this is rich and warm, with toasty oak and mocha overtones to the black cherry and spice flavors. Shows elegance and finesse. Drink now through 2018. 1,171 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon Domaine 100% Lorane Grapevine Stock
review: A remarkable, harmonious wine. It is firm in texture, blossoming with ripe cherry and currant fruit, shaded with hints of pepper and clove and finishing on a creamy note. Drink now through 2007. 296 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Croft
review: Supple and expressive, with juicy red berry and black cherry flavors shaded with pear-skin tannins and hints of floral spice. Lingers nicely. Drink now through 2022. 204 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Hyland Vineyard
review: Light, transparent and refreshing, this is bursting with raspberry and mocha flavors that are focused by juicy acidity. Finishes with hints of peppermint and lime. Drink now through 2017. 175 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Pfeiffer Vineyards
review: Rich, ripe and generous, this has a plush mouthful of blackberry, strawberry and cinnamon flavors, which swirls through the round finish and picks up hints of pepper and toast. Drink now through 2007. 277 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Oregon Signature Collection Vin Glacé
review: Sweet and rich, with a deft stiletto of citrusy acidity balancing the opulent pineapple, fig and orange blossom flavors, lingering enticingly. Drink now through 2016. 800 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley Pfeiffer Vineyards
review: Fresh and expressive, with bright pear and tangerine aromas and flavors, lingering on the open-weave finish. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills Roserock
review: Lithe and expressive, this vital style shows polish to the deftly balanced frame surrounding flavors of raspberry, orange peel, white tea and cream, persisting into a vital finish. Drink now through 2021. 200 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon Blackjack Block
review: Light and airy, a refreshing style that relies on pretty boysenberry and wild plum character to lend extra charm to the satiny texture. Finishes with finesse. Drink now through 2018. 140 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon Domaine
review: This is velvety, showing beautifully ripe flavors that focus into a lovely beam of blackberry and red plum fruit, nicely defined and lingering effortlessly on the deftly balanced finish. Drink now through 2014. 982 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon Domaine
review: Bright, crisp and sharply focused, beaming its raspberry, red currant and mineral flavors like a laser through the thin layer of fine tannins, echoing beautifully on the finish. Drink now through 2010. 500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon Reserve
review: The polished style of this supple Pinot emphasizes its pretty black cherry and violet-petal aromas and flavors, which linger effortlessly on the round finish. Has a nice tinge of pepper as well. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon Reserve
review: A beautiful Pinot Noir with plenty of currant, blackberry and sweet cream flavors that deploy themselves elegantly and hang on through a long finish. Approachable now, but give it until 1999 to develop more depth. 1,890 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Pfeiffer Vineyard
review: Round and velvety, with pretty violet-scented red cherry and raspberry flavors, finishing with spicy vanilla notes, all of it riding on a razor's edge of bright acidity. Delicious already. Best from 2002 through 2008. 200 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Oregon Backbone
review: Smooth and round, light-footed but fleshy, with orange and lime accents to the pear and melon flavors. Mineral notes show on the finish. Drink now. 400 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Oregon Domaine
review: Light and juicy, brimming with Bartlett pear, cream and cashew flavors that keep singing through the long, charming finish. Drink now. 7,800 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Oregon Domaine
review: Light and silky, shining a vivid beam of lemon, melon and pear flavors through the persistent finish. Drink now through 2011. 3,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Oregon Reserve
review: A lovely white, smooth and round on the palate, delivering a generous portion of melon, spicy pear and caramel flavors that linger beautifully, drawing you back for another sip. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Oregon Signature Collection
review: Bright and lively, brimming with lemon meringue, golden raisin and green tea character. Finishes with zip. Drink now. 71,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Oregon Unity
review: Fresh and vibrant, bursting with pear, floral and spice flavors, lingering easily on the deftly balanced, dry finish. Drink now. 163 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Oregon Vin Glacé
review: Sweet and juicy, not so unctuous but balancing its tropical fruit and honey flavors beautifully. Drink now. 968 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Oregon Vin Glacé
review: Rich, unctuous dessert wine layers its honey, melon and pineapple flavors on a beautifully rounded frame, balancing with just enough citrusy acidity to keep it from being cloying. Drink now through 2005. 150 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley Pfeiffer Vineyards
review: Fresh and lively, this is juicy with vivid grapefruit-scented pear and melon flavors. Finishes gracefully. Drink now. 235 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon Backbone
review: Light in texture, with generous currant, blueberry and spice flavors. A roasted tomato note adds interest to the long and expressive finish. The tannins are a bit crinkly. Best from 2016 through 2020. 809 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon Domaine
review: Firm and flavorful. A juicy mouthful of cherry, red berry, olive and dusky spice flavors, persisting nicely on the chewy finish. Needs time to soften the edges. Best from 2007 through 2012. 1,060 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon Domaine
review: Strives for elegance and delicacy and achieves a lithe, pretty style, centering on strawberry and raspberry flavors shaded with dusky spice notes. Flavors build with successive sips. Drink now through 2008. 625 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Freedom Hill Vineyard
review: Light, tight and tangy, with juicy raspberry and tangerine peel flavors combining smoothly on the lively, espresso-inflected finish. Drink now through 2017. 350 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Kennel Vineyard
review: Light and focused, with vivid raspberry and orange tea flavors on a polished frame, lingering with terrific presence against powdery tannins. Best from 2017 through 2020. 200 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Old School Vineyards
review: Light and expressive, with juicy black cherry and floral flavors that play against lively acidity, an open texture and polished tannins. Finishes with intensity. Best from 2016 through 2020. 190 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Pfeiffer Vineyards
review: Supple and expressive, with presence and depth to the cherry, red plum and cinnamon flavors that ride over fine tannins in a medium-weight, generous style. Drink now through 2020. 200 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill-Carlton District Goodrich Road
review: Light and polished, with powdery tannins around a complex core of red cherry, passion fruit, orange peel and spice flavors that don't quit as the finish persists. Drink now through 2021. 200 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Oregon
review: Ripe and focused, a juicy Chardonnay with intense pear, citrus and black pepper flavors that pick up a hint of caramel on the polished finish. Drink now through 2005. 10,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Oregon
review: Generous with its almond-scented peach, pear and mineral flavors that linger enticingly on the finish. Ripe, supple and spicy, it's tempting now, best in 1998. 8,500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Oregon Reserve
review: Bright and focused, smooth in texture, generous with its pear, spice and dark honey flavors that linger gently on the elegant finish. Drink now. 900 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Oregon Backbone

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Finger Lakes King's Cab
review: This soft red offers easygoing cherry and raisin notes, with a dash of toast on the finish. Drink now. 200 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Finger Lakes Late Harvest
review: This off-dry white offers a mix of yellow apple and lime notes, with a slight herb twinge on the finish, which leaves an awkward feel. Drink now. 50 cases made.

name: Syrah Finger Lakes
review: A touch trim, with light cherry and pomegranate notes. 82 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon
review: Light on its feet, with ripe blackberry and floral flavors that linger nicely on the generous finish. Drink now through 2015. 6,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Focused on a medium-weight frame, this offers cherry, licorice and wet earth flavors that glide over powdery tannins and into a long and expressive finish. Drink now through 2020. 21,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Taut and expressive, layered with plum, guava, floral and spice flavors that persist against light, crisp tannins on the sleek finish. Drink now through 2018. 20,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Fresh and lively, with dark fruit notes playing against a springy bed of light tannins, lingering gently, giving off hints of spearmint and spice. Drink now through 2018. 15,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley
review: Deftly balanced and inviting, with pear and green melon flavors playing against a light texture, finishing with refinement. Drink now. 9,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley
review: Fresh and tangy, with lime and honeydew melon flavors that linger easily. Drink now. 3,600 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon
review: Light and fragrant, with pretty rose petal overtones to the currant and berry fruit, finishing with delicate grip. Drink now through 2014. 13,500 cases made.

name: Riesling Oregon
review: Lithe, spicy and refreshing for its white grapefruit, peach and melon flavors, balanced against an off-dry frame. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley
review: Fresh and lively, with pretty peach and citrus flavors on a light, dry frame. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon
review: Light and appealing for its raspberry, cherry and floral aromas and flavors, nicely suspended over fine tannins. Drink now through 2014. 15,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon
review: Light and appealing for its ripe plum and peppery spice flavors, finishing crisp and lingering gently. Drink now. 12,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon
review: Smooth, round and generous, a lovely balance of creamy, vanilla-scented blackberry and raspberry flavors, which echo nicely on the supple finish. Drink now through 2004. 8,581 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon Rex Hill Vineyards
review: Rich and spicy. Enlivens its focused raspberry and cherry flavors with hints of cinnamon and pepper, as the flavors echo nicely on the round finish. Drink now through 2005. 9,700 cases made.

name: Riesling Oregon
review: Light and sweet, appealing for its pure pear and tropical fruit aromas and flavors, lingering nicely on the refreshing finish, like sweetened ice tea. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Willamette Valley
review: Light and fragrant, soft in texture, with pretty pear and floral flavors gliding smoothly through the off-dry finish. Drink now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Oregon
review: Light and tight, with almond overtones to the peach flavors. Dry finish. Drink now. 2,300 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Oregon
review: Light and silky, with pretty tangerine, cream and melon flavors that slide easily over the soft, off-dry finish. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Oregon
review: This earthy wine is feathery light, with pretty lemon and lime flavors. Drink now. 1,250 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Oregon
review: Soft and round, with a spicy mineral edge to the pretty melon fruit. Drink now. 2,006 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon
review: Not much on the nose, but plenty of flavor, offering raspberry, currant and floral character that lingers nicely. Drink now through 2003. 5,332 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Light and transparent, with an orange peel note to the modest raspberry flavors, lingering softly. Drink now through 2016. 11,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Oregon Rex Hill Vineyards
review: Earthy, mineral flavors are more prominent than the modest apple flavor in this medium-weight, firm-textured white. Drink now. 2,550 cases made.

name: Riesling Willamette Valley
review: Very tangy, with a sharp acid edge to the apple flavors. Lingers well, but the profile lacks charm. Drink now. 900 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon
review: Floral, foxy aromatics detract from the fruit in this one.   12,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon
review: Smells attractive, with hints of strawberry, but it's leafy, oaky and tannic, without the spicy charm the aromas suggest. Turns bitter on the finish. Drinkable now. From Rex Hill.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot Elgin
review: Polished, with a sanguine edge framing the dried currant, black cherry and tobacco notes. The long finish lets the mineral note play out. Drink now. 1,100 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Elgin
review: Bright, with stylish floral and white peach notes backed by straw and mineral hints. Good length. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon South Australia
review: Soft and round, with a vegetal edge to the ripe black cherry and plum fruit, lingering on the finish. Best after 2014. 10,410 cases made.

name: Chardonnay South Australia
review: Fresh and vibrant, with apple and floral flavors that dance lightly through the crisply balanced finish, persisting well. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay South Australia Reserve Riverland
review: Ripe and spicy, with a grapefruit edge to the pineapple and caramel flavors, finishing focused and a little sharp. Drinkable now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc South Australia
review: Light and sleek, with crisp acidity set against the silky texture, offering pretty passion fruit and herb flavors. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Shiraz South Australia
review: Velvety, generous, up front and appealing, with lifted blueberry and plum fruit, showing hints of tomato leaf and licorice. Lingers narrowly. Drink now through 2016. 9,935 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Riverland Reserve
review: An attractive wine, soft and generous with honey, spice and caramel flavors. Finishes with a silky texture, more honey notes. Drink soon. 500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay South Australia
review: Smooth and spicy, with a coffee note sliding through the pear and melon flavors. Drink now through 2015. 2,509 cases made.

name: Shiraz Riverland
review: Ripe and smooth, a youthful wine with appealing berry and spice flavors. Ready now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon South Australia Riverland
review: Ripe and generous but soft-textured, with lots of appealing berry and currant flavors and a slightly smoky edge. Best to drink soon. 10,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz South Australia Riverland Reserve
review: Ripe, smooth and generous, with lots of plum, prune and spice flavors that remain rich on the finish. Tasty now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Riverland
review: Sturdy wine with simple blackberry and toast flavors, finishing with a nice polish. Ready now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz South Australia Riverland
review: Light, smooth and spicy, appealing for its cedary tobacco overtones and plummy flavor at the core. Drinkable now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Merlot South Australia Riverland Reserve
review: Fruity, spicy and cedary, a smooth-textured wine with ripe berry flavors balancing the finish. 1,000 cases made.

name: Mourvèdre Riverland
review: A little chunky at first, but it turns smooth as the blackberry flavor comes through. Ready now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Riverland
review: Light and polished, a simple wine with appealing but modest red plum, cedar and cherry flavors. 5,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Riverland
review: Fresh and appealing, with bright apple and pear flavors and, on the finish, some spicy oak notes. Ready to drink. 3,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay South Australia Riverland
review: Lean and simple, with a mineral edge to the modest pear flavors. Drinkable now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Riverland Reserve
review: A jazzy wine with ripe flavors, crisp texture and some simple, spicy grape notes adding interest. Drink soon. 500 cases made.

name: Sémillon South Australia Riverland
review: Round and fruity, well-mannered, with a polished texture and nice fig and pineapple notes that carry through the finish. 5,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Riverland
review: A light and simple red, with modest herb-accented berry flavors that turn mineral-like on the finish. 6,000 cases made.

name: Syrah Casablanca Valley Bayo Oscuro CJ's Barrel
review: Rich and redolent of dark fruit flavors of blackberry, plum and cherry, swathed in luscious spicy notes. Backed up by fresh acidity, this offers an intense and powerful finish that lingers with dark chocolate and tarragon hints. Drink now through 2019. 49 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Casablanca Valley Sabino
review: Offers a seductively spicy aroma, with plush yet fresh flavors of apple cobbler, peach tart and concentrated pastry. Long and rich, showing plenty of spice midpalate and a creamy, complex finish. Drink now through 2017. 90 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Casablanca Valley Sabino
review: This well-cut Chard balances Honeycrisp apple, grilled pineapple, brioche and light cream notes with fresh acidity, as hints of spring herb, spice and salted butter line the finish. Drink now through 2015. 33 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Casablanca Valley Alazan
review: Offers a caressing mouthfeel, with rich, mineral-infused flavors of cherry, plum, currant and raspberry that are woven together by medium-grained tannins. Features a silky texture on the spicy finish. Drink now through 2020. 150 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Casablanca Valley Alazan
review: This dense version displays a core of black cherry skin and wild berry notes that are well-integrated with juicy acidity and light tannins. Hints of grilled herb and hot stone settle in the long finish. Needs some time to unwind. Best from 2014 through 2018. 280 cases made.

name: Syrah Casablanca Valley Bayo Oscuro
review: Dark and fleshy, with alluring notes of anise, melted fig, boysenberry preserves and warm cocoa that stay poised and suave through the polished, lengthy finish. Drink now through 2012. 120 cases made.

name: Syrah Casablanca Valley Bayo Oscuro
review: Very inviting, with fig and boysenberry fruit backed by velvety structure. The long, mocha- and spice cake-filled finish glides along nicely. Ripe, but elegant and pure. Mouthfilling. Drink now through 2010. 245 cases made.

name: Syrah Casablanca Valley CJ's Barrel
review: A pure and minerally red, with refreshing acidity to the dark plum, cherry and dark currant flavors. Hints of pepper and Asian spice emerge midpalate, leading to a finish filled with chocolate and dried meat accents. Drink now through 2020. 45 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Casablanca Valley Sabino
review: Offers a plush texture, with rich, balanced flavors of Fuji apple, melon, cream and spice that are fresh and juicy. Well-structured, presenting a crisp finish, with buttery accents. Drink now through 2020. 110 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Casablanca Valley Alazan
review: A ripe, juicy Pinot, with bright acidity driving the dark cherry and red plum notes, picking up hints of licorice and underbrush. Complex and long. Drink now through 2017. 230 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Casablanca Valley Alazan
review: Surprisingly juicy, with really solid black cherry and cassis notes layered attractively with spice and toast shadings. A hint of wet earth on the finish adds length and complexity. Drink now through 2010. 645 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Casablanca Valley Alazan CJ's Barrel
review: A bright red, with focused flavors of dark cherry, slate and allspice that are woven together with hints of plum sauce and dark chocolate. Dried beef notes linger on the powerful finish. Drink now through 2018. 50 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Casablanca Valley Alazan CJ's Barrel
review: On the jammy side, with macerated black cherry and blackberry defining this dark, brutish Pinot, which slowly opens up with hints of smoke, olive and underbrush to the long, savory finish. Drink now through 2018. 48 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Casablanca Valley Alazan CJ's Barrel
review: Dark and rich, displaying a core of black cherry and dark raspberry notes supported by light, silky tannins and juicy acidity. The finish is long, with an aftertaste of cherry and light spice notes that shows hints of briar. Drink now through . 44 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Casablanca Valley Alazan CJ's Barrel
review: Ripe and well-layered, displaying lots of red licorice up front, a core of red and black currant and fig fruit, and nice shadings of spice and black tea that help fill in the finish. Judicious toast lets the finish linger nicely. Drink now through 2011. 55 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Casablanca Valley CJ's Barrel
review: Vibrant and effusively fruity, with well-defined flavors of red plum, raspberry and cherry that are fresh and clean. The minerally finish features a flush of spice, showing rich, savory accents. Drink now through 2019. 75 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Casablanca Valley CJ's Barrel
review: Delicate, with a refined edge to the cherry and plum compote flavors, accented by forest floor notes. Grippy acidity holds the spicy finish. Drink now through 2019. 75 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Casablanca Valley CJ's Barrel
review: A rich and muscular Pinot that features hints of mint and thyme. The concentrated mulberry, cinnamon spice and red fruit flavors are rich and juicy. Ginger and licorice accents linger on the vibrant finish. Complex and satisfying. Drink now through 2019. 45 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Casablanca Valley Tobiano
review: This fresh and open-textured red has an engaging minerality to bright cherry and crushed red plum flavors. Hints of tangerine enliven this as well, leading to a luxuriantly spiced finish. Best after 2019. 550 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Casablanca Valley Cariblanco
review: Shows fine depth and structure to the flavors of white cherry, ripe melon and Key lime pie. Accents of green herbs and spice flood the crisp, pure-tasting finish. Drink now. 606 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Casablanca Valley Cariblanco
review: There's a lot here, with straw, pink grapefruit and lemon zest flavors and bright, chalky minerality. The finish is long and refreshing. Drink now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Syrah Casablanca Valley Bayo Oscuro
review: Presents a rich, lively mix of pepper, red raspberry and currant jelly flavors that are well-structured and supported by ample acidity. Offers zesty minerality on the finish, with some ripe notes.  Drink now through 2019. 156 cases made.

name: Syrah Casablanca Valley Bayo Oscuro
review: Quite ripe, but very fresh, featuring delicious crushed raspberry, blueberry and black cherry fruit laced with sweet spice, licorice and violet notes. The long finish lets a mineral note glide in. Drink now through 2011. 275 cases made.

name: Syrah Casablanca Valley Bayo Oscuro
review: A really enticing Syrah, with black cherry and blackberry fruit infused with pepper, spice and mocha-tinged toast. Sweet and fleshy on the vivacious finish. Drink now through 2007. 550 cases made.

name: Syrah Casablanca Valley Bayo Oscuro CJ's Barrel
review: This is ripe, but nicely poised, with dark, juicy blackberry and boysenberry fruit carried by polished structure. The finish lets violet and anise notes glide in. Pure and delicious. Drink now through 2012. 24 cases made.

name: Syrah Casablanca Valley CJ's Barrel
review: Unctuously spicy and creamy, offering well-structured and powerful flavors of dark currant, dried meat and raspberry. Features an intense beam of baker's chocolate, with a long, minerally finish. Drink now through 2019. 51 cases made.

name: Syrah Casablanca Valley Lucero
review: Ripe yet cut, offering a more classical profile of olive paste, pepper and game notes to the pure boysenberry, black currant and plum skin fruit character that sports a mineral edge on the finish. Drink now through 2018. 1,130 cases made.

name: Syrah Casablanca Valley Lucero
review: Dark but lively, with blackberry and melted licorice notes laced with briar, tobacco and roasted mesquite. The juicy finish offsets the toast nicely. Drink now through 2012. 990 cases made.

name: Syrah Casablanca Valley Lucero
review: Very fresh—and youthful still—with bright violet, plum and black cherry fruit leading the way, followed by stylish notes of white pepper and iron. The polished finish has nicely integrated toast. Drink now through 2011. 770 cases made.

name: Syrah Casablanca Valley Lucero
review: Rich, but light on its feet, with racy violet, blackberry, raspberry and sweet spice notes that race through the mineral-tinged finish. Offers fine length and grace. Drink now through 2010. 700 cases made.

name: Syrah Casablanca Valley Tobiano
review: Very ripe but racy, with dark currant, plum, violet, mineral and cocoa powder notes. The long finish has plenty of fruit, but also keeps a nice floral edge. Drink now through 2008. 550 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Casablanca Valley Alazan
review: This polished version is filled with ripe cherry and red plum flavors that feature hints of fig paste. Raspberry and spice notes show on the fresh finish. Drink now through 2018. 115 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Casablanca Valley Alazan
review: A rich, savory style, with hints of dried meat to the dark fruit flavors, supported by fresh acidity and ample tannins. Very minerally on the vibrant finish, presenting hints of white pepper. Drink now through 2018. 160 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Casablanca Valley Alazan
review: Juicy and compact for now, with a solid core of red and black cherry and currant fruit backed by lively spice notes. There's nice grip on the finish. Should unwind in the short term. Drink now through 2010. 300 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Casablanca Valley Alazan
review: Rich, with a juicy core of black cherry and plum fruit backed by sweet toast and spice notes. A nice, lingering hint of briar on the finish. Drink now. 350 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Casablanca Valley Alazan
review: Delightful red and black cherry aroma, with fleshy, medium-weight cherry, plum, spice and toast flavors that build through the finish, where a nice spicy hint lingers. Really delicious. Drink now through 2005. 230 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Casablanca Valley Tobiano
review: Crisp and juicy, with concentrated flavors of red cherry, raspberry and currant supported by fresh acidity. The minerally finish has plenty of zesty notes.  Drink now through 2019. 275 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Casablanca Valley Tobiano
review: Shows good density and structure to the black cherry, dried blueberry and damson plum flavors, lengthening out midpalate. Sandalwood and nutmeg accents grace the bright, juicy finish. Drink now through 2017. 720 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Casablanca Valley Tobiano
review: This ripe, fresh red delivers instant gratification, offering juicy layers of black cherry, raspberry, mocha and spice, with a floral hint adding to the long finish. Drink now. 790 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Casablanca Valley Tobiano
review: A lovely, racy Pinot, offering good depth to the dark cherry pulp fruit, with notes of wild flowers, spice and light licorice breezing through the minerally finish. Drink now. 1,555 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Casablanca Valley Cariblanco
review: This compact yet crisp white features crunchy Granny Smith apple and white grapefruit character lightly framed with hints of straw and hot stone. Drink now. 645 cases made.

name: Syrah Casablanca Valley Bayo Oscuro
review: Offers a meaty aroma, with flavors of roasted plum and cherry tart. Lithe midpalate, featuring a ripe finish that is open-textured and filled with spice details. Drink now through 2021. 200 cases made.

name: Syrah Casablanca Valley Bayo Oscuro
review: Ripe and densely structured, with concentrated dark plum and roasted cherry flavors that feature plenty of smoky and meaty notes. Asian spice and dark chocolate details fill the finish. Drink now through 2019. 120 cases made.

name: Syrah Casablanca Valley Bayo Oscuro
review: Very enticing, with lots of white pepper and violet aromas followed by crushed plum and licorice notes. Smoky and fleshy on the finish, but stays fresh, with nice drive. Drink now through 2009. 480 cases made.

name: Syrah Casablanca Valley Bayo Oscuro
review: Freshly crushed raspberry and boysenberry fruit aromas and flavors here, with notes of pepper, fig and minerals. Fleshy in the middle, but with nice taut acidity holding the finish together. Drink now through 2005. 230 cases made.

name: Syrah Casablanca Valley Lucero
review: Shows engaging accents of tea and Asian spice to the red currant, roasted plum and berry flavors. Meaty notes show midpalate, with a rush of chocolate and spice on the smoky finish. Drink now through 2020. 390 cases made.

name: Syrah Casablanca Valley Lucero
review: Racy, with flavors of dark currant, red plum and raspberry, accented by plenty of chocolate notes. Sleek, presenting a minerally finish that oozes with tar and espresso details. Needs short-term cellaring. Best from 2015 through 2019. 1,043 cases made.

name: Syrah Casablanca Valley Lucero
review: Balanced, full and rich, with layers of blackberry, cream and dark plum flavors, edged with savory herb and graphite notes. Hints of blood orange show on the snappy finish. Drink now through 2018. 1,275 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Casablanca Valley Sabino
review: Big and plush, with lots of creamy notes to the pear tart, baked apple and kiwifruit flavors. Offers a rich and well-spiced finish. Drink now. 115 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Casablanca Valley Alazan
review: Ripe and juicy, delivering dark plum and blackberry fruit laced with toasty vanilla and spiced bread notes. Good length. Drink now. 390 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Casablanca Valley Alazan
review: Ripe and focused, with a racy beam of red licorice, red currant and cherry fruit, and as supple, lingering finish. Very solid. Drink now. 470 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Casablanca Valley Alazan CJ's Barrel
review: This has a ripe, rounded core of dark berry and melted red licorice notes, which hang on nicely though the medium-weight finish. Drink now. 68 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Casablanca Valley Tobiano
review: Bright and juicy, with a racy beam of raspberry and red cherry fruit laced with sweet spice notes. The finish is silky. Drink now. 2,275 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Casablanca Valley Tobiano
review: Plush, with a smoky edge that lets incense and mulled spice notes lead the way for dark cherry and fruitcake flavors. The silky finish lets the spicy edge linger. Drink now. 870 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Casablanca Valley Tobiano
review: Ripe, fresh and elegant, with lots of bouncy cherry fruit, spice, briar and sassafras notes. A nice unadorned style. Drink now. 1,600 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Casablanca Valley Tobiano
review: Pretty black and red cherry fruit, with hints of licorice root and briar. Fresh, open-knit finish shows lots of elegant spice and fruit. Drink now. 550 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Casablanca Valley Cariblanco
review: This has a plump core of verbena and pink grapefruit, offset nicely by racy herb and straw notes. Shows nice cut on the finish. Drink now. 430 cases made.

name: Syrah Casablanca Valley Lucero
review: Shows lots of chocolate nib accents to the green olive, dark plum and dried berry flavors that are supported by firm acidity. The brooding finish has plenty of roasted notes. Drink now through 2020. 400 cases made.

name: Syrah Casablanca Valley Lucero
review: Offers a meaty aroma, with flavors to match, accented by plenty of espresso, Asian spice and forest floor notes. The muscular tannins on the finish are matched to crisp acidity and mocha details. Drink now through 2017. 988 cases made.

name: Syrah Casablanca Valley Tobiano
review: Plush, with alluring vanilla bean, macerated cherries and mocha notes that glide over well-rounded tannins. Dark and smoky finish, but not overdone. Drink now through 2008. 350 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Casablanca Valley Sabino
review: A buttery and spicy style, with rich flavors of apple and pear tart supported by fresh acidity. Creamy finish.  Drink now. 270 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Casablanca Valley Tobiano
review: Spice, briar and earth hints lead the way for a core of mulled blackberry and cherry fruit, which lingers on the nicely focused finish. Drink now. 2,560 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Casablanca Valley Tobiano
review: Delightful Pinot character, with a range of spicy red and black cherry fruit, hints of sweet earth, and a lingering briary finish. Very tasty. Drink now. 950 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Casablanca Valley Cariblanco
review: Crisp, offering plenty of green herbal notes to the citrus and fresh-cut apple flavors. Lemongrass accents and lively minerality on the finish, with white pepper accents.  Drink now. 425 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Casablanca Valley Cariblanco
review: This is light, but shows good cut, offering lime, chalk and sweet pea notes that zip through the bright finish. Drink now. 555 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Casablanca Valley Cariblanco
review: Delivers nice nervy lime and grass notes, with a chalky, bracing finish. Drink now. 1,385 cases made.

name: Syrah Casablanca Valley Bayo Oscuro CJ's Barrel
review: A direct beam of blackberry, fig and plum notes is backed by sweet toast and spice, with a dash of licorice. Drink now. 35 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Casablanca Valley Cariblanco
review: This has snap pea notes to the ripe citrus and spice flavors. Savory finish. Drink now. 1,468 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Casablanca Valley Cariblanco
review: Open and fresh-tasting, with plenty of zest to the white fruit and citrus flavors. Taut, green herbal notes show on the finish. Drink now. 422 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Casablanca Valley Cariblanco
review: This is filled with dried herb, grapefruit, candied orange and quince flavors, with a zesty finish that features notes of celery salt and lime. Drink now. 690 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Casablanca Valley Cariblanco
review: Fresh, with nice cut to the lime, grapefruit and herb flavors that linger on the finish. Drink now. 1,020 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Casablanca Valley Cariblanco
review: Firm and bright, with solid lemon peel and straw flavors and a crisp, refreshing finish. Drink now. 400 cases made.

name: Muscat de Hambourg Ella Valley Rosé
review: Kosher. Pleasantly sweet, with a fruity aroma and delicious flavors of peach, cherry and kirsch. Needs to go with a light pastry at dessert. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Semi-Dry Select Cuvée Prestige Ella Valley White
review: Kosher. A touch candied, with melon and herbal flavors, which lack focus. Sauvignon Blanc and Muscat. 5,000 cases made.

name: Vintner's Select Ella Valley
review: Kosher. Muddled, with pruny flavors and candied spicy notes on the finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. 1,665 cases made.

name: Riesling Ella Valley
review: Canned fruit and pineapple flavors are a bit flat. Kosher. 500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma Valley
review: Features firm, gutsy, rustic notes of currant and wild berry, with plum, sage and tobacco leaf flavors. Balanced and intense, this picks up sage and bay leaf details on the finish. Drink now through 2022. 1,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma County
review: Soft and modest in structure, with appealing black cherry, cinnamon and spiced herb flavors. Drink now through 2018. 1,100 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Dry Creek Valley
review: This gorgeous wine delivers a pure, rich dark berry mix of flavors, with blackberry and mocha at the core. Full-bodied yet graceful and balanced, gaining depth without gaining weight, with a long, tapered finish. Drink now through 2024. 155 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Dry Creek Valley
review: An immense wine that's beautifully crafted, dark, rich, dense and focused, with tiers of blackberry, graphite, flowers, crushed rock, mocha and black licorice. Ends with a long, persistent aftertaste and fine-grained tannins. Best from 2013 through 2030. 175 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Dry Creek Valley Spencer Vineyard
review: A rich, juicy, seductive style, with tiers of blackberry, licorice, dusty, loamy earth and anise notes, showing touches of flowers and herbs. Engaging and deftly balanced. Drink now through 2030. 300 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Dry Creek Valley Heirloom Vineyard
review: Sharply focused on pure licorice, blackberry, dusty herb and savory notes. The flavors are deep and intense, with grippy, gravelly tannins. However, this remains long and persistent, a good sign in a very young wine. Best from 2019 through 2029. 140 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Dry Creek Valley Jersey Boys Vineyard
review: Pure, rich and sophisticated, with a tightly focused core of dusty, gravelly blackberry, anise, cedar and licorice flavors, ending with the dusty, tannic theme that runs throughout. Best from 2020 through 2032. 700 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Dry Creek Valley Tamara Vineyard
review: This enjoyable version exhibits a rich, complex core of mocha-laced dark berry, graphite, crushed rock, black licorice and integrated herb flavors, all well-distributed and maintaining focus on the long, persistent finish. Ends with ripe, chewy tannins. Drink now through 2030. 180 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Dry Creek Valley Tamara Vineyard
review: Very ripe and juicy, brimming with red and black fruits, with touches of cedar and tobacco. Melted black licorice and kitchen spices add to the aroma and flavor, ending with ripe, fine-grained tannins. Drink now through 2025. 198 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Dry Creek Valley Jersey Boys Vineyard
review: An exciting display of power and finesse, with potent chewy and chunky blackberry, mocha, licorice, black cherry and savory herb flavors. Dense and tightly focused, this ends with a long, lingering aftertaste and gravel-laced tannins. Best from 2017 through 2028. 600 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Dry Creek Valley Spencer Vineyard
review: Broad, rich and expansive, with a mix of spicy berry, cedar, dill and tobacco leaf overshadowing a trimmer mix of dark berry, licorice and espresso. Ends with chewy tannins. Drink now through 2024. 345 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Dry Creek Valley Tamara Vineyard
review: Rich and smooth-textured, with firm, dense blackberry, gravel, spice and kirsch flavors that unfold and turn fleshy. Though rich and dense, the tannins weigh in with a gravelly profile. This is ultimately drying and gripping, ending with a texture that evokes coffee grounds. Best from 2017 through 2026. 180 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Dry Creek Valley Tamara Vineyard
review: This offers good intensity, vibrancy and focus, with a trim, taut beam of earth- and mineral-laced red and black fruits, supported by chewy, gritty tannins. Drink now through 2022. 219 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Dry Creek Valley Jersey Boys Vineyard
review: Marked by a pronounced gravelly, graphite-pencil edge in flavor and drying, tannic texture that masks the dark berry, licorice and herb flavors. Best from 2016 through 2028. 689 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Spencer Vineyard
review: Dense and fairly ripe, with powerful notes of smoky blackberry, bitter chocolate and spiced licorice. Burly tannins frame the finish. Best from 2018 through 2023. 219 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Dry Creek Valley Jersey Boys Vineyard
review: Dense and earthy, with firm, muddled, cedar-laced tar and dark berry flavors, showing glimpses of red and black licorice that pull together on the finish. Fairly tannic. Drink now through 2022. 345 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Barbara County
review: Serves up a tasty mix of blackberry and wild berry flavors woven in with mineral and pebble notes, ending with a touch of tobacco and sage. Drink now through 2012. 5,400 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Barbara County
review: Aromas of blueberry and blackberry pie are tight and a bit astringent, turning lean and tannic. Needs decanting. Drink now through 2011. 5,900 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington
review: With firm texture and beautiful focus, this powerful, seamless wine has a distinctly gamy note weaving through the ripe, peppery currant and plum flavors. Finishes with chewy tannins. Best from 2004 through 2010. 4,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington
review: A firm red, chewy in texture and brimming with rich cherry and plum flavors that keep sailing through the beautifully balanced and harmonious finish. Give it time to settle down. Best from 2003 through 2010. 2,400 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Yakima Valley Barrel Fermented
review: With its lovely peach-vanilla aromas and flavors, this strikes an extraordinary balance between fruit and oak, all of which is supported firmly and harmoniously. Beautiful to drink now.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: Rich, plush and elegant, a high-fidelity voice that sings out its plum, black cherry, vanilla and spice flavors. A Washington Merlot that echoes ripe fruit and oak on the long finish. Drinkable now. 1,800 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington
review: Smooth, ripe and generous with its sweet berry, currant, beet and tealeaf flavors, but biting tannins grab at the back, and need until 2000 to 2003. Don't worry; it has the intensity and richness to get there. 600 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Red Mountain Ice Wine
review: Very sweet and rich in texture, offering honey and wildflower aromas and flavors that persist nicely on the unctuous finish. Drink now through 2007. 500 cases made.

name: Syrah Yakima Valley
review: Lithe and supple, nicely balanced to show off pure plum and blueberry flavors, which linger on the fine-grained finish. Doesn't clop you over the head, but has firmness and generosity to spare. Drink now through 2007. 600 cases made.

name: White Riesling Yakima Valley Late Harvest
review: Frankly sweet, with pretty apricot, peach and pear flavors rolling smoothly through the long finish. Harmonious and tasty already. Drink now through 2001. 800 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Red Mountain
review: Dense, with firm tannins around a velvety core of blueberry, plum and currant fruit, finishing with spicy green olive character as it all comes together harmoniously. Drink now through 2010. 1,200 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Red Mountain
review: Dark and dense, with gritty tannins around a plump core of black cherry and anise flavors, echoing peppery notes as the flavors linger. Best after 2005. 1,300 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington
review: A distinctive, elegant red with lovely currant and blueberry flavors at the center and delicately earthy, herbal overtones, touching on toasty oak on the long, fine-grained finish. Drink now through 2012. 4,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yakima Valley
review: Smooth and supple, velvety in texture and ripe with coffee- and vanilla-scented black cherry and blackberry flavors that extend into a rich finish. Drinkable now. 400 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yakima Valley Estate Bottled
review: Ripe, concentrated, smooth and elegant, with well-defined Cabernet flavor emerging on the finish against a firm underpinning of tannin. Drinkable now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yakima Valley Reserve
review: Ripe, with brilliant currant and cherry flavors, and focused to carry them through a layer of fine-grained tannins, offering round textures and a sense of elegance. Best from 2002 through 2006. 900 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yakima Valley Reserve
review: Firm in texture, noteworthy for its grace and well-modulated intensity, offering berry and herb flavors that linger on the harmonious finish. Drink now through 2004. 490 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yakima Valley Tapteil Vineyard
review: Offers a nice array of rich, intense, complex, ripe currant, black cherry and olive flavors, framed by spicy oak and finishing with firm, gripping tannins. A striking wine that packs in lots of flavor, but one that will require patience. Drink from 1999 300 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley
review: Smooth, polished and deftly balanced, with pretty pear, honey and spice flavors that linger engagingly on the silky finish. Better than an earlier sample. Drink now through 2003. 1,000 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Yakima Valley Late Harvest
review: Ripe and sweet, pillow-soft in texture, with lovely rose-scented pear and honey flavors that persist on the delicate finish. Drink now through 2002. 300 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Yakima Valley Late Harvest
review: Sweet and unctuous, a spicy, floral white that picks up some melon, apricot and vanilla notes on the long, supple finish. Drinkable now. 650 cases made.

name: Muscat Yakima Valley Late Harvest
review: Flavorful and direct, a refreshing, clean-tasting example of pure varietal fruit. Sweet but not unctuous; beautifully balanced. 500 cases made.

name: Reserve Red Mountain
review: Taut and and tightly focused, with lively cherry and stony mineral aromas and firm flavors that finish with a grip of tannins. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Petit Verdot, Malbec, Cabernet Franc and Carmenère. Best after 2018. 1,020 cases made.

name: White Riesling Red Mountain Late Harvest
review: Frankly sweet, honeyed, silky, full of pear tart flavors that balance nicely with just enough tangy citrus character to keep it honest. Drink now through 2005. 115 cases made.

name: White Riesling Yakima Valley Late Harvest
review: Sweet, bright and juicy, a mouthwatering balance of ripe pineapple, honey and tangy citrus flavors, lingering well on the balanced finish. Drink now through 2013. 700 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington
review: Bright and tangy, a lively red with blackberry and anise flavors, finishing with a touch of cedar. Tannins are hard. Best from 2004 through 2008. 1,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yakima Valley Reserve
review: Jam-packed with flavor, jazzy, with spicy black cherry and currant flavors on a racy frame. Made for the cellar, it has fine-grained tannins and plenty of intensity. Best from 2002 through 2010. 750 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot Washington
review: Silky, smooth and generous, with its cherry, orange peel and spice flavors, which echo nicely on the rounded finish. Has enough fine tannins to warrant cellaring. Best from 2002 through 2007. 2,000 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Red Mountain Late Harvest
review: Sweet and refreshing, with pink grapefruit and lemonade flavors that pick up floral notes as they last on the finish. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Lemberger Yakima Valley
review: Ripe and rich. A polished wine with generous black cherry and berry flavors wrapped in a light cloak of oak. Approachable now. 1,100 cases made.

name: Malbec Red Mountain Heart Of The Hill Vineyard
review: Trim and persistent, with notes of cherry, stony mineral and spice. Drink now through 2021. 280 cases made.

name: Merlot Red Mountain Reserve
review: Firm and focused, with red pepper accents to the lively black cherry and tobacco flavors. Finishes with refinement. Drink now through 2016. 132 cases made.

name: White Riesling Columbia Valley Dry
review: Aromatic and expressive, with pretty green apple, nectarine and floral aromas and flavors that linger enticingly on the finish. Picks up a nice hint of mineral. Drink now. 1,200 cases made.

name: White Riesling Yakima Valley Late Harvest
review: Pure and focused, sweet but balanced, with lively acidity and straightforward apple and pear flavors, finishing with a delicate touch of honey. Drink now through 2009. 1,200 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Red Mountain
review: This refined, claret-style Zinfandel has pretty white pepper and cream notes that add interest to the well-behaved plum and spice flavors. Drink now through 2011. 300 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Red Mountain
review: Brash and generous, a supple mouthful of cherry, blackberry and earthy spice flavors, lingering on the round finish against a light jolt of acidity. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington
review: Ripe and open-textured, offering meaty cherry and pepper flavors that echo nicely on the finish. Drink now through 2006. 3,600 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yakima Valley
review: With a firm structure and supple texture, this shows off its spicy-chocolate, currant and berry flavors with more than the usual style. Drinkable now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yakima Valley Reserve
review: Firm in texture, generous in flavor, offering layers of blackberry, currant and a touch of cedar and fresh mushroom on the slightly chewy finish. Drink now through 2005. 1,070 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yakima Valley Reserve
review: Dark and peppery, firm in texture, with a gamy edge to the ripe cherry and currant flavors. Has a hint of leather at the end. Chewy at this stage. Best from 2000 through 2005. 400 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Red Mountain
review: Fresh and appealing for its effusive pear and nectarine aromas and flavors, lingering on the juicy finish. Drink now. 650 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Washington
review: Chardonnay on your shopping list? How about this brightly styled, budget-minded version. It's aromatic and tasty, with pretty apple and guava aromas and flavors that persist appealingly on the open-textured finish. Drink now through 2002. 2,500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Yakima Valley Reserve
review: Ripe, and bright with flavor, all reined nicely into a supple, polished framework. Fresh and lively. Drink now through 2000. 600 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Yakima Valley
review: Fruity, spicy and lively, a mouthful of citrusy peach and melon flavor that keeps spilling over on the finish. A wonderful sipper. 1,000 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Yakima Valley Late Harvest
review: Complex spice flavors weave through this sweet dessert wine, balanced by a refreshing touch of bitter almond on the finish. 400 cases made.

name: Lemberger Washington
review: Light and appealing for its blueberry and red plum flavors, which echo nicely and pick up some intensity on the soft finish. Drink now. 3,400 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: Ripe and focused, this firm-textured red has solid blackberry and plum flavors at the core, shaded with pretty hints of spice and toast. Approachable now. Best after 1999. 1,200 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: Firm in texture, with a nice range of berry and currant flavors that seem to suspend themselves in midair, echoing on the finish. If it kick-starts when the tannin softens, it should be best around 1997. 600 cases made.

name: Merlot Red Mountain
review: Firm, chewy style offers leathery spice and mineral flavors. It's a bit short on fruit, but it has density and length and should develop well. Best after 2006. 400 cases made.

name: White Riesling Columbia Valley
review: A sweet, complex wine, generous with its ripe red apple, pineapple and citrus flavors. Better focused in the middle than on the finish. Drink soon. 5,000 cases made.

name: White Riesling Columbia Valley
review: Freshly sweet, like biting into a bright, green apple after a bite of ripe peach. Shows some restraint on the light finish. 1,800 cases made.

name: White Riesling Columbia Valley Dry
review: Fresh and appealing for its pretty apple and floral aromas and flavors on a lightly off-dry frame. Drink now. 1,800 cases made.

name: White Riesling Washington
review: Light, sweet and appealing for its pretty apple tart and crème fraîche flavors. Drink now. 8,000 cases made.

name: White Riesling Yakima Valley
review: Soft, lightly sweet and fruity, offering a ripe apricot note to the fresh pear and apple flavors; generous and delicious to drink now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington
review: Firmly textured, with smoky, floral accents to the sturdy base of currant flavors. Finishes smoothly; try in 1998 or '99. 850 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington
review: On the tannic side; a rough-textured Cabernet that shows a decent level of currant and plum flavor. Should be best from 1997. 1,100 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yakima Valley
review: Very firm and focused, a chewy red that shows a nice core of black cherry and dark plum flavor. Drinkable now. 750 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yakima Valley Reserve
review: Very ripe, Port-like flavors effuse black cherry, plum and chocolate. Feels almost sweet as it bulges with flavor, although the finish closes up. Best from 2000 through 2004. 50 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot Washington
review: Distinctive stuff, firm, with earthy, cedary flavors to round out the soft plum fruit, which lingers on the finish. Drink now through 2004. 11,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet-Merlot Washington
review: Open-textured and generous, allowing plenty of black cherry, cinnamon and cola flavors to emerge. Drink now through 2002. 11,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley Reserve
review: Strikes a balance between ripe fruit and spicy oak, not well-integrated but lively and generous right through the finish, echoing fig, caramel and spice flavors. Drink now. 600 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Washington
review: Straightforward style has spicy, slightly earthy apple and honey flavors, echoing softly. Drink now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Washington
review: Light and fruity, with pretty apricot and pear flavors that linger. Drink now. 2,800 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Washington
review: Soft, bright and generous with its vanilla-scented pear and citrus flavors, which echo nicely on the finish. Drink now through 2004. 4,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Washington
review: Bright and flavorful, with enticing nectarine and spice flavors that hold on through the finish. Give it until 1997 to settle down. 1,100 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Yakima Valley
review: Bright, peppery and lively, it's a crisp mouthful of citrusy apple flavors with layers of spice and vanilla folding in on the finish. 900 cases made.

name: Lemberger Washington
review: Ripe and juicy, with fresh blackberry and pepper flavors that linger on a light frame, and an airy layer of coarse tannin. Drink now. 1,800 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: Crisply focused, with a bright beam of cherry, plum and currant flavors that broadens and deepens on the finish, hinting at tobacco. A pleasant drink with a Bordeaux profile. Drinkable now.

name: Merlot Washington
review: Firm, earthy style emphasizes dark berry and mushroom flavors, with firm tannins on the finish. Needs cellaring to soften. Best after 2002. 3,400 cases made.

name: Riesling Columbia Valley Dry
