review: Fresh and aromatic, with floral, pineapple-scented citrus flavors that finish off-dry. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: White Riesling Columbia Valley
review: Sweet and snappy, with a resiny edge to the soft pear and cream flavors. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: White Riesling Columbia Valley
review: Vibrant and refreshing, with exciting floral, peach and apple flavors; a classic off-dry Riesling for summer sipping. 1,400 cases made.

name: White Riesling Yakima Valley Dry
review: Lightly sweet and pleasantly fruity, with appealing melon and apple flavors that pick up a citrusy tinge on the finish. 1,200 cases made.

name: White Riesling Yakima Valley Late Harvest
review: Sweet but balanced with enough acidity to taste almost delicate, showing appealing honey-scented floral, peach and almond flavors. 1,700 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Red Mountain
review: Firm and chewy, with blueberry and plum flavors at the center, echoing on the finish. Best after 2004. 112 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington
review: Light, smooth and silky, with a pretty plum and grape character that lingers gently on the finish. Ready now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yakima Valley
review: Packs a lot of flavor onto a lean frame, offering a minty berry and floral character and a firmly tannic finish. Best after 1999. 800 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yakima Valley Tapteil Vineyard
review: Lean and firm, with enough currant and berry flavors poking around on the palate to overcome the tannic structure. Not a big wine, but it could develop with cellaring through 1995.

name: Chardonnay Washington
review: Light and fragrant, with easygoing peach and spice flavors that linger nicely. Drink now. 850 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Yakima Valley Barrel Fermented
review: A supple wine with an earthy, almost gamy accent to the flavors. Finishes with style. Ready now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Columbia Valley
review: Light and delicately sweet, with grapefruit and apple flavors shining through the finish. Drink now. 1,800 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Yakima Valley
review: Bright and fruity, off-dry and focused, featuring pear and almond flavors that swirl nicely on the finish. 1,200 cases made.

name: Columbia Valley
review: On the light side, with pretty raspberry and spice flavors, this open-textured wine is appealing now for its freshness. 3,000 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Red Mountain Late Harvest
review: Sweet but nicely balanced to give a gentle spin to the Gewürztraminer flavors of litchi and grapefruit along with honey and spice. Drink now. 1,600 cases made.

name: Lemberger Yakima Valley
review: Light and vibrant blackberry and spice flavors, appealing to drink right now and firm enough to be there through 1996. 1,200 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: Firm in texture, deep in color. A chewy wine with a nice core of blackberry flavor overlapped with some toasty and earthy notes. Tannins need at least until 2000. 1,400 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: Firm, a bit tannic for the weight, but has some nice blackberry, tar and mineral flavors. Best from 1998. 1,400 cases made.

name: Merlot-Cabernet Washington
review: Smooth and spicy around a core of bright, citrusy flavors. Some black cherry and tarry notes develop on the finish. Drink now through 1999. 630 cases made.

name: Riesling Columbia Valley
review: Bright and refreshing, with pretty citrus and apricot flavors, finishing off-dry. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Red Mountain Dry
review: Light and refreshing, with tangy green melon flavors, finishing soft. Drink now. 950 cases made.

name: Riesling Washington
review: Pleasant, off-dry and nicely balanced with juicy acidity, even if the flavors seem muted. Drink now. 8,000 cases made.

name: Sangiovese Red Mountain
review: Light and airy in texture, with pretty blackberry and floral aromas and flavors, finishing with a bite of chewy tannin and a touch of tar. Drink now through 2005. 85 cases made.

name: Syrah Yakima Valley
review: A bit more subtle than most Syrah, with modest plum and earth flavors that last nicely on a wiry frame. Drink now through 2004. 800 cases made.

name: Vintage Rosé Washington
review: Fruity, generous and popping in cherry and vaguely cinnamonlike flavors, finishing on the dry side. Don't drink this too cold. Drink now. 600 cases made.

name: White Riesling Columbia Valley
review: Light and fragrant, delicately sweet and silky, offering nice peach and mineral flavors that recede gradually on the finish. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: White Riesling Yakima Valley Dry
review: Light and brightly fruity, with appealing floral, peach and green apple flavors that linger nicely on the crisp, dry finish. 1,800 cases made.

name: White Riesling Yakima Valley Late Harvest
review: Sweet and fresh-tasting, showing peach and hints of apricot. On the light side for such a sweet wine. 800 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington
review: Lean and lithe, a nicely polished red with a modest level of berry flavor and herbal notes. Drinkable now.

name: Chardonnay Washington
review: Bright, with straightforward pear and citrus flavors that linger lightly on the finish. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Lemberger Washington
review: Soft texture, dark color and bright berry flavors add up to a pleasant, quaffable wine to wash down a casual dinner. 1,400 cases made.

name: Lemberger Yakima Valley
review: Smoky, almost burnt on the nose, but the flavors are polished and generously fruity, echoing raspberry and spice. Drinkable now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: Fragrant, with currant, cherry, spice and vanilla aromas. This medium-weight wine has plenty of style and grace, but needs until 1994 to soften the still-scratchy tannins.

name: White Riesling Columbia Valley
review: Off-dry, with pretty, resiny apple flavors that linger lightly on the finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: White Riesling Washington
review: Light and a tad sweet, with modest pear and floral flavors. Drink now. 9,000 cases made.

name: White Riesling Yakima Valley Dry
review: Light, bright and fruity, shining its nectarine and apricot flavors through a narrow beam. Clean and drinkable; off-dry on the finish.

name: Chardonnay Red Mountain
review: This earthy white shows a metallic edge to the lemon curd flavors. Finishes with tart balance on a broad frame. Drink now. 335 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Red Mountain
review: Has a medicinal edge to the ripe pear and spice flavors, but it finishes clean with citrusy acidity. Drink now. 600 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Yakima Valley Barrel Fermented
review: Ripe, spicy, somewhat bitter around the edges. Has a creamy finish, which makes it appealing. 900 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Columbia Valley
review: On the dry side, with light, juicy nectarine and melon flavors in modest proportions. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Columbia Valley
review: Soft and appealing for its melon and floral aromas and flavors. Charming to the end. Drink soon. 1,800 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Yakima Valley
review: Soft, sweet and simple, offering a pleasant mouthful of melon and peach flavors. Finish is a bit subdued. 1,800 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Yakima Valley
review: Soft and fruity, the melon and apple flavors settling smoothly on the finish. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Lemberger Washington
review: Smooth and earthy, with a strong gamy note running through the black cherry flavor, finishing a bit grainy. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Lemberger Washington
review: Smooth and generous with its ripe fruit flavors, plus a strong earthy-gamy streak that persists on the finish. Not for everyone. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Merlot Red Mountain Reserve
review: Firm in texture, with modest blueberry and earthy flavors, fading on the finish. Best after 2006. 714 cases made.

name: Vintage Rosé Washington
review: On the dry side, this is generous with its straight-on guava and strawberry flavors. Finishes with a hint of green. Drink now. 1,800 cases made.

name: Lemberger Washington Vintage
review: Off-dry and modestly fruity rosé, offering watermelon and raspberry flavors. Made from Lemberger. Drink now. 400 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: Lean, green and chewy, showing some berry notes in the middle, with more herbal flavors than fruit. Best after 2005. 1,800 cases made.

name: Muscat Yakima Valley Late Harvest
review: Sweet and spicy, a nutmeg note dominating the fruit in this fresh-tasting dessert wine.

name: Chenin Blanc Columbia Valley
review: Light, off-dry and juicy, with an herbal edge to the fruit character. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: Dense, herbal and chewy, with smoky plum and currant notes, but at this stage the smoky oak dominates and it turns dry and tannic. Best to cellar a year or two. 1,300 cases made.

name: White Riesling Yakima Valley Dry
review: Light and appealing, a delicate white showing modest peach and resin flavors. 1,200 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Yakima Valley Late Harvest Ice Wine
review: Sweet and fruity, lean, with focused pear and spice flavors but not a lot of other extra dimensions. 300 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Red Mountain Reserve
review: Earthy, leather flavors are more prominent in this firm, lean red.   1,000 cases made.

name: Lemberger Yakima Valley
review: Soft in texture, a little tannic, a little tired and oaky, but still flavorful enough to be modestly appealing. 1,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: Tarry, earthy, gamy flavors predominate in this firm-textured, fast-maturing red. 2,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Washington
review: Excessively gamy. 9,000 cases made.

name: Lemberger Yakima Valley
review: Simple, red grape and berry-flavored red wine that would likely benefit when paired with food.

name: Chenin Blanc Yakima Valley Late Harvest Ice Wine
review: If you can get past the swampy, rhubarb aromas, you'll find raspberry jam and milk chocolate flavors, along with more rhubarb. 259 cases made.

name: Syrah Red Mountain
review: Extremely earthy and barnyardy.   1,200 cases made.

name: Naoussa Ramnista
review: A minerally red, with a rich, meaty aroma and firm flavors of dark currant, wild plum, sage, spice and mocha. Interesting notes of underbrush chime in as well. Needs time. Xinomavro. Best from 2014 through 2020. 1,000 cases made.

name: Xinomavro Imathia Diaporos Block 5
review: A ripe red, with concentrated dark plum and kirsch flavors that are long and lush. The spicy finish features nutmeg and mineral notes. Drink now through 2017. 500 cases made.

name: Xinomavro Naoussa Ramnista
review: Ripe, with an intense minerality to the flavors of dried herb, dark currant and raspberry tart. Very spicy, presenting a lilting finish that is fresh and broad in texture, revealing plenty of tannins. Drink now through 2019. 3,000 cases made.

name: Xinomavro Naoussa Ramnista
review: This offers a ripe, sanguine aroma, with flavors to match, including dark currant, mulberry and spice. Features sinewy tannins, presenting notes of sandalwood and savory herbs on the tannic finish. Drink now through 2017. 3,000 cases made.

name: Amyndeon Rosé Akakies
review: Concentrated and fruity, with cherry, melon and strawberry flavors. Fresh, spicy finish features touches of richness. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Macedonia Paranga White
review: A medium-bodied white, with a fresh pippin apple, green peach and grapefruit flavors. The crisp, spicy finish offers floral notes. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Naoussa Ramnista
review: Muscular, with plenty of meaty accents to the dried berry and dark plum flavors. Iron and mineral, with plenty of tannins, on the finish. Xinomavro. Drink now through 2014. 1,500 cases made.

name: Vin de Pays d'Imathia Dyo Elies
review: This medium-bodied red displays flavors of red currant and white cherry, with hints of tangerine. Lemon-basil notes mark the lively finish. Syrah, Merlot and Xinomavro. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Vin de Pays de Florina Petra
review: This has concentrated flavors of white peach and spice, with a fresh finish that features notes of glazed citrus. Roditis. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Vin de Pays de Macedonia Paranga
review: Inviting fruit aromas and flavors of berry, red plum and raspberry are framed by plenty of fresh acidity. The pure, minerally finish offers some notes of iron and spice. Xinomavro, Syrah and Merlot. Drink now through 2014. 1,000 cases made.

name: Vin de Pays de Macedonia Paranga
review: A delicate red, showing a good array of spicy red fruit flavors, dominated by cherry and plum, with hints of apricot. Tight finish, filled with cocoa notes. Distinctive. Xinomavro and other local varieties. Drink now. 1,500 cases imported.

name: Macedonia Paranga Red
review: The red berry and cherry flavors are juicy and forthright in this crisp, medium-bodied red. Mineral and spice notes show on the finish. Xinomavro, Merlot and Syrah. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Macedonia Paranga Red
review: A firm red, with currant, dried plum and forest floors flavors. Exhibits dusty notes midpalate, offering a ripe, decidedly tannic finish. Xinomavro, Merlot and Syrah. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Sec Rosé Amyndeon Akakies
review: Flavors of spiced plum, raspberry coulis, balsamic and ground spice mix in this expressive rosé, lightly creamy and backed by tangy acidity. Xinamavro. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Syrah Vin de Pays d'Imathia
review: Lively, with a vibrant mix of ripe plum, dark chocolate and boysenberry flavors that linger with spicy notes on the finish. Drink now through 2008. 250 cases imported.

name: Vin de Pays d'Imathia Diaporos
review: A chewy red, with rustic yet concentrated flavors of dark currant, dried cherry and wild berry. Forceful tannins extend through the mocha-filled finish. Drink now.

name: Vin de Pays d'Imathia Yianakohori
review: Juicy and spicy, with loads of dried cherry flavors, with pretty floral notes. Sanguine finish. Merlot and Xinomavro. Drink now. 250 cases imported.

name: Vin de Pays de Florina Petra
review: Fresh-tasting, with juicy undercurrents to the quince and white cherry flavors, supported by a firm structure. Roditis. Drink now. 3,800 cases made.

name: Vin de Pays de Florina Petra
review: Concentrated tropical fruit flavors, including mango, pineapple and guava, fill this crisp, firm white. Short, minerally finish.  Drink now. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Vin de Pays de Florina Petra
review: Interesting for its floral aroma and bright peach flavors, with plenty of apricot and citrus. Balanced and fresh, with good focus. Roditis. Drink now. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Vin de Pays de Florina Samaropetra
review: Dried basil and lemon curd flavors make for an interesting mix in this juicy white, with hints of jellied citrus on the finish. Drink now. 12,000 cases made.

name: Macedonia Paranga
review: A firm red, with licorice notes to the dried red berry, plum and cherry flavors. The minerally finish shows hints of white pepper. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Naoussa Ramnista
review: Robust and very meaty-tasting, with some dried cherry notes. Plenty of tar and smoke, which fills the finish. Needs grilled meat. Xinomavro. Drink now. 400 cases imported.

name: Vin de Pays d'Imathia
review: A dense, inky red, with smoke and roasted plum flavors and some hints of Asian spice on the finish. Rustic but enjoyable. Drink now. 300 cases imported.

name: Vin de Pays de Macedonia Paranga
review: A firm red, with flavors of dried cherry, plum and spice that finish with minerally notes. Try with roasted lamb. Xinomavro and others. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Vin de Pays de Macedonia Paranga
review: Fresh and fruity, with flavors of red berry, plum and spice. Hints of orange peel and cinnamon on the finish. Xinomavro, Merlot and Syrah. Drink now. 8,500 cases made.

name: Vin de Pays de Macedonia Paranga
review: Light- to medium-bodied, with pretty red cherry and spice flavors, lingering on the finish with some meaty notes. Xinomavro and Agiorgitiko. Drink now. 2,000 cases imported.

name: Macedonia White Petra
review: The ripe blood orange, currant and cherry flavors are supported by juicy acidity, with floral and lavender notes on the finish. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Naoussa Ramnista
review: Medium-bodied, with dried cherry flavors and decadent meaty overtones, with spice and smoke on the finish. Xinomavro. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Naoussa Ramnista
review: Mature-tasting, with a touch of richness and plenty of sandalwood, dried cherry and vanilla flavors. Needs roasted lamb or goat. Xinomavro. Drink now. 400 cases imported.

name: Xinomavro Naoussa Ramnista
review: Packs a tannic punch, with flavors of dried cherry and pomegranate. Cola and dried beef notes show on the finish. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Amyndeon Akakies Rosé
review: Spicy rosé with berry and cherry flavors and some peppery notes. Drink now. 600 cases imported.

name: Amyndeon Rosé Akakies
review: Offers herbal notes to the cherry and melon flavors. Xinomavro. Drink now. 7,000 cases made.

name: Imathia Yianakohori
review: Tart, with sour cherry and roasted plum flavors that finish with dried beef notes. Merlot and Xinomavro. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Macedonia Paranga White
review: This features intense green herbal and modest pippin apple flavors. Unfocused finish. Roditis and Malagouzia. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Syrah Vin de Pays d'Imathia
review: Straightforward red, with some plum flavors and herbal notes. Drink now. 60 cases imported.

name: Vin de Pays d'Imathia
review: Shows a crisp edge to the dried berry and red currant flavors. The short finish features some mushroom notes. Drink now.

name: Vin de Pays d'Imathia Yianakohori
review: Sinewy red, with pretty dried cherry, olive and licorice flavors and some smoky notes on the finish. Merlot and Xinomavro. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Vin de Pays de Florina Samaropetra
review: Structured, with lemon, lime and green apple flavors. Salted almond notes enliven the finish. Sauvignon Blanc, Gewürztraminer and Roditis. Drink now. 750 cases imported.

name: Amyndeon Akakies Rosé
review: Clean and correct, with berry and dried cherry flavors. Xynomavro. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Florina Samaropetra
review: A touch cloying, with ripe apple and spicy notes. Drink now. 12,000 cases made.

name: Vin de Pays de Florina Samaropetra
review: Straightforward, with appley flavors and a tart finish. Sauvignon Blanc, Gewürztraminer and Roditis. Drink now.

name: Vin de Pays de Macedonia Paranga
review: Fruity, with berry and cherry flavors. Meaty notes on the finish. Xinomavro and Agiorgitiko. Drink now.

name: Amyndeon Akakies Rosé
review: Cherry flavors turn a tad sour and flat on the finish. 1,200 cases imported.

name: Xinomavro Naoussa
review: Medium-bodied, with dried cherry and orange peel flavors and meat and smoke notes. Drying tannins overwhelm the finish.

name: Vin de Pays d'Imathia Yianakohori
review: Tannic, with berry and dried cherry flavors that turn astringent on the finish. Xynomavro and Merlot.

name: Naoussa Ramnista
review: Meaty and gamy aromas and flavors fill this awkward red. Xynomavro.

name: Tokaji Aszú 6 Puttonyos
review: A touch of furniture polish on the nose leads to an expansive profile of apricot preserves, Key lime pie, crushed pine and almond biscotti in this rich, creamy dessert wine. Rapierlike acidity finds fine harmony and drives the mouthwatering, spiced finish. Drink now through 2032. 250 cases made.

name: Tokaji Aszú 6 Puttonyos
review: This sweet wine leads with notes of cedar and woodsy spice to the racy candied citrus, dried pineapple and apricot notes. The inherent richness is offset by a searing acidity that carries the tangy finish. Drink now through 2030. 250 cases made.

name: Tokaji Aszú 6 Puttonyos Lapis
review: Terrific aromas of spearmint, truffle, dried apricot and orange peel lead to flavors of the same, with the addition of a saline mineral essence on the finish. This is all put together on an elegant, harmonious frame, lingering with an orange and stone aftertaste. Drink now through 2030. 350 cases made.

name: Tokaji Ilona Cuvée
review: Orange and apricot flavors combine in this rich, concentrated dessert white. There's no lack of acidity, which builds through the finish. Impressive for its intensity, rather than complexity. Drink now through 2022. 500 cases made.

name: Tokaji Cuvée Patrícia
review: Medium-sweet, this white offers immediate appeal, exhibiting honey, apricot, beeswax, spice and mineral flavors. Stays fresh, elegant and vibrant on the lingering finish. Drink now through 2020. 250 cases made.

name: Tokaji Ilona Cuvée
review: Hints of cedar and leather lead in this sweetie, sporting racy acidity behind the dried apricot and lush peach notes. An open, crowd-pleasing style. Drink now through 2019. 250 cases made.

name: Furmint Tokaji Demi-Sec
review: Ripe and rich, with warm vanilla tones from oak complementing the peach and apple flavors. This is fresh and harmonious, leaving a mouthwatering impression. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Brut Tokaji Pezsgő Henye
review: Mouthwatering and sleek, this linear sparkler features a fine, creamy mousse, carrying rich flavors of toasted brioche and honey, as well as accents of lemon curd, glazed apricot, floral and herb. Drink now through 2018. 500 cases made.

name: Furmint Tokaji Sec
review: A lip-smacking, light- to medium-bodied white, with a juicy mix of Honeycrisp apple, melon and blood orange flavors accented by abundant ground spice and fresh tarragon notes. Zesty finish. Drink now through 2020. 2,000 cases made.

name: Furmint Tokaji Sec
review: Ripe and expressive, this white offers peach, pineapple and mineral flavors, matched to a supple texture. This is kept focused by bright acidity, lingering on the finish. Drink now through 2012. 2,000 cases made.

name: Tokaji Sec
review: Rich and spicy, with a light kiss of oak lending nutmeg, vanilla and butter nuances to the peach and grapefruit flavors. Stays fresh and long. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Supple and harmonious, with rich, smooth coffee, currant, vanilla, sage and cedary notes. Finishes with a long, complex aftertaste and firm, well-integrated tannins. Best from 2003 through 2010. 1,900 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley
review: Ripe and nicely integrated, with a supple blend of black cherry, plum, currant, herb and toasty oak and mulchy flavors. Concentration carries through the finish with supple, firm tannin. Drink now through 2006. 1,200 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Bright and up-front ripe wild berry flavors, with a hint of orange peel and nutmeg, are appealing. Drink now through 2006. 1,900 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley KRV Block 13
review: Starts out a bit raw, with spicy pear, citrus, lemon and cedary oak. Gains complexity on the finish.  Drink now through 2004. 3,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley
review: Smooth, with appealing cedar, herb and currant flavors, finishing with green olive and spice notes. Mildly tannic. Drink now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Has cedar and resin aromas, with spicy baked apple and citrus notes. Drink now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley Estate
review: Green been, cedar, plum and currant flavors have supple texture, picking up firm, rather dry tannins in the finish. Drink now through 2005. 1,521 cases made.

name: Pinot Grigio Napa Valley
review: Cedar and citrus aromas lead to similar flavors, finishing with a bitter lemon peel edge. Available only at the winery. Drink now. 272 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Estate
review: Rich and intense, with an earthy, leathery streak that shows more dill-laced oak than pure fruit. Drink now. 1,469 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Napa Valley
review: Lean, with currant, cherry, herbal and toasty oak flavors. Drink now through 2004. 495 cases made.

name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape Cuvée de Nalys
review: This has a robust feel, with lots of toasty apple wood and alder notes leading the way, followed by mouthfilling flavors of cherry preserves, linzer torte and blackberry compote. The finish is inlaid with spice, while more toasty wood notes echo through. Best from 2013 through 2023. 3,563 cases made.

name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape Cuvée de Nalys
review: A gorgeous cassis aroma, with flickers of tea, incense and warm mulling spices, giving way to a silky, lengthy core, showing more cassis, along with notes of anise and cherry preserves. Silky and reserved through the finish, with good depth for moderate cellaring. Best from 2013 through 2019. 3,999 cases made.

name: Signature Series Columbia Valley
review: Smooth and round, with expressive blueberry, pepper and floral flavors on a polished frame. This is generous and persistent on the finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Syrah, Petit Verdot and Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2022. 6,100 cases made.

name: Brut Champagne
review: Firm and tight, but with a nice range of flavors within a compact frame. Peach, orange and gingerbread notes thread the moderately rich texture, and this lingers nicely on the finish. Drink now through 2009. 19,000 cases made.

name: Brut Rosé Champagne
review: Lean and driven by vibrant acidity, this bubbly offers cherry, raspberry and toast notes. Fleshes out midpalate, but the structure urges it to a lingering finish. Drink now through 2010. 2,597 cases made.

name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape Cuvée de Nalys
review: Solid, with focus to the core of cassis and raspberry coulis flavors. A warm stone and garrigue inlay and fresh acidity drive the modestly grippy finish. Best from 2018 through 2027. 3,421 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Oakville Signature Series
review: Pure and rich, this is a solid effort, with generous plum and dark berry fruit shaded by smoky oak, ending with firm, ripe tannins. Drink now through 2026. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 7,000 cases made.

name: Sangiovese-Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot Toscana
review: Soft and very ripe, with spicy berry and meat character on both the nose and palate. Full and round-textured, with good tannins and a long finish. Very attractive red. Drink now through 2012. 2,715 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Ti Point
review: Lively, vivid and appealing for its pineapple and tangerine flavors, which linger nicely on the fresh finish. Drink now. 12,000 cases made.

name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape Cuvée de Nalys
review: This is open-knit at first, with solid black cherry, garrigue, tobacco and currant paste notes that are then followed by surprisingly grippy structure for the vintage. Not quite the range to be outstanding, but shows solid appellation character. Drink now through 2020. 1,770 cases made.

name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape Cuvée de Nalys
review: Primal and forward, with red berry fruit layered with vanilla, plum sauce and red licorice notes, followed by a racy finish. Lacks the range of the top wines of the vintage, but this is pure and balanced. Drink now through 2017. 3,105 cases made.

name: Côtes du Rhône-Villages
review: Dark and dense, with a nice smoldering tobacco frame to the rich plum, warm currant preserves and mulled cherry fruit flavors. A tarry edge adds length on the finish. Very solid. Drink now through 2013. 18,032 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: Ripe and supple, brimming with lovely blackberry, cherry, mocha and tobacco flavors, finishing with polish, subtlety and some power. Drink now through 2015. 15,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: This red is supple, refined and distinctive for its coffee and smoke overtones around a silky core of black cherry and berry fruit, lingering on the generous finish. Drink now through 2014. 15,043 cases made.

name: Signature Series Columbia Valley
review: Supple and sleek, with black cherry aromas and precise, medium-bodied flavors of mineral, olive and spice. Tannins firm up the finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Syrah and Sangiovese. Drink now through 2022. 5,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale
review: Dense and chewy, with dark-toned cherry and spice flavors, hinting at coffee and sassafras as the finish rolls on with a touch of heat from alcohol. Best from 2011 through 2016. 3,500 cases made.

name: Pauillac Signature Series
review: Focused, with good typicity. Cedar and iron notes give this a pleasantly austere edge, while a mix of red and black currant fruit hangs in reserve. The finish has a taut, racy structure. Best from 2018 through 2024. 5,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa County
review: A subtle, reined-in style, this is trim and spicy, with touches of cedar, cherry and berry that hang with you, ending with fine-grained tannins and a sense of elegance. Drink now through 2022. 25,000 cases made.

name: Meritage Napa Valley
review: A lithe and sinewy red, with notes of slate to the roasted plum, berry and shiso leaf flavors. Hints of pepper show on the finish.  Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Petit Verdot, Cabernet Franc and Malbec. Drink now through 2020. 12,400 cases made.

name: Meritage Rutherford
review: Soft and easygoing, with modest but appealing notes of black cherry, mocha and toasty herb. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Petit Verdot, Malbec and Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2020. 10,400 cases made.

name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape Cuvée de Nalys
review: This offers a slightly mature profile already, with shiso leaf and savory notes guiding the modest core of dried cherry and red currant fruit, all backed by fine-grained cedar and balsam threads on the finish. Drink now through 2022. 3,900 cases made.

name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape Cuvée de Nalys
review: Silky and refined, with lovely cherry sauce and plum coulis flavors stitched with hints of dried star anise and sweet spice. Offers a gentle, perfumy finish. Drink now through 2020. 3,300 cases made.

name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape Cuvée de Nalys
review: An old-school style, with chestnut, bay and cedar notes leading the way, backed by dried currant and black cherry fruit. The finish lets savory and warm stone hints fill in on the chewy-edged finish. Not dense, but shows good range and character. Drink now through 2020. 3,560 cases made.

name: Malbec Mendoza
review: Medium-bodied, with good cut to the dried plum and cherry flavors. Mocha and sandalwood notes show on the lightly creamy finish. Drink now. 200,000 cases made.

name: Malbec Mendoza
review: Briary flavors accent this moderately creamy red, which features plenty of milk chocolate and mocha notes. Mineral and spice details show on the chewy finish. Drink now through 2016. 175,000 cases made.

name: Malbec Mendoza
review: Ripe and fleshy, offering crushed black cherry and plum puree notes, with enough fresh acidity to carry the spice, cedar and smoke hints. Drink now. 100,000 cases made.

name: Malbec Mendoza
review: Ripe yet fresh, with dark cherry and cassis fruit character, bright acidity and light tannins. The finish picks up a pleasant earthy undertone. Drink now. 37,000 cases made.

name: Malbec Mendoza
review: A rounded, forward style, with notes of linzer torte and boysenberry preserves laced with sweet spice. Stays rounded and easy on the finish. Drink now. 30,000 cases made.

name: Bordeaux Supérieur
review: This bright, fresh style offers racy cherry, plum and spice notes that stay nicely defined through the floral-tinged finish. Lively acidity adds length. Drink now. 16,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Alexander Valley
review: Firm and flavorful, with dark berry, mint, dried herb and cedary oak notes, easing up as the tannins fold in. Drink now through 2020. 30,000 cases made.

name: Meritage Napa Valley
review: Mocha and cherry aromas lead to easygoing plum, spice and herb flavors. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2017. 34,099 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Santa Barbara County
review: Supple, with graceful cola-sassafras, dried currant and subtle herb and spice notes that are well-proportioned in an easy-drinking, well-balanced style. Drink now through 2010. 6,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Amador County Grandmère Old Vine
review: Vibrant and zesty, with raspberry and toasty vanilla aromas that lead to flavors of cherry jam, fresh sage and earth, with firm, briary tannins. Drink now through 2015. 11,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma County Old Vine
review: Soft and quite ripe, this is a good quaff, with notes of dried plum, licorice and spicy cinnamon. Drink now through 2017. 23,800 cases made.

name: Sangiovese-Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot Toscana
review: A good red, with plum and berry character and a hint of cedar. Medium-bodied, with ripe tannins and a delicate finish. Good wine for the money. Costco's in-house brand. Best after 2008. 2,715 cases made.

name: Côtes du Rhône-Villages
review: Solid, with a racy core of dark raspberry and blackberry fruit lined with a light graphite spine. Lingers with anise on the finish. Drink now. 47,712 cases made.

name: Côtes du Rhône-Villages
review: Friendly raspberry and damson plum fruit is lined with savory and anise hints, followed by an open, silky finish. Drink now. 24,000 cases made.

name: Côtes du Rhône-Villages
review: Very direct and juicy, with a core of dark fig and warm cherry preserves wound with hints of toast and spice. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Rioja Reserva
review: This supple red delivers cherry, underbrush, vanilla and tea flavors, with modest tannins and fresh acidity providing structure. Gentle but lively. Drink now through 2018. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: Fresh and silky, with pretty cherry, spice and coffee flavors, lingering gently. Drink now through 2016. 10,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: Soft and generous, with an orange peel note adding interest to the cherry and spice flavors. Drink now through 2011. 8,600 cases made.

name: Signature Series Columbia Valley
review: Firm in texture, with gritty tannins around a juicy core of blackberry and tar flavors, finishing with a meaty note. Needs hearty food. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Syrah, Cabernet Franc, Petit Verdot and Sangiovese. Best from 2014 through 2017. 4,500 cases made.

name: Bordeaux Supérieur
review: Features a streak of kirsch, with hints of licorice and tar, backed by a light briary edge on the finish. Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now. 30,000 cases made.

name: Médoc
review: Fresh, with unadorned red currant and savory notes, backed by a lightly sanguine hint on the finish. Drink now. 20,111 cases made.

name: Médoc
review: Light cedar and tobacco shadings surround the core of damson plum and red currant fruit, with a hint of sandalwood caressing the finish. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Carneros
review: Fans of minty bay leaf scents will find this red's herbal edge appealing, even if the fruit struggles to work through it. Drink now through 2020. 30,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Amador County Grandmère Old Vine
review: Soft and jammy, with notes of cherry pie, white pepper and dried sage. Drink now through 2016. 20,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Ti Point
review: Juicy, ripe pear and melon flavors have a very crisp, lemony edge, with plenty of acidity, and grace notes of fresh herbs and cut grass. Drink now. 51,284 cases made.

name: Côtes de Provence Rosé
review: Light cherry and watermelon rind notes are stitched with a savory thread in this rosé, ending with a crisp finish. Grenache, Cinsault, Mourvèdre, Tibouren, Rolle, Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now. 30,000 cases made.

name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape Cuvée de Nalys
review: High-toned, with floral, cherry and sandalwood notes leading the way, followed by hints of tea and dried fig on the medium-weight finish. Drink now through 2012. 2,790 cases made.

name: Syrah Columbia Valley
review: A representative Washington Syrah, if not quite as deep and generous as some. It shows ripe berry and spice flavors, and fine tannins. Drink now through 2011. 4,307 cases made.

name: Pinot Grigio Friuli Grave
review: This zesty white is smoky and open-knit, showing lots of ground spice, blanched almond and white peach flavors. Lightly juicy acidity runs throughout. Drink now. 75,000 cases made.

name: Côtes du Rhône-Villages
review: Open-knit and light-bodied, with friendly cherry and anise flavors that glide through the easy finish. Drink now. 48,525 cases made.

name: Malbec Mendoza
review: Offers a balsam aroma, with sinewy flavors of dried cherry and raspberry. Allspice notes show on the finish. Drink now. 216,000 cases made.

name: Malbec Mendoza
review: Medium-bodied, with flavors of strawberry rhubarb pie that feature some green pepper notes. Soft finish.  Drink now. 200,000 cases made.

name: Bordeaux Supérieur
review: A bit trim, with herb, pomegranate and dusty cherry notes that mingle through the slightly taut finish. Drink now. 24,000 cases made.

name: Médoc
review: Modest bitter plum and red currant fruit is lined with light savory and sanguine hints that hang on the finish. Drink now. 16,900 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County Master Cask Series II
review: Lemon flavors are ripe and moderately intense, with a smooth texture and well-balanced acidity. Drink now. 9,600 cases made.

name: Meritage Master Cask Series III Napa Valley
review: Dense and a bit rustic, showing red currant and spicy floral aromas, with plum, cedar and roasted herb flavors that take on tannins on the finish. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Oakville Signature Series
review: Fairly simple with modest notes of cherry, cedar and charred herbs. Drink now through 2019. 7,010 cases made.

name: Tierra de Chile Aconcagua Valley
review: On the high-toned side, with a hint of dill leading the way for modest cherry and toast notes. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Drink now. 2,935 cases made.

name: Pinot Grigio Friuli Grave
review: Flavors of blanched almond, yellow apple, apricot and stone mix in this open-knit and fresh white. Drink now. 135,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Central Otago
review: Firm, with good concentration to the leather, berry and spice flavors. Herbal, chewy tannins grip the finish. Drink now through 2009. 6,010 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley
review: Polished and spicy, with white pepper and cardamom overtones to the dark berry flavors, turning crisp on the finish. Drink now. 25,041 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Yountville
review: There's an herbal flair to the firm cassis and blackberry notes, which have some charm on the lean frame, with toasty flavors. Drink now through 2012. 2,750 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Carneros
review: Offers a modest mix of trim herb and dried berry that is more than serviceable. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley
review: The modest light berry, black tea and spicy notes are clean yet uninspiring. Drink now. 25,000 cases made.

name: Brut Champagne
review: A tight, compact style, with bread dough, citrus and honey notes. Straightforward and coarse on the finish. Drink now. 13,000 cases made.

name: Extra Dry Asolo Prosecco Superiore
review: Crisp and juicy, this easy-drinking version offers hints of orange blossom, white peach and fresh ginger. Drink now. 200,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Grigio Friuli Grave
review: Crisp and stony, a light, easy-drinking white, with juicy pear, almond, candied lemon zest and fresh earth notes. Drink now. 220,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Grigio Friuli Grave
review: Light-bodied and crisp, with a stony base and hints of kiwifruit, apricot and citrus zest. Drink now. 211,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Grigio Grave del Friuli
review: A light sipper, with straightforward notes of green melon, apple, star fruit and anise. Tangy finish. Drink now. 50,000 cases made.

name: Bordeaux Supérieur
review: Light bitter cherry and plum pit notes are laced with a hint of vanilla, with an open finish. Drink now. 35,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa County
review: A dry, herbal style, with modest dried berry, dusty oak flavors and chewy tannins. Drink now through 2014. 15,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa County
review: Full-bodied currant, roasted coffee and chicory dill notes thin out and lose velocity on the finish. Drink now. 8,000 cases made.

name: Meritage Master Cask Series III Napa Valley
review: Offers modest dried cherry, spice and cedar notes. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc. Drink now. 32,531 cases made.

name: Meritage Rutherford
review: Modest in structure, with dry tannins and notes of cherry, herb and spice. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Petit Verdot, Cabernet Franc and Malbec. Drink now through 2017. 9,800 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley
review: Grapey wild berry and blackberry scents are modestly varietal, simple and easy-drinking. Drink now. 9,782 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Amador County Grandmère Old Vine
review: Ripe and sweet, with black raspberry jam and spice notes. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Grigio Friuli Grave
review: A straightforward white, with fresh acidity and hints of stone, apple and spice. Drink now. 310,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Oakville Signature Series
review: Offers cherry, herb and earth notes. Drink now. 6,984 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Lean and pleasantly herbal, with sweet-and-sour cherry notes that have a refreshing tang on the finish. Drink now. 2,300 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma County Old Vine
review: Ripe and simple, with baked cherry and spicy herb notes. Drink now. 17,842 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley Master Cask I Series
review: Offers ripe black cherry and charred anise notes, but this is undermined by burnt aromas and flavors. 19,342 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Alexander Valley Master Cask Series X
review: Not much to like. Earthy, dried plum and berry flavors turn thin and bitter. 12,600 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Signature Series
review: Crisp and lively, with easygoing cherry and spice flavors. Drink now through 2022. 8,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Victoria Indelible Reserve
review: Lithe, polished and refined, a distinctive Shiraz with a glowing core of blackberry and plum flavors shaded with gamy tones, olive and peppery spices, finishing with light, fine tannins. Drink now through 2010. 500 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon South Eastern Australia
review: Ripe and appealing for its pure currant and blackberry flavors, resting on a layer of firm but fine tannins, lingering nicely. Drink now through 2006. 11,200 cases imported.

name: Shiraz South Eastern Australia Bushvine
review: Bright and generous, with blueberry and blackberry flavors on a lively frame, finishing smooth and fuzzy-textured from fine tannins. The flavors persist nicely. Drink now. 9,400 cases imported.

name: Shiraz South Eastern Australia Bushvine
review: Bright and juicy, a lively Shiraz with nice blackberry, red plum and white pepper aromas and flavors, which echo nicely on the finish, balanced with a gentle zing of acidity. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Victoria Indelible Reserve
review: Youthful and floral, with pretty blackberry and currant flavors wrapped in firm tannins and shaded with spicy oak. Needs time to flesh out. Best from 2006 through 2010. 700 cases imported.

name: Merlot South Eastern Australia
review: Soft, open textured, with pretty currant and blackberry flavors that echo nicely on the generous finish. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon South Eastern Australia
review: Gamy notes weave through the otherwise focused currant fruit, combining to give this a distinctive feel. Tannins are not intrusive. Not for all tastes, but well-made. Drink now through 2004. 10,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay South Eastern Australia
review: Light, creamy and well-mannered. A mouthful of pretty pear and floral flavors that linger well. Drink now. 5,400 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay South Eastern Australia
review: Light and tart, with juicy pear, apricot and aromatic lemon flavors, lingering nicely on the lively finish. Drink now. 7,900 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay South Eastern Australia
review: Soft and spicy, with pretty vanilla and nutmeg overtones to the tropical fruit flavors, persisting nicely on the generous finish. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Langhorne Creek
review: A deft style, playing its ripe, licorice-scented blackberry and tar flavors against a fine structure that lets the flavors sail through the open-textured finish. Drink now through 2015. 1,500 cases made.

name: Shiraz Clare Valley Single Vineyard Series Baile An Gharraí
review: Bright, with a firm edge to the juicy blackberry and slightly citrusy flavors, lingering on the lively finish. Best from 2010 through 2014. 5,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Clare Valley Single Vineyard Series Tulach Mor
review: Smooth and polished, with an open-weave texture that showcases its pretty raspberry, roasted tomato and coffee aromas and flavors. Drink now through 2014. 5,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz-Mourvèdre-Grenache Clare Valley
review: Lithe and appealing for its meaty blackberry and cherry flavors, playing grandly on an open texture. Lingers nicely. Drink now through 2012. 500 cases made.

name: Shiraz South Australia Lizards of OZ
review: Light and appealing for its soft plum and berry flavors, echoing nicely. Drink now. 25,000 cases made.

name: Syrah Galilee Kerem Kishor
review: There are plenty of beefy notes in this sinewy red, which features flavors of roasted plum, hoisin sauce and cedar. Grippy tannins, with notes of pepper on the chewy finish. Kosher. Drink now through 2018. 500 cases made.

name: Riesling Galilee Savant
review: A ripe and off-dry style, with sweet-and-sour notes to the roasted peach flavors. Kosher. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Papa's All-Blacks Old Vine North Coast
review: This has personality to spare, with powerful flavors and a burly structure. Blackberry, orange zest and pepper aromas pair with racy notes of dried cherry, Asian spice and licorice. The tannins are ripe but big. Zinfandel, Petite Sirah, Carignane, Alicante Bouschet and other mixed blacks. Best from 2017 through 2023. 819 cases made.

name: Cabernet-Shiraz-Merlot Western Australia
review: Supple, fleshy and generous with its cherry and licorice flavors, mineral and herb accents adding extra dimensions, finishing with some refinement. Drink now through 2012. 1,500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay South Eastern Australia
review: Soft, round and spicy, with exotic spice notes weaving through the melon, orange and slightly resiny flavors, which echo on the finish. Drink now through 2004. 10,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz South Eastern Australia
review: Ripe and round, open-textured and showing solid berry and spice flavors, echoing softly on the fine finish. Drink now through 2004. 10,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay South Eastern Australia
review: Light in texture, with pretty apple and spice flavors. Drink now. 30,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz South Eastern Australia
review: Firm, simple, pleasant for its dark berry and pepper flavors, finishing a bit chewy. Drink now. 30,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz South Eastern Australia
review: Sharp-edged, with raw cherry and herb flavors. Drink now. 30,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Carneros Hudson Vineyard
review: There's a wonderful range of ripe, exotic, complex flavors in this wine--tiers of concentrated earthy pear, citrus, fig and apricot--and it exhibits an elegance and finesse rarely achieved in California Chardonnay. Just wish there was more of it. Drink now through 2004. 282 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast Camp Meeting Ridge
review: Rich, smoky and exotic, with toasty oak, vanilla, fig, pear and hazelnut flavors that are deeply concentrated, long and complex on the finish. Drink now through 2004. 285 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Carneros Hyde Vineyard
review: Intense, with complex earthy pear, fig, melon, citrus and hazelnut flavors that are remarkably elegant and sophisticated, long and lingering on the finish. Drink now through 2004. 566 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Mountain McCrea Vineyard
review: Tightly reined in, intense and deeply concentrated, with an elegant, bright core of pear, anise, hazelnut, citrus and honeyed notes, lingering long and lively on the finish. Drink now through 2004. 1,866 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Carneros Hyde Vineyard
review: Ultrarich, almost syrupy, with a gorgeous core of ripe, buttery pear, honey, pineapple and citrus flavors that are amazingly well-focused, finishing with a tight beam of flavor that zings across the palate, enlivened by juicy acidty. Drink now through 2007. 538 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Vine Hill Vineyard
review: Displays remarkable depth and integration, slowly unfolding to show flavors of pear, vanilla, fig, anise, smoke, butter and spice that loll, smooth, rich and creamy, on the palate. An altogether complex and concentrated young wine that packs in flavor while maintaining harmony and finesse. 2,748 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast Camp Meeting Ridge
review: Kistler strikes again with this rich and unctuous Chardonnay. Bold, flavorful and fleshy, its layers of ripe pear, fig, citrus and honeysuckle flavors gain depth and complexity thanks to judicious oak seasoning, which adds toast and anise nuances. Delicious. Drink now through 2004. 282 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast Parmelee-Hill Vineyard Stone Flat
review: Intense, with rich layers of smoky oak, ripe fig, melon and roasted marshmallow. Full-bodied, with touches of nutmeg, anise and roasted fig. All in all very complex and distinctive. Drink now through 2017. 891 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast Trenton Roadhouse
review: This classy version combines the best of rich, coastal California Chardonnay with Burgundian techniques, rendering a creamy, multifaceted wine, with layers of fig, melon, anise, toasty oak, hazelnut and poached pear. Drink now through 2022. 830 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Mountain McCrea Vineyard
review: Fresh, rich and vibrant. Full-bodied, deep and concentrated, showing spicy green apple and pear flavors, with a lemon-citrus shading. Gains velocity on the finish, where this holds its focus. Drink now through 2013. 3,634 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Mountain McCrea Vineyard
review: Manages to deliver a rich core of flinty, spicy pear and anise notes while showing its young, tight, complex and concentrated nature. A remarkably well-focused Chardonnay with a long, full finish that keeps pumping out the flavors. 2,765 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Durell Vineyard
review: A seamless wine of classic proportions. Ripe, rich and polished, with tiers of pear, citrus, melon, hazelnut and fig culminating in a long, polished aftertaste. Kudos to Kistler. Drink now through 2006. 1,882 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Durell Vineyard
review: This is a delicious mouthful of Chardonnay. It's big, bold, rich and creamy, brimming with tiers of flavor--vanilla, pear, anise, fig and melon--and finishing with harmonious notes of smoke and nectarine. Drink now through 2002. 2,847 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Carneros Hudson Vineyard
review: Combines richness with a creamy texture, allowing the taut citrus, pear, melon and fig notes to fan out, gaining depth and length. Displays beautifully integrated smoky oak nuances. Drink now through 2020. 1,060 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Carneros Hudson Vineyard
review: This packs in lots of dense flavors, highlighted by nectarine, tangerine, peach and citrus, gaining as this leads to its long, pure finish. The richest and most concentrated of the 2009 Kistlers. Drink now through 2020. 1,080 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Carneros Hudson Vineyard
review: Exhibits great intensity and concentration, without weight, offering a mix of fresh melon, apple, pear and fig flavors that are lively, vibrant and full-bodied. Yet this is most elegant and graceful on the finish, where the flavors sail on, ending with a dash of smoke and light butterscotch. Drink now through 2016. 918 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Dutton Ranch
review: A pure, simple, delicious Chardonnay that's brimming with ripe, juicy pear, apple, apricot and exotic spicy notes. Fills out the palate with a load of complexity that gives long, lingering flavors. Has a good dose of toasty oak, but the wine wears it well. Ready now. 1,844 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Vine Hill Vineyard
review: Intense, trim and delicate, with a subtle, tightly knit beam of rich fig, apricot, melon and spicy hazelnut flavors that build and gain depth on the finish. Drink now through 2012. 3,640 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Vine Hill Vineyard
review: A crisp and lively Chardonnay with a rich, concentrated, tightly wound band of nectarine, pear, citrus and spice. Gains momentum on the palate, and finishes with a wonderful display of fruit and oak complexity. Best from 1999 through 2006. 2,782 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Kistler Vineyard
review: Very tight and rich, presenting a dense core of white peach, nectarine, citrus and crushed rock. Shows impressive balance, purity, focus and persistence, ending with a dash of vanilla. Will only improve with time. Drink now through 2020. 1,425 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Kistler Vineyard
review: Tight, rich and concentrated, with a pretty array of creamy oak, custard, citrus, pear and buttery oak flavors that fan out and gain nuance on the finish. Drink now through 2003. 951 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Kistler Vineyard
review: Smooth and creamy, with rich, subtle flavors that develop and expand to reveal a complex core of ripe pear, butter, hazelnut and smoky oak. In all, very harmonious wine. The finish lingers on and on, revealing nuance after nuance. 929 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Kistler Vineyard
review: A rich, enormously complex blend of ripe pear, apple and spice flavors, with toasty, smoky, buttery nuances. Has a long, full aftertaste. 1,874 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Kistler Vineyard
review: Oozing with rich, opulent, delicious pear, honey, vanilla, lemon and spicy nutmeg flavors that explode on the palate, displaying uncommon finesse and a smooth creamy texture that allows the flavors to glide across the palate. Has an amazingly long and intense finish. 507 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast
review: Complex, riveting aromas of dusty berry, anise and wild blackberry carry over to the palate in a tight, concentrated manner, offering great density, richness and complexity. Finishes with a return to the dusty berry flavors and firm tannins. Drink now through 2009. 2,785 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Camp Meeting Ridge
review: Extraordinary. Dark in color, with gorgeous flavors and rich and exotic aromas of black cherry, fresh roasted coffee, mocha, currant and spice. Fills out on the palate to reveal uncommon richness, depth and dimension, and has a tremendous aftertaste. Drink now through 2007. 118 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Camp Meeting Ridge
review: Impressive with its dense, concentrated core of black cherry, plum and berry flavors, picking up a pretty oak shading and a slight meaty accent, both of which add dimension. Firmly tannic on the finish, so if you're lucky enough to have a bottle or two, cellar into 1999 for best results. 190 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Cuvée Natalie Silver Belt Vineyard
review: This fresh, ripe and pure red delivers vivid plum, wild berry, black licorice and mineral notes. Full-bodied, firming on the finish, where the tannins have a slight grainy quality, ending with a supple edge. Drink now through 2018. 1,046 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Carneros Hudson Vineyard
review: Offers a rich, intense, layered mix of flavors, centered around smoky fig, apricot, melon and spice. Tight, concentrated and persistent. Best from 2010 through 2014. 1,818 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Carneros Hyde Vineyard
review: Serves up rich flavors of fig, vanilla, apricot and roasted marshmallow that work around the theme of smoky, toasty oak. Ends long, deep and persistent. Drink now through 2022. 1,055 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Carneros Hyde Vineyard
review: Possesses a compelling and exotic Puligny-Montrachet aroma. Rich and complex, offering a mix of ripe pear, fig, honeydew melon and toasty oak flavors that fold together. Drink now through 2021. 1,065 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Carneros Hyde Vineyard
review: Smoky toasty oak notes are present from the first scent, joined by white peach, nectarine, honeydew melon and tangerine accents, gaining depth and persistence. A sure bet to improve with cellaring. Drink now through 2020. 1,065 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Carneros Hyde Vineyard
review: Trim, intense and focused, with a citrusy edge and a long, lingering finish that promises to only get better. A touch more leesy in character than the other Kistlers. Best from 2012 through 2020. 1,784 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Carneros Hyde Vineyard
review: Aromatically complex, with vibrant citrus, fig, apricot and creamy nectarine flavors that are deep and concentrated, long and sophisticated, with amazing intensity. Drink now through 2006. 538 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Dutton Ranch
review: Starts out smoky and toasty, turning focus to the ripe pear, fig, apricot and anise flavors, with a touch of hazelnut on the aftertaste. Drink now through 2002. 1,872 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Vine Hill Vineyard
review: Exhibits a rich core of creamy fig, apricot, melon and anise flavors, with toasty, mocha-laced oak. Though big and layered, this is also quite elegant and refined, featuring jazzy citrus blossom notes. Drink now through 2022. 1,880 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Vine Hill Vineyard
review: Pure, ripe and supple, with subtle melon, spice, citrus and honeysuckle notes that are full-bodied, elegant and delicate, ending with a mix of floral and mineral notes. Drink now through 2016. 2,125 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Vine Hill Vineyard
review: Aromatically complex, with a mix of ripe pear, fig, citrus and hazelnut flavors that are tightly focused, with lively acidity, excellent depth and balance and a long, lingering finish that keeps repeating the fruit and oak themes. Drink now through 2011. 3,645 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Vine Hill Vineyard
review: Tight and flinty, with rich pear, fig, anise, vanilla and hazelnut flavors that start out subtly and build to a rich, complex aftertaste. Drink now through 2002. 2,774 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast Camp Meeting Ridge
review: Aromatically rich and complex with flavors to match. Shows layers of fig, pear, anise, custard and citrus that fan out and gain depth and nuance. Drink now through 2005. 278 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast Durell Vineyard
review: Rich and expansive, starting tight and unfolding to reveal complex pear, apple, citrus and green fig notes, easing into a lengthy aftertaste that keeps the flavors at the forefront. Drink now. 1,055 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast Durell Vineyard
review: Rich and refreshing, delivering a vibrant core of zesty tangerine, white peach, nectarine and lemon blossom flavors that are full-bodied and assertive without being weighty. Ends with good intensity. Drink now through 2020. 1,055 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast Durell Vineyard
review: A sturdy effort, very rich and potent, with tiers of smoke, baked apple, spice and honeysuckle. Young and raw yet tightly focused and persistent on the finish, where a touch of lemon folds in. Drink now through 2020. 1,065 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast Durell Vineyard
review: This delivers a subtle, toned-down mix of citrus, green apple, mineral and apple blossom flavors, turning graceful and silky. Long, persistent finish. Drink now through 2020. 1,434 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast Dutton Ranch
review: Beautifully crafted, sleek and refined, with a bright, zingy mix of vibrant white peach, nectarine, tangerine and green apple flavors, finishing with a long, lively, juicy aftertaste that reverberates with lemon blossom accents. Drink now through 2020. 1,060 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast Dutton Ranch
review: This tight white is focused on lemon- and citrus-laced white peach and nectarine flavors, which unfold into a delicate, understated style, joined by notes of wet rock and honeydew melon. Drink now through 2019. 920 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast Stone Flat Vineyard
review: Exhibits a bright, vivid, juicy mix of lemon, green pear, white peach and honeydew flavors, shaded by spicy, toasty oak. Deftly balanced, ending with minerality and a trace of savory herb. Drink now. 1,060 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast Stone Flat Vineyard
review: A flinty, minerally style, with crushed rock, wet stone, green apple and lemon-citrus notes that are tight and focused, ending with a tart citrus peel pithiness on the finish. Drink now through 2021. 1,060 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast Stone Flat Vineyard
review: A seductive style that combines smooth, creamy oak with spicy baked apple, hazelnut, citrus rind and green fig notes. Tightly focused, fresh and vibrant, ending with snappy stone fruit flavors. Drink now through 2019. 1,055 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast Trenton Road House
review: Another notably subtler expression of Chardonnay for Kistler, this offers an earthier expression, with peach and nectarine notes at the center. The flavors fan out on the finish. Drink now through 2019. 918 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast Trenton Roadhouse
review: Lively, with zesty lemon-citrus and mineral notes that impart pleasing juiciness, focus and persistence keeping the flavors fresh, lively and long on the palate. Drink now through 2020. 830 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County
review: Packs in lots of ripe, fresh, lively pear, nectarine, spice and honey notes that turn smooth and elegant with a fleshy texture and a long, full, complex finish. At this stage, this is the showiest of the Kistler wines. Drink now. 7,320 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County Cuvée Cathleen
review: Smoky marshmallow and toasty oak lead the way to a rich, broad array of creamy fig, pear and apricot. Intense, focused, complex and concentrated, it perhaps more than most of the 2000 Kistlers needs time. Best from 2004 through 2008. 535 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County Cuvée Cathleen
review: Wonderful intensity, richness and range of flavor are the hallmarks here, with earthy fig, pear, anise, green olive and herbal notes. The long-lasting finish adds a pretty dose of smoky, toasty oak. Drink now through 2005. 538 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County Cuvée Cathleen
review: Ripe, rich and opulent, with tiers of spicy pear, apple, melon and citrus flavors. Finishes with a complex, concentrated aftertaste that keeps pumping out the flavors. Drinkable now, or cellar into 2000. 540 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Mountain
review: Pure and focused, with a vivid core of white peach, nectarine and tangerine flavors. Tangy acidity gives this a chalky, minerally edge and a long, persistent and captivating finish. Drink now through 2022. 4,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Mountain McCrea Vineyard
review: From Kistler's impressive Chardonnay lineup comes this smooth, ripe, rich and polished wine, with a succulent core of ripe pear, spice, hazelnut, fig and honey flavors. Notable for its depth, concentration, complexity and finesse, with a long, full aftertaste. Drink now through 2001. 2,791 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Mountain McCrea Vineyard Athearn Estate
review: Fresh and lively, with a subtle mix of white peach, nectarine and chalky crushed rock. Delivers pure and zesty vibrancy on the finish. Drink now through 2019. 1,820 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Mountain McCrea Vineyard Athearn Estate
review: Shows wonderful, exotic aromas of zesty pear, apple and flowers, with pretty toasty, creamy oak and yeasty, leesy shadings. Adds a minerally quality on the palate, with a long, persistent finish. Drink now through 2009. 3,645 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Durell Vineyard
review: Yet another winner from this winery. Remarkably complex and concentrated, serving up a lot of intense fruit flavors, with ripe pear, citrus, fig and toasty oak and hazelnut notes. This is a young and tightly wound Chardonnay that should only get better with age. Drink now through 2002. 2,735 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Durell Vineyard Sand Hill
review: Rich, dense and young, with toasty, buttery notes over tight fruit flavors that will need a few years to develop fully. Creamy, peachy, pearlike and intense, but still a bit raw from oak; drinkable now. 2,470 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Kistler Vineyard
review: Though rich and creamy, this shows a measure of elegance and finesse that imparts delicacy and complexity, with hazelnut, pear, fig and anise flavors. Ends long and clean. Drink now through 2022. 1,980 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Kistler Vineyard
review: Rich without being overblown, with smoky, toasty oak joining ripe pear, melon, citrus, honeysuckle, mineral and fig flavors that are notably elegant and refined, keeping a tight focus and ending with a lingering aftertaste. Drink now through 2011. 1,830 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Kistler Vineyard
review: Wonderful focus on ripe, structured pear, pineapple and earthy citrus flavors, which unfold gracefully to reveal subtle flavor and textural nuances. Oak plays a small role, giving the wine a flash of smoke and toast. Lovely aftertaste. Drink now through 2007. 1,853 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Kistler Vineyard
review: Rich and creamy, with layers of fig, pear, tangerine, melon and spice. Refreshingly elegant and sophisticated, with a long, detailed aftertaste. Drink now through 2006. 1,854 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Kistler Vineyard Cuvée Catherine
review: Dark, rich and plummy, with wonderful complexity, a tightly focused core of black cherry, wild berry, chocolate and pretty, toasty oak. Firm and deep, it's drinkable now.--California Pinot Noir retrospective. Drink now through 2005. 192 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Cuvée Elizabeth
review: Intense and vibrant at first, with vivid, juicy wild berry, black cherry and raspberry fruit. Yet turns more and more delicate, ending with a burst of ripe fruit, dusty berry and mineral notes. Drink now through 2009. 255 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Cuvée Natalie Silver Belt Vineyard
review: Complex black cherry and blackberry flavors are shaded by spicy, cedary oak and supported by firm, gripping tannins that make for a powerful expression. Shows a measure of elegance and finesse. Drink now through 2023. 1,070 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Kistler Vineyard
review: Intense and full-bodied, with creamy oak, dark berry, cedar and spice flavors, this is a powerful expression of Pinot Noir. Best served by cellar time, this will only gain and hold from here. Not shy on tannins. Best from 2014 through 2024. 2,135 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Kistler Vineyard
review: Rich and graceful, with a luxurious beam of blueberry, blackberry and wild berry fruit that's tight-knit and structured, with a pleasant fresh earth and spicy underbrush presence. Drink now through 2023. 1,635 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Kistler Vineyard
review: Offers a trim, complex beam of intense dark berry fruit, which joins a mix of wild berry and raspberry notes. Medium- to full-bodied, showing good acidity and a clean, fruity finish. Drink now through 2019. 2,084 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma Valley Kistler Vineyard
review: A peppery, powerful Cabernet with a deep ruby color, cherry and plum flavors and lots of tannin. In spite of its youth, it tastes well-balanced and will become elegant when it begins to age out in five years or more. Definitely worth laying away.

name: Chardonnay Carneros Hudson Vineyard
review: Very tight and well-built, with a firm backbone of toasty oak framing the taut citrus, green apple and nectarine flavors. Vibrant and persistent, ending with a return of the oak elements. Drink now through 2021. 1,055 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Carneros Hudson Vineyard
review: Tightly wound, with flavors that build, unleashing ripe pear, fig, smoky, toasty marshmallow and charcoal notes, ending with strong, leesy tannins. Needs time. Drink now through 2019. 1,060 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Carneros Hudson Vineyard
review: Smoky, toasty aromas pick up rich citrus, pear and apple flavors on the palate in a tight, sharply focused manner, with the fruit and oak fanning out on the finish. Drink now. 915 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Carneros Hudson Vineyard
review: Beautifully defined and focused fruit flavors, with intense pear, spice and citrus notes, turning rich and complex. Drink now through 2005. 283 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Carneros Hudson Vineyard
review: Young and crisp, with a flint, citrus and pear core, it's tightly wound and sharply focused. Best from 1999 through 2002. 288 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Carneros Hyde Vineyard
review: Offers spicy graham cracker, honey, honeydew melon, fig and baked apple flavors that are intense and leesy, gaining on the finish. Drink now through 2019. 1,065 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Carneros Hyde Vineyard
review: This tight, flinty Chardonnay features intense, focused and taut flavors of nectarine, peach and snappy honeydew melon, ending with a spicy mineral edge. Drink now through 2018. 1,074 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Carneros Hyde Vineyard
review: Sleek and elegant, with flavors that gain complexity and nuance. Lots of spicy and sharply focused citrus, pear, anise and apricot flavors that are smoky and rich. Drink now through 2005. 935 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Dutton Ranch
review: Serves up a complex mix of flavors, with ripe, spicy apple, pear, honeysuckle and fig. Full-bodied, deep and persistent, ending with a citrusy mineral edge. Drink now through 2012. 3,628 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Dutton Ranch
review: A plump, rich and creamy style, with ripe fig, hazelnut and buttery flavors, and pretty glimpses of anise, pear and tangerine. Drink now through 2005. 1,838 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Dutton Ranch
review: Big, ripe and full-bodied, with layers of concentrated fig, citrus, melon, anise and custard. Turns silky and toasty, with a long finish. Drink now through 2005. 1,868 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Dutton Ranch
review: Intense and lively, with layers of tightly wound pear, spice, vanilla and nutmeg, held together by crisp acidity and finishing with a long, full, lingering aftertaste. Drinkable now. 2,800 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Dutton Ranch
review: Rich, crisp and tightly wound with pretty spice, apple, pear and vanilla flavors peeking through. A pleasant kiss of oak adds complexity and dimension. Finish offers butterscotch and finesse.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Vine Hill Vineyard
review: Young and vibrant, with a core of honeydew melon, creamy oak and pithy citrus flavors that are commanding, tight and focused. Long and persistent on the finish. Drink now through 2020. 1,880 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Vine Hill Vineyard
review: Offers a firm, deep core of lemon- and grapefruit-scented green apple and nectarine notes, maintaining a lively, zesty texture and vibrant acidity, ending long and clean. Drink now through 2022. 1,570 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Vine Hill Vineyard
review: Complex, with a roasted marshmallow edge from toasty oak. There's a medium-bodied mix underneath of sleek citrus-infused pear, anise, melon and hazelnut flavors that linger and turn elegant. Drink now through 2010. 2,721 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Vine Hill Vineyard
review: Lots of complexity, depth and richness, built around a tight, concentrated core of anise, pear, fig and earthy citrus. Holds its tight focus on a long flavorful finish. Drink now through 2006. 1,848 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Vine Hill Vineyard
review: Offers depth, richness, complexity and wonderful flavors, with layers of fig, peach, nectarine and anise, framed by light, toasty oak. Finishes with long, complex, earthy flavors. Drink now through 2005. 932 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Vine Hill Vineyard
review: Aromatically complex, with flavors to match, offering tiers of rich honey, pear and hazelnut flavors that expand and linger. The texture is smooth and polished, leading to an altogether complex and fascinating aftertaste. 1,857 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Vine Hill Vineyard
review: Rich, complex and young, combining a generous core of pear, pineapple, spice and earth notes with a smooth, supple texture. Turns smoky and toasty on the finish, but is a delicious Chardonnay. Keeps pumping out the flavor. Drink now through 1996. 2,765 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast
review: Bold, ripe, rich and complex, with exotic fig, pear, melon and spicy Chardonnay flavors that pick up a trace of toasty oak on the finish. Beautifully balanced, it can stand cellaring into 1998. 7,017 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast Durell Vineyard
review: Intense and full-bodied, with a fresh, vibrant, supple core of spicy apple, honeysuckle and citrus flavors that are well-balanced, clean and pure. Drink now through 2013. 1,810 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast Durell Vineyard
review: Exotic, rich and complex aromatics of white peach, toasty oak, tangerine, nectarine, mineral and pebble, ending with a lively, elegant beam of fruit flavors that are long and lingering. Drink now through 2011. 1,830 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast Parmelee-Hill Vineyard Stone Flat
review: Fragrant floral and white peach notes offer a tight core of baked apple and crushed rock flavors. A sleeker, trimmer style for Kistler, laced by mineral accents. Drink now through 2019. 1,080 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast Stone Flat Vineyard
review: Intense and vibrant, featuring rich, pure layers of ripe pear, fig, apricot and smoke. Still a touch coarse and raw, but the flavors fold together nicely on the sleek, tapered finish. Drink now through 2018. 1,065 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast Trenton Roadhouse
review: Tightly focused, with a rich core of honeydew melon, citrus, pear, fig and mineral, maintaining vibrancy and leading to a long, deep, persistent finish. Promises to gain over the next few years. Drink now through 2020. 830 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast Trenton Roadhouse
review: Aromas of green apple, lime and floral lift off and expand gracefully, delivering elegant balance and a long, clean and persistent finish. Drink now through 2018. 1,065 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County Cuvée Cathleen
review: Notably rich, intense and complex, with thick butterscotch, vanilla, hazelnut and leafy-fig flavors that unfold to offer layers of subtle anise and spice notes. Finishes with a burst of lemon custard and some tannins. Drink now through 2006. 535 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County Cuvée Cathleen
review: Quite rich and complex, with tiers of ripe pear, apple, melon, custard and anise. Turns smooth and polished, with an intricate aftertaste. Drink now through 2004. 540 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County Cuvée Cathleen
review: Remarkably complex, with ripe, rich pear, fig and smoky oak flavors. Lingers on the finish. This should develop even more complexity over the next year. First Cuvée Cathleen bottling. 522 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Mountain McCrea Vineyard
review: Sleek, rich and polished, with pretty lemon custard, toasty oak, hazelnut and nectarine, all in tightly focused beam, offering great length and concentration. Drink now through 2006. 2,762 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Mountain McCrea Vineyard
review: Delicious Chardonnay. Rich and full-bodied, with ripe, complex and concentrated pear, butterscotch, fig, melon, hazelnut and honey notes, finishing with a long, lingering aftertaste. Drink now through 2006. 1,845 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Mountain McCrea Vineyard
review: Smooth, rich and smoky, with layers of tangerine, pear, fig, hazelnut and honey. Gains richness and depth, turning thick and concentrated on the finish. Drink now through 2006. 2,786 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Mountain McCrea Vineyard
review: Still young and tight, with a pretty array of ripe pear, fig and melon flavors and a buttery texture. Finishes with an anise and herbal edge. Mature, ready to drink. California.--Chardonnay Challenge. 2,470 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Mountain McCrea Vineyard
review: Remarkably rich, concentrated and elegant, with tiers of pear, lemon, melon and stony-mineral flavors that are sharply focused and stay with you from start to finish. Impeccably well balanced and flavorful. Drink now to 1993. 1,010 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Mountain McCrea Vineyard Athearn Estate
review: Combines ripeness, richness and structure, delivering a taut mix of flint, fig, apricot, white peach and nectarine flavors, all shaded by toasty oak. Ends with a long, full, lingering finish. Drink now through 2021. 2,110 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Mountain McCrea Vineyard Athearn Estate
review: A lively, vibrant mix of citrus, ginger, ginger snap, pear, melon and green fig flavors, this maintains a deft balance and offers depth and nuance on the finish. Drink now. 2,110 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Mountain McCrea Vineyard Athearn Estate
review: Fresh apple and spicy floral scents are elegant and delicate in this medium- to full-bodied white, which is impressive for its fresh, snappy fruit vitality. Drink now through 2016. 1,820 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Durell Vineyard
review: An elegant style, with subtle, understated fig, melon, anise and toasty oak. The texture is silky, with a long, rich, buttery aftertaste. Drink now through 2005. 2,755 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Kistler Vineyard
review: A rich, creamy, seamless style, with a vibrant core of honeydew melon, nectarine and white peach, shaded by light oak. A well-balanced wine of dimension and complexity. Drink now. 1,810 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Kistler Vineyard
review: Ultrarich, with exotic, honey-laced fig, apricot and Asian pear flavors, backed by leesy tannins that give this a wet stone, crushed rock minerality and a cleansing aftertaste. Drink now through 2019. 1,425 cases made.
