name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Kistler Vineyard
review: Loads of rich, viscous fig, apricot, nectarine and a touch of honey is this deeply concentrated, almost syrupy bottling. Finishes with a luxurious aftertaste of exotic spices. Drink now through 2006. 1,853 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Kistler Vineyard
review: Lots of spicy, oaky, exotic tropical fruit aromas leading to an equally rich and concentrated wine, loaded with fig, pear, hazelnut and anise flavors, turning complex. Drink now through 2005. 545 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Kistler Vineyard
review: Ripe and full-bodied, with a core of smoky pear, spice and citrus flavors, turning buttery on the finish and picking up a pretty anise note. Still young and vibrant, it's worthy of another couple of years in the cellar. 522 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Kistler Vineyard
review: Enormously complex and deep, with rich, concentrated pear, pineapple, citrus and hazelnut flavors that glide across the palate. Finishes with a long, smoky, toasty aftertaste that goes on and on. Drink now through 1995. 511 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Kistler Vineyard
review: Kistler is hot. Complex and delicious, with great balance and a long aftertaste. Brimming with ripe, butterscotchy flavors over ripe, round fruit. Big and full-bodied but elegant. Drink now through 1992.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley
review: Firm and focused, with a beam of dried berry, spice, loamy earth and red and black licorice that gains depth and richness, ending with a long, layered finish. Drink now through 2022. 741 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Kistler Vineyard
review: Deliciously rich and focused, with a bright core of ripe plum, black cherry, anise, cedar and spice. Impressively gains nuance and complexity on the finish, where the flavors sail on. Drink now through 2006. 273 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Kistler Vineyard Cuvée Catherine
review: Wonderful fruit purity. Ripe, rich and focused, with complex plum, raspberry, blueberry and spice, picking up light toasty oak on the finish. Shows enough tannic strength to merit short-term cellaring. Best from 2000 through 2006. 279 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Cuvée Catherine Occidental Station Vineyard
review: Intense and vibrant, well-oaked and balanced, featuring a dense mix of spicy dark berry and raspberry that is pure and persistent. Long finish. Best from 2014 through 2024. 918 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Cuvée Elizabeth Bodega Headlands Vineyard
review: Austere, with a pleasant briny, flinty, oyster shell texture. Underneath, there's trim ripe berry flavors that gain richness and dimension. Quite tannic. Needs time. A strikingly distinctive Kistler. Best from 2013 through 2023. 780 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Cuvée Natalie Silver Belt Vineyard
review: Weaves together a savory mix of dried herb, cherry and wild berry flavors. Supple in texture, graceful in balance and refined in delivery. Drink now. 1,070 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Kistler Vineyard
review: Offers fresh, juicy, snappy raspberry and wild berry flavors, shaded by spice and wilted rose. The delicate, minerally finish shows understated elegance. Drink now through 2021. 2,100 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma Coast Occidental Vineyard Cuvée Elizabeth
review: Intense and concentrated, with vivid blackberry, wild berry and raspberry fruit that's focused and complex, ending with ripe tannins. Drink now through 2009. 264 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Carneros Hudson Vineyard
review: Offering rich layers of honeydew melon, apricot, fig and hazelnut, this is sleek and focused, gaining depth and maintaining a persistent aftertaste. Drink now through 2018. 1,065 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Carneros Hudson Vineyard
review: Exotic and smoky, with layers of fig, honeysuckle, citrus and marshmallow flavors that are full-blown and mouthcoating, ending with a smoky campfire aroma. Drink now through 2008. 522 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Carneros Hudson Vineyard
review: Deep, rich and concentrated, with a complex range of ripe pear, citrus, fresh earth, herb and sage flavors that are well-focused and persistent, leading to a long, supple, harmonious aftertaste. Drink now through 2008. 945 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Carneros Hyde Vineyard
review: Very tight and compact, revealing little outside a vibrant intensity and a core of citrus-infused green apple, melon and spice flavors, tightening on the finish. Best from 2015 through 2022. 1,065 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Dutton Ranch
review: Shows off fresh bread dough and toasted grains, with a tight core of pear and citrus-scented fruit, and light cedary oak. Gains complexity on the finish, with hints of anise and citrus, and the acidty is vibrant and juicy. Drink now through 2006. 2,766 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Dutton Ranch
review: Rich and intense, with complex layers of fig, anise, apricot and sage, packing in lots of flavor while maintaining a sense of elegance and grace. Drink now through 2006. 2,766 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Dutton Ranch
review: A smoky, earthy style that's a bit heavy-handed, but the core of fruit is intense and concentrated, with rich fig, pear, anise, hazelnut and cedary oak. Best from 1999 through 2004. 1,876 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Dutton Ranch
review: Powerful and weighted with gorgeous fruit on the palate, yet retains elegance. Shows well-integrated apple, pear, nutmeg and ginger flavors and a long, clean finish. Beautifully tuned.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Vine Hill Vineyard
review: Pure, vivid green apple, pineapple, honeydew melon and subtle oaky spice notes define this taut style, ending with leesy tannins. Drink now. 2,280 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Vine Hill Vineyard
review: Displays wildflower, subtle peach and mineral flavors that are dialed back without sacrificing depth and persistence. One of the most understated and delicate of the Kistler's new releases. Drink now through 2019. 1,848 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Vine Hill Vineyard
review: Deep, rich and smoky, with layers of ripe fig, lemon, custard and melon. Long, intricate aftertaste. Drink now through 2005. 1,874 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Vine Hill Vineyard
review: Ripe, rich and exotic, with layers of pear, toast, hazelnut and smoky oak, all folding together into a complex and concentrated Chardonnay. 2,764 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast Durell Vineyard
review: Delivers a laser beam of pineapple, lime, citrus and light cedary oak notes. Impressive for the juicy vibrancy and long, clean finish. Drink now through 2021. 1,055 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast Durell Vineyard
review: Starts with a pithy citrus and green apple skin edge, with a touch of tannins to the green apple, honeysuckle and melon flavors. Offers a long, clean, refreshing finish. Drink now through 2019. 1,055 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast Dutton Ranch
review: Tight yet expansive, with the flavors unfolding to reveal green apple, guava, tropical fruit and crushed rock notes, edging in on the finish, where this gains a zesty, chalky minerality. Drink now through 2021. 1,060 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Coast Dutton Ranch
review: Fresh and snappy, with zesty, leesy citrus, green pineapple and green apple flavors, picking up a pleasing floral scent and ending with a stone fruit flintiness. Drink now through 2019. 1,060 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Mountain McCrea Vineyard
review: Intense, with concentrated fruit and oak that are perfumed and floral, with layers of fig and nectarine folding in nicely. An elegant, restrained version from Kistler. Drink now through 2006. 2,762 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Mountain McCrea Vineyard
review: Rich and concentrated, with subtle flavors of honey, pear, vanilla and hazelnut. The long, full aftertaste develops traces of pineapple and spice as it lingers on the palate. 2,760 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Mountain McCrea Vineyard Athearn Estate
review: Taut and tart, with a core of grapefruit-infused green apple and melon flavors, showing a pithy citrus skin texture that shows concentration but also a youthful tightness. Drink now through 2022. 1,810 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Mountain McCrea Vineyard Athearn Estate
review: Rich and creamy, with well-integrated fig, light toasty oak, green apple and pineapple notes. The refreshing finish echoes ripe, clean flavors. Drink now. 2,130 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Durell Vineyard
review: The high-toned oak is toasty and smoky, with a touch of vanilla and yeasty dough scents. This is trim and focused on the palate, showing hints of green apple, citrus, lemon and cedary oak, with a long finish. Drink now through 2009. 1,810 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Durell Vineyard
review: Young, intense and tightly wound, with vibrant pear, citrus, anise and cedary oak flavors, picking up touches of vanilla and lemon on the long, complex finish. Drink now through 2006. 1,845 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Durell Vineyard
review: A smooth, ripe and harmonious Chardonnay that has rich and complex flavors of pear, hazelnut, honey and spice, following through to a smoky aftertaste. Try now. 2,758 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Durell Vineyard Sand Hill
review: Ripe and assertive, brimming with rich pear and apple notes, framed by toasty oak flavor. The finish is pretty with spicy pear and honey notes. Drinkable now.   2,857 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara Star Lane Vineyard
review: Subtle at first, featuring Key lime, nectarine and ruby grapefruit flavors that gain momentum, picking up floral highlights and notes of celery leaf and lemon zest on the finish. Smooth, with a balanced acidity. Drink now. 236 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Ynez Valley Camp 4 Vineyard
review: This presents a tight mix of dried dark berry, cedar, tobacco and spice, with touches of black licorice and anise, gaining depth and complexity on the finish. Drink now through . 320 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Santa Ynez Valley Camp 4 Vineyard
review: Crisp, sleek and focused, with plenty of pop to the lemon, green apple and grapefruit flavors, set on a sleek body, accented by hints of mineral and fresh herbs. Drink now. 249 cases made.

name: T'Aya Camp 4 Vineyard Santa Ynez Valley
review: Crisp lemon-lime flavors mingle with green apple and melon notes, offering a touch of fresh fennel and celery leaf on the finish, giving this an appealing green accent. Marsanne, Roussanne and Grenache Blanc. Drink now. 357 cases made.

name: Grenache Blanc Santa Ynez Valley Camp 4 Vineyard
review: Full-bodied, with broad spice, melon and citrus zest notes and a soft acidity, with a nutty finish. Drink now. 133 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Concerto Beckstoffer To Kalon Vineyard
review: Cedary dill-laced oak makes a strong presence, yet there's ample dried currant, sage, blueberry and plum notes that fold in, giving this depth and richness, if ending on a woody note. Best from 2009 through 2015. 100 cases made.

name: Moscato California
review: Juicy and crisp for a Moscato, with floral, spice and honey details, presenting a core of citrus and melon flavors. Drink now. 2,300 cases made.

name: Red California
review: A juicy, easygoing quaff, offering raspberry, spice and sassafras notes. Zinfandel, Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Petite Sirah. Drink now. 45,000 cases made.

name: White California
review: Medium-bodied, with peach, dried apricot and yellow apple notes that are pleasantly tangy and softly juicy. Chardonnay, Chenin Blanc and Gewürztraminer. Drink now. 15,000 cases made.

name: White Winemaker's Reserve California
review: Rich candied orange peel and ripe peach notes, with peppery details, have a soft acidity. Viognier, Moscato, Symphony and Sémillon. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Foxy White California
review: Pretty apricot, mango and spice aromas lead to rich and and toasty flavors that finish with a silky, oily texture. A catchall white blend dominated by Chenin Blanc and Chardonnay. Drink now through 2006. 4,000 cases made.

name: Syrah California
review: Pomegranate, roasted herb and black cherry flavors have lively structure, with earthy character. Drink now through 2006. 2,000 cases made.

name: Fumé Blanc California
review: Tough going, with white balsamic and clunky candied-fig flavors. 350 cases made.

name: Ice Wine Limited Release Niagara Peninsula
review: Seductive aromas of baked apples, nectarines and vanilla custard are followed by a medium-sweet, viscous texture with just enough acidity to keep it from being cloying. The soft, lush fruit flavors have lingering hints of white pepper and truffle at the edges. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Mother Of Invention Sierra Foothills
review: Ripe and juicy, with pear, melon and dried apricot flavors on a fleshy body, finishing with a refreshing note of lime juice. Crisp and zingy. Roussanne, Marsanne and Viognier. Drink now. 307 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Sonoma Valley The Family Secret Indian Springs Ranch
review: Orange zest and lime sherbet flavors are fresh and intense, lending an effusive quality that lingers throughout the finish. Drink now. 417 cases made.

name: Syrah Sonoma Valley The Inheritance Kivelstadt Vineyard
review: Distinctive and a bit untamed with grilled beef and licorice aromas and big but rustic smoky plum and peppered herb flavors that finish with dry tannins. Best after 2018. 250 cases made.

name: Rosé Twice Removed Venturi Vineyard Mendocino County
review: Floral apricot and watermelon scents pair with innocuous strawberry flavors. Carignane and Grenache. Drink now. 565 cases made.

name: New Zealand White
review: Deft, refined style emphasizes ripe pear and melon flavors at the center of a fresh, open-textured wine, with subtle spice and vanilla weaving through the long, generous finish. Chardonnay. Drink now through 2006. 3,700 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Nelson
review: Focused, with good intensity to a pretty burst of green pea, grass and lemon-lime flavors. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: The Big Mouth Calaveras County
review: Dense aromas of spice, wet clay and dried berry veer toward dryness. Simple yet pleasing. Syrah, Grenache and Mourvèdre. Drink now. 600 cases made.

name: Veltliner Alto Adige Valle Isarco Eichberg
review: Creamy and layered, this finely meshed white underscores the star fruit, yellow plum and kumquat notes with rich hints of creamed almond, petrol-tinged smoke and fleur de sel. Broad and mouthwatering on the finish. Drink now through 2018. 1,100 cases made.

name: Blauburgunder Alto Adige Bachgart
review: Light-bodied and snappy, this well-balanced red offers ripe black cherry, incense, dried herb, smoke and fresh earth notes. Spiced finish. Drink now through 2018. 1,250 cases made.

name: Weissburgunder Alto Adige
review: A crisp, lithe white, with a stony underpinning and a subtle range of crunchy white peach, sliced almond, ground ginger and verbena. Drink now through 2017. 15 cases imported.

name: Blauburgunder Alto Adige Bachgart Riserva
review: A well-knit red, with smoke and spice box accents to the flavors of steeped cherry, earth and singed orange peel. Offers a fresh finish of moderate length. Drink now through 2017. 400 cases made.

name: Riesling Eiswein Rheinhessen Niersteiner Bildstock
review: Beginning to reveal some mature character, this is smoky and minerally, with apricot and almond notes supported by vibrant acidity. It's lost some of the early fatness in texture, gaining complexity and terrific length. Drink now through 2010. 178 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Santa Cruz Mountains
review: Densely concentrated wine, with smoky, ripe plum aromas and flavors on the finish, yet balanced and supple enough to make it accessible now.

name: Riesling Eiswein Rheinhessen Niersteiner Bildstock
review: Still very young, this bright, fruity wine marries peach and lemon flavors with moderate sweetness and vibrant acidity. Not a sugarbowl, it's very fresh and taut . Try now.

name: Grauburgunder Beerenauslese Rheinhessen Niersteiner Spiegelberg
review: Showing some maturity, this has lost its overt sweetness to complex marmalade, spice and woodsy flavors. Supported by bracing acidity, it combines freshness and mature flavors. A good match for foie gras or blue cheese. Drink now through 2004. 275 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Santa Cruz Mountains
review: Massive, intense and tannic, with rich bell pepper, olive and currant flavors that ring true. It's a deep, powerful, oaky wine that will require years to reach full maturity, but if you're patient this could be a hummer.

name: Müller-Thurgau Kabinett Trocken Rheinhessen Niersteiner Spiegelberg
review: A serious, dry Müller-Thurgau. It's a rich wine with nice, concentrated fruit flavors and a lingering finish. Appealing aromas of bread dough and apples. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Santa Cruz Mountains
review: A spicy, cedary style, with ample ripe berry and plum flavors that turn astringent and tannic on the finish, where the fruit comes through. Try after 1996. 500 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Rheinhessen Niersteiner Schloss Schwabsburg
review: Soft, fruity and easy to drink, this Riesling smells and tastes ripe and appley, with hints of honey and melon. Smooth in texture, clean and uncomplicated on the finish.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Santa Cruz Mountains
review: Strong smoke and tobacco aromas make this wine taste almost like ash instead of fruit, lending a bitter flavor that nearly obscures a modest core of currant and berry flavors. Best after 1997. Much better than bottles tasted earlier.

name: Riesling Kabinett Rheinhessen Niersteiner Bildstock
review: Enticing peachy, floral aromas give way to a crisp and appealing Riesling. Seems dry, but still fairly concentrated. A nice apple note runs throughout this wine, and it has a nice clean finish.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Santa Cruz Mountains
review: Deep and dark in color, it turns earthy and mulchy on the palate with unripe Cabernet flavors and a dose of bad oak. Misses the mark.

name: Riesling Spätlese Rheinhessen Niersteiner Rehbach
review: A light but decent Riesling with enough crisp apple and grapefruit flavors to give it life. Balanced toward the lean, tart side, but still enjoyable.

name: Kerner Spätlese Rheinhessen Niersteiner Olberg
review: An appealing, floral-flavored wine with a bit of sweetness balanced by good acidity. Fairly simple but enjoyable.

name: Riesling Beerenauslese Rheinhessen Niersteiner Bildstock
review: Soft honey, smoky and caramel notes are still clean and tasty in this round wine. It's not particularly sweet, but has presence on the palate, and finishes with a pleasant light bitter note.

name: Riesling Kabinett Halbtrocken Rheinhessen Niersteiner Bildstock
review: This is tart, taut and Teutonic. Austere to the point of being difficult to like. Only for fans of a very lean, tart style. Thin on flavor.

name: Vin de Constance Constantia
review: Intense, with dried orange peel, nectarine, apricot and kumquat notes laced with a vibrant green tea edge. The long finish picks up a bitter almond hint for added tension, while the unctuous fruit sails through. This is still very youthful and densely packed, so no rush at all. Muscat de Frontignan. Drink now through 2040. 200 cases made.

name: Vin de Constance Constantia
review: Rich and unctuous, yet superbly racy, this offers a gorgeous panoply of dried apricot, fig, mango and quince flavors, underscored by a lively blood orange note and backed by a long, ginger- and green teafilled finish. Youthfully tight, this should cruise for some time in the cellar. Muscat de Frontignan. Best from 2016 through 2030. 2,500 cases made.

name: Vin de Constance Constantia
review: Gorgeous, featuring a core of creamed peach, persimmon, maple and nectarine notes inlaid with flashes of green tea, dried papaya and mango. Lush and refined, with accents of blood orange and mouthwatering spice echoing on the finish. Muscat de Frontignan. Drink now through 2020. 300 cases imported.

name: Vin de Constance Constantia
review: This is gorgeous from the start, proffering sweet but precise tangerine, nectarine and clementine fruit flavors laced with date, orange blossom and green tea notes. Long and pure through the finish, with a lingering echo of bitter orange. The track record for this wine keeps getting better. Drink now through 2020. 400 cases imported.

name: Vin de Constance Constantia
review: Ripe and unctuous, but steely too, with mirabelle plum, apricot, kumquat and quince flavors racing along, enlivened by green tea and ginger accents through the very lengthy finish. Muscat de Frontignan. Drink now through 2033. 2,000 cases made.

name: Vin de Constance Constantia
review: This offers a wide range of blood orange marmalade, apricot, peach and mango notes all tightly stitched together but unfurling steadily through the opulent finish, picking up nectarine, kumquat and ginger notes. And then there's a racy feel echoing at the very end, giving this lovely lift. A beauty. Muscat de Frontignan. Drink now through 2035. 350 cases made.

name: Vin de Constance Constantia
review: Gorgeous apricot, warmed peach, dried mango and maple notes lead the way in this unctuous dessert wine, with crystalized ginger, green tea and dried blood orange flavors filling in through the finish. Has enough well-embedded acidity to carry it all easily, finishing with impressive range and cut. Drink now through 2030. 2,950 cases made.

name: Vin de Constance Constantia
review: Pure orange peel, tangerine, persimmon and clementine flavors are laced with hints of green tea, candied lime peel and honeysuckle. Rich, but racy and mouthwatering. The gorgeous amber color and a caressing mouthfeel just add to the pleasure. Lovely precision. Should age nicely. Drink now through 2023. 3,004 cases made.

name: Vin de Constance Constantia
review: Superfocused, with racy, mouthwatering acidity, this has extra layers of delicious tangerine, peach cobbler, orange peel, green tea and quince that course through the very lengthy finish.--Non-blind Vin de Constance vertical (2010). Drink now through 2025. 2,537 cases made.

name: Vin de Constance Constantia
review: This has put on some weight, with butter pecan and maple notes now moving in on the orange peel, clove, quince and fig flavors. Long and lush on the finish, with the acidity nicely buried.--Non-blind Vin de Constance vertical (2010). Drink now through 2020. 1,788 cases made.

name: Vin de Constance Constantia
review: This dessert wine is loaded from the get-go, with mango, blood orange, smoke, persimmon, ginger, date and fig flavors, all on a burnished texture supported by well-imbedded acidity. Superlong finish. Gorgeous. Late harvest Muscat de Frontignan. Drink now through 2010. 1,049 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Constantia Perdeblokke
review: Delicious, with a mouthwatering edge to the lemon granita, white peach, straw and yellow apple flavors. Offers a chiseled feel through the finish despite the obvious weight. This solid version may benefit from some aging. Drink now through 2015. 300 cases made.

name: Vin de Constance Constantia
review: Sweet and rich, but also superracy, with fresh-cut tangerine, orange and nectarine flavors, backed by bright acidity and a long, lingering finish of spice, orange zest and heather honey. Hard to resist now, but should age wonderfully. Muscat de Frontignan. Drink now through 2017. 1,665 cases made.

name: Vin de Constance Constantia
review: Viscous but lively in texture, this has layers of orange peel, maple, crème brûlée, green tea and quince paste flavors that stay tightly knit through the lengthy finish. An excellent dessert wine that is quietly putting together an enviable track record. Muscat de Frontignan. Drink now through 2015. 1,776 cases made.

name: Vin de Constance Constantia
review: The lovely apricot, crème brûlée and orange marmalade notes will reel you in, while the unctuous texture and long, riveting finish will keep you there. An outstanding dessert wine for cellaring. Late harvest Muscat de Frontignan. Drink now through 2008.

name: Vin de Constance Constantia
review: This has the color of dark iced tea, with a burnished edge to the maple, clove, date, green tea and mulled spice notes all laced with tangy acidity and a long, incense-infused finish. Clearly maturing in its flavor profile, but still with plenty of zip.--Non-blind Vin de Constance vertical (2010). Drink now through 2014. 1,036 cases made.

name: Vin de Constance Constantia
review: This has a gorgeous, clear maple color, with delightful date, golden raisin, dried quince, fig and bitter orange notes laced with hints of Meyer lemon and persimmon. There's nice taut focus on the finish, with a hint of chamomile flower lingering at the end.--Non-blind Vin de Constance vertical (2010). Drink now through 2014. 1,197 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Constantia
review: A creamy, mature edge takes over in this lovely white, letting melon, sweet butter and lemon curd notes glide through, with a pretty echo of jasmine through the finish. Very suave. Drink now. 240 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Constantia Blocks 361 & 372
review: A racy, pure style, showing a chiseled edge to the mix of verbena, lime pith, white asparagus and fleur de sel flavors, followed by a long, vibrant finish. If you prefer it more mellow, this has the substance to age a bit in the cellar. Drink now through 2019. 750 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Constantia Perdeblokke
review: This has alluring aromas of white peach and straw out front, followed by white asparagus, gooseberry and thyme notes. The long, chiseled finish should unwind with modest cellaring. Drink now through 2017. 150 cases made.

name: Vin de Constance Constantia
review: Dark fig in color, with a green rim, this looks and drinks like a Sercial Madeira at the moment. Fully mature, with alluring incense, toffee, date and Christmas pudding notes allied to a racy, fine-grained palate. This has nice minerality, with black tea and incense notes extending through the tangy finish. Showing more acidity than sweetness now, this may be a bit taut for some, but there's still plenty of complexity.--Non-blind Vin de Constance vertical (2010). Drink now.

name: Constantia Red
review: A ripe, polished style, with a suave core of currant, cherry and plum confiture notes inlaid with light mocha and singed vanilla notes. Enticing through the finish, in a fruit-forward way. Cabernet Sauvignon, Malbec, Petit Verdot and Shiraz. Drink now through 2020. 5,000 cases made.

name: Constantia Red
review: Dark in profile, with a charcoal frame around steeped plum, fig and black currant fruit flavors that give way to bittersweet cocoa, mint and smoldering tobacco notes on the finish. For fans of the old-school style. Cabernet Sauvignon, Petit Verdot and Malbec. Drink now through 2018. 3,400 cases made.

name: Marlbrook Constantia
review: Gorgeous. Full of lavish oak shadings that display coffee, tobacco and vanilla to augment the black cherry and plum. Concentrated, intense and beautifully balanced, with a long finish.  Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Drink now through 2004.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Constantia Perdeblokke
review: Tightly coiled, with verbena, white asparagus and tarragon notes weaving around a core of lemon curd. Reveals a light paraffin echo on the finish. Let this unwind a bit. Drink now through 2018. 670 cases made.

name: Vin de Constance Constantia
review: Offers a lovely amber color, with blood orange, bitter almond, clove, green tea and dried persimmon notes backed by a noticeably spicy Muscat hint on the finish. More rustic and broader than the other vintages, and not quite as deep or long.--Non-blind Vin de Constance vertical (2010). Drink now through 2017. 2,425 cases made.

name: Constantia Red
review: Pleasantly grippy, with a charcoal frame around the core of macerated black currant, blackberry and bitter plum notes. Buried savory and mint accents line the finish, with the charcoal edge adding texture and length. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Malbec, Shiraz and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2017. 1,350 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Constantia
review: Racy, chiseled style, with straw, lemon zest and mineral notes that crackle all the way through the tangy, herb-tinged finish. Drink now. 16,665 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Constantia
review: Nice focus here, with lemon peel, straw, peach, floral and chalk notes on a pure, racy frame. Concentrated, brisk and lively. Very solid.10 percent Sémillon. Drink now through 2004. 10,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Constantia
review: Focused black currant, mineral and cedar notes run through this medium-weight Cabernet, with the mineral and fruit lingering on the finish. Vibrant, but elegant, with nice length. Drink now through 2004. 6,800 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Constantia
review: Brooding nose of cocoa and sanguine notes, with dark currant and cassis on the palate. Not quite as supple on the finish as the best South African Cabs, but very solid. Drink now through 2004. 4,500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Constantia
review: Shows a lot of toast while also letting the pure fig and quince flavors come through. Juicy, but elegant finish. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Marlbrook Constantia
review: Shows coffee and chocolate aromas, with dark currant flavor and an herbal hint underneath. Supple texture, with a pretty cedar note on the finish. Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Drink now through 2003. 3,200 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Constantia
review: Focused, with Key lime, white asparagus and mâche notes backed by a light echo of shortbread through the fresh, racy finish. Drink now through 2018. 25,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Constantia
review: A brisk-edged version, with citrus peel, white peach and gooseberry notes zipping along. The finish is a bit quick, but this displays good cut and a refreshing feel overall. Drink now. 15,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Constantia
review: Focused, with a core of citrus peel and tarragon notes and a bright, racy finish. Drink now. 23,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Constantia
review: Pretty combination of lush lime, lemon curd and straw flavors, with firm, steely acidity and a minerally, balanced finish. Contains 10 percent Sémillon. Drink now through 2005. 12,800 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Constantia Noble Late Harvest
review: Not much Sauvignon Blanc character, but this is piquant and full of orange marmalade, backed by vibrant acidity and a rich texture. Not too sweet, it has a long citrus-preserve finish. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Constantia
review: Mature and elegant, with supple dried currant and black cherry flavors and cedar and coffee notes. Firm, focused finish still has flesh. For fans of the style. Drink now through 2003. 5,900 cases made.

name: Marlbrook Constantia
review: Winy and distinct, with sanguine cedar and vanilla aromas and dried currant, cocoa and mineral flavors. Taut, Old World style that's a bit shy on pure fruit, but still tasty. Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Drink now through 2004. 5,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Constantia
review: Nice weight here, with straw, lemon zest and pink grapefruit flavors that run along to a juicy finish. Contains 10 percent Sémillon. Drink now through 2003. 19,000 cases made.

name: Marlbrook Constantia
review: Shows its cool origins, with mint and smoked bell pepper aromas, followed by supple black currant and black cherry fruit. Tobacco-tinged finish leaves a firm impression, but the green notes may be a bit much for some. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2005. 3,500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Constantia
review: Forward, with lemon curd and straw notes giving way to peach and wax hints on the finish. Drink now. 350 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Constantia
review: Austere and herbal, this Cabernet also offers concentration, intensity, coffee, black currant and vanilla flavors to the sinewy framework. Has personality. Drink now through 2002.

name: Chardonnay Constantia
review: Pronounced matchstick aroma, with apple, fig, toast and candied lemon peel flavors. Still has life on the finish, despite its age. Drink now. 3,450 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Constantia
review: Mature, showing candied apple and spice elements combined with a bright, elegant structure. Drink now.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Constantia
review: Big, bold and exotic, delivering passion fruit, clove and cardamom flavors on a loosely knit structure. The finish lacks a little focus. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay Constantia
review: Quite mature, with a matchstick note on the nose and a hint of earth running through the wax and lemon curd notes. Drink now. 2,550 cases made.

name: Riesling Constantia
review: Modest lime and mineral notes. Crisp finish. Drink now. 200 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Constantia
review: Shy on the nose, with a hint of grapefruit on the palate. Clean, but short finish. Drink now. 15,000 cases made.

name: Mme. Marlbrook Constantia
review: Soft, with an odd mix of herb and tangerine notes that don't mesh. Sémillon, Chardonnay, Sauvignon and Muscat de Frontignan. 200 cases imported.

name: Cinsaut-Cabernet Sauvignon Paarl
review: A light, rather crisp-textured red wine with little tannin and fresh, jammy fruit flavors. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Paarl Red
review: A very light red, with charming strawberry and cherry flavors. Best served chilled, like a rosé. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Pinotage Paarl
review: A rather light red, almost like Pinot Noir, with fresh cherry flavors and lively texture. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Paarl
review: A good, straightforward Cab with earthy, fruity flavors and moderate tannins. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Paarl White
review: A fresh, simple white wine with modest fruit flavors and a soft texture. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Steen Paarl
review: A simple white wine with apple and citrus flavors, finishing on a nice grapefruity note. 10,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Paarl
review: A very light, almost watery Chardonnay with simple flavors and a short finish. 5,000 cases made.

name: Pinotage Stellenbosch
review: Light and flavorful, offering an interesting array of flavors, hitting black cherry, plum and cedar notes. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Stellenbosch Granite Selection Cape Winemakers Guild
review: A sleek, tangy, mineral-driven style, with prominent sanguine and iron notes that hold the damson plum, black cherry and red currant fruit together while sage and olive hints line the finish. Shows good cut and drive. Best from 2016 through 2019. 33 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Stellenbosch Granite Selection Cape Winemakers Guild
review: Tobacco leaf and tar notes framing the mulled spice, black currant and braised fig flavors in this rock-solid Cab. The long, rich finish lets the tobacco edge linger nicely. Drink now through 2014. 50 cases made.

name: Three Expressions Cape Winemakers Guild Stellenbosch
review: A gentle, perfumy style, with a hint of maturity to the cinnamon and mocha notes, melding into a core of lightly mulled plum, blackberry and raspberry fruit. A cinnamon edge lingers on the finish. Drink now. 100 cases made.

name: Shiraz-Grenache-Viognier Western Cape
review: This offers bitter cherry and damson plum fruit, lined with hints of anise and singed savory. Light-bodied but fresh. Drink now. 5,500 cases made.

name: Tamboerskloof Red Stellenbosch
review: Ripe and lush, with a racy edge adding to the plum compote, raspberry puree and kirsch notes, imparting lift and focus through the anise-accented finish. Shows modest toast throughout. A nice display of fruit. Syrah. Drink now through 2021. 3,000 cases made.

name: Tamboerskloof Red Stellenbosch
review: A fresh, elegant style, with black tea and incense notes leading the way for flavors of supple red and black cherry preserves, bergamot and plum. Stays polished and friendly through the finish, delivering a hint of sanguine. Syrah. Drink now through 2015. 4,100 cases made.

name: Tamboerskloof White Stellenbosch
review: A friendly, forward style, with pear and peach notes liberally laced with fennel and apricot hints. Juicy finish. Viognier. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: White Riesling Lake Erie Ohio
review: Clean and easy, with peach and almond notes and a fresh finish. Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Pinot Grigio Lake Erie Ohio
review: Shows the grape's typical spice and floral notes, with a clean, light-weight finish. Drink now. 100 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Lake Erie Ohio
review: Some red and black cherry fruit, with an herbal hint coming in on the slightly tart finish. Drink now. 100 cases made.

name: Delaware Lake Erie Ohio Ice Wine
review: Canned peach aroma, followed by sweet fruit-cocktail flavors, though an honest apricot note comes in on the finish for balance. Drink now. 200 cases made.

name: Syrah Lodi Farráh
review: A big, rich, full-bodied and expressive mix of spicy, beefy flavors, this deeply fruited Syrah flirts with berry jam yet gains depth and sophistication. Drink now through 2022. 5,000 cases made.

name: Syrah Lodi Farrah
review: Smooth, rich and complex, showing tiers of ripe plum, blackberry and wild berry, with notable cedary dill- and vanilla-laced oak. But this is very nicely proportioned, ending with a long, lingering finish. Drink now through 2015. 3,500 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Lodi Old Vine Marisa Vineyard
review: Ripe, burly and jammy, this Zin carries it all off with a dense backbone of crisp acidity and muscular tannins. Offers notes of blackberry cobbler, licorice and toasty caramel. Drink now through 20120. 300 cases made.

name: Petite Sirah Lodi
review: Very toasty, with a smoky air to the cedar and mahogany aromas, framing the firm yet plump flavors of dark berry and plum. Spice box, tobacco and nutmeg details gain momentum on the finish. Drink now through 2030. 780 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Lodi Old Ghost Old Vine
review: Lots of character in this hearty, rustic style. Deeply concentrated, with intensity and generous texture to a distinctive medley of pomegranate, cola, toasty rye and wild cherry flavors. Finishes with mouthcoating tannins that have a supple quality. Drink now through 2009. 1,500 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Lodi Old Vine
review: This should appeal to fans of intensely ripe and jammy Zinfandels. The aromas of raisin and charred spice lead to zesty, slightly hot flavors baked cherry, tar and licorice. Drink now through 2018. 32,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Lodi Old Vine Marisa Vineyard
review: A ripe bruiser with a sense of focus, offering aromas of dried cherry and licorice and brooding flavors of dark berry, herb and smoky cracked pepper. Tannins frame the finish. Drink now through 2024. 985 cases made.

name: Rosé Lodi
review: Crisp and lively, with appealing flavors of strawberry, raspberry and spice. Grenache, Carignane, Syrah and Mourvèdre. Drink now. 3,040 cases made.

name: Syrah Lodi Farrah
review: A ripe and showy Syrah, with aromas of raspberry jam and toasty oak that lead to dense flavors of dried cherry, smoky meat and licorice. Drink now through 2019. 6,500 cases made.

name: Syrah Lodi Farráh
review: Notably oaky, offering dill, caramel and toasty oak flavors, with a woody character that doesn't diminish the complex mix of flavors. Full-bodied, with ample plum, black and wild berry notes that stand up to the oak in a good way. Drink now through 2016. 3,600 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Lodi Marisa Vineyard Old Vine
review: Aromas of bay leaf and dried plum lead to big yet soft flavors of dried cherry and pepper. Drink now through 2019. 800 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Lodi Marisa Vineyard Old Vine
review: For fans of big and superripe Zinfandel, this offers aromas of dried cherry and jalapeño, with blowsy flavors of warm raspberry and toasted herbs. Drink now through 2018. 690 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Lodi Old Ghost Old Vine
review: Bold baked cherry and toasty oak aromas open to zesty, ripe dried berry, pepper and smoky anise flavors. Tannins harden the finish. Drink now through 2021. 5,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Lodi Old Vine
review: Dusty raspberry and spice aromas pair with ripe flavors of dried cherry, black licorice and jerky. Drink now through 2018. 37,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Lodi Old Vine
review: A dense, muscular expression of Zinfandel. Gobs of blackberry and wild berry fruit, vanilla, spice and a hint of pepper are persistent. Drink now through 2005. 1,648 cases made.

name: Syrah Lodi Farráh
review: Pushes ripe berry and cherry flavors to a candied edge, with cola and cedar notes and a zesty, herbal tea edge. Elegant, with good concentration and firm tannins. Drink now through 2014. 2,500 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Lodi Old Ghost Old Vine
review: Rich and superripe, with powerful notes of prune, licorice and pepper. Drink now through 2020. 5,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Lodi Old Ghost Old Vine
review: A hulk of a wine. This is ripe, dark and brooding, jammed with notes of raisin, roasted anise, mineral and herb. Best after 2014. 1,500 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Lodi Old Vine
review: Bold licorice and dried cherry aromas lead to zesty, easygoing plum and peppery herb flavors. Drink now through 2021. 50,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Lodi Old Vine
review: Superripe and loaded with licorice and pepper notes, plus blueberry and raisin. Drink now. 21,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Lodi Old Vine
review: Big and ripe, with a lingering sweetness, but remains appealing for its berry pie aromas and supple, spicy cherry and blackberry flavors. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Lodi Old Ghost Old Vine
review: Ripe as cherry pie, with spicy vanilla notes and sweet-tart boysenberry, charred oak and fresh herb flavors. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Lodi Old Ghost Old Vine
review: Dense and intense, with ultraripe dried cherry, licorice and cracked pepper aromas and stout blueberry and lead pencil flavors that finish with gritty, minerally tannins. Best from 2008 through 2013. 1,365 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Lodi Old Vine
review: Offers savory aromas, almost beef jerky, with rustic, sweet-and-sour cherry, smoke and cracked pepper flavors. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Lodi Old Vine
review: Intense and ultraripe, with dried cherry, spice and tobacco accents. Has good complexity but the flavors are gripped by lean, gritty tannins. Best after 2007. 2,800 cases made.

name: Albariño Lodi
review: Fresh hay and dried chamomile notes mingle with citrus and lime zest flavors and slightly coarse acidity. Drink now. 1,460 cases made.

name: Grenache Blanc Lodi
review: Tangy stone fruit and citrus flavors are juicy, butting up against a spicy, cedary side. Offers a slightly waxy note on the finish. Drink now. 350 cases made.

name: Rosé Bricks & Roses Lodi
review: Easygoing and a bit simple, with hints of orange zest and dried cherry. Grenache, Carignane, Syrah and Mourvèdre. Drink now. 4,200 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Lodi Marisa Vineyard Old Vine
review: Quite ripe and rather raisiny, with accents of licorice, herb and pepper. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Lodi Old Vine
review: Superripe, with distinct flavors of raisin, licorice and herb. Drink now. 50,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Lodi Old Vine
review: Jammy and overripe, with notes of prune, dried cherry and caramel. Drink now. 32,000 cases made.

name: Rosé Lodi
review: Easygoing but muted, with hints of strawberry and dried herb. Carignane, Grenache, Mourvèdre and Syrah. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Syrah Lodi Farráh
review: Quite dense and chewy, with notes of dried cherry, grilled herb and spice. Best after 2017. 6,500 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Lodi Old Vine
review: Offers modest dried cherry, fresh herb and spice notes. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Lodi Old Vine
review: Pushes the envelope of ripeness, with bold aromas of plum, raisin and licorice that lead to intense black currant and tobacco flavors that finish with firm, drying tannins. Best from 2008 through 2011. 10,000 cases made.

name: Syrah Lodi Farráh
review: Tangy and firm, with wild berry, sauerkraut and herb flavors wrapped in brawny, green-edged tannins. 400 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Lodi Old Vine
review: Full-bodied and ripe, showings lots of prune aromas and flavors. 24,000 cases made.

name: Weissburgunder Kabinett Neusiedlersee
review: Clean and fresh, with apple, citrus and almond flavors on a light-bodied frame. Good as an apéritif. Drink now.

name: Weissburgunder Kabinett Trocken Burgenland
review: Dry and spicy yet rich in texture, filling out the apple, pastry and nut flavors nicely. Balanced on the soft side. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now.

name: Weissburgunder Kabinett Trocken Burgenland
review: Richly textured and sporting concentrated apple and pear flavors, with a hint of apple skin adding structure and a slight astringency on the finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland
review: Has an herbal aroma, with plummy flavors and a crisp finish. Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Drink now.

name: Weissburgunder Kabinett Trocken Burgenland
review: This has modest apple and citrus flavors, with some canned fruit notes on the finish. Drink now.

name: Weissburgunder Kabinett Trocken Burgenland
review: Fresh and juicy, offering peach, apricot and a hint of orange on a vibrant frame. An ideal aperitif. Drink now. 1,500 cases imported.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Neusiedlersee-Hügelland Rot 97
review: Soft and supple, showing leafy black currant aromas and flavors. Overall a bit diffuse, lacking focus on the finish. Cabernet Sauvignon and Blaufränkisch. Drink now. 4,485 cases made.

name: Weissburgunder Kabinett Neusiedlersee
review: Austere and linear, with a hint of cat's pee to the grassy flavor, ending crisply. 1,080 cases made.

name: Weissburgunder Kabinett Trocken Neusiedlersee
review: Lean and crisp, showing apple and lemon flavors that tail off quickly. 2,600 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Blaufränkisch Neusiedlersee-Hügelland Siegendorf
review: Stewed flavors of plum and herbs don't add up to much. Finishes on an astringent note.   1,073 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Vin de Pays d'Oc Sélection des Grands Chais
review: A lively, well-rounded white with fresh acidity and ripe melon and peach flavors. It's soft and clean. 4,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay-Sauvignon Blanc Vin de Pays d'Oc Selection des Grands Chais
review: Combines ample fruit flavors and a fairly rich texture for a solid, straightforward character. 4,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot Vin de Pays d'Oc Selection des Grands Chais
review: A kiss of sweet oak flavor lends some appeal to a basically lean and mature red. 4,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay-Sauvignon Blanc Vin de Pays d'Oc Séléction des Grands Chais
review: The bottle mimics the Empire State Building, but the wine fails to reach its heights. It's ripe and soft, with floral and melon flavors that turn slightly cloying on the finish. 4,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot Vin de Pays d'Oc Selection des Grands Chais
review: This is thin and herbal, with modest dill and dried cherry flavors. A touch of richness, but overall tired and over-the-hill. 4,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Vin de Pays d'Oc Selection des Grands Chais
review: Tough and tannic, with earthy aromas. The modest plum and berry flavors are quickly overwhelmed by earthiness and astringency. 4,000 cases made.

name: Brut Albemarle County New World
review: Soft candy apple and brioche flavors with a floral finish. Nice medium-weight mousse. Drink now. 423 cases made.

name: Brut Albemarle County SP
review: Plump sparkler, with apple and pineapple notes followed by a pillowy finish. Drink now. 800 cases made.

name: New World Red Albemarle County
review: This has modest flesh behind slightly candied red and black cherry fruit. Hint of cocoa on the finish. Drink now. 2,260 cases made.

name: Viognier Albemarle County
review: Hanging on, with a buttery edge framing the apple and piecrust notes. A dash of clove moves in on the finish. Hurry. Drink now. 426 cases made.

name: New World Red Albemarle County
review: Simple candied cherry flavor turns a touch cloying. Dusty tannins on the finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. 1,130 cases made.

name: New World White Albemarle County
review: Hits your nose like rubbing alcohol. Tastes like lime-flavored MD 20/20. Chardonnay. Or so they say. 189 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes
review: This white lets its pear, quince and white peach flavors play out, with a flash of salted butter on the creamy, slightly off-dry finish. Drink now through 2014. 435 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Dry
review: Well-focused, with a pure, racy core of white peach, salted butter, blanched almond and talc notes. The white peach edge holds sway on the finish. Drink now through 2015. 401 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes
review: Stylish, with jasmine, peach and almond notes backed by a tangy edge of apple on the medium-weight finish. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Dry
review: A ripe style, offering a caressing feel to the melon, peach and yellow apple fruit flavors. A hint of almond runs through the finish. A crowd-pleaser. Drink now. 302 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Dry
review: A bracing style, with lime, slate and fennel notes and a mouthwatering finish. Drink now through 2013. 250 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Dry
review: Nice purity, with a crisp lime edge backed by slate and green apple notes that linger on the chiseled finish. Drink now. 307 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Finger Lakes
review: On the leafy side of the spectrum, with tobacco and olive notes holding sway over the red- and black-cherry fruit. Good energy and freshness, but best for fans of the herbal side of Cab Franc. Drink now. 148 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Cayuga Lake Dry
review: Fresh and light overall, with forward lychee and watermelon notes, and a hint of rose water on the finish. Drink now. 121 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Cayuga Lake Semi-Dry
review: Moderately juicy, with an off-dry edge to the mix of McIntosh apple, ginger and apricot flavors that hang a little loosely on the open-knit finish. Drink now. 125 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes
review: A frankly off-dry style, offering pear, creamed apple and apricot notes that carry through the rounded finish. A little shy on zip, but the open, flattering feel will win this fans. Drink now. 301 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes
review: A very plump, forward style, with McIntosh apple, melon and fig notes, followed by a round, open-knit finish. Drink now. 297 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Dry
review: Offers light jasmine and lime notes, with a dry, talc-lined finish. Drink now. 448 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Dry
review: Fresh, with jasmine and melon notes backed by a hint of slate on the pure, focused finish. Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Vignoles Finger Lakes Late Harvest
review: Luscious late-harvest wine with an earthy, mushroomy aroma that segues to nut, honey and subtle apricot flavors on the palate. The nuances linger on the finish, too. Drink now. 150 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Finger Lakes
review: Ripe, with a nice, rounded core of plum and black currant backed by modest toast and coffee. Solid finish. Drink now through 2010. 149 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Finger Lakes Barrel Reserve
review: This gentle, fresh style offers a light-bodied mix of yellow and green apple fruit, leading to a nice, unadorned finish. Drink now. 193 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Finger Lakes Barrel Reserve
review: Bright, showing nice melon, pear and fig notes backed by modest toast, with a round, lingering finish. Drink now. 210 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Cayuga Lake Dry
review: Lively, with pink grapefruit, almond and orange blossom notes. Lightly spicy, open-knit finish. Drink now. 96 cases made.

name: Riesling Cayuga Lake Semi-Dry
review: Moderate sweetness carries the McIntosh apple and fig notes, with a touch of lime on the medium-weight finish. Drink now.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Dry
review: Open-knit for a dry style, with green apple and pear notes backed by a light twinge of lime on the finish. Drink now. 400 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Finger Lakes
review: Mature already, showing a lightly roasted edge to the plum and cherry fruit, with hints of tobacco and brown sugar. This is good, though surprisingly advanced already. Drink now. 96 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Finger Lakes Barrel Reserve
review: Good bracing green apple and pear notes, with a fresh, tangy finish. Drink now. 98 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Cayuga Lake Dry Sunrise Hill Vineyard
review: A light, almost brisk style, with lime, pippin apple and slate notes that have zip, but lack some weight through the finish. Drink now. 107 cases made.

name: Riesling Cayuga Lake Dry
review: Modest lime and green apple notes, with a bony finish. Drink now. 218 cases made.

name: Riesling Cayuga Lake Dry
review: Seems a touch off-dry, with moderate intensity to the lime and green apple fruit. Spice and butter notes on the finish. Drink now. 200 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes
review: Light, with an off-dry feel to the modest peach, pear and floral notes. Open-knit finish. Drink now. 400 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Dry
review: A good, brisk style, with kiwifruit and Key lime notes that leave a mouthwatering feel. Not big, but lively. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Cayuga Lake Barrel Reserve
review: Smoky, with medium-weight apple and toast and a spicy finish. Drink now. 272 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Finger Lakes
review: This light, crisp style shows a tangy note of yellow apple, backed by a floral edge. Drink now. 193 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Cayuga Lake Sunrise Hill Vineyard Dry
review: Light and crisp for a Gewürztraminer, offering brisk lime and apple notes, with a hint of lychee on the quick finish. Drink now. 104 cases made.

name: Riesling Cayuga Lake Dry
review: Moderate peach and floral notes, with an easy finish. Drink now. 396 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes
review: A friendly, off-dry style, with light-hearted candied lime peel and peach notes. Open-knit. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Dry
review: Shows a hint of maturity, with a petrol note checking in on the apple and green melon flavors. Has a round, easy finish. Drink now. 315 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Finger Lakes
review: Lightly crisp, with cherry fruit and a dash of raisin toast. Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Finger Lakes
review: Light-bodied, with a mix of cherry, plum and tobacco notes that lose some focus on the finish. Drink now. 160 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Finger Lakes
review: Light cherry and pomegranate notes lead to a flash of cedar on the finish. Drink now. 187 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Cayuga Lake Semi-Dry Sunrise Hill Vineyard
review: Light-bodied and open, with modest lime, pear and green almond hints, followed by a clean but short finish. Drink now. 109 cases made.

name: Merlot New York
review: Easy black cherry and spice notes up front, with a slightly firm finish. Drink now.

name: Riesling Cayuga Lake Dry
review: Light lime, floral and peach notes, with a moderate finish. Drink now. 296 cases made.

name: Sangiovese Cayuga Lake
review: Light, with a leafy edge behind the soft, lightly muddled cherry and red currant fruit. The finish is clean and rounded. Drink now. 71 cases made.

name: Gewürztraminer Cayuga Lake Semi-Dry Sunrise Hill Vineyard
review: Very light, with an off-dry hint to the green apple and watermelon notes. Clean, but shy on depth. Drink now. 117 cases made.

name: Meritage Finger Lakes
review: Very light, with muddled watermelon and cherry notes, showing a hint of cinnamon on the finish. Cabernet Franc, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now. 120 cases made.

name: Vignoles Cayuga Lake Estate Grown
review: Frankly sweet, with fruit cocktail flavors that manage to stay fresh enough on the finish. Perhaps this is best as a base for punch. Drink now. 600 cases made.

name: Merlot Finger Lakes
review: Light and tart, showing damson plum and pomegranate flavors, with a hint of sour cherry on the loosely knit finish. 197 cases made.

name: Sangiovese Finger Lakes
review: Shows basic, light-bodied cherry fruit, with a hint of vanilla on the finish. 257 cases made.

name: White Cabernet Franc Finger Lakes Rosé
review: Slightly cloying strawberry fruit is backed by a lightly earthy tobacco edge. Awkward. 163 cases made.

name: Brut Finger Lakes
review: An extremely doughy aroma and flavor makes this difficult to appreciate at first. But it turns more appealing as you sip. Crisp, appley. 350 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Cayuga Lake
review: Rather crisp, with an overt herb and pine profile holding sway over modest cherry and cranberry fruit. 175 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Cayuga Lake
review: Quite light, with red cherry and strawberry flavors and a faint hint of toast. Washed-out finish.

name: Chardonnay Cayuga Lake Barrel Reserve
review: Canned peach and lime notes quickly turn dilute. 200 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Finger Lakes
review: Very diffuse, with only some faint candied lime flavor hinting at vinous origins. 555 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Finger Lakes Barrel Fermented
review: The spicy, nutmeg and cinnamon flavors don't mesh well with the green apple and pineapple notes in this light-bodied, tart wine. Has pleasing elements, but lacks harmony. 560 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Finger Lakes
review: Tart cranberry flavors and a hint of spice, but a strong vegetal note dominates its aroma. Tight, tannic and verging on lean. 400 cases made.

name: Riesling Cayuga Lake Semi-Dry
review: Touch of sweetness, but it sits apart from the flinty, green apple notes for a slightly disjointed presentation. Has an odd malted note on the finish too. 298 cases made.

name: Vignoles Cayuga Lake
review: Broad and a touch flabby, with peach, maple and apple cider notes.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Cayuga Lake
review: More like a dark rosé in color, with a vegetal nose, this offers little fruit. Dilute finish.

name: Lemberger Cayuga Lake
review: Fading already, with washed out cherry and rhubarb notes and a wispy finish. 47 cases made.

name: Prism Finger Lakes
review: A very deep-colored, aromatic, tannic and tart red wine that smells like Port and tastes like cider. It doesn't have the stuffing of flavor to measure up to the color and aroma, though.

name: Riesling Cayuga Lake
review: Very sweet and sugary in flavor, without much fruit except for some lemon and green apple that doesn't blend in well. This is awkward—tart and cloying at the same time. 400 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes
review: A mix of herb and peach flavors that ends up a bit awkward, earthy and dull.

name: White Cabernet Franc Finger Lakes
review: Cracked pepper and jalapeño aromas give way to a cloying watermelon flavor, with a vegetal note rattling the finish. 103 cases made.

name: Riesling Clare Valley
review: Dry and appealing for its slightly resiny lime and apple flavors, finishing crisp. Drink now. 1,500 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Anderson Valley
review: Well-focused and persistent, offering a complex mix of spicy cedar, ripe berry, dried herb and subtle floral shadings. Drink now through 2018. 780 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Anderson Valley Cerise Vineyard
review: Presents the wilder side of Pinot, with savory herb, underbrush, wild berry and spicy, floral scents, gaining depth and persistence on the dry, tannic finish. Drink now through 2020. 355 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Anderson Valley Demuth Vineyard
review: Sharply focused on snappy raspberry and wild berry flavors, with touches of cedar, spice and loamy gravel, giving this a graphite edge. Drink now through 2022. 575 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Anderson Valley Demuth Vineyard
review: Fresh and intense, with snappy wild berry, dried savory herb and fresh earth. This maintains a dry profile on the cedary finish. Drink now through 2019. 280 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Anderson Valley Cerise Vineyard
review: Strong notes of minty earth and bay leaf are evident throughout, giving this a dusty, dried herb edge that overshadows the ripe plum and berry flavors. Ends with dusty tannins. Drink now through 2022. 680 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Reserve
review: Tightly wound and firmly tannic, this offers a dense core of dark berry, black licorice and loamy earth, with slowly emerging tannins. Ends with black licorice and sandalwood notes amid a chewy aftertaste. Best from 2015 through 2026. 175 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Reserve
review: Dense, rich and complex, with a mix of mineral, blackberry, mocha, creamy oak and crushed rock flavors. Reveals a hint of suppleness midpalate on, balanced by sizable tannins. The future looks promising. Best from 2015 through 2024. 175 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Reserve
review: A muscular and well-oaked style, rich and intense, with a deep core of loamy earth, dried berry, currant and black licorice flavors, ending with dry, chunky tannins. Has room to grow. Drink now through 2020. 200 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Knights Valley West Block
review: A classy, Burgundian style, rich and creamy, with smoky oak framing the fig, melon, apricot and pear flavors. This is unified by a seamless texture that echoes butterscotch and roasted marshmallow notes. Drink now. 152 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Beckstoffer Dr. Crane Vineyard
review: Exhibits rich, juicy, vivid black cherry and black berry fruit that's well-centered and nicely proportioned. The finish shows hints of red and black licorice, with a crushed rock earthiness. Drink now through 2024. 198 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Beckstoffer To Kalon Vineyard
review: This seamless, graceful effort is pure, rich and supple, featuring subtle currant, cherry and plum notes that are pure and focused, with a long, lingering finish. Drink now through 2024. 196 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Knights Valley
review: Full-bodied and beautifully proportioned, offering a rich, ripe core of cherry, plum and blackberry that is elegant and intense, with firming tannins and a long, persistent finish. Should develop for years. Best from 2014 through 2025. 328 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Beckstoffer Dr. Crane Vineyard
review: Pure, rich and full-bodied, brimming with dark berry, cherry and plum notes that are edgy and chewy. Smooths out toward the finish, indicating that this will improve with age. Best from 2014 through 2024. 90 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Beckstoffer To Kalon Vineyard
review: Charry, cedary oak dominates now, but there remains an attractive mix of dark berry, spice and crushed rock on the aftertaste. An impressive core of fruit persists. Drink now through 2024. 167 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Knights Valley Pont de Chevalier
review: Delivers a rich array of pineapple, mango, fig and apricot flavors, giving this a distinctive flavor profile. For all the richness, this remains elegant and light-footed, ending with subtle oak shadings. Drink now through 2021. 287 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Knights Valley West Block
review: Ultrarich and creamy, exhibiting tiers of ripe pear, fig, honeydew melon, baking spices and anise. This is elegant and graceful, ending with a delicate finish. Drink now through 2018. 300 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Knights Valley West Block
review: Offers a complex mix of baked apple and pecan flavors, with spicy and pithy notes. Rich, full-bodied, elegant and stylish, ending with a return to the baked apple pie and spice themes. Drink now through 2017. 200 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Beckstoffer Dr. Crane Vineyard
review: A graceful style that's slow to unfold, but reveals intensity, richness, depth and balance as it does, with ripe plum, black cherry, blueberry, mineral and cedar flavors. Drink now through 2022. 135 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Beckstoffer To Kalon Vineyard
review: Exhibits a dusty, loamy earth character amid dark berry, cedar, crushed rock, graphite and savory herb notes, ending with a supple texture and a complex mix of elegant flavors. Drink now through 2030. 400 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Knights Valley West Block
review: Well-oaked, this will win fans of buttery Chardonnay, gaining flavors of toasted marshmallow, fig and apricot. Lingers on a long, full finish. Drink now through 2020. 146 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Knights Valley West Block
review: Complex aromas of yeast, crème brûlée, fig, apricot and toasty, cedary oak give this a rich core. The oak adds a dimension of complexity and nuance on the long finish, with kiss a of anise. Drink now. 565 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Knights Valley
review: An elegant style, offering a distinctive ripe red berry flavor, with hints of cherry and raspberry. Ends with firm, fine-grained tannins. Drink now through 2024. 335 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Beckstoffer To Kalon Vineyard
review: Fresh aromas of ripe plum, black cherry and blueberry are supple and complex, full-bodied and fleshy. Firms nicely and ends on a delicate minerally note. Drink now through 2020. 110 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Knights Valley Pont de Chevalier
review: Spicy oak, savory herb, green tea and honeydew flavors are at the center of this white, showing vegetal touches of celery. Ends clean and refreshing, with the oak gaining presence. Drink now through 2020. 261 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Knights Valley West Block
review: A big effort, with plenty of flavor and intensity, offering a core of spicy apple, pear, melon, cedar and nutmeg notes on the finish. Ends raw and leesy. Should gain with time. Drink now through 2018. 420 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Beckstoffer Dr. Crane Vineyard
review: A rich, full-bodied style, firm and spicy. A touch rustic, with dried currant, espresso, mineral and sage, ending with good length and complexity. Drink now through 2016. 125 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Beckstoffer To Kalon Vineyard
review: Smooth-textured, with complex herb, currant, sage and dried berry flavors that are full-bodied, intense and concentrated, ending with firm tannins and a minty bay leaf edge. Drink now through 2016. 150 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley Carneros Beresini Vineyard
review: Intense, featuring ripe, firm, pithy apple, pear and melon fruit that's complex and shaded by light oak. Gains some subtle notes on the finish. Drink now through 2014. 100 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Knights Valley Pont de Chevalier
review: Pear, lime zest and lemon notes are light and elegant, with a whiff of floral complexity on the finish. Drink now. 125 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Knights Valley
review: Firm and spicy, full-bodied, with dried currant, mineral and sage notes that are complex and firming on the finish. Balanced and subdued. Drink now through 2016. 250 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Knights Valley Pont de Chevalier
review: Soft and elegant, with pear and yellow apple flavors that are lightly spiced, accented by fresh ginger notes. Drink now. 179 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Knights Valley West Block
review: Ripe and oaky, with rich fig, vanilla, anise and honeysuckle flavors that are full-bodied, ending with a measure of complexity. Drink now through 2011. 150 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: A crisp Cabernet, but it has distinctive blackberry and currant flavors that persist on the vibrant finish. Good now, it has room to grow through 2000 to 2002 and beyond. 250 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: On the earthy side, with loamy, cedary notes weaving through the crisp berry flavors. Finishes firm. Drink now through 2006. 200 cases made.

name: Merlot Washington
review: This is a smooth, silky Merlot, on the lighter side, with floral overtones to its modest berry flavors. A pretty wine to drink soon. 500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Columbia Valley
review: Light, simple and pleasant for its smooth texture and black cherry flavors shaded by hints of tobacco and spice. Ready now. 400 cases made.

name: Port Washington
review: On the dry side for Port, but offers some ripe berry and plum flavors, a spirity edge and some grip on the finish. Drink soon. 220 cases made.

name: Fumé Blanc Washington
review: Smooth, soft and generous with its spicy, buttery pineapple flavors. Ready now. 250 cases made.

name: White Riesling Columbia Valley
review: Strongly floral, almost bitter, this soft, generous wine shows hints of peach and cream around the edge. Ready now. 500 cases made.

name: Lemberger Yakima Valley Pleasant Vineyards
review: Dark, dense and spicy, with a modest level of blackberry flavor sneaking in to balance the toasty spice notes. Drinkable now. 116 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Columbia Valley
review: Earthy, slightly bitter flavors make this seem charmless. 500 cases made.

name: Riesling Kabinett Trocken Pfalz Laumersheimer Kapellenberg
review: Mulled citrus and spice notes, with fresh grapefruit, highlight this elegant dry Riesling, which is bright and focused, with a lingering lemon-tinged finish. Drink now through 2015. 2,250 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Trocken Wachau Loibner Ried Loibenberg
review: This massively concentrated, unctuous Grüner is loaded with ripe peach, smoke and apricot flavors that feature accents of tropical fruit. The powerful finish is filled with an alluring mix of cream, slate, smoke and spice. Drink now through 2019. 1,048 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Wachau Loibner Vinothekfüllung
review: This races across the palate, offering a rich mix of baked apple, dried pineapple and roasted peach flavors that are full of exotic spicy notes. Well-extracted, showing hints of grapefruit peel that glide into the powerfully creamy finish, which ends with nuances of white chocolate. Drink now through 2026. 833 cases made.

name: Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wachau Ried Schütt
review: Sleek and lithe, with an inner intensity, this white evokes power and grace. Dense with peach, mineral and anise flavors, the structure literally vibrates on the palate. The finish is a bit discordant, so give it time. Best from 2003 through 2008. 30 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Trocken Wachau Loibner Ried Kreutles
review: Steely and concentrated, with loads of grapefruit, dried apricot, slate and cocoa flavors that are mouthfilling and a touch exotic. The powerful finish echoes the primary fruit and is joined by smoke, slate and lentil-like notes that are rich and focused. Needs a bit more time. Best from 2011 through 2020. 900 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Trocken Wachau Loibner Ried Loibenberg
review: Very classy and expressive, with a complex array of ripe peach, apple, glazed pear and candied ginger flavors. There's plenty of minerality midpalate, and this is finely balanced, with a long finish of apricot, cream and white chocolate. Drink now through 2020. 720 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Wachau Loibner Ried Schütt
review: Delicious aromas of roasted pineapple, ginger spice and savory, smoky mineral turn to honey and vanilla on the palate in this impressive version. Very expressive now and almost overwhelming, but should integrate nicely with some bottle age. Best from 2019 through 2027. 700 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Trockenbeerenauslese Wachau Loibner
review: Simply beautiful. Racy in structure, courtesy of searing acidity, with intense apricot and passion fruit flavors, this has balance, class and length. Silky in texture and never heavy or cloying. Best from 2003 through 2012.

name: Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wachau Dürnsteiner Ried Schütt
review: This explosively fruity white delivers concentrated notes of peach cobbler, apple tart and lemon meringue that are broad and lush. Unctuous, presenting a deft blend of mineral and lightly smoky flavors. Custard and white chocolate accents fill the long, rich finish. Drink now through 2024. 625 cases made.

name: Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wachau Dürnsteiner Ried Schütt
review: A big, rich Riesling, with tropical fruit flavors of mango and guava, along with luscious ripe peach and apple. The finish is filled with spice and smoke. This is really humming. Drink now through 2018. 25 cases imported.

name: Riesling Smaragd Wachau Loibner
review: Shades of pine and stone accent the core flavors of apple and grapefruit in this sleek, well-structured white. Balanced and focused, dissolving into citrus, floral and mineral notes on the lingering finish. Drink now through 2024. 600 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Beerenauslese Wachau Loibner
review: Fascinating. Distinctive piquancy and stoniness augment the honey and apricot character in this velvety BA. Balanced on the soft side, with enough structure to carry the flavors to a lingering conclusion. The finish is almost dry. Drink now through 2003. 220 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Trocken Wachau Loibner Ried Loibenberg
review: A powerful white, rich and ripe, yet shows elegance. The white raspberry and citrus notes mesh beautifully with the herbal and vegetal details, all supported by vibrant acidity. Delicious now, but this should show even more in a few years. Drink now through 2027. 1,300 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Trocken Wachau Loibner Ried Schütt
review: This complex Grüner features mouthfilling glazed citrus, peach and ruby grapefruit flavors that are backed up by a firm acidity and accented by rich cream and spice notes. The long, plush finish features notes of lentil and almond. Drink now through 2018. 240 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Trocken Wachau Loibner Vinothekfülling
review: Lush yet powerful, with baked apple, ripe pear and glazed grapefruit flavors that are rich and concentrated. Quite juicy on the fresh finish, which features plenty of slate and smoke. Drink now through 2018. 240 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Wachau Loibner Ried Loibenberg
review: Bold, rich and ripe, showing unctuous and complex flavors of peach cobbler, baked apple and dried pear, flanked by notes of dried mango and pineapple. Features crème brûlée hints midpalate, with dried apricot and golden raisin details lingering on the finish. Drink now through 2022. 1,330 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Wachau Loibner Ried Schütt
review: Rich and filled with a complex mix of white fruit, savory spice and lentil flavors that make for a powerful, textbook style of Grüner. Shows concentrated creaminess, with a long finish redolent of chamomile and hints of lavender. Drink now through 2024. 750 cases made.

name: Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wachau Dürnsteiner Ried Kellerberg
review: Rich and powerful, with loads of luscious apple, peach, ripe pear and currant flavors. Notes of mineral and smoke are joined by plenty of spice on the lush yet firm finish. One for the cellar. Best from 2009 through 2016. 35 cases imported.

name: Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wachau Dürnsteiner Ried Schütt
review: Focused, rich and powerful, featuring concentrated flavors of ripe apricot, peach and apple. This is very spicy on the long, lush finish, with plenty of cream and spice. Drink now through 2016. 348 cases imported.

name: Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wachau Loibner Ried Loibenberg
review: Very rich and ripe, with the texture of angel food cake and loads of mouthwatering peach, dried cherry and berry flavors. The long finish features nut, butterscotch and spice. Drink now through 2015. 792 cases made.

name: Riesling Smaragd Wachau Dürnsteiner Ried Kellerberg
review: There's purity to the peach, apple, grapefruit and mineral aromas and flavors in this taut and linear white, which tightens up as the finish turns chalky and austere. Best from 2018 through 2025. 500 cases made.

name: Riesling Smaragd Wachau Dürnsteiner Ried Schütt
review: Rich, lush and full of juicy pear tart, ripe apple and blood orange flavors, supported by fresh acidity. Open-textured yet full of finesse, and matched to a vibrant minerality and a plush spiciness. Lanolin and beeswax notes add a hint of exoticism to the long finish. Drink now through 2022. 625 cases made.

name: Riesling Smaragd Wachau Loibner Vinothekfülling
review: An ethereal Riesling, showing a vibrant minerality to the open-textured flavors of baked apple and pear, accented by notes of dried pineapple and mango. Quite honeyed midpalate, with a finish that echoes lemon curd, custard and spice. Rich and compelling. Drink now through 2022. 500 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Auslese Wachau Loibner
review: An amazing wine for food. Intense aromas of honey and white pepper, with a hint of spices. Full-bodied and off dry, with wonderfully wild and spicy flavors. Long, long finish. Not imported into the U.S. 250 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Federspiel Trocken Wachau Loibner
review: This features a rich, intense mix of ginger, tangerine and peach flavors that are powerful and backed up by plenty of juicy acidity. The intense finish offers notes of golden raisin, cream and spice. Drink now through 2017. 3,048 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Trocken Wachau Loibner Ried Loibenberg
review: Very smoky and lush, with golden raisin, apricot and tropical fruit flavors. The long finish is supported by a firm structure and lots of crunchy, spicy notes. Drink now through 2014. 75 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Trocken Wachau Loibner Ried Schütt
review: A lively floral note emerges amid the rich, lush flavors of dried peach, baked apple and grapefruit. Firmly structured, with notes of salted almond and white pepper lingering on the ripe and slightly honeyed finish. Drink now through 2020. 750 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Trocken Wachau Loibner Vinothekfülling
review: A ripe, rich, full-bodied white, with a gorgeous array of lush peach, mineral, smoke and spice flavors. This also has a big structure and a long, long finish of white pepper, with hints of celery and fennel. Drink now through 2011. 459 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Trocken Wachau Loibner Vinothekfüllung
review: Offers a powerful structure, with well-integrated apple, ripe citrus and grapefruit flavors. Concentrated notes of dried green herbs and mint, accented by some creamy hints, fill the firm, focused finish. Drink now through 2020. 833 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Wachau Loibner Ried Kreutles
