review: Richly spiced, this medium-bodied white features a core of ripeness to the unctuous flavors of apple tart, dried quince and baked pear. The creaminess extends into a plush finish that offers Bourbon vanilla accents. Drink now through 2022. 1,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wachau Dürnsteiner Ried Kellerberg
review: Rich and refined, displaying focused flavors of peach, apple, cream and spice. This is lush and creamy midpalate, with a lithe finish that features notes of sweet butter and spice. Drink now through 2016. 348 cases imported.

name: Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wachau Dürnsteiner Ried Schütt
review: A distinctive aroma of roses introduces this peach- and apple-infused Riesling. Rich and medium- to full-bodied, it has understated power and intensity, which show on the long finish. Drink now through 2012.

name: Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wachau Loibner Ried Loibenberg
review: Broad, rich and lush, with finely expressed peach, pear, apple and gooseberry flavors that are well-spiced. The long finish is filled with notes of buttercream and honey. Drink now through 2016. 600 cases imported.

name: Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wachau Loibner Ried Loibenberg
review: Lush, with a rich texture and a concentrated array of powerful apple, nectarine, mineral and crisp apple flavors. There's also plenty of ripe tropical fruit notes, with a long, spicy finish. Drink now through 2015. 50 cases imported.

name: Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wachau Ried Loibenberg
review: Terrific Riesling. Ripe, aromatic and full of intense peach, smoke and mineral flavors, it builds and builds on the palate to a lingering finish. The sleek structure melds effortlessly with the dense texture. Best from 2003 through 2010.

name: Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wachau Ried Loibenberg
review: A eucalyptus, anise accent creeps into the peach and mineral flavors here, while the frame is focused and muscular, even slightly coarse in texture. Fine length. Give it time to come together. Best from 2002 through 2010. 45 cases imported.

name: Riesling Smaragd Wachau Loibner Ried Loibenberg
review: Very firm and fresh, with abundant minerality to the dried apple, apricot and red peach flavors, featuring notes of citrus zest. Powerfully structured, showing hints of white pepper midpalate. Pure, crisp and well-spiced on the finish. Drink now through 2022. 1,165 cases made.

name: Riesling Smaragd Wachau Loibner Vinothekfüllung
review: Ripe and expressive, featuring apple, peach, lanolin and quince flavors. Broad and compact, this is tangy, with a tactile, chalky feel on the finish. Drink now through 2023. 300 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Federspiel Trocken Wachau Loibner
review: There's lots of vibrant acidity to the peach, gooseberry and grapefruit flavors, with hints of white chocolate midpalate. The powerful, crisp and mineral-laden finish features some smoky notes. Drink now through 2017. 2,400 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Trocken Wachau Loibner Ried Kreutles
review: A rich, honeyed style, with a backbone of acidity to the ripe apple, salted almond and minerally flavors. There's an enticing floral note to this as well, revealing a plush finish of white chocolate and spice. Drink now through 2020. 667 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Trocken Wachau Loibner Ried Kreutles
review: Creamy and rich, with ripe peach, apricot, smoke and spice flavors. The intense finish of pepper, cumin and citrus notes make this exotic and seductive. Drink now through 2012. 75 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Trocken Wachau Loibner Ried Loibenberg
review: Taut, with an underlying crispness to the ripe apple and dried cherry flavors. Peppery accents show as well, with notes of chamomile and bergamot lingering on the powerful finish. Drink now through 2018. 1,333 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Trocken Wachau Loibner Ried Schütt
review: A balanced, well-crafted Grüner, with concentrated flavors of peach, red currant, berry, smoke and spice. There's hints of tea and gooseberry on the lithe finish. Drink now through 2013. 20 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Trocken Wachau Loibner Vinothekfülling
review: Roses come to mind when smelling this white. Elegant despite its weight, with peach and quince flavors. Quite supple and balanced by moderate acidity. Very good finish. Drink now through 2010. 20 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Trocken Wachau Loibner Vinothekfülling
review: Dense, backward and full-bodied, this is a powerful white, with more mineral notes and structure than fruit today. It has firm acidity underneath, and a terrific finish, so give it time to harmonize and express itself. Best from 2004 through 2012. 25 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Trocken Wachau Loibner Vinothekfülling
review: Opulent and concentrated, with apricot, pineapple, vanilla and lentil notes displayed on a broad, open and moderately firm structure. It shows some heat on the finish, along with a lingering aftertaste of apricot and mineral, so give it time to settle down. A brilliant '00. Drink now through 2006.

name: Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Wachau Loibner Ried Kreutles
review: This is loaded with ripe peach, smoke and glazed pear aromas and flavors, offering minerally and savory notes. Hazelnut and vanilla accents on the persistent finish add charm. Drink now through 2023. 1,300 cases made.

name: Riesling Federspiel Trocken Wachau Loibner
review: Powerfully structured, with flavors of gooseberry, dried quince and pear tart that are flanked by rich spicy notes. Elegant and fresh-tasting on the finish. Drink now through 2018. 833 cases made.

name: Riesling Federspiel Trocken Wachau Loibner
review: This offers an exuberant aroma of mineral and white pepper, with lively lemon-lime, fresh-cut green apple and gooseberry flavors. Richly spiced, featuring plenty of dried green herb and savory notes, which linger on the crisp, glistening finish. Drink now through 2018. 833 cases made.

name: Riesling Federspiel Wachau Loibner
review: A refined white, with flavors of ripe apple, peach and dried apricot that are viscous yet elegant. Notes of dried sage and hints of tarragon create a crisp chord. Finishes with slate and cream details. Drink now through 2019. 830 cases made.

name: Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wachau Dürnsteiner Ried Kellerberg
review: Firm and focused, with broad yet well-structured flavors of currant, Meyer lemon and savory herb. Very minerally on the crisp finish. Drink now through 2020. 417 cases made.

name: Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wachau Dürnsteiner Ried Schütt
review: Broad and opulent in texture, yet there's concentrated flavors of apple, pear and mineral supported by a vivid structure. Intense, it gets a little coarse on the finish, so give it time to mellow. Drink now through 2006.

name: Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wachau Loibner Ried Loibenberg
review: Elegant and refined, offering focused acidity to the mineral, apple and pomelo flavors, with notes of ginger and spice. The crunchy finish is bright and juicy, revealing hints of lushness. Drink now through 2020. 1,167 cases made.

name: Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wachau Loibner Ried Loibenberg
review: A minerally style, with plenty of ripe peach, apricot and apple flavors that are accented by hints of cinnamon. The plush finish features savory spice and notes of golden raisin. Drink now through 2014. 600 cases imported.

name: Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wachau Loibner Ried Loibenberg
review: Focused and peppery, with ample weight and a solid structure supporting the peach and mineral flavors. It's well-integrated and balanced, with a sleek, lingering aftertaste of wet stone. Drink now through 2010. 30 cases imported.

name: Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wachau Ried Loibenberg
review: Tropical fruit and an herbal accent mark this expansive yet transparent Riesling. Lovely flavor concentration is seemingly packed into an airy framework, subtly integrating the acidity and mineral element. Best from 2000 through 2005. 916 cases made.

name: Riesling Smaragd Wachau Loibner Ried Loibenberg
review: A ripe style, this delivers peach and apple pie flavors, with notes of orange, herbs and earth. Chunky in profile, offering a finish that matches the blunter approach. Drink now through 2020. 1,000 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Federspiel Trocken Wachau Loibner
review: This is filled with tropical fruit flavors, offering a ripe profile. Dried pineapple, mango and currant notes mingle easily, turning crisp and creamy-tasting on the finish. Drink now through 2018. 1,500 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Federspiel Wachau Loibner
review: Lovely beeswax and citrus flavors glide along the palate, while lively acidity carries notes of cilantro and pea. Ends with a persistent, harmonious finish. Drink now through 2021. 2,200 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Trocken Wachau Loibner Ried Loibenberg
review: Floral and peach notes here, and almost Riesling-like in its delicacy, yet the typical white pepper flavor comes through in this structured, medium-weight white. Lingering aftertaste of cinnamon. Drink now through 2008.

name: Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Trocken Wachau Loibner Vinothekfülling
review: Rich and exotic, with loads of tropical fruit, apricot and ripe peach flavors. A broad-shouldered wine that finishes with smoky and minerally notes. Try with sautéed scallops. Drink now through 2012. 375 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Trocken Wachau Loibner Vinothekfülling
review: A strong scent of rose marks this off-dry white, whose floral, peach and apple flavors are distinctive and delicious. It builds in intensity and weight through the long finish. Spicy apple aftertaste. Drink now through 2012.

name: Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Trocken Wachau Ried Loibenberg
review: A sappy Grüner Veltliner, rich and ripe, exuding vanilla, fennel and baked apple notes on a broad, firm framework. It's all balanced and lingering on the finish. Drink now through 2007. 60 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Trocken Wachau Ried Loibenberg
review: Beautiful aromas of smoke, mineral and Eastern spices, draped on a velvety texture and supported by a moderate backbone. Forward in character, it picks up a licorice note on the finish. Drink now through 2005.

name: Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Trocken Wachau Ried Loibenberg
review: Suave and broad-shouldered, yet the flavors are austere, holding back right now. A good structure bodes well for the future, and the aftertaste of peach, honey and vanilla expresses the ripeness. Best from 2001 through 2006. 580 cases made.

name: Riesling Beerenauslese Wachau Ried Pfaffenberg Steiner Süss
review: Fabulous aromas of apricots, minerals and flowers are followed by peach and honey flavors, all wrapped in an elegant, lively package. Light and airy, with a lingering finish. Enjoy now.

name: Riesling Federspiel Trocken Wachau Loibner
review: A very elegant Riesling, delivering vibrant apple and peach flavors that are supported by a juicy acidity. The long finish echoes the primary fruit, accented by light spice and honey notes. Drink now through 2015. 900 cases imported.

name: Riesling Federspiel Trocken Wachau Loibner
review: Appealing and mature mineral notes grace this white, leading to ripe, rich flavors of peach, apple and pear. Glazed apricot and spice fill the broad finish. Drink now through 2013. 900 cases imported.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Niederösterreich Steiner Ried Pfaffenberg Selection
review: This is fresh, elegant and expressive, sporting apple, white peach and white pepper aromas and flavors. Balanced, lingering with citrus and spice accents on the finish. Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wachau Dürnsteiner Ried Kellerberg
review: Already harmonious and appealing, from the succulent texture to flavors of white peach, grapefruit and white pepper. It has a tangy edge, courtesy of the vibrant structure, with a lingering finish. Drink now through 2015. 375 cases made.

name: Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wachau Dürnsteiner Ried Kellerberg
review: This starts out rich, with firm acidity to keep it focused. Apple, peach and white pepper are the main flavor themes. It's tightly wound now though, needing some time to unwind. Drink now through 2008.

name: Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wachau Dürnsteiner Ried Schütt
review: A minerally style, with well-crafted flavors of pippin apple, Asian pear and lemon-lime that are crisp and refreshing. Finishes with notes of slate and spice. Drink now through 2020. 625 cases made.

name: Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wachau Dürnsteiner Ried Schütt
review: Offers vanilla cream aromas and flavors, with blood orange, ruby grapefruit and loads of nutmeg and spice. Dutch apple pie flavors fill the light, bracing finish. Drink now through 2012. 667 cases made.

name: Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wachau Dürnsteiner Ried Schütt
review: Interesting lanolin, pine and mineral notes are more prominent than the citrus flavor in this taut white. It's really stony, with enough flesh to cover the bones. Drink now through 2018. 750 cases made.

name: Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wachau Dürnsteiner Ried Schütt
review: Ripe and rich, yet with an underlying structure that dominates now and shows promise for the future. Licorice, herb and mineral notes are not typical, but more an essence of terroir in 2003. Drink now through 2010. 30 cases imported.

name: Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wachau Dürnsteiner Ried Schütt
review: Rich and juicy, this is full of apricot and mineral aromas and flavors, beautifully displayed on a solid but balanced frame. Citrus notes linger on the finish. Best from 2000 through 2005. 830 cases made.

name: Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wachau Ried Loibenberg
review: Very tasty. Ripe and packing pear, floral and stone notes, backed by lively acidity. Full-bodied and moderately concentrated, with some heat coming through on the finish, pulling it a little out of balance. Drink now through 2008.

name: Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Trocken Wachau Loibner Ried Loibenberg
review: An elegant style of Grüner Veltliner, featuring a rose aroma and flavors of white grapefruit and peppery greens. It's medium-bodied with a long finish. Drink now through 2012. 1,000 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Trocken Wachau Loibner Ried Loibenberg
review: Rich and concentrated, offering peach, lentil and white pepper flavors on a broad, open-knit frame. Shows a little heat on the finish, but with power and a mineral aftertaste. Drink now. 50 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Trocken Wachau Loibner Ried Schütt
review: Features a mix of ripe tropical fruit and dried herbal flavors that are framed by firm acidity, finishing with notes of bergamot.  Drink now. 750 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Trocken Wachau Ried Loibenberg
review: Gorgeous aromas and flavors of pineapple, spice, grapefruit and mineral, accented by lentil. Rich and mouthcoating, yet with enough acidity to keep it lively. Good length, with a minty, vegetable aftertaste. Drink now through 2003. 60 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Trocken Wachau Ried Loibenberg
review: Very ripe, with exotic overtones of honey, vanilla custard and apricot, but it seems top-heavy right now, although there's plenty of acidity to support the flavors and rich body. Needs time to integrate. Best from 2000 through 2006. 625 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Trocken Wachau Ried Loibenberg
review: This is floral in character, and intense, with plenty of ripe apricot and spice flavors that turn dry and minerally. Long and enticing finish. Try with food.

name: Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wachau Dürnsteiner Ried Kellerberg
review: Ripe and smoky, featuring lots of baked peach and apple flavors, with plenty of glazed citrus notes. The finish offers ginger and spice. Drink now through 2013. 420 cases imported.

name: Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wachau Dürnsteiner Ried Kellerberg
review: Elegant, floral in flavor, with pepper and mineral accents. Restrained but ripe and fresh. Just needs to integrate. Drink now through 2007. 30 cases imported.

name: Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wachau Dürnsteiner Ried Kellerberg
review: Flavors of apple and pear mark this full-bodied, up-front Riesling, with power and richness losing a little intensity on the finish. Drink now through 2007.

name: Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wachau Dürnsteiner Ried Schütt
review: Thickly textured white showing muted apricot, licorice and green tea flavors on a solid structure. A tad disjointed now, with a powerful finish. Best from 2003 through 2008.

name: Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wachau Dürnsteiner Ried Schütt
review: Haunting aromas of roses and violets give way to violets and cherry candy on the palate. The richness midpalate firms up nicely on the finish. Drink now through 2004. 415 cases made.

name: Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wachau Loibner Ried Loibenberg
review: A balanced, peach-infused white backed by a laserlike structure. It starts out plump, with stony notes coming through on the long finish. Best from 2007 through 2018. 665 cases made.

name: Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wachau Loibner Ried Loibenberg
review: Extremely aromatic, offering rose, pine and apple aromas and flavors, with a hint of peach. Very well-defined and firm, it has vivacity, with a long mineral aftertaste. Drink now through 2009. 75 cases imported.

name: Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wachau Ried Loibenberg
review: More severe in style and not very expressive today, this firmly structured '98 nonetheless gains intensity in the mouth, with a fine and endless finish of apricot and grapefruit. Best from 2001 through 2005. 830 cases made.

name: Riesling Smaragd Wachau Dürnsteiner Ried Kellerberg
review: Minerally and savory, with pippin apple and green peach flavors, supported by firm acidity. Salt and pepper notes show on the finish. Drink now through 2018. 415 cases made.

name: Riesling Smaragd Wachau Dürnsteiner Ried Schütt
review: Elegant, displaying lime, apple and almond notes in a harmonious and rich package. The lime and mineral character reverberates on the finish. Best from 1999 through 2002. 450 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Federspiel Trocken Wachau Loibner
review: Ripe and minerally, with exuberant dried apple, Asian pear and grapefruit notes that are well-concentrated. Lemon zest and white pepper details show on the rapierlike finish. Drink now through 2020. 1,500 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Federspiel Trocken Wachau Loibner
review: Light, elegant and racy, with apple, citrus and green pear flavors, followed by licorice and spice on the finish.  Drink now through 2015. 1,541 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Federspiel Wachau Loibner
review: Light and fresh, with a good mix of dried apple and savory herbal flavors that are well-structured and glide across the palate. Lemon zest notes show on the open-textured finish. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Trocken Wachau Loibner Ried Kreutles
review: Peach and mineral flavors fill this broad, ripe Grüner. The long finish is filled with mineral and smoke notes.  Drink now through 2009. 500 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Trocken Wachau Loibner Ried Kreutles
review: A spicy, peppery version, sporting citrus and vegetal notes and a mouthwatering acidity. It's tight right now, but has good length, so give it a little time. Best from 2007 through 2013. 750 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Trocken Wachau Loibner Ried Kreutles
review: An herbaceous note—mint, shiso—adds a distinctive accent to the peach, melon and vanilla flavors. Rich and round in profile, with an openness and moderate length. Drink now. 50 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Trocken Wachau Loibner Ried Loibenberg
review: Full-bodied and ripe, showing plenty of peach flavors, with melon, spice and smoke. Has a broad, supple texture, with minerally notes on the finish. Drink now through 2010. 916 cases made.

name: Riesling Beerenauslese Wachau Loibner
review: Rich and smoky, with lush flavors of ripe peach, cream and spice. Long finish features glazed apricot notes. Drink now through 2012. 20 cases imported.

name: Riesling Beerenauslese Wachau Loibner
review: Lush and sweet, but balanced by vibrant acidity, this subtle wine retains its varietal character, offering peach, citrus and mineral on an elegant frame. Drink now through 2005.

name: Riesling Federspiel Trocken Wachau Loibner
review: Crisp and intense, with flavors of fresh-cut apple that show citrusy notes. Finishes with hints of slate and sea salt. Minerally and pure-tasting. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Federspiel Wachau Loibner
review: This is light and crisp, with peach, melon and citrus flavors. Picks up floral accents as it winds down on the finish. Drink now. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 1,150 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Lieblich Wachau Steiner Ried Pfaffenberg Selection
review: Rich, ripe and decadent, with off-dry flavors of baked pineapple, peach and mango. The spicy finish features plenty of vanilla and hints of butter. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2011. 90 cases made.

name: Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wachau Ried Schütt Dürnsteiner
review: A combination of lime, peach and herb notes give complexity to this vibrant, exciting wine. A touch of botrytis adds interest and the finish is long.

name: Traminer Smaragd Trocken Wachau Loibner
review: Firm and well-structured, with concentrated flavors of Golden Delicious apple and red peach. The ripe finish of tropical fruit and spice is long and juicy. Drink now through 2015. 336 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Wachau Ried Loibenberg
review: Rich and textured, dry and spicy, it has weight and density of flavor. Tobacco and herb notes are broad and long, but finish short. Best from 1999 through 2003. 330 cases made.

name: Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wachau Ried Loibenberg
review: Obviously ripe, but this delivers more on the nose than on the palate. Medium-bodied, with spicy flavors. Clean finish.

name: Traminer Smaragd Trocken Wachau Loibner
review: Concentrated, with touches of richness matched by flavors of peach, mango and a hint of butterscotch. Notes of white chocolate emerge on the finish. Exotic. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now.

name: Grüner Veltliner Beerenauslese Wachau Loibner
review: Rich and sweet, with ripe pear, apple and butterscotch flavors and plenty of smoke, which lingers on the finish. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now. 110 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Trocken Wachau Ried Loibenberg
review: More like a kabinett due to its elegant weight and style, this is medium-bodied, with a clean, spicy floral character and a crisp, lively finish.

name: Traminer Smaragd Trocken Wachau Loibner
review: Light and spicy, with an aroma of rose petal and flavors of white peach. Shows notes of tangerine on the finish. Drink now. 13 cases imported.

name: Traminer Smaragd Trocken Wachau Loibner
review: Bright, this white matches crisp acidity with a glycerinelike texture and grapefruit flavor. Drink now. 140 cases made.

name: Traminer Smaragd Trocken Wachau Loibner
review: A delicate, spicy white, with grapefruit, vanilla and cinnamon notes allied to a vibrant structure. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now.

name: Grüner Veltliner Federspiel Trocken Wachau Kreutles
review: Very exotic. Lime, passion fruit and floral flavors are underscored by tobacco notes. Dry, but turns short on the finish.

name: Riesling Beerenauslese Wachau Ried Pfaffenberg Steiner
review: Ripe peach and allspice aromas and flavors fill this dessert white, which turns a bit vegetal on the finish. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now. 85 cases made.

name: Brut Napa-Sonoma-Mendocino Counties Halyard
review: A lovely little bubbly,  crisp yet soft, with fresh citrus and apple aromas and supple flavors. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Rosé Napa-Sonoma-Monterey Counties Sinnet
review: Sleek and crisp, offering a salmon hue and floral strawberry aromas, with zesty watermelon and spice flavors. Drink now. 522 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Dundee Hills
review: Crisp and harmonious, with lemon blossom and apple aromas and focused spice and mineral flavors. Drink now through 2019. 320 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Dundee Hills
review: Bright and tangy, light-footed and appealing for the citrusy apple and green tea flavors. Has deftness, and finishes with persistence. Drink now through 2020. 275 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Dundee Hills
review: Firm in texture, with smoky flavors that weave in black cherry and cola notes as they push against mildly grippy tannins. Best after 2018. 560 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill County Vintage Select
review: Overtly ripe and generous, with distinctive smoky cherry and tomato aromas and flavors that open up on the palate. The flavor profile won't please everyone, but it's a well-made wine. Drink now.

name: Pinot Noir Yamhill County Vintage Select
review: A yummy, fairly well-integrated wine where the fruit and oak are together b ut neither stands out. It's smooth and velvety with ripe cherr y and vanilla-gingery flavors that are long on the finish.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Vintage Select
Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Leland Vineyards Reserve
review: Has mouthfilling, supple, generous flavors, with marvelous concentration of strawberry and red cherry flavors framed by sweet oak. The fruit character is brilliantly realized and the velvety texture makes it drinkable now, though it can age through at least 1994.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Vintage Select
review: Lots of rich concentrated cherry, spice, strawberry, plum and oak nuances c ombine to give this wine depth and complexity. Has all the elements to get better in the bottle. Just give it a year or two.

name: Chardonnay Willamette Valley
review: A bright and fruity Oregon Chardonnay. Nicely balanced, with a greenish, floral edge to the appealing apple and pear flavors. Drinkable now. 4,925 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Vintage Select
review: Spicy oak flavors are rough around the edges. The cherry and plum notes are pleasing, but it stops short of excellence with a tannic finish. Drinkable now. 13,800 cases made.

name: White Riesling Willamette Valley Late Harvest
review: Bright, fruity and freshly sweet, like biting into a fresh peach, complete with the fuzzy texture on the finish. Nice now, maybe even better in 1997. 1,088 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley
review: Bright and effusively fruity. An ebullient wine that reminds you of biting into a fresh peach. Drink soon for its freshness. 2,375 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley
review: Ripe and a little floral, fleshy with a tinge of pink to the color, echoing strawberry on the finish.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Vintage Select
review: Smoky and meaty, but with enough black cherry and plum flavors to hold your interest. 1,750 cases made.

name: Riesling Willamette Valley
review: Soft, sweet, generous nectarine, honeysuckle and pear flavors echo nicely on the finish. 1,727 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley
review: Simple, fresh and grapey in flavor, with a touch of peach on the lively finish. Drinkable now. 1,488 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Unfiltered Reserve
review: Not the ager you might expect but light and soft, with the ripe plum and currant flavor spreading nicely across the palate, finishing gently. Drinkable now. 509 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Tough and tannic, with tart cherry and blackberry flavors and hints of chocolate, finishing with firm, drying tannins. Drink now. 6,560 cases made.
